England fans sang anti-IRA songs during Tuesday's friendly draw with Italy.<n>It is embarrassing to listen to - a stain on our good-natured travelling supporters.<n>It also places a strain on the FA as they prepare for the Republic of Ireland friendly in Dublin in June.

'John' posted the advert in his local newsagents in Muswell Hill, London.<n>It reads: 'John looking for a companion an apprentice / worker / lover for a craft that will change your life and bring you a way of life with quality'<n>The ad was spotted by a passer-by and has since gone viral.

Daniel Andersson played in goal for Helsinborg against Kalmar on Saturday.<n>The 42-year-old was forced to play after Par Hansson and Matt Pyzdrowski were injured.<n>The former Celtic and Barcelona striker impressed with Andersson's display.
Salford Red Devils ended a run of 17 defeats in a row by Wigan Warriors.<n>Weller Hauraki and John Bateman were sent off two minutes from time.<n>The win was Salford's first over Wigan since 2006.

Alan Pardew was involved in a touchline spat with Manuel Pellegrini last year.<n>The Crystal Palace boss called Pellegrini a 'f***ing old c**t'<n>Pardew has taken advice from the LMA and has been helped by a sports psychologist.<n>The 53-year-old believes he has the ability to manage a top-four side.

Mile Jedinak suspended for Crystal Palace's clash with Manchester City.<n>Marouane Chamakh and Fraizer Campbell still out for Eagles.<n>Yaya Toure returns for City but James Milner could miss out.<n>Eagles have won just two of last eight Premier League home matches.
Manchester City are nine points behind Chelsea in the Premier League.<n>Both teams have eight games left to play.<n>Joe Hart insists City will not give up on the title.

Former All Black Mils Muliaina was arrested last night on suspicion of sexual assault.<n>The 34-year-old was led away by police after Connacht's defeat by Gloucester.<n>He has been bailed after being questioned for more than six hours.<n>All Blacks star is accused of assaulting a woman in Cardiff in March.<n>The incident is believed to have happened after Connacht's game with the Blues.
QPR ended a five-game losing run with a 4-1 win against West Brom.<n>Chris Ramsey's side are just three points adrift of safety.<n>QPR travel to Aston Villa on Tuesday night.

Lydia Ko shot a 2-over 74 on Saturday in the ANA Inspiration.<n>Ko tied the LPGA Tour record for consecutive rounds under par at 29.<n>The 17-year-old New Zealander has had at least one birdie in all 187 of her rounds in 49 career events on the tour.

Abou Diaby has made 22 appearances in the last five seasons at Arsenal.<n>The midfielder has suffered 42 injuries keeping him out of action for 226 weeks.<n>Arsene Wenger has hinted that Diaby could have a future at the club.<n>Arsenal face Liverpool in the Premier League on Saturday.

Jordan Spieth and Phil Mickelson have attracted large crowds.<n>The two American golfers are playing in the final tournament before the Masters.<n>Spieth is currently four places ahead of Mickelson in the world rankings.

Alan Hutton ruled out of Aston Villa's clash with QPR on Tuesday.<n>Scott Sinclair and Ashley Westwood also out for Tim Sherwood's side.<n>QPR are without Eduardo Vargas and Yun Suk-young.<n>Vars and Suk-young will miss Tuesday's clash at Villa Park.<n>Richard Dunne, Leroy Fer and Alejandro Faurlin also out for Hoops.<n>Aston Villa have lost their last four Barclays Premier League games against QPR (D2 L3), winning three and drawing the other.<n>QPR have won just one of their last nine Barclays Premier League games against Aston Villa
Kim Sei-Young is three shots clear at the top of the leaderboard.<n>The South Korean shot a three-under-par round of 69 on Saturday.<n>World No 1 Lydia Ko shot her second consecutive over-par score.

Tiger Woods has dropped out of the world's top 100 for the first time in 19 years.<n>The former world No 1 has not played since February due to a back injury.<n>Colin Montgomerie has said it would be fantastic to see Woods play at the Masters.<n>Montgomerie believes Woods will never be the same player again.

Liverpool scored 52 Premier League goals last season.<n>Luis Suarez and Daniel Sturridge were Liverpool's top scorers.<n>But with seven games of the season left, Liverpool have scored 45.<n>They have only managed six top scorers this term.<n>Only Crystal Palace and Sunderland have more top scorers.<n>Liverpool have not filled the void left by Suarez.<n>They are missing Harry Kane, Diego Costa, Sergio Aguero and Charlie Austin.

Serena Williams beat Sabine Lisicki 7-6, 1-6, 6-3 at the Miami Open.<n>The world No 1 recorded her 700th career victory on Wednesday.<n>Williams will face Romania's Simona Halep in the semi-finals.<n>She will face Sloane Stephens or Halep in the final.

Andy Murray says British players questioning the move should work on their world ranking.<n>Aljaz Bedene is due to arrive in Britain in the coming weeks.<n>Murray admits Bedene's stance threatens certain players position.
Kim Sei-young is two shots clear at the top of the leaderboard.<n>Lydia Ko's record-equalling run of 29 rounds under par came to an end.

Nick Scholfield has been lined up to ride Spring Heeled in the Grand National.<n>The Grand National will take place at Aintree on Saturday, April 11.<n>Scholes has ridden in six Nationals and finished third in 2013.

Novak Djokovic came back from a set down to beat Alexandr Dolgopolov.<n>The world number one will now face David Ferrer in the last eight.<n>Andy Murray and Kei Nishikori also through to the quarter-finals.

Newport Gwent Dragons beat Cardiff Blues 25-21 at Rodney Parade.<n>Wing Hallam Amos, replacement Nic Cudd, penalty try and two Tom Prydie penalties secured victory.<n>The Dragons will now face either London Irish or Edinburgh in semi-finals.

Police in Rhein Erft, Germany received a bizarre phone call.<n>The caller said that a kangaroo was spotted 'happily' hopping in a field.<n>Police dismissed the call and believed it was an April Fools prank.<n>They later found the kangaroo in a field in Bruhl.<n>The animal's fencing was damaged by severe storms that hit Germany.

Social media has reacted after Channel 7 managed to let a questionable name appear on screen during one of Australia’s biggest charity telethons.<n>TV hosts stood by unaware that philanthropist Hugh G. Rection made a generous donation of $32.38.<n>Twitter users were quick to identify the blunder.
Carla Suarez Navarro defeated Venus Williams 0-6, 6-1, 7-5.<n>Suarez Navarro will now face Andrea Petkovic in the semi-finals.<n>Petkovic beat Czech Karolina Pliskova 6-4, 6-2.

Alfonso Thomas will coach Delhi Daredevils in the Indian Premier League.<n>The Somerset seamer is still recovering from a broken ankle.<n>Thomas will take up the short-term coaching appointment with Delhi until April 16.

England stars George Ford, Jonathan Joseph and Dave Attwood will all return to the scene of their Six Nations defeat to Ireland.<n>The quartet will be hoping to make amends in the Champions Cup.<n>Mike Ford believes the loss will help them in the long run.

Andy Murray beat Dominic Thiem 3-6, 6-4, 6-1 in the quarter finals.<n>Murray will face Tomas Berdych or Juan Monaco in the semi finals.<n>The world No 4 has called on British compatriot Aljaz Bedene to be happy.

Sim Bhullar is set to become the NBA's first player of Indian descent.<n>The Sacramento Kings are set to sign Bhullar to a 10-day contract.<n>The 7-foot-5, 360-pound centre will be on the roster on Friday.

Rangers have been de-listed from the AIM after Dave King failed to find a new nominated advisor.<n>Rangers are currently second in the Scottish Championship.<n>Manager Stuart McCall has been reassured that the decision will not affect his squad's promotion push.

Moeen Ali was not available for the World Cup due to injury.<n>Ali is expected to be fit for Worcestershire's first Championship match.<n>Adil Rashid and James Tredwell are England's current spinning options.

Arsenal beat Liverpool 4-1 in the Premier League on Saturday.<n>The win was Arsenal's seventh in a row and moved them up to second.<n>Arsene Wenger believes something is finally happening at the club.<n>The Frenchman says everyone can'smell' it and that it is happening.

Hugo Lloris is out injured for Tottenham's trip to Burnley on Sunday.<n>Michel Vorm will deputise in goal for the Premier League clash.<n>Mauricio Pochettino has praised Vorm's attitude after missing out on the Capital One Cup final.

Celtic beat St Mirren 2-0 in their SPL clash at Paisley on Good Friday.<n>Leigh Griffiths was caught on camera enjoying a biscuit on the bench.<n>The striker remained firmly on the bench throughout the match.

Porto have received £440million from player sales in the last 11 years.<n>The majority of these deals have involved South Americans.<n>19 of the 29 players in the table have South American backgrounds.<n>Porto have won seven of a possible 10 league titles since 2004.

Lionel Messi faces tests to determine whether he can play against Celta Vigo.<n>Barcelona star missed both Argentina games during international break.<n>Barca face Celta Vigo at the Nou Camp on Sunday afternoon.<n>READ: Messi's injury was the result of a tackle by Martin Demichelis.<n>CLICK HERE for all the latest Barcelona news.

River Plate vice president Matias Patanian admits club 'dream' of Falcao.<n>Manchester United striker has struggled on loan at Old Trafford.<n>Falcao spent eight years with River Plate before leaving for Porto in 2009.

Brendan Rodgers failed to make it as a professional footballer.<n>Rodgers left Northern Ireland for England aged 16.<n>The Liverpool boss was asked to play in a reserve game before making his debut.<n>Rodgers believes the memory has helped him to nurture Raheem Sterling and Jordan Ibe.

Golden State Warriors beat Los Angeles Clippers 110-106.<n>Stephen Curry scored 27 points for the Warriors.<n>Klay Thompson had 25 and David Lee 17 for the visitors.<n>Brooklyn Nets beat Indiana Pacers to reclaim Eastern Conference lead.<n>Tony Parker scored 16 points in his 1,000th NBA game.

Jamie Carragher flew out to Spain to watch his son play in the Mediterranean International Cup.<n>The Liverpool youngsters drew 1-1 with local Catalan side CE Mercantil.<n>The tournament is now in its 15th year and features over 200 clubs from 36 countries in Girona in northern Spain.
Sunderland travel to Newcastle for the Tyne-Wear derby on Sunday.<n>The Black Cats have won just four times all season.<n>John Carver's side have won just once in their last 12 games.

James Rodriguez has been out of action since February 4.<n>The Colombian international has scored 12 goals in 33 games since joining Real Madrid.<n>Rodriguez will be hoping to add to the 12 goals he has scored in 33 games since joining Real Madrid.

Thiago came on for Philipp Lahm in the 10th minute against Dortmund.<n>The Spanish midfielder hadn't played for Bayern since March 2014.<n>He suffered a serious knee injury against Hoffenheim and has been sidelined since.<n>Thiago admits it was an emotional moment and he thanked the fans.

Kevin Theophile-Catherine has been on loan at St Etienne this season.<n>The French side have an option to make the deal permanent for £1.5m.<n>Theophile-Catherine wants to see if there are other options before committing.<n>He has two years left on his Cardiff contract.

Salford Red Devils secured a second win in a row with a 18-12 victory.<n>Josh Griffin scored a try and kicked three goals for the Red Devils.<n>Jack Hughes, Aaron Murphy and Danny Brough scored tries for Huddersfield.

Salford half-back Rangi Chase faces the threat of a four to eight-match ban.<n>He was charged with making a Grade E dangerous throw on Good Friday.<n>The Red Devils went on to beat Huddersfield 18-12.

Andros Townsend scored England's equaliser against Italy on Tuesday.<n>The Tottenham winger has had more ups and downs than most players experience in their careers.<n>Townsend has scored as many goals for England as he has for Spurs.
Widnes beat Warrington 30-10 in the Cheshire derby.<n>The game was stopped for eight minutes after a flare was thrown.<n>Warrington's losing run is their worst since 2009.

England arrived back in Manchester on Wednesday evening.<n>The squad had been delayed en route from Turin due to a technical issue.<n>Northern-based players and staff were allowed to disembark.<n>Roy Hodgson's side had been due to leave Italy immediately after the game but had to take an extra night's stay in Manchester.<n>The Three Lions drew 1-1 with Italy in Turin on Tuesday night.<n>Andros Townsend, Harry Kane, Kyle Walker and Ryan Mason touched down at Luton Airport on Wednesday afternoon.

Wigan Warriors beat St Helens 12-4 in their Super League clash.<n>Dominic Manfredi, Louie McCarthy-Scarsbrook and Joe Burgess scored tries.<n>Warriors climb up to third in the table after their win over Saints.

Theo Walcott scored five out of 10 for his performance against Italy.<n>Wayne Rooney, Andros Townsend and Ross Barkley all scored seven.<n>Graziano Pelle scored the opener in the 1-1 draw against England.<n>Manchester City midfielder Yaya Toure continues to be linked with Inter Milan.
Daryl Clark will face his boyhood club Castleford Tigers.<n>Clark left the Tigers at the end of last season.<n>Warrington Wolves hooker is the reigning Man of Steel.

Raheem Sterling's Liverpool future has been in doubt after he admitted he is not yet ready to sign a new £100,000-a-week contract.<n>Liverpool are holding out for a deal that would keep him at Anfield until 2018.<n>Brendan Rodgers says he is'relaxed' about Sterling's stalled contract talks.<n>Rods says Sterling has to 'concentrate on his football' and that Liverpool are a'superpower' in world football.<n>Liverpool travel to the Emirates to face Arsenal in the Premier League on Saturday.
Joe Hart has labelled Gianluigi Buffon a 'legend of the game'<n>The England ace has been inspired by the Italian goalkeeper.<n>Hart also received his 50th cap against Italy on Tuesday night.

Graziano Pelle scored Italy's equaliser against England on Tuesday night.<n>The Southampton striker has not scored in the Premier League since December.<n>Pelle has scored nine goals in his first 12 games for the Saints.

Five staff members sustained serious injuries after taking a joy ride down 'the Super Slide' at the Royal Easter Show on Saturday night.<n>The ride was closed after heavy rain made it particularly dangerous.<n>A 22-year-old woman broke both her legs, a 60-year-old man suffered broken ribs and internal bleeding while a 23-year-old woman also broke her leg.<n>Three of the contractors escaped without injury.

Northampton were thrashed by Clermont in Champions of England.<n>Saints were simply obliterated by the formidable Top 14 giants.<n>Noa Nakaitaci scored two tries before half-time.<n>Nick Abendanon, the ex-Bath and England full-back, capped a masterful display with a break-away try from 90 metres out.

Zara, 33, joined Rob Edmond for the final leg of his barrel-roll challenge.<n>The personal trainer rolled the barrel 517 miles from Perthshire to Wiltshire.<n>The trek also saw Joanna Lumley, Fred MacAulay and Rufus Hound join him.<n>Zara pretended to pull husband Mike, 16, along while striking a pose for the cameras.

Manuel Pellegrini says Manchester City will have to buy young talent.<n>The current crop of Academy players aren't ready for first-team action.<n>Part of the pressure comes from FA chairman Greg Dyke's proposal to increase the quota of homegrown players to 12 in Premier League squads.<n>Pellegrini says City must be patient and wait for the right players to come through.

National Union of Teachers expected to call for industrial action this weekend.<n>The ballot of 300,000 members would take place after the election.<n>Last time teachers went on strike was in July, when 21% of schools closed.

Arsenal tried to sign Nuri Sahin in 2005 when he was playing for the Under 17s.<n>But the Turkey international didn't want to go to England.<n>Sahin spent five months on loan at Liverpool before returning to Dortmund.
Antonio Nuez, 59, allegedly attacked his girlfriend at his home.<n>Woman, who has not been named, pepper sprayed and ran to neighbor.<n>Nuez will be charged with aggravated assault.

Kevin Sinfield will quit rugby league at the end of the season.<n>The Leeds Rhinos captain will join Yorkshire Carnegie on 18-month contract.<n>Former Leeds and England coach Tony Smith admits he was shocked by Sinfield's decision.<n>Smith says Sinfield will still have a lot to contribute to rugby league.

Residents of Beckley Club Estates in Dallas, Texas, say they saw a man approach a male peacock, who was in the middle of its mating ritual.<n>Footage shows the thief grab the animal by both its claws before shoving him in his black SUV.<n>Peacocks have lived in the neighborhood for 20 years and residents are worried about their survival if the bird cannot return.

Male tortoise pictured trying to mate with a female at Kiev Zoo.<n>But he fails to impress his partner and she leaves him on its back.<n>He had to crawl for 15 minutes across the grass before finally getting up.

Farmer captures moment a duckling groomed a lamb's woollen coat.<n>Duck begins pecking at the lamb's head and neck as if grooming its coat.<n>Lamb appears to be about to walk away when the pecking becomes more erratic.<n>Duck and lamb appear to be so comfortable they can lay down for a nap together.

The Glass House in Chislehurst, south east London was built as a bunker for government officials in the event of a nuclear attack.<n>The property has now been transformed into a luxury home with a swimming pool, stunning atrium and a glass staircase.<n>It took two years to completely renovate the property which has five bedrooms, a games room, kitchen and roof terrace.

CCTV footage shows the thieves in action at the Shell fuel stop in Walnut Creek, California, last Friday morning.<n>One man distracts a cashier at the window while another hooks up a cable to the ATM.<n>With the other end of the cord attached to a white pickup, the vehicle speeds off and uproots the ATM from its mount.<n>Two of the suspects have been described as white males, while the escape vehicle was detailed as a white Ford F-250 or F-350 four-wheel drive truck.

Tyler MacNiven won the ninth season of The Amazing Race, and a $1million prize.<n>He and fiancee Kelly Hennigan made a three-minute save-the-date video to give friends and family a heads up on their September 26, 2015 wedding.<n>The video, which was filmed in San Francisco, shows the two literally saving 'the date' as they wash up on shore and fight friends disguised as villains.<n>In the end, the two escape from one very large explosion.

Peter Alliss, 84, claims equality laws have backfired and 'b*****ed up game'<n>He said legislation has prompted decline in women's membership.<n>Clubs had previously only allowed female members if they played at restricted times in return for a discounted membership fee.<n>But Equality Act 2010 ruled this was illegal discrimination.<n>Women must now have equal access to the course and pay the same membership rates as men.

Manchester City lost 2-1 to Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park on Monday.<n>Manuel Pellegrini's side sit fourth in the Premier League table.<n>Jose Mourinho, Carlo Ancelotti, Andre Villas-Boas and David Moyes have all won the Premier League but all left their jobs by the following year.

Arsenal face Liverpool in the Premier League on Saturday afternoon.<n>Arsene Wenger was quizzed about Per Mertesacker's 'live' team talk.<n>The Arsenal boss was informed that the story was an April Fools' joke.<n>Sportsmail revealed the story was a hoax at midday on April 1.

Leighton Baines and Luke Garbutt visited Alder Hey Children’s Hospital.<n>The Everton duo handed out Easter eggs and met patients.<n>Baines hailed the strength and character of the children.<n>The Toffees face Southampton at Goodison Park on Saturday.

Oscar scored in Brazil's 3-1 victory against France last Thursday.<n>Juventus scouts were present at the Stade de France to watch Oscar.<n>The Blues forward could be drinking an espresso in Turin next season.
Carlisle United lost 3-1 at Accrington Stanley on Saturday.<n>Manager Keith Curle has laid into his players.<n>The Cumbrians are without a win in five games in League Two.

Yaya Toure was part of a five-man wall when Jason Puncheon stepped up to take a free-kick in the first half.<n>The free-kick killed off Manchester City's chances of salvaging a point.<n>Sportsmail columnist Jamie Carragher felt Toure did not do enough.<n>The defeat left champions City nine points adrift of Chelsea.

Charlie Sumner, 20, staged a one-man pitch invasion at Madejski Stadium.<n>He ran topless onto the pitch and performed a series of somersaults.<n>Reading supporter said he had done it for 'laugh' and that his family had'seen the funny side'<n>He is now facing a potential three-year ban for the stunt.

Mesut Ozil posted a picture on Twitter relaxing with his dog.<n>The Arsenal playmaker has returned home after the international break.<n>Ozil impressed as Germany beat Georgia 2-0 on Sunday.<n>The Gunners take on Liverpool at the Emirates Stadium on Saturday.

Lionel Messi suffered a blow to his right foot in Barcelona's 2-1 win over Real Madrid last month.<n>The forward didn't feature in either of Argentina's recent friendlies.<n>Barcelona travel to Celta Vigo in La Liga on Sunday.

Greg Dyke was given a £16,000 watch as a gift at the World Cup.<n>The FA chairman initially refused to hand his back.<n>FIFA's ethics committee has confirmed receipt of the item.<n>Dyke will now allow the watch to be auctioned for Breast Cancer Care.

Tyler Walker scored his first goal for Nottingham Forest against Brentford.<n>The 18-year-old attacker is the son of former England defender Des Walker.<n>The younger Walker has managed just 56 minutes of senior action.<n>He has scored seven goals in 13 starts for the club's Under-21s.

Peter Alliss said equality for women has 'b******* up the game'<n>The veteran broadcaster also said the BBC should have done more.<n>He said the corporation's failure to secure the Open Championship was'regrettable'

Amanda Beringer asked her brother Brad Fraser to make a toast at her wedding at Eagle Bay, south of Perth.<n>Far from a conventional toast, Mr Fraser performed a song which poked fun at the burdens of marriage.<n>The crowd, who can be heard bursting out in laughter throughout the song, erupt into a standing ovation at the end of the performance.

David Luiz went off after 35 minutes with a hamstring injury.<n>The Brazilian defender was caught by a stray leg while running away from a Marseille player.<n>PSG won the game 3-2, and returned to the top of the French table.<n>Luiz could be a doubt for the Champions League quarter-final against Barcelona.

John Daniel Tohill, 37, was last heard from in 2005 after he left Nelson.<n>His family hired investigators and police but there was little incentive for them to appeal to the public for information.<n>On Tuesday John called his brother Tobias saying he would be visiting.<n>John will visit his family in the coming weeks, including his father, who is in the final stage of dementia.

YouTube videos show Noah Monte perfectly balancing on the palm of his father's hand as he's lifted through the air.<n>As he whizzes up and down, the infant manages to keep his legs and body upright.<n>His outstretched arms help him to remain airborne.

Lucy Garrod, 27, wore contact lenses for 12 years with no problems.<n>But one day woke up with an itchy and irritable right eye.<n>She went to GP who prescribed drops and tests revealed corneal abrasion.<n>She spent a week in hospital and doctors said she was partially blind.<n>But she learned to take photographs with her left eye and passed degree.

The critters were filmed at Indiana's Indianapolis Zoo after getting a makeshift backboard and hoop installed in their pen.<n>However, they're forced to contend with the hilly floor of their enclosure as they play on the makeshift court.<n>March Madness is set to come to a close tonight as the Wisconsin Badgers and Duke Blue Devils go head-to-head at the Lucas Oil Stadium in Indianapolis.

A video uploaded by YouTube user Shkesi shows a baby girl mesmerized by a toy mothering hen.<n>As the plush bird bounces up and down and pops out an egg, the infant can barely believe her eyes.<n>When the first egg emerges she cries for joy and when the third comes she lets out a shriek with her arms waving around.

The snowstorm engulfed the Kommunalnyi Bridge in less than a minute.<n>The video maker captured the storm engulfing the Russian city of Krasnoyarsk.<n>The video shows snow falling on the bridge and then plunging into the river.

Fritz the Golden Retriever from California was filmed wearing bunny ears.<n>Slow-motion footage shows him licking his lips and enthusiastically leaping.<n>But despite his best efforts, the egg narrowly misses his jaw and hits the grass.<n>Other videos show him being thrown steak, tacos, bread rolls and donuts.

Loushanna Craig had gone to Tenerife with her husband for three-day holiday.<n>But she was refused to fly home after her biometric ID card was stolen.<n>Airline staff feared she was an illegal immigrant and refused to fly her.<n>The 37-year-old has now blamed Ryanair for her ordeal.

Fay Purdham and Christopher Dodd played football as boys.<n>But the pair lost touch as teenagers and Fay began her transition.<n>They reunited at a party and are now planning their dream wedding.<n>Miss Purdham has frozen her sperm before changing gender.

Rory McIlroy is bidding to win his fifth major and complete career grand slam.<n>The world No 1 is playing in his fifth Masters at Augusta National this week.<n>McIlroy was given a squeeze on the shoulder by Sir Nick Faldo during Monday's practice round.
The incident took place in the sky over Russia's Dmitrov district.<n>The hot air balloon collides with a transmission tower and plummets.<n>The basket carries three people and all survived the crash.

Graeme McDowell has made the cut just twice in seven attempts at the Masters.<n>The Northern Irishman has finished 17th in 2009 and 12th in 2012.<n>McDowell has vowed to play 'aggressive' golf to improve his record.

Tiger Woods has not won a major since the 2008 US Open.<n>The 39-year-old has not finished in the top 100 in the world since 1996.<n>Woods has not finished in the top 10 in a major since 2008.<n>The American has not finished in the top 10 at the Masters since 2005.
Notts County have appointed Ricardo Moniz as their new manager.<n>The Dutchman pulled out of the running due to 'family reasons'<n>Moniz has six games to save Notts County from relegation.

Residents in Alderholt, Dorset, awoke on Sunday to find egg on doorsteps.<n>The village has 3,000 residents and the egg was delivered to every home.<n>Residents described the deed as 'a wonderful act of random kindness'
Arnold Palmer is out of the Masters with a dislocated shoulder.<n>But he will still act as an honorary starter on Thursday.<n>Ben Crenshaw will stand in for Palmer in the par-three tournament.

Dundee United have lost seven of their last nine matches in all competitions.<n>Paul Hartley is not reading too much into Dundee United's recent slide.<n>United attempt to register their first win in a derby this season at the fourth attempt.

QPR travel to Aston Villa in a Premier League relegation showdown.<n>Villa are 19th in the table, while Rangers are 17th.<n>Chris Ramsey has vowed to call Tim Sherwood ahead of the game.<n>Sherwood was Ramsey's closest lieutenant at Tottenham last season.<n>Sherwood says he will give Ramsey the red button if he calls him.

Tomas Berdych defeated Juan Monaco 6-3, 6-4 in the quarter-finals.<n>The Czech will now face Andy Murray in a rematch of the Australian Open semi-final.<n>Berdych and Murray clashed in a fiery encounter in Melbourne.

Roger Federer posted a picture of himself with a snowball on Twitter.<n>The World No 2 has opted not to play at the Miami Open this year.<n>The Swiss star's agent revealed he wants to maintain his fitness.

Exeter Chiefs will face Gloucester in the semi-finals of the European Challenge Cup.<n>The Chiefs outscored their opponents six tries to one at Sandy Park.<n>David Ewers, Thomas Waldrom, Byron McGuigan, Sam Hill and Dean Mumm all scored tries for the home side.<n>Chris Harris scored a late try for Newcastle Falcons.

Lewis Ferguson was mucking out the stables as usual at Paul Nicholls’ yard on Thursday morning.<n>Ferguson, whose double somersault horror fall from the favourite Merrion Square has been watched by hundreds of thousands online.<n>The 18-year-old was back riding out and said he was undeterred from getting back in the sadal.

The two-metre long reptile is seen perched on a power pole.<n>It battles to swallow the rabbit before finishing the feat in under a minute.<n>Goannas are found throughout most of Australia, but it’s unknown where the clip was filmed.

Saracens' wage bill soared by another £1million last season alone.<n>The club are being investigated by Premier Rugby for alleged salary cap breaches.<n>Chairman Nigel Wray has dismissed rugby’s salary caps rules as ‘a farce’
Liam Plunkett is in contention to play in the first Test in Antigua.<n>The 29-year-old wants to 'rough up' the West Indies batting line-up.<n>Plunkett has recovered from a minor ankle complaint.

Martin Guptill has not represented New Zealand at Test level since 2013.<n>Matt Henry has been called up to the Test squad for the first time.<n>James Neesham will miss the tour because of a hamstring injury.<n>Daniel Vettori has been replaced by Mitchell Santner.

Jonathan Trott has been in fine form for Warwickshire.<n>The 33-year-old batsman has been impressive in addressing the personal demons which led to his departure from Brisbane.<n>Alastair Cook feels Trott is ready to play for England again.

Jonathan Trott left the 2013/14 Ashes trip after just one match.<n>The batsman struggled with what was initially labelled a'stress-related condition' and later diagnosed as situational anxiety.<n>Alastair Cook was concerned that would be the end of his Three Lions days.<n>Cook is confident Trott is ready to face the 'pressure cooker' of international cricket.
Ben Gibson made his Yorkshire debut in 2011 aged 15.<n>The wicketkeeper has now retired from cricket at such a young age.<n>The 19-year-old said it was a 'difficult decision' to retire.

The FIA-backed world endurance championship has removed the practice.<n>'For me that is the past. The condition of women is a little bit different now,' said WEC chief executive Gerard Neveu.<n>Anthony Davidson has backed the decision to remove grid girls.

Jonathan Trott has returned to the England squad for the first time since taking a break with a stress-related illness.<n>Dr Steve Peters worked with Trott during the last year to help him rebuild his career.<n>Peters said there is no magic cure for mental illness and that Trott had worked hard to counter his problems.
Moises Henriques will join Surrey after the IPL.<n>The Australian all-rounder will play in the T20 Blast.<n>Henriques was not selected for the forthcoming Ashes.

Project by men's face product company West Coast Shaving.<n>Members of 30 legendary bands are blended into 30 single faces.<n>Van Halen, Nirvana, The Beatles, U2, Chilli Peppers and Led Zeppelin all feature.

Chelsea and Tottenham Hotspur drew 0-0 at Staines Town.<n>Both sides missed chances to go joint top of the league.<n>DeAndre Yedlin impressed for Spurs at right-back.<n>Ruben Loftus-Cheek was forced off injured after just 37 minutes.

Men aged 65 and over ten times more likely to be diagnosed with melanoma.<n>Older women are about five times more likely to develop the disease.<n>Many patients being diagnosed today suffered cancer-causing sunburn.<n>Number of diagnoses expected to rise to 20,000 a year by 2027.

David Edwards scored a late winner for Wolves against Leeds.<n>Wolves moved into sixth place in the Championship with the win.<n>Benik Afobe and Carl Ikeme also scored for the Molineux side.<n>Leeds striker Jonathan Taylor scored a first-half equaliser.

Clayton Donaldson and David Cotterill put Birmingham 2-0 up after 18 minutes.<n>Cherries hit back through goals from Adam Cook and Tyrone Wilson.<n>Cotterill was sent off for a second bookable offence.<n>Yann Kermorgant scored a penalty to make it 3-2 to Bournemouth.<n>Charlie Daniels then made it 4-2 to move the Cherries back to the top.

Referee German Delfino awarded a penalty to Velez Sarsfield after Daniel Valencia was adjudged to have handled the ball in the area.<n>However, the decision was overturned after linesman Ivan Nunez caught a replay of the incident on a nearby cameraman's monitor.<n>Video technology is not allowed in Argentine football.
Ander Herrera joined Manchester United for £29million in the summer.<n>The Spaniard has started the last eight matches for United.<n>Herrera scored twice in the 3-1 win over Aston Villa on Saturday.

Real Madrid goalkeeper Iker Casillas handed a fan his shirt at half-time.<n>Casillas had earlier made sure the young fan was OK after being hit by a ball.<n>Real Madrid eased to a 9-1 victory against Granada at the Santiago Bernabeu.

Jordan Henderson is yet to sign an extension to his current £60,000-per-week contract.<n>The Liverpool vice-captain is seeking a new £100,000-a-week deal.<n>Sportsmail understands an improved offer worth £5.2million per year will be enough for Henderson to stay at Anfield.

Manchester City have paid for six coaches to transport fans to Selhurst Park.<n>The Premier League champions face Crystal Palace on Monday night.<n>Around 3,000 City fans will have to travel to Selhurst Park by coach.<n>The game kicks off at 8pm, making it impossible to return home on same night.

Huddersfield had not won in seven games before the game.<n>Naki Wells and James Vaughan scored the goals for the hosts.<n>Luke Varney scored a second-half header for Ipswich.<n>But the Tractor Boys couldn't find a winner at the John Smith's Stadium.

Ben Cousins smiled as he left Fremantle Magistrates Court on Thursday.<n>The former AFL star had been on bail and was supposed to appear in court on Wednesday morning.<n>His lawyer claimed Cousins had conflicting medical appointments.<n>Magistrate Steven Malley issued an arrest warrant for Cousins on Wednesday afternoon.<n>The Brownlow medallist surrendered himself at Fremantle Police Station on Thursday morning.

Real Madrid bounced back from their El Clasico defeat with a thumping win.<n>Gareth Bale opened the scoring before Cristiano Ronaldo scored a first-half hat-trick.<n>A Karim Benzema own goal made it 5-0 before half-time.<n>Sergio Ramos and Marcelo were also on target for Carlo Ancelotti's side.<n>Carlos Ibanez scored a consolation for the visitors with a second-half strike.

Arsenal are closing in on the Premier League title after beating Liverpool.<n>Arsene Wenger admits he didn't expect Hector Bellerin and Francis Coquelin to be playing such key roles for the Gunners.<n>Wenger admits Bellerin was selected because of his pace.

Arda Turan was celebrating after Turkey's 2-1 win against Luxembourg.<n>He went to the cockpit to announce his congratulations over the PA system.<n>Turkish aviation officials have warned the crew they face consequences.<n>They said that nobody other than the crew should be allowed in the cockpit.
Manchester City are currently fourth in the Premier League.<n>Manuel Pellegrini says his side must splash the cash in the summer.<n>The Chilean has called for his side to sign a 'crack' player.

Troy Deeney opened the scoring for Watford in the 37th minute.<n>Odion Ighalo doubled the hosts' lead on 65 minutes.<n>The win sees Watford move up to ninth in the Championship.<n>Aitor Karanka's side are now 16 points behind the leaders.

Malky Mackay has been sacked as Wigan manager.<n>The Latics are currently eight points off the relegation zone.<n>Mackay was handed the job in November after an FA investigation.<n>The former Cardiff boss is still under investigation by the FA.

Jeremy Mathieu scores winner in 73rd minute to hand Barcelona victory.<n>French centre-back heads home from close range after Xavi free-kick.<n>Barcelona stay four points ahead of Real Madrid at the top of La Liga.
Juan Arango was not booked but could face a heavy ban.<n>He was not on the pitch when he bit the shoulder of Jesus Zavela.<n>A Arango free kick had earlier brought his team level at 3-3.

Liverpool are currently seventh in the Premier League table.<n>Brendan Rodgers' side have lost both of their top-four matches.<n>The Liverpool boss has conceded defeat in his quest for the top four.<n>Rodgers admits the slide out of the elite will damage Liverpool in the transfer market.

Video shows ISIS fighters destroying ancient Assyrian city of Nimrud.<n>City is believed to date back to the 13th century B.C. and is on UNESCO list.<n>Militants seen using sledgehammers, jackhammers and drills to destroy relics.<n>They then fill barrels with explosives and blow up the ancient city.

Liverpool face Blackburn in the FA Cup on Wednesday night.<n>Mamadou Sakho and Steven Gerrard travelled to Paris for charity game.<n>Liverpool lost 4-1 to Arsenal in the Premier League on Saturday.<n>The defeat all but ends their Champions League hopes next season.

Ander Herrera scored six of his seven Manchester United goals without having to make eye contact with the ball.<n>Herrera netted a brace against Aston Villa on Saturday.<n>The Spanish midfielder scored against Yeovil in the FA Cup back in January.<n>Herrera joined Manchester United for £29million in the summer.

Marseille took the lead through Andre-Pierre Gignac after 30 minutes.<n> Blaise Matuidi equalised for PSG with a superb curling effort.<n>Marquinhos put Marseille back in front after a mistake from Marco Veratti.<n>Zlatan Ibrahimovic put PSG ahead with a free kick two minutes later.<n>Jeremy Morel put through his own net to make it 2-2.<n>Morel scored an own goal to make it 3-2 to PSG.<n>Laurent Blanc's side went on to win 3-2 to go three points clear at the top.

Nik Wallenda, 36, says the 400-foot observation wheel will be moving when he attempts his feat April 29.<n>The Orlando Eye, part of a new entertainment complex, will offer views of central Florida from inside 30 enclosed, air-conditioned glass capsules.<n>No distance for the performance has been set yet, but Wallenda, 36, said he was not likely to walk the entire 20 minutes or so.

Seven baby foxes were found abandoned in a cardboard box in a car park.<n>They are being bottle-fed and vaccinated against rabies before being released.<n>The tiny animals are thought to be only 10 days old and weigh six ounces.<n>They will be released back into the wild in July when they have grown up.

Liverpool are expanding their Main Stand at Anfield.<n>The new structure will be completed by the start of the 2016-17 season.<n>Work on the Main Stand expansion will be completed by the start of the 2016-17 season with 9,000 seats to be added.<n>The new Main Stand will be able to seat 21,000 spectators and will be open in time for the 2016-17 season.

Man had been paying with bounced checks and was kicked out of Neely's Grog House in Port St Lucie, Miami.<n>He returned minutes later with a cup of gasoline and threw it on the bouncer.<n>The bouncer and his friend chased the man, and tackled him before the man lit the bouncer on fire and fled in a truck.

Jordan Spieth leads the Masters by one shot going into final round.<n>The 21-year-old set a new 54-hole scoring record at 16 under par.<n>Justin Rose is second after carding five birdies in his last six holes.<n>Rory McIlroy and Tiger Woods are both in the field tied fifth.

Matt Kemp's anger management issues cost him his first marriage.<n>One of his most shameful moments was broadcast on national television.<n>Kemp was so enraged he unleashed an expletive-ridden tirade on his then-wife Lela Radojkovic, who was carrying their first child.<n>The 44-year-old said he regrets treating his ex-wife that way.<n>Kemp discusses his anger issues on Tuesday's episode of Insight on SBS.

The 75-year-old man was playing golf at the Palmer Sea Reef Golf Course.<n>He believes he stood on the crocodile while looking from his golf ball.<n>The 1.2 metre reptile 'nipped' him and he drove himself back to the clubhouse.<n>He was treated by paramedics at the scene before being taken to hospital.<n>The man is in a stable condition in Mossman District Hospital.<n>Clive Palmer posted a joke on his Twitter account following the incident.

Josi Harrison, Laura Lefebvre, and Hailey Walden, all in 8th grade, were lured into sending naked pictures to their boyfriends at Clatskanie Middle School.<n>They were blackmailed into sending more and were told to'suck it up'<n>When they reported the incident to the principal and police chief, they were told they would be charged with distributing child pornography.<n>On Thursday, a judge ordered the school district to pay the girls $75,000 in damages.

Sky Sports pundit Martin Tyler has picked his favourite game of all time.<n>The game between Liverpool and Newcastle is one he has always loved.<n>It saw the two Premier League title hopefuls slug it out at Anfield.<n>Robbie Fowler, David Ginola, Faustino Asprilla, Les Ferdinand and Stan Collymore all scored in a seven goal thriller.

Jason Denayer is on loan at Celtic from Manchester City.<n>The 19-year-old made his Belgium debut on Tuesday night.<n>Manager Ronny Deila will ask City to keep hold of Denayer next season.<n>Deila also wants to sign Hearts captain Danny Wilson.

Raymond Billam claimed he could barely walk due to back and knee problems.<n>But fraud investigators secretly filmed him playing for his pub football team.<n>The 40-year-old admitted benefit fraud and was given a suspended sentence.

Arsenal beat Burnley 1-0 to win their eighth Premier League game in a row.<n>Gunners are four points behind leaders Chelsea in second place.<n>Ivan Gazidis says he is 'not happy' with second place.<n>But he admits that winning the title is unlikely for the club.<n>Gazidis says the club will 'keep pushing' to finish in the top four.<n>But he fears the club will struggle to maintain that position.

Chelsea technical director Michael Emenalo watched Miranda on Saturday.<n>Miranda has one year left on his contract at Atletico Madrid.<n>The 31-year-old has also been offered to Manchester United and City.<n>But the emergence of Jose Maria Gimenez at Atletico may influence Miranda's decision.

Brett Anthony O'Connor has lost his appeal to ban the media from naming him during his trial.<n>The 52-year-old has been free on bail since March, when he was charged with sexually and indecently assaulting two 12-year-old boys.<n>He has been charged with four counts of indecent assault involving a child under the age of 16 and six counts of assault involving sexual intercourse with a child under the age of 16.<n>The former child safety officer with Education Queensland has been charged with ten counts of sex offences.

Chelsea beat Queens Park Rangers 2-0 at Stamford Bridge on Sunday.<n>Thibaut Courtois was exceptional in goal for the Blues.<n>But he has struggled in previous weeks after an error led to Hull goal.<n>Courtois says he never doubted himself and is happy with his form.

Manchester City lost 4-2 to Manchester United in the derby.<n>Just eight people were arrested at Old Trafford.<n>A handful of City fans were ejected for mocking the Munich Disaster.<n>23 people died when a plane carrying Man City crashed in 1958.

Former chief boss Martin Kimber left in December after report said 1,400 children had suffered horrific sexual abuse over a 16-year period.<n>The new chief executive could be paid up to £40,000 more than Kimber.<n>The council will now offer up to £200,000 to candidates.
Reanne Evans is 10 time ladies' snooker world champion.<n>29-year-old faces Ken Doherty in first qualifying round.<n>Evans would be first woman to reach World Championship finals.

LeBron James says he would pick himself for MVP this season.<n>James believes his influence with the Cleveland Cavaliers deserves recognition.<n>Cavaliers have already won 51 games this season and are No 2 in the Eastern Conference.

Liam Stewart, son of rock star Rod Stewart, was set to make his senior Great Britain ice hockey debut at the World Championships.<n>The 20-year-old forward had been included in new head coach Pete Russell's 23-man party for the World Championship in Holland next week.<n>But Stewart sustained a shoulder injury during Spokane Chiefs' Western Hockey League play-off series against Everett and is replaced in the squad by Craig Peacock.

Stuart Armstrong is hoping to win his first Scottish Premiership title.<n>The midfielder joined Celtic from Dundee United in January.<n>Armstrong watched Dundee United lose 2-0 in the Scottish Cup final last year.

San Antonio Spurs beat Houston Rockets 110-98 on Wednesday.<n>Spurs move into third place in the Southwest Division, half a game behind Houston and Memphis.<n>Memphis thrashed New Orleans to level with Rockets at top of division.<n>No 1 playoff seed Atlanta beat Brooklyn Nets 114-111 in Eastern Conference.<n>Cleveland secured the Central Division title and No.2 seed in the conference by defeating Milwaukee.

Geoffrey Kondogbia has impressed Liverpool scouts this season.<n>The midfielder was a target for Real Madrid, Manchester United and Juventus before signing for Monaco in 2013.<n>The 22-year-old has represented France three times.<n>Liverpool are also monitoring James Milner and Danny Ings.
Newcastle have lost four of their last five games in all competitions.<n>John Carver's side travel to Liverpool on Monday night.<n>Newcastle last won at Anfield in 1994.

Gareth Bale returns from international duty with Wales with a double.<n>He scored both goals as Wales won 2-0 in Israel on Tuesday.<n>The Welshman was back in training with Real Madrid on Wednesday.<n>They prepare to take on 19th-placed Granada on Sunday in 11am kick-off.

Danny Ings is a target for Real Sociedad, who are keen on signing him.<n>Burnley striker Ings is out of contract in the summer.<n>Ings has also attracted interest from Manchester City and Manchester United.<n>Roy Hodgson will watch Ings closely to see if he can make the move.

Atletico Madrid take on Real Madrid in the Champions League last 16.<n>Real beat Atletico in last season's final in Lisbon.<n>Fernando Torres has praised coach Diego Simeone's coaching style.<n>The former Liverpool striker believes Simeone's clear understanding of the team's weaknesses has been the key to their success.
Lazio beat Empoli 4-0 to go one point clear of Roma in Serie A.<n>Napoli beat Fiorentina 3-0 to move up to fourth place in the table.<n>Palermo recorded just their second away win of the season.

Rory McIlroy is looking to complete a career grand slam this week.<n>Only five men have won all four golf's majors in the Masters era.<n>McIlroy is heavily favoured to win the Masters at the Augusta National.<n>He was caddied by One Direction's Niall Horan during the Par-3 Contest.
The Wildcats are rooted to the foot of the table after eight consecutive defeats.<n>The rout saw a hat-trick of tries by Wolves' Richie Myler.<n>Stefan Ratchford also scored 28 points for Warrington.

Sergio Aguero scored his 100th goal for Manchester City on Sunday.<n>The Argentine striker netted in the 89th minute against Manchester United.<n>Aguero joined City for £38m in 2011 and is settled in Manchester.<n>But if City slip outside the top four this season, Aguero could be on the move.
Jamie Peacock scored a double in Leeds' win over Salford.<n>The 37-year-old prop had not scored a try for 12 months.<n>Leeds claimed a 20th successive victory over Salford.

Mike Brown hasn't played since the Six Nations final on March 21.<n>The full back was knocked out in a collision with Italy's Andrea Masi.<n>Conor O'Shea has revealed his concern at the increasing force of rugby's collisions.

Manchester United beat Manchester City 4-2 at Old Trafford.<n>Goals from Ashley Young, Marouane Fellaini, Juan Mata and Chris Smalling secured the win for the Red Devils.<n>Sergio Aguero scored his 100th City goal but United were far the better team.<n>Click here for Manchester United transfer news.

Diego Costa limped off in Chelsea's 2-1 win over Stoke City on Saturday.<n>Spain international has suffered with hamstring problems all season.<n>Costa will miss games against QPR and Manchester United.<n>But he could return in time for Chelsea's trip to the Emirates on April 26.

Manuel Pellegrini could be out of a job by the end of the season.<n>Manchester City have not improved under the Chilean.<n>The club's squad is too old, too foreign and too old.<n>City have had a very good team for quite a while now.
Manchester City lost 2-1 to Crystal Palace at the Etihad Stadium.<n>Eliaquim Mangala was an unused substitute for the champions.<n>Glenn Murray and Jason Puncheon scored the goals that won the game.

Barcelona were desperate for defensive reinforcements last summer.<n>Everton defender John Stones was on their list of targets.<n>But influential voices at the Catalan club urged them to bid for Stones instead.<n>Barcelona signed Jeremy Mathieu from Valencia and Thomas Vermaelen from Arsenal for a combined £14.5m.<n>But Vermaelen is yet to start a game for the La Liga leaders.

Everton beat Southampton 1-0 at Goodison Park on Saturday.<n>The Toffees have now won three in a row in the Premier League.<n>Robert Martinez has been criticised for his tactics in recent weeks.<n>But Martinez has rejected claims that he is stubborn in his approach.<n>The Spaniard insists that he is flexible and his tactics are 'innovative'

Romelu Lukaku's new agent Mino Raiola said he would never have signed for Everton had he been his representative earlier.<n>Agent hinted that Everton are just a stepping stone to the top.<n>Robert Martinez has dismissed the claims as nonsense.<n>Lukaku was injured as Everton beat Southampton 1-0 on Sunday.

Ross Barkley was substituted with 20 minutes to go against Southampton.<n>Everton won 1-0 thanks to a Phil Jagielka goal.<n>James McCarthy said Barkley was 'different class' despite the mistake.

Kevin Streelman and Camilo Villegas both holed out on the fourth and eighth.<n>Spieth hit a hole-in-one on the fourth but could not complete the hat-trick.<n>Nicklaus recorded his first ever hole-in-one at the Masters.<n>Tiger Woods played in the par-three contest for the first time in 11 years.

Tiger Woods is in contention to win his fifth Masters title at Augusta National.<n>The former world No 1 was spotted dancing on Monday during practice.<n>Woods will play in the Par-3 Contest on Wednesday for the first time in 11 years.<n>Australia's Marc Leishman has withdrawn from the Masters due to personal reasons.
Marc Leishman has withdrawn from the Masters to be with his wife.<n>Bubba Watson was recently voted the most unpopular golfer on tour.<n>Arnold Palmer posed with Niall Horan under the Oak Tree.

Chelsea beat Stoke 2-1 in their Premier League clash on Saturday.<n>Jose Mourinho's side are seven points clear at the top of the table.<n>Willian believes his side must continue in the same vein against other sides.<n>The Brazilian has backed Mourinho to lead them to the title.

The PFA Player of the Year is voted for by players in the Premier League.<n>Harry Kane has scored 29 goals in 44 games for Tottenham this season.<n>Eden Hazard is the odds-on favourite to win the award.

Manchester United beat Aston Villa 3-1 at Old Trafford on Saturday.<n>Wayne Rooney scored a stunning goal to seal the win.<n>United now sit two points above Manchester City in fourth place.<n>City face Crystal Palace on Monday night and Van Gaal believes dropping two points will affect their players' mentality.

Liverpool have lost their last two games 4-1 to Manchester United and Arsenal.<n>Brendan Rodgers is ready to recall £20million defender Dejan Lovren.<n>The Croatian has been out of the team recently, but could return.<n>He was dropped for the game at the Emirates by Rodgers.<n>The Reds travel to Blackburn in the FA Cup quarter-final on Wednesday.

Jeremy Peace has put West Brom up for sale for £150million.<n>But the chairman will only sell to a buyer who will invest heavily.<n>Tony Pulis is adamant Peace wants to ensure his legacy is maintained.

Michael Owen believes Raheem Sterling is a better player than Mesut Ozil.<n>The former Liverpool forward made the claim before Arsenal's 4-1 win.<n>Ozil scored his side's second goal in their victory at the Emirates.<n>Owen has refused to back down from his opinion.

Robert Lewandowski scored the winner on his first visit back to Dortmund.<n>The Poland striker spent four years at the club before leaving on a free transfer last summer.<n>Bayer Munich are now 10 points clear at the top of the Bundesliga.

Mateo Musacchio fractured his fibula and dislocated his ankle on Sunday.<n>The 24-year-old defender is expected to be sidelined for six months.<n>Santi Cazorla tweeted his support for the Villarreal defender.

Bastian Schweinsteiger limped off against Borussia Dortmund.<n>Bay Munich said the injury was not serious but he will miss the Cup tie.<n>Franck Ribery also missed training on Monday with an ankle injury.

Bayern Munich travel to Bayer Leverkusen in the German Cup quarter-final.<n>Pep Guardiola's side are without Franck Ribery and Arjen Robben.<n>David Alaba is out for two months after tearing a knee ligament.<n>Goalkeeper Manuel Neuer says 1-0 win over Dortmund was good for confidence.

Manchester City manager Manuel Pellegrini says academy players are not ready for the first team.<n>The Chilean hints that City may look to buy English players to reach homegrown quotas.<n>City's current group of home-grown players will be reduced in the summer when Frank Lampard departs.<n>Jack Wilshere and Ross Barkley have also been linked with City.

Gary Caldwell's first taste of management was 'crazy' following Wigan's battling 2-2 draw against Fulham.<n>The Latics may be heading for relegation but they proved they are ready to go down fighting.<n>Ross McCormack opened the scoring for the home side after just three minutes.<n>A Jermaine Pennant free-kick hauled Wigan level, only for a stunning long-range effort from Matt Smith to put Fulham back in front.<n>But Jason Pearce's 69th-minute effort earned the Latics a point.

Norwich remain second in the Championship after a dramatic win at Bolton.<n>Gary Hooper came off the bench to score a stoppage-time winner.<n>Graham Dorrans had given the Canaries an early lead.<n>Adam Le Fondre had equalised for the visitors.

Manchester United beat Manchester City 4-2 at Old Trafford on Sunday.<n>Ashley Young, Marouane Fellaini, Juan Mata and Chris Smalling scored.<n>Gary Neville said United are getting closer to being 'the real deal'<n>Neville said United could have considered seven points a good result.

England defeated South Africa 21-14 in the final of the Tokyo Sevens.<n>Phil Burgess, Charlie Hayter and Tom Mitchell scored the tries for the English.<n>It is England's first title on the Sevens World Series this season.<n>The 22 points moved them onto 100 and ahead of Australia into the fourth and final Olympic qualifying position available from the series.

Tracey Neville is Phil Neville's twin and sister to Gary Neville.<n>She is England's new netball coach and will select a squad of 12 for the World Cup in Australia in August.<n>Neville earned just £742 a month as a player but has risen to the rank of national head coach first.

Wing's Chinese restaurant is a Manchester favourite with a famous clientele.<n>The restaurant's owner, Mr Wing, is always pushing for publicity.<n>The Class of '92, including Paul Scholes and Nicky Butt, were regulars.<n>Radamel Falcao went there on the day he signed for Manchester United.

Arsenal beat Liverpool 3-0 at the Emirates on Saturday.<n>The Gunners are now just four points behind fourth-placed Chelsea.<n>Arsene Wenger's side have won seven of their last nine league games.<n>But they have never entered the title race this season.

Kenny Miller fears Rangers' promotion bid could be derailed by their recent form.<n>Rangers suffered their first defeat of Stuart McCall's six-game reign.<n>Miller says the Ibrox side's lack of consistency could wreck their chance of a Premiership return.

Jake Drage was jailed after a crash that killed a woman.<n>The 23-year-old surfer was taken into custody in June last year.<n>He sang a children's song for reporters as he left a West Java jail.<n>The surfer said he cannot wait to get back in the water.

Novak Djokovic lost the second set of the Miami Open final to Andy Murray.<n>The Serbian started shouting at his backroom team after the loss.<n>A ball boy was caught up in the crossfire and Djokovic grabbed a towel from him.<n>He has since issued an apology to the youngster and his parents.

CAF president Issa Hayatou has promised unanimous support to Sepp Blatter.<n>Hayatou said: 'Africa is comfortable having you. Africa stays with you'<n>Blatter is seeking a fifth term in office to extend a reign that began in 1998.

Atletico Madrid took the lead through Mikel Gonzalez's own goal after just 90 seconds.<n>And the hosts doubled their lead 10 minutes later through Antoine Griezmann.<n>But the visitors showed uncharacteristic defensive frailties throughout.<n>David Moyes' side have conceded just 29 times in 21 La Liga games.

Cristiano Ronaldo scored 300th goal for Real Madrid on Wednesday.<n>Portugal international netted in the 2-0 win at Rayo Vallecano.<n>Ronaldo has scored 161 goals in the Santiago Bernabeu since 2009.<n>He has netted 15 times each against Atletico Madrid and Barcelona.<n>Ronaldo has also scored 60 goals in the Champions League for Madrid.

Gary Mabbutt, 53, was rushed to hospital after waking up at 1am.<n>Doctors warned him it was 'touch and go' on whether his leg would be amputated.<n>His diabetes had led to a clogged artery in the limb.<n>Surgeons replaced artery with a vein and needed 112 staples to seal wound.<n>Mabbutt will not be able to play football again and has turned down coaching roles.

Jennifer Aniston works out three times a week with her trainer, Mandy Ingber.<n>She takes 3.6kg weights with her when she stays at a hotel.<n>She says exercise, plus meditation, is her 'ultimate stress reliever'

Bizarre incident was caught on CCTV at Nottingham train station's car park.<n>Man seen trying to lift exit barrier, damaging it in the process.<n>Police have released a CCTV image in hope he will be recognised.

Jan Oblak denied Gareth Bale and James Rodriguez in goal for Atletico.<n>Carlo Ancelotti wants his side to repeat their performance at the Bernabeu.<n>Diego Simeone was impressed with his goalkeeper's performance.

Danielle Jones, 33, was shocked when her hero turned up at her wedding.<n>Gary Barlow sang 'A Million Love Songs' at the reception in Berkshire.<n>Bride and groom were given the song as a gift by the singer.<n>Gary had been asked to sing by the bride's bridesmaids on Twitter.

Deanna Robinson, of Quinlan, Texas, was 38 weeks pregnant.<n>She says she was struck at least three times at her parents' home.<n>Her 18-month-old son was removed from her care because of abuse allegations.<n>Video shows her cornered and two officers struggle with her.<n>One appears to hit her with his fist and his arm raises again.

Amanda Peake Glover was a youth ministry teacher and choir singer who'd only one month before had completed the Myrtle Beach marathon with her brother.<n>She was rushed by ambulance to a nearby hospital but was soon pronounced dead.<n>She is survived by her husband Benjamin, daughters Hope, Reagan and Caroline and son Walker.

Woods was pictured hugging his children Sam, 8, and Charlie, 6, during the second day of practice at Augusta National.<n>The 39-year-old is preparing for his latest attempt at a comeback at The Masters 2015.<n>Woods has started just two events in 2015 and dropped outside the world's top 100 for the first time since September 1996.<n>Longterm girlfriend Lindsey Vonn was also at Augusta on Tuesday as she chaperoned Wood's children.

Atletico Madrid and Real Madrid played out a goalless draw on Tuesday.<n>The second leg of the Champions League quarter-final takes place next week.<n>Sportsmail rates the players in the first leg of the clash at the Calderon.

Andy Murray, 27, will marry Kim Sears, 27, in Dunblane on April 11.<n>The couple have kept the wedding low-key, with only close family and friends invited.<n>Murray is friends with James Corden and Alex Ferguson.

Video features Democrat campaigners Jared Milrad and Nate Johnson.<n>They are talking about their upcoming summer wedding in the video.<n>But Russian network Dozhd fears it could fall foul of Putin's 'gay propaganda' laws, which allow heavy fines for promoting homosexuality.

Cara Lee-Fanus was rushed to hospital but died from a head injury.<n>Her mother Kirsty Lee and her ex-boyfriend Alistair Wayne Bowen appeared in court today.<n>The pair were jointly charged with causing or allowing the death of a child.<n>They will appear at Guildford Crown Court for a plea and case management hearing on May 9.

The cricketing legend was laid to rest in a private ceremony in Sydney's eastern suburbs.<n>His wife Daphne and immediate family were the only people present at the ceremony.<n>Prime Minister Tony Abbott had offered a state funeral but Richie Benaud politely declined.<n>Former colleagues and friends gathered at the Australian Golf Club for a memorial following the funeral.

Huddersfield ensured their status in the Championship with a goalless draw at Brighton.<n>The Seagulls ended a run of three successive defeats but are still without a goal from one of their own players for nine hours and 20 minutes.<n>Birmingham City's Demarai Gray was on target for the second successive game.<n>The winger's strike rescued a point for the hosts against Blackburn Rovers.<n>Adam Le Fondre's seventh goal of the season rescued a point for Bolton.<n>The on-loan Cardiff marksman netted for a second successive game.

A woman, 44, slipped and fell from Hassans Fall lookout at Lithgow.<n>She was bushwalking with a male friend and her two children, aged 12 and 13, when she dropped her phone at the lookout.<n>She is believed to have suffered serious head, spinal and chest injuries when she plunged 30 metres.<n>It took two hours for police, paramedics and the Lithgow Volunteer Rescue Squad to rescue her.<n>She was airlifted to Westmead Hospital in Sydney where she remains in a stable condition.

Rolando Aarons has suffered another injury setback and may not play again this season.<n>The Newcastle midfielder was in contention to play for the club's Under 21s against Derby on Wednesday evening.<n>It is understood he has succumbed to injury once again and it is feared his campaign could be over.

Sally and Stephen Morley had their IVF baby, Pixie, nine months ago.<n>They were the first couple in their area to use the EmbryoScope technology.<n>The revolutionary technology allows medics and parents to watch the cell dividing.<n>It also allows experts to select the best embryos based on how they form.

Scottish comedian Limmy uploaded the seven-second clip to his Twitter.<n>Fans were outraged as the three-inch house spider crawls out of his mouth.<n>Limmy, 38, starred in BBC comedy Limmy's Show.

Rose Devereux, 49, was left in agony and disfigured after years of treatment.<n>Her bottom row of teeth virtually destroyed by terrible gum disease.<n>She also suffered 50 per cent bone loss because of untreated gum disease.<n>She claims disintegrating abscesses drained into her body, effectively poisoning her.<n>She was often unable to lift her left leg to put her socks on.<n>The General Dental Council has investigated the work of Janakan Siva.<n>He will now go before a disciplinary committee and could be struck off.

Raheem Sterling has attracted interest from a number of big clubs.<n>Liverpool boss Brendan Rodgers has insisted he will not be sold.<n>But the likes of Arsenal, Chelsea and Manchester City could make moves.<n>Manchester United and Bayern Munich are also interested in Sterling.
Chelsea beat Shakhtar Donetsk 3-2 in the UEFA Youth Team League final.<n>Izzy Brown scored twice and Dominic Solanke once.<n>The 18-year-old captained the side in Switzerland.

Jared Milrad and Nate Johnson, from Chicago, Illinois, were seen walking hand in hand in Clinton's video to announce her 2016 bid.<n>Milrad, 31, is a lawyer and social activist; Johnson, 30, is a health care consulting company worker.<n>The couple will get married in July in a Chicago park then have their reception at a LGBT community center.

Paul Scholes says Raheem Sterling should stay at Liverpool.<n>Scholes says Sterling should concentrate on playing every week.<n>Sterling says he is not ready to sign a new £100,000-a-week deal.<n>The 20-year-old has been linked with a move to Arsenal.

Caen midfielder N'golo Kante is attracting interest from a host of Premier League clubs.<n>Arsenal, Newcastle United and Southampton have all checked on the 24-year-old.<n> Caen are willing to sell the defensive minded midfielder for around £5million.

Lauren Hill, 19, passed away from Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma (DIPG)<n>On Friday, basketball star LeBron James posted farewell letter to her on Twitter.<n>In letter, he praised Lauren for 'leadership', 'courage' and'strength'<n>He added: 'Your time spent on earth will never be forgotten'<n>Many users have deemed tribute 'touching' and 'beautiful'

North Charleston officer Clarence Habersham, 37, should be arrested, say lawyers.<n>He was the second officer to arrive at the scene of the shooting.<n>He reported that Walter Scott had gunshot wounds to his chest, right side, and backside.<n>However, he gave a two-sentence supplemental report saying he tried to render aid to the body.<n>Video shows that Scott was running away when he was shot five times.<n>Shooter Michael Slager, 33, has been charged with murder in the death.

Pop star, 41, had wanted to extend his home by two storeys.<n>He wanted to build underground extension under his garden and studio.<n>Williams angered his neighbour Led Zeppelin guitarist Jimmy Page.<n>He withdrew the plans but has submitted fresh blueprints for the house.<n>Williams bought the property for £17.5million in 2013 and has a swimming pool.

City officials are trying to determine what caused bricks to fall nine stories from the facade of a vacant building in downtown Cleveland, crushing a minivan that was parked below.<n>No one was injured in the accident.<n>The building and minivan were unoccupied at the time of the collapse, and no injuries were reported.

Edson Cholbi do Nascimento, known as Edinho, will be the team's coach in the second division of the Brazilian league this year.<n>Edinho recently made headlines after being convicted in a money laundering case that involved a drug gang.<n>He is appealing a 33-year prison sentence.

Police hunting owner of 'Staffy-type' dog after girl, 4, suffered bite wounds.<n>Child was outside shops with her older sister in Brighton, East Sussex.<n>She suffered a single puncture wound to her upper lip following the incident.<n>Youngster was taken to Royal Alexandra Children's Hospital for treatment.

Newcastle are just nine points above the Premier League relegation zone.<n>John Carver's side are just two wins away from relegation.<n>Newcastle lost 2-0 to Liverpool at Anfield on Monday night.<n>Newcastle have just four home games left in the current campaign.

Erica Leeder, 26, was charged with assaulting a police officer.<n>The incident occurred at Rockingham Police Station, south of Perth.<n>The mother of three was arrested on March 25 during a strip search.<n>She has been granted bail and will reappear in court in May.<n>The woman has two previous charges and could face 18 months in jail.

Siem de Jong suffered a collapsed lung in February and was ruled out for five months.<n>The £6million signing has returned to training and will feature for Newcastle's reserves on Wednesday.<n>Newcastle have lost five on the spin and are on the verge of relegation.

Miracle Godson went for a swim at East Quarry, Appley Bridge, on Friday.<n>He jumped into deep waters and failed to surface, friends desperately tried to save him.<n>His lifeless body was found by police divers at about 5pm that day.<n>His rugby league club said he had great future potential and scouts were monitoring his progress.

Hibernian face a battle over potentially lucrative gate revenues.<n>The club would have to hand over 50 per cent of play-off profits to lower league clubs under recently passed SPFL rules.<n>Hibs are currently second in the Championship.

Aljaz Bedene cannot play for Great Britain in the Davis Cup.<n>The Slovenian-born player has been granted a British passport.<n>But the ITF have ruled that he cannot play for Great Britain.<n>Greg Rusedski has backed Bedene's bid to be eligible to play for GB.

Lewis Hamilton will start first for the Chinese Grand Prix.<n>He was four hundredths of a second ahead of Mercedes team-mate Nico Rosberg.<n>Sebastian Vettel will start third with Ferrari team-mate Kimi Raikkonen fourth.

Justin Rose will tee off with Jordan Spieth at 19.50 (BST) on Sunday.<n>The Englishman is in contention to win his first major title.<n>Rory McIlroy is paired with Tiger Woods in the final pairing.<n>There is one all-English pair in Paul Casey and Ian Poulter.

Novak Djokovic beat Andy Murray in the Miami Open final.<n>The world No 1 lost his cool after losing the second set.<n>He confronted a ball boy who seemed startled by the confrontation.<n>Djokovic has since issued an apology via Facebook.

Sunderland have moved three points clear of the relegation zone.<n>The Black Cats host Crystal Palace at the Stadium of Light on Sunday.<n>Costel Pantilimon admits there has been a mood change under Dick Advocaat.

Ian Bell scored 143 on the first day of the first Test in Antigua.<n>England were 34 for three before Bell and Joe Root put on 177.<n>Bell was dropped from the side in the Caribbean in 2009.<n>The 33-year-old said he deserved to be dropped and did 'a lot of hard yards' to get back in.

Leigh Griffiths fired Celtic into an early lead with a third minute strike.<n>But Edward Ofere equalised for Inverness just a minute later.<n>The draw means Celtic remain two points clear at the top of the Scottish Championship.

Rangers defeated Raith Rovers 4-0 in the Scottish Championship on Sunday.<n>Nicky Law scored a double and Nicky Clark scored a header.<n>Haris Vuckic also netted at Ibrox to keep Rangers in second place.<n>Rangers and Hibernian are level on 61 points with one game remaining.

Rangers defeated Raith Rovers 4-0 in the Scottish Championship on Sunday.<n>Stuart McCall has warned his side they must improve further.<n>Rangers are three points clear of Hibernian in the promotion race.

Moussa Sissoko was sent off for a reckless lunge on Lucas.<n>Newcastle manager John Carver labelled the challenge 'indefensible'<n>Carver said he would not defend anyone if it was 'indefensible'<n>Click here for Newcastle United transfer news.

Paul Downton sacked as managing director of England cricket.<n>The move comes a day ahead of an ECB board meeting.<n>Sportsmail asks: Who's next?

Chelsea Under 19s face Shakhtar Donetsk in the UEFA Youth League final.<n>Chelsea are the current holders of the trophy after winning it last year.<n>Adi Viveash's team are favourites after their semi-final win over Roma.<n>Dominic Solanke has scored 11 goals during Chelsea's run to the final.

Paul Downton has left his role as managing director of the ECB.<n>He was appointed in February 2014 after the Ashes whitewash.<n>England have struggled in several areas since then.<n>Downton made the decision to sack Kevin Pietersen.<n>He also reappoint Peter Moores as England coach.

Dikembe Mutombo was elected to the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame on Monday.<n>The eight-times NBA All-Star is famous for swatting away opponents' shots and wagging his finger at them.<n>Mutombo was a four-times NBA Defensive Player of the Year.<n>He played in the NBA from 1991 until 2009, recording 11,729 points, 12,359 rebounds, and 3,289 blocks.

Rory McIlroy tee off with Phil Mickelson and Ryan Moore at 3.41pm BST.<n>Tiger Woods will tee off with Jamie Donaldson and Jimmy Walker.<n>McIlroy will be joined over the first two rounds by three-time Masters champion Mickelson.

Cesc Fabregas scored the only goal of the game in the 88th minute.<n>The win moves Chelsea seven points clear at the top of the Premier League.<n>Dider Drogba also praised his side's 'belief' in the game.

Brooklyn Nets beat Portland Trail Blazers in the only game on the NBA schedule.<n>Brook Lopez scored 32 points and dominated twin brother Robin.<n> Nets are now in seventh place in the Eastern Conference standings.

Manchester City lost 2-1 to Crystal Palace at the Etihad on Monday night.<n>City are now nine points behind Premier League leaders Chelsea.<n>Gary Neville believes City have a'mentality problem'<n>The former Manchester United defender said they 'cannot sustain success'

Jordan Spieth holds two-shot lead after seven holes of final round last year.<n>But Spieth bogeyed the eighth and ninth and Bubba Watson birdied the same holes to take control of the tournament.<n>Spieth finished joint second with Sweden's Jonas Blixt.<n>The 21-year-old believes he is better equipped to cope with pressure this year.

PSG face Barcelona in the Champions League on Wednesday night.<n>Lucas Moura has singled out Lionel Messi for special praise.<n>PSG playmaker has revealed he is 'obsessed' with Messi's playing style.

The FA have formed a concussion experts panel to help make the game safer.<n>The panel of eight medical professionals will advise the FA on what can be done to make the game safer.<n>The Jeff Astle Foundation has been raising awareness of the danger of long-term head injuries from playing football.
