Bristol City beat Bradford City 6-0 on Tuesday night to secure promotion.<n>The Robins are now 10 points clear at the top of League One.<n>Aden Flint says the team had three aims at the start of the season.<n>They want to win promotion, be champions and win the Johnstone's Paint Trophy.

Barcelona are in France ahead of their Champions League quarter-final tie.<n>Luis Suarez, Lionel Messi and Neymar have a special relationship, says Gerard Pique.<n>Pique also claims there is 'no hint of jealousy' between the trio.<n>Barcelona take on Paris Saint-Germain at the Parc des Princes on Wednesday.

Police have released photos of 13 people they want to speak to in relation to the incident at ANZ Stadium on April 3.<n>A touch judge suffered a broken shoulder when he slipped as he tried to dodge bottles being thrown by angry Canterbury fans.<n>Sideline interchange official Darren Alchin was taken to hospital with a broken shoulder.<n>Referee Gerard Sutton escaped with no injuries despite slipping over as he attempted to dodge the missiles.
Daniel Agger is accused of elbowing Mattias Jorgensen in derby.<n>Incident was not seen by match officials during Brondby's 0-0 draw.<n>Denmark FA are to investigate the incident.

Ian Drinnan claimed he could barely walk and needed crutches to get around.<n>But he was filmed looking sprightly as he put up goalposts at his club.<n>The 58-year-old was supervised training sessions for hours on end.<n>He was also helping with improvements to Blackpool Rangers FC.<n>He admitted fraud and was sentenced to 80 hours unpaid work for the community.

Lavall Hall, 25, was shot dead by Miami Gardens police on February 15.<n>Officers said he attacked them with a broom - but video shows him running.<n>Hall was released from a mental hospital just one week before the shooting.<n>His family have filed a wrongful death lawsuit against the city and the officers.

Terry released footage of Kate Upton dancing in a bikini without her permission.<n>The video has been viewed more than 22 million times on YouTube.<n>In a new interview Kate says there is no bad blood between them now.

Shaqueel van Persie scored a'scorpion kick' in his back garden.<n>The seven-year-old has trained with both Manchester clubs.<n>Robin van Persie Snr posted the video on his Instagram account.<n>The Holland international has been linked with a £5million move.

Lewis Hamilton claims his Mercedes contract is '99.6 per cent done'<n>The British driver opted to negotiate with himself instead of an agent.<n>Hamilton says he has had to read 'about 80 pages' of the terms and conditions.<n>The 30-year-old is favourite to win the Chinese Grand Prix on Sunday.
YouTube user Serpentor filmed his feline friend in action.<n>Footage shows the tabby producing bizarre gurgling noises.<n>When her back is rubbed, she lets out a string of gobbledygook sounds.

Magnitude 3.1 earthquake hit north of San Fernando at 9pm last night.<n>It was centered four miles north of San Fernando near Interstate 210.<n>US Geological Survey said quake had a depth of about five miles.<n>It came three days after a magnitude 3.5 earthquake hit the area.

Matej Vydra fires Watford into the lead with a stunning volley.<n>Adlene Guedioura doubles the Hornets' advantage shortly after the break.<n>The win keeps Watford in the Championship promotion hunt.<n>Millwall's relegation is confirmed after a fourth straight defeat.

Quinn Patrick was on a fishing trip with his dad at Snow Lake, Indiana.<n>The pair caught a Bowfin lying lifeless on a concrete dock.<n>When the fish propels itself from the ground it slaps Quinn in the face.<n>The sound of the fish making impact with the youngster’s face is not dissimilar to a sound effect used in a cartoon.

The Curl-crested Jay is native to South America and lives in Brazil.<n>The bird is one example of species that have learned to incorporate peculiar everyday sounds into their song.<n>Videoed behind a fence, the bird makes a sinister noise like a distorted voice before creating an almost digital sound.<n>Following this the bird makes a noise that sounds like running water before a Space Invaders style tune emerges from it.

England were all out for 341 on day two of the first Test in Antigua.<n>Jimmy Anderson was England's only wicket to fall on the day.<n>He is three wickets away from breaking Sir Ian Botham's England record.<n>Anderson was watched by his wife, two daughters and parents.<n>He was stuck in a stubborn stand with Chris Jordan, who scored 38.

Joao Teixeira has been ruled out for the rest of the season.<n>The Liverpool youngster broke his leg during Brighton's draw with Huddersfield.<n>Brighton manager Chris Hughton has said it is a'real blow' to lose Teixeira.

Jason Denayer is on loan at Celtic from Manchester City.<n>The 19-year-old defender is wanted back by City for pre-season assessment.<n>But Ronny Deila confirmed that Denayer will miss the Champions League qualifiers in July.

The listing, posted Friday, showed a laminated badge featuring a photo of Hernandez, 25, and identifying information.<n>Hernandez is currently in prison during his trial for the the June 2013 shooting death of Odin Lloyd.<n>The listing, which was deleted on Saturday and had zero bids, was posted by a user who claimed he was in jail with Hernandez.

Mats Hummels has been linked with a £30million move to Manchester United.<n>The Germany defender has two years left on his contract at Borussia Dortmund.<n>Hummels sat out Dortmund's 3-2 German Cup win over Hoffenheim.<n>Dort Dortmund CEO Hans-Joachim Watzke is optimistic about extending Hummels' stay.

Borussia Dortmund lost 1-0 to Bayern Munich in the Bundesliga.<n>Robert Lewandowski scored against his former club to give Bayern victory.<n>Jurgen Klopp says his side lacked punch and deserved to lose.<n>Dortmund captain Mats Hummels disagrees with his coach.

Boy, 11, with autism, drew world map from memory in New York classroom.<n>His mother's student took photos and posted them on Reddit as user Bobitis.<n>Map included major countries, political borders and tiny coastal islands.

Borussia Dortmund defeated Hoffenheim 3-2 in extra time in the German Cup quarter-final on Tuesday night.<n>Sebastian Kehl fired a spectacular volley in extra time to give Dortmund a place in the semi-finals.<n>Neven Subotic and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang scored for Dortmund.<n>Kevin Volland and Roberto Firmino scored for Hoffenheim.<n>Ricardo Rodriguez converted a second-half penalty to allow Wolfsburg to advance with a 1-0 victory over Freiburg.

John Terry was targeted by QPR fans at Loftus Road.<n>The Chelsea captain was rarely troubled by Bobby Zamora.<n>He also dealt with Charlie Austin well during the game.<n>Chelsea won the game 1-0 thanks to a Cesc Fabregas goal.

Chelsea travel to Loftus Road to face QPR on Sunday.<n>It will be the club's 700th game under Roman Abramovich's ownership.<n>Jose Mourinho believes the Russian has been good for English football.<n>The Blues have won three Premier Leagues, four FA Cups, three League Cups, one Europa League and one Champions League since 2004.

England Women's U19 European Championships qualifier against Norway will be replayed after refereeing mistake.<n>Referee Marija Kurtes wrongly awarded an indirect free-kick and disallowed a goal.<n>Young Lionesses thought they had equalised but team-mate Rosella Ayane had entered the box too early.<n>England won 3-1 against Switzerland on Thursday and will qualify if the penalty is scored and the match is drawn 2-2.

The storm system stretches from Texas up to the Great Lakes and down to North Carolina.<n>Strong storms rumbled through the Southern Plains early on Thursday, missing major population centers but offering a preview of bad weather.<n>Tornadoes were reported on Wednesday and early Thursday in Kansas, Missouri and Oklahoma, but those areas saw minimal damage.

Mockumentary W1A shows bosses holding an emergency meeting after Clarkson uses the word ‘tosser’ on Top Gear.<n>The episode was apparently filmed last July, but the narration has recently been tweaked.

Footage shows the dictator smiling and waving with his right wrist in bandages.<n>South Korean official says he must have suffered the injury in the past.<n>But doctors who have examined the photos say it is unlikely to be fractured.<n>Kim Jong-Un, 32, has been the subject of speculation over his health for years.

Manchester United travel to Stamford Bridge to face Chelsea on Saturday.<n>Louis van Gaal's side are currently third in the Premier League table.<n>Gary Neville believes United have a good chance of beating Chelsea.<n>But he admits it will be a tough test for Van Gaal's side.

The first year students at Washington University were rowing at Creve Coeur Lake in Missouri.<n>The St. Louis freshman men’s crew were captured on video rowing under a bridge by filmmaker Benjamin Rosenbaum.<n>The filmmaker lets out a laugh as hundreds of fish jump from the water and hurl themselves at the boat.

Goska spent some time volunteering at Criadouro Ona Pintada in Brazil.<n>She has mixed with a number of exotic animals while there.<n>One-year-old rescued jaguar, Perseu was captured on video being bottle-fed.<n>The volunteer holds the jaguar around the neck and gives it cuddles.

Siem de Jong came through first half of Newcastle Under 21s defeat.<n>Midfielder made way at the break after suffering collapsed lung.<n>Newcastle lost 2-0 to Derby County at St James' Park on Wednesday.

State Senator Jeffrey Klein tweeted a link to a Google search for Susan Del Percio.<n>Republican strategist Del Percio said the tweet was a'silly mistake'<n>The tweet was deleted quickly and Klein apologized for the mistake.<n>He said that a staffer 'accidentally tweeted a link from her personal phone'

Jack Colback says Newcastle United fans are being short-changed.<n>The 25-year-old admits the squad is far from the standard required.<n>Colback was one of the only players to deserve credit this season.<n>Newcastle have lost five games in a row and are 18th in the table.

Graeme McDowell carded a final round of 73 on Sunday to finish six over par for the tournament.<n>The former US Open champion is now a combined 24 over for his eight appearances in the year's first major championship.<n>McDowell said he would never consider not playing the Masters.

Rory McIlroy was joined by Niall Horan at the Masters on Wednesday.<n>The One Direction singer fell while caddying for McIlroy in Par-3 Contest.<n>But Horan revealed that the pair will reunite on stage in Boston.<n>One Direction play Gillette Stadium in Massachusetts on September 12.

Yan Tai weighed just over seven stone when she began dating You Pan.<n>But two years on and the pretty 20-year-old has ballooned to 14 stone 2lbs.<n>You splashed out on meals for Yan almost every day.<n>He even woke her up and fed her midnight snacks in a bid to stop her attracting too much attention from other men.<n>The food-obsessed 25-year-old even got friends to hold up pictures of their favourite food while he asked Yan to marry him.

Andy Lee retains his WBO middleweight title after draw with Peter Quillin.<n>The fight was judged a draw by the judges after 12 rounds in Brooklyn.<n>Lee threw more punches and connected with greater frequency.<n> Quillin's unbeaten record remains intact.

Jermain Defoe was introduced to the crowd at a WWE event in Newcastle.<n>The Sunderland striker was booed by some of the crowd.<n>Defoe scored the winner for Sunderland in the Tyne/Wear derby on Sunday.

Moussa Sissoko was sent off for a reckless challenge on Lucas Leiva.<n>Newcastle lost 2-0 to Liverpool at Anfield on Monday night.<n>John Carver says the club will deal with Sissoko's fate.<n>Newcastle are currently 19th in the Premier League table.

Martin Montoya scored a lofted pass into a basketball hoop during training.<n>The 23-year-old defender was applauded by his team-mates.<n>Barcelona defeated Almeria 4-0 on Wednesday evening.<n>Luis Suarez and Lionel Messi scored the goals in the victory.<n>Second-placed Real Madrid beat Rayo Vallecano 2-0.

Jose Mourinho believes he is improving in every aspect of his job.<n>Chelsea boss says he cannot help but be truthful when he addresses the media.<n>Mourinho has won league titles in all four countries he has managed.<n>Mourinho was fined £25,000 earlier this season after claiming there was a clear campaign against his side after being riled by a number of refereeing decisions.

Kevin Pietersen joined Surrey team-mates for team photo at KIA Oval.<n>The batsman looked in deep thought as he sat right at the end of the photo.<n>The Surrey squad begin their County Championship campaign on April 19.<n>The event comes just days after the sacking of Paul Downton.<n>Pietersen is expected to return to the England set-up after being axed.

Pensioner drove red Peugeot towards Southend - but on London-bound track.<n>Car chase ended when she finally stopped on the busy dual carriageway.<n>One man needed treatment for neck and back injuries after crash on Monday.

Jose Mourinho and Sir Alex Ferguson formed a firm friendship.<n>The pair were fierce rivals, but formed a friendship after the 2004 Champions League.<n>Mourinho says he learned respect from Ferguson after beating United.<n>The Chelsea boss has had a frosty relationship with Arsene Wenger and Pep Guardiola.

The Masters got underway on Thursday at Augusta National in Georgia.<n>Rory McIlroy is bidding to complete a career grand slam.<n>Tiger Woods is looking to rediscover his magic after a difficult year.<n>Here, Sportsmail brings you the lowdown on a selection of The Masters WAGS.

Liverpool players and their partners enjoy day one of Grand National Meeting.<n>Brad Jones, Glen Johnson and Fabio Borini were joined by other halves.<n>The day after Liverpool's FA Cup replay win over Blackburn.

Michael Vaughan has emerged as the favourite for the new role.<n>The former England captain has held talks with new ECB chief executive Tom Harrison.<n>Andrew Strauss and Alec Stewart are also in the frame for the role.

Leah Williamson's penalty was disallowed in the first game.<n>But German referee Marjia Kurtes awarded Norway a free-kick.<n>That set up a replay which lasted 18 seconds.<n>Williamson took the penalty again and scored.<n>England secured a place at this summer's tournament in Israel.

Manchester City face Manchester United at Old Trafford on Sunday.<n>City are one point behind United in the Premier League table.<n>Sergio Aguero insists City can retain their title.<n>Aguero scored a 94th minute winner to win the title in 2012.

Spieth shot 64 to take the first-day lead at Augusta.<n>The 21-year-old Texan is the youngest Masters leader in history.<n>Justin Rose and Ernie Els both shot 67 on day one.

Button crashed into the back of Pastor Maldonado on lap 49 of the race.<n>The Brit was demoted to 14th after the incident and given a five-second penalty.<n>The McLaren driver was also given two penalty points on his superlicence.

Leicester Tigers are two points behind Northampton Saints in the table.<n>The Tigers face Saracens on Saturday in the Aviva Premiership.<n>Richard Cockerill believes the title race will go to the final day.

Jimmy Anderson could only take one wicket on day two of first Test.<n>Anderson was in line to overtake Sir Ian Botham's record of 383 Test wickets.<n>Chris Jordan believes Anderson's wickets are 'just around the corner'

England were all out for 399 on day two of the second Test in Antigua.<n>Chris Jordan and Justin Holder fought out a close battle for the last two wickets.<n>Shiv Chanderpaul's Test career has now lasted 21 years and 28 days.

Ben Stokes overstepped the line when he thought he had Jermaine Blackwood caught by Alastair Cook.<n>Michael Vaughan thinks the 23-year-old should return to his natural style.<n>Jonathan Agnew thinks England will rue Tuesday’s showing.

Seamus Coleman handled the ball in the area in the first half.<n>Everton had taken the lead through Aaron Lennon.<n>Swansea's Jonjo Shelvey scored from the spot to level the scores.<n>Roberta Martinez says Coleman should have been awarded a free-kick.

Chelsea beat QPR 1-0 in the west London derby at Loftus Road.<n>Cesc Fabregas' low strike was enough to secure the win for the Blues.<n>Chelsea defender Branislav Ivanovic was struck on the head by a lighter.<n>QPR boss Chris Ramsey condemned the behaviour of the home fans.<n>Ramsey refused to blame Robert Green for the loss, despite his mistake.

Chelsea sit seven points clear at the top of the Premier League table.<n>Thibaut Courtois has won four trophies in the last five seasons.<n>The Belgian goalkeeper wants to win the Premier League this season.<n>Courtois says he has dreamed of playing in finals since a young age.

Augusta National has been hit by heavy rain during the week.<n>Rory McIlroy has won all four of his majors after rain.<n>The Northern Irishman is favourite to win the Masters.

Porto are the only undefeated side in the Champions League.<n>Pep Guardiola's Bayern Munich are the other side to have scored in the competition.<n> Julen Lopetegui says Porto have room to improve ahead of the match.<n>Bay Munich are the current holders of the Champions League.

Ben Flower will return for Wigan against Warrington on Thursday.<n>Flower was sent off in last year's grand final for two punches on Lance Hohaia.<n>Coach Shaun Wane says he wants Flower to be 'a bit more aggressive'<n>Flower had knee surgery during his enforced lay-off.
Three players diagnosed with dengue fever this week.<n>Players forced to use insect repellent during practice sessions.<n>Players will need two weeks to fully recover from the disease.

Andy Murray is set to marry fiancée Kim Sears in Dunblane this weekend.<n>There are believed to be well over 100 people attending.<n>Murray has confirmed that there will be no celebrities at the wedding.<n>The 27-year-old Scot arrived back in Britain on Monday.

Ben Flower landed a sickening blow on Lance Hohaia in the Grand Final.<n>Flower was banned for six months and is preparing to return to rugby league.<n>The Wigan forward said he regrets the attack every day.<n>Flower promised he was a changed man and wants to return to the game.

YouTube user MicahMedia uploaded a video showing how to peel an egg.<n>He pops the hardboiled egg into a tumbler glass and fills it with water.<n>He vigorously shakes the glass from left to right to loosen the shell.<n>The 28-second video currently has over 16million views on the site.

Southampton have failed to score in five of their last nine league matches.<n>Ronald Koeman's side are currently seventh on 53 points.<n>They host Hull City in the Premier League on Saturday.<n>Saints have failed to score in seven of their last 10 league matches.

Eden Hazard is one of the elite players in English football.<n>He has been a key part of Chelsea's success this season.<n>The Belgian winger is in line to be named PFA player of the year.

Crystal Palace are 11th in the Premier League table.<n>Alan Pardew's side beat Manchester City 2-1 on Monday night.<n>Sunderland host Palace at the Stadium of Light on Saturday.<n>Pardew was first Newcastle boss to suffer four successive defeats to Sunderland.

Mark Selby beat Elliot Slessor to reach the third round of the China Open.<n>John Higgins and Ding Junhui also advanced effortlessly on Wednesday.<n>Shaun Murphy came from behind to beat Anthony McGill 5-4.

Former England rugby star bought Monbeg Dude for £12,000 at auction.<n>After £105,500 payday he tweeted ‘Holy s***, I’m lost for words and emotions'<n>After he bought the horse Zara called him an idiot, but she was there with him.<n>Monbeg Dude was a 40-1 outsider when the race began.

Stoke City manager Mark Hughes wants to extend Britannia Stadium pitch.<n>Potters' current 100m x 66m pitch is the smallest in the Premier League.<n>Hughes wants to make pitch bigger to suit Potters' passing style.<n>Everton, Liverpool and Chelsea are three of the ten clubs who do not currently comply with the regulated size.

Jose Mourinho has won 21 major trophies during his career as a coach.<n>Chelsea boss has coached a host of world class players during his career.<n>Here, Sportsmail picks his best ever XI from his time in charge.

Richie Benaud has died aged 84 in a Sydney hospice after battling skin cancer.<n>The legendary commentator passed away peacefully in his sleep surrounded by his wife Daphne and family.<n>Prime Minister Tony Abbott has offered his family a state funeral.<n>A veteran of 63 Test matches, Benaud played a pivotal role in the formation of World Series Cricket in the 1970s.

Chelsea U19s beat Roma U19s 4-0 in UEFA Youth League semi-final.<n>Dominic Solanke scored a brace, with Charlie Colckett and Tammy Abraham also on target.<n>Chelsea will now face Shakhtar Donetsk in the final.

Lauren Hill was diagnosed with Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glioma, a rare brain cancer, shortly after her 18th birthday and told she had less than two years to live.<n>But she defied doctors' expectations and played four games for Mount St. Joseph University in Cincinnati, raising more than $1.5 million for research.<n>She moved to Cincinnati Children's Hospital earlier this year and died on Friday morning.

Campaign aims to get pedestrians off their phones in Philadelphia.<n>Video features characters in'safety suits' talking to residents.<n>37 people died from being hit by cars in the city last year.<n>Campaign is aimed at 18 to 25-year-olds who are most likely to be hit.

The unnamed woman, believed to be between 25 and 45 years old, was discovered lying unconscious March 22 in the area near Shore Parkway and 26th Avenue in Brooklyn.<n>Paramedics who responded to the scene were unable to revive her and she was pronounced dead that evening.<n>Investigators believe the name 'Monique' was etched across a tattooed ribbon within a heart topped with a rose.

Robin Thomas, of Jonesboro, Arkansas, posted the ad on his truck.<n>The retired cook said he's looking for a woman who is 'normal and down-to-earth' and closer to his own age, hoping for 'at least 28'<n>Thomas has three kids, aged six to 11, who he said that his kids think the sign is 'cute'

I'm getting hydrophobic'<n>His wife Bonnie, 67, posted the two-minute clip on Facebook.<n>It has been viewed almost 30 million times.

NAC Breda boss smashes through plastic casing of dugout.<n>Robert Maaskant furious after his side give up two-goal lead.<n> NAC Breda were leading 2-0 at half time against FC Dordrecht.

Prince of Wales and Duchess of Cornwall visited Ballindalloch Distillery.<n>Couple were invited to fit the bungs to the casks on a tour of the site.<n>But they will have to wait around eight to 10 years to sample the whisky.<n>The whisky from both casks will then be bottled to benefit charities.

An unidentified man was caught on the NBC sports channel wandering across the green at the Ko Olina resort in Oahu and plunging into a pond.<n>Announcers couldn't help but chuckle at the course-crasher's escapades as he went into the water to retrieve a hat that had blown off in the wind and proceeded to lose his beer at the same time.

Arsenal face Reading in the FA Cup semi-final on Saturday evening.<n>The Gunners will clash with Chelsea's Premier League match at home to Manchester United in the same time frame.<n>Arsene Wenger says something must be done to solve the fixture scheduling mess in England.<n>Wenger also branded rumours that he will be replaced by Jurgen Klopp as 'ridiculous'

Bournemouth defeated Reading in a hard-fought game at the Madejski Stadium.<n>Callum Wilson scored the only goal of the game in the fourth minute.<n>The Cherries are now just a point behind the play-offs with a game in hand.

Zlatan Ibrahimovic will miss matches against Nice, Lille, Metz and Nantes.<n>The striker will also miss the Champions League tie against Barcelona.<n>Ibrahimovic was banned for three matches in January for verbally abusing a referee.

Unnamed worker spotted standing on roof 30-feet above ground in London.<n>Local resident took pictures of the man with a rope tied around his waist.<n>Building expert said man should have had scaffolding and a longer ladder.<n>Health and Safety Executive visited the property and stopped the work.

Liverpool reached the FA Cup semi-final with 1-0 win over Blackburn.<n>Reds will face Aston Villa in the next round on Sunday.<n>Simon Mignolet insists the players are not thinking about giving Steven Gerrard a dream send-off.<n>Gerrard will leave Anfield at the end of the season.

Boca Juniors beat Palestino 2-0 to finish top of Group Five in Copa Libertadores.<n>They will now face arch rivals River Plate in last 16 of the competition.<n>River Plate beat San Jose 3-0 to keep alive their Copa Libertadores dream.<n>Ingual thumped Universidad de Chile 4-0 to go top of Group Four.

Robert Durst, 71, sent letter to reporter Molly Hennessey-Fiske.<n>It was addressed to 'Hiya Holly' and was sent to Baton Rouge state prison.<n>In sloppy handwritten text, Durst spoke about places he lived in LA.<n>He said he 'hated LA traffic, which makes Houston look like a small town'<n>Dufts was arrested on weapons charges last month and is awaiting extradition.<n>He is suspected of murdering his friend Susan Berman in Los Angeles.

Piers Morgan says Arsenal should sack Arsene Wenger and replace him with Jurgen Klopp.<n>Morgan says Klopp is the perfect fit for the 'dynamic, driven young winner'<n>Klopp announced he will be leaving Borussia Dortmund in the summer.<n>Morgan has long been an outspoken critic of Wenger.

Two French tourists allegedly ignited an aerosol spray with a lighter causing a large flame to make contact with a quokka on Rottnest Island off Perth in Western Australia on April 3.<n>The lucky little critter survived the reckless incident but was singed by the flame.<n>Both men aged 18 and 24, and both currently living in Cockburn Central, were evicted from the island.<n>They have each been charged with animal cruelty and will appear in Fremantle Magistrates Court on April 17.

A survey has shown Australia to be most expensive country in the world.<n>It is the fourth consecutive year that Australians have been in the top three.<n>The United States remains the world's cheapest developed country.<n>A luxurious hotel room in Sydney will set you back around $1126 per night, $640 more than in New York.<n>A two-litre bottle of Coca Cola also tops the charts in Australia at $4.30, 51 percent more than New York.

Baggage handlers at Miami International Airport have been caught on video stealing from passenger luggage.<n>Police also caught a baggage handler at JFK Airport in New York stealing from a passenger's wallet.<n>Since 2002, the TSA has fired 513 workers for theft, with most of them found stealing from checked luggage.<n>Airline customers have reported $2.5million in lost property from 2010 to 2014.

Parma have been deducted four points for breaching financial regulations.<n>The club were declared bankrupt last month and have not paid their players.<n>Parma beat Juventus 1-0 on Saturday but are rooted to the bottom of Serie A.

Bianca Gascoigne was talking on her phone in central London on Tuesday.<n>She was approached by gang of eight who grabbed her phone from her.<n>They then attempted to snatch her bag but she fought back and fought back.<n>The attackers ran away and reportedly left with her phone and texts.<n>The former model later tweeted about the mugging branding them 'lowlifes'

A 15-year-old girl was struck by a car in Warrilla at 1am on Wednesday.<n>She was flung into the air before appearing to land on her head.<n>The driver can be heard beeping his horn at the girl who is standing middle of the road before hitting into her.<n>Amazingly, the girl suffered minor injuries and has already been released from Shellharbour Hospital.

Carmem Dierks was running the dodgy practice in west Orange County, Florida.<n>She is facing charges of practicing unlicensed dentistry and operating an unregistered dental lab.<n>During a raid on her practice, authorities discovered hundreds of patient files, two dentist chairs, an X-ray machine and dental molds.

Ronnie Tran, 2, and his mother were kidnapped from their home in Des Moines.<n>Police say the mother was stunned with a Taser and bound with plastic ties.<n>She was then driven to a house in Fife where she was tied to a cupboard.<n>Ronnie was found safe and well in Renton on Wednesday and reunited with his parents.<n>Police have arrested one woman but are still searching for boy's grandmother.

Shannen Hussein, 21, lives on a hobby farm outside Melbourne with over 150 pets.<n>She has spent her life raising animals of all shapes and sizes.<n>Ms Hussein shares her wild adventures on social media.<n>Her lamb Winter has become an internet sensation after a video of him bounding down a hallway went viral.

Jurgen Klopp will leave Borussia Dortmund at the end of the season.<n>The German has been in charge of the Bundesliga club for seven years.<n>Klopp is the bookmakers' favourite to replace Manuel Pellegrini at Manchester City.<n>The 47-year-old has been linked with Liverpool and Arsenal in the past.

Kunis is being sued for $5,000 by a woman claiming to be her former childhood friend.<n>She says Kunis stole her chicken when she was a child.<n>Kunis has responded with a video saying the woman is lying.<n>She will counter-sue for injuries sustained while watching Karo's music video.

The footage was captured at Spring Garden station in Philadelphia.<n>It shows the group of youngsters viciously attacking the victims.<n>They then pull them to the ground, punch them and stamp on their heads.<n>The brawl, involving students from Benjamin Franklin High School, even spilled onto the tracks, with one person falling onto the line.

Two men died at the scene and a third was taken to hospital in a serious condition.<n>The incident happened at an industrial site in Wetherill Park, west of Sydney.<n>Police say the shelving in the shipping container moved and trapped the men.

Eden Hazard's sublime strike in the first-half proved crucial for Chelsea.<n>Branislav Ivanovic had a tough afternoon marking Marouane Fellaini.<n>Oscar grew into the game and proved decisive at both ends.

Photo protest will take place outside Stamford Bridge at 3pm on Saturday.<n>The event is aimed at improving the rights and welfare of construction workers building the stadiums for the 2022 World Cup in Qatar.<n>More than 1,400 confirmed deaths of construction workers in Qatar.

The lawyer's wardrobe has gone from strength-to-strength since wedding.<n>She has worn designer Prada, Stella McCartney and Dolce & Gabbana.<n>The 37-year-old also has a selection of Alexander McQueen.

Alexis Sanchez's shot squirmed between Adam Federici's legs.<n>Reading goalkeeper had made a string of fine saves earlier in the match.<n>Arsenal will play Chelsea in the FA Cup final on May 30.

Premier League weekend sees Swansea face Everton at the Liberty Stadium.<n>Southampton host Hull City at St Mary's Stadium on Saturday.<n>Tottenham Hotspur host Aston Villa at White Hart Lane.<n>Manchester United host Manchester City at Old Trafford.<n>Liverpool host Newcastle United at Anfield.

Tottenham Hotspur host Aston Villa at White Hart Lane (Saturday 3pm)<n>Kyle Walker and Hugo Lloris are both absent for Spurs.<n>Jan Vertonghen is a doubt for Mauricio Pochettino's side.<n>Aston Villa are without Alan Hutton, Ashley Westwood and Scott Sinclair.<n>Aly Cissokho could return after training again this week.

Steve Davis and Dennis Taylor played each other in the World Snooker final in 1985.<n>Davis was leading 8-0 before Taylor fought back to lead 9-7 overnight.<n>The final was watched by 18.5million, a BBC2 record.<n>But it is way behind the most-watched sporting events:.<n>1966 World Cup final 32.30m.<n>1970 FA Cup final replay Chelsea v Leeds 28.49m.<n>2012 London Olympics Opening Ceremony 27.3m.

Tottenham Hotspur host Aston Villa at White Hart Lane on Saturday.<n>Tim Sherwood was sacked by Spurs chairman Daniel Levy last summer.<n>Sherwood will be returning to the club he played for and managed.<n>Spurs boss Mauricio Pochettino says he will be given a good reception.
