Conor McGregor is preparing for his world title fight against Jose Aldo.<n>He said Floyd Mayweather lacks the skills in areas other than boxing.<n>'It would take me less than thirty seconds to wrap around him like a boa constrictor and strangle him,' he said.<n>Mayweather takes on Manny Pacquiao at the MGM Grand on May 2.

Ronda Rousey wants to return to the WWE after her appearance with Fast and Furious co-star The Rock at Wrestlemania 31.<n>But her packed schedule will make it difficult for her to make the return.<n>Ronda Rousey is currently preparing for her fight against Bethe Correia.

Jeff Novitzky will spearhead the development of the UFC's new drug testing programme.<n>The sport has been rocked by a number of high-profile failed tests.<n>Anderson Silva, Nick Diaz and Hector Lombard all failed tests.

Jimi Manuwa takes on Jan Blachowicz in the main event of UFC on Saturday.<n>Manuwa lost his first fight to Alexander Gustafsson last year.<n>The Londoner believes he can finish his opponent in the second round.

Mirko Filipovic faces Gabriel Gonzaga in Poland on Saturday.<n>The Croatian lost to the Brazilian in 2007 at UFC 70.<n>Filipovic is desperate to avenge that defeat and is in good shape.<n>Gonzaga said he does not consider the fight a rematch.
Conor McGregor makes the eighth defence of his featherweight title.<n>Jose Aldo makes the eighth defence of his belt against McGregor.<n>McGregor says Aldo doesn't want the title as much as he does.

Paula Creamer has called for a Masters tournament for women at Augusta.<n>The 2010 women's US Open winner first floated the idea on Twitter.<n>Creamer suggested a women's event could be staged the week following the men's showpiece in April.

Chad Mendes takes on Ricardo Lamas in the main event of UFC on Saturday night in Fairfax, Virginia.<n>The winner will be in a battle for the title against Jose Aldo.<n>Mendes believes Aldo will be victorious against Conor McGregor.

Justin Rose will play in the Zurich Classic of New Orleans this week.<n>Rose finished second behind Jordan Spieth at Augusta National earlier this month.<n>The 34-year-old has not been outside the top 15 on his last three outings at TPC Louisiana.<n>Steve Stricker will also play in the tournament after back surgery last December.
Conor McGregor is preparing for his title challenge against Jose Aldo.<n>The Irishman has revealed a new tattoo of a tiger on his stomach.<n>McGregor claims Aldo lacks motivation to defend his belt.

Chad Mendes stopped Ricardo Lamas in the first round in Virginia.<n>The victory ensured Mendes retained his featherweight ranking.<n>The fight was Mendes' first since losing to Jose Aldo in 2014.<n>Al Iaquinta beat Jorge Masvidal by split decision in their lightweight fight.

Lindsey Vonn has been dating Tiger Woods since 2013.<n>The 30-year-old has been pictured with Woods' children at the Masters.<n>Vonn says Woods is a 'great father' and her children are 'great kids'<n>The US skier says her knee is finally healthy after injury.
Sir Nick Faldo will cross the Swilcan Bridge for the final time.<n>Tom Watson will also compete at St Andrews for the last time.<n>The Open Championship will be held at the home of golf in July.
Bubba Watson shows off incredible trick shot in practice.<n>Watson is in China working with his caddie.<n>The American has struggled for form in recent weeks.
Jim Furyk defeated Kevin Kisner on the second play-off hole.<n>The 44-year-old hit a final round 63 to finish 18-under in regulation play.<n>Furyk's win was his first on the PGA Tour since 2010.

Kiradech Aphibarnrat won the inaugural Shenzhen International in a play-off.<n>The 25-year-old beat Chinese teenager Li Hao-tong on the first extra hole.<n>Aphibarnrat won his first European Tour title in Malaysia in 2013.
Kiradech Aphibarnrat fired six birdies in the space of nine holes.<n>The 25-year-old leads the Shenzhen International by two shots.<n>Bubba Watson is two over par after a round of 74.

Carly Booth is currently in Mauritius for a photo shoot with Golf Punk magazine.<n>The 22-year-old posted a selfie to her 9,778 followers on Instagram.<n>Booth is the youngest-ever Scot to qualify for the Ladies European Tour.

Jordan Spieth shot a second-round 62 at the RBC Heritage.<n>The 21-year-old bounced back from his opening 74 with a nine-under-par round.<n>But Troy Merritt fired a 10-under 61 to equal the course record.<n>The 29-year-old American is four shots clear at the top of the standings.

Rory McIlroy's foundation is hosting the event at Royal County Down.<n>Martin Kaymer, Luke Donald and Patrick Reed confirmed their participation.<n>The tournament will feature five players who have been world number one.
Jordan Spieth struggled in difficult conditions in South Carolina.<n>Masters champion carded a three-over-par 74 in first round.<n>21-year-old admitted lack of preparation affected his first round.
Rory McIlroy battled with Fifty Shades of Grey star Jamie Dornan.<n>The duo were promoting new football concept Circular Soccer.<n>McIlroy defeated Dornan 2-1 to take the crown.

Agnieszka Radwanska was beaten 7-6 (8/6) 6-4 by Sara Errani in Stuttgart.<n>The Polish world No 9 is the second top seed to exit the tournament.<n>Ana Ivanovic was beaten by Caroline Garcia on Tuesday.<n>World No 15 Errani will now face Kazakhstan's Zarina Diyas.

Rafael Nadal was beaten 6-4, 7-6 (8-6) by Fabio Fognini in Barcelona.<n>The world No 4 was looking for his ninth career title on the Catalan clay.<n>Fognini will now face Pablo Andujar in the quarter-finals.

Bubba Watson finished 38th at Augusta National on Sunday.<n>The defending champion is in joint 17th place at the Shenzhen International.<n> Huang Wen-yi leads the field by four shots after the first day.

Jordan Spieth returns to golf just days after winning the Masters.<n>The 21-year-old will play in the RBC Heritage Classic.<n>Spieth has had two victories and two runner-up finishes in his past four events.

Rafael Nadal beat Nicolas Almagro 6-3 6-1 at the Barcelona Open.<n>World No 4 is looking to win his ninth title on the Catalan clay court.<n>Neymar watched Nadal's win from the stands after his two goals against PSG.<n>Click here for more tennis news.

Great Britain face France in Davis Cup quarter-final in July.<n>There will be a capacity of 7,000 for the match at London's Queen's Club.<n>But less than half the overall allocation will be available.<n>Andy Murray and Leon Smith will lead the GB team in the tie.

Marin Cilic was knocked out of the Barcelona Open by Victor Estrella.<n>The U.S. Open champion lost 6-4 6-4 to the Dominican Republic.<n>Cilic is struggling for fitness and form after a shoulder injury.

Ana Ivanovic was beaten 7-6 (8/6) 6-4 by Caroline Garcia in Stuttgart.<n>Garcia had beaten Ivanovic twice already this year.<n>Ekaterina Makarova and Carla Suarez Navarro also through to second round.

Angelique Kerber beat Maria Sharapova 2-6, 7-5, 6-1 in Stuttgart.<n>Top seed Sharapova had won her previous 13 matches in Stuttgart.<n>She will be replaced by Simona Halep of Romania when the rankings are updated on Monday.
Jose Mourinho was given a tour of Wimbledon by Tim Henman.<n>Mourinho said he felt like he was British when Andy Murray won in 2013.<n>Murray ended Britain's 77-year wait for a men's champion.

Serena Williams beat Sara Errani in three sets on Sunday.<n>The US star said it was an 'eye-opener' as the claycourt season gets underway.<n>Williams and Alison Riske lost the doubles rubber to hand Italy a 3-2 win.

Kei Nishikori beat Teymuraz Gabashvili 6-3 6-4 in the second round of the Barcelona Open.<n>The world No 7 will face Nicolas Almagro in the third round.<n>Eight-time champion Rafael Nadal will play Nicolas Almagro in the second round.

Martina Navratilova has left Agnieszka Radwanska's coaching team.<n>The pair announced in December they would work together.<n>Radwanska is 13-11 this season, including a first-round loss in Stuttgart.

Novak Djokovic beat Rafa Nadal in the Monte Carlo Masters semi-finals.<n>The Serbian is the favourite to win the French Open in June.<n>But Nadal says he has faced Djokovic before and he will be no different.<n>The Spaniard is looking to win a sixth consecutive French Open.

Queen's Club will host the Davis Cup quarter final between Great Britain and France.<n>The tie will take place from July 17-19 and tickets go on sale on May 27.<n>Andy Murray has won the tournament three times.

Jenson Button failed to start the Bahrain Grand Prix.<n>The McLaren driver was denied his 100th race for the team.<n>Lewis Hamilton has out-qualified and finished ahead of Nico Rosberg at every race this season.<n>Bernie Ecclestone denied trying to engineer a deal for Hamilton.

Jenson Button will start the race 20th and last.<n>Fernando Alonso managed to get a McLaren into Q2 for the first time this season.<n>Button was given a lift back to the pits on a motorcycle by a marshal.

Azerbaijan will host the European Grand Prix in 2016.<n>The race will be held in the capital of Baku.<n>But F1 supremo Bernie Ecclestone has given the all-clear.<n>A report by Human Rights Watch in 2015 criticised Azerbaijan.<n>But Ecclestone said the country's human rights record has been checked.
Novak Djokovic defeated Tomas Berdych 7-5 4-6 6-3 in the final.<n>The world No 1 became the first player to win the opening three Masters 1000 events.<n>The Serbian has now won 17 matches in a row.

Lewis Hamilton has dominated the opening three races of the season.<n>Hamilton has won in Australia, Malaysia and Singapore.<n>His Mercedes team-mate Nico Rosberg is second in the standings.<n>Rosberg will start behind his team-mate for the fourth consecutive race.
Jenson Button failed to complete qualifying in Bahrain.<n>The McLaren driver was set to start from the back of the grid.<n>But his team decided not to run him after he broke down in practice.

Lewis Hamilton has taken pole position for the Bahrain Grand Prix.<n>Sebastian Vettel was beaten to pole by four tenths of a second by the Brit.<n>Mercedes team-mate Nico Rosberg qualified second and third.

Kimi Raikkonen's contract with Ferrari expires at the end of the season.<n>There is an option for 2016 if both parties are in agreement.<n>Raikkonen has finished fourth in the first two races of the season.<n>But Ferrari team principal Maurizio Arrivabene has urged him to improve.

Kimi Raikkonen finished second in Bahrain Grand Prix on Sunday.<n>The Finn has an option to stay at Ferrari for next season.<n>But team principal Maurizio Arrivabene says he will not sign the deal.<n>The Italian also said Lewis Hamilton never called him after Bahrain.

Nico Rosberg topped the timesheet in Friday practice for Bahrain Grand Prix.<n>Mercedes driver described Ferrari's pace as 'dangerous' and 'worrying'<n>Ros Rosberg trails team-mate Lewis Hamilton by 17 points in drivers' standings.

Ecclestone has urged Hamilton to consider a move to Ferrari.<n>The Brit is out of contract with Mercedes at the end of the season.<n>Hamilton is 13 points ahead of Sebastian Vettel in the drivers' championship.

Davy Condon was forced to retire after suffering a spinal concussion.<n>The Irish jockey fell at the third-last during the Grand National at Aintree.<n>It was the second time within a year that Condon suffered a similar injury.

French trainer Freddy Head likens Ride Like The Wind to last year's fifth-placed runner Charm Spirit.<n>Ride Like The Wind won just one of his four starts last season.<n>But he has run twice this term, posting a career best on his most recent start.

Jenson Button's McLaren suffered an electrical fault that cut the engine.<n>The British driver was forced to stop on track as a safety precaution.<n>The 35-year-old ultimately finished down in 19th place.

Robbie McNamara broke eight ribs, cracked six vertebrae and has no feeling in his legs after a fall at Wexford on Saturday.<n>The jockey was due to partner last year's Cheltenham Gold Cup winner Lord Windermere in the Crabbie's Grand National at Aintree.<n>McNamara remains in the Mater Hospital in Dublin.

AP McCoy will ride to the final race at Sandown on Saturday.<n>McCoy has confirmed he will ride to the race if he can secure mounts.<n>There had been speculation that the soon-to-be-crowned 20-time champion jockey would end his career after riding in the AP McCoy Celebration Chase.

Ian Wright will present AP McCoy with his final champion jockeys trophy.<n>McCoy is an Arsenal fan and has been invited to attend a home game.<n>Sky were reluctant to allow Thierry Henry to present the award.
Northampton face Saracens in the Aviva Premiership on Saturday.<n>The Saints have suffered defeats to Clermont and Exeter.<n>Tom Wood is keen for his side to bounce back from recent results.

Scotland youth international Jack Cosgrove has agreed to join Edinburgh.<n>The 20-year-old Worcester prop has been capped nine times for the Dark Blues Under 20s side.<n>Cosgrove has penned a two-year deal with Alan Solomons' side.
Michael Allen will join Edinburgh at the end of the season.<n>The 24-year-old has never lived outside of Ireland.<n>Allen can play at wing or centre.

Mariano Galarza played for Gloucester against Sale Sharks last month.<n>The lock was selected as a replacement despite being ineligible.<n>Glouth lost the match 23-6 at the A J Bell Stadium.<n>The club now face the prospect of having points deducted for the misdemeanour.

Billy Vunipola, Steffon Armitage and Nick Abendanon shortlisted for European Player of the Year award.<n>The trio are joined on the shortlist by Leinster's Jamie Heaslip and Clermont's Fritz Lee.<n>Armitage was named on the bench for Toulon's quarter-final against Leinster.
Davy McGregor was injured while playing for Heriot's Rugby Club.<n>The former Ulster hooker was caught by an opponent's hip or shorts.<n>The Barbarians won the match 97-31.

Manu Tuilagi has been out of action since October with a groin injury.<n>The 23-year-old is targeting a return to action in time for the summer.<n>Leicester Tigers centre has not featured for England since the three-Test summer tour of New Zealand in 2014.

Mike Brown was knocked out during England's Six Nations match against Italy.<n>The full back has not recovered from the injury and is not expected to play again.<n>Conor O'Shea has ruled Brown out of Harlequins' next two games.

Mike Fitzgerald has helped the Chiefs win two Super Rugby titles.<n>The New Zealander will follow Peter Betham to Leicester next season.<n>Leicester director Richard Cockerill said he was 'a good addition'

Matt Giteau has been an outstanding force for Toulon in Europe.<n>The 32-year-old has not featured for Australia since the 2011 World Cup.<n>Australia will pick 'elite' players based abroad with 60 caps or seven years of professional service at home.

England assistant coach Andy Farrell says rugby union is going to be the sport of the year with the World Cup coming up in England.<n>Stuart Lancaster's side begin their World Cup campaign against Fiji at Twickenham on September 18.<n>England will begin their preparations for the tournament with a two-week training camp at Pennyhill Park in early July.

The Australian Rugby Union has passed a new rule to allow players with over 60 caps playing overseas to be selected for Australia.<n>Players who sign for a club next season and don't have 60 caps can be eligible.<n>Matt Giteau, Drew Mitchell and George Smith would qualify for the World Cup.<n>Will Genia, Adam Ashley-Cooper, Nic White, Peter Betham, Sekope Kepu and James Horwill are all off to European clubs for next year.

Joe Root scored 118 not out as England posted 373 for six in Grenada.<n>The tourists lead by 74 runs going into day four of the second Test.<n>Root's century was his sixth Test century and first away from home.<n>England's top order also starred as Gary Ballance scored 77.<n>Captain Alastair Cook scored 76 and Jonathan Trott 59.<n>Root has backed England to win the Test and take the series.

Joe Root scored 118 not out as England reached 384-6 at stumps on day three.<n>England lead by 74 runs going into the final day of the second Test.<n>Alastair Cook scored 76 in the first innings but failed with the bat again.<n>Ben Stokes hit eight runs before being run out by Windies captain Denesh Ramdin.
Ben Stokes was out for a duck as Marlon Samuels gave him a send-off.<n>Samuels saluted the England all-rounder as he walked past.<n>England closed the third day on 373 for six, a lead of 74.

Alastair Cook and Jonathan Trott scored their 10th hundred partnership.<n>It was England's first Test century since March 2013 against New Zealand.<n>New Zealand all-rounder Corey Anderson is a doubt for the series.<n>Anderson broke his finger playing for the Kiwis in the IPL.<n>Yorkshire are keen to get Adil Rashid back soon.

Stuart Broad took three wickets for 19 runs on day two in Grenada.<n>England bowled West Indies out for 299 in the second Test.<n>Alastair Cook and Jonathan Trott reached 74 without loss at stumps.<n>Broad praised Cook's level-headed approach to his batting.
Aaron Finch has had surgery on a hamstring injury.<n>The batsman sustained the injury playing in the IPL.<n>Finch will be out of action for up to three months.

Alastair Cook passed Alec Stewart's 8,463 runs to become England's second highest Test run-scorer.<n>Cook and Jonathan Trott reached 74-0 at stumps on second day.<n>England were reduced to 74-0 after bad light stopped play.

High Kingdom kicked out and suffered a cut leg at Kentucky Horse Park.<n>Zara Phillips was due to make her debut at the three-day event.<n>The Queen's granddaughter won silver in the team Equestrian section at the World Equestrian Games in 2014.
Kawhi Leonard was named NBA Defensive Player of the Year.<n>The Spurs took a 2-1 lead in the first-round series with a 100-73 win.<n>Game 4 takes place on Sunday at the AT&T Center in Texas.

Alastair Cook put West Indies in to bat on day one of the first Test.<n>Graeme Swann revealed the moment Cook's form turned.<n>Adil Rashid was left out of the England side after much discussion.<n>Devon Smith was the first Grenadan ever to score a Test run.

Marlon Samuels and Ben Stokes clashed on the pitch on day one.<n>Stokes was put on his back by Stuart Broad, who bowled too short.<n>Samuels said England 'can't help' talking to him and that he 'continues to score runs'<n>Samuels is 94 not out and has scored 294 runs in the two Tests so far.

Alejandro Valverde won the Fleche Wallonne on Wednesday.<n>Team Sky's Chris Froome finished 123rd after a fall in the closing stages.<n>Froome is expected to be fit for the Tour de Romandie next week.

Ronnie O'Sullivan beat Craig Steadman 10-3 in first round.<n>The 39-year-old had trouble with his shoes during the session on Tuesday.<n>He could have faced a fine of around £250 for a dress-code breach.<n>But he could have accepted any other pair of size eights offered his way.<n>O'Sullivan will face Matthew Stevens in the second round.
Reanne Evans relinquished her WLBSA World Ladies title on Tuesday.<n>Evans lost 4-2 in the semi-finals to Hong Kong's Ng On Yee.<n>Yee went on to defeat England's Emma Bonney 6-2 in the final.

Michael van Gerwen cruised to a 7-0 win over James Wade.<n>The Dutchman is now second in the Premier League table.<n>Gary Anderson beat Van Gerwen 7-5 in the night's finale.<n>Anderson lost 7-1 to Stephen Bunting in the opening match.<n>Raymond van Barneveld defeated Dave Chisnall.<n>Phil Taylor drew 6-6 with Adrian Lewis.

All five of the first-round series have now been won with 2-0 leads.<n>John Wall and Bradley Beal lead Washington to a 117-106 win in Toronto.<n>LeBron James scores 30 points as Cleveland Cavaliers beat Boston Celtics 99-91 to go 2-0 up in their NBA first-round playoff series.<n>Dwight Howard scores 28 points as Houston Rockets beat Dallas Mavericks 111-99 to go 2-0 up in their series.

Judd Trump beat Stuart Carrington 10-6 in the first round of the World Championship.<n>The 25-year-old led 7-2 overnight and was made to battle by Carrington.<n>Trump closed the gap to three before securing the victory.<n>He will now face Marco Fu in the next round.

Paula Radcliffe was 'close to pulling out' of the London Marathon on Sunday.<n>But celebrity doctor Hans-Wilhelm Muller-Wohlfahrt helped her.<n>Muller-Wohlfahrt has worked with the likes of Ronaldo and Michael Owen.<n>Sunday's race will be Radcliffe's final competitive marathon of her career.
Ding Junhui was on for a maximum 147 break at the Crucible.<n>The Chinese world No 3 screwed back for the blue instead of the black.<n>Ding would have pocketed £30,000 for the break.

Jimmy Butler scored 31 points as the Bulls beat the Bucks 91-82.<n>The Bulls take a 2-0 lead in their first-round NBA play-offs series.<n>Klay Thompson scored 26 points as the Golden State Warriors beat the New Orleans Pelicans 97-87 to take a 2-0 lead in their series.

Golden State Warriors beat New Orleans Pelicans 123-119 in overtime.<n>Victory takes Warriors to 3-0 lead in first-round play-off series.<n>Chicago Bulls also have 3-0 lead over Milwaukee Bucks.<n>Cleveland Cavaliers beat Boston Celtics 103-95 to go 3-0 up in series.

The August 1 exhibition will take place at Ellis Park Stadium in Johannesburg.<n>Chris Paul and Luol Deng will play in the match, which will be captained by Paul.<n>NBA legends Gregg Popovich and Dikembe Mutombo will also take part.

Neil Robertson rattled in an opening break of 133 in his 10-2 win.<n>The 2010 champion turned a 7-2 lead into a 10-2 victory over Jamie Jones.<n>Robertson has committed more hours to the game than ever before.

Cesc Fabregas returns to Arsenal on Sunday against Chelsea.<n>Arsene Wenger wants Fabregas to be given a good reception.<n>But some fans feel he doesn't deserve much more than that.<n>Wenger says he regrets Fabregas left the club in 2011.

Aston Villa beat Liverpool in the FA Cup semi-final at Wembley Stadium.<n>Gabriel Agbonlahor missed the semi-final win with a hamstring injury.<n>The attacker took to Instagram to show off his boxing workout.<n>Tim Sherwood's side face Manchester City at the Etihad on Saturday.

QPR boss Chris Ramsey believes they will avoid relegation if they win three more league games.<n>Aston Villa boss Tim Sherwood believes his appointment has given them a lot of belief and confidence.<n>Nigel Pearson believes Leicester have a more realistic chance of staying up.

Sir Philip Carter passed away on Thursday after a short illness.<n>Carter was chairman of Everton throughout the 1980s.<n>He won two league titles, an FA Cup and the European Cup Winners' Cup during his time at Goodison Park.

Burnley lost 1-0 at Everton in the Premier League on Saturday.<n>Danny Ings hasn't scored since February 11 and hasn't scored in eight matches.<n>Sean Dyche insists that the rest of his players must help out Ings.<n>Burnley have scored just one goal in their last seven matches.

Aaron Lennon has four games remaining on his loan at Everton.<n>Robert Martinez wants to get the most out of the winger before considering a permanent deal.<n>Kevin Mirallas has been linked with a switch to Tottenham.

Kevin Mirallas has been linked with a move away from Everton.<n>Robert Martinez admits he does not know what the future holds.<n>Tottenham Hotspur have been linked with a swap deal for Mirallas.<n>Everton host Manchester United in the Premier League on Sunday.

Leroy Fer damaged medial ligaments in his knee against Sunderland.<n>The Dutch midfielder has struggled for form and fitness since arriving.<n>Fer could be rushed back for QPR's clash with West Ham on Saturday.
Steve McClaren has been linked with the Newcastle job.<n>Derby boss insists his sole focus is on getting Rams promoted.<n>McClaren is understood to be one of two people on Newcastle's short list.

Hull City are just two points clear of the relegation zone.<n>They were beaten 2-0 by Southampton on Saturday.<n>Steve Bruce is confident he can keep the Tigers up.<n>Hull have six games to save their season.

Yannick Bolasie has been in fine form for Crystal Palace in recent weeks.<n>Alan Pardew says he would sell the winger for £40-60million.<n>The Palace boss claims all his players are 'undervalued'<n>Pardew says he will sell if he is offered more than he is willing.

Newcastle United fans boycotted their last home game against Spurs.<n>Thousands of supporters are planning a mass protest against Mike Ashley.<n>John Carver has called for unity at the club following a divisive season.

Leicester City midfielder Esteban Cambiasso linked with Delhi Dynamos.<n>Cambiasso signed a one-year deal with Leicester last summer.<n>Fox's Premier League status could hinge on whether or not he stays.

Thibaut Verlinden is a 15-year-old midfielder who plays for Standard Liege.<n>Verlinden has had trials with Liverpool and Everton.<n>Stoke have also agreed a deal to sign Mohamed El Ouriachi from Barcelona.

Romelu Lukaku is Everton's top scorer this season with 18 goals.<n>The Belgium international revealed he encountered abuse playing in youth teams back in his homeland.<n>Lukaku is hoping to strike up a partnership with Arouna Kone.

Mauricio Pochettino left Southampton for Tottenham last May.<n>The Argentine is returning to St Mary's for the first time since.<n>Saints fans are planning on turning the ground orange on Saturday.<n>The idea is to show support for manager Ronald Koeman.

QPR are currently in the Premier League's relegation zone with 28 points.<n>Chris Ramsey's side face West Ham, Liverpool, Manchester City, Newcastle and Leicester in the final five games of the season.<n>Ramsey believes three wins will secure QPR's top flight status.<n>The former Arsenal midfielder wants his side to improve their defensive concentration in order to avoid the drop.

Eden Hazard was in fine form as Chelsea beat Manchester United.<n>Craig Gardner starred as West Brom beat Crystal Palace.<n>Everton beat Burnley, Stoke beat Southampton and Leicester beat Swansea.<n>John Terry was Chelsea's rock in defence against Manchester United.

England Under 21 captain Jack Butland revealed he voted for Harry Kane.<n>Butland hopes the Tottenham striker can fire the young Lions to glory.<n>The Stoke keeper joined Gareth Southgate at St George's Park on Thursday.<n>Butland was part of the ill-fated side that crashed out of the Under 21 finals two years ago.

Brendan Rodgers insists he is the man to guide Liverpool to success.<n>Liverpool manager is under pressure after a disappointing season.<n>But Rodgers insists he is the right man to lead the club forward.

Swansea City are interested in signing Rudy Gestede from Blackburn Rovers.<n>The Benin international striker is valued at £7million by the Championship side.<n>Garry Monk is also considering a move for Anderlecht's Aleksandar Mitrovic.<n>The Swans are also considering a move for Marseille's Andre Ayew.<n>CLICK HERE for all the latest transfer news with our live updates.

Six games to go in the Premier League and there are just four points separating the bottom five.<n>Hull, QPR, Sunderland, Burnley and Leicester are all on the brink.<n>Sportsmail's reporters give their verdict on the closest relegation run-in for years.

Sebastien Pocognoli has found his game time limited at West Brom.<n>The Belgian defender was an important player under Alan Irvine.<n>Pocognoli admits he's baffled by Tony Pulis' decision to drop him.<n>The 27-year-old says he's open to a new league but wants to stay in the Premier League.

Stoke City beat Southampton 2-1 in the Premier League on Saturday.<n>Mark Hughes has revealed talks have opened over a contract extension for goalkeeper Asmir Begovic.<n>Bosnian's existing deal expires next year and he has attracted interest from Real Madrid and Manchester United.

Leonardo Ulloa scored the opening goal of the game after 15 minutes.<n>Leicester City moved off the bottom of the Premier League table with the win.<n>Nigel Pearson's side have won three games in a row for the first time since 2000.

Celtic could win the league on May 11 if they face Aberdeen.<n>Adam Rooney does not want to see Aberdeen celebrate on their patch.<n>Ronny Deila's side have lost all three previous meetings with Aberdeen.

Harry Kane scored his 30th goal of the season on Sunday.<n>Tottenham striker tops this week's EA Sports' Performance Index.<n>Kane is followed by Christian Eriksen and Eden Hazard.<n>Southampton's Morgan Schneiderlin is seventh after his display against Stoke.

West Ham will move to the Olympic Stadium in Stratford next season.<n>The Hammers have announced a new season-ticket structure.<n>The cheapest season ticket at Upton Park is £620 but there will be £289 seats on offer from the 2016-17 season.<n>Sam Allardyce says filling the stadium is the 'ultimate for the success of the team'

Andre Blackman, 24, stole a jacket worth more than £1,000 from Harrods.<n>Blackman told Hammersmith Magistrates' Court it was a'moment of madness'<n>He was ordered to carry out 40 hours of unpaid work.<n>Blackman has already played for 11 clubs in his short career.

West Brom host Liverpool in the Premier League on Saturday.<n>The Baggies are eight points above the relegation zone.<n>Tony Pulis believes his side can rise to the challenge.<n>They also face Manchester United, Chelsea and Arsenal in final five games.

Harry Kane is up for PFA Player and Young Player of the Season.<n>Tottenham striker scored 20 Premier League goals this season.<n>Kane is also in Roy Hodgson's England squad for the Euro 2016 qualifier against Slovenia on Wednesday.<n>Tottenham forward is up against Eden Hazard and Alexis Sanchez.

Chris Sutton has called for more accountability for officials.<n>He branded additional official Alan Muir 'idiotic' for not seeing a handball.<n>Inverness defender Josh Meekings is now fighting a ban from the Scottish Cup Final.

Inverness defender Josh Meekings handled a Leigh Griffiths header.<n>The incident occurred during Celtic's Scottish Cup semi-final win.<n>Meekings was not sent off and no penalty was given as Inverness went on to win 3-2 after extra-time.<n>The Ibrox club have vowed to 'vigorously defend' their player.

Celtic were denied a penalty in the first half when Josh Meekings handled.<n>Referee Alan Muir failed to spot the incident and sent off Steven McLean.<n>McLean was then sent off for a second bookable offence.<n>Inverness scored from the spot to force extra time.<n>Celtic boss Ronny Deila was furious at the decision.

Celtic have written to the SFA seeking 'to understand' how the match officials failed to spot the hand Josh Meekings used to block a Leigh Griffiths shot.<n>Brown views the whole furore as 'a bit of sour grapes' that speaks of the frustration within his old rivals.<n>'If Rangers were in that position they would have won a Treble in that time, probably two or three...' he said.

Stuart McCall is in charge of Rangers until the end of the season.<n>He is compiling a dossier of potential targets for next season.<n>McCall says he is not sure if he will be at the club beyond this campaign.

Inverness beat Celtic 3-2 in the Old Firm League Cup final on Saturday.<n>Leigh Griffiths had a goal-bound shot blocked by Josh Meekings.<n>The Bhoys were leading 1-0 when the incident occurred.<n>Celtic have asked the Scottish FA for an explanation.<n>John Hartson has urged his former club to move on from the injustice.
Rangers board met with Mike Ashley on Wednesday.<n>It was the first time they had spoken to the Newcastle United owner.<n>Ashley owns an 8.92 per cent stake in Rangers.

Walter Smith worked closely with Ally McCoist and Kenny McDowall.<n>McCoist finally resigned and was placed on gardening leave in December.<n>McDowall is awaiting a final severance deal which would free him up to work elsewhere.

Aston Villa are four points above the bottom three with five games left.<n>Tim Sherwood believes his side have enough to survive with enough games left.<n>Gabriel Agbonlahor could be back from a hamstring injury for Villa.

Isco has been one of Real Madrid's best players this season.<n>But he has seen his place come under threat in recent weeks.<n>Was dropped when James Rodriguez returned from injury.<n>Has now admitted he is unhappy with life at the Bernabeu.
Ally McCoist was sacked as Rangers manager in December.<n>The 53-year-old has been on garden leave since his departure.<n>John Brown insists he will be welcomed back 'with open arms'

Bacary Sagna left Arsenal for Manchester City last summer.<n>The Frenchman has played only 16 times for City this season.<n>City are fourth in the Premier League, with Arsenal second.<n>Sagna insists he has no regrets about leaving the Emirates.

Arsenal host Chelsea in the Premier League on Sunday afternoon.<n>Arsene Wenger has failed to win in 12 games against Jose Mourinho.<n>The Arsenal boss has drawn five and lost seven of his 12 clashes.<n>But Wenger says his record will have no bearing on the game.

Floyd Mayweather is using a cryotherapy bath to aid his recovery.<n>The bath is cooled to -175F (-115C) using liquid nitrogen.<n>Mayweather is preparing for his fight against Manny Pacquiao.<n>The bout is set to take place on May 26 at the MGM Grand in Las Vegas.

Tottenham have struggled at lunchtime this season.<n>Spurs have won two of 10 matches kicking off at 12.45.<n>Mauricio Pochettino says it could be because they have had a lot of energy.<n>Tottenham face Southampton at St Mary's on Saturday.

Pep Guardiola's contract at Bayern Munich expires at the end of the 2015-16 season.<n>Borussia Monchengladbach boss Lucien Favre is on course for Champions League football next season.<n>Ottmar Hitzfeld believes Favre is the man to replace Guardiola at Bayern.

Pep Guardiola will see out his three-year contract with Bayern Munich.<n>Karl-Heinz Rummenigge claims Guardiola would not join Manchester City.<n>Bay Munich could win the Bundesliga title this weekend.

Real Madrid and Barcelona have only met twice this season, both times in La Liga.<n>The two sides have met 12 times in 19 months but never in the Champions League's largest match.<n>Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi are the two best players in the world.<n>Gareth Bale is the star man for Real Madrid, who are looking for their third Champions League in a row.
Walter Smith stepped down as Rangers chairman in 2011.<n>He returned to the club against his instincts as chairman.<n>Smith says that the club must get back to resembling Rangers.

Manny Pacquiao will fight Floyd Mayweather on May 2 in Las Vegas.<n>Pacquiao held an open workout at the Wild Card gym in Hollywood.<n>The Filipino star spoke about his motivation and his belief in God.<n>Pacquiao said he will pass on his knowledge to Mayweather.

Floyd Mayweather is down to within three-and-a-half pounds of the welterweight limit ahead of mega-fight against Manny Pacquiao.<n>Mayweather was photographed taking the scales for the WBC’s mandatory weight check 30 days before a world title fight.<n>The electronic machine showed Mayweather at 150.5 lbs.<n>There was a modicum of surplus fat at the sides of his waist but he looks well on track with his conditioning.

Manny Pacquiao fights Floyd Mayweather on May 2 in Las Vegas.<n>The Filipino is training with trainer Freddie Roach in Los Angeles.<n>A personalised speed ball with Mayweather's face painted on it was given to Pacquiao by lawyer Robert Shapiro.<n>Shapiro is famed for representing OJ Simpson in 1995.

Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao will fight in the richest-ever fight on May 2 in Las Vegas.<n>Mayweather will earn upwards of $180m, Pacquiao $120m.<n>The undefeated American is the favourite to win the fight.

Floyd Mayweather Jnr continues preparations for Manny Pacquiao fight.<n>The 38-year-old took to the swimming pool to continue his training.<n>Mayweather Jnr's mega-fight with Pacquiao is set to take place on May 2.<n>CLICK HERE for all the latest Mayweather and Pacquiao news.

Floyd Mayweather's fight against Manny Pacquiao will cost US viewers up to $100 (£67.48)<n>The fight will be shown on HBO and Showtime in the States.<n>Mayweather's fight against Canelo Alvarez in September 2013 cost US viewers $64.95.<n>Sky won the bidding war to screen the fight on British shores.

Floyd Mayweather takes on Manny Pacquiao in Las Vegas on May 2.<n>The mega-fight is a reported £160million clash.<n>Mayweather has released a series of pictures from his training camp.<n>The American appears to be hanging a weight from his head.<n>Pacquiao has thanked actor Mark Wahlberg for stopping by.

Arsenal host Liverpool at the Emirates Stadium (Saturday 12.45pm)<n>Danny Welbeck will face a fitness test on the knee injury he picked up on international duty with England.<n>Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain remains unavailable for the Gunners.<n>Liverpool striker Daniel Sturridge is expected to return from a hip injury.<n>Martin Skrtel and Steven Gerrard will serve three-match suspensions.
Sevilla will play Fiorentina for a place in the Europa League final.<n>Rafael Benitez's Napoli will take on Dnipro Dnipropetrovsk of Ukraine.<n>The final will take place in Warsaw on May 27.

Burnley host Tottenham Hotspur at Turf Moor (Sunday 1.30pm)<n>Defender Stephen Ward could return for Clarets.<n>Matt Taylor also nearing return after recovering from achilles surgery.<n>But Dean Marney and Kevin Long remain long-term absentees.<n>Tottenham will be without goalkeeper Hugo Lloris.<n>Danny Rose will be assessed after returning from England call-up.<n>Roberto Soldado is a doubt with a knee injury.<n>Clarets have scored just 14 goals in 15 Premier League home games this season.<n>Tottenham have kept just one clean sheet in their last 13 Premier League away games

Manchester City have already met Jurgen Klopp to assess him for the manager’s job – but it was back in 2013.<n> Txiki Begiristain, City’s director of football met the Borussia Dortmund manager and concluded that he was not the right fit for City.<n>The club went on to appoint Manuel Pellegrini.<n>Begiristain’s meeting and rejection of Klopp back in 2013 adds weight to the growing evidence that Klopp will not get the Manchester City job.

Sam Allardyce has been sacked as West Ham United manager.<n>The Hammers are struggling in the Premier League and are 18th.<n>They are moving to the Olympic Stadium next season.<n>If Rafael Benitez wants to return to English football he may be persuaded by the Hammers project.

Floyd Mayweather will fight Manny Pacquiao in Las Vegas on May 2.<n>The mega-fight is being billed as the most lucrative in boxing history.<n>The Money Man's daughter Iyanna has been spending time in her father's training camp.<n>Iyanna says she is amazed by her dad's work ethic in the gym.

Floyd Mayweather takes to his Shots account to post a picture inside his private jet.<n>The WBA and WBC welterweight world champion takes on Manny Pacquiao on May 2 in the most expensive fight in boxing history.<n>The bout at the MGM Grand in Las Vegas is expected to total $300million.<n>Boxing legend Muhammad Ali wants Pacquiao to win the fight, according to his daughter Rasheda Ali.
Jurgen Klopp will leave Borussia Dortmund at the end of the season.<n>The German has long been linked with the Gunners.<n>Nigel Winterburn says Arsene Wenger should be given more time.

Thomas Tuchel will take over at Borussia Dortmund in July.<n>The 41-year-old has been in charge of Mainz for the past four years.<n>Jurgen Klopp announced this week he is leaving the club at the end of the season.<n>Click here for Borussia Dortmund transfer news.

Usain Bolt visited a gym in a favela in Rio de Janeiro on Thursday.<n>The Jamaican sprinter took three shots from the basketball court and converted all three.<n>Bolt has admitted that the 2016 Olympic games in Rio will be his last.

Dennis Kimetto is a client of Dutch management company Volare Sports.<n>The world marathon record holder is also a former Kenyan champion.<n>His agent Rosa & Associati has also been suspended by Athletics Kenya.<n>The country has seen a rise in doping among its top runners.

Usain Bolt ran the 200 metres in 19.19sec at the 2009 World Championships.<n>The Jamaican sprinter is currently in Rio de Janeiro.<n>He will compete in the 'Mano a Mano' 100-metre challenge on Sunday.<n>Bolt insists he is almost impossible to beat when he is fully fit.

Labour have 55 of the 92 clubs in England's top four divisions in their own constituencies.<n>The Conservatives have 29 constituencies, the Liberal Democrats seven.<n>Only one club falls into independent hands: Bradford West, which holds Valley Parade.<n>18 of the 20 Premier League grounds are in constituencies held by Labour.<n>David Cameron’s Tories have 29 constituencies, the Lib Dems have seven.

Fulham drew 1-1 with Rotherham in the Championship on Saturday.<n>Matt Derbyshire opened the scoring for the visitors after four minutes.<n>Ross McCormack equalised for the hosts in the second half.<n>Kit Symons admitted his side were second best and need to rebuild.

Tiger Woods' club came into contact with a tree root on the ninth hole.<n>The 39-year-old dropped his club on the follow through.<n>Woods ended up finishing tied for 17th at the Masters on Sunday.<n>Jordan Spieth won his first Masters title with a final-round 68.

Rotherham were sanctioned by the Football League for fielding an ineligible player in their 1-0 win over Brighton on Easter Monday.<n>Derby defender Farrend Rawson was on loan at the club but his youth loan had expired and the paperwork over an extension was not dealt with correctly.<n>The Millers have vowed to fight the charge, hiring top QC Jim Sturman to defend them.<n>But Rotherham manager Steve Evans believes a decision is imminent.

Real Madrid beat Atletico Madrid 1-0 on Wednesday to win 1-0 on aggregate.<n>Real's players arrived at the Santiago Bernabeu mobbed by their fans.<n> Raphael Varane filmed the moment on his camera phone.<n>Real could face Barcelona, Juventus or Bayern Munich in the semi-finals.
Laurent Blanc says PSG need more time to reach the top.<n>The French club were knocked out 5-1 on aggregate by Barcelona.<n>PSG have now lost three successive Champions League quarter-finals.

Newcastle United fans plan mass protest against owner Mike Ashley.<n>Supporters' group have asked fans to stand in 34th minute of Saturday's match against Swansea.<n>Swansea boss Garry Monk insists players will not be affected by protests.<n>Swansea travel to St James' Park to face Newcastle on Saturday afternoon.

Wasps lock Joe Launchbury has been out since October.<n>The 24-year-old has a nerve problem caused by a bulging disc in his neck.<n>Launchbury is hopeful of making his comeback against Leicester Tigers.
Rafa Benitez has won 12 trophies since joining Valencia in 2002.<n>The 55-year-old is out of contract this summer.<n>Manchester City, Paris St Germain and Real Madrid are all considering changes.

Yaya Toure's agent Dimitri Seluk says he wants to talk to Manchester City.<n>The 31-year-old midfielder has two years left on his current contract.<n>City are prepared to listen to offers for the Ivorian midfielder.<n>Roberto Mancini wants to be reunited with Toure at Inter Milan.

Jack Wilshere was on the bench for Arsenal's FA Cup final win against Reading.<n>The 23-year-old has been out for five months through injury.<n>Ray Parlour believes Wilshere can be the future of the club.<n>But the former Arsenal man fears his injury record could turn him into another Abou Diaby.

Sportsmail revealed how popular each Premier League club is.<n>Arsenal came out on top globally with 5.68million followers.<n>Manchester United (4.87m) and Manchester City (8,872,812) are second and third on the list of clubs with most followers on Weibo.<n>Guang Guangzhou Evergrande Taobao are third on the list of clubs in the world with most Weibo followers.<n>Everton are the only Premier League club to have more followers in China than on Twitter.

Alexis Sanchez has scored 22 goals in all competitions this season.<n>The Chilean forward has been nominated for PFA Player of the Year.<n>Sanchez has singled out team-mate Santi Cazorla as a'spectacular' player.<n>Arsenal are currently second in the Premier League table.<n>The Gunners have also reached the FA Cup final for the second consecutive season.

Juventus beat Monaco 1-0 on aggregate to reach Champions League semi-finals.<n>Defender Patrice Evra believes Italian side played the Italian way against Ligue 1 side, describing their 0-0 draw at Stade Louis II as 'ugly'<n>Former Manchester United full back has urged Paul Pogba not to rush his return from injury.

Bafetimbi Gomis injured his hamstring in Swansea's 1-1 draw with Everton.<n>The Frenchman will miss league trips to Leicester and Newcastle.<n>Gomis hopes to return for the visit to Arsenal on May 11.

Real Madrid will play Juventus in the semi-finals of the Champions League.<n>Barcelona and Bayern Munich are the other two teams in the last four.<n>The Champions League semi-finals will take place in Berlin on June 6.<n>Click here for more Champions League news.

England have named their squad for the UEFA European Under-17 Championship.<n>The tournament takes place in Bulgaria from May 7 to 13.<n>John Peacock's side are the defending champions.<n>They will face Holland, Italy and the Republic of Ireland in Group D.<n>Jay Dasilva, Ike Ugbo and Chris Willock all included in the squad.

Investigators have released images of fans who tended to the wounded.<n>Pictures show men and women rushing towards those crushed in tragedy.<n>Police say 'unusual' appeal is necessary as they may be able to answer questions of victims' families.<n>96 Liverpool fans died when fans were crushed in an enclosure at ground.

Jordan Spieth won the Masters by four shots on Sunday.<n>The Augusta champion visited the observation deck of the Empire State Building on Monday.<n>The world's media were keen to get even more footage of the Augusta champion after his big weekend.

Jordan Henderson has signed a new long-term contract with Liverpool.<n>The vice captain's new deal will keep him at Anfield until 2020.<n>Henderson says he is 'over the moon' with the new contract.<n>Click here for more Liverpool news.

Marcus Bettinelli made his Fulham debut against Rotherham United.<n>The 22-year-old goalkeeper has one more year left on his contract.<n>Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho is interested in signing him.<n>Petr Cech is expected to leave Stamford Bridge in the summer.

Bayern Munich host Porto in the Champions League on Tuesday.<n>Pep Guardiola's side are chasing a third trophy this season.<n>Bay Munich are top of the Bundesliga and in the German Cup semi-final.<n>Guardiola says Franck Ribery is unlikely to recover in time.

Gareth Bale has not started eight of Real Madrid's 50 matches this season.<n>The Welshman has been injured, and has missed four league matches.<n>But Real have won every match he has missed, scoring 25 and conceding just one.<n>Bale has scored 12 goals in six games since his return from injury.

Thiago Alcantara was a target for Manchester United during David Moyes' time at Old Trafford.<n>But the Spaniard was not keen on a move to the Premier League.<n>Thiago's performance for Bayern Munich against Porto has been impressive.<n>The 27-year-old is one of the best passers of the ball in his position.

Southampton are the 16th-highest payers in the Premier League.<n>Chelsea are the third-highest payers with Manchester United at the top.<n>Bottom club Burnley have the fourth lowest wage bill at £21.5m.<n>QPR's £75.3m bill was almost twice what the club earned in total.

Phil Neville says keeping David de Gea at Manchester United is the club's biggest summer signing.<n>The Spanish keeper has been heavily linked with a move to Real Madrid.<n>Neville believes De Gea is world-class and has improved so quickly.

Mats Hummels is valued at £35million by German side Dortmund.<n>Manchester United have reportedly made an opening £21.5m bid.<n>United also retain an interest in Ilkay Gundogan.<n>Dortmund want Real Madrid's Sami Khedira as their new captain.

Radamel Falcao has scored just four goals for Manchester United this season.<n>But the striker could still sign for the club permanently after talks on Sunday.<n>United chief executive Ed Woodward held talks with Monaco president Vasim Vasilyev.<n>The Colombian has been given a second chance by Louis van Gaal.

Rafael cracked three ribs during Manchester United's U21 game with Leicester.<n>The Brazilian right-back is surplus to requirements at Old Trafford.<n>United have handed trials to MK Dons teenagers Luke Tingey and Kyran Wiltshire.

Adam Federici let a shot slip through his grasp in extra-time.<n>Alexis Sanchez scored to put Arsenal 2-1 up and book their place in the final.<n>Reading forced extra-time after Garath McCleary's volley cancelled out Sanchez's opener.

Bayern Munich have scored 115 goals in all competitions this season.<n>They have scored at a rate of 2.61 goals per game - a staggering 141 for the season.<n>Bay Munich's goalscoring machine has been unstoppable so far.<n>Pep Guardiola's side have five Bundesliga matches to play this season.<n>They could potentially play three Champions League matches if they reach the final.

UEFA publish new Champions League regulations for next season.<n>Top-seeded teams in eight groups will be defending Champions League winners plus title holders in the seven highest-ranked countries.<n>Arsenal, Atletico Madrid and Porto will drop in status in the August 27 draw.<n>PSV would benefit if the winners of the Champions League also won their domestic title.

Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal has been impressed with Michael Carrick's contribution to the team this season.<n>The 33-year-old midfielder has been injured a lot this season.<n>Van Gaal has identified Borussia Dortmund's Ilkay Gundogan as a long-term successor.<n>Gundogan's contract expires at the end of next season.<n>Dortmund could listen to offers to avoid losing him on a free transfer in 2016.

Barcelona beat Paris Saint-Germain 2-0 at the Nou Camp to reach the Champions League semi-finals 5-1 on aggregate.<n>Neymar scored both goals for the Spanish side.<n>Here, Sportsmail looks at the five things we have learned from the game.

PSG were knocked out of the Champions League by Barcelona on Tuesday.<n>The French side lost 2-0 at the Nou Camp in the second leg of the quarter-final.<n>PSG defender David Luiz was at fault for both of Neymar's goals.<n>ITV pundit Roy Keane offered his sympathy to the Brazilian international.

Campbell has listed a second property for sale in the same exclusive neighbourhood.<n>He bought the luxury penthouse by the Thames in 2011 for £4.25million.<n>It has since been extensively renovated by his wife Fiona Barratt-Campbell.<n>The former Arsenal and Tottenham defender's kitchen is filled with marble.

West Ham are set to move into the Olympic Stadium for start of 2016-17 season.<n>The Premier League club are confident the deal does not contravene domestic or European legislation.<n>Club say they were selected as anchor concessionaire following a 'fair, transparent and robust process'

Bayern Munich beat Porto 6-1 to reach Champions League semi-finals.<n>Pep Guardiola was left purring at his side's first-half performance.<n>Bay Munich lost the first leg 3-1 in Portugal last week.<n>Club doctor Hans-Wilhelm Muller-Wohlfahrt resigned following the defeat.

Alexis Sanchez has scored 22 goals for Arsenal this season.<n>The Chilean forward scored twice in the FA Cup semi-final win over Reading.<n>Sanchez has scored three goals in his last three matches.<n>The Gunners face Chelsea in the FA Cup final at Wembley on May 19.

Adam Federici let Alexis Sanchez's shot slip in FA Cup semi-final.<n>Reading goalkeeper will bounce back against Birmingham in Championship.<n>Manager Steve Clarke says Federici is a'strong character'

Bayern Munich beat Porto 7-4 on aggregate to reach Champions League semi-finals.<n>Pep Guardiola had been under pressure after first leg defeat to Porto.<n>The Spaniard said winning is a matter of life and death for Bayern.

Andres Iniesta had failed to register an assist in 19 La Liga appearances this season.<n>But the 30-year-old showed critics he is on the decline with a stellar first-half against PSG.<n>The Spaniard provided the assist for Neymar's first goal of the night.<n>Barcelona went on to win the game 2-0 and the tie 5-1 on aggregate.<n>Click here for all the latest Barcelona news.
John Higgins beat Robert Milkins 10-5 in the first round of the World Championships.<n>Graeme Dott also advanced with a 10-8 victory over Ricky Walden.

Hawkins won 10-9 at the Crucible after Matthew Selt won five frames in a row.<n>The Kent player led 9-4 before Selt launched a comeback.<n>Hawkins will play either Mark Allen or Ryan Day in the second round.
West Ham are in talks with Jamaican starlet DeShane Beckford.<n>The 17-year-old has impressed during a trial with the Hammers.<n>Beckford also has offers from clubs in Belgium.

Kenny Bayless will referee Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao's fight.<n>The match will take place at the MGM Grand Garden Arena on May 2.<n>Bayless has refereed previous super fights involving Mayweather and Pacquiao.<n>Glenn Feldman, a much respected judge from Connecticut, will be among the three wise men scoring the fight.<n>Dave Moretti and Burt Clements, from Reno, will be the other judges.

Jordan Spieth collected £1.23million for winning the Masters.<n>Ian Poulter was dressed all in purple for his final round at Augusta.<n>Tiger Woods and Rory McIlroy were paired together for the final round.

Kenny Bayless will referee Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao.<n>The veteran referee has worked five of Mayweather's bouts and seven of Pacquiao's.<n>Oscar De La Hoya believes Bayless' appointment favours Mayweather.<n>De La Hoya was defeated by Mayweather in 2007 on a split decision.

Andy Murray tied the knot with Kim Sears at Dunblane Cathedral on Saturday.<n>The tennis star announced his engagement in November last year.<n>Judy Murray arrived at the cathedral just before 4.00pm in a resplendent white dress.<n>The couple are expected to have around 100 guests at their wedding.

Glenn Roeder has returned to management at Sheffield Wednesday.<n>He joins Adam Pearson in a new managerial committee at the club.<n>The trio are tasked with returning Wednesday to the Premier League.

Bayern Munich take on Porto in the Champions League quarter-final second leg on Tuesday night.<n>If Bayern win, Xabi Alonso will become only second player to win Europe's top club prize with three different teams.<n>Clarence Seedorf is the only other player to have done so with AC Milan, Ajax and Real Madrid.<n>Alonso won the Champions League with Liverpool in 2005.<n>He also won it with Real Madrid last season despite being suspended.

There are 23 current and former Premier League players still involved in Europe's top competition.<n>Cristiano Ronaldo, Patrice Evra, Carlos Tevez, Paul Pogba, Dimitar Berbatov, Gerard Pique, Javier Hernandez are all involved.<n>Xabi Alonso, Gareth Bale, Alvaro Arbeloa, Jerome Boateng, Yohan Cabaye, Steven Gerrard, Yaya Toure, Steven Gerrard, Samir Nasri, Robin van Persie, Cesc Fabregas, Samir Nasri, Fernando Torres, Yaya Toure, Robin van Persie, Steven Gerrard, Frank Lampard, Fernando Torres, David Villa, Javier Hernandez, Raheem Sterling
Tim Sherwood has won five games in charge of Aston Villa.<n>The former Tottenham boss took over from Paul Lambert on February 14.<n>Villa have reached the FA Cup final against Chelsea on Saturday.

Sam Allardyce was furious that a foul by Eliaquim Mangala was not given.<n>The Hammers boss was furious because Stewart Downing stayed on his feet.<n>West Ham lost 2-0 to Manchester City at the Etihad on Sunday.

West Ham are currently mid-table in the Premier League table.<n>They have lost their last five games in all competitions.<n>But defender Carl Jenkinson insists they are not going to give up.<n>The Hammers lost 2-0 to Manchester City on Sunday.

Manchester City lost 3-1 at Porto in the Champions League last week.<n>Bay Munich are 3-1 down from the first leg against Porto.<n>Pep Guardiola will come under more scrutiny if Bayern fail to overturn the deficit on Tuesday night.<n>City director of football Txiki Begiristain is keen on appointing Guardiola as their new manager in the summer of 2016.

Martina Hingis made her comeback in the Fed Cup on Saturday.<n>The former World No 1 was defeated 6-4, 6-0 by Agnieszka Radwanska.<n>Hingis was persuaded to play because of injuries in the Switzerland team.<n>The Swiss star has to play in the Fed Cup to qualify for the Olympics.

PSV Eindhoven's Memphis Depay has been linked with a move to Bayern Munich.<n>Manchester United and Liverpool are also interested in the Dutch international.<n>Ronald de Boer has compared Depay to a young Cristiano Ronaldo.<n>De Boer believes Louis van Gaal's presence at United could help United.

Chelsea's 1-0 win over Manchester United was watched on Sky by 6.9m.<n>But the FA Cup semi-final between Arsenal and Reading was watched on BBC by just 2m.<n>Both organisations blame each other for their respective rights holders.<n>The Premier League purposely chose to broadcast fixtures involving top-four clubs on semi-final days.

Liverpool have been given permission to install a 4.5metre privacy screen.<n>The club had grown concerned over leaks of team details.<n>Local residents wanted a designated area for fans to watch training.<n>READ: Liverpool's new training ground could be the most advanced in the Premier League.

Steven Gerrard's Liverpool career will end in Stoke on May 24.<n>Gerrard was hoping to end his Liverpool career with an FA Cup win.<n>Liverpool were beaten by Aston Villa in the semi-final on Sunday.<n>The 34-year-old will join LA Galaxy in the MLS in July.
Chelsea defeated Manchester United 1-0 at Stamford Bridge.<n>Eden Hazard scored the only goal of the game in the first half.<n>Louis van Gaal's side are now a serious challenger for the title.

Eden Hazard has been in superb form for Chelsea this season.<n>The Belgian scored the winner against Manchester United on Saturday.<n>Jose Mourinho has praised Hazard's talent and humility.<n>Hazard is widely expected to be named PFA Player of the Year on Sunday.

Liverpool face a major rebuilding job this summer following a mass exit.<n>Brendan Rodgers could see up to 10 of his stars leave Anfield.<n>Steven Gerrard has agreed to join MLS side LA Galaxy.<n>Glen Johnson is out of contract and set to go on a free transfer.<n>Kolo Toure is also out of contract and considering whether to accept new deal.<n>Raheem Sterling is embroiled in a contract stand-off with Manchester City.<n>Martin Skrtel’s future is also unclear as he is yet to agree a new contract.<n>Liverpool will listen to offers for Mario Balotelli

Michael Conlan and Paddy Barnes both qualified for the Rio Olympics.<n>The pair were fighting in Venezuela on Saturday night.<n>Barnes claimed the 49kg spot with a split-decision win.<n>Conlan needed to win and also needed a shock result elsewhere.<n>The Belfast bantamweight claimed a 49-46 unanimous points win.

Amir Khan has been chasing a fight with Manny Pacquiao for two years.<n>The Bolton boxer is now the stand-by for Pacquiao.<n>A fight with Pacquiao could take place in Abu Dhabi in November or December.<n>Khan says he would love to box the Filipino in the Middle East.

Juventus are monitoring Raheem Sterling's situation at Liverpool.<n>The Serie A side are looking to strengthen this summer.<n>Manchester City, Chelsea, Real Madrid, Paris St Germain and Bayern Munich are all among Sterling's admirers.<n>Juventus have made an offer for Belgium midfielder Axel Witsel.

Aston Villa beat Liverpool 2-1 in the FA Cup semi-final on Sunday.<n>Fabian Delph scored the winner as Tim Sherwood's side reach the final.<n>Tom Cleverley has praised the impact of Sherwood in the last two months.<n>Manchester United loanee says the attacking style is paying off.<n>Villa face Arsenal in the final at Wembley on May 30.

Frank Lampard should have started more games for Manchester City.<n>Phil Jagielka is five games away from going a complete season without getting a single booking on club duty.<n>Tom Cleverley has found a steely edge since Tim Sherwood took charge at Aston Villa.

David Moyes gave Wayne Rooney his professional debut at Everton back in 2002.<n>Moyes succeeded Sir Alex Ferguson as Manchester United manager in 2013.<n>Rooney has been a vital cog in Louis van Gaal's new-look United outfit this season.<n>Rooney scored only goal as United lost 1-0 to Chelsea at Stamford Bridge.

Manny Pacquiao fights Floyd Mayweather on May 2 in the richest fight of all time.<n>Pacquiao's shorts will carry sponsorship logos worth £1.5m.<n>The shorts will be the most expensive in the world.<n>Pacquiao is assured more than £50m from the fight.<n>Mayweather's latest insight into his camp comes in the form of a video about the gloves he trains with.

Liverpool's FA Cup semi-final defeat has put the club under scrutiny.<n>The burning ambition at Anfield is for Liverpool to be Champions League regulars with the potential to win the Barclays Premier League.<n>Are Liverpool heading for mediocrity? Or is there sufficient talent to ensure the mistakes are corrected and progress can be resumed?<n>A huge summer beckons and there is no margin for error.

Manchester United lost 1-0 to Chelsea in the Premier League on Saturday.<n>Eden Hazard scored the only goal of the game at Stamford Bridge.<n>Wayne Rooney was happy with his side's performance despite the result.<n>Louis van Gaal labelled his side's display as their best of the season.

Marouane Fellaini has been in fine form for Manchester United in recent weeks.<n>The midfielder has been a key figure in United's recent wins over Liverpool, Tottenham and Manchester City.<n>Chelsea goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois believes his side will be able to combat Fellaini's style of play on Saturday.

Eden Hazard scored the only goal of the game in Chelsea's 1-0 win over Manchester United at Stamford Bridge on Saturday.<n>The Belgian has been the Blues' star performer all season.<n>Hazard is now the player you look to in a crisis.<n>He is improving every season, which is a good sign.

Eden Hazard opened the scoring for Chelsea in the first half with a low strike.<n>The Belgian forward has now scored 13 Premier League goals this season.<n>Chelsea move four points clear of Manchester United with two games to play.

Chelsea beat Manchester United 1-0 in the Premier League on Saturday.<n>Ander Herrera was denied a late penalty after appearing to dive.<n>Jose Mourinho said he was happy it was not a Chelsea player.<n>Mourinho was angered by Sky Sports' coverage of Diego Costa's suspension.
Chelsea beat Manchester United 1-0 at Stamford Bridge.<n>Victory moves Blues to within two wins of first title in five years.<n>Jose Mourinho says there is still a long way to go in the title race.

Chelsea beat Manchester United 1-0 at Stamford Bridge.<n>Eden Hazard scored the only goal of the game in the first half.<n>John Terry is adamant there is still work to be done to win the title.<n>The Blues now have two wins from their last six matches.

Bournemouth went from third to second in the Championship after 2-2 draw.<n>Chris Maguire scored an injury time penalty to salvage a point for Wednesday.<n>Eddie Howe's side are unbeaten in 10 and are not falling apart.

Radamel Falcao has failed to score or have a shot on target in 10 games.<n>The Colombian has also collected £3,080,000 in wages during that time.<n>Falcao started in Manchester United's 1-0 defeat at Chelsea on Saturday.<n>The striker lost the ball following a John Terry challenge.

Andres Iniesta made his Barcelona debut under Louis van Gaal in 2002-03.<n>The Spain international has praised Van Gaal for giving him his chance.<n>Iniesta also admitted he took great joy in winning the 2009 Champions League with Barcelona at the Stadio Olimpico in Rome.

Manchester United host Manchester City in the derby on Sunday.<n>Wayne Rooney wants to put a smile on the faces of United fans.<n>United have lost their last four meetings with City.<n>Roo Rooney is the leading United scorer in derby history with 11 goals.

Everton defeated Burnley 1-0 in their Premier League clash at Goodison Park.<n>Kevin Mirallas opened the scoring on his return to the first team.<n>Burnley forward Ashley Barnes was sent off just before half time.<n>Jose Mourinho had previously criticised Barnes for a 'criminal challenge' on Nemanja Matic at Stamford Bridge.

Rotor Volgograd have been wound up after going bankrupt.<n>The Russian outfit famously beat Manchester United in the UEFA Cup in 1995.<n>A 'new' amateur club, which will also be known as Rotor Volgograd, will take part in the Russian third division.

Steven Naismith has won the Barclays Spirit of the Game Award.<n>The Everton forward has helped a number of charities in the local community.<n>Naismith teamed up with Job Centre Plus to give unemployed fans the opportunity to watch Everton at Goodison Park.

Burnley travel to Everton in the Premier League on Saturday.<n>The Clarets are two points from safety with a game in hand.<n>Everton boss Roberto Martinez says Burnley have a fearlessness.<n>The Spaniard says they are similar to his old side Wigan who avoided relegation.

Manny Pacquiao takes on Floyd Mayweather in Las Vegas on May 2.<n>The Filipino boxer has released a range of t-shirts commemorating the bout.<n>There are four shirts available, three of which cost $29.99 (321)<n>The cheapest shirt has an 'M' for Mayweather above a 'P' for Pacquiao.

Ross Barkley missed from the spot in Everton's 1-0 win against Burnley.<n>Robert Martinez defended the young England player.<n>Leighton Baines has scored 15 penalties from 16 attempts in the Premier League.
Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao fight is just two weeks away.<n>Tickets for the fight have yet to go on public sale.<n>The impasse has left fans in the dark, and ticket brokers perplexed.

Christian Benteke has two years left on his contract at Aston Villa.<n>But boss Tim Sherwood says he could be sold in the summer if he wants to.<n>Villa are believed to value the Belgium international at upwards of £25million.<n>Wolfsburg have monitored Benteke's situation.

Laura Robson has been training in Tampa, Florida in a bid to get fit.<n>The 21-year-old has not played since the 2014 Australian Open.<n>Robson is hoping to be fit in time to take part in the French Open.

Floyd Mayweather fights Manny Pacquiao on May 2.<n>The fight is expected to be the biggest in the history of boxing.<n>Sky Sports pundits Jamie Redknapp and Thierry Henry go head-to-head.<n>The pair pretend to go head-to-head in the studio.<n>But the mock tension quickly disappears as they collapse into giggles.

Steven Gerrard is set to leave Liverpool at the end of the season.<n>Martin Skrtel has praised the impact Gerrard has had at Anfield.<n>The defender believes Liverpool can overcome the loss of Gerrard.<n>Gerrard is aiming to lead Liverpool to the FA Cup final next month.

Liverpool face Aston Villa in the FA Cup semi-final on Sunday.<n>Brendan Rodgers wants Liverpool to reclaim their Wembley glory days.<n>He believes cup success would help develop a stronger winning mentality.<n>Rodgers has an indifferent record against Villa since arriving at Anfield.<n>Click here for Liverpool transfer news.

Stoke are 17th in the Premier League Fair Play table.<n>Mark Hughes believes they are being harshly marked down because of the song.<n>Stoke fans have been singing Tom Jones' song 'Delilah' since 1980s.

Barcelona host Valencia at the Nou Camp in La Liga on Saturday.<n>Victory will take Luis Enrique's side five points clear at the top of the table.<n>Andreas Iniesta is definitely ruled out for Barca with a bruised pelvis.<n>Real Madrid kick off against Malaga in the evening kick-off.<n>Karim Benzema has been ruled out of the match with Malaga.

Luis Suarez scored twice as Barcelona beat PSG 3-1 on Wednesday.<n>The Uruguayan says he nutmegged David Luiz twice because it was his quickest way to goal.<n>The double took his tally to 17 goals for Barca this season.<n>The forward says the tie is not over despite the two goal lead.

Zlatan Ibrahimovic was banned for four games after swearing at referee.<n>The PSG striker appealed the decision and has now had ban reduced.<n>Dimitri Payet has also had his two-game ban reduced by one.<n>Both clubs appealed to the French Olympic Committee (CNOSF)

Greek government have proposed new laws banning teams from European competitions.<n>Government says it is necessary to protect the safety of fans.<n>But UEFA say that is direct government interference in football.<n>Gianni Infantino says there will be no choice but to suspend Greece.

Stephan Lichtsteiner played with Eden Hazard at Lille.<n>The Juventus defender says he could tell Hazard was special in training.<n>Lichtsteiner also believes Kingsley Coman has the attributes to be a top striker.

Gareth Bale is out of Real Madrid's Champions League tie against Atletico.<n>The 25-year-old injured his calf during Saturday's 3-1 win against Malaga.<n>Wales international wished his team-mates good luck on Facebook.<n>Real host city rivals Atletico at the Santiago Bernabeu on Wednesday night.

Robin van Persie made his first appearance since February after recovering from an ankle injury.<n>Jonny Evans has been out for six games due to a suspension for spitting at Papiss Cisse.<n>Sean Goss scored Manchester United's equaliser after Harry Panayiotou put Leicester ahead after 18 minutes.<n>Rafael had to be taken off in the 44th minute with a rib injury after being caught in the air by Leicester's Andy Dodoo.

Monaco host Juventus in the Champions League quarter-finals on Wednesday.<n>Leonardo Jardim says his side's performance shows you don't need to buy big.<n>The French club have been forced to nurture young talent in recent seasons.

Diego Simeone admits he is surprised by the lack of English clubs in Europe's elite competition.<n>Chelsea, Arsenal and Manchester City were eliminated in last 16.<n>Everton were dumped out of the Europa League in the same round.<n>Simeone believes that Spain is still home to the two best teams in Europe - Wednesday night’s opponents Real Madrid.

Nathaniel Clyne is yet to sign a new contract at Southampton.<n>The England right-back is out of contract at the end of the season.<n>Manchester United, Chelsea and Liverpool are all interested in him.<n>The Saints will sell him if he does not sign a new deal at St Mary's.

Everton have expressed an interest in QPR striker Charlie Austin.<n>The Toffees have made a new striker their priority for the summer.<n>Everton were among clubs who watched Club Brugge forward Obbi Oulare.

Rob Green made a calamitous error in England's 1-1 World Cup draw with USA in 2010.<n>The QPR goalkeeper allowed a speculative effort to go through his hands and was unable to retrieve it.<n>Green gained his first international cap since the World Cup in 2012.<n>QPR face Green's former club West Ham in the Premier League on Saturday.

Memphis Depay has held talks with Paris St Germain this week.<n>PSG understood to have made a significantly better financial offer than Liverpool.<n>PSV have informed PSV of their wish to do so while Liverpool have established a good relationship with the club.<n>Depay is intrigued by the prospect of playing with Zlatan Ibrahimovic.<n>Bay Munich are also considering a move for the winger.

Real Madrid striker Javier Hernandez scored a late winner against Atletico Madrid.<n>The on-loan striker celebrated his goal with a tap in at the corner.<n>Thierry Henry believes Hernandez owes all the credit to Cristiano Ronaldo.

Barcelona face Paris Saint-Germain in the Champions League on Tuesday.<n>Luis Suarez has scored 19 goals in all competitions for the club.<n>The Uruguayan admits he was nervous at playing alongside Lionel Messi and Neymar when he joined the club this season.<n>Barcelona take a 3-1 lead into the second leg against PSG.

Thierry Henry has responded to critics who disagreed with his views on Javier Hernandez's celebration.<n>The former Arsenal striker criticised Hernandez for 'winning the World Cup'<n>Henry posted an 84-minute video of Michael Laudrup's passing.<n>The Mexican striker scored the winning goal for Real Madrid against Atletico.

Amir Khan will fight Chris Algieri in New York on May 29.<n>The Bolton-born fighter takes on Algieri at the Barclays Center.<n>Khan has slammed Kell Brook for his recent comments.<n>Brook defends his world welterweight title against Frankie Gavin at London’s 02 Arena on Saturday, May 30.
Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao will meet in Las Vegas on May 2.<n>Rick Hatton says Pacquiao has the style to beat Mayweather.<n>But the Hitman warns Mayweather to avoid facing Amir Khan.

Kell Brook will fight Frankie Gavin at the O2 in London on May 30.<n>Brook will defend his IBF World Welterweight title for the second time.<n>Brook beat Jo Jo Dan for his first world title in Sheffield last month.<n>Amir Khan had ruled out a fight with Brook until later in the year.

Floyd Mayweather takes on Manny Pacquiao in a $300 million mega-fight on May 2.<n>The undefeated pound-for-pound No 1 believes he is the best boxer ever.<n>He also criticised Ali's 'rope-a-dope' tactics against George Foreman.

Floyd Mayweather vs Manny Pacquiao is set to take place on May 2.<n>The official advert for the fight has been released by both fighters.<n>The 30-second clip was filmed in a Los Angeles studio on March 11.<n>Sky won the bidding war to screen the fight on British shores.<n>Customers will be charged £19.95 for access to the MGM Grand in Las Vegas.

Manny Pacquiao will fight Floyd Mayweather in Las Vegas on May 2.<n>The pair came close to agreeing a big-money bout five years ago.<n>But it eventually fell through, leaving the boxing world waiting.<n>Pacquiao's trainer Freddie Roach believes his man has a better chance of winning now than he did in 2010.
Manny Pacquiao's final conference call was interrupted by a jam.<n>Boxer was answering questions from the assembled media.<n>Floyd Mayweather is due for his final conference call this Wednesday.

Blackpool chairman Karl Oyston has denied five FA charges.<n>Oyston sent abusive text messages to a fan in December.<n>The Seasiders chief labelled a supporter a'retard'<n>Oyston has until April 6 to respond to the charges.<n>He is expected to appeal the decision.
Amir Khan has been showing off his lightning quick technique.<n>The 28-year-old used an empty plastic bottle during a training session.<n>Khan will fight Chris Algieri in New York on May 29.

Hull, Leicester and Swansea are following Poland international Maciej Rybus.<n>The 25-year-old has one year left on his current deal and has a get-out clause for £3.2million.<n>He impressed during Poland's 1-1 draw with Republic of Ireland last month.

Inverness defender Josh Meekings handballed in the Scottish Cup semi-final.<n>He was given a one-match suspension by the Scottish Football Association.<n>The Inverness player will miss the cup final against Falkirk on May 30.<n>FIFA vice president Jim Boyce has criticised the SFA's decision.

Manchester City need eight homegrown players for next season's squad.<n>Manuel Pellegrini watched City's academy in their FA Youth Cup final.<n>City also interested in Danny Ings, Jay Rodriguez and Dedryck Boyata.<n>Frank Lampard, Scott Sinclair and Micah Richards could all leave.<n>James Milner is expected to decide his fate at the end of the season.

Cheltenham Town have two games left to keep their Football League status.<n>Manager Gary Johnson asked his players to sign a pledge to give their all.<n>'You need everyone to give everything for the cause,' says Johnson.

Harry Kane, Nabil Bentaleb and Ryan Mason have all shone this season.<n>Tottenham have been tipped to promote more academy players.<n>But Mauricio Pochettino says he will not do that based on past success.<n>Pochettino also says Hugo Lloris' ambition is to play in the Champions League.

Tranmere are one point behind Cheltenham and two behind Hartlepool.<n>The Wirral club are 94 years old and have been in the Football League since 1913.<n>Manager Micky Adams has left the club by'mutual consent'

Tranmere are bottom of League Two after a 3-0 defeat by Oxford on Saturday.<n>Fans called for Adams to leave after the game at Prenton Park.<n>The club confirmed his departure in a statement on Sunday.<n>Assistant manager Alan Rogers and academy manager Shaun Garnett will take temporary charge of first-team affairs.

Burton Albion secured promotion to League One with win at Morecambe.<n>Lucas Akins scored both goals in the 2-1 victory at St James' Park.<n>Shrewsbury are one win away from a return to League One after beating York.<n>Bury set a new club record of seven straight away wins by beating Portsmouth.<n>Tranmere remain bottom of the table after 3-0 defeat at home to Oxford.

Steven Gerrard and Frank Lampard will be honoured by the PFA.<n>The pair will be awarded with special merit awards at the ceremony.<n>Gerrard and Lampard will both leave the Premier League for the MLS.<n>The pair have won 19 major trophies between them.
