Aaron Cresswell has been linked with a move away from West Ham.<n>The 25-year-old has been a consistent performer for the Hammers.<n>Sam Allardyce believes he would be better off staying at Upton Park.

Javier Hernandez scored Real Madrid's winner against Atletico Madrid.<n>The Mexican striker scored 'the goal of his life' in the 88th minute.<n>Manchester United team-mates Michael Carrick and Wayne Rooney led the tributes to Hernandez on Twitter.

Featherstone prop James Lockwood has been banned for two years.<n>Lockwood has been handed a ban by UK Anti-Doping.<n>The former Dewsbury forward has breached Rugby Football League anti-doping regulations.

Sampdoria president Massimo Ferrero has quashed rumours that manager Sinisa Mihajlovic is set to be replaced by Rafael Benitez at Napoli.<n>But Ferrero has revealed he would take Benitez to see a dietician first.<n>Sampdoria travel to face Napoli on Sunday in a crucial Serie A fixture.

Rafa Benitez is out of contract with Napoli at the end of the season.<n>The Spaniard has been linked with the Manchester City job.<n>But Benitez has said he has not had contact with City.<n>Napoli are on course to reach the semi-finals of the Europa League.

Ian Watson could come out of retirement to help Salford.<n>Red Devils have lost four players to suspension and three more to injury.<n>Watson has stepped up training ahead of Sunday's home game against Castleford.

Bradford Bulls are investigating reports of vandalism at their stadium.<n>Three cars were broken into during Sunday's defeat by Hull KR.<n>The incident occurred in the Richard Dunn Sports Centre car park.

The fire at Bradford City's Valley Parade stadium claimed 56 lives.<n>John Helm was commentating on the game at the time of the blaze.<n>He says there is no evidence to suggest the fire was caused deliberately.
Bryan Habana scored the only try of the game in extra-time.<n>Leigh Halfpenny kicked 20 points from six penalties and a conversion.<n>Toulon face Clermont Auvergne in the Champions Cup final.

Sir Oliver Popplewell conducted the 1985 inquiry into the Bradford fire.<n>He says police should look at eight other fires allegedly connected to the then club chairman to'see if there was anything sinister'<n>The fire at Bradford's Valley Parade stadium claimed 56 lives.<n>Popplewell's inquiry concluded that the cause was an accident.

A new book claims the fire at Valley Parade was just one of at least nine fires at businesses owned by or associated with the club's then chairman Stafford Heginbotham.<n>Former sports minister Gerry Sutcliffe says new allegations do not justify a new inquiry into the disaster.<n>Sutcliffe says he knew Heginbotham 'flew by the seat of his pants' in terms of the finances of the club.

The fire at Bradford City's Valley Parade claimed 56 victims and injured 265.<n>The 30th anniversary of the tragedy is approaching.<n>Rangers boss Stuart McCall lost his father in the blaze.<n>McCall has always claimed he and his father were the fortunate ones.

Paul Smith is in line to fight Andre Ward on June 20 in Oakland, California.<n>The fight is expected to be announced this week.<n>It will be the first time Smith has fought Ward since 2011.<n>Ward has not fought since November 2013.<n>A rematch with Carl Froch is possible if Ward beats Smith.

Julio Cesar Chavez Jr was stopped in nine rounds by Andrzej Fonfara.<n>Carl Froch had expressed his desire to fight Chavez Jr in Las Vegas.<n>The 37-year-old has not fought since knocking out George Groves.

Manchester City players have backed Patrick Vieira to replace Manuel Pellegrini as manager of the club if he is sacked at the end of the season.<n>Pellegrini's future at the Etihad Stadium is under scrutiny following a largely disappointing campaign.<n>Vieira is highly-respected among City players and his work with the youth team has not gone unnoticed too.<n>City's first-choice managerial option remains Bayern Munich boss Pep Guardiola.

An Icelandic duo has created a snack that is made using cricket flour.<n>Called the Jungle Bar it also contains dates, sesame seeds and chocolate.<n>Cricket flour is said to be a good source of protein and other nutrients.<n>The duo hopes it will encourage people in the West to eat more insects.

Russian YouTuber captured the terrifying moment a stream of soil flowed down a bank next to a main road in the Kemerovo Region of Russia.<n>The earthflow is a type of landslide and is usually triggered by heavy rainfall.<n>It can be seen crushing trees in its path and leaving toppled power lines in its wake.<n>The earthflow also blocked nearby railroad tracks and caused power outages, but no one was hurt.

Nicholas Tooth, 25, died after hitting his head on an opponent's shoulder.<n>He was playing for the Quirindi Lions in a first grade rugby union match.<n>The young man was visiting his hometown in the New England region of NSW for the weekend.<n>He was airlifted to Newcastle's John Hunter Hospital but died late on Sunday.<n>Tributes have poured in for the 'highly regarded' player.
Women aged 17 to 25 use Facebook to judge themselves, study finds.<n>They check the social networking site every few hours, Australian psychologists found.

Video shows the Galaxy S6 Edge shattering under 110lbs (50kg) of pressure.<n>Firm claims tests were unfair as 'rarely occurs under normal circumstances'<n>Samsung has responded with a video demonstrating the flaw.

A woman proved that she had the biggest muscles in the room and maybe even the city during a 'Flex Cam' at a Philadelphia Soul game.<n>Video of the unidentified woman's robust display at the Arena Football League game has over 300,000 views on YouTube.

Haim Kaplan filmed the hilarious moment at Ngorongoro Conservation Area.<n>Baboons approach truck and one makes a lunge at the driver.<n>Man makes an attempt to scare them away but is forced to retreat.<n>Baboons re-emerge and carry snacks in both hands and mouth.
Dr Sandra Lee, from Upland, California, is a dermatologist who shares videos of herself extracting her patients' zits on her YouTube channel.

Three years ago, Karen Huff Klein, 71, was tormented by middle school students in Greece, New York in a 10-minute video.<n>She tried to ignore the boys calling her fat, ugly and poor but was seen wiping away her tears.<n>Now one of the students involved in this verbal attack has been accused of forcing a special-needs student to drink urine from a toilet.<n>The bullying was videotaped and posted on Snapchat.<n>Mrs Klein said of the latest incident: 'They didn’t learn any lessons from the other ordeal. I don’t think they ever will'

Dog salons in Taiwan are giving customers bizarre new haircuts.<n>Shapely new cuts are being offered to make pets look more attractive.<n>Hairdressers say demand is increasing as more people seek social media shares.

Indonesian President Joko Widodo has confirmed the executions of Bali Nine duo Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran are 'only a matter of time'<n>The pair lost their most recent appeal for clemency however three of the other death row prisoners are still awaiting the results of their appeals.<n>Chan and Sukumaran remain in an isolated cell on Nusakambangan Island where they have lodged a challenge with the Constitutional Court to have their death sentence overturned.

John Lahiff was bitten on the leg and foot at the Palmer Sea Reef Golf Course.<n>The elderly man was playing alone when he accidentally stood on a crocodile.<n>The 1.2 metre reptile reacted quickly, grabbing Mr Lahiff and biting him.<n>He received puncture wounds on his leg and foot, including one down to the bone.<n>The man in his 70s has spoken out from his hospital bed at Cairns Base Hospital, swearing he will return to the green again.

The Tateyama Kurobe Alpine Route opened to the public on today.<n>The 65ft high walls can be seen on the Murodo track in Tateyama, Japan.<n>The route usually attracts around a million visitors every year.<n>Numbers are predicted to rise this year with the opening of the Tokyo-Toyama line.

The ancient Tuscan town is shrouded in mystery with its origin and history remaining unknown.<n>Residents were forced to flee their homes in the town more than 60 years ago due to seismic instability.<n>A number of historical earthquakes, including one in 1887 that measured 6.7 on the Richter scale, caused severe damage to the settlement’s infrastructure.<n>A new town with the same name was built around a mile from its location and it 1953 the remaining population moved away.

Manchester City are four points clear at the top of the Premier League.<n>They have a superior goal difference and have played a game more than Liverpool.<n>Manuel Pellegrini is under pressure and may be sacked if they finish fifth.<n>Yaya Toure and Samir Nasri are likely to be among the first-team casualties.<n>But where will City be by then?

St Catherine's Island, off the coast of Tenby, Pembrokeshire, is only accessible by crossing a beach during low tide.<n>A new footbridge, which will stretch more than 328 ft (100 metres), will open up the island from the coast of Tenby for the first time.<n>The fort, which defended Britain from French invasion, was built in 1867.

Scott Kaiser captured the footage in Santa Barbara, California.<n>Bird looks majestic before opening its mouth to show size difference.<n>Then opens its mouth again and inflates its air sacs as it sits down.<n>Appears to be the pelican’s tongue and some inner bill anatomy.

Adam Prowse, 34, of Torquay, was captured on camera dancing.<n>The video shows him gyrating with customer Nichola Sullings 57.<n>Originally filmed while on his round in Exeter, Devon.<n>Adam said the dancing started when he had the stereo on in his van.

Patrick Miller and Damien Rigden stayed at a hotel in Cyprus for a friend's wedding.<n>The self-employed personal trainer and his friend, from Cambridge, decided to film the conditions at the hotel.<n>The three-and-a-half minute video shows the pair exploring the hotel, including a swimming pool filled with dead insects.

Julie Stauch and married couple Sean Bagniewski and Vidhya Reddy all appear in on the video announcing Clinton's 2016 bid.<n>Bagniewski, who ran for Des Moines City Council in 2013, was a campaigner for Clinton in 2007.<n>He is also said to be in talks with Martin O’Malley’s people and may support him.

Jack Wilshere met Pele at the launch of 10Ten Talent on Thursday.<n>The Arsenal midfielder was given the 'honour' to interview the Brazil legend.<n>Pele has bemoaned Brazil's performance at last summer's World Cup.<n>Glenn Hoddle also attended the launch and is a client of 10Ten Talent.

Museum will be dedicated to the celebrated director, actor and writer.<n>It is hoped the museum will be housed in the former arts and crafts school.<n>The 17th century building is currently unoccupied after a refurbishment.<n>A competition is being held to decide what project will be set in the building.<n>Museum is expected to be completed in two years, but no permission yet.
Footage was shot at Domodedovo Airport in Russia.<n>Man is seen sleeping on the conveyor belt as other passengers look on.<n>Other passengers appear more concerned with spotting their luggage.

Former England rugby captain Lewis Moody is undertaking a 100km trek to the North Pole.<n>His plane was forced to make an emergency landing due to poor visibility.<n>Moody and his fellow trekkers were unharmed in the incident.<n>The team were rescued from the remote site by a helicopter.<n>They will now begin their trek the next day.

Dog named Teeny is captured on video sat opposite Eric Ko.<n>The pair hold onto push-up bars with their front paws and hands.<n>The dog looks up at the trainer in excitement and completes a press-up.<n>The pair then go on to complete a count of four together.

Study by University of Alberta in Canada found knuckle cracks in less than 310 milliseconds.<n>The cracking is caused by the rapid formation of a gas-filled cavity.<n>The experiment was made possible by magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)

Lion gets its head stuck in barrel at Dierenrijk zoo in the Netherlands.<n>Keepers place food in barrels to stimulate the lions as part of challenge.<n>Animal reaches in too far and gets its head stuck as other lions chase after it.<n>One lion appears to come to the rescue by standing on barrel.<n>But unfortunately the animal is unable to free its head and the other two lions walk around looking perplexed.

The cafe based in Moscow invites cat lovers to bring their pets.<n>Customers are allowed to adopt the cats but only if they meet certain requirements.<n>The cafe was influenced by the many cat cafes that have opened up in parts of far-east Asia.

Comedy sketch by 26 Minutes follows 'Jeff Randl' who travels to Switzerland.<n>He is loud, arrogant and takes offence to a rainbow-coloured gondola.<n>The Bible-toting snowboarder also takes offence to being loud.<n>The video has received mixed reviews on YouTube.

Michael Carrick has 33 caps for England and played against Italy.<n>He has started nine competitive games for England but they have won just four.<n>Carrick was dropped for the quarter-final of the 2006 World Cup.<n>He was also part of England's disastrous draw with Macedonia in 2008.<n>Carrick has also been impressive in Manchester United's midfield this season.

Steven Sloan, joined by friends Michael Niccum and Eugene Dight were on an aluminium rowboat when the encounter occurred off the west coast of Anderson Island, Washington.<n>The group believe that the sound of the rope being pulled along the side of the boat is what attracted the orcas.<n>The killer whales begin circling and swimming dangerously close to and underneath the tiny boat.

Allen Stanford's deal with England ended with his arrest and subsequent 110-year jail sentence.<n>Sir Curtly Ambrose has defended England's involvement with Stanford.<n>Ambrose accompanied Stanford when he flew to the Lord's nursery ground in 2008 to launch his five-year deal with England.

England have pulled out of the home nations international Under 16 tournament.<n>The FA announced this week that England are pulling out of the event.<n>It is understood this surprise move has been prompted by Sky allegedly withdrawing their title sponsorship.

Premier League clubs have rejected a £135m-a-year title sponsorship deal.<n>Guinness offered the top flight a huge deal of £135m over three years.<n>The Premier League want £60m-a-season from a mega-rich backer.<n>The FA have failed to find an 'in association' FA Cup partner.

ECB to spread the net far wider than expected in search for new director.<n>Michael Vaughan, Andrew Strauss and Alec Stewart are all in the frame.<n>Roy Hodgson is launching Roses 2015, the annual clash between York and Lancaster universities.

Turia Pitt suffered burns to 65 per cent of her body when she was caught in a bushfire in September 2011.<n>The motivational speaker said she still struggles to overcome her near-death ordeal.<n>The 27-year-old ran her first marathon last month and clocked a faster time than before she was injured.<n>Ms Pitt is currently training ahead of the 10-day fund raising trek along the Inca Trail in Peru.

Marina Granovskaia is Chelsea director and club's transfer and contract negotiator.<n>She is confirmed to speak at a women in sport conference on May 21.<n>Granovskaia sold defender David Luiz for a remarkable £50million.<n>She allegedly told captain John Terry to ‘take it or f****** leave it’ before he signed his one-year contract extension.

Giles Clarke embarrassed VIP guests with his behaviour at the Lord's Pavilion Long Room dinner.<n>The departing ECB chairman arrived upset that the new ECB regime had just sacked his England managing director appointment, Paul Downton.<n>Clarke lost the plot when eloquent guest speaker Ehsan Mani of Pakistan outlined his concern for the future of world cricket.

The Salt card is designed to end the tiresome task of manually unlocking a smartphone or tablet.<n>It automatically unlocks the device when a user is nearby and locks it again when a user moves out of range.<n>It connects to a user’s Android handset or iPhone via Bluetooth.<n>Firm suggests the Salt card is stored on the phone.<n>It was created by Joel Paglione and Niko Zistakis, from Chicago.<n>They raised $82,000 (£53,512) on Kickstarter to put it into production.

Researchers at the University of Arizona have captured the behaviour of a Bombardier beetle.<n>The tiny bug can mix chemicals in an internal'reaction chamber'<n>When threatened, it can then fire streams of foul-smelling liquid from its rear.<n>It can even precisely aim the nozzle at the attacker.<n>This behaviour has been caught on camera for the first time.

The Rubber Bowl in Akron, Ohio, was built in 1939 and it served as the home for the University of Akron's football team for 68 years.<n>The stadium hosted acts like the Rolling Stones, Ringo Starr, Black Sabbath, Simon & Garfunkel, Alice Cooper, Bon Jovi, Van Halen, Metallica, Tom Petty, Bob Dylan, The Grateful Dead and Aretha Franklin.<n>The stadium was closed in 2009 when the Zips moved into InfoCision Stadium and has been basically unused for five years.

Jason Matthews, 40, left his Saab 93 in a side street before the race.<n>He finished the race after five hours 11 minutes of running but could not remember where he had parked it.<n>Spent hours searching for the car before enlisting the help of a taxi.<n>Good Samaritan Adam Coppin, 32, decided to join the search for the car.<n>He found it safe and sound in an office car park in Salford Quays.

The pups were apparently discovered in a discarded shoe box on Tuesday afternoon and taken to the Humane Society for immediate treatment.<n>A note on the cardboard container, left on a woman's car, indicated they were born last Friday and their mother had died.<n>In a bid to save their lives, vets decided to put the young dogs with a surrogate cat.<n>Kit the tabby had recently nursed her own kittens, she was able to feed the puppies with her own milk.

The cute calf had been taking a stroll through the bush with his mother.<n>When the pair came across a dirt track road, the adult strolled on ahead.<n>But when the baby elephant rushed to catch her up he appeared to get his leg caught in the grass.<n>The clumsy little one stumbled as he stepped down onto the path.<n>He eventually fell over and landed - trunk first - down in the mud.

Hector Morejon was shot by a police officer in Long Beach, California.<n>According to his mother, Lucia Morejon, was at home when she heard the shots.<n>She went to an alley near her home to see what happened and then realized it was her son in the ambulance.<n>'When he saw her, he propped himself partially up and cried to her, 'Mommy, Mommy, please come, please come!''her attorney's statement said.

The 25-year-old has pleaded not guilty to shooting Odin Lloyd five times.<n>Lloyd was dating the fiancee's sister and was found dead in 2013.<n>Prosecutors presented hundreds of pieces of evidence since testimony began on January 29.<n>Hernandez's legal team are expected to wrap up quickly next week.

Chancellor said Labour had 'form' on jacking up income tax and National Insurance.<n>He said: 'Ed Miliband and Ed Balls have done it all before – and they would do it all again'<n>David Cameron said voters would pay a 'heavy price' for a Labour government.<n>He condemned Labour’s plans to abolish the married couples tax allowance.

Boobesh Palani, 26, passed away at Wellington Hospital with his friends by his side.<n>He was rescued from shark infested waters at Burdan's Gate, Eastbourne, about 10.30pm on Monday by two teenage girls.<n>Police released images of Mr Palani lying in his hospital bed in the hopes an appeal to the public would help identify the man.<n>Mr Palani, a 26-year-old student from India, was known to a New Zealander travelling in Sri Lanka who saw his photo online and told the police of his name.

International Red Cross has been negotiating for a week to deliver life-saving supplies to Yemen.<n>But it has not yet been able to gain entry after 11 days of air strikes against Iran-backed Houthi rebels.<n>UN last week said 500 people had been killed in two weeks of fighting in the Middle Eastern country.<n>Hopes of getting aid into the country by tomorrow are fading as they seek clearance from Arab states waging air strikes.

Marina Lyons, 80, took her dog Rosie to the PDSA PetAid Hospital in Hull.<n>The Lhasa Apso had surgery to remove her spleen due to a suspected tumour.<n>When she returned home she noticed bruising on Rosie's back.<n>Vet told her it was from the operation and that Rosie was fine to go home.<n>Mrs Lyons took Rosie to a vet for a second opinion, and was 'horrified'<n>She had to have treatment to remove dead skin from the burn.<n>Rosie is expected to have a skin graft next week.

Shinto Kanamara Matsuri started as a small tradition but has grown into a popular a tourist attraction.<n>Festivalgoers parade through the streets with three giant phalluses, while spectators lick or snack on sausages or vegetables shaped as male and female genitalia.<n>Participants pray to a god who is said to help with fertility, child birth and protection from sexually transmitted infections.

Pension reforms have been met with confusion by customers as young as 23 trying to cash in their retirement savings.<n>Over-55s have been able to withdraw all or part of their pension pots.<n>Previously they had to buy a regular pension income for life, known as an annuity.<n>But many are unaware of age restrictions or tax implications.

Sudheer Khamitkar, 42, shot his 38-year-old wife Smita Haval Khamitkar, and their sons Arnav Khamitkar, 10 and Arush Khamitkar, 6, in separate rooms at their Tulsa home.<n>The bodies were found on Wednesday as officers conducted a welfare check requested by the mother's employer.<n>Police are still searching for a motive and are interviewing the father's current and former employers to learn if he was having personal troubles.

Prime Minister visited a primary school near Bolton to unveil policy.<n>He was trying to help Lucy Howarth, 6, with a story about 'Prince Ronald'<n>As he read the story the youngster pulled a series of funny faces.<n>Mr Cameron was trying to unveil Tory plan to force poor pupils to resit tests.<n>Children who do not get good results in Sats tests will have to take new test.

Britain's biggest banks racked up £39billion bill in just three years.<n>'Remediation costs' wiped out 61% of their profits between 2011 and 2014.<n>Bill driven by payment protection insurance scandal and foreign exchange fines.<n>Total charge for wrongdoing last year was only 8% less than the previous year.

The Camerons were filmed at home for an ITV profile due to be shown.<n>They gathered around the breakfast table (white marble and costing £750)<n>Mr Cameron was teased for appearing to confuse Disney film Frozen for a book.

The image was created by superimposing a blurry picture of Monroe over a picture of Albert Einstein drawn in fine lines.<n>At normal viewing distance, healthy eyes should be able to pick up the fine lines on Einstein's face.<n>But if you move closer or farther away from the screen, the brain ignores Monroe's image altogether.

The bone was found in a cave in northwestern Slovenia in 1995.<n>It was thought to be the oldest musical instrument in Europe.<n>But new analysis shows it is simply a bone chewed by a hyena.<n>Several'instruments' attributed to Neanderthals are simply chew toys.
Police in Brazil busted gang's lair and laid down dog who rolled over.<n>The picture has since gone viral in the country.<n>Police recovered cocaine, marijuana and weighing scales from the scene.

Up to half of women suffer from Pelvic organ prolapse, or POP.<n>But many are offered just one solution: a hysterectomy.<n>Now, a leading gynaecologist has claimed thousands may be undergoing the drastic operation needlessly.

Researchers from London and Edinburgh have developed a computer.<n>It can collate meteorological information and produce forecasts.<n>It uses a process known as 'natural language generation' (NLG)<n>This could be used in humanoid robots on our TV screens.<n>Prototype system will be tested by generating local weather reports on the BBC's website.

Jennifer Drew, 31, spends an hour a day searching for deals and coupons.<n>She has accumulated so many products that they fill room of her house.<n>English teacher estimates she saves £70 each week on food using coupons.<n>Once managed to buy a week's worth of food for 29p - and gave it away.

Michelle Mone is selling Glasgow townhouse in order to buy ex-husband out.<n>She bought property off-plan in upmarket Park Circus area after 2011 split.<n>She paid £780,700 for duplex and had extensive works done before moving in.<n>It now boasts magnificent reception hall and stairway and is worth £1m.<n>It is understood she will move back into five-bedroom mansion in Lanarkshire.<n>Ms Mone, who also has £2m flat in Mayfair, shared decision to move on Twitter.

Protesters mounted Admiralty Arch and called for others to join them.<n>Banners read'respect existence or expect resistance' and 'better squat than let homes rot'<n>The arch was sold in 2012 after a Spanish developer paid £60 million for it.

Audrey Dimitrew, 16, of Virginia accepted a spot on the under-16 Chantilly Juniors club in November.<n>She was told by coaches she did not have the skills to compete with her team.<n>Audrey was benched the first two tournaments and told she would not play much for the rest of the season.<n>She was then offered a transfer to another club but the league said no.<n>Her family filed a lawsuit against the league seeking to let her transfer clubs.

The self-proclaimed kidnapper behind the Gone Girl abduction of Denise Huskins in California says he will turn himself in if his co-conspirators are given immunity.<n>This comes one day after the kidnappers demanded an apology from the police for calling the entire incident a hoax.<n>The kidnappers wrote that they may be the 'direct agent of harm' but that the police had 'every opportunity to stop it'<n>This comes as the police have said that the kidnapping was an 'orchestrated event'

Prime Minister David Cameron topped polls of the two-hour debate.<n>32% of 7.4m viewers hailed Cameron as'most impressive' on economy.<n>But pollsters refuse to predict who will win on May 7.<n>They say it will be Ed Miliband or Cameron who takes top job after votes are cast.

Samantha Giufre, 19, suffered multiple fractures to her skull and face, along with bleeding on her brain on September 7, 2014.<n>She was dragged along the street behind a car in Casula, south-west of Sydney.<n>One man has been charged in relation to the violent incident, but police are searching for others they believe were involved.<n>Ms Giufre said she has been left with permanent disabilities after the attack.
Gen Nakatani told MPs there has been no alien breach of Japanese airspace.<n>He said no government studies into extra-terrestrials were under way.

Danel Hall Jr, 10, shot in the stomach by stray bullet intended for dog.<n>The boy was rushed to hospital where he underwent emergency surgery.<n>Unknown gunman had been attempting to shoot the dog, police said.<n>Neighbour of Danel's dog denied accusations he was the one shooting.

50 years after the futuristic puppet show launched, ITV is bringing it back.<n> jerky puppets have been replaced by computer-generated figures.<n>In a nod to 21st-century political correctness, there are also more women.<n>Lady Penelope and her faithful chauffeur Aloysius Parker have been given slight tweaks for 2015.

The five-second rule is not as sure-fire as many snackers would surely like it to be.<n>Experts have largely dismissed the almost magical powers surrounding the rule.<n>They say what type of food and where you drop it does come into play.<n>Wet foods are cut fruit, cold meats, ham, salami, dairy products, and cooked rice or pasta.

James Schoenfeld, 63, was granted parole on the 20th time it considered the possibility of releasing him.<n>He was one of three kidnappers who hijacked a school bus in Chowchilla, California, in 1976 and kidnapped 26 children and the driver.<n>They then buried the children alive in a trailer stocked with food and water.<n>Schoenfeld and his co-conspirators were inspired by the 1971 Clint Eastwood film Dirty Harry in which the antagonist kidnaps a school bus of children in exchange for ransom.

NBC sketch show parodied CNN's daytime news coverage on Sunday.<n>Show turned into series of let-downs when it emerged there was no footage.<n>But ingenious producers managed to cover up with abysmal animations.<n>SNL writers joked that CNN's animations look like they belong in 1985.<n>Also imagined network providing imagery for coverage of Indiana's law.

Jon Huxley hopes to cash in on the Fifty Shades of Grey effect.<n>He wants to attract guests from the gay and swinging communities.<n>Mr Huxley said he has decided to appeal to the swinging community.

Banksy is believed to have ventured into Gaza earlier this year.<n>He left behind four murals, including one depicting Niobe cowering in rubble.<n>The painting, titled 'Bomb Damage,' was drawn on a metal door.<n>Rabie Dardouna said he has been tricked into selling the door for £100.<n>But he is now demanding the decorated door is returned.

Luke Shambrook, 11, has been missing from a campsite in Victoria for four days.<n>Police are still hopeful that they will find the missing boy.<n>He was last seen leaving Candlebark Campground at 9.30am on Good Friday.<n>He has limited speech and his family says he is probably confused and may not even be aware he is lost.<n>Police have seen a boy matching Luke's description walking near the Devils River on Sunday.

Geraldine Alcorn, 29, of Pittsburgh, allegedly encrypted her phone number on the girl's math homework and exchanged thousands of text messages with her.<n>She also allegedly talked of adopting and running away with the girl before Alcorn resigned last month.<n>Alcorn is not believed to have sexual feelings for the girl but allegedly told police of a 'deep love' she has for her.

Dark.Cyanide, 18, climbs up some of New York's tallest buildings without ropes or harnesses in search of the perfect shot.<n>He says the tallest building he has ever scaled had 72 storeys, and the city is 'huge' and constantly changing.<n>Teen, who goes by the name of Dark.Cyanide, says he likes photographing the city because it is constantly changing.

Genes for Good is a Facebook app designed to survey the health of millions of social network users.<n>Users can also send in spit samples to tie their survey results to their genes.<n>It is available for free from Facebook's store but only currently open to people aged over 18 with a valid mailing address in the US.<n>Researchers don't have any plans to extend it outside of the US at the moment, but this may change depending on how successful the scheme is.

Summer Michelle Hansen, 32, of California entered a guilty plea in February to 16 felony counts related to sex acts with her five male students.<n>The mother of three was sentenced on Friday to three years in state prison and must also register as a sex offender for life.<n>Parents of the victims were upset that Hansen's plea agreement was approved, which was made directly to Riverside County Superior Court Judge Becky Dugan.<n>If she had been convicted at trial, Hansen would have faced 13 years in prison.

The lunar eclipse began at 10.58pm (AEDT) on Saturday night.<n>It ended at 11.03pm.<n>Sydneysiders missed out due to wet and cloudy weather.<n>The event was predicted to be one of the shortest lunar eclipses of the century.<n>Adelaide, Melbourne and Perth also had a spectacular view.

Louis Jordan, 37, went missing on January 23 after setting out to fish off the coast of North Carolina.<n>He was found on Thursday by a German-flagged ship 200 miles off the coast after his boat's mast had fallen off.<n>He was taken to a hospital in Norfolk, Virginia, where he was treated for a broken collarbone and dehydration.<n>He said he survived his ordeal by drinking rain water and eating raw fish and flour fried in oil.

Tutti Rouge's Jessica features removable cookies.<n>This allows extra cleavage and volume to be added.<n>The £38 bra is a 28D right through to a 38HH.<n>Ashley James, who starred in Made In Chelsea, models the collection.

Chloe the wombat is now one-year-old and lives at Taronga Zoo in Sydney.<n>She has found herself a new friend at the zoo - a prickly echidna.<n>The joey was found in her pouch still alive after her mother was killed by a car earlier this year.<n>Chloe follows her zoo keeper around when she isn't napping.

ABC is planning a pilot episode of a new Muppets show, with Big Bang Theory creator Bill Prady in charge.<n>Characters including Miss Piggy, Fozzie Bear and Gonzo will all return.<n>But Miss Piggy has not yet agreed to join in - as she is in a relationship with Kermit the Frog.

Marylin Stoneman entrusted with financial affairs of vulnerable victim.<n>The 64-year-old began withdrawing up to £200 a day to fund her gambling.<n>She admitted stealing £22,650 from the elderly victim but was ordered to pay back just £1,350 - which was all that remained of the stolen funds.<n>The victim said he felt angry and betrayed by Stoneman and said he 'can't trust anyone'
Kennel Club says seemingly harmless foods can be killers.<n>56,000 dogs treated for poisoning between 2010 and 2014.<n>Of those, 470 dogs died, according to the charity and vets.

Match of the Day presenter launched scathing attack on Ukip leader.<n>He said Farage was'reluctant to offer a political view' during TV debate.<n>Mr Farage came under fire for his controversial comments on HIV treatment.<n>Former Manchester United defender Rio Ferdinand also criticised Ukip leader.
Mass brawl broke out Friday night at Resorts World Casino in Queens, New York.<n>Four hundred people reportedly turned on one another.<n>Ambulances were seen outside tending to the wounded.

Bowe Bergdahl was found to have been 'going over to the other side with a deliberate plan,' according to a former military intelligence officer.<n>Lt. Col. Anthony Shaffer said on Fox News' The O'Reilly Factor on Monday night that Bowe Bergdahl 'had Afghan contacts and he was actually trying to offer himself up with the Taliban'<n>The former military intelligence officer said he had been told the information by two senior sources who knew about a 2009 Naval Criminal Investigative Service investigation into Bergdahl's activities.<n>The investigation reportedly included a forensic review of Bergdahl's computer which showed his

European Commission has been investigating Google for five years.<n>Could fine firm 10% of annual revenues if it is found to have been behaving unfairly.<n>Shopping, comparison and travel companies among those contacted.<n>Decision to file charges would kick start EU's most prominent antitrust suit since its ten year-long campaign against Microsoft Corp.<n>Firm was forced to pay out more than £1billion in fines in 2012.

The First Lady appeared on The Tonight Show on Thursday night.<n>She and Fallon performed a follow-up routine to one they did in 2013.<n>It was to celebrate the fifth anniversary of her Lets Move! program.<n>The anti-childhood obesity campaign she launched in 2010.

Lizzie Borden was acquitted of murdering her father and stepmother in 1892.<n>The trial inspired the schoolyard rhyme: 'Lizzie Borden took an ax and gave her mother 40 whacks'<n>The Lizzie Borden Chronicles, a Lifetime miniseries, premiered on Sunday.<n>The grave has been defaced with black and green paint in the past.

The identity of 4,726 people who illegally uploaded the film will be revealed.<n>This includes their names, IP addresses and residential addresses.<n>The identity of the account holders will be kept private by the film makers.<n>The Federal Court did not signify any limit to the amount of damages that the copyright holder of the film could claim directly from each individual.<n>i iiNet has warned its customers to expect speculative invoicing - an 'intimidating' letter demanding significant sums of up to US$7000 for an alleged infringement.

Total lunar eclipse will transform the moon on Saturday night.<n>It will be visible in the skies of North America, Asia and Australia.<n>According to one US pastor, the event was predicted in the Bible.<n>It suggests a world-changing event will take place, as predicted in the Bible.<n>But Nasa says the change in hue is entirely harmless.

French health chiefs say UK is responsible for sharp rise in binge-drinking.<n>They say it is being copied by increasing numbers of youths on the continent.<n>But critics say it's double standards where children are encouraged to drink wine at the table from a relatively early age.

Lib Dem leader Nick Clegg said he wanted to tackle 'dangerous levels of air pollution' which cut life expectancy by up to eight months.<n>Normal petrol and diesel engines would be barred under the proposal.<n>To win the money, firms would have to create a family car which breaks into the top five in UK sales and have ultra low emissions.

NASUWT union says signs are needed as staff are subjected to abuse.<n>Research shows that majority of teachers today are verbally abused.<n>Some 82 per cent of 3,500 NASUWT members polled were verbally abused by pupils in the last 12 months.

The eggs were created by 14 of the UK's top cake artists for Cake Masters Magazine.<n>Each of the treats is entirely edible and made using a range of decorating techniques and sugar work.<n>The eggs were on display at Cake International in London last weekend.

Maxwell Morton, 16, of Jeannette, Pennsylvania, was ordered to stand trial for first-degree murder.<n>He is accused of shooting Ryan Mangan, 16, in the face with a loaded gun he was holding February 4.<n>Morton then sent a selfie of Mangan's body to a friend via Snapchat.<n>His lawyer says Morton and Mangan were friends and the shooting was an accident.

Mike Heatlie, 42, launched attack on Fiona McCartney outside Edinburgh nightclub.<n>He asked her for a cigarette but she and a friend did not have one.<n>Heatlie then lashed out and punched Ms McCartney, 43, leaving her unconscious.<n>She is now facing a £7,000 dental bill and says she is too frightened to leave home.<n>Heatlie pleaded guilty at Edinburgh Sheriff Court to the attack.<n>He is due to appear again on April 22 for sentencing.
Casey, 26, unveils summer range with Honeyz.com.<n>Full of boho frocks and paisley prints.<n>Says she's designed accessories to complement her outfits.

Kecil the orangutan was moved from his birthplace in Ohio to a zoo in Wisconsin after his natural mother failed to bond with him.<n>He was then given to a second surrogate, but both rejected him.<n>Keepers at Brookfield Zoo, Chicago, were worried he might not find love with his new mother Maggie, 53.<n>But the pair have now formed an inseparable bond and Maggie has proved her parenting prowess once again.

Amedy Coulibaly stormed into the Hyper Cacher Jewish store in Paris.<n>He killed four customers and took others captive before being shot dead.<n>Images broadcast from the store 'lacked the most basic precautions'<n>Lawyer for survivors said French media endangered their lives.

Blanca Cousins, 15, fell to her death from a 19th-floor window in Hong Kong.<n>She had locked herself in a bathroom after a row with her father, Nick.<n>Mr Cousins, 57, was arrested on suspicion of causing her death.<n>He was released on bail yesterday pending police inquiries.<n>It is alleged Mr Cousins and his Filipino partner Grace Garcia Cousins, 53, never registered the births of Blanca and her 14-year-old sister.<n>Mr Cousins was also questioned over claims that his Filipino partner, Grace Garcia Cousins, 53, had overstayed her visa by 20 years.

Diwalinen Vankar, 58, went to the bank of the Vishwamitri River to wash clothes.<n>But a mugger crocodile grabbed her daughter Kanta's leg and dragged her into river.<n>Vankar tried to pull her daughter free but the crocodile's jaws were too strong.<n>She then attacked the 13ft long creature with a wooden washing paddle.<n>It took her 10 minutes to free her daughter from the crocodile's jaws.

Syed Viqaruddin asked police van to stop in deserted area on way to court.<n>But when bus stopped another prisoner 'tried to snatch rifle from policeman'<n>Police opened fire when they 'did not listen', killing five men and one officer.<n>Viqaruddin had been in custody since 2010 accused of attacking police.<n>He had also reportedly planned to assassinate then-Gujurat chief minister Narendra Modi.

Andy Murray beat Tomas Berdych 6-4, 6-4 in the semi-final of the Miami Open.<n>The Scot will face Novak Djokovic in the final on Sunday.<n>Murray will be world No 3 when the new rankings come out next week.

Beatrize Carrion-Moore is accused of kicking a deputy in the groin several times.<n>She is also accused of offering him oral sex in exchange for a get out of jail free card.<n>Bar manager said she had a similar problem with Carrion-Moore a week before.<n>Carrion-Moore was charged with trespassing after warning, resisting arrest with violence and battery on a law enforcement officer.

Ben Morgan broke his leg playing for Gloucester against Saracens in January.<n>The No 8 is hopeful of featuring for England at the World Cup.<n>England kick off their tournament against Australia in mid-September.

Raymond Frolander, 18, sexually abused 11-year-old boy at Florida home last July.<n>Child's father then walked in and beat Frolander unconscious, police said.<n>After Frolander's arrest, police released his mugshot, which showed him in a bloodied state.<n>Now, Frolander has been sentenced to 25 years in prison by judge.<n>Pleaded no contest to lewd and lascivious molestation of victim younger than 12.

Monarch first attended Maundy Day service in Westminster Abbey in 1935.<n>She was eight years old and 18 years away from her coronation.<n>The Queen was all smiles as she arrived at Sheffield Cathedral.<n>She was joined by the Duke of Edinburgh for the traditional ceremony.

Bluebird was spotted flying out of a lamp post near Copenhagen, Denmark.<n>The little blue tit usually takes between one to two weeks to build a nest.<n>She collects moss, grass and straw to line her nest which she then lines with feathers, fur or wool so it is ready for laying.

Plane was due to land at Manchester airport at 7pm on Monday night.<n>But it was diverted to Birmingham airport due to high winds.<n>Passengers were forced to stay in seats as they waited for plane to be refuelled.<n>Police were called to Birmingham airport after reports of passengers 'kicking off'<n>Officers returned two hours later after reports that angry passengers were trying to disembark.<n>Some claimed they had been waiting in Manchester airport for up to 24 hours.<n>But some claimed they were left waiting hours for transport and did not arrive until 7am.

Haley Mulholland became suspicious husband Kevin was having an affair.<n>She took a lie detector test and discovered he had cheated on her.<n>The mother-of-eight now monitors her husband's movements.<n>She also sniffs him to see if she can smell another woman's perfume.<n>The couple still share a house in Bristol but Mr Mulholland has to sleep on the sofa.

Dr Milton Wainwright claims he has evidence of alien life in Earth's stratosphere.<n>He says the organisms test positive for DNA and have masses six times bigger than the size limit of a particle that can be elevated from Earth to this height.<n>The organisms are contained in a microscopic metal globe designed by an intelligent species to'seed' alien life on Earth, he claims.<n>His views have been widely dismissed by the scientific community.

11 per cent of computer scientists enrolled in higher education haven't had sex.<n>Meanwhile, nine per cent of physicists declared that they were still virgins.<n>Students enrolled in Arts subjects like history and English were more likely to have lost their virginity before or at university.<n>22 per cent of students didn't lose their virginity until they were 18 years old.
Jose Alberto, 58, was found dead next to a scarecrow in Argentina.<n>Prosecutors believe he died while having sex with the scarecrow.<n>The scarecrow was dressed in a wig and lipstick.

Steven Abberley hurled tirade of abuse at politicians during Commons session.<n>He then threw glass balls from public gallery but they missed MPs.<n>Abberley excused himself before shouting 'you are all just liars' at PM and rest of chamber during televised debate.<n>He told police officers he had daubed words 'the enemy within' on wall.<n>Abberley, 28, was given a 12-month community order and told to pay £170.

Tong Shao, 20, a chemical engineering student at Iowa State University, went missing in September 2014.<n>After a three week search, police found her body stuffed in the trunk of her Toyota Camry in Iowa City.<n>Her boyfriend, Xiangnan Li, 23, was listed as a person of interest in the case and is believed to have been the last person to see her alive.<n>He is now wanted for murder.

A new hashtag has popped up on Instagram exposing 'awful' things parents do to their children.<n>#a**holeparent has almost 4000 posts from parents all over world.<n>Most of the photos show children crying, followed by an explanation of exactly what their parent has done to upset them so.

Gilmore Gasoline Filling Station has been restored to its former glory.<n>The coffee giant bought the garage in Los Angeles last year.<n>It was a backdrop for was listed as a Los Angeles cultural monument in 1992.

Two girls, Zoe and Eleanor, made a video of themselves deeming classmates as 'hot' or 'not'<n>The clip has been viewed more than 120 times in just a few days.<n>Half of three to six-year-olds say they worry about being fat.<n>A fifth of girls under 11 have even tried diets.

The inscriptions were found in Naours, a two-hour drive north of Paris.<n>They were left for posterity by young men facing the horror of trench warfare a few dozen miles away at the Somme.<n>One inscription found in a rough-hewn passage 100 feet underground read: 'James Cockburn 8th Durham L.I.'

Police say the 26-year-old woman, who has not been named, delivered a baby in a bathroom stall at Ceva Logistics in Redford, Michigan.<n>Staff at Ceva Logistics heard moaning coming from a bathroom stall at around 10am Tuesday and found blood on the floor.<n>The woman returned to her seat in a cubicle and continued her work.<n>Police found a newborn's lifeless body stuffed inside her bag and hidden beneath her desk.<n>The mother and baby were taken to a local hospital, where the child was pronounced dead.<n>It remains unknown at this time whether the baby was born alive

The Hospital of Dolls, or Ospedale delle Bambole as it is known in Rome, was built by the Squatriti family 60 years ago.<n>Descendants Federico Squatriti, 52, and his 82-year-old mother Gelsomina continue the family tradition.<n>They carefully restore hundreds of toys - mending the porcelain heads and re-attaching the limbs.

Scar Booth, available from the Apple iTunes store for 79p, offers a gallery of 77 wounds - purportedly real ones - superimposes onto selfies.<n>Anti-violence charities have hit back at the disturbing app for 'trivialising' abuse and brutality.

Man, 45, had suffered from condition called arteriovenous malformation for 20 years.<n>It is a tangle of blood vessels in the brain which diverts blood from the arteries to the veins, bypassing normal brain tissue.<n>Caused facial deformities and problems with his vision and speech.<n>Was examined at Mayo Clinic and Harvard Medical School, which had considered him to be inoperable.<n>But Vall d'Hebron hospital in Barcelona ruled surgery was his only treatment.<n>Took a team of 45 doctors, surgeons, nurses and anaesthesiologists 27 hours to complete.
Little Foot was unearthed in the 1990s in South Africa.<n>Lived at the same time as Lucy, the most famous.<n>fossil, known as Lucy.

The cable company complained to the Better Business Bureau's National Advertising Division (NAD) that the ads featured a number of false claims.<n>The watchdog has ruled that several of the campaign's claims couldn't be substantiated.<n>The ads all ended with Lowe saying: 'Don't be like this me — Get rid of cable and upgrade to DirecTV'

Neanderthals may have succumbed to diseases carried to Europe by modern humans.<n>They would have been infected by tuberculosis, whooping cough and encephalitis.<n>But they may have also been unable to fight off pathogens like Heliocbacter pylori.<n>This bacteria causes stomach ulcers and is thought to have spread to Europe.<n>Neanderthals may have been unable to fight off these new diseases, but may have helped to improve our immunity to other diseases.

Clare Hines was diagnosed with a brain tumour after suffering epileptic seizures.<n>She was told to have surgery to remove the tumour or have her baby terminated.<n>One week before the operation she found out she was pregnant.<n>She went against doctors' warnings to keep the baby and give birth.<n>Seven weeks after Noah was born she and her husband flew back to the UK to undergo surgery.

Pete Evans has been dropped as the celebrity ambassador for popular salad chain 'Sumo Salad'<n>The food chain are strongly denying that this move is related to Evans' recent paleo controversies.<n>Sumo Salad maintains that their decision was not due to Evans' paleo controversies.<n>This comes at the same time that Evans announced that his disputed baby cookbook 'Bubba Yum Yum: The Paleo Way' will become a self-published digital book.

DNA-like fragments may have come with 'instructions' that guided their growth into complex life forms 4 billion years ago.<n>Scientists believe these fragments used their innate self-evolving abilities to grow into repeated chemical chains.<n>The study is based on a discovery in the 1980s that RNA can chemically alter its own structure.

Poundland has been forced to pull decorative plastic Easter Eggs.<n>The eggs look like Cadbury Mini Eggs and could choke children.<n>Trading Standards officials raised the alarm over the Chinese made decorations.<n>The eggs have now been withdrawn nationwide ahead of the Easter break.

Rebecca Eldemire, 21, was shot in the face twice by her boyfriend, 27-year-old Larry Tipton, as she slept in her locked bedroom.<n> Tipton lay down face up beside her and fatally shot himself.<n>Eldemire called 911 the night before her murder to ask for protection from Tipton.<n>Police left after she told them she was okay to handle him on her own.

James Ramirez, 37, called to hospital after wife Gillian Nelson, 34, gave birth.<n>She died after complications arose with birth of son Wesley in Bromley.<n>Mr Ramirez said he found his wife 'delirious and spaced out' following birth.<n>He stayed in room with her until she was taken to theatre at 6.30am.<n>Southwark Coroner's Court heard there had been blood loss and nine people in room.

ISIS' leadership is dominated by former members of Saddam Hussein's army.<n>Almost all of the group's regional commanders were in the dictator's army.<n>Ex-generals and intelligence officers now play leading roles in ISIS.<n>The group also have extensive contacts with oil smugglers from the 1990s.

Hue Go can be controlled wirelessly from any iOS or Android device.<n>Users can also sync it to TV, films and video games to create atmosphere.<n>It uses rechargeable Li-ion battery and offers three hours of continuous light.

Scott Suggs, 28, and Brandy Kangas, 36, arrested after anonymous tip.<n>Police received tip about welfare of 17-month-old son and two daughters.<n>Officers found them locked in'sparsely furnished' room at home in Virginia.<n>Rooms were stained with urine and feces and had homemade gate.<n>Couple pleaded guilty to felony child neglect but escaped jail sentence.<n>They were handed six-year suspended sentences, 10 years of probation.<n>Children, who lack social skills, are fearful of closed doors, say police.

Chiropractor Gertrude Pitkanen would take babies from their mother's arms seconds after they were born and hand them to adoptive parents.<n>The transactions formed the basis of a lucrative, illicit market that started in Butte, Montana, in 1920s.<n>Most of the children who were victims of this horrific crime have now aged, have families and have forged their own lives.<n>They have joined together to form Gertie's Babies who have been using DNA to trace their biological families and search for their estranged siblings.

Huw Davies, 34, has been searching for permanent employment for 13 years.<n> BSc (hons) degree and three A-levels have not even been called for interview.<n>Mr Davies, from Merthyr Tydfil, has also spent time teaching in South Africa, Kuwait and the desert kingdom of Saudi Arabia.<n>He has been forced to dig deep into his savings to pay the rent and bills.<n>Mr Davies has registered with job agencies in Cardiff and Swansea.
Sarah's mother told her she should try facial exercises to avoid wrinkles.<n>She said they worked and she's been doing them for 30 years.<n>Sarah's face was transformed after the exercises.

Faith and Hope Howie were dubbed the miracle twins when they were born on May 8 last year.<n>They died 19 days after they were born due to an extremely rare condition known as disrosopus.<n>Their parents, Simon Howie and Renee Young, laid them to rest at Pinegrove Memorial Park in Sydney's west.<n>Family members have visited the grave every week to leave mementos and flowers for Faith and Hope.<n>But when Mr Howie and Ms Young arrived on Thursday they found the site completely bare.

The 3,118 unidentified applicants were accepted as freshmen by the university in Gainesville for the fall.<n>But after reading acceptance notices, they realized they would need to spend their entire first year taking online classes.<n>Classes are part of a new program - Pathway to Campus Enrollment (PaCE) - which started in 2015 and aims to accommodate a higher number of students.<n>The students who were accepted had not applied to the program, which will likely help expand enrollment in the university's new $15million online undergraduate program.

ISIS militants infiltrated Palestinian refugee camp in Damascus today.<n>The group entered the Yarmouk camp as Jordan closed its border crossing.<n>The militants reportedly entered the camp from the nearby Hajar Aswad neighborhood.<n>ISIS could use the camp as a base to threaten the heart of the Syrian capital.

Sabrina Broadbent Tetzner, 32, left the FLDS sect eight years ago to escape an abusive husband.<n>She was granted full custody of her four children ages 8-13 last Thursday.<n>But when she tried to pick them up from the Colorado City, Utah compound, she was met by 600 members of the cult.

Clare Goldwin admits she will sometimes fork out for Boden's brightly printed clothes for her daughter.<n>But she doesn't want to be labelled a Boden 'yummy mummy'<n>The company has experienced more challenging times but is now back on track.

The family consisted of a black mother and a white father.<n>They were enjoying a day out in Portland, Maine when they were targeted.<n>The man was in a car filled with a group of young white men when he yelled the racial slur at them and sped off.<n>News anchor Jackie Ward witnessed the incident and shared her story.<n>She said she was shocked and reminded her to be kinder to each other.

The University of Houston said in a statement Tuesday that it was paying McConaughey speaking fees totaling $135,000 plus travel expenses.<n>Meanwhile, the actor is donating his fees to his jk livin Foundation, which the actor started to provide tools to help high school students lead active lives and make healthy choices for the future.

Grey hair trend on trend with silver hair lovers posting images online.<n>Hashtag #grannyhair has been trending on Instagram for a week.<n>Jean Paul Gaultier showed silver haired models on his Paris catwalk.

Bikram Choudhury, 69, has been accused of sexually assaulting six women.<n>He has strongly denied the allegations in an interview with CNN.<n>He said he would never need to assault anyone because 'women loves me'<n>He pioneered Bikram yoga, in which followers practice 26 yoga moves in 105F temperatures for 90 minutes.

Shows such as Poldark, Vikings, Outlander and Game of Thrones are dressing up their key actors in breeches, leather and chain metal.<n>The dimly-lit period setting only serves to accentuate the mean and moody looks.<n>Aidan Turner is leading the way as Captain Ross Poldark in the BBC's much talked-about Sunday night offering.

Kalman Kallai travelled from Borden, Ontario to Comox, British Columbia.<n>He took the chair for free from online advertisement site Kijiji.<n>Traveller mimics planes, waves at cows and even dances in the video.

A boy came home Tuesday afternoon to find his parents dead in their Pennsylvania home.<n>Police say the couple, Chris and Nicole Peppelman, were hacked with a chainsaw.<n>Authorities have not yet identified the couple, but family and friends say they were Chris and Nicole Peppelman, owners of an excavating company.<n>Friends and neighbors say the couple had 'had some troubles'

Campaign group Let Toys Be Toys posted images online.<n>Show a wide divide between aspirations for girls and boys.<n>Males offered doctor's uniforms while girls given babygros with 'I hate my thighs' slogan.

Investigation was launched into the circumstances surrounding Go Set a Watchman.<n>State officials had been suspicious that the 88-year-old author was being manipulated.<n>She lives in a nursing home and is reportedly deaf and blind.<n>Go Set a Watchman is a sequel to To Kill a Mockingbird.<n>Lee had said for decades she wanted to publish only her own novel.

Last week Demelza Poldark was barely showing – but she is now pregnant.<n>Within ten minutes of tomorrow night’s episode, fans will see Aidan Turner’s Ross Poldark gaze lovingly at his new baby daughter.<n>Women across the country have voiced their longing to settle down with the brooding Cornish gentleman.

Mick Schumacher made his pre-season test debut in Formula 4 on Wednesday.<n>The 16-year-old was pictured accidentally driving through gravel.<n>He crashed at speeds of up to 100mph in Brandenburg, eastern Germany last month.<n>Michael Schumacher, who is still recovering from a ski accident, won F1 championship seven times.

All Saints Church in Wolverhampton re-scheduled the service for tomorrow.<n>Vulnerable women will now be able to attend their regular Thursday sessions.<n>Sessions were cancelled on Christmas Day and New Year's Day.<n>Church is the only place where prostitutes can receive support, vicar says.

French President Francois Hollande said some militants were killed.<n>But there was no word on the fate of two men abducted at the same time.<n>Rijke was abducted by extremists in November 2011 from a hostel in Timbuktu.

A six-alarm fire broke out at General Electric's Appliance Park in Louisville, Kentucky, at 7am Friday.<n>No injuries have been reported, though the building caught on fire contained plastics.<n>The cause of the fire is not yet known.<n>Workers at the facility, which makes a range of appliances, were evacuated and sent home.

Mike Whitehead was standing against Labour's Alan Johnson in Hull.<n>He claimed he was joining Ukip after becoming 'disgusted' at Tories.<n>But the Tories today revealed he had already been sacked from party.

BBC1 bosses have ordered a second series of period drama Poldark.<n>Aidan Turner will return as Captain Ross Poldark for the new series.<n>The show has helped BBC1 deliver its strongest start to a year for a decade.
Candice, 26, is the muse for Max Factor's latest campaign.<n>The South African beauty looks stunning in a platinum blonde wig and crimson pout.

Woolworths says customers will purchase enough prawns to stretch from Sydney to Cairns.<n>Sales of seafood will increase by 80 per cent over Easter holiday.<n>Drink experts reveal which tipple is best to wash it down.

Lindsey Walker booked into the Rex Hotel in Whitley Bay, North Tyneside.<n>She and her partner stayed in the reception because the next door room was full.<n>The family were invited to a late-night party with escorts in the room next door.<n>Their room included wallpaper hanging in shreds, holes in the walls and broken tiles.<n>Ms Walker said the hotel had refused a full refund and accused staff of making up their story.

A series of billboards posted around New York City are seeking to encourage residents to consider a move east to Detroit.<n>The ads are the brainchild of a trio of people opening a new Thai restaurant in the Motor City.<n>They want exposure for their new business but also to promote Detroit as an alternative for New Yorkers who feel that city has got too expensive for them.<n>There are four billboards — two in Manhattan and two in Bushwick in Brooklyn — which went up about a month ago.

Jennifer Houle, 22, was last seen on surveillance footage walking alone on a bridge in Minneapolis early on Friday morning.<n>Her body was found in the river on Wednesday and the medical examiner's office has confirmed it was her.<n>She died of freshwater drowning, the medical examiner's office said.<n>Police have not said whether she fell or jumped from the bridge.

Antonio Valente, from Dallas, Texas, learned his photos were being used on a fake Facebook profile after a woman he met online told him about it.<n>The profile used photos of him and his daughter but the name 'Johnson Michael Lynn' and claimed he was from Ohio.<n>Marianne Heinrich, who lives in Vienna, wired $4,000 to the man when he said he needed money to pay taxes in England.<n>She soon realized she had been conned and used an image from the profile to search Google photos and discovered they had been stolen from Valente.<n>The profile has since been removed.

Amber Rachdi, 24, from Troutdale, Oregon, weighed 46st (657lb) at her heaviest.<n>She was warned by doctors she risked dying by the age of 30.<n>But she has since lost 20st in a year and is happier than ever.

Kim Callaghan piled on the pounds after the birth of her two children.<n>She reached a worrying 20st 3lb and was afraid she looked like a man.<n>Kim joined Slimming World and lost a stone in her first three weeks.<n>She now weighs a slim 9st 10lb and has dropped ten dress sizes.

Scientists found a new virus that infects bacteria living deep beneath the ocean floor.<n>They believe the virus actively causes one of its own genes to mutate.<n>This allows the bacteria to adapt to the harshest environments on Earth.<n>Findings have raised the prospect that life may still be clinging on deep underground on planets such as Mars.

Donny Ray Williams was sentenced to five years probation and a suspended jail sentence on Friday.<n>He admitted in December to raping two women in 2010 and 2013.<n>One of the women wrote a letter asking for'some jail time' because Williams 'risked my life' with Ambien.<n>The other woman was not present for the sentencing, during which a judge said Williams 'was a victim of an independent crime and has serious medical issues'

Cleopatra bathed in donkey-milk baths.<n>Necropti used clay and crushed beetles as blushers.<n>Gresini used vinegar to get Bleach blonde hair.<n> Geishas used rice flour to whiten their faces.<n>Mary Queen of Scots washed herself in white wine.

Piper Kulk, 8, died in hospital on Sunday morning.<n>Her brother, William, 9, died later that evening.<n>The siblings were travelling in a car with their mother and grandmother.<n>Their car aqua-planed and ended up on the other side of the road.<n>The other passengers suffered serious injuries.<n>Warwick Milham arrived at the scene after hearing his wife and daughter were involved in the crash.<n>The national Easter long weekend death toll now stands at 16.

Bobbi Ann House, 39, and Zackerie House, 27, accused of writing at least $13,500 in bad checks.<n>The purchases started in western Oregon in early March, then moved through Oregon coastal towns and into Colorado and Oklahoma.<n>The two are now believed to be camping.<n>Investigators believe they are driving a blue 2005 Cadillac Escalade.<n>The car, which they took possession of March 14, has been listed as stolen.

The Labor Department said Friday that the economy generated a disappointing 126,000 net new jobs in March.<n>The figure was half of what was expected and the worst month since December 2013.<n>The unemployment rate remained at 5.5 percent.<n>Economists say the disappointing data could make the Federal Reserve less likely to start raising interest rates from record lows in June.

Ally Lees, of Alfie Bird's restaurant in Birmingham, created the dish.<n>It is three-foot in circumference and contains 150 eggs and 945g of protein.<n>The chef says it would take more than five people to eat it.

Greece is due to repay £330million loan to International Monetary Fund.<n>Reports it will introduce parallel drachma currency to pay domestic bills.<n>But deputy finance minister says Greece will make payment on time.
The wide leg trouser is a new trend for SS15.<n>Louise and Emma have given their top tips on how to pull it off.<n>The pair say that it can be done with denim, cropped or printed pants.

One of the exclusive cul-de-sac's Art Deco houses has gone on sale for £4million.<n>The street is known locally as Millionaires' Row and has 11 houses.<n>The homes were built between 1909 and 1910 by developer Michael Paget Baxter.<n>With celebrities occupying six of the properties, that leaves just five other houses.

Danny Lambo, 37, has bought his girlfriend a £10,000 chocolate bath.<n>The bespoke gift is now available to buy.<n>It contains 205 litres of melted chocolate and 1.3 million calories.<n>Bath runs on chocolate milk, not water.<n>Danny, who is worth £25m, says he is known as 'Lambo' because of his passion for Lamborghinis.

Bob Katter released a statement on his party's website accusing the Queensland Government of assuming Billy Gordon would quit.<n>Mr Katter, federal MP for Kennedy, is of Lebanese descent.<n>He said he sympathised with Mr Gordon's position after he was accused of domestic violence and withholding his criminal history.<n>The statement has sparked criticism on social media, with users questioning his terminology.<n>Mr Katter has since defended the statement, saying he used the term black puppet 'because I'm dark and I come from Cloncurry'

Three former managers of the AIDS Healthcare Foundation filed a suit last week alleging the company paid employees and patients kickbacks.<n>The lawsuit alleges kickbacks started in 2010 at the company's California headquarters and spread to programs in Florida and several other locations.<n>The Los Angeles-based company cares for more than 400,000 patients in 36 countries.<n>The company's president said in a statement the company has 'done nothing wrong'

Denise Chiffon Berry, 44, and her son were driving in Hawthorne, California on Wednesday when they passed by three men in a Cadillac.<n>The mother and son allegedly laughed at the scene, but someone in the car didn't find it funny when he made eye contact with the 12-year-old boy.<n>Ms Berry feared the men were following her so she pulled over to tell a police officer parked there monitoring traffic.<n>The officer told Ms Berry to park in front of him and he would investigate the Cadillac.<n>It was as Ms Berry was parking, that the Cadillac pulled up and the man in the

Just 28 of 700,000 babies born in the UK in 2013 were given the name.<n>That compares to 235 Garys being born in 1996, when the name was 147th most popular in Britain.<n>In 2013, it didn't even make the top 1,000.<n>Some blame shamed pop star Gary Glitter for the name's decline.

James Bowen has sold more than four million copies of A Street Cat Named Bob.<n>The former Big Issue salesman has also churned out multiple spin offs.<n>But the Daily Mail can reveal that he continued to have his rent paid for.<n>Since 2012 the taxpayer has forked out £15,500 for Bowen to live in Haringey.

Detective Patrick Cherry was filmed ranting at an Uber driver in New York.<n>The cop was trying to park his car but the driver honked his horn.<n>Detective Cherry launched a tirade at the driver, mocking his accent.<n>He also questioned the driver's command of the English language.<n>The NYPD's Internal Affairs Bureau is investigating the incident.

Svetlana Lokhova, 33, was driven to a breakdown by sexual harassment.<n>Tribunal found she was falsely accused of being a cocaine user.<n>Banker said she was hired by Sberbank only because of her looks.<n>She was awarded £3.14million for lost earnings, £44,000 for hurt feelings and £15,000 in aggravated damages.

Colombian-born Manuela Arbelaez's mind was clearly somewhere else when she removed the wrong price tag during Thursday's show.<n>The model and host Drew Carey both gasped after she revealed the true price of the Hyundai Sonata SE before contestant Andrea had finished guessing.<n>As the presenters realized what had happened, Andrea shouted out 'I win!'<n>Arbelaez later tweeted about her embarrassment at the heart-warming TV moment.

California Gov. Jerry Brown ordered state officials to impose mandatory water restrictions for the first time in history on Wednesday.<n>Brown said Wednesday that he had signed an executive order requiring the State Water Resources Control Board to implement measures to cut water usage by 25 percent.<n>The order will require campuses, golf courses, cemeteries and other large landscapes to significantly cut water use.<n>Brown's order will require local governments to replace 50 million square feet of lawns throughout the state with drought-tolerant landscaping.<n>The move will affect residents, businesses, farmers and other users.

19 children at a Brisbane primary school have contracted whooping cough.<n>Health expert has slammed parents for not taking vaccination seriously.<n>He said it was part of a growing trend that many people had not immunised.<n>There are about 1200 cases of whooping cough every year in the Metro North area.

Scientists at the University of Connecticut say we know how far away the source of a sound is by listening to the echoes it produces.<n>In a study they found that the reverberation of sound helps us locate the distance of, for example, a car passing round a bend or a person nearby.<n>The research was conducted by scientists from the University of Connecticut and published in the Journal of Neuroscience.

Siobhan O'Dell, 17, from North Carolina, was rejected from Duke University.<n>But she sent a reply to the admissions office, rejecting their offer.<n>She said: 'Despite Duke's outstanding success in rejecting previous applicants, you simply did not meet my qualifications'<n>Image of her email has gone viral, attracting nearly 100,000 likes.

Christopher Bridger, 25, from Stevenage, Hertfordshire, jailed for 12 years.<n>He attacked three women after separate drinking sessions and pretended he was gay.<n>The HCPC Conduct and Competence Committee today removed him from register.<n>They described his crimes as 'a serious breach of trust'

Tina Wardle was stabbed to death by her son Mark in 2011.<n>The pair had been married for less than two years.<n>Kris Wardle said Tina was a devoted mother to their two children.<n>He said Mark was quiet and only interested in computer games.

Linsey 'Jade' Berardi starred in season 12 of Bad Girls Club: Chicago.<n>She was nicknamed the 'Brooklyn Brat' on the Oxygen network show.<n>She exited the shower after a fight with Jada Cacchilli in the second episode.<n>Her family has asked for donations to be sent to animal shelters.

Townsville nurse Maria Sevilla and her son, Tyrone, will be forced out of the country within 28 days.<n>Ms Sevilla had her visa application rejected because her son's autism would be a 'burden on the Australian health system'<n>Immigration Department said the health requirements were an objective assessment to determine whether the care would likely result in significant costs.<n>Ms Sevilla said she did not want to be a burden, and was working in Australia in an effort to give her son the best possible 'future'

Brittany Lyn Hilbert of Orlando, Florida was charged with domestic violence battery and battery of a person over 65-years-old.<n>The alleged victim told police that he was dating Hilbert for 18 months, adding that they've been living together for two months.<n>According to public arrest records, Hilbert was taken into custody on March 25 of last year for possession of cannabis and resisting an officer.<n>On April 5 of last year, Hilbert was charged with illegal possession of Xanax and weed.

Kim Jong-un has ordered the recreation of the famous 'pleasure troupe'<n>The group of hand-picked teenagers was established by Kim Il-sung.<n>They are usually taken to Pyongyang at the age of 13 to work as servants.<n>The troupe was dismantled after Kim Jong-il's death in 2011.<n>But now that the mourning period has ended Kim Jong-un has ordered the re-establishment of the tradition.

Prime Minister takes advice from martial arts pupils ahead of TV debate.<n>Tory leader asks: 'Shall I get Nigel Farage and put him on the floor, is that OK?'<n>Tory leader later backtracked, insisting there will be 'no bodily contact'<n>Mr Cameron and Ukip leader Mr Farage will take part in two-hour showdown.

Jaye and Matthew Cox delivered their daughter Annabelle at just 20 weeks in Canberra Hospital on May 5 last year.<n> Annabelle was born weighing just 290 grams and had developed a serious form of Spina Bifida.<n>The couple contacted Angel Gowns to help create a dress from Jaye's wedding gown to bury Annabelle in.

The book was published in the 1930s by two self-styled intelligence experts.<n>It posed fiendishly difficult brain-teasers for members of the public.<n>Here, we offer you a selection of its tortuous tests.

The Stonehenge Village complex on Manhattan's Upper West Side has a gym that is only open to full-rent tenants.<n>Full-rent tenants pay $3,500-a-month for a one-bedroom apartment.<n>The gym was built to lure full-price-paying tenants, who pay as much as $10,000-a-month.<n>The Human Rights Commission said in a notice filed Thursday that there's enough evidence of age discrimination to merit a hearing on the complex's fitness room.
Transvestite entertainer Matsuko Deluxe's android clone debuts.<n>The 'Matsukoroid' doppelganger made its on-screen debut on Saturday.<n>It is the first android to host its own show in Japan.

Images from Europe's Sentinel-1a satellite show the damage caused by the Nepal earthquake this week.<n>Interferogram shows Mount Everest shrank by one inch due to the land that was shaken in the natural disaster.<n>An area 75 miles (120km) by 30 miles (50km) has lifted up 3.2ft (1 metre) from the ground around the capital, Kathmandu.

Turkish prosecutor Mehmet Selim Kiraz died after far-left group took him hostage.<n>They uploaded photographs of him with gun pointed at his head to social media.<n>Turkey had imposed blocks on Twitter, Facebook and YouTube yesterday.<n>But the social media sites agreed to remove the images after a court order.

Labour leader Ed Miliband said it was 'not good enough' for workers to know how many hours they would be working from one week to the next.<n>He said a Labour government would give workers the right to demand a'regular contract' after three months.<n>Mr Miliband said there had been an 'epidemic' of zero-hours contracts under the Coalition.

Tomas Driukas, 25, was arrested after paramedics were called to his home.<n>His five-month-old daughter was taken to hospital with breathing difficulties.<n>Infant, believed to be a twin, died later that day after suffering'several injuries'<n>Detectives arrested the baby's parents on suspicion of murder yesterday.<n>The 22-year-old mother, identified by neighbours as Renata Braskyte, was today released on bail pending further enquiries.

The Grand National takes place on Saturday at Aintree.<n>Around £500 million is being staked globally by punters.<n>Four out of ten Britons betting on the Grand National make their choice purely down to the name of the horse.<n>70 per cent of women admit relying on pot luck.

Jennifer Barnett worked at Archway School in Stroud, Gloucestershire.<n>Mother-of-four, 60, left teaching to have her fourth child in 1997.<n>She was diagnosed with mesothelioma 14 months later and died last September.<n>Coroner recorded verdict of death as a result of industrial disease.<n>Her family are now taking legal action against Gloucestershire County Council.

The 30-year-old singer has no idea where she got the tick bite that infected her.<n>She was bedridden for five months.<n>'I felt like I couldn't breathe, I couldn't talk and I couldn't move,' she said.
Sue Townsend died aged 68 in April last year.<n>She achieved huge success with The Secret Diary of Adrian Mole.<n>The book was followed by seven sequels, selling in total 8million copies.

Canterbury forwards James Graham and David Klemmer could face point penalties or a temporary game ban for their arguments with a referee.<n>The pair argued with referee Gerard Sutton after he awarded South Sydney a late penalty at the ANZ Stadium in Sydney on Friday night.<n>Canterbury's Klemmer was sin-binned after crowding in on Sutton alongside Graham and yelling 'You're off your f****ing face,' at the lead referee.<n> NRL head of football Todd Greenberg revealed that the match review committee would 'look very closely at' their behaviour.

Oscar Hbinette shredded through the snow on the Tolbachik volcano on the Kamchatka Peninsula in Russia.<n>His friend Fredrik Schenholm photographed his exploits on the 12,000 foot tall volcano.<n>The adventure photographer looked on in amazement as Oscar flew down the icy slopes, while lava bubbled furiously behind him.

New data shows that the average cost of property in London falls below that of Salcombe, Devon.<n>The seaside town boasts a skyrocketing average property price: £671,759.<n>In the pricey west London neighbourhood of Notting Hill, property prices average £1,629,495.

Zulkifli bin Hir was killed in a raid in the Philippines in January.<n>The FBI said on Wednesday that bin Hir was dead.<n>The reward offered by the US State Department for his arrest was $5million.<n>He was also affiliated with the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters.

The Daxing Internet Addiction Treatment Centre has so far welcomed 6,000 mostly young, mostly male patients.<n>Founder Tao Ran is a doctor and colonel in the People’s Liberation Army regarded as China’s leading expert in wangyin.<n>He says 90 per cent of his patients are clinically depressed from a lack of normal social interaction.

Mike Hand was diagnosed with a tumour on his spinal cord in January.<n>The 39-year-old has been left wheelchair bound and needs adaptations.<n>He and his wife Kate tried to claim for financial support to adapt their home.<n>But they were told they couldn't claim because they didn't claim benefits.<n>They say they are now having to rely on their salary to support their family.
