Gertrude Weaver, 116, of Camden, Arkansas, became the world's oldest person on Wednesday.<n>The death of 117-year-old Misao Okawa in Japan has made her the oldest person in the world.<n>Weaver would like to meet the president at her birthday party because she has voted for him twice.<n>She exercises in her wheelchair three times a week and eats three meals a day at the facility's dining room.

Kady Marsh was breastfeeding her seven-week-old baby Isla at a Sydney hotel.<n>Hotel management asked her to move from the lounge area because it was an area restricted to over 18s.<n>She was told to use the disabled toilet in the hotel's main bar.<n>The hotel says it's ludicrous to suggest that they wouldn't welcome breastfeeding women.

The first iPad was revealed by Steve Jobs in California in April 2010.<n>At the time, experts struggled to see how it would prove popular.<n>Within the first 24 hours of Apple’s launch the company sold 300,000 units.<n>Five years on, 225 million units have been sold - and opinion is now split.<n>Some experts have predicted that the iPad’s days are numbered.

Richard Hutchinson, 40, attacked his former friend in a betting shop.<n>He punched the victim in the jaw so hard he was left with a fractured skull.<n>The pair had a 'long-running' feud after Hutchinson borrowed £300 from victim.<n>Hutchinson said he lashed out because he wanted to'sort it out' with victim.<n>He has been jailed for two years after being found guilty of assault.

The woolly mammoth died out between 20,000 and 25,000 years ago.<n>It was previously thought that the giant creatures died out from post-Ice Age climate change and being hunted to extinction by early man.<n>But new evidence from Russia suggests they died out from osteoporosis.<n>The deficiency in calcium resulted in mammoths breaking their limbs and spines, and left them unable to walk.

The boy, who has not been named, died from his injuries at Grant Elementary School in Dumont, New Jersey on March 6.<n>He had been playing chess with another student and became upset that his opponent didn't say 'checkmate' after beating him.<n>A lunch aide overheard him saying to the other student: 'Do you want me to do something drastic?'<n>He then climbed through a window and jumped through it 'headfirst, unforced, unassisted and of his own accord', according to a new police report.<n>The boy had previously told his opponent on four separate occasions that he would

A Sydney woman was diagnosed with leukemia seven months into her pregnancy.<n>Doctors told her she could give birth via a caesarean section and undergo chemotherapy but both would require her to have a blood transfusion.<n>The 28-year-old refused both options due to her religious beliefs.<n>She had a stillbirth and died 13 days after her diagnosis.

Gang targeted couple in their 80s after they were tipped off that money was kept in their home in Welwyn Garden City, Hertfordshire.<n> Verna Fisher, then 81, awoke in total darkness in the early hours of 31 July last year.<n>Four men wearing white balaclavas and gloves confronted her.<n>Mrs Fisher was thrown off the bed while the burglars took her purse containing £250 and a mobile phone from under her pillow.<n>Brothers Jermaine Kellman, 29, Marvin Sempler, 30, Clinton Jackson, 25, and Darren Lewis, 34, were each handed 13-year jail terms.

Hutchinson said Wednesday that he won't sign a religious freedom bill that his state's legislature sent to him on Tuesday.<n>He is sending it back to lawmakers, he told reporters, for amendments that will bring it more in line with the 1993 federal Religious Freedom Restoration Act.<n>'My son Seth, signed the petition asking me, Dad, the governor, to veto this bill,' Hutchinson said.<n>Seth told Daily Mail Online that 'I love and respect my father very much, but sometimes we have political disagreements, just as many families do'<n>'I had communicated with him my opposition to the bill

Robert Durst, 71, appeared in court in New Orleans on gun possession charges.<n>His lawyers were expected to challenge the case against him after he was arrested on March 14 in a hotel room in the city.<n>However, no witnesses showed up and the judge became angry.<n>Two FBI agents and a state trooper could face contempt of court charges.<n> Durst is awaiting extradition to California where he will be tried for murder.

Bath Abbey could have the world's first natural underfloor heating system.<n>Ancient crypts below the church will be tapped into Roman drain.<n>850,000 litres of spring water empties into the ground every day.<n>Engineers hope to divert the warm water through a network of underground pipes to provide a world-first natural underfloor heating system.

The historic steam yacht was designed in 1900 and built the following year.<n>It first undertook war service as HMAS Sleuth in World War I before it sank years later in 1981 near Hobart after hitting an object underwater.<n>The boat then came under the ownership of miner Pat Burke, which became the infamous playground for his close friends at the time.<n>It is now on the market after being restored and being relocated from Sydney to Melbourne.

Czech President Milos Zeman has banned the U.S. Ambassador from Prague Castle.<n>Ambassador Andrew Schapiro criticised Zeman over his plans to attend a Russian World War II parade in Moscow.<n>Zeman said Schapiro is no longer welcome in the Prague Castle.<n>Prime Minister Bohuslav Sobotka said Zeman's reaction was 'not adequate'

Houses with a Waitrose near you cost an average of £38,831 more.<n>But homes with Aldi or Lidl on your doorstep cost thousands less.<n>Study by Lloyds Bank investigated average house prices in areas with chain supermarkets nearby.

Crew on Sea Shepherd vessel Bob Barker rescued those on board the vessel named Thunder on Monday.<n>The crew said the captain of the sunken ship was seen cheering and applauding when his vessel was completely submerged.<n>Sea Shepherd claims Thunder is one of six vessels known to illegally fish vulnerable toothfish in the Southern Ocean.<n>The organisation's ships collected and delivered to authorities over 72 kilometres of illegal gillnet.

Bette Carrouze, 78, from Brighton, lives in sheltered accommodation.<n>She regularly leaves her home in the early hours of the morning for nights out.<n>The single mother of two is a big fan of Brighton's gay scene.<n>Says she is making up for all the hard work put in to raising her daughters.

Scooter's Coffee, Omaha, was hacked on Sunday by an 'unknown third party'<n>Staff were locked out of the page for 24 hours before it was restored.<n>The company said the images were similar to those posted after Delta Air Lines was hacked and Crayola's page was hacked in January.

A mini solid chocolate egg contains 550 kilojules.<n>A 67-kilogram woman would need to walk for 40 minutes before guilt.<n>A man weighing in at around 80 kilograms could achieve the same in 30 minutes.<n>A medium chocolate bunny contains around 4400 kilojules that won’t burn themselves off.

Archbishop of Canterbury yesterday called on Christians to use non-violent means of resistance when faced with persecution by extremists.<n>Most Reverend Justin Welby said the dead were'martyrs'<n> Delivering his Easter sermon in Canterbury Cathedral, he said: 'Christians must resist without violence the persecution they suffer'<n>Dr Welby told congregation that killing of Christians over past year had been a 'wicked' development.

Rekha Nagvanshi, 30, urinated in her in-laws' cups of tea everyday for a year.<n>She was angry that her husband's parents had stopped her doing chores.<n>She wanted revenge by urinating in their cups of tea for more than a year.<n>But her mother-in-law found her squatting over the teapot and called the police.

Adam Rushton, 37, took advantage of his post as a beat officer.<n>Staffordshire Police officer found guilty of five counts of misconduct.<n>He was also convicted of breaching data protection rules.<n>Staffordshire Police Deputy Chief Constable Nick Baker called Rushton 'a disgrace to the police service'

Photographer John Massung was flying over Sebastian Inlet on Thursday when he saw hundreds of sharks.<n>Massung posted the pictures to Facebook, where users theorized that the swarm was a mix of Blacktip and Spinner sharks.

Florists in Jeff Davis County, Georgia, say they would deny service to gay people regardless of the legality.<n>Conservative Christian shop owners have come under fire after Indiana's Religious Freedom Restoration Act.<n> Memories Pizza in Walkerton, Indiana, plans to reopen soon after being bombarded with calls following the attention.
The 28-year-old actress recently starred in a West End production of Speed The Plow.<n>She recently posed in a series of racy ensembles by Moschino and Agent Provacateur.

Lianne Hindle died three hours after giving birth at North Manchester General.<n>Her death came just months after three babies and one mother died there.<n>Her partner Chris Barnes is calling for action to prevent further tragedies.<n>He said: 'Something has to be done. It isn't right. Maternity units are supposed to be the safest places to have babies'

11 former Atlanta Public Schools educators convicted of racketeering.<n>They were accused of altering answers on standardized tests.<n>Teachers and principals were given up to $5,000 in bonuses for their work.<n>A 12th defendant was acquitted by the jury this week.<n>The 11 will be sentenced on April 8 and could face up to 20 years in prison.

China's navy rescued 225 foreign nationals and almost 600 Chinese citizens.<n>They included 176 people from Pakistan with the remainder from Ethiopia.<n>Russia also sent in planes brought back 300 subjects, including diplomatic staff.<n>It came the same day Saudi-led war planes made a weapons drop in Aden.

U.S. Attorney for the District of Columbia told House Speaker John Boehner that Lerner could wrap herself in the Fifth Amendment.<n>Lerner insisted on her innocence in a 2013 hearing, but then refused to answer questions from Congress when they subpoenaed her again in March 2014.<n>The Obama administration now says that's perfectly legal.<n>Lerner has been accused of playing political favorites by targeting conservative nonprofit groups with extra scrutiny and intrusive red-lining.

Joni Mitchell has suffered from Morgellons disease for most of her life, and has recently been hospitalized after she was found unconscious at her home.<n>The disease is incredibly rare, and affects predominantly middle-aged white women.<n>Symptoms are similar to those of mental illness, with the sensation of crawling and bugs and parasites.<n>Most experts claim the disease is just a mental illness, and that the colorful fibers on the skin are not consistent with animal or vegetable fibers.

Jamyra Gallmon, 21, has been charged with first-degree murder while armed for allegedly killing David Messerschmitt, 30, on February 9.<n>The woman admitted to police that she set up the lawyer using a masculine-sounding email address and went to the upscale Donovan hotel with the intention of robbing him.<n>An affidavit revealed that Messerschmitt had posted a Craigslist ad soliciting responses from other men, using 'dcguy456'

Tracy Stratton said daughter Tianni suffered physical attacks and verbal abuse.<n>She claims seven-year-old has been left so traumatised she is afraid to leave house.<n>Ms Stratton is now claiming damages from The Royal Borough of Greenwich Council.

Samantha Cameron reveals doctor has told her she is not having another baby.<n>Prime Minister and his wife have been on the election campaign trail.<n>Mr Cameron was heard quipping 'Come on darling, maybe another one?'<n>The couple have also admitted to relaxing in Downing Street with Gogglebox.

Blaze in Holborn, central London, started in a tunnel carrying electrical cables.<n>More than 2,000 office workers evacuated and roads closed as firefighters battle to put out the fire.<n>More than 1,000 buildings remain without power as power engineers try to restore supplies.

Joseph McEnroe, 36, from Carnation, Washington, was convicted of slaying four adults and two children - aged three and five - in 2007.<n>The same 12 people that found him guilty of the murders are now determining whether he will be executed or sentenced to life in prison without parole.<n>McEnroe told the court on Thursday he 'thought' he had to kill Wayne Anderson, 60, and Judy Anderson, 61; their son and daughter-in-law Scott and Erica Anderson, both 32; and the younger couple’s children Olivia, 5, and Nathan, 3.

Baby, known as Mary, was born at Alder Hey Children's Hospital in 2013.<n>She was kept in hospital for three months and had no contact with her parents.<n>Mary died six months later with traces of cocaine and painkillers in her stomach.<n>Parents were reported to social services five times over a four-year period.<n>Review has called for lessons to be learned after baby's death.

Shauna McGlasson, 25, from Workington, was 17st and battled depression.<n>She got stuck in the turnstiles of a ride at Blackpool Pleasure Beach.<n>The incident inspired her to change her diet and exercise routine.<n>She dropped seven stone and now weighs in at just over 10 stone.

Dr Margaret-Ann and David Rous were on an Easter getaway to Tiree.<n>The couple were using Mr Rous's light aircraft to make a surprise visit.<n>But the plane crashed into a hillside and both died in the crash.<n>The couple, who had only been married for a year, were described as 'wonderful'

The world's highest-grossing fast food chain announced Wednesday that it will raise starting wages at its restaurants to a dollar over minimum wage.<n>The increase will be instituted starting July 1.<n>McDonald's expects the average wage to be more than $10 an hour by the end of 2016, up from the current rate of $9 an hour.<n>The company owns about 10 percent of the more than 14,300 McDonald's restaurants across the country.

Woods announced on Friday that he will be playing at the Masters in Augusta next week.<n>The 39-year-old played an 18-hole practice round on Tuesday at Augusta National.<n>Woods last competed at the Farmers Insurance Open on February 5.<n>He walked off the course after 11 holes because of tightness in his lower back.<n>Woods will have gone nine weeks without competition when he hits his opening tee shot on Thursday at the Masters.

Jen Psaki, the president's former State Department spokeswoman, is expecting a baby girl in July.<n>Katie Fallon, his current legislative director, is expecting twin boys in May.<n>Both are working under the president's 'family-friendly' policies.

Jessica Ainscough died in late February after a seven-year battle with cancer.<n>She spurned chemotherapy and radiation, choosing to fight the cancer with a controversial treatment known as Gerson Therapy.<n>Her partner Tallon Pamenter has revealed she began a course of targeted radiation in her final weeks.<n>'This was a risky and tough decision, but Jess bravely embraced this last chance option,' he said.

Ed Miliband admitted he had a weep during Pride, a British film.<n>The film centres on the 1984 miners' strike and Margaret Thatcher.<n>Miliband said he and his wife watched the film and he 'blubbed'<n>Labour leader received a lot of praise for his admission.

Man seen leaning out door of van as it hurtled down outside lane of M40.<n>He appeared to be laughing and making jokes with colleagues inside the van.<n>His boss has revealed he was only doing it because he needed fresh air.<n>KJ Rail director Dave Roy said the man, the driver and their colleagues in the van would be hauled before a disciplinary hearing tomorrow.

Donald Trelford had his son Ben when he was 73 and his daughter Poppy when he was 76.<n>Peter Stringfellow, 74, and Bella are expecting a sibling for their 20-month-old daughter.<n>Donald believes he is the oldest living British new father.

'It is a man-made disaster,' she told Glenn Beck during a Monday radio interview.<n>'California is a classic case of liberals being willing to sacrifice other people’s lives and livelihoods at the altar of their ideology,' she said.<n>The 'tragedy' of California, Fiorina, said, is it 'has suffered from droughts for millennia,' and still 'liberal environmentalists have prevented the building of a single new reservoir'<n>Fiorina, a one-time California Senate candidate, is a possible Republican presidential candidate in 2016.

Australia's biggest venomous snake has produced a huge lethal'shot'<n>The four-metre long king cobra Raja has delivered almost 500 milligrams of deadly toxin for veteran handler Billy Collett.<n>The toxin is enough to fill a shot glass and 40 times the amount of venom of a brown snake.<n>Mr Collett has been milking snakes for almost 10 years but has never extracted venom from a king cobra.
Gigi, 19, says Kendall, 19, has a good sense of when to stand up and when to back off.<n>She also believes Karlie Kloss is comfortable with her social media persona.

Tara McIntyre was left virtually wheelchair-bound after the crash in Essex.<n>Ben Hagon's high-powered Mercedes sports car crashed into her at up to 75mph.<n>She had just popped out to the shops when she was hit by the drunk-driver.<n>Judge branded Hagon's driving'madness' and accused him of changing Miss McIntyre's life for the worse for ever.

Beyoncé, Kelly Rowland and Michelle Williams performed at the Stellar Gospel Awards in Las Vegas last weekend.<n>The group received a rousing standing ovation from the 9,000-plus crowd, but they weren't introduced as Destiny's child - they were introduced by their individual names.<n>Daily Mail Online has learned exclusively that the threesome want to do another ten-year reunion tour and intend to cut a reunion album.<n>But they won't use the group name for that either.<n>Beyoncé's father and former manager Mathew Knowles owns one-fourth of the group as well.

The fashion duo have teamed up with New York-based company 'Print All Over Me'<n>The online company allows you to digitally design your own prints.<n>The photo shoot was their own idea.<n>The girls admit they don't like to model and hide behind wigs and sunnies.

Governor Jerry Brown observed the survey on Wednesday, which found the lowest water level in the Sierra Nevada snowpack since 1950 when records began.<n>The fourth consecutive year of vanishing snow spells trouble as California depends on it to melt into rivers and replenish reservoirs.<n>As he stood in a brown meadow that's normally blanketed in snow, Gov. Brown ordered sweeping, unprecedented measures to save water in the state.

Brad Pitt personally backed the building of 104 homes in New Orleans.<n>The star vowed to help'make it right' for the city's displaced citizens.<n>But the homes started to rot after being built with defective wood.

The tiny fishing village of Jose Ignacio is a favourite with the rich and famous.<n>It is located on the coast of Uruguay, the second smallest country in South America.<n>The chic resort is known for its shabby chic cottages and sleek hotels.<n>Guests have included Rolling Stone Ronnie Wood and Shakira.

Graeme Oxby documented fans at events across Britain for his photo series.<n>The 50-year-old visited their homes to capture images for 'The Kings of England' series.<n>Collection is on tour until 2017 and a book of images has been set up on Kickstarter.

Motorist had been stuck behind HGV for several miles and tried to overtake.<n>He gambled on passing lorry at traffic lights but misjudged gap.<n>He lost control of the vehicle and swerved into a lamppost at 50mph.<n>Car ended on the opposite side of the road, with caravan still attached.<n>Driver was questioned by police after the dramatic incident on Tuesday.

Atif Saeed, 38, was in Lahore, Pakistan's safari park when he spotted the lion.<n>Armed only with a camera, the photographer crept up to the animal.<n>He managed to capture a few frames before retreating to safety.

Takako Konishi travelled from Tokyo to Minnesota to find the $1m in a suitcase.<n>She was found dead in a mini-skirt and high-heeled boots in the frozen wastes.<n>Allegedly went searching for the cash in the hit 1996 film Fargo.<n>But it turns out she was talking to a cop who was on her case.

Asia Siddiqui, 31, was arrested Thursday in Queens, NY for allegedly plotting a terrorist attack with former roommate Noelle Velentzas, 28.<n>She had previously published a poem in an Al Qaeda magazine, which was the precursor to Inspire.<n>The poem, titled 'Take Me to the Lands Where the Eyes are Cooled', details Siddiqui's aspiration to 'drop bombs' and 'taste the Truth through fists and slit throats'<n>Her friend Samir Khan, an American citizen, was killed in a 2011 drone strike in Yemen.<n>Khan published Siddiqui's poem in a publication which was the precursor to Inspire

Mensa is an elite society with 121,000 members worldwide.<n>To join, you must be in the top two per cent of the population.<n>This test is based on an IQ test, but it is not a proof of intelligence.<n>Take the quiz to see if you have the intelligence to join Mensa.

Students this year will likely spend of a third of their prom budgets on the elaborate new ritual of promposals, according to a survey by Visa.<n>The average American high schooler could spend over $300 just asking his or her date to the yearly dance.

Amanda Holden will host a new series on ITV highlighting plight of RSPCA centre in Birmingham.<n>She will appeal to members of the public to take in the animals featured in the show.<n>She has two pets - a Yorkshire terrier and a Siberian fluffball cat.

Konstantin Sivkov wrote a column for the Military-Industrial Courier.<n>He said that Russia needs new'megaweapons' to unleash chaos.<n>Sivkov says that Russia should develop nuclear weapons that can cause tsunamis and seismic activity at Yellowstone National Park.<n>He says that the new system would be an asymmetric threat against the US.

Simon Danczuk said it was 'unacceptable' people should be free to come home.<n>Comes after nine members of same family were arrested in Turkey.<n>They include Councillor Shakil Ahmed's son Waheed, his cousins, aunt and four children.

Researchers from OIST in Japan compared the distribution of fairy circles in the Namibian desert with that of human skin.<n>They found that the majority of skin cells and fairy circles both had six 'neighbours', and similar percentages of other neighbours.<n> Desert fairy circles are considered one of nature's greatest mysteries because it is now known how they form.

John Lewis is desperate to sell off its leftover Christmas stock.<n>The department store has slashed prices on almost 200 products.<n>It comes after the outlet reportedly spent £7million on its campaign.<n>Store is selling the stock just days before Easter, when families buy eggs.

Dublin-based airline has banned passengers from bringing booze on board.<n>It follows a handful of incidents involving unruly behaviour on board.<n>Passengers who are caught trying to sneak alcohol into the cabin risk being kicked off the flight.

Ashley Jennifer White, 30, and Paul Thomas, 32, charged with felony child abuse and neglect.<n>Their 5-year-old son, Noah Thomas, went missing March 22 as his mother slept with her infant daughter.<n>Noah's body was found in septic tank on White and Thomas' property March 26.

ISIS militants impose new law in Syrian stronghold of Raqqa.<n>Anyone caught with mobile phone or playing music on will be jailed.<n>Those who don't will be fined and kept in prison until they pass test.<n>Anyone caught smoking or turning up late for prayer will also be imprisoned.

The Bell 525 Relentless is due to make its maiden flight this year.<n>It has a luxurious 88-square-foot cabin and space to fit 20 passengers.<n>One early buyer calls it 'a marvel of modern technology'<n>The helicopter is aimed to be a limo in the sky for offshore oil and operations.

Tim McNaughton is believed to have shot dead his father Greg McNaughton.<n>The 24-year-old then tried to shoot a family friend before turning the rifle on himself.<n>Tim was issued with a ‘shooter’ firearm licence by the Northern Territory Police.<n>Posted a photo of the license on Facebook, writing: ‘Mwahahaha do the realize what they have just done [sic]’<n>Police are investigating the deaths as a murder-suicide.

Two trainee obstetricians have been removed from Fiona Stanley Hospital.<n>The $2 million hospital is in southwest Perth.<n>The concerns were revealed by unnamed sources.<n>The hospital went on 'baby bypass' when the maternity unit opened four months ago.<n>The hospital had to direct expectant mothers to other hospitals.<n>The hospital's medical service provider Serco failed to return sterilising equipment by an arranged date in February.<n>The company was fined $60,000 and was subject to Department of Health workers auditing its staff.<n>Reports that blood and bone fragments were found on some medical instruments.

Prince Harry took to the skies in a 250mph Spitfire on a training flight.<n>The 30-year-old royal is beginning a month-long attachment with the Australian Defence Force in Canberra tomorrow.<n>Bucks Palace released footage of the royal's flight ahead of his arrival.<n>The flight was staged to support the Royal Foundation’s Endeavour Fund.<n>Harry is leaving the Army in June and will be based in Australia.

Lane Smith died after hitting his head in a freak accident last July, leaving behind his pregnant girlfriend and their unborn son.<n>Kayli Henley was snapping pictures of the couple and their son Taos when she was asked to make their family complete.<n>She photoshopped a photo of Smith from the family into a ghostly image that shows him standing over his girlfriend and their son.<n>The image has been shared more than 25,000 times and has been liked more than 200,000 times on Facebook.

The unidentified man and woman were in their 50s and from Cleveland.<n>Blood was found in the cabin aboard the MS Ryndam.<n>The bodies were taken off the ship Thursday night by a team of FBI crime scene investigators.<n>Authorities will not say how the couple died.

Princess Beatrice, 26, was spotted out in East London last night.<n>She was partying at Shoreditch House with boyfriend Dave Clark, 31.<n>She looked glamorous in a knee-length black leather dress.<n>The dress is currently sold out.<n>FEMAIL have found great alternatives that are also available to buy online.

Young Princesses Elizabeth and Margaret were let loose 70 years ago.<n>They joined jubilant crowds in London celebrating end of WWII.<n>Now adventure has been re-created in a new film showing the sisters.<n>Among the most curious viewers is The Hon Margaret Rhodes, 89.<n>She was first cousin to the Queen and her best friend.<n>Mrs Rhodes says it was 'wonderful bedlam' and 'at its most euphoric'

Nicole Kidman has been slammed by an American union for her new ad campaign with Etihad Airways.<n>The Association of Professional Flight Attendants argues the sponsorship deal was at odds with Kidman's role as a United Nations Women's Goodwill Ambassador.<n>The union has waged a public campaign against Etihad and other United Arab Emirates airlines.<n>Kidman stars in Etihad's new 'Hollywood Glamour' global brand campaign.

Patients tried and failed to book almost 34 million GP appointments.<n>The 10 per cent who could not amounts to around 33.8 million unsuccessful attempts each year - or 81 per surgery each week.<n>The shambolic situation is responsible for as many as a quarter of A&E visits, researchers say.

The $2 billion Fiona Stanley Hospital in southwest Perth was found to have blood and bone fragments on some of its medical instruments.<n>The hospital was stripped of its medical service provider Serco after they failed to return sterilising equipment by an arranged date in February.<n>The company was fined $60,000 and was subject to Department of Health workers auditing its staff.<n>The hospital has been found of continuing to operate with poorly sanitised instruments.

Sofia Davila, 21, posted raunchy pictures and flirted with strangers online.<n>She suggested they meet up for sex and would then trick men into going to bed.<n>She would then spike their drinks and rob their homes after they fell unconscious.<n>Police caught her after she tried to trick them by saying she was an innocent bystander.<n>She is now awaiting trial after admitting tricking 15 men and robbing them.

Nicola Horlick, 54, raised six children while working in the City.<n>She feels a noticeable difference in her body between first and last child.<n>Advises her daughters to marry early and have babies while they are young.<n>Says juggling child-rearing with boardroom duties meant she had to breastfeed in the office.

Jennifer McGirr, 61, said the abuse started when her windows were smashed.<n>She said a man threw a brick at them in a 'premeditated' attack.<n>Ms McGirr described other hotels in Blackpool as 'grim' on show.<n>She said she has received intimidating phone calls since starring on show.

Jay Alvarrez and Alexis Rene share their travel snaps on Instagram and Jay's tumblr page.<n>Jay is a photographer who takes amazing shots of his girlfriend and their lifestyle around the world.<n>The couple live in California and enjoy surfing, skydiving and helicopter journeys.

Rick Yoes, 57, was jailed this weekend after he was issued a $1,700 fine for six code violations at his Grand Prairie, Texas home.<n>The electrician says he didn't know about the citations and turned himself in to avoid paying the fine.<n>Yoes has been cited for high grass over a foot long, overhanging tree limbs, a dilapidated wood fence, an inoperable vehicle and junk in the yard.

Sharon Freundel gave a speech at a Maryland Jewish school on March 22.<n>She did not address her husband's recent scandal but did allude to the scandal which shocked her community.<n>Her husband Bernard Freundel is set to be sentenced for 52 counts of misdemeanor voyeurism on May 15.

Ralph Body manned the front desk of the luxury 27 on 27th building in Long Island City, Queens until March 29.<n>The 41-year-old says he was fired for being too nice to his wealthy tenants.<n>Building management says Body broke the rules, but Body says he only did what was asked of him.

Lusitanian toadfish make five types of calls and males can even sing in choruses to attract mates, according to Portuguese scientists.<n>Males build nests under rocks during mating season, which runs from May to July and sing to attract female visitors.<n>They sing to attract females and to warn off rivals who may try to steal their nest.

Staffordshire-Boxer cross Leo was hunting for treats at his owner's home.<n>He knocked over a hob knob, turning the rings on and starting the fire.<n>Leo's owner and his daughter's boyfriend escaped unharmed.

Dr Omar Saadi Al-Atraqchi could be struck off after he admitted voyeurism.<n>The 42-year-old doctor cut a hole in a Lynx bottle and dried it out.<n>He then hid his iPhone inside the bottle and slid it under cubicles.<n>But he was caught out twice - once when a man noticed a glint of a camera.<n>The Iraqi GP pleaded guilty and was fined £500 at Highbury Corner Magistrates' Court.<n>He now faces a hearing to determine whether he will be struck off the medical register.

The search for a two-metre South American boa constrictor has been called off.<n>Snake catcher Tony Harrison warned that if the large-predatory boa has Inclusion Body Disease 'it can be unbelievably contagious'<n>He believes the snake will be found 'within a month' but there are fears if the boa is pregnant there could then be up to 30 live young on the loose.

Shrine at Dusseldorf airport reveals first photograph of Patrick Sondheimer.<n>Mr Sondheimer, 36, tried to break down cockpit door to stop pilot crashing plane.<n>He spent up to five minutes trying to smash his way in before dying.<n>Picture is alongside pictures of four other crew members killed in crash.<n>But shrine also includes picture of co-pilot Andreas Lubitz, who crashed plane.

Airstrikes targeted rebel-controlled army camps in Red Sea port city of Hodeida.<n>Also hit warehouses belonging to a dairy factory that produces dairy products.<n>Drawing return fire from anti-aircraft guns as Saudi-led campaign enters seventh day.

Bunkie King, 60, has revealed how her three-way relationship with Australian actor Jack Thompson and her sister worked.<n>Ms King entered into a relationship with Thompson, who was twice her age, while he was also involved with her sister Leona - nicknamed Le.<n>She has now written a book about the unconventional arrangement.

Former Bon Jovi guitarist Richie Sambora is a 'person of interest' in an investigation into criminal threats.<n>He allegedly threatened to 'dig a hole in the desert and bury her' during a heated phone argument with his former lover Nikki Lund.<n>The pair had an eight-year affair before going their separate ways last July.<n>Sambora is currently on vacation in Bora Bora with his ex-wife Heather Locklear and daughter Ava.

Pet obesity is at an all-time high with half of pets set to be overweight.<n>PDSA has warned that too many treats, the wrong type of food and lack of exercise are to blame for turning bunnies into giants.<n>Carots named as the worst culprits as they are very high in sugar.<n>Charity's annual Pet Fit Club puts overweight pets through six-month diet.

Arnold Quintero, 21, from San Antonio, Texas faces a string of charges.<n>Girl told police she was punched and forced to undress in front of her attacker.<n>He faces two charges of aggravated sexual assault of a child.<n>She also told police she was burned with a lighter and had sex with him.

Teachers say they are being forced to spy on children during sensitive discussions.<n>National Union of Teachers suggest Government strategies to tackle extremism and terrorism have instead'shut down debate' in schools.<n>Teachers say they now feel nervous discussing controversial issues.<n>Claim young people feel unable to express there views on certain subjects.
Park Inn by Radisson launches virtual travel service.<n>'E-scapes' allows customers to appear to be on a trip away.<n>Social media accounts updated to give the illusion they're on a trip.

Billy-Anne Huxham was found by police on Thursday night.<n>She was located after she made contact with a family member.<n>Her ex partner Carl Garry Chapman has been charged with a string of offences including assault, torture and deprivation of liberty.<n>The 32-year-old was out on bail at the time of the abduction where he used a firearm to subdue the victim.<n>Ms Huxham escaped her captor and fled to a local restaurant where she called her parents who then contacted police.

The changes come after soldiers complained about the current rules.<n>Rules that ban tattoos below the knee or elbow will also be lifted.<n>Troops will be able to have as many as five tattoos on their body.

Tory Dan Poulter lost two inches off his waist and lost 24 per cent of body fat.<n>Lib Dem Tom Brake and Labour's Gavin Shuker also put on weight.<n>Each was given strict orders to eat more healthily and exercise.

Rodney Todd and his two sons and five daughters then used a generator for power.<n>They were last seen alive on March 28.<n>Police say they were likely asleep when they died.<n>The children's mother says she is'numb'

Gibbons use soft whispers that are almost inaudible to the human ear.<n>Called 'hoos' they are produced at frequencies below the threshold of hearing for eagles and other birds of prey.<n>Scientists say the findings could help explain how humans evolved speech.

The Real Housewives Of New Jersey star lost his driver's license and was fined the maximum of $10,000.<n>He pleaded guilty in October to unlawful use of an ID and impersonation.<n>His guilty plea included an 18-month sentence.<n>That will run concurrent with his 41-month federal sentence for bankruptcy fraud and failing to file taxes.<n>The 42-year-old will serve 18-months in prison which will run concurrently to the 41-months he was sentenced to last year on separate charges for bankruptcy fraud.

Summer Robertson, 21, died while volunteering in one of South Africa's poorest townships.<n>The charity worker was overpowered by fierce currents off the coast.<n>Her parents have paid tribute to their 'bubbly tomboy' who was 'living the dream'<n>Another volunteer Alice Barnett, 19, also died after her body was washed up.

Labour has vowed not to increase VAT or National Insurance in the next election.<n>But Mr Balls refused to rule out using the point at which it kicks in.<n>The 40p tax rate has already risen from 2million to 5million in two decades.<n>The Tories have promised to lift the threshold if they are returned to power.

Gemma Flanagan, 31, from Liverpool, was left paralysed after being hit by Guillain Barre Syndrome.<n>The aspiring model was working for British Airways when the condition first struck.<n>She assumed partying in six-inch heels during a stopover was the cause of the pain.<n>But she was left frozen in her own body, unable to move, speak or swallow.<n>She spent seven months in the specialist Walton Neuro Rehabilitation Unit.<n>Today, the aspiring model is taking part in a show called 'The Beauty Within' by Models of Diversity at London's Olympia.

Karen Davis from Port Pirie, South Australia, has been charged with disorderly behaviour.<n>The 38-year-old was captured streaking by a camera car for Google Maps Street View.<n>Ms Davis had issues with her size-K breasts in her 20's and is finally ready to embrace them.<n>She plans to skydive topless for her 40th birthday.

A Perth woman has been charged with a string of offences after footage of her racially-charged attack on her African neighbours went viral.<n>The 51-year-old woman unleashed a racist tirade at her neighbours, swinging a crowbar at them and verbally abusing them.<n>The clip was filmed by a refugee family who say their children have been asking their mother if they are'really monkeys'<n>The woman insists she was the victim and says she was in fear of her life.

Louis Jordan, 37, was stranded 200 miles off the coast of North Carolina.<n>He was found by a German container ship on Thursday afternoon.<n>Jordan was not dehydrated, suffered no sun damage and was in good health.<n>He was taken to Sentara Norfolk General Hospital in Virginia.

Adam Crapser, 39, of Salem, was issued with deportation papers by the Department of Homeland Security in January.<n>The father-of-three arrived in America with the name Shin Sonh Hyuk in 1979 around the age of three along with his biological sister.<n>However, his first set of adoptive parents abandoned him and the second set turned out to be abusive.<n>Now, after a life battling joblessness because of his lack of immigration papers, homelessness and crime, Crapser is facing deportation.
