David Fitzgerald believes Jesus was a literary invention.<n>He says he combined stories from several cults and figures in Judea during the first century.<n>He says there are no contemporary mentions of Jesus in historical accounts from the time when he was supposed to have lived.<n>He also points to discrepancies in the early gospels of Mark, Matthew and Luke, claiming these were written decades after the supposed time of Jesus.

Taliban publish bizarre biography of supreme leader Mullah Omar.<n>Hails one-eyed terrorist's'special' sense of humour and love of grenade launchers.<n>Release lavished praise on extremist in celebration of 19th year as leader.<n>Taliban have reportedly seen defections to ISIS recently.<n>Mullah Omar has not been seen since 2001 US-led invasion.

Randy Johnston, 68, from Dallas, Texas, decided to leave two 'fake poops' on his granddaughters' beds.<n>His son then went about filming the moment of discovery.<n>But footage shows that the prank turned out to be decidedly disastrous.<n>Porter, six, wails in horror and Randy tries to put a stop to the waterworks.

Boko Haram fighters have been murdering dozens of women and girls.<n>They have also been using children as 'expendable cannon fodder'<n>The U.N.'s human rights chief said today that if reports are true, Boko Haram have committed war crimes and crimes against humanity.

Putin 'to consider any attempt to return Crimea to Ukraine as declaration of war'<n>He will take necessary step - including using nuclear weapons - to retain control.<n>Kremlin intelligence chiefs 'issued spectrum of responses from nuclear to non-military'<n>These disturbances thought to involve cyber attacks or ethnic tensions.

Kourtnie A. Sanchez, 25, was arrested Monday on charges including electronic solicitation, unlawful sexual relations, solicitation of unlawful sexual relations and three counts of promoting obscenity to a minor.<n>She was a student teacher at Marshall Elementary School in Eureka during the fall 2014 semester.<n>Prosecutors allege her victims were aged between 15 and 17.<n>She left her position in December 2014.<n>Sanchez is believed to be a married mother-of-three.

Jeralean Talley of Inkster tops a list maintained by the Los Angeles-based Gerontology Research Group.<n>Talley was born on May 23, 1899.<n>She credits her long life to her faith and says 'it's not in my hands or your hands'<n>Talley's husband died in 1988 and five generations of her family have lived in the Detroit area.<n>In 2013, her 114th birthday drew the attention of President Barack Obama, who said in a personal note that she's 'part of an extraordinary generation'

Lewis Ferguson lost his balance on the final fence at Wincanton.<n>The 18-year-old jockey was flung from his horse Merrion Square.<n>Ferguson escaped with only 'dented pride' according to trainer Paul Nicholls.

Mobile phone companies boasted 4G would be five times faster than 3G.<n>But the actual figure is actually only 2.5 times faster - 14.7 megabits per second.<n>This is compared to 5.9Mbit/s per second on the 3G service that most people use.<n>4G services are likely to slow down as more people connect to them.<n>EE, which is being taken over by BT, is the fastest to offer 4G speeds.

John R. Lind, 34, admitted tainting Pat Maahs' drink with his semen.<n>He worked at Beisswenger’s hardware store in New Brighton, Minnesota.<n>Maahs thought the coffee smelled bad because the milk was spoiled.<n>Lind pleaded guilty to indecent exposure, defined as engaging in lewd or indecent behavior.

The victims of a medical experiment run by the United States in Guatemala are suing Johns Hopkins University for $1billion.<n>The lawsuit has 750 plantiffs and includes victims and their families, and claims the university approved and helped plan the study.<n>In the aftermath of the experiment, some of the individuals died of syphilis, with open sores covering their bodies, while those who did survive claim they passed the disease down to their children.<n>It is estimated approximately 700 people were infected with the disease, and of the roughly 75% who were treated, only 25% were reported to have completed their treatment.

RSPCA has no more legal actions left under Hunting Act after latest case.<n>Charity has been criticised for spending £22.5million pursuing animal welfare cases last year.<n>It has power to bring its own prosecutions rather than rely on police.<n>But last October, report recommended abandoning the policy and leaving job to Crown Prosecution Service.

Havasupai tribe are the smallest Indian nation in America, with just over 600 inhabitants.<n>The tribe is located at the bottom of Havasu Canyon, in the heart of the Havasupai Nation reservation.<n>The village of Supai is concealed at the bottom of the canyon, eight miles from the nearest road.<n>The tribe also grow food and weave as a source of livelihood, although being situated at the base of the canyon has left them vulnerable to flooding.

Li Chien, 30, was annoyed at his neighbour's dog barking in Taiwan.<n>He grabbed a bread knife from his kitchen and went to his neighbour's yard.<n>He slit the throat of the dog called Lucky and killed it.<n>The dog's distraught owner Tang Chao, 40, called police.

Residents danced in the streets, blared their horns and waved national flag.<n>President Hassan Rouhani called on world powers to fulfil their part of deal.<n>The agreement aims to prevent Tehran making a nuclear weapon in exchange for phased sanction relief.

Donna Oettinger, 41, cradled son Zaki, 3, in front of train in March 2012.<n>She had sought urgent psychiatric help in months before tragedy, inquest told.<n>She had attempted to kill herself three months before they died.<n>Coroner rules doctors and social services made five'significant' failures.<n>But coroner Selena Lynch said 'nothing could have been done' to foresee deaths.

Mohammed Alam, Sayed Juied and Sadek Miah jailed for 17 years each.<n>Trio targeted multi-million pound homes in west London, Surrey and Hertfordshire.<n>Thieves would wait until owners were away before striking early in morning.<n>Gang targeted 21 homes taking a Ferrari, Porches, Minis, paintings and cash.

The unnamed trader made the profit after buying 315,800 shares of chipmaker Altera at $36 a share.<n>The trader also purchased 3,158 call options on Altera, with each giving them the right to purchase 100 shares.<n>The trader sold their shares at a much higher price than they would have made if they had purchased the stock at the current price.

More than 480 design teams submitted entries to eVolo Magazine's 2015 contest.<n>A jury of experts chose three winners and awarded 15 other designs.<n>The first place was awarded to a Polish group called Bomp for its 'natural habitat' Essence Skyscraper.<n>The project is an urban mega-structure with a range of natural habitats.<n>It beat designs for a giant 'Times Squared 3015' concept at the heart of Times Square, a Bio-Pyramid in the Sahara and Cybertopia.

FBI destroyed files which were part of investigation into King's death.<n>Leading King historian Stuart Wexler said it could have been 'one of the greatest scandals in the history of the FBI'<n>He said that the bureau chose to cover up the role of a high level informant.<n>King was shot dead by James Earl Ray on 4 April 1968 at the Lorraine Motel in Memphis, Tennessee.

Chelsea Manning, formerly Bradley, began tweeting on Friday.<n>She is serving a 35-year sentence for espionage.<n>Manning is dictating the tweets over the phone to close friends.<n>She hopes to use the Twitter to disseminate about'meaningful' news about her life and government transparency.

Deborah Fuller dragged her dog Tango along the B1066 in Essex.<n>The Rhodesian ridgeback was left with wounds to his paws and chest.<n>Fuller denied causing unnecessary suffering to an animal but was convicted.<n>She has been banned from keeping animals and had her dogs confiscated.
Sarah Theeboom stopped washing her hair six years ago after a friend told her that giving up shampoo was the secret to gorgeous locks.

Ten officers from Guernsey Police executed search warrants on Eagle Medical Practice and private residential address on island of Alderney.<n>Health & Social Services Department raised concerns over four deaths.<n>Doctor excluded from treating patients at Mignot Memorial Hospital.<n>General Medical Council informed and said matter is now subject of police investigation.

More than 1,000 Cuban properties are listed on the popular home-rental website.<n>Private rooms are available for as little as $12 (£8) a night.<n>The bulk of them are located in the capital of Havana.<n>One of the biggest hurdles Airbnb hosts are currently facing is the lack of internet access.

Rae Johnston, 33, is a Sydney based tech and gaming journalist.<n>She is one of a growing number of Australians who are dressing up in hand-made costumes of their favourite comic book, television show or movie characters.<n>Ms Johnston has been selected to host the Cosplay championships at this year's Oz Comic-Con.<n>She said she chose Wonder Woman as her signature because of her empowering character and 'compassion'

Teacher in Portland, Oregon, was filmed swinging an axe into a fellow teacher's groin in a class experiment.<n>The teacher missed his target and swung the blunt end of the axe straight into his genitals.<n>However, his co-worker stepped up and took a second swing at the cinder block - and the teacher was OK.

British national arrested on Saturday as part of operation against DHKP-C.<n>Members of banned leftist group took Turkish prosecutor hostage last week.<n>Both the prosecutor and the hostage takers were killed after a police shoot-out.

Blue Bell Ice Cream has suspended operations at an Oklahoma production facility that officials had previously connected to a foodborne illness linked to the deaths of three people.<n>Last month, the company and health officials said a 3-ounce cup of ice cream contaminated with listeriosis was traced to a plant in Broken Arrow, Oklahoma.<n>The now-recalled ice cream product is not sold in retail locations and is shipped in bulk to 'institutional accounts' such as hospitals in 23 states.<n> Listeriosis, also known as listeria, is a life-threatening infection caused by eating food contaminated with bacteria called Listeria monocytogenes

Salvina Formosa from South Wentworthville, west of Sydney, has been taking part in step classes to improve her fitness.<n>The 101-year-old widow now does weights and sit-to-stand exercises several times a week.<n>The Western Sydney Local Health District's community-based program Stepping On is designed to improve strength and balance in elderly people who have had a fall or are fearful of falling.

Apple's official recruitment site has nine battery and power software job listings.<n>These include an iOS battery life software engineer and a power systems engineer.<n>Apple's larger iPhone 6 and 6 Plus have been found to last a full day.<n>Apple's Watch battery lasts 18 hours on an all-day charge.

Engine of Ao Nang Princess 5 ferry exploded and caught fire in Andaman Sea.<n>Passengers were throwing themselves into the water when the incident happened.<n>Rescuers are still searching for the 12-year-old girl who was in the toilet.<n>One person died in the fire but none were reported to be injured.

Ugaaso Abukar Boocow's Instagram feed has nearly 70,000 followers.<n>Her posts show a side of Somalia most people have never seen.<n>The 27-year-old civil servant was two when she and her grandmother fled the country's civil war and moved to Canada.

Gizelle Laurente said her son was not allowed to board a flight from Darwin to Brisbane because of his autism.<n>She said she had a letter from his paediatrician and his usual medication.<n>But Qantas said he was not allowed to fly because it had not been given the required paperwork to clear an unaccompanied child.

Kamron T. Taylor, 23, escaped from the Jerome Combs Detention Center in Kankakee at about 3 a.m. Wednesday.<n>He somehow escaped from his cell, hid inside the facility, then beat and choked the guard who was making rounds, said Kankakee County Sheriff Timothy Bukowski.<n>Taylor was convicted of first-degree murder in February and faces a sentence of 45 years to life in prison.

Hakaoro Hakaoro was jailed in January 2014 for working without a license.<n>The 55-year-old has been found guilty of six new complaints.<n>The new allegations include inviting women into his house to enter a sexual relationship with him.<n>He also asked them to carry out household duties.<n>Hakaoro had his licence cancelled in 2013 after a string of similar complaints.

German Red Cross worker Rene Schulthoff photographed girl in Azraq camp.<n>She ran barefoot through rocky terrain and became terrified when he raised camera.<n>He did not realise how scared she was until he was editing the photographs.<n>Heart-breaking image follows iconic picture of another Syrian girl.<n>She surrendered to camera in same camp last year after mistaking it for a gun.

Ryan Burns of Eureka, California, said he could barely believe his eyes when he went out to investigate where the beeping was coming from.<n>He swiftly whipped out his camera phone to film the canine at the wheel.<n>The animal stands up with his front paws firmly pressed on the horn.<n>He refuses to get down from the device even when the camera zooms in.<n>Burns later uploaded the video clip online with the dog's owner stepping forward.

Kevin Pimentel, 12, shot dead his six-year-old brother, Brady, as they made dinner inside their Florida home last week before shooting his older brother in the leg and then taking his own life.<n>The boys' 16-year-old brother, Trevor, was shot in the leg and attended the boys' joint funeral in a wheelchair on Wednesday.<n>The boys' mother, who works two jobs to keep the family afloat, and another brother, 18, were not home at the time.<n>Officials said there was no argument or incident that sparked the gunfire.

Tiffanie DiDonato, from Swansboro, North Carolina, was born with diastrophic dysplasia, a rare form of dwarfism.<n>The 34-year-old mom is three months pregnant with her second child and uses a wheelchair and crutches.

Crsity Collins was a paramedic in Launceston, Tasmania, while she was high on ice.<n>The 30-year-old said she was never offered support despite checking herself into the emergency room on six occasions.<n>She said she was never asked if she was on meth or taking drugs.<n>Ms Collins first tried ice while living in Darwin, before moving back to Launceston.
The tiny Himalayan kingdom of Bhutan is a land of myths and magic.<n>It measures its success with a Gross National Happiness index.<n>Tiger's Nest Monastery is the most sacred site in the country.

Carlos Colina, 32, faces charges of accessory after the fact to an assault, battery and improper disposal of a body.<n>Remains, including a torso and limbs, first were found in a duffel bag discarded outside the building of technology company Biotech Saturday morning.<n>Colina was arrested Sunday after severed human body parts were discovered in a duffel bag and a human head was found in his apartment building's recycling bin.<n>The head of victim Jonathan Camilien, 26, of Somerville, was found in a recycling bin in Colina's apartment building across the street.<n>Colina has not been charged with

Dangelo Conner, from New York, filmed himself messing around with a Taser.<n>He first electrocuted a Coke can, but his antics all went horribly wrong.<n>He then decided to zap a bracelet he was holding, sending the current into his body.<n>The footage has gone viral, being viewed more than 17million times.

Orgasmic meditation involves light stimulation of clitoris for 15 minutes.<n>Aim is not to orgasm but to 'feel' the sensation as intensely as possible.<n>There are currently over 10,000 practitioners worldwide and 2,000 in the UK.<n>Classes cost £195 for a seven-hour session.

Steven Christopher Costa, 31, plans to head to Iraq next month.<n>He will join Kurdish fighters and other foreign ex-servicemen in the war against ISIS.<n>The married father-of-two has raised the cash to pay for flights to the Middle East.<n>He said: 'When you have a rabid dog, you take it to the vet and put it down'

The Plant Gravity Sensing study will be conducted on 13 April.<n>It will be conducted when new supplies are taken to the ISS.<n>Experiment will examine cellular process of formation in thale cress.<n>Small dishes will hold seedlings, and astronauts on the station will watch how they are able to grow inside the Japanese Kibo module.<n>Scientists will be examining whether a plant’s ability to work out which way it is growing - the gravity sensor - can form in the absence of gravity.<n>The results could help farmers on Earth get a higher crop yield.

The IRS targeted tea party groups and others with questions like 'Where are the values of the tea party?' and 'Where are the values of the Constitution?'<n>The Treasury Department's Office of Inspector General found that the IRS targeted 298 groups with more scrutiny than others.<n>A federal judge has ruled that the tea party groups can sue the government for violating their First and Fifth Amendment rights.<n>The IRS must now identify the groups it targeted and certify that they are a class-action suitPlaintiff.

Colourful cocktails are deceptively easy to drink but can contain vast quantities of alcohol.<n>The Zombie is a fruity cocktail made from three different types of rum, lime juice, falernum, Angostura bitters, Pernod, grenadine, cinnamon syrup and grapefruit juice.<n>The Negroni is a classic made with Cognac, tomato juice, simple syrup and muddled fresh herbs.

Lisa Colagrossi, 49, collapsed from a brain aneurysm and never regained consciousness on March 19.<n>Her mother Lois was greeting mourners at her funeral on March 23 when she was approached by her daughter's boss Camille Edwards.<n>Witnesses who overheard the confrontation said Mrs Colagrossi refused to hug Edwards and told her: 'You are the reason I am standing in this church'<n>The family has denied any grudge against Edwards or the station.

Kristin Holmes, 26, allegedly uploaded photo of herself pointing a gun.<n> captioned image: 'I'll post a few actual pics of me so you know the difference when you "come find me"'<n>She then 'exchanged words' with other users on Facebook, it is reported.<n>After a user reported image to police, Holmes was arrested for 'Facebook thugging'<n>She is now facing a Class 1 misdemeanor that could result in one year in jail.

Ukip leader said overall caps on net migration would be 'ludicrous'<n>But he added that 50,000 limit'might change every year'<n>Conservatives accused Mr Farage of'making up his policies as he goes along'

Choupette, a three-year-old Siamese cat, is the world's most pampered pet.<n>She has appeared in two adverts, earning £2.18million last year.<n>That's just £220,000 less than Cara Delevingne, who took home £2.4million.<n>Lagerfeld, 82, said he doesn't allow his pet to do foodstuffs.
Manual urges party supporters to appear 'level headed' and 'agreeable'<n>It also provides stock answers to ease voters' concerns about party.<n>Green Party membership has surged to more than 50,000.

Sarah Thomas, 42, has been a referee for college football's Conference USA since 2013.<n>She has previously refereed preseasons games, scrimmages and minicamps.<n>Thomas will be among eight new hires made for the 2015 season, a source close to the matter said.

Rob Kardashian has been a regular on the red carpet for years.<n>But in the last year he has disappeared from the public eye.<n>He is now rarely seen out and about and rarely tweets.<n>His family have expressed their concern for him in new clips.

Joshua Malatino and his then-girlfriend, Samantha Scott of the Snow Kone Joe ice cream truck business were charged in April 2013.<n>The driver of a Mr. Ding-A-Ling truck said the two had repeatedly harassed and stalked him.<n>Malatino allegedly offered his rival's customers free ice cream and boasted that he 'owned the town's ice cream truck business in Gloversville'

Latisha Fisher, 35, charged with second-degree murder for allegedly killing 20-month-old Gavriel Ortiz-Fisher Monday.<n>Fisher was evaluated as mentally fit as recently as September after pleading guilty to stabbing her aunt in 2011.<n>She was diagnosed with schizophrenia after the incident.

Paris Picnics makes it easy for tourists to enjoy the French capital.<n>Customers can pick from four picnic options, including champagne.<n>The baskets are delivered in a bright yellow Piaggio called Pepe.

Kathrin Goldbach and her family have reportedly fled their home in Montabaur.<n>The 26-year-old maths teacher and her brother Andreas are said to be too scared to return to the small town they both grew up in.<n>They are afraid they will face the 'hatred of the world' if they return.<n>Miss Goldbach is seeking comfort from a priest after boyfriend's death.

Jordan Waddingham, 12, found the world's largest European wasp nest.<n>The nest is 90kilograms tall and is one metre tall and three metres wide.<n>It took two days to unearth the nest from the ground and four men to carry it out of the bush.<n>The nest is on display at the Queen Victoria Museum and Art Gallery in Launceston.

Dr Michael Shannon saved Chris Trokey's life when he was born premature more than 30 years ago.<n>But in 2011, Dr Shannon was trapped in his burning SUV after it was T-boned by a semi-truck.<n>Trokey, now a paramedic, pulled him out alive and the pair met on Sunday at a fundraiser for childhood cancer.

A 71-year-old man and 64-year-old woman were both charged with unlawfully possessing a firearm.<n>The pair, both from Bundaberg, will appear in the Bundaberg Magistrates Court on Friday.<n>The carcasses of more than 50 greyhounds were found at the bush site in Coonarr, near Bundaberg, on Tuesday.<n>Early investigations suggest the dogs were young dogs that were killed as they were too slow.

Randy Pierce, from Nashua, New Hampshire, lost his sight when he was just 22 years old.<n>He was also left in a wheelchair after suffering from a neurological disease.<n>Pierce left his wheelchair for good in 2006 and has since climbed all 48 mountains in New Hampshire.<n>He is now gearing up to run the Boston Marathon this month.

Sir Stirling Moss won 212 races during his 14-year career.<n>He last drove a Sprite in 1962 - one month before he crashed at Goodwood.<n>The 85-year-old revealed his unusual daily routine for his longevity.<n>He does 77 press-ups and has half a bottle of Chardonnay each day.

Tina Campbell, 29, paid £100 for hair extensions in a bid to look glamorous.<n>A few weeks later, she developed painful boils on her scalp.<n>She spent her 29th birthday in bandages after her hair extension nightmare.

Footage shows 27-year-old Jared Henry of Arkansas being knocked off his longboard to the ground while the doe spins on its stomach into a ditch.<n>The deer apparently broke its pelvis and died while Henry recovered from the incident unscathed.<n>To date the winceworthy video of Henry in action in the Ozark Mountains has been watched more than 300,000 times.

The Red Lady's remains were found in the El Mirn Cave in Cantabria, Spain.<n>Radiocarbon dating suggests she was buried 18,700 years ago.<n>An engraved stone found near her remains appears to have been a makeshift tombstone.<n>But the reasons why she was buried in such an elaborate tomb, close to an area where her peers would have lived day-to-day, continues to baffle archaeologists.

Taylor Davis, 20, was seen in the Kissimmee, Florida store, touching himself and possibly following a female shopper on Tuesday.<n> Osceola County Sheriff Deputies found the suspect in his car in the parking lot.<n>Davis told deputies he went to Walmart to do some shopping and inappropriately touched himself inside his sweatshirt but did not expose himself.<n>He then began following a woman he found attractive around the store.<n>The 20-year-old was arrested on disorderly conduct and criminal mischief and booked into the Osceola County Jail.

The £300,000 599 GTO was driven by Roberto Cinti, 38, from Anzio.<n>He mistook the throttle for the brake and mashed the car through a shop.<n>The 2012 model can hit 60mph in just 3.3 seconds and has 671bhp.<n>The car's owner was waiting in the hotel when the accident happened.

Sussex Police has been accused of 'victim-blaming' in its campaign.<n>Women's rights groups said rapists were to blame for sex attacks.<n>But supporters said it was 'blindingly obvious' it was not blaming women.<n>Poster features picture of two women and says 'which one is most vulnerable?'

Robert Durst, 71, is facing murder charges in California for death of his mother.<n>The property where he grew up in Scarsdale, New York, is on the market.<n>The seven-bedroom Tudor stone mansion has been described as 'grand'<n>It boasts five fireplaces, a library, maids' quarters and a chandelier.

Children as young as two were squashed by adults trying to grab candy.<n>The Sacramento event was trying to break the world record for the biggest Easter egg hunt.<n>But it did not break the record because they missed the deadline.<n>Instead, they were raising money for victims of human trafficking.
Traquair castle in Scotland hosts the world's largest Easter Egg hunt.<n>Learn how to be a court jester at Stirling Castle.<n>At Carreg Cennen Castle children can bottle feed lambs.

The average American ingests about 3,500 milligrams of salt per day - the amount of sodium in a teaspoon of salt.<n>Federal government regulations and the American Heart Association have for decades warned that excess salt contributes to the deaths of tens of thousands of Americans each year.<n>The guidelines currently dictate the people should limit their intake to 2,300 milligrams, with a stricter 1,500 milligram limit for African Americans and people over 50.<n>In February the Dietary Guidelines Advisory Committee recommended keeping the larger limit, although it withdrew support for the stricter limit for African Americans and people over 50.

excrement was found on a train travelling between Lichfield Trent Valley and Longbridge.<n>London Midland said the 'act of vandalism' was 'disgusting'<n>Passenger Christopher Talbot said the smell was so bad it made him sick.<n>London Midland said CCTV images of the culprit would be passed onto police.

Samsung will reportedly be the main supplier of the A9 chips in Apple's iPhone range.<n>It has previously supplied Apple with various iPhone parts.<n>But following legal disputes, Apple signed a monopoly deal with TSMC.<n>This affected Samsung's business as Apple still uses Samsung chips.<n>But Samsung has recently partnered with GlobalFoundries to meet demand.

The Canadian Fair Trade Network is hoping the images will make people think about the garments they are wearing and just where they have come from.<n>Each label says that the product is 100 per cent cotton - but adds that is not the whole story.<n>The photographs feature clothing labels telling the tragic stories of factory workers from Bangladesh, Cambodia and Sierra Leone.

Fergus Simpson from University of Barcelona applied a mathematical formula to assume aliens obey the same laws of conservation of energy as animals on Earth.<n>He said there must be a minimum size necessary for supporting intelligent life, based on the range of body sizes of intelligent animals such as apes and humans.<n>And, if they exist, he believes intelligent aliens typically weigh more than 650 lbs (300kg) - around the size of a polar bear.

Cavemen and women sketched prehistoric beasts on the rough limestone walls of a cave 36,000 years ago.<n>Now a replica has been built near Vallon-Pont-D'arc in Southern France and contains 1,000 painstakingly-reproduced drawings.<n>Experts scanned the original drawings using 3D modelling techniques to capture each marking.<n>The replica cave bears images of 14 different species such as cave bears, woolly rhinoceros, mammoths and big cats.

Tina Sinatra said her father had a vasectomy before he fathered Ronan.<n>The 66-year-old ridiculed claims that the 27-year-old was her brother.<n>In 2013, Mia Farrow said Frank Sinatra may be the father of her son.<n>The actress had been married to the singer for four years.

Meaghan Hudson, 25, told friends and family she had cancer in December 2013.<n>She said she had multiple myeloma and was unlikely to survive.<n>Friends shaved their heads in solidarity and got tattoos of inspirational song lyric.<n>Meaghan's stepmother set up a fundraising website and received $5,000.<n>But police said Meaghan admitted to faking the disease last year.

Ukip leader said he wanted to 'keep his mind as clear as possible'<n>But he admitted he would break his drink ban at 6pm before the debate.<n>He said: 'I just want to keep my mind as clear as I possibly can'<n>David Cameron and Mr Farage will share the platform tonight.

Tuti Yusupova's friends claim she was the world's oldest person.<n>They say her birth certificate and passport prove she was born in 1880.<n>Ms Yusupova's death came in the same week as Misao Okawa died.<n>Ms Okawa was the world's oldest person at 114 and died on April 1.

Four babies and two mothers died at Oldham Royal and North Manchester General hospitals in the space of just eight months.<n>Lisa Parkisson, 35, died 48 hours after giving birth at the hospital in June.<n>In another case newborn Thomas Beaty died after being forced back into womb.<n>Independent investigators found 'notable absence of clinical leadership' in the maternity wards and 'failure to adequately plan care' in a number of cases.<n>Report also noted that risk management was 'below standard' in some cases.

Hand-painted psychedelic cartoon depicts eponymous submarine from 1968 film.<n>It was used as master version from which artists created all other images.<n>Yellow Submarine was a critical success on its release and led onto The Beatles' 10th studio album the following year.

Maxine Fohounhedo, 30, was charged in December with kidnapping and raping a female passenger he picked up after she ordered an UberX ride.<n>The 22-year-old woman told police she was intoxicated and fell in and out of consciousness during the ride with Fohounhedo.<n>She alleged that she eventually woke up in Fohounhedo's apartment as he was having sex with her.<n>He was released from Cook County Jail on Monday night after spending four months behind bars.

Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran's legal appeal against their Indonesian death row sentence was heard on Monday.<n>But a Jakarta court rejected their last ditch legal appeal.<n>Indonesia's attorney-general HM Prasetyo says the pair will be executed soon.<n>He said: 'This is proof of their tendency to delay... it's like toying with law'

India Mayhew, seven, suffered serious head injuries after horse bolted.<n>She was riding just metres ahead of her father and a member of staff.<n>Police said the horse suddenly went out of control and dragged her up.<n>She was rushed to hospital but doctors declared her dead on arrival.

Alison Hall, 48, was at work when she felt her chest tightening.<n>She took out her inhaler and felt something shoot to the back of her throat.<n>A false nail then came loose from the back of her throat and fell out.<n>She believes it may have worked its way inside the inhaler through a gap.<n>Ms Hall is now urging others to check their inhalers before use.

Ruanne Dellal says Jack Dellal left her £15million estate when he died.<n>She is now suing his family for an additional £385million.<n>Claims they must have given her vast chunks of his fortune in secret.<n>Family say she is owed a'reasonable provision' following his death in 2012.

Charlie Chaplin married second wife Lita Grey, who was 16 years his junior.<n>The pair divorced just three years after they married in 1924.<n>The 50-page divorce papers lay bare the film star's 'cruel and inhumane' treatment of his teenage bride.<n>The papers were found in a bank in America and are set to fetch £15,000.

Dr Julie Epstein has been found guilty of medical misconduct.<n>She prescribed anabolic steroids and other hormones to 40 patients.<n>Dr Epstein could also be struck off as a doctor.<n>The tribunal found she was irresponsible diagnosing medications such as steroids and keeping inaccurate patient records.

School safety experts have reported a 'worrying increase' in e-terrorism, where threats are sent electronically.<n>The Ohio-based National School Safety and Security Services reviewed more than 800 school threats covered in the media during the first half of the 2014-15 academic year.<n>Researchers found that about one-third of cases involved violent remarks sent anonymously via text message, social media, email or other online means.<n>Law enforcement officers say the use of the modern technologies has made it much harder to determine if a threat is real and to find the culprit.

The Chicago Cubs lost 3-0 to the St. Louis Cardinals on Sunday night.<n>35,000 fans attended the game at Wrigley Field.<n>The stadium has been undergoing a major renovation.<n>Two bathrooms on the upper deck were temporarily out of service.<n>Fans were forced to wait more than an hour to get to the bathroom.<n>Some were forced to pee in plastic cups.<n>Disgusted fans uploaded pictures to social media showing the humiliating scenes.

John Clarkson created Creme Egg pie to serve with chips at his Preston chip shop.<n>The 55-year-old fryer blind-baking the pie casing to ensure egg doesn't melt.<n>One and a half Cadbury's Creme Eggs are then stuffed into the pie casing.<n>The dish is then battered and deep fried and served with chips for £2.75.

Lindsey Norman spotted the image of Jesus in a hot cross bun.<n>She bought the buns from Sainsbury's in Peterborough on eve of Easter.<n>Said it made her 'giggle' because it's coming up to Easter this year.

The 56-year-old Arkansas man drank anywhere from 3 to 10 times the amount an average American takes in every day.<n>Black tea has high levels of oxalate, a chemical known to produce kidney stones and even lead to kidney failure if consumed in excessive doses.

Fashion Police co-host, 40, was seen leaving Trump International Hotel.<n>On Monday she was promoting her new tell-all memoir Going Off Script.<n>In it she details her tumultuous relationship with Jerry O'Connell.<n>The pair dated from 2003 to 2004 and had an affair with Geri Halliwell.

Former boxing promoter, 61, had surgery last week to complete sex change.<n>She was expected to stay in hospital for 10 days but has been released early.<n>She now faces six weeks of recovery at home with her three children.<n>She tweeted: 'First night at home not feeling to bad still very sore and got pain but in good health'

Ivan Carlos, 22, and Brenda Avilez, 18, were sleeping in a trailer at the Lone Oak Mobile Home Park in Palmetto at around 2.30am Wednesday.<n>Christian Crawford, 35, lost control of the vehicle and crashed through the fence at the Park's fence.<n>Crawford was taken to a hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.<n>A fetus was also in the home at the time of the crash but did not survive.<n>The incident is being investigated as a traffic homicide.

Ivan Milat is serving seven consecutive life sentences for the murders of seven backpackers in NSW between 1989 and 1992.<n>His nephew Alistair Shipsey has compiled 94 letters from women writing to him from around the world.<n>One letter from a woman from Texas tells Shipsey she has even proposed.<n>Shipsey says he has released the book of his uncle's letters for 'those who want to read the facts'

Lara Logan is back home and recovering after being hospitalized for the fourth time this year.<n>She is said to be resting at her home in the Washington DC area but working on upcoming stories.<n>A close family friend of Logan's, financial pundit Ed Butowsky, confirmed late last month that the 43-year-old had been hospitalized.<n>Logan was brutally sexually assaulted in Cairo's Tahrir Square while reporting from the Arab Spring in 2011.
Cressida Bonas, 26, has been snapped up by Mulberry.<n>She's also starred in a West End play and is set to star with Judi Dench.<n>Prince Harry and Cressida split last year.
Hot spot near the Four Corners intersection of Arizona, Colorado, New Mexico and Utah.<n> covers only about 2,500 square miles.<n>Researchers say they don't know why.

Experts want to attract more workers from Asia where wages are low.<n>The Productivity Commission has suggested extending the length of working visas for live-in nannies from overseas could help tackle the childcare shortage.<n>Around 10,000 au pairs travel to Australia each year.<n>By working in Australia nannies from Indonesia and the Philippines can learn English and send money home.<n>Federal Opposition Leader Bill Shorten says foreign nannies are not the answer to limited childcare and rising costs.

John Knott, 71, was battling to stop gipsy camp being built near his home.<n>His wife Elizabeth, 70, had been diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease.<n>The couple lived in an 'idyllic' £500,000 cottage in Bosbury, Herefordshire.<n>But Mr Knott was said to be at 'end of his tether' over the gipsy camp.<n>He shot his wife Anne dead before turning the shotgun on himself.<n>For confidential support call the Samaritans in the UK on 08457 90 90 90, visit a local Samaritans branch or click here for details.
Tham Khoun Ex caves are located in the Xe Bang Fai River in Laos.<n>Locals believe that spirits inhabit the underground wonderland.<n>Visitors can explore the caves by kayak or on foot.

Richard and Angela Maxwell, from Lincolnshire, scooped £53,193,914.<n>The couple, both 67, plan to take family on holiday to New Zealand first class.<n>Mr Maxwell said he will retire and play bowls with his new-found wealth.

Diane and Bob Greenberg raised their children in separate faiths.<n>Katie, 24, was a devout Catholic, while Steven, 21, was Jewish.<n>Diane took charge of Katie while Bob taught Steven.<n>Their unusual arrangement has baffled many - but they think it works.

Star Reader was diagnosed with Biliary Atresia within days of birth.<n>Doctors discovered baby's bile ducts were blocked, a condition fatal if untreated.<n>Neither parent was a suitable match, so aunt Shanell Reader offered part of her liver.<n>She has since saved her niece's life, and the baby is now healthy.

Virginia Roberts had hoped to join lawsuit involving Andrew's friend Jeffrey Epstein.<n>Claims she was forced to have sex with the Duke of York three times.<n>Judge Kenneth Marra ordered her claims to be'struck from the record'<n>He refused to make a statement regarding the veracity of Miss Roberts's allegations.

The White House was without power for a few seconds.<n>State Department briefings were also affected.<n>The cause of the outage is not known, but the Department of Homeland Security says there's no evidence of malicious intent or terrorism related activity.<n>The Smithsonian Air and Space Museum was evacuated and guests were told to leave.

Jeffrey Williams, 20, is accused of shooting and wounding the officers on March 12.<n>In a series of phone calls from jail that were recorded, he spoke freely about the incident.<n>Williams said he was being harassed by a group of people outside Ferguson PD on the night of the shooting.<n>'I ran up the hill and he (an unidentified person) shot at the car.... I shot back,' Williams said in the recordings.

Andy Hornby is non-executive chairman of Pharmacy 2U.<n>He was in charge of HBOS when it collapsed in 2008.<n>Details of thousands of NHS patients were sold to marketing firms.<n>Many of those whose details he is selling are vulnerable.

Rosa Camfield died on Monday at 101 years old.<n>Her great-granddaughter Sarah Hamm posted a photo of Rosa cradling her new-born great-granddaughter Kaylee to Facebook two weeks ago.<n>The image of Rosa cradling Kaylee became an online sensation and has since been shared by millions.<n>As of Wednesday afternoon, the photo had received over 2.5 million likes and nearly 78,000 shares.

Cosmetic surgeon Dr Fredric Brandt hanged himself on Sunday at his Miami mansion.<n>The City of Miami Police Department confirmed that Dr Brandt's death was a suicide by hanging on Monday.<n> Columnist Lesley Abravanel told Daily Mail Online exclusively that sources close to Dr Brandt said he had hanged himself.<n>Abravanel said Brandt, 65, was 'devastated' recently over rumors comparing him to a character on the Netflix show, Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt.

The orphaned cubs were found abandoned in homes across the UK.<n>One was found in Derbyshire, the other in Cornwall and both were rescued.<n>The first of the cubs, named Little Star, was half the weight of an apple.<n>It was carried away in a Jack Russell's mouth, but it died within 24 hours.<n>Now the cubs are doing better and are being fed custard creams.

'Now that this is behind us, let's move forward together with a renewed commitment to the civility and respect that make this state great,' Indiana Governor Mike Pence said.<n>The Arkansas legislature also passed changes to its legislation at the behest of the state's Republican Governor Asa Hutchinson.<n>The governor signed a reworked version of the bill into law last night.

Christian Englander, 30, was arrested on Monday for throwing a peel at the comedian.<n>He has now said that attack was'misconstrued as a racial attack'<n>On Thursday he threw another peel at a man he had a fight with.<n>He claims he was angry about the first attack and that he did not seem remorseful.

New system allows owners to monitor their pets' movements on a website.<n>Pet GPS allows owners to monitor temperature, cage position and more.<n>Service is available from 10 US airlines including Delta and American.<n>Airline has a history of animal related incidents including failed dog flights.

In first standoff, officers fired 'toward the vicinity' of Tamerlan and Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, report states.<n>Also reportedly failed to appropriately aim their guns.<n>Shortly after, officer mistakenly fired on a police vehicle carrying two cops.<n>Both officers were unhurt; transit cop Richard Donohue was critically wounded.<n>Report was released by Massachusetts Emergency Management Agency.

Honolulu Museum of Art handed over seven artifacts to U.S. authorities.<n>They are believed to have been smuggled into the U.S. by an art dealer.<n>Subhash Kapoor is facing charges in India for allegedly selling looted items.<n>The items will be returned to India once they are in New York.

New book features beautiful photographs of the late artist Frida Kahlo.<n>The pictures were taken by Gisle Freund who travelled to Mexico in 1950.<n>Frida Kahlo: The Gisle Freund Photographs is out now.

Xiangyu Ouyang, 26, was on a state-sponsored scholarship from Singapore when authorities say she began dosing the bottles with paraformaldehyde.<n>The potentially deadly form of embalming fluid is also used in pesticides.<n>Ouyang admitted to poisoning two students' bottles as well as her own.

Elijah McCrae, five months, has a fatal genetic disease.<n>His parents have started a bucket list to make sure he lives a full life.<n>The list includes visiting Sydney's aquarium and Opera House.<n>Elijah is'very floppy' and doctors say he won't live to his second birthday.

Antti Pendikainen soars through the air with a parachute attached to snowmobile.<n>Extreme sports group, Stunt Freak Team, spent just three hours conjuring up the plan before beginning test flights.<n>After a four-minute ride and bumpy landing, Antti is then seen landing the contraption before coming safely to a stop.

Babies were surprised when objects like cars and balls passed through walls.<n>They were also confused when toys floated in thin air and broke the laws of gravity.<n>Researchers at Johns Hopkins University in Baltimore say the results suggest babies learn from the unexpected.

The three men - Thomas Jordan Driver, 25, David Elliot Moran, 47, and Charles Thomas Newcomb, 42 - were arrested Thursday.<n>Each faces one state count of conspiracy to commit murder.<n>The state said the murder plot started after Driver, an officer at the Department of Corrections Reception and Medical Center in rural north Florida, had a fight with the inmate.<n>The FBI was initially alerted to the murder plot by a confidential informant inside the Klan.

Emirates and Etihad planes were traveling in opposite directions over the Arabian Sea.<n>Both planes received an 'emergency warning' from their collision avoidance systems.<n>The planes were flying in opposite directions over Mumbai airspace.<n>Etihad Airways says safety of its passengers was never compromised.

Former British premier made unannounced visit to Ulaanbataar last month.<n>He is now a consultant to the cash-strapped Mongolian government.<n>But the secrecy surrounding his trip stoked fears from ecologists.<n>They fear he is being deployed to encourage Western investment.<n>The region is dotted with the burial mounds of the rulers of the ancient Hun civilisation.

Researchers at Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory cut real skin samples and then attempted to rip them apart.<n>They found mammalian skin has sophisticated stress resistance properties that prevent holes and cuts from expanding.<n>The curly fibers of collagen that make up dermis of the skin straighten and stretch in response to a tear to share the load and prevent further damage.<n>Scientists hope their findings could eventually lead to stronger new materials that do not easily tear that could be used in aircraft.

Japanese tourist, 48, charged after writing her name and date on dome.<n>Officials said eyeliner pencil did not leave any permanent marks.<n>It's the second time in four weeks that Italian police have charged a holidaymaker for defacing one of the country's top landmarks.

Marvin "Papi Gallo" Jones and Ramon Luis Nicolas were in the middle of a bout when the phone slipped out.<n>Referee Frankie Santore Jr. went over to pick up the Samsung Galaxy and looked like he was chastising Jones, who seemed confused.<n>Jones later told TMZ Sports that he was listening to music before the fight and put his phone in his shorts.

Bridewell Prison in Liverpool is being developed into a luxury hotel.<n>The jail was once home to men and women detained for petty crimes.<n>The rooms have been transformed into bright and airy abodes.

Ashley Doody, 30, was arrested on Sunday after allegedly attacking her mixed-breed dog, Trixie.<n>Police say she was high on bath salts and thought the dog was possessed.<n>The dog was taken to a veterinarian and is expected to survive.<n>Doody has been charged with aggravated cruelty to animals.

Charlene Bishop, 17 months old, went to feed her pony Taffee on Wednesday.<n>She was worried when she didn't meet her at the gate as normal.<n>Her mother Danielle Flisher went to investigate and found Taffee lying on the floor and dying from horrific head injuries.<n>Vets called to the field in Boxley, near Gillingham, Kent, had no option but to put the distressed pony down.

The Block's four apartments are now on the market.<n>Apartments will be open to the public on April 11-12.<n>The auctions will be on April 28.<n>Ayden and Jess will be hoping that they've created something that potential buyers will like.<n>Darren and Dea returned for The Block Triple Threat.<n>Josh and Charlotte's apartment is 1/27 Darling Street.<n>Agent Mark Konishi has been tasked with the sale of Josh and Charlotte's apartment.<n>Julliis Craig's Andrew McCann and auctioneer Damien Cooley are the agents.

Figures show 29 per cent of GP trainee posts remain unfilled this year.<n>In some parts of the UK, more than 60 per cent of positions remain unfilled.<n>Doctors warn the figures mean we may be headed for a recruitment crisis.<n>Last week it was revealed 10 per cent of patients failed to book GP appointment in 2013/14.

Margaret Atwood said Kate hasn't lived up to Princess Diana's reputation.<n>Author said she thinks duchess is cautious when it comes to clothes.<n>But she added she is right not to follow in Diana's footsteps.

Qantas warned in February that it would begin strictly enforcing its business class lounge dress code from April 1.<n>But not everyone got the memo.<n>Disgruntled customers who did not get the memo about the newly enforced Qantas dress code have posted their complaints on social media.

Misty Machinshok, 33, 'coached' Gary Machinshok, 29, on best positions to rape.<n>She planned to tell friends the girl got pregnant at a house party.<n>He has admitted raping the girl 'every few days' in 2013, and sexually assaulting her 11-year-old sister.<n>Mrs Machinshok has been jailed for 15 to 30 years for all charges.<n>Her husband will be sentenced this month after striking a plea deal.

Alfred Hitchcock was born in 1899 in Leytonstone, East London.<n>He was educated by the Jesuits and his first work was The Lodger.<n>A 5 ft 7 in Humpty Dumpty, he was the neurotic fat boy with piggy eyes.

Voters complained about aggressive campaigning tactics and fights.<n>Detectives were called when scraps broke out over 'political views'<n>Details released to Press Association under Freedom of Information Act.

Jean-Marie Le Pen said he had 'never regretted' making similar statements.<n>His daughter Marine Le Pen distanced herself from the comments.<n>She said she 'deeply disagrees' with her 'deliberately provocative' father.
