The 38-year-old suspect jumped into Brush Creek in Kansas City, Missouri, after being stopped by police.<n>He spent 10-15 minutes in the water before being fished out by responding officers.<n>The suspect may face charges in connection to a hit-and-run crash.

Alex Stock featured in now-infamous feature A Rape on Campus.<n>Was portrayed as callous social climber who discouraged rape victim.<n>Said the magazine should have fired reporter Sabrina Erdley.<n>Also said he did not think 'Jackie' should be publicly shamed.

Anthony Ray Hinton, 58, was released from the Jefferson County Jail in Birmingham, Alabama, on Friday morning.<n>He hugged tearful family members as he walked out and was embraced by his sister, Darlene Gardner.<n>He was freed after prosecutors admitted earlier this week that they couldn't find evidence that a gun found at his home fired the bullets used in two brutal 1985 murders.

The Thunder was being tracked by environmental charity Sea Shepherd.<n>The charity believed the ship was engaged in illegal fishing off Gabon.<n>The 40 crew on board were rescued from life rafts after the ship sank.<n>The captain of the ship is believed to have scuttled the vessel to cover up the illegal fishing.

Adele Berry was sent string of texts from man after she rang Vodafone.<n>She spoke to call handler but did nothing to suggest she was interested.<n>Man later got in touch, saying his name was 'Miguel' and called himself 'future hubby'<n>He sent her pictures of himself and promised to buy her shoes when he met her.<n>Vodafone has now suspended the man pending an investigation.

Abdel-Kader Russell-Boumzar was jailed in January after a racist rant on a train went viral.<n>The 17-year-old was released on bail on Thursday after a 69 day stint behind bars for a string of alleged offences.<n>He was charged with numerous offences, including serious assault, creating a disturbance and racial vilification.<n>Magistrate Deborah Vasta said Russell-Boumzar was currently 'public enemy number one' and warned him he would be targeted once released on bail.

Dr Fredric Brandt was found hanged in his Miami home on Wednesday.<n>The dermatologist and cosmetic surgeon had been suffering from depression.<n>He had been compared to the grotesque character of Dr Franff in Tina Fey's Netflix show 'Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt'<n>The exclusive pictures show him as a young boy, just 'a Jewish kid from Newark'

Abba visited the Wellington Museum in Waterloo, just south of Brussels.<n>‘Waterloo’ quickly entered the English language as a synonym for ‘a decisive defeat’<n>Locals are preparing to mark the bicentenary of the Battle of Waterloo.

Sinbad the ginger tabby cat travelled from Alexandria Port in Egypt to Hereford.<n>He was found by staff at Mediterranean Linens in Moreton-on-Lugg.<n>They heard meows coming from inside the container, which was carrying laundry linen.<n>RSPCA described the case as 'unique' and said it was incredible Sinbad had survived.<n>He has now gone into quarantine in Bristol for four months.<n>It is hoped he will then be re-homed and be adopted by a loving family.
Jonathan Maitland said the public is ready for his upcoming play.<n>An Audience with Jimmy Savile will open in London in June.<n>McGowan will play the disgraced paedophile in the play.

Rita, 24, models colourful new collection of eyeliners, lipsticks and nail varnishes.<n>She also unveiled her own range for the beauty giant.<n>Partied with boyfriend Ricky at Tommy Hilfiger's Paris store opening.

Kevin Perz, 56, graduated from Parkway Central High School in Chesterfield, Missouri, in 1977.<n>He has been looking up the teachers he has the fondest memories of from his days at the school.<n>Over the past few years he has been mailing them a 'gift'<n>It started in 1992, when he sent a check to his calculus teacher made out for $5,000.<n>Then in 2002, he sent a $10,000 check to his former business teacher.<n>He recently sent Marilyn Mecham, his home economics teacher, a check for $10,000.<n>Perz called Mecham and told her how much it took him

Jeremy Clarkson was involved in a 'fracas' with producer Oisin Tymon.<n>He punched him in the mouth and verbally abused him for 20 minutes.<n>Mr Tymon went to A&E for treatment after the incident at a hotel in Hawes.<n>But he told police he did not want to press charges against Clarkson.<n>Officers have now dropped the probe without taking action against him.

Richard Curry was diagnosed with a rare cancer in his septum.<n>He was told he would have to have his prosthetic nose removed.<n>The 71-year-old had to have metal implants inserted into his cheekbones.<n>The implants were then attached to his nose using magnets.<n>A check-up last month found no signs of the cancer returning.

Two people died in the blast at 121 Second Avenue in the East Village.<n>Investigators have now shifted their focus to what caused the explosion.<n>Suggestion someone may have improperly tapped a gas line serving the building.<n>Landlord could now face charges of manslaughter and reckless endangerment.

The 20-month-old boy was admitted to hospital struggling to breathe.<n>He was pronounced dead shortly after being rushed to hospital.<n>Police are treating the incident as suspicious and executed a crime scene warrant on Wednesday.<n>Officers are appealing to the public for any information about the incident.

Jamie Anderson said CGI characters did not have the same charm as the 'lovingly detailed' miniature puppets.<n>The original show launched 50 years ago and landed all over the world.<n>The jerky puppets that rescued the world have been replaced by CGI.

Robert Mccombs told a court in Grand Rapids, Michigan that Steven Carl Day admitted to him and his roommate Roger Musick that he molested a young relative and that he was molesting other young girls.<n>'Day said he thought one of the girls was starting to like it,' Mccombs testified.<n>Mccombs said that the next thing he knew, Mccombs was attacking Day.<n>'When I saw him in the choke-hold, his arms were down, his eyes were bulging. He wasn't moving,' Mccombs told the court.

David Cameron has pledged to offer cut-price properties to 200,000 young buyers.<n>The project, launched last month, is part of a dramatic extension of the Help to Buy scheme.<n>It doubles the number of new starter homes in England from 100,000 to 200,000.

The sculpture was created by eight people over 250 hours to celebrate the screening of the third series of Sherlock.<n>It stands 6ft tall and weighs 40kg, taking over 250 man hours to create.<n>The artwork will be on display at Westfield Stratford City shopping centre until it is removed.

Kentucky guard Andrew Harrison directed the slur at Wisconsin's Frank Kaminsky after the Wildcats' 71-64 loss Saturday night.<n>Kaminsky said Harrison called him to apologize and they had a 'good conversation'<n>The loss ruined Kentucky's undefeated season; they finished 38-1.

Tanya Heath Paris features hundreds of heel varieties.<n>Each shoe features a button in the centre of the heel.<n>Once a new heel is slid into the shoe, it is locked into place.<n>At the push of a button, the heel can be released and slid out of place.<n>Brand was masterminded by Canadian designer Tanya Heath.

Fear of spiders is a survival trait written into our DNA, researchers have discovered.<n>Dating back hundreds of thousands of years, instinct to avoid arachnids developed as an evolutionary response to a dangerous threat.<n>It could date back to early human evolution in Africa, where spiders with very strong venom existed millions of years ago.

Lance Corporal Albert Duffy had served in Afghanistan three times.<n>He was injured by Keith Anderson, 28, who asked for a cigarette.<n>He left him in a coma for 14 days and with severe brain damage.<n>Anderson, who was high on drugs, was jailed for seven years this week.

Andrew Getty, 47, was heir to the vast Getty oil fortune.<n>Body found in bathroom at his gated, three-storey £2.6 million villa.<n>Police say a woman called them to Andrew Getty’s home on Tuesday.<n>She said he had suffered a heart attack and had severe stomach problems.<n>Investigators say he died of natural causes or an accident.

Kyhesha-Lee Joughin died in March 2013 after suffering massive bowel damage.<n>The toddler was locked in a bedroom by her father, forcing her to defecate and urinate in the room.<n>Her father Matthew Lee Williamson and a family friend, Christopher Arthur Neville Kent, have been charged with manslaughter and child cruelty.<n>The court heard Kent offered to plead guilty on the basis of criminal negligence.

Documents released by Edward Snowden claim Britain spied on Argentina.<n>Claims Britain actively spied on the South American state between 2006 and 2011.<n>Britain has not responded to the allegations, which have been published.<n>Revelations come in the wake of heightened tensions over Falklands oil find.

Fire crews were tackling a blaze at a nearby chemical plant in Manchester.<n>They used water to dampen down the flames and mixed it with detergent.<n>This then turned into a six foot wall of foam which drained into the canal.<n>Environment Agency are investigating to assess if the foam has harmed wildlife.

Mindy Kaling has said she was not aware her brother pretended to be black when he applied to medical school in the late 1990s.<n>A representative for the comedienne said she has been estranged from Vijay Chokal-Ingam 'for years'<n>He claims in his new book that he changed his appearance to get into the St. Louis University School of Medicine.<n>He says he felt he had to do it to get into a school that accepts only minorities.<n>He says his sister Mindy Kaling has told him she is 'ashamed' of him for opening up about his alleged experience.

Local Government Association warns system is under pressure.<n>Wars councils may not be able to create more places at the rate needed.<n>By 2017/18, two in five local authorities will have more children ready to start school than there are places, analysis shows.

Hannah and Alex from New Zealand couldn't afford to buy a full-sized lot so they built their own home on the back of a flatbed truck.<n>The two-bedroom, two-bath home is powered mostly by solar panels.

Teresa James, 40, believes discomfort is worth it for the end result.<n>She is one of an increasing number of women for whom whitening their teeth has become an integral part of their beauty routine.<n>Almost a third of Britons are now preoccupied with whitening their teeth.

Couple were stranded after their trimaran overturned off the coast of Kent.<n>Woman was left in the water clinging to the hull of the overturned boat.<n>Her partner ensured she was safe, then tied a rope around himself to find flare.<n>Alarm was raised after a man spotted the couple in the water yesterday.<n>Rescue boat was sent and was able to locate upturned vessel within minutes.<n>The couple were taken to hospital by lifeboat and are unharmed.

The Dalny Vostok trawler sank 205 miles off Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula.<n>63 crew members were rescued with sea's temperature near zero degrees Celsius.<n>Emergency services said a further 15 are still missing.

Chinese authorities to track unruly citizens when they return home.<n>Police, customs officers, border control and bank credit agencies will be contacted.<n>Bad behaviour will include disorder on public transportation.<n>Chinese travellers spent $164 billion on foreign trips in 2014.

Chelsea Ellen Bruck, 22, has been missing almost six months, police said.<n>The Maybee woman was dressed as the comic villain Poison Ivy when she attended a Halloween party October 26 in Frenchtown Township.<n>The sheriff's office published a sketch of the man she was seen with in a parking lot.<n>That was the last time she was seen at the outdoor party at a rural farmhouse which was attended by around 800 people.

Jodie Barden, 28, has two daughters, eight-year-old Ella and one-year-old Chloe.<n>Both suffer from Cockayne Syndrome, which causes premature ageing.<n>The condition also means they will not reach adulthood and will die.<n>Mrs Barden has already made arrangements for both daughters' funerals.

Labour accused of crude new attempt to 'weaponise' the NHS.<n>They were accused of orchestrating a letter from doctors claiming hospitals will not be safe if David Cameron wins the election.<n>Ed Miliband was also accused of hypocrisy after he claimed that the Coalition had made it harder to get a GP appointment.

Jamaica, Colombia and Saint Lucia have the highest percentage of female managers.<n>Britain ranked relatively poorly, with only 34.2% of managers being women.<n>Pakistan was ranked as the worst country in the world for having female managers.

Andrew Mogni, 20, from Glen Ellyn, Illinois, had only just arrived for a semester program in Italy when the incident happened in January.<n>He was flown back to Chicago via air ambulance on March 20, but he died on Sunday.<n>Initial police reports indicated the fall was an accident but authorities are investigating the possibility that Mogni was robbed.

Most Rev Justin Welby made the remarks during Easter Sunday sermon.<n>He said the mainly Christian victims were 'witnesses, unwilling, unjustly, wickedly'<n>Pope Francis also made similar statements during his Easter Sunday Mass.

The principal of a Canberra school has been suspended after the incident.<n>The school has also removed the cage which was designed for the boy.<n>The boy was locked in the 2m by 2m structure while in class.<n>The principal has been removed and an investigation is underway.

Survey of 19,000 people found more a country paid to unemployed or sick the more likely its residents were to want a job.<n>In Norway, which pays the highest benefits in Europe, almost 80% of people wanted a job.<n>In Estonia, one of the least generous countries, only around 40% did.

Denise and Glen Higgs, from Braunton, Devon, lost hope.<n>Former RAF fireman Glen was made infertile due to testicular cancer treatment.<n>Couple had daughter Mazy, born three years ago.<n>Used eight embryos and tried again with same batch.<n>Twin babies Carter and Carson were born last week.

Hayley Adams, 29, of Barnstaple, Devon, caught stealing from William Tanner.<n>Seen sneaking into 89-year-old's bedroom and taking cash from his coat.<n>CCTV device put in room by his daughter Angela Wrenn, 56.<n>She had expressed concern that his money kept going missing.<n>But was shocked to discover culprit was Adams's boyfriend's great-grandchildren.<n>Admitted taking £65 but relatives said amount stolen in one year was thousands.<n>Adams convicted of three counts of theft but escaped with community order.

The Clinton campaign has reportedly signed a lease for two floors of office space in the trendy Brooklyn Heights neighborhood.<n>The neighborhood is one of the most hipster-friendly in the city.<n>The 19-story building will feature Hillary staffers rubbing elbows with a federal prosecutor and Morgan Stanley investors.<n>A Republican Party official in Iowa said that the Clinton's choice of digs 'won't matter much in flyover country where most people live in modest apartments'

New York is in the throes of a cultural revolution - but MOMA is still brilliant.<n>The city is largely based in Brooklyn and Queens, but has a contemporary arts scene.<n>The Golden Circle is a spectacular route through Iceland that runs through the city.

A student expelled from George Mason University for violating its sexual misconduct policy is suing in federal court to clear his name.<n>The student says he had been in a longstanding relationship with the woman, and that they frequently engaged in sadomasochistic role playing.<n>The lawsuit comes as colleges across the country, and particularly in Virginia, are under increased scrutiny for how they respond to allegations of sexual assault.

Nicholas Figueroa, 23, was killed in gas explosion and building collapse last month.<n>Hundreds of mourners gathered at Church of the Holy Name of Jesus in Manhattan.<n>His mother, Ana, wept as she watched his casket being loaded into hearse.<n>Mr Figueroa's father, Nixon, told mourners: 'I'm here but I'm broken. My son is broken. My wife is broken. It hurts... It's heartbreaking for everybody'<n>The former model and bowling lane employee was on second date at Sushi Park restaurant when building exploded.

The BBC has axed Richard Hammond and James May from Top Gear website.<n>Previously featured trio alongside racing driver The Stig at top of page.<n>But now The Stig appears solo in his white helmet on motoring programme's website.<n>Comes after Jeremy Clarkson was sacked from BBC for 'unprovoked' attack.

Michelle Pfeiffer is set to star in a new television comedy produced by Katie Couric.<n>The show will focus on a morning news program and will be similar to Couric's role as an anchor on Today for 15 years.<n>Pfeiffer will also serve as an executive producer on the program, with Couric serving as an executive producer.<n>The project is being created by Murphy Brown creator Diane English, who will also serve as a writer, producer and showrunner.

Rama the elephant, who completed paintings with his trunk, died Monday, Oregon Zoo officials announced on Facebook.<n>His leg was injured in 1990 when female elephants shoved him into a moat.<n>The zoo said he had experienced a'sharp decline in mobility' in recent weeks.<n>The elephant's 32nd birthday would have taken place on Wednesday.

John Howard, 66, was treasurer of Overseas Press and Media Association.<n>Father-of-three had sole access to the non-profit organisation's account.<n>He spent thousands on restaurant meals and trips to France over two years.<n>Fraud was only uncovered after the company had problems paying creditors.<n>Howard jailed for two and a half years and mouthed 'I'm sorry' to colleague.

Both men were asked their opinion on the practice in a quiz for Cosmopolitan.<n>Green Party leader Natalie Bennett responded it is 'OK for other adults but not for me'<n>Education Secretary Nicky Morgan answered: 'A bit too risky, thank you very much!'

Clarkson University in Potsdam, New York, claims that older buildings where hauntings are usually reported, often have poor air quality.<n>This can affect our brains, causing mood swings and anger.<n>Researchers are comparing conditions in 'haunted' and non-haunted old buildings to see if mould may cause people to think they have seen ghosts.

Kristi Gordon, of British Columbia's news channel Global BC, was joined by her fellow anchors Robin Stickley and Squire Barnes as they reflected upon the cruel comments.<n>The mom-to-be read some of the messages aloud before admitting that they had taken their toll on her.

A Sydney psychologist has surrendered his registration after a woman claimed he told her she had 'nice t**s'<n>Darryl Dewar hugged his client, patted her head, directed her to sing and used offensive language during a consultation in 2012.<n>The woman, who was having suicidal thoughts at the time, also claimed he called her 'a horny little thing'<n>Mr Dewar has been reprimanded and banned from re-registering as a psychologist unless he takes part in counselling or further education.

The 16-year-old girl was thrown from the car and trapped underneath for more than four hours.<n>She suffered only minor injuries because of a depression in the roof of the car that created a space between the roof and the ground.<n>The two other passengers, aged 16 and 17, managed to climb up to the road.<n>The three girls were returning from Fossil Creek outdoor area when the accident occurred near the border of Gila and Yavapai counties.

Victoria's Secret caused huge backlash with 'The Perfect Body' ad.<n>More than 27,000 people signed Change.com petition for apology.<n>Now lingerie brands have poked fun at the slogan with their own images.<n>Curvy Kate lingerie brand has recreated the ad with models of all shapes.

Dimitri Harrell, 21, allegedly shot Samirria White, 19, at St Paul home.<n>He then 'held their three-month-old baby in his arms while pointing gun at her'<n>Miss White was then'shot in face at close range', according to police.<n>Harrell later told officers weapon accidentally discharged during argument.<n>Now, suspect has been charged with second-degree murder at court.<n>He faces up to 40 years in prison; remains in custody in lieu of $200,000 bail.

Tiffany Jackson was arrested for driving with an invalid licence.<n>Children at Highland Oaks Middle School in Memphis shared the picture.<n>School suspended three pupils for three days for sharing the image.<n>Officials said they had demonstrated an 'inappropriate use of electronic media'<n>But they later overturned the decision following a backlash.
American YouTube user KentuckyFriedIdiot filmed himself teaching his newborn daughter how to suck a plastic water bottle.<n>To date the clip has been watched more than 190,000 times.

Tiffany Sical, 21, and Bryan Rodriguez-Solis, 23, were driving home.<n>Couple were in Rhode Island after watching Fast and Furious 7.<n>But they were killed when Joel Norman, 24,'sped wrong up highway'<n>Crash left their six-year-old daughter, Jaylene, an orphan, police said.<n>Norman arrested and charged with driving under the influence.

Ferme de Montagne proprietors Suzanne Dixon-Hudson and her architect husband Henry suggested we meet at The Dorchester for cocktails.<n>Staff spend a mandatory week working and gaining experience at the Mayfair hotel before the start of each new season.<n>Les Gets is well placed in the giant Portes du Soleil area, which has 400 miles of groomed pistes.

A spring snowstorm and icy roads caught Colorado drivers by surprise Friday, causing a 39-vehicle pileup near Boulder.<n>No serious injuries were reported in the crashes on U.S. Highway 36 between Boulder and Denver, but tow-truck drivers were kept busy hauling away damaged cars.<n>In Aurora, near Denver, one person died after being thrown from an Oldsmobile Bravada that lost control and rolled on an icy stretch of Interstate 225.

Prosecution took two months and more than 100 pieces of evidence to accuse the former New England Patriots player of killing Odin Lloyd.<n>Hernandez's lawyers called five witnesses to testify on Monday before resting at 3pm.<n>Following tomorrow's closing statements, the jury will deliberate on their verdict.

Edmund Echukwu, 35, collapsed in a swimming pool at a sex party last Friday.<n>He was pulled from the water at a £3million mansion in Radlett, Hertfordshire.<n>Mr Echukwu was pronounced dead at Watford General Hospital last night.<n>A neighbour paid tribute to him today, saying he was a'sweet guy'<n>A post mortem examination is due to be held today, coroner will open inquest.

Labour will launch billboard advert using image from famous 1979 poster.<n>But it will warn: ‘The doctor can’t see you now’ instead of 'Labour Isn’t Working’<n> poster features same long line of people used to illustrate dole queues.<n>But this time places them outside a waiting room.

Germanwings flight 4U814 to Venice was diverted to Stuttgart.<n>Airline said Airbus A319 aircraft appeared to be losing oil.<n>A passenger and a flight attendant required medical treatment.<n>Yesterday, another Germanwings flight was forced to make an emergency landing in Venice after a passenger and a flight attendant fell ill.

The Illume ArcLighter creates a ‘super high-intensity’ electrical arc.<n>It's claimed to be the first flameless gadget of its kind.<n>Instead of using a spark and fuel mechanism, it creates an electric arc.<n>This means there is no need to refill the lighter and it's rechargeable.<n>Inventors are raising money to put the lighter into production on Kickstarter and have almost doubled their goal.

Three proton beam therapy centres to open in the UK by 2017.<n>First centre in Cardiff will be operational by next year.<n>The treatment will be available to NHS cancer patients.<n>Cardiff-based Proton Partners International has formed the group.<n>Parents of Ashya King, who received proton beam therapy, welcome news.<n>They fled to Spain in a bid to get Ashya the treatment he needed.

Casey Levi filmed the moment he tried to get his son Sam to eat a California roll with a $10 prize up for grabs.<n>He stipulated that there must be no 'gagging or making any faces'<n>Footage shows the youngster stepping up to the challenge but backing down after a minute's hesitation and running off 'to be sick'<n>His younger sister Charlie confidently steps up to the mark.<n>'Don't jump around, I don't want you to choke,' Charlie's father says as he watches her struggling to chew the large morsel.

Official Sydney Royal Easter Show website lists the retail value of showbags.<n>Some bags cost more than it would to buy the items outright.<n>Others offer a mere 10 cents less than their retail value.<n>Some bags have grossly inaccurate value listings.

AmberMarie Irving-Elkins was in the hallway of a Los Angeles courthouse on Thursday when she felt her baby come - and couldn't make it to hospital in time.<n>A deputy ran over and told her to stop pushing - but she could not.<n>She pulled down her trousers and the baby's head was visible.<n>The baby was born healthy and Irving-Elkins is doing well.

US President Barack Obama said on Saturday that diplomacy was the best option to deal with Iran's contested nuclear program.<n>Iran and six world powers determined the outlines of a landmark agreement which would curb Iran's nuclear program and potentially lift economic sanctions.<n>Many of Obama's Republican opponents in Congress have been skeptical of a deal with Iran and suggested the US may be giving too much away in its negotiations.
Pete Bennett won the seventh series of Big Brother in 2006.<n>He has since struggled with drug addiction and Tourette's Syndrome.<n>He has now revealed that he is homeless and living off friends.

Raymond Howell Jr.'s body was found near a culvert in McKinney, Texas on Thursday morning and friends said he had died from a bullet wound.<n>Police have not confirmed how he died but friends said he had been bullied by older students at McKinney Boyd High - where he was a freshman.<n>School district officials have not responded to requests from DailyMail.com for comment on the claims.

Prime Minister pictured eating hotdog with knife and fork on a campaign stop.<n>He was eating with cutlery during a visit to a garden in Poole, Dorset.<n>It is likely to have been to avoid a repeat of Ed Miliband's bacon sandwich gaffe.<n>Mr Cameron insists he will not change the way he speaks or behaves to win voters.

Ukip leader accused of 'dangerous scaremongering' over high cost of treatment.<n>But official figures show more than half of those diagnosed were born overseas.<n>Labour leader Ed Miliband branded the comments 'disgusting'<n>Former England captain Gary Lineker wrote on Twitter: 'Farage is a d***!'

Steven Mathieson, 38, stabbed prostitute Luciana Maurer 44 times.<n>As she lay dead on floor, he called two more vice girls over to his home.<n>He raped them before they managed to flee while still naked.<n>His young son was asleep in bedroom next door while he carried out crimes.<n>Mathieson pleaded guilty to murder and rape at the High Court in Glasgow.<n>He now faces life in prison after the court heard he was high on cocaine.

Phil Blackwood was sentenced to two-and-a-half years with hard labour.<n>He posted a mocked-up image of Buddha wearing DJ headphones on Facebook.<n>The advert for a cheap-drinks night provoked outrage among Buddhists.<n>MPs and human rights campaigners said he is enduring appalling conditions.

Landon Carnie and his twin sister Lorie were thought to have died in 1975.<n>First flight of Operation Babylift crashed minutes after take-off.<n>Twin sister found huddled together in a paddy a day later and taken to U.S.<n>They were adopted by adoptive parents who had been told they were dead.<n>Now 41, Landon has returned to crash scene to mark 40th anniversary.

Susan House was out walking her dogs when the gas explosion tore through her home in Lincolnshire.<n>The 55-year-old miraculously survived the blast, which ripped off two walls and damaged the roof.<n>Her father George, 86, said the house will have to be 'flattened' after he said his daughter was 'lucky to be alive'<n>A neighbour said he heard a 'big bang' and thought it was a bomb going off.

The wreckage of a bus and train used in the dramatic scene from 1993 film The Fugitive lie abandoned in the Great Smokey Mountains.<n>Fans of the film will recognise the vehicles as those used by Harrison Ford's character Dr Richard Kimble when he escapes prison.<n>The dramatic scene cost an eye-watering $1.5million to shoot and was filmed in the North Carolina mountains.<n>The wreckage has since become a tourist attraction 23 years after it was shot and is still visible on location.

Jessica Chastain recently purchased a $5.1 million apartment at The Osborne in Manhattan's Midtown neighborhood.<n>The Osborne Apartments are allegedly haunted by the ghosts of opera singer Johanna Gadski and architect Alfredo Taylor.<n>Chastain most recently appeared on the big screen in the 2014 films Interstellar and A Most Violent Year.

Greg Gibbins was stabbed during a brawl on the Central Coast, NSW.<n>The 28-year-old went into cardiac arrest but later died in hospital.<n>A 25-year-old friend who tried to help Mr Gibbins is in a serious condition.<n>Police say the attack was a 'random attack' and that the pair were 'innocent victims'

The noose was found about 2am Wednesday in a plaza area at the heart of the Durham, North Carolina campus.<n>It sparked a mass protest on campus, with students carrying signs that read 'Black Lives Matter' and 'No  lynchings in Durham'<n>University officials have not identified the student in question, citing federal education laws protecting student privacy.
Orange has always been the most popular colour.<n>Blue has been on the rise - but is still far behind.<n>Swedish programmer created graphs to show change over time.

Picture of woman lying on ground with rifle strapped to her body has emerged.<n>TV footage showed police sealing off street in central Aksaray neighbourhood.<n>She was carrying rifle, two hand grenades and one pistol, it said.<n>Attack comes day after Turkish prosecutor died in hospital after members of DHKP-C stormed courthouse and took him hostage.

Trevor Duffy, 19, of the Bronx died in November after a night of heavy drinking during a party held by Zeta Beta Tau members at an off-campus home.<n>Two students who were expelled from the University at Albany want to return.<n>University investigation concluded Duffy's death was the result of hazing.

Leila Alavi was found dead inside a car in an underground car park at Auburn in Sydney's west in January.<n>The 26-year-old had taken out an apprehended violence order against her ex-husband Mokthar Hosseiniamraei.<n>Her sister Mitra has revealed Ms Alavi was on a mission to find a women's refuge to escape her estranged husband.<n>Ms Alavi was reportedly found by a distressed colleague.<n>Her ex-partner was charged with murder at Parramatta Court in January.

Officers in Paramus, Bergen County, responded to an animal that was headbutting a door in the wealthy community.<n>The goat was captured by three policemen around 6pm Saturday.<n>It was handed over to animal control and police are still searching for its owner.

The new iPhone app allows users to broadcast live video and audio to the internet.<n>Twitter's new streaming app has already attracted a number of complaints from women who have been sexually harassed or trolled.

Kinessa Johnson from Yelm, Washington State, works for the Veterans Empowered to Protect African Wildlife.<n>The organisation was founded by an ex-Marine and is made up of former soldiers who signed up post-9/11.<n>She joined last November after a four-year stint in the services as a weapons instructor and mechanic.<n>Photos on her Instagram and Facebook of her holding a rifle have been met with criticism online.<n>She insists the organisation's intention is not to harm anyone and refutes claims she is a 'poacher hunter'

New jab being given to people living in West African countries hit by virus.<n>Scientists hope that immunisation is possible with just one injection.<n>One jab protects against a disease which has killed more than 10,460 people.

Anjelica 'AJ' Hadsell, 18, was last seen driving near her parents' home in Norfolk, Virginia, on March 2.<n>Residents reported seeing a white van driving around the pond.<n>Her stepfather Wesley Hadsell was arrested last month amid claims he knows who took her.<n>He has a criminal record including dropped rape and kidnapping charges.

David Hyche developed the beeping egg device nine years ago.<n>He put a transmitter in a plastic egg so his daughter could join in.<n>The Alabama Institute for Deaf and Blind has used the technology this year.

Lib Dem leader says idea of more than two parties forming government is not 'going to work'<n>He said it would be a'messy' way to run the country and risked instability.<n>Mr Clegg told voters to go to the ballot box on May 7 expecting a hung parliament.

The Queen will lead the nation at a religious service commemorating the 70th anniversary of Victory in Europe (VE) Day.<n>A chain of beacons will be lit across the country and Spitfire and Lancaster bomber planes will take to the skies.<n>The Queen famously joined the jubilant victory celebrations in London and danced the conga through the Ritz Hotel before joining crowds outside Buckingham Palace.

Vanilla Ice, whose real name is Robert Van Winkle, was charged with grand theft in February.<n>He was filming a reality show inside an adjacent home when he allegedly stole items from the property.<n>He will perform 100 hours of community service and pay $1,333 to the estate of the neighbor.

Colin Barnett said'some good' has come out of the year-long search for missing Malaysia Airline plane.<n>The Premier for Western Australia made the comments at the launch of a new blueprint for marine science in WA.<n>Search parties have not been successful in recovering MH370 since it disappeared on March 8 last year.<n>This comes as the wife of an Australian passenger on MH370 spoke of her heartache, revealing she is yet to tell her children why their father hasn't come home.

Blackadder actor was going through customs at Newcastle Airport.<n>Staff thought his pease pudding was Semtex, a plastic explosive.<n>Traveller was allowed through with his snacks but warned to pack them in hold luggage next time he was travelling.

Shigella infections, otherwise known as 'Delhi Belly' or 'Montezuma's revenge' were traced to people who had recently traveled to the Dominican Republic, India or other countries.<n>The symptoms include diarrhea, stomach cramps and nausea.<n>The superbug sickened at least 243 people, in 32 states and Puerto Rico.<n>The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention released the report Thursday.

The echidna was spotted paddling out to sea off Victoria's Mornington Peninsula.<n>The video was posted online by YouTube user Emma B.<n>Echidnas, like many native Australian animals, are 'proficient' swimmers.<n>They like fresh water to the open ocean.

Indonesian officials probing labor abuses told the migrant workers today they were allowing them to leave for another island by boat.<n>More than 300 fishermen emerged from nearby trawlers, villages and even the jungle to make the trip.<n>They were finally being rescued by the Indonesian Fisheries Ministry after officials issued a moratorium on fishing to crack down on poaching.

The letters were expected to bring in anywhere from $300,000 to $600,000 at Sotheby's auction.<n>The current owner of the signage is Yankee Hall of Famer Reggie Jackson, who purchased the 10-feet-tall letters for an undisclosed amount after the stadium saw its final game in 2008.<n>Jackson said he bought the letters 'on a lark'

Asylum seekers and refugees applying for minicab licences are exempt.<n>Rules laid down by Transport for London mean they do not have to reveal whether they have a criminal history.<n>Anyone else applying for a cab licence must undergo criminal records checks.

Colin Turnbull, 69, caught having sex with Rozina Khanim, 39, in classroom.<n>Governor at Priory School in Birmingham found pair in 'compromised position'<n>Mr Turnbull, a married teacher, has worked at the school for nine years.<n>He hired out a room to offer private tuition to pupils looking to pass 11+.<n>Staff told him to 'never return' and said behaviour was 'wholly unacceptable'

Prime Minister's wife swooped into Rochester and Strood in Kent.<n>Visited a special school in the constituency, which Ukip hold by-election.<n>David Cameron has made no secret of his desire to kick Mark Reckless's 'fat arse' out of the Commons.

The toothfish poaching vessel Thunder issued a distress signal on Monday.<n>The environmental group Bob Barker launched a rescue mission.<n>The crew were held in life rafts and were rescued safely.<n>The vessel was trailed for more than 100 days before it started to submerged.

Naughty Boy, real name Shahid Khan, has been working on Zayn's music.<n>He posted a clip of what was thought to be his first single on Twitter.<n>The track, entitled I Won't Mind, sent both One Direction fans and Louis Tomlinson into turmoil.<n>Naughty Boy has since removed the clip.

Labour’s shadow chancellor looked down at his feet and laughed nervously.<n>He eventually answered correctly following a ten second pause.<n>Mr Balls said it was 'always a dangerous thing for politicians to answer'

The Scandfit Try Size bra comes in three different varieties.<n>The smallest is a B cup, the largest a D cup and the largest a DD.<n>The £150 bra claims to take you from a B-cup to a DD in an instant.<n>It comes with four pairs of inserts labelled one to four, according to their size.<n>Each bra cup has an internal insert which can be layered to create different sizes of cleavage.

Earthquakes cause Earth to oscillate in a constant ring like a bell.<n>As short waves near the surface they create weak microseismic waves.<n>This is combined with long waves dragging across the ocean's floor.<n>These waves create a constant hum that can last for longer than 50 seconds.

By 2100 there will be one per cent more Muslims than Christians, study shows.<n>Number of Muslims will increase at more than double the rate of world's population.<n>By 2050, Muslims will make up ten per cent of Europe's population.<n>Atheists, agnostics and those who are religiously unaffiliated will decline from 16 per cent of world's population to 13 per cent in next four decades.

Yahya Rashid, 19, of Willesden, north west London, was arrested.<n>Arrested at Luton Airport having landed on a flight from Istanbul.<n>He was taken to a central London police station where he was charged.

Becky Watts, 16, went missing from her Bristol home in February.<n>Her dismembered body parts were found 11 days later in Barton Hill.<n>An inquest into her death has been opened and adjourned until August.<n>Her step-brother Nathan Matthews, 28, faces a single count of murder.<n>His girlfriend Shauna Hoare, 21, is accused of perverting the court of justice.<n>Four others are accused of assisting an offender.

Barronelle Stutzman, 70, of Richland, Washington, was fined $1,000 in March for refusing to sell a same-sex couple wedding flowers.<n>The couple, Robert Ingersoll and Curt Freed, were longtime customers at Arlene's Flowers and Gifts.<n>When Ingersoll asked for flowers for his 2013 wedding, Stutzman said her'relationship with Jesus Christ' wouldn't allow her to do it.<n>The couple got married in their home with 11 guests and flowers from another florist.<n>A crowdfunding campaign to help pay the fine has raised over $87,000 in just a few days.

Ralph Vaughan Williams's work topped Classic FM Hall of Fame poll.<n>Listeners voted for the piece after more than 200,000 people voted.<n>It topped the poll last year and four years ago was named the nation's favourite Desert Island Discs tune.<n>It was played as Hayley Cropper took a lethal cocktail to end her suffering on Coronation Street last year.

M&S general merchandise sales, mainly women's clothes, up 0.7%.<n>This is the first rise after 14 consecutive quarters of losses.<n>Belinda Earl, fashion chief, won the role in September 2012.<n>She ran Debenhams, Jaeger and Aquascutum before M&S.<n>Also behind £199 suede skirt worn by Alexa Chung and Olivia Palermo.

Simon Mitchell, 44, stole from Donna's Dream House, a charity for terminally ill children.<n>He claimed to have celebrity contacts to gain the trust of the charity.<n>Mitchell was meant to be helping the charity following arson attack in 2011.<n>He pleaded guilty to two counts of theft at Preston Crown Court.

Becky Schoenig of St. Louis, Missouri was shocked when her new Ford Fusion was stolen from her driveway Monday.<n>On April 1, she learned that police had found the car and would be returning it to her with a few minor changes.<n>She noticed that the rims had been spray painted red, there was red detailing on the sides of the car, and her steering wheel now had some orange accents.<n>Schoenig is now getting the vehicle professionally cleaned to deal with the strong smell of cigarettes and marijuana.

Bryan Santana, 20, of Orlando, Florida, found guilty of first-degree murder.<n>Killed roommate Shelby Fazio, 23, in October last year, then mutilated her body and had sex with it.<n>Judge Renee Roche said Santana has 'no glimmer of humanity' in closing statements.<n>Family of victim cried in court as verdict was handed down.

Steven Howie, 28, left his girlfriend with 18 separate injuries after attack.<n>He punched, kicked and kneed Karen Murray, 31, over an hour.<n>Pair were staying at Carronbridge Hotel in Stirling on New Year's Eve.<n>They had been at a cancelled party at Stirling Castle.<n>But argument quickly turned violent after they returned to their room.<n>She was unable to call police because inn was so isolated.

Shaquille Omar Hallisey's attack in Cardiff was described as'savage'<n>His victim Matthew Leeke, 38, was left with a fractured skull after the assault.<n>Witnesses said three men were arguing with Mr Leeke before the attack.<n>Paramedics treated cuts to the back of Mr Leeke's head and his forehead.<n>Hallisey admitted wounding with intent to cause grievous bodily harm.<n>He was jailed for four years at Cardiff Crown Court after pleading guilty.

Janet Muller was found dead in the boot of a burning car on March 13.<n>Police have released CCTV footage of the 21-year-old on the night before.<n>Student was seen walking in subway in Portslade at 10.30pm on March 12.<n>Family pay tribute to 'inspirational, passionate and caring person'

Kevin Franklin, 58, siphoned off the fortune over an eight-year period.<n>He used the money to marry his new wife in the Italian Alps.<n>Meanwhile his 80-year-old victim was forced to borrow from his children.<n>Franklin was jailed for four-and-a-half years at Warwick Crown Court.

Benito Gonzalez Jr., 46, pleaded guilty to a lewdness charge after allegedly masturbating in a Starbucks.<n>The father-of-three says his post-traumatic stress disorder is to blame.<n>The 17-year Camden police veteran says he has been battling PTSD since a 2011 incident when a drug dealer shot him in the head.

Chef will work in team of six and spend three months away from London.<n>Must order in seasonal ingredients from Balmoral kitchen garden.<n>Royal job pays £28,000-a-year but there is accommodation available.

Pope Francis urged the international community not to 'look the other way'<n>He asked for 'tangible help' from communities for Christians persecuted.<n>The pontiff, 78, has been increasingly vocal about the persecution of Christians.<n>He spoke to tourists and Catholic pilgrims in St Peter's Square in Vatican City.

Eight-strong team painted phone booths in Beijing in Baymax style.<n>They painted 30 in five hours to raise a smile for burnt-out residents.<n>The project is called 'Beijing Warmth' and has been dubbed 'Baymax craze'<n>However the work may be removed after officials said it was wrong colour.

Swindon factory will become the global production hub for the next generation Civic.<n>The new Civic will be exported to the world, including Japan and the USA.<n>Just over half of the vehicles produced at Swindon are exported to the Continent.

Author of new novel, Kate, reveals the scientific and cultural reasons behind twins.<n>Kate and Ashley are identical twins but have very different looks.<n>Many African societies abhor twins because they resemble litter.<n>In Greek mythology, twins were believed to be the product of human intercourse.<n>Not all monozygotic twins are truly identical.<n>Some are ‘mirror image’ twins, others are more closely related.

Data bosses caught boasting to the Mail of their underhand tactics.<n>They admitted ignoring an official no-call list meant to protect the vulnerable.<n>Said they could never be honest with people about consequences of passing on personal information.<n>Offered to sell information on people with pensions who completed a survey.

Helaman Barlow was chief of the towns of Colorado City, Arizona, and Hildale, Utah but has now left the Fundamentalist Church of Latter-Day Saints.<n>He said he acted on the orders of the church out of fear his family would be taken away.<n>He said he taped conversations with law enforcement officials and passed them onto Jeffs when he was on the run.<n>His account comes amid reports that Jeffs continues to direct the church despite being in prison for marrying and raping two 12-year-old girls.

Aer Lingus flight EI 660 had left Dublin at 8.30am and was forced to return.<n>The aircraft is undergoing an inspection to determine the cause of the issue.<n>The flight was carrying 120 passengers to Vienna.<n>It was the second incident at Dublin Airport on the day.<n>Earlier in the day, two Ryanair planes collided on the runway.<n>Part of one of the winglets was ripped off, causing disruption for hundreds.

A bathing box on Brighton beach in Melbourne has sold for $276,000.<n>The box was first constructed in 1862 and is part of the city's tourism history.<n>A mechanic's garage in Paddington in Sydney has sold for $1.2 million.<n>The grey-fronted building was built as a fire station in 1917.<n>It is now expected to be turned into a three-bedroom, four-storey house.

Theodosia Aresti, 71, moved into her new-build flat in London five years ago.<n>But a blocked pipe unleashed a 'tsunami of sewage' into her flat.<n>The pensioner says she now hopes to move after the nightmare.

Breakfast served at Manchester cafe has equivalent of 97 teaspoons of sugar.<n>Easter Feast includes two types of cereal, marshmallows and mini eggs.<n>Contains three types of flavoured milk and is served in a chocolate 'bowl'

Hayleigh Mcbay, 17, pretended to dump David Clarke via WhatsApp.<n>But he also pretended that he wanted to break up with her.<n>The joke backfired spectacularly when he revealed the truth.<n>Hayleigh then uploaded a screenshot of the conversation to Twitter.<n>The tweet has seen more than 12,000 retweets and favourited more than 11,000.

Jack Rivera, a New York trucker, captured the collision on his dashcam as he drove along the Interstate 35E in Texas last Wednesday.<n>The driver of a black SUV, identified as 49-year-old Laura Michelle Mayeaux, came off at the 397 exit and veered over to the wrong side of the lane.<n>She then steers head-on into a truck which rolls over on its side with debris flying everywhere.<n>Rivera said he got out of his vehicle to see if he could offer any assistance to the parties involved before authorities arrived.<n>Mayeaux later admitted to police she
Nearly 3,400 miles were covered with 99 percent of the drive in fully automated mode.<n>Nine-day trip crossed 15 states and the District of Columbia.<n>Team collected nearly three terabytes of data.

Bloomberg 'considering' running for Boris Johnson's job in 2016, reports say.<n>London mayor Johnson will stand down in 2016, leaving the position vacant.<n>The former New York mayor has significant business interests in the city.<n>He has previously said he thinks of London as his'second home'

Wicked Waffle in North End, Portsmouth, is serving up the sweet treat for £25.<n>It contains four waffles, 12 scoops of ice-cream, four chocolate flakes and a giant portion of whipped cream.<n>But diners can clear their plate within 45 minutes with no toilet breaks.<n>They are awarded the meal for free and a winners' T-shirt.<n>Only two people have managed to finish the Wicked Waffle Challenge.

Disabled cat, called Freeman, was sitting in its front garden when dogs pounced.<n>The two dogs dragged the cat on to its neighbour's lawn before tearing into it.<n>CCTV shows a woman collect the dogs and walk off leaving cat to die in agony.<n>Police are investigating after a neighbour passed the footage on.

Kathleen Blomberg was reunited with her two cats, Kitty Cordelia and Sebastian, on Wednesday.<n>The American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals found the the traumatized animals under Blomberg's bed.<n>The heavily damaged apartment where Blomberg lived is still under a full-vacate order.<n>Authorities now believe the explosion was caused by an illegally tapped gas line.

Cheryl Howe, 32, from Morecambe, was diagnosed with PCOS at the age of 12.<n>She suffers from excessive hair growth on her face, breasts, stomach and legs.<n>She had heavy periods from the age of eight and had periods for 28 days a month.<n>She has spent six years fighting for treatment on the NHS.<n>She finally got approved for NHS funding for laser hair removal treatment.<n>The mother-of-two is booked in for the £10,000 treatment in September.

Edward Nudel, 41, was indicted Wednesday on multiple charges after allegedly strangling a relative's dog.<n>Police say Nudel broke into his relative's home and strangled a 2-year-old Pomeranian named Lola 'in an especially depraved and sadistic manner'<n>Nudel and the relative reportedly had an argument and, after strangling the dog, he called the relative and said 'I killed Lola'

High Court throws out rules introduced to stop violent prisoners being transferred.<n>The policy was brought in after fugitive armed robber Michael Wheatley walked out of an open jail in May while on day release.<n>Wheatley absconded Standford Hill prison in Kent and went on a robbing spree.<n>After being caught he was told he must serve at least eight years in jail.<n>But High Court rules excluding transfers for prisoners with a history of absconding was unlawful.

Dr Joe Hanson, a science writer and biologist based in Austin, Texas, calculated what the human body is in terms of chemical elements.<n>He revealed that a 'human molecule' might contain 375 million atoms of hydrogen, 132 million atoms of oxygen and 85 million atoms of carbon.<n>By comparison, this human molecule contains just one atom of cobalt and three molecules of the metal molybdenum.

Remington 'Remi' Walden was killed three years ago when his family's Jeep Grand Cherokee exploded when it was rear-ended.<n>Jurors ruled that the SUV manufacturer, Chrysler, acted with reckless disregard for human life in selling the family of Remi Walden a 1999 Jeep with a gas tank mounted behind the rear axle.<n> Walden, of Bainbridge, Georgia, was killed when the Jeep driven by his aunt was hit from behind by a pickup truck in March 2012.<n>The verdict came nearly two years after Chrysler compromised with a federal safety agency and agreed to a scaled-down recall of some older-model Jeep

The first nude gallery tour of the National Gallery of Australia took place on Wednesday night.<n>The hour-long tour was led by Melbourne-based artist Stuart Ringholt.<n>The tour was in aid of the NGA's current exhibition, 'James Turrell: A Retrospective'<n>Ringholt has led nude gallery tours at the Museum of Contemporary Art in Sydney and MONA in Tasmania.
