Zhou Yongkang is accused of corruption and leaking of state secrets.<n>All-powerful Chinese Communist Party has always been reluctant to admit wrongdoing.<n>But move to announce charges against Zhou is being touted by official media.<n>It is being touted as proof that the leadership is determined to take action.

Kathryn Beale, 41, is part of cottage industry that prepares fresh placenta.<n>She whizzes it into smoothies or grinds it into pills for women convinced of its health benefits.<n>Mothers have reported powerful healing properties from eating placenta.<n>Other celebrities who have eaten their own placentas include January Jones.<n>Swindon Council is claiming that Kathryn's services pose a danger.<n>It is taking her to court saying they want to stop her from trading.

Christie was questioned by a teacher about a $225million legal settlement he made with ExxonMobil.<n>The state originally wanted $8.9billion from the oil company, and Kathy Mooney says that would have had a huge impact on pensions for public employees.<n>Christie cut Mooney off, saying she didn't have enough'detail' to know about the deal.

WARNING GRAPHIC IMAGES.<n>Kadeem Brown, 25, was hit by a taxi in the Bronx and killed.<n>Emilo Garcia, 44, was driving without a license after suffering a seizure.<n>He then slid across the median and into the side of a building.<n>A five-year-old girl was hit and killed by the cab.

Shia paramilitary fighters looting and setting fire to buildings in Tikrit.<n>Head of Salahuddin provincial council said 'hundreds of houses' had been burnt.<n>Comes as Iraqi forces ordered to oppose vandalism in city retaken from IS.<n>Prime Minister Haider al-Abadi called on Iraqi forces to arrest those responsible.

More than 7million gardens in Britain have now been paved over.<n>Royal Horticultural Society says replacing grass with plants boosts mood.<n>RHS is urging people to plant trees, shrubs, climbers, hedges or flowers.

NSW Police have shared a bizarre image on their Facebook page.<n>The image shows a car parked on a busy road covered in chili peppers.<n>The incident occurred on Bridge St in Hornsby on the Upper North Shore of Sydney.<n>It is unclear what the car owner's offence was.

Charles Kane of Spencerport, New York was arrested Thursday as he met up with a 14-year-old girl for sex.<n>Kane, a married band teacher with two young daughters, had posted a Craigslist ad seeking a young girl for a daddy/daughter relationship.<n>He had been communicating with an undercover cop for months, and the cop posed as the girl in this case.<n>Kane was arrested when he showed up to meet the girl at a local movie theater with a full box of condoms on him.

Angela Collins and Margaret Elizabeth Hanson used Xytex Corp to start a family in 2006 believing they had a strict vetting process.<n>They were told their donor had an IQ of 160, a bachelor of science degree in neuroscience, a master’s degree in artificial intelligence, and was working on his PhD in neuroscience engineering.<n>But in June 2014 they discovered his name was James Christian Aggeles.<n>He is said to have schizophrenia, has spent time in jail and dropped out of college, and his pictures had been doctored to remove a large mole from his cheek.<n>The couple are now suing the company

Mohammad Liaqat launched into 'racist tirade' at Mount Carmel School.<n>34-year-old assaulted headmaster during rampage in front of shocked parents.<n>He was found guilty of assault and racially or religiously aggravated behaviour.<n>Liaqat will be sentenced at Burnley Crown Court in June.

Jesse Roepcke, 27, from Summerfield, was arrested Sunday for pointing a laser at passing cars.<n>As he was being strip-searched in jail, a bag of marijuana fell out of his rectum.<n>Roepcke told police he was just having fun with the laser and did not know it was illegal.

First-of-its-kind robotic vehicle recently dove to depths never before visited under Antarctica's Ross Ice Shelf.<n>Icefin was deployed (and retrieved) the vehicle through a 12-inch diameter hole through 20 meters of ice and another 500 meters of water to the sea floor.<n>Will help understand how Antarctica's ice shelves are changing under warming conditions.

Kayla Mooney, who is in her first year teaching science at Danbury High School in Connecticut, turned herself into police on Tuesday.<n>She 'had sexual contact with a male student off campus late last year'<n>She has been charged with second-degree sexual assault and providing alcohol to a minor and was released without bail.

The so-called 'blood moon' could be seen by billions of people across the western U.S., Canada and Australia.<n>The eclipse is the third in a series of four blood moons, with the final one expected on September 28.<n>Unlike more lengthy eclipses, the moon in this case only skimmed the upper part of Earth's shadow.

Number of GPs from abroad up by 11 per cent in a decade, figures show.<n>Foreigners now account for almost one family doctor in five in the UK.<n>NHS is facing a shortage because many GPs are retiring early.<n>Others are moving overseas in search of better conditions.

HIV specialists and network security experts at University College London created a simulation of how the virus spreads.<n>They say the spread is similar to that of computer worms such as the highly damaging 'Conficker' worm.<n>Model accurately predicted patients' progression from HIV to AIDS in a major clinical trial.<n>It says early treatment is key to staving off AIDS.

Under-25s saw wages rise nine times faster than over-50s, figures show.<n>In last three months of 2014, 5.4 per cent of 18-25-year-olds changed jobs.<n>Only 1.2 per cent of over-50s changed jobs, according to ONS data.<n>Critics said employers were taking advantage of older workers.

Jan Hansen's egg is so big that it took him three days to put together.<n>It is made from layers of Belgian chocolate which covers an iron frame.<n>The creation had to be completed using a step ladder.<n>The chocolatier hopes to raise £1,000 from the sale of the egg.

Daniel DeMarco was arrested on Friday at 2.45pm in Elmwood Park, New Jersey.<n>Police on scene believed DeMarco, 28, looked suspicious as they were patrolling the area for narcotics travel.<n>They found him in possession of a bag of crack cocaine, a hypodermic syringe and drug paraphernalia.<n>DeMarco was also charged with being under the influence of a controlled dangerous substance and DWI.<n>He is still employed by the New Milford, New Jersey, police department but they have not said if he will face suspension.

Last year the TSA were allowed to keep $675,000 in spare change dropped by travellers.<n>The sum was $107,000 more than what passengers left behind in 2012.<n>According to federal law, if no one comes back to claim the money the TSA are allowed to keep it.

Referees and officials were struck with projectiles by angry supporters.<n>Sideline interchange official Darren Alchin was taken to hospital with a broken shoulder blade after slipping over.<n>South Sydney Rabbitohs sealed a final minute 18-17 victory over the Bulldogs in an intense encounter at ANZ Stadium in Sydney.<n>Fans turned on referee Gerard Sutton and his colleagues after they penalised Bulldogs captain James Graham in the final minute.

Youtube user Joe Penna solved 1,296 Rubik's Cubes in three-to-four days.<n>He teamed up with animator Jeff Schweikart to create the animated video.<n>The one minute and 25 second clip features a robot and a female robot.<n>Penna says the elaborate project took a total of four people to complete.

Photographer Scott Gable spent four months travelling across the region documenting the labour and threadbare equipment used to harvest the carbohydrate-rich food.<n>The pictures were taken over a period of four months across China, Thailand, Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia.<n>Mr Gable said he was determined to capture every stage of production with his Rice Project.

80 current and former leaders say there is clear evidence that academy-style freedoms are benefiting a generation of children.<n>Letter signed by heads of good and outstanding autonomous schools.<n>They say most successful education systems benefit from academy freedoms.

Colin Mcinerney, 28, claims he was beaten and had his head stomped on.<n>He was allegedly attacked by a man, two teenagers and a boy aged only about 10.<n>His girlfriend, Rachael Sheppard, said he had just gestured at the family by waving with his little pinky as people do in Darwin.<n>Sheppard said the older man allegedly started bashing Mr Mcinerney.<n>Police were called to the McDonalds near Darwin about 7.15pm following reports of a 'violent disturbance'

Mike Holpin, 56, says he wants more children because it is 'God's will'<n>He has a family tree tattoo of his children and grandchildren.<n>Former friends say his claims to have 40 children are nonsense.

Pat Ingles, 69, from Edinburgh, lost her husband to prostate cancer 12 years ago.<n>She now wants to make the most of the time she has left.<n>She likes to party and stay out dancing on tables.<n>She also enjoys pole dancing and gym sessions.

French MPs have voted to punish anyone who 'incites' people to become dangerously thin with a year in prison and huge fines.<n>Law will be studied closely in Britain after MPs highlighted the irresponsibility of fashion websites.<n>Around 40,000 people suffer from anorexia in France, the vast majority women and teenage girls.

Toni Elliot, 53, was eating at Puckett's Boat House in Franklin, Tennessee.<n>She spat out the mouthful and discovered a pearl in her hand.<n>Forty-nine precious stones followed.<n>As naturally-occurring pearls are rare, it's expected that Elliot's stash could fetch a princely sum.

Small businesses will be forced to close over the Easter long weekend.<n>Penalty rates will come into force across Good Friday, Saturday, Sunday and Easter Monday.<n>Young workers will not be able to earn money this weekend.<n>Too Big to Ignore campaign will allow businesses to put up posters in their windows explaining why they are closed.
Fashion retailers have started offering their own make-up ranges.<n>From Marks and Spencer to Primark, they're all at it.<n>Claire Coleman put some of the biggest beauty brands to the test.

Harold Ekeh, 18, has been accepted to every Ivy League college.<n>He is straight A student with SAT score of 2270 at Elmont Memorial High School.<n>He moved from Nigeria with his parents to Long Island 10 years ago.<n>Says his parents' struggle to fit in inspired him to succeed.

Prisoners, made up of women, children and the elderly, were freed southwest of Kirkuk.<n>They believed they were being led to their execution, but instead were piled onto minibuses.<n>Yazidis are said to be in poor health and bearing signs of abuse and neglect.

Orana Wildlife Park in New Zealand's Christchurch is one of the few zoos in the world which has installed a moving cage.<n>Visitors can step over the fence and into the depths of a lion's den during feeding time, if they dare.<n>The spectators are mere centimetres away from the huge animal, sitting inside their lair to see every whisker, tooth and hair.

Personal injury claims company Direct Assist fined £80,000 by watchdog.<n>Firm told one complainant they were likely to be called for three years.<n>Information Commissioner's Office said it registered 801 concerns.<n>Every complaint came from people who had not given permission for company to call them, the ICO said.

Jamyra Gallmon, 21, has been charged with first-degree felony murder while armed over the killing of David Messerschmitt.<n>The 30-year-old lawyer was found stabbed to death in his hotel room on February 9.<n>Police released surveillance video of a 'person of interest' who was seen entering the Donovan Hotel shortly after Messerschmitt texted his wife to say he would be home in an hour.<n>Sources told NBC Washington that Gallmon is the woman in the video and that she went to the hotel for a'sexual encounter'<n>The 21-year-old attended Forestville Military Academy in

RunBase will allow visitors to learn about the world's most prestigious road race, run a replica of the course on a treadmill or see artifacts from its 118-year history.<n>It will give runners a place to gather before going for a jog by the Charles River, and then shower and change before heading back to work or to the convention center across the street.<n>A combined effort between the B.A.A., Adidas and longtime shoe-seller Marathon Sports, which is providing the staff and retail know-how, the Boston RunBase is a shoeseum of sorts.

Fitness guru Ashy Bines has admitted some of the healthy eating recipes she had shared had been ripped off from other websites.<n>The 26-year-old confirmed the revelations in a YouTube video.<n>Ms Bines also reveals she has been abused by online trolls.<n>One user said they hoped her unborn child would get Down's Syndrome.

China, South Korea and Japan have all banned new charter flights of Thai carriers after an audit by the UN's International Civil Aviation Organization.<n>According to CASA, Thai Airways is the only Thai airline that regularly operates in Australia.<n>The regulator claims to have made contact with the airline and the Thai aviation safety regulator for 'further detailed information'

Tidwell Middle School student started a blog called 'Killing Children'<n>There were 11 stories published online that featured classmates' names.<n>The boy was removed from class and his parents withdrew him from school.<n>But as students returned from spring break, the boy was allowed to return.<n>The district confirmed they allowed him to return, saying it was a horror story.<n>The DA has ruled the blog was protected by the First Amendment, and no charges will be laid.

Calcium formations on ‘Altamura Man’ suggest he was 128,000 to 187,000 years old.<n>Scientists plan to sequence his DNA to see if they can reveal new details about the evolution of our ancient ancestors.<n>It is believed Altamura Man was left in such a peculiar spot after falling in a well and getting stuck.

Locations in Ceredigion, Powys and Pembrokeshire are being used to radicalise Muslims, police say.<n>Those involved in such activities 'take part in seemingly ordinary activities'<n>But they 'have an ulterior motive', says officer from Wales Extremism Unit.

Freddie Hussey, three, was killed when trailer mounted pavement and crushed him.<n>His mother Donna, 32, has been targeted by trolls on Facebook over death.<n>She had just dropped son Archie, eight, off at school when tragedy happened.<n>Driver Tony Davies, 38, was spared jail after admitting causing death by careless driving.

Photographer Victor Albert Prout travelled along the Thames in a makeshift boat, capturing images of landmarks.<n>He installed a dark room on board his punt, and developed the images on the spot, taking pictures from the river.<n>His collection is the oldest documented record of Britain's best known landmarks, such as Windsor Castle.<n>The images, which include pictures of Richmond Bridge and the Houses of Parliament, are to be sold at Oxford Book Fair.

Ukip MEP Diane James insists party would carry on without Farage.<n>Says party has'very, very high-calibre of individuals' waiting to lead.<n>Mr Farage has vowed to stand down if he fails to win Thanet South seat.<n>A poll in February put him on course to win the seat by a small margin.

Ephedra foeminea waits for the full moon to 'bloom' and produces a sugary droplet to attract pollinating insects.<n>The droplets ooze from the plant’s female organs where seeds are produced.<n>When a butterfly lands on one of the tasty transparent orbs at night, the pollen it’s carrying is used to fertilise the seed.<n>Researchers from Stockholm University noticed the droplets at the same time of the year having conducted four years of research.

Joseph Getty, 26, was caught driving his Range Rover through Belgrave Square while double the legal drinking limit.<n>He pleaded guilty to drink-driving and received a 20-month ban as well as a fine of £1,000, which he paid immediately.<n>His conviction came just a day after his relative Andrew Getty was found dead at his Hollywood home.

Bryan Santana of Orlando, Florida is accused of stabbing and strangling his roommate Shelby Fazio then having sex with her corpse.<n>Prosecutors said during opening statements on Wednesday that he reveled in the pain he caused her.<n>One of those messages read: 'I'm not sorry for what I did'<n>This came just days after Santana's lawyer argued that he is not competent to stand trial.

John Noble, 53, sent a 270 page package to the Las Vegas Review-Journal explaining his suicide.<n>Included was a two hour DVD in which he blamed the M Resort's staff for having him banned from the buffet.<n>Shot himself in the head on Easter Sunday while waiting in line.<n>He won a lifetime free buffet pass to the resort in 2010.<n>In 2013 he allegedly harassed female members of staff after the death of his mother.

Police beat workers at'sweatshop' factory in Mauritius over pay and conditions.<n>Workers were protesting about their pay, treatment and concerns about a missing worker.<n>69 of the women have been deported to Bangladesh and scores more fear for their jobs.<n>The Mail on Sunday exposed the factory where women make 'feminist' T-shirts.

Peter Thurston, 80, built the vessel to take his mind off his divorce.<n>He spends summers on the boat and winters on the water in Kent.<n>The vessel has an oven, fridge freezer, shower, toilet and double bed.

UK has now met the controversial target to spend 0.7 per cent of national income on overseas aid.<n>But new EU accounting rules are being brought in which change the way national income is measured.<n>New total includes estimates of parts of the black economy such as prostitution and drug running.<n>It means that Gross National Income will rise – pushing up the amount that will need to be spent on aid to meet the 0.7 per cent target.

Wikileaks founder's father John Shipton sold his Newtown home for $1.42 million on Wednesday.<n>The two-bedroom property was first put on the market for at least $1.1 million, but failed to sell in an initial auction in mid-March.<n>The property was originally built in the 1870s as the servant's quarters to a Victorian villa next door.<n>Assange has sought political asylum in the Ecuadorian embassy in London since June 2012 after Britain attempted to extradite him to Sweden for questioning over sexual assault charges.

For nearly 40 years, physicists have argued that black holes suck in information and then evaporate without leaving behind clues as to what they once contained.<n>But a new study shows that information isn't lost once it enters a black hole.<n>This is an important discovery because even physicists who believed information remains in black holes have struggled to show, mathematically, how this happens.

University of Sydney is running a pilot of a 17-week bridging diploma for Year 11 students at the elite school Scot's College.<n>Students who completed the course successfully were guaranteed places in a number of undergraduate level courses.<n>Staff were worried over how the course was advertised to Year 11 students 'as an alternative to completing the HSC'<n>National Union of Students president Rose Steele said it was'really concerning' if the program was only open to students who could afford it.

The world's largest atom-smashing machine is located in Switzerland.<n>It was shut down two years ago after confirming existence of Higgs boson.<n>Scientists hope it will now unlock even more fundamental secrets.

Drug company Novartis accused of trying to block trials aimed at promoting a ‘cheap, safe and effective’ treatment for sight loss on the NHS.<n>The BMJ says Novartis has ‘bullied’ experts who have tried to prove that a cancer drug can be used to treat one of the most common forms of blindness.<n>Avastin is just as effective at tackling wet age-related macular degeneration as the current treatment, Lucentis.<n>It is estimated that widespread use of the drug would save the NHS around £102million a year.

Dramatic pictures show the moment an Audi deliberately crashes into a bus.<n>The crash was part of a £1million 'crash for cash' scam that took place.<n>Passengers on the bus were allowed to falsely claim from insurers.<n>Ringleader John Smith, 45, from North Wales, faces jail for the elaborate fraud.

Penny Wong tweeted a picture of her daughter Alexandra and her partner Sophie Allouache on Tuesday morning.<n>The couple welcomed their second child, Hannah, on Good Friday in Adelaide.<n>It is the second child for the long-term couple who welcomed their eldest daughter Alexandra in 2011.

The 5,300-ton HMS Talent limped back to port with a huge dent.<n>Royal Navy top brass are investigating the incident.<n>Defence officials refused to disclose exact details of the crash.<n>But they were adamant HMS Talent struck ‘floating ice’ rather than a Russian sub.

Etienne Gould Nunan was born at Melbourne's Monash Hospital in July last year.<n>He was born with a hole in his heart and a brain bleed and weighed 558 grams.<n>He developed pneumonia, suffered a collapsed lung and endured 58 blood transfusions to fight infections.<n>But he was finally allowed to go home after spending almost five months in hospital.

Many of the super-rich are having them built.<n>They include Benedict Cumberbatch, Sir Philip Green and Roman Abramovich.<n>Plans for a Beckham home show a lower-groundfloor ‘cinema room’<n>The room measures some 300 sq ft — just over twice the size of the average British living room.

Council chiefs condemned for claiming it was too dangerous to collect litter.<n>Winchester Council said its annual clean-up had been hit by new rules.<n>Health and Safety Executive denied tightening rules and said councils were 'over-interpreting' legislation.

Julian Lines was filmed climbing sheer rock face in the Cairngorms, Scotland.<n>The 42-year-old was using just his hands and feet for support as he scaled cliff.<n>He was filmed grappling to find footholds and handholds as he climbed to summit.<n>Mr Lines, from Northern Ireland, has been solo climbing for almost 30 years.

London Ambulance Service has just filled 225 vacant posts with applicants from Sydney and Melbourne.<n>They were recruited on the back of a series of practical demonstrations on dummies, a written exam and an interview that lasted in all between four and six hours.<n>It is the latest example of how the NHS is recruiting overseas because it has failed to train enough staff in Britain to meet the needs of the rising and ageing population.<n>London Ambulance Service has been the hardest hit by this exodus. Currently 340 posts are vacant, a fifth of the total workforce needed. Last year alone more than 230 paramedics quit.<n>Paramedics are taking up

SNP leader Nicola Sturgeon said retirement age should be frozen.<n>She said it was unfair for pensioners in Scotland because they don’t live as long as their counterparts in the rest of the country.<n>She also called for a huge inflation-busting increase in the State pension.<n>Parts of Scotland have among the lowest life expectancies of any part of the UK.

Netanyahu said in a televised statement: 'A deal based on this framework would threaten the survival of Israel'<n>He added: 'Such a deal would not block Iran's path to the bomb. It would pave it'<n>The preliminary agreement was signed in Lausanne, Switzerland on Thursday.<n>It sets out framework where Iran would scale down plans to enrich uranium and make weapons-grade plutonium in return for Western powers dropping stringent economic sanctions.<n>Iran will also be subjected to inspections and sanctions will be dropped.

Detective Patrick Cherry was stripped of his shield and gun and will be placed on administrative duty following the outburst.<n>The outburst was viewed more than three million times on YouTube.<n>Detective Cherry appears on NBC 4 New York on Friday night to say: 'I apologize. I sincerely apologize'<n>'My intention was to be courteous and then we got into an argument,' he says.

The First Lady joined the So You Think You Can Dance All Stars on stage during Monday's Easter Egg Roll festivities.<n>This comes only days after she sported her mom dance moves on the Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon.<n>President Obama read from his favorite childhood book Where the Wild Things Are.<n>However, this year there was a disturbance when bees started buzzing near the children gathered for story-time.

The statue was unveiled in 2009 in Celoron, New York.<n>It is based on a famous moment from Ball's show 'I Love Lucy'<n>Residents have dubbed it 'Scary Lucy' and a Facebook page has been set up to get it removed.<n>Sculptor Dave Poulin has pledged to make a new one.

Quotas restricting milk production abolished today after 30 years.<n>Allowed dairy farmers to produce as much milk as they like without penalty.<n>Move is expected to drive a spike in production, particularly in Ireland.<n>Price war over cost of milk is likely to break out, bringing down price for consumers.

We all love to post our 'luxurious' travel pictures to Instagram.<n>Beyonce's Louvre portrait and Justin Bieber's plane snaps are great examples.<n>However we have to be prepared for some reality when travelling.

Gwyneth Paltrow, 42, has been snapped in a tiny Marysia bikini.<n>The actress is known for her super toned figure.<n>Other stars to show off their figure in skimpy swimwear include Halle Berry and Gwen Stefani.

Khalid Saeed Batarfi was a senior leader with al-Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula.<n>He was freed along with 300 other inmates as terrorists stormed prison.<n>Pictures show him posing with an AK-47 and posing on a Yemeni flag.

Engineers at the University of Sheffield have shown that tampons can glow in ultra-violet (UV) light, because they absorb chemicals found in products containing ‘optical brighteners’<n>Optical brighteners are found in toilet paper, laundry detergents and shampoos.<n>Tampons absorb these chemicals because they are used in products that whiten and brighten colours.<n>If a tampon is dunked in a river and glows under UV after 30 days, it means that the tampon could shed light on previously undetectable mis-plumbed pathways.

The Army of Russia fashion line unveiled at Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week.<n>Features balaclavas, shiny'military boots' and sweat pants.<n>The label is aimed at cashing in on a new wave of patriotism sweeping Russia.<n>The move comes ahead of a military parade to mark the 70th anniversary of the end of the Second World War.

V Stiviano showed off two new accessories while enjoying lunch in Los Angeles on Thursday.<n>The 32-year-old was joined for the outing by an older male companion, who was also wearing braces on her already straight teeth.<n>This just days before a judge will decide if she must hand over $2.8million in gifts she received from her ex, embattled former Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling.

Ian Walters, 51, allegedly killed wife Tracy by driving into a tree at 84mph.<n>Court heard two dogs and suitcases were thrown out of the pick-up truck.<n>Prosecutors allege Walters deliberately veered off the M1 after argument.<n>Court heard Walters' wife had made a flurry of calls to police about him.<n>He denies murder and two other charges relating to the crash.

The disgusting symbol of racial hatred was found at 2 a.m. Wednesday.<n>It was found outside the Center for Sexual and Gender Diversity.<n>Duke University and the police are investigating the incident.<n>Students took to social media to express their outrage at the discovery.

The Boy Scouts' Greater New York Councils said they hired Pascal Tessier, an 18-year-old Eagle Scout.<n>The national scouting organization changed its policy in 2013 to allow openly gay kids as scouts, but not adults as leaders.<n>The change took effect in January 2014.<n>The national organization has expelled adults who were open about it, including a gay troop leader in Seattle who was removed last year.

Huge sandstorm has caused chaos in Dubai as flights have been diverted and people have been forced to wear masks.<n>Flights bound for Dubai International Airport were diverted to nearby airports as visibility drops to 500 metres.<n>Police in Abu Dhabi say a 24-year-old was airlifted to hospital after being seriously injured in a traffic accident.<n>Forecasters are warning that the high winds will continue over the weekend and visibility will be reduced.

Cross-dresser robbed a bank in Santa Cruz, California, last Friday.<n>He was wearing a blonde wig, women's clothing and glasses.<n>Police have released surveillance images in the hunt for the bankrobber.<n>He was seen 'acting suspiciously' outside a nearby bank an hour before.

Madison Small left school early on Monday and when she woke up in the night with a severe headache, she was rushed to hospital.<n>She was not well enough to stay at the hospital and by Tuesday afternoon, she had passed away.<n>The Virginia Medical Examiner's office is investigating her death but so far no cause has been given.<n>Her family said she was otherwise healthy when she fell ill.

Boris Majnaric, 75, of South Jordan, Utah, built the 384-sq-ft, four-room bird house in 1996.<n>He went on to rear more than 200 birds - five times over the legal limit.<n>Over the years neighbors filed a torrent of complaints about the pigeons, detailing excess droppings and noise.<n>Majnaric, who was so fond of his flock he once delivered CPR to an ailing member, was not present for the demolition.<n>He spent more than $40,000 fighting the city in court.<n>But in late March, a district judge did not sign an order

President Obama said the thought of Malia, 16, heading to college has him crying on a daily basis.<n>The 11th grade student has already visited at UC Berkeley, Stanford, NYU, Columbia, Harvard, Brown, Princeton, Yale and Wesleyan.<n>He said: 'I start tearing up in the middle of the day and I can't explain it, why am I so sad? 'They're leaving me'

Drug was developed by British pharmaceutical giant Astra Zeneca.<n>Originally aimed to treat certain types of tumour, but proved ineffective.<n>Now experts have revealed it can reverse effects of Alzheimer's disease.<n>Treatment, called AZDO5030, restored memory in mice with disease.<n>Researchers have now started human trials to test its efficacy.

Anthony Stokes, 17, died on Tuesday after he crashed a stolen Honda into a pole as he fled the scene of an attempted burglary in Roswell, Georgia.<n>He had been given just six to nine months to live when he received a transplant at the age of 15 because his heart was unable to pump enough blood.<n>But the hospital initially refused to put him on the waiting list because they thought he would be 'non-compliant' with the treatment.<n>His story made headlines and the hospital backed down.<n>He died less than two years after he was given a second chance at life.

Gnome was signed by all four members of the Beatles after starring on iconic cover of the Fab Four's 1967 album Sgt Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band.<n>The 20-inch tall cardboard gnome has emerged for sale almost 50 years later after being listed for auction by a private collector.<n>The model has emerged for sale almost 50 years later after being listed for auction by a private collector.

A man was ejected from a Melbourne nightclub when he returned and stabbed a bouncer in the back.<n>The 29-year-old security guard was taken to hospital with non-life threatening injuries.<n>Police have expressed their 'disgust' over the incident.<n>In a separate incident, early on Good Friday, another security guard was stabbed.<n>The 24-year-old was taken to hospital with serious injuries and is in a stable condition.

The city is thought to be the biggest underground city in Cappadocia, consisting of 3.5 miles (7km) of tunnels, secret churches, tombs and safe havens.<n>It lies beneath the Nevehir fortress and the surrounding area, which was being excavated by Turkey's Housing Development Administration.<n>The subterranean city dates back around 5,000 years and was discovered when builders saw signs of a massive network of tunnels.
Lauren Crawley, 54, from Hertfordshire, was given a new implant.<n>It makes it easier for the patient to blink again.

Zoe Dennise Prince, 28, was working at the Gold Coast amusement park until September last year.<n>She allegedly injured her right wrist while checking harnesses on the Tower of Terror ride.<n>Ms Prince claims she suffered her injury as the company Ardent Leisure was negligent and set poor working conditions.<n>She has already undergone two operations and she has developed intersection syndrome and De Quervain’s tenosynovitis in her right wrist.

High Court rules hospital must pay Suzanne Adams in excess of £14.6m.<n>Her son James Robshaw was born with cerebral palsy after birth.<n>James cannot speak, dress or feed himself and must use a wheelchair.<n>The payout is the largest ever awarded for birth injury.
Maria Malone-Guerbaa, 41, from London, used nothing but paints.<n>Used her own brushes and professional kryolan paints.<n>The final result has earned thousands of likes on Instagram.

Nathaly Hernandez, from Kentucky, has a number of health complications.<n>But she never gave up on singing and was filmed as she lip-synced to Wrecking Ball.<n>She has lived at the Home of the Innocents nursing facility since she was three months old.

Lisa Williams, 49, hit taxi driver David Coleman three times with hammer.<n>She had found the 54-year-old brawling with her brother in the street.<n>The two families had been 'neighbours at war' since Colemans moved in in 2007.

Gang of four tried to hack into cash machine outside Waitrose in Warwickshire.<n>They spent eight minutes trying to access the vault before speeding off in stolen car.<n>Police helicopter followed them as they sped towards flats in Tamworth.<n>Gang were arrested after abandoning the car and a list of ATMs was found.<n>Dean Beech, Pedro Taylor, Jason Hadley and Mark Kirk were all jailed.

Shaun Andrew McKerry, 31, was unmasked as the axe wielding thief.<n>He burst into a shop in Shildon, County Durham, and demanded cash.<n>But the shopkeeper heard his demands and rugby tackled him to the floor.<n>His wife then appeared clutching her son's baseball bat and managed to subdue him further.<n>McKerry was dubbed 'Boomerang Boy' in the 1990s because he always returned home after his crimes.

Gul Ahmad Saeed, 25, is alleged to have shot dead his fiancee's family.<n>He is said to have been angry at her uncle for refusing to marry her.<n>His parents were also allegedly killed for opposing the wedding.<n>He is now said to be in the Pashtun tribal area on the Afghan border.

Charles Terreni Jr was found dead at Pi Kappa Alpha house on March 18.<n>He was the son of a former staff member for South Carolina governor.<n>Cause of death ruled alcohol poisoning.<n>Fraternity has been suspended while investigation takes place.

Valerie Cadman-Khan, 56, was arrested in 2008 amid child neglect claims.<n>She won her lawsuit against Cleveland Police last month.<n>But she revealed she has not yet received an apology from the force.<n>She was handcuffed in front of her daughter Aimee, who was 12 at the time.

Michelle Gent used Lib Dem HQ in Ashfield, Nottinghamshire, for auditions.<n>The 50-year-old directed and starred in violent films featuring whips and swords.<n>Some of the clips show women bound with leather straps and others drenched in fake blood.<n>Source said actors were told to 'prepare for anything' at auditions.
Two Boeing 737s collided while taxiing to a runway at Dublin Airport.<n>Passengers on board both planes escaped injury.<n>Budget airline said planes were taken out of service for repairs.

Scientists used a new technique to reconstrcut the colourful patterns on 28 fossilised cone snail shells that are up to 6.6 million years old.<n>The shells come from the northern Dominican Republic and are thought to have been covered in streaks of orange, purple, blue and even large pokadots.<n>The technique has allowed researchers to look millions of years into the past to see how these once elaborately decorated shells would have once looked.

Disease claims almost 11,000 lives a year in the UK, with most deaths occurring after it spreads around the body.<n>Scientists studied samples taken from tumours in the prostate and around the body in ten men with the disease.<n>Reading the DNA revealed details of how the cancer metastasises - or spreads - allowing scientists to understand how the disease changes.<n>Doctors may be able to find these key cells in individual patients in the future.<n>This could lead to drugs being developed to wipe out the cells.

Ed Miliband faced ridicule after billing himself as the 'happy warrior'<n>Labour leader's secret cribsheets also reveal how he planned to'relish the chance to show who I am'<n>Ten pages of notes were apparently left behind in Salford ITV studios.

Punters reacted with a mixture of amusement and fury to the announcement Future Music Festival will not return to Australia in 2016.<n>Many people were genuinely upset over the cancellation.<n>But others were quick to make fun of Future festival goers, blaming'shirtless f***wits' for ruining the festival.<n>'What will we do with all the d*****bags in singlets?' Adam Connelly joked on Twitter.

The penthouse at Australia 108 in Melbourne's CBD has been sold for $25 million to a Chinese businessman.<n>The apartment is spread across the entire 100th floor of the super skyscraper and boasts 360 degree views of the city.<n>The new owner, whose identity was not disclosed, will have 360 degree views over Melbourne's CBD, their own private grand foyer and glass elevator.<n>The 750 square metre apartment on Southbank promenade will have at least four bedrooms with huge walk in robes and ensuites.

The Mexican artist met Jose Bartoli in 1946 while recovering from surgery in New York.<n>The passionate three-year romance was saved by Jose until his death in 1995.<n>A collection of 25 of the letters will be auctioned off at Doyle New York on April 15.

Anthony Corrales of New Jersey has filed a suit claiming he was almost killed by a retired NYPD officer.<n>The incident occurred last June outside the Resorts World Casino in the Queens section of New York City.<n> Corrales claims he was driving with his wife and daughter, 10, when a car cut in front of him and refused to let him change lanes.<n>He then got out of his car to get the car's license plate number, and claims the driver, Robert Muller, mowed him down.<n>Muller then drove off at breakneck speed, and was later arrested for menacing behavior, harassment and cracking

Ambra Battilana, 22, accused Hollywood producer Harvey Weinstein of molesting her last Friday night at his Manhattan office.<n>She did not 'co-operate' with police for four days after filing report.<n>It has been claimed she was working behind the scenes to get a movie role.<n>But she decided to pursue the case after the 'pipe dream' came to nothing.<n>She attended a Broadway play the day after filing her police report.

Kun Kun was banished from his village after locals signed a petition.<n>The petition was signed by 203 people including his own grandfather.<n>He was forced to play alone and described as a 'ticking time bomb'<n>Now a specialist school in Linfen, China, has stepped in to help.

Woman in her 60s found floating in water at boat club in Sawley, Leicestershire.<n>A 65-year-old man arrested and released on bail in connection with death.<n>Post-mortem examination failed to establish cause of death, police say.<n>Discovery came just hours after children's Easter Egg hunt in grounds.

Joe Sullivan, 46, will head up security at the $40 billion taxi service.<n>Will help Uber defend against growing safety concerns over drivers.<n>Firm has been sued by cities of San Francisco and Los Angeles.<n>Claims include failing to vet drivers and a data leak last May.<n>Sullivan is first federal prosecutor to specialize in high-technology crime.

Roy Keane will stand trial over an alleged road-rage incident with a taxi driver.<n>The 43-year-old has denied committing a public order offence.<n>It was claimed he behaved aggressively towards driver Fateh Kerar.<n>Keane did not attend a brief hearing at Trafford Magistrates' Court today.<n>He is accused of causing harassment, alarm or distress to Mr Kerar.

The new Facebook app is available on Virgin's new Dreamliner routes.<n>Customers can check in and post updates from 35,000ft for free.<n>Selfie spots are also being developed to help passengers take the perfect picture.<n>Mood lighting is also available to help with jetlag.

Mark Jones is accused of killing 41-day-old Amelia Rose Jones.<n>The youngster died of a bleed to the brain after being rushed to hospital.<n>She was being babysat by her grandfather the night before she died.<n>Court heard he told her she was a 'bloody nightmare' when he looked after her.<n>Jones, 45, denies murdering the child at her terraced home in Pontnewydd.

Sikander Rafiq, 34, and Samara Jabreen, 32, lied to Birmingham City Council.<n>Couple pocketed £66,268 housing benefit, council tax benefit and income support.<n>Court heard Jabreen first lodged a genuine claim for income support in 2002.<n>But three years later, when Rafiq bought them a house, Jabreen claimed to be a private tenant and asked that her benefit payments be made to her landlord.<n>She even claimed single occupancy discount on her council tax payments.

The F-35 Lightning II jet's helmet gives its pilots a 360 degree view.<n>All the information they need is shown straight onto the visor.<n>The jet is considered one of the most complex pieces of weaponry ever.<n>Its 8 million lines of software code is three times more than an F-22 Raptor.<n>Each helmet costs $400,000 - millions more than the original budget.

Allie Davis, 21, from Minneapolis, asked her boyfriend to take a ten-question exam on Beyonce, One Direction and other pop stars.<n>He passed with a score of 80 per cent, and she revealed that he must score at least 60 per cent 'to stay in the relationship'

29-year-old Pankaj Saw fell three storeys from a Macquarie Park balcony.<n>He was on the phone to his wife in India at the time of the tragic fall.<n>Mr Saw died at the scene from serious head and internal injuries.<n>He was in Australia on a long-stay work visa, and had been working in Sydney in recent years.

Tracy Morgan was seen out with his family in New Jersey on Monday, almost a year after his horrific auto accident.<n>The actor appeared to strain and wince as he walked with a cane, but he looked much improved as he was joined by his fiancee and daughter.<n>Morgan was seriously injured in the accident which claimed the life of his friend James McNair and injured three others.<n>He was forced to miss the Saturday Night Live 40th anniversary special last month as he still had not fully recovered from his brain injury.

Scientists found signs of oxygen depletion and hydrogen sulphide poisoning.<n>This happened when the sun-lit surface waters of the ocean became devoid of oxygen and were poisoned by hydrogen sulphide.<n>Experts from the University of Southampton believe the same could happen to the Earth today due to the amount of carbon dioxide created through the burning of fossil fuels.

Reid said he is 'over' the fear that he may not regain vision in that eye following a New Year's Day exercise accident.<n>The 75-year-old former boxer said he was using the band because 'I was trying to maintain my firmness'<n>Reid explained that he was exercising in his new home in Nevada at the time when the strip'slipped, spun me around, about, I guess four feet'

Ruba Khandaqji, 36, was charged with two counts of corruption by threat against a public official and resisting arrest without violence.<n>Khandaqji called the Osceola County Sheriff’s Office on Monday telling the dispatcher she was going to hire a hitman and 'kill whomever I can kill'<n>The 36-year-old pharmacist told deputies she planned to kill Gov. Rick Scott, which prompted her arrest.<n>Authorities say Khandaqji has a history of mental instability and has come to authorities' attention four times in the last three months.

Italian model Ambra Battilana, 22, claims Weinstein groped her at his Manhattan office on Friday night and asked her for a kiss.<n>She called police and they monitored a phone conversation with him.<n>It is claimed he did not deny doing what she said he did to her.<n>Weinstein voluntarily went to speak with police on Saturday and promised full cooperation with the probe.

Alexander Bradley appeared in Bristol County Superior Court on Wednesday to decide what he could testify to in Aaron Hernandez's murder trial.<n>Bradley, who says he was Hernandez's former drug dealer and then his best friend, cannot reveal his claim that Hernandez shot him in the eye.<n>He will be allowed to tell jurors he saw someone hand Hernandez a black Glock pistol in a Miami hotel.<n>Bradley has sued Hernandez over a February 2013 shooting incident, but he cannot reveal his claim that Hernandez shot him.

Professor Ninian Peckitt, 63, accused of punching patient in the face to correct fracture.<n>World-renowned surgeon faces being struck off after being accused of failing three of his patients.<n>He was working as honorary locum at Ipswich Hospital in Suffolk at time.<n>Allegedly described procedure as one in which patient’s face had been ‘digitally manipulated as best they could be achieved’, hearing told.

The little owl was spotted creeping along a tree branch in Beaconsfield, Buckinghamshire.<n>He then begins tugging at his brother's wing, prompting an amusing game of tug-of-war.<n>The scene was photographed by sales manager Dean Mason, 48, who hid away in a camouflaged shelter.

Researchers at Joint Base Lewis-McChord reviewed records of 3.9million personnel who served after 9/11.<n>Found no direct link between deployment to a war zone and elevated suicide rates.<n>Suicide rates were similar regardless of whether or not servicemen and women were deployed to Iraq or Afghanistan.<n>Those who left sooner had a greater risk, with a rate of 48.04 among those who spent less than a year in the military.

Wayne Kyle gave his first interview since the end of his son's killer's trial.<n>Eddie Routh was sentenced to life in prison without parole in February.<n>Mr Kyle said he and his wife Deby are still grieving and'surviving'

The six-month-old kitten had fallen from a building in Zetland, inner-east Sydney, last month.<n>It was taken in by a local vet clinic, My Vet Animal Hospital, who shared the story of aptly-named 'Seven' on social media.<n>Since then, the cat has won the hearts of many who have donated funds to help pay for the his hefty medical bills and surgeries.

Italian priest sacked after online lover allegedly handed dossier to church.<n>It contained alleged evidence of sex with prostitutes and role play.<n>Priest allegedly favoured role-play scenarios in which lover played Judas.<n>He 'also had to atone for his betrayal of Jesus by becoming his slave'

Kong Meng Xiong, 21, of St. Paul, Minnesota has been charged with kidnapping, third-degree criminal sexual conduct and false imprisonment.<n>The girl's family reported the kidnapping on Sunday and that they opposed to their daughter marrying Xiong, whom she was dating, because of their age differences.<n>The girl told police that Xiong threw the girl's iPad against a wall at her family's home and then ripped her sweatpants as he dragged her into his car.<n>The girl managed to escape but Xiong took hold of her a second time, forced her into his car, and took her to his family's

Katherine Hadsell says police in Norfolk, Virginia, are doing nothing to find her 18-year-old granddaughter Anjelica Hadsell.<n>The Longwood University student was home for spring break when she vanished on March 2.<n>Police are searching a pond near Carrsville, Virginia, in an attempt to find the cell phone of Anjelica 'AJ' Hadsell.<n>Her stepfather Wesley Hadsell was arrested late last month after he broke into a home two weeks after her disappearance.

Mohamed Hamdin, 24, appeared in Downing Centre Court on Tuesday.<n>He was charged with indecent assault after a 15-year-old girl was allegedly groped.<n>The incident occurred at a concert by U.S. rappers YG and Ty Dolla $ign.<n>Charges were laid after a violent brawl broke out at the concert.

The bodies of a mother, her two sons and her husband were found in a Tulsa home on Wednesday afternoon.<n>Police believe the father killed his wife and children before using the gun on himself and are not seeking a suspect.<n>The father's handgun was found near the dead body of the father.<n>Police found the bodies after the mother's employer requested a welfare check because she had not shown up to work for two days.

The native Australian marsupial once occupied more than 70 per cent of the Australian mainland.<n>Now it’s disappeared from around 80 per cent of that area.<n>Small populations remain in Queensland, the Northern Territory and Western Australia.<n> Predators like feral cats and foxes are the biggest threat to the bilby populations.

Churchill, then 84, was President Eisenhower's guest of honour at gathering.<n>The party was held at home of US ambassador in London, in 1959.<n>The wartime comrades met at Winfield House, a mansion in Regent's Park.<n>The former prime minister, famously partial to a daytime drink, appeared to be struggling to keep his eyes open.

The Duchess of Cornwall pub will be built on the centre-piece Queen Mother Square.<n>The inn, which will have 20 bedrooms, is being built in the prince's model village in Dorset.<n>It is a joint development between the Duchy of Cornwall and brewery Hall & Woodhouse.

Gary Dahl's wife, Marguerite Dahl, confirmed he died March 23.<n>Mr Dahl's Pet Rock formed a brief but remarkably successful craze for several months in 1975.<n>He estimated he had sold 1.5million of them at roughly $4 each.<n>His later inventions included The Original Sand Breeding Kit and Red China Dirt.

Michael Olsen, 52, abandoned his car in the middle of the road in Welling, Kent.<n>He was challenged by PCs Mark Bird and Robert Wilson who pursued him.<n>He turned round and pulled a gun on PC Wilson's head as they got out of their car.<n>PC Bird lunged at Olsen to save his colleague and was shot in the hand.<n>Ol Olsen was arrested and found to have a bag of bullets in his pocket.<n>He was jailed for 12 years at Isleworth Crown Court today.

Sean McCabe was diagnosed with Hodgkin Lymphoma in June 2013.<n>He was given the all-clear in September but two months later told it had returned.<n>30-year-old was told he had just two months to live and was told to expect death.<n>He planned his own funeral and wrote a goodbye letter to his children.<n>But after making a recovery he was told his cancer was in remission.<n>Has now rebooked the church for his wedding to fiancee Lisa Williams.

Former Redgum frontman John Schumann slammed protesters for using his song, I Was Only 19 at a Reclaim Australia rally.<n>Saturday's rallies across the nation erupted into violence when the group's supporters clashed with anti-racism groups.<n>The songwriter said the song was about promoting tolerance, compassion and inclusiveness.

Rilwan Oshodi bought victim's bank details for £3,200 and spent her savings.<n>He spent £1million on computers, cheeseburgers and bottles of champagne.<n>But he has been ordered to pay back the money he stole from her.<n>He insists he is broke and cannot pay his lawyers - but judge rules he must.<n>Oshodi, 31, was jailed for eight years in 2013 for conspiracy to defraud.

Lillian Roldan, 39, says she dated Ariel Castro from 2000 to 2003.<n>Roldan detailed her 'romantic' relationship with Castro in the new book The Lost Girls by John Glatt.<n>She says she never knew about the young women he was keeping prisoner in his basement.<n>Roldan says Castro was 'completely normal' in the bedroom and even romantic.

Kim Howe's stepchildren could sue Jenner for wrongful death, it is claimed.<n>Mrs Howe, 69, died in Pacific Coast Highway crash with Jenner in February.<n>Mr Jenner is said to have'rear-ended' her Lexus, pushing it into oncoming traffic.<n>She had 'virtually no relationship' with either of her late husband's children.<n>Source told TMZ one of the step-children had been asked to find pictures of the pair together.

Aleksandr Glushko, 21, crashed his pickup truck in Fairbanks, Alaska.<n>He then stole a forklift to drive three miles to retrieve the truck.<n>But a railroad worker spotted him driving the forklift by the crash site.<n>He was arrested by police who were at the scene when he looped back.<n>Gushko has two prior DUI convictions.

Rosie, 27, models her new summer sleepwear collection for Autograph.<n>The model, who follows an organic diet, says she loves to sleep.<n>The range is full of mix and match pieces featuring silk and lace.

Gertrude Weaver passed away from complications due to pneumonia on Monday in Camden, Arkansas.<n>Last week she became the oldest person in the world after the death of 117-year-old Misao Okawa in Japan.<n>She attributed her long life to treating others well and eating her own cooking.

Chase Lacasse, 19, was arrested and charged with felony impersonation of police.<n>He was apprehended by real state police after visiting an ice cream stand.<n>The teenager had posted on social media that he wanted to join the police.<n>He had also posted numerous photos of himself dressed up as an officer.

Apryl Foster, 33, was last seen leaving a bar alone in Ybor City, Florida, on February 12.<n>Her body was found in her submerged car in a lake a few blocks from her home on Sunday.<n>Autopsy showed she was intoxicated when she drove into the water.<n>Her blood alcohol level was 0.18, over twice the legal limit for driving.<n>The medical examiner ruled her death an accidental drowning.
Sam Smith, 22, has lost three stone in the last year.<n>Followed a dairy-free, low-carb and low sugar diet.<n>Has been named the star of Vogue's April 'Today I'm Wearing' series.

Russian artist Marina Yamkovskaia, 39, specializes in creating life-like bird dolls.<n>She says she can't keep up with orders for the creatures.<n>Indeed, on her website all of the critters appear to have sold out except for one $399 fluffy owl named Leo.

Supermarket beat Wetherspoons and Bella Italia to win the title.<n>Mystery shoppers tried breakfast at restaurants, pubs and hotels nationwide.<n>Morrisons' Big Breakfast, which costs £4, was one of the most popular.

Survey of 4,000 British adults found 7 per cent have a drinking problem.<n>Young people are more likely to have a problem with alcohol, poll found.<n>Nearly half of young workers think it is acceptable to regularly get drunk.<n>One in ten admitted to getting in a car with someone they knew was intoxicated.

Obama has granted clemency to 22 drug dealers sentenced under outdated guidelines.<n>Most were convicted of dealing hard drugs like crack cocaine and heroin.<n>Eight of those whose sentences were commuted were serving life sentences.<n>White House said many of the 22 people would have served time before.<n>Mr Obama has now approved 43 commutations during more than six years in office.

Iain Mackay, 40, is believed to have argued with Thai girlfriend before death.<n>He is also understood to have clashed with man who was talking to her.<n>Incidents happened in Hua Hin, a coastal town and beach resort.<n>Mr Mackay, from Stornoway, Scotland, was in a rage when he cut himself.

Maryland's middle class is the highest paid in the country, with an average income of $72,483.<n>Alaska is second with $72,237, followed by New Jersey with $70,165.<n>The top five is completed by Hawaii and the District of Columbia, where middle class citizens are paid an average higher than $67,500.<n>Mississippi's middle class is the lowest paid in the country, with an average income of $37,963.<n>New York - home to the financial capital of the United States, New York City - falls 17th in the table.
