Le Femme, in New Jersey, offers training to those undergoing sex change.<n>School was created by Ellen Weirich, who helps transgender women.<n>She says she took it upon herself to help transitioning females.

Kansai International Airport in Japan has never lost a piece of luggage.<n>The airport has a 21-year-old baggage-handling record.<n>Staff place suitcases on carousels with their handles facing outwards.<n>Seven of the top 10 airports for baggage handling are in Asia.

Ellanora Baidoo and Victor Sena Blood-Dzraku have been married since 2009 but have never lived together.<n>Judge has ordered Baidoo to send Blood-Dzraku a private message on Facebook containing the divorce summons.<n>The message will be repeated once a week for three consecutive weeks or until 'acknowledged' by Blood-Dzraku.

Jane Bacon, 51, booked £1,000 trip to Sharm El Sheikh with husband Peter.<n>She was told she could die within months from breast cancer and wanted to delay trip.<n>Doctors said she needed 18-week course of chemotherapy and contacted airline.<n>EasyJet told her she would have to pay £176 to switch flights to avoid clash.<n>Airline has since apologised and refunded the additional cost for switching flights.

A 30-year-old Darwin man is accused of posing as a nurse at a Queensland hospital.<n>He allegedly used a female nurse's employee registration number.<n>The alarm was raised by payroll workers when they noticed the registration number.<n>The man was receiving a $100,000 annual salary and accommodation from Queensland Health in the six weeks he was at the hospital.<n>He was charged on Saturday with one count of fraud.

Nicholas James Langan, 24, from Townsville, was arrested on January 27 at a beach in Canggu, north of Kuta.<n>Police seized the 0.1 gram joint and a small bag of marijuana weighing 0.86 grams.<n>An Indonesian prosecutor has finalised the charges against Langan.<n>Also arrested was Hanung Pekik Hermantoro, 25, a driver for The Green Room Villas where the Queensland painter was staying.
Personality could replicate robot's owner, 'a deceased loved one,' or 'a celebrity'<n>Friends will be able to clone their robots and swap aspects of its personality.

Lance Lara, 10, from Fort Worth in Texas, has been crowned world champion.<n>But he has already been trampled on several times and is injured often.<n>Pressure to breed bigger and more vicious bulls is increasing.

Millions of devout Christians have been commemorating the final days of Jesus Christ by taking part in Holy Week celebrations.<n>In a diverse display of traditions, thousands of penitents have marched through streets in hooded cloaks.<n>In northern Philippines, bare-footed men with bloodied backs lie on roads being beaten with sticks and whips.<n>In Venezuela, crowds of penitents, some wearing crowns of thorns, gathered for mass at the Santa Teresa's Basilica.

The 44-year-old actress is starring in Levo League's Ask4More campaign, which encourages women to request the salaries that they deserve.<n>On average, women only earn 78 cents for every dollar made by men.

On Saturday, Rosetta swooped to within 8.6 miles (14 km) of comet 67P's surface.<n>During this close flyby, the probe was able to capture a stunning four image montage showing the two lobes of the icy comet.<n>The top right frame offers a stunning view onto Hapi, the comet’s ‘neck’ region that is littered with boulders.<n>The scale at this distance is 1.7 m/pixel and the image measures 3.1 x 1.7 km.

ISIS has launched English-language radio bulletins on its Iraqi broadcast service.<n>The first broadcast, on Tuesday, covered the latest ISIS activities in Iraq.<n>It was hosted by a man with an American accent who spoke traditional Arabic.<n>ISIS already has an English-language magazine - Dabiq - which is published eight times.
The New Jersey native bought the SoHo pad in 2007 for $24million.<n>The five-bedroom, five-and-a-half-bathroom duplex has 3,100 square feet of outdoor space.

The bill for moving the creatures is nearly six times the original estimate.<n>Water voles are an endangered species and must be protected, agency says.<n>In January and February 2014 residents on the Levels were forced to abandon their homes after record rainfall saw rivers burst their banks.<n>Villages were cut off in the wettest January since records began in 1766.

Albert Webb, 51, Jimmy Chuter, 26, and Jesse Webb, 19, targeted pensioners.<n>They followed victims home from Post Office and demanded money for work.<n>If they had no cash, they would be driven to a cash point or con their way into their homes.<n>Gang carried out 35 thefts, starting in February 2012 when victims still had cash.<n>Most of the victims were women in their 70s or 80s, with one 97-year-old.<n>Brother Jesse Webb, 19, was due to be sentenced with his father and brother.<n>But he went on the run and was

Kamron Taylor, 23, escaped from the Jerome Combs Detention Center in Kankakee, Illinois, at about 3am Wednesday.<n>He was being held on 45 years to life for the June 2013 murder of Nelson Williams Jr, 21.<n>Williams' father, Nelson Williams Sr, says Taylor threatened his family in a courthouse outburst in February.<n>Taylor beat and choked the guard and stole his uniform and SUV.<n>Police are searching about 50 homes in the area for Taylor.

Karen Davis, from Port Pirie in South Australia, was reported by police with disorderly behaviour after she flashed her breasts on Google Street View.<n>She handed herself into police voluntarily.<n>Law professor Rick Sarre believes it should not result in charges or a court appearance and that the swab was unnecessary.<n>'I think it's outrageous, but I know young juvenile offenders who have been questioned over certain things who have had the same thing happen to them,' he said.

Labour leader admits he cried when he and his wife watched Pride.<n>He said the film tells the story of miners in Wales and London's gay community.<n>Mr Miliband said he was 'brilliant’ playing Manic Miner as a 12-year-old.<n>He said he struggles with hand-eye coordination but was 'brilliant’<n>Labour leader also revealed he gave up his iPhone for a BlackBerry.

Benjamin Astbury was born 12 weeks early weighing just 1lb 3oz.<n>He suffered five cardiac arrests and was born with a bowel problem.<n>He was put into a paralysed state for six days while doctors tried to save him.<n>But he has defied the odds and is about to celebrate his first birthday.<n>His mother Taniya, 36, said his survival shows'miracles do happen'

Shadow Cabinet ministers branded industry leaders as members of '1 per cent'<n>Lord Prescott suggested the signatories were 'tax dodgers, Tory donors and non doms'<n>Labour's business spokesman suggested Paul Walsh should no longer take over as head of the CBI.

Gov. Jerry Brown ordered a 25 percent overall cutback in water use by cities and towns in the golden state on Wednesday.<n>The ongoing drought is already taking its toll on once Technicolor landscape of lush yards, emerald golf courses and aquamarine swimming pools.<n>State reservoirs have a year's worth of water, and with record low snowfall over the winter there won't be much to replenish them.<n>Wells in some parts of the state are going dry as groundwater levels fall.

The world's most expensive Easter treat is a five kilogram chocolate bunny worth $64,000 (£33,000)<n>Australian families will consumer 124.3million Easter treats this year.<n>Chocolate retailers are going above and beyond to create something truly spectacular... and mouth-watering.

Two long-time friends and their four sons traveled from Montreal, Quebec to Corbin, Kentucky to eat at the original home of Kentucky Fried Chicken.<n>The group of six completed the drive in three days crossing two Canadian provinces including Quebec and Ontario, as well as five U.S. states - New York, Pennsylvania, Ohio, Indiana and Kentucky.<n>For three of the sons, it was the first time they had tasted KFC.

Tyecka Shanta Evans, 28, charged with manslaughter in the death of her 3-month-old daughter.<n>Evans initially told police her daughter had crawled over a pillow and had a plastic shopping bag over her head.<n>She later admitted she went out for nearly two hours and found her daughter unresponsive upon her return to her apartment in Ocala, Florida.<n>Evans has a lengthy criminal record, including at least 10 arrests since 2009.

Up to one million free-roaming dogs on Romania's streets are being hunted down by 'dog catchers'<n>The 'euthanasia' of strays was legalised by the Romanian parliament in September 2013 to help reduce a massive overpopulation.<n>But a group of former models called the K-9 Angels have rescued hundreds of dogs from the streets where they would be savagely killed.<n>They claim government funds for programmes aimed at neutering the animals were never implemented.

Researchers in Massachusetts say keystrokes may reveal information.<n>It could help doctors identify people with Parkinson's disease.<n>An algorithm created by the scientists can tell how effectively someone is striking a keypad.

Personal trainer Allie Dodds, 24, alleges Ashy Bines used her recipes without crediting her or asking if she could publish them in a book.<n>Ms Dodds regularly published recipes for her friends and family on her Mealspiration blog.<n>She said Ms Bines contacted her in July 2013 to ask if she could share her recipes online with her Facebook fan base.<n>'I just couldn't believe it... That's really nasty,' she said.<n>Ms Bines admitted in a video statement that 10 recipes contained within her Clean Eating Diet Plan had been stolen.
Olivia Palermo is the face of Aspinal of London.<n>She has designed a limited edition 'Tech Tote'<n>All profits go to charity ADCAM.

Ford, 45, will have the tumor removed from his abdomen on May 11 and hopes to return to work as a city councilor in September.<n>He was diagnosed with malignant liposarcoma last year and has undergone five rounds of chemotherapy and a month of radiation.<n>The rare cancer began in his fat cells but has now shrunk to a manageable size, he said.

TOWIE star Joey Essex joined Ukip leader Nigel Farage on a boat trip.<n>The pair were in Grimsby to try and understand his general election plans.<n>Essex told reporters the Ukip leader is a'really, really reem guy'<n>Mr Farage quipped: 'I think that's good... I'm not sure'

Cassandra Fortin, 17, has been receiving chemotherapy for Hodgkin lymphoma since December.<n>The state Supreme Court ruled last year that she was mature enough to make her own medical decisions.<n>She and her mother, Jackie, argued she did not want chemo treatments despite the risk of dying without them.<n>The state Department of Children and Families took temporary custody of Cassandra after she and her mother argued she did not want chemo.<n>Doctors said the teen had an 85 percent chance of survival with chemo, but faced a near certainty of death within two years without it.<n>But she was declared to be in remission in

Sandstorms swept across the north-west of the country bringing strong winds and floating sand to the region.<n>The sandstorm reduced the visibility to as little as 30 metres in Golmud, in the country's north west Qinghai Province.<n>China's National Meteorological Centre has now issued a blue alert for the latest sandstorms to hit the northern regions.

Handwritten note was delivered by passenger 'Bethanie' to pilot Jai Dillon.<n>She writes that she feels the need to'reach out' in light of Alps crash.<n>She thanks the pilot and the airline for 'allowing her' to live her life in Spain.<n>Photo of the letter has been shared more than 2,000 times on Twitter.

Sherrell Dillion has been given a place in the final of Top Model of Colour.<n>However, she says she is now homeless after a mice infestation.<n>She says she hopes the competition will be the 'big break' she's been looking for.

tatty tarmac site overlooks the golden sands at Rhossili in South Wales.<n>Visitors to the tip of the Gower peninsula can see coastline stretch on for miles.<n>The beach has been the setting for Doctor Who and a host of car TV adverts.

Ollie the Owl was snatched from a pub shelf in Nottingham last month.<n>The £7.99 ornament has since been on three holidays in Europe.<n>The thieves even set up a Facebook page to keep fans updated on its travels.

Ethel Rider, 87, fell from her bed at Half Acre Care Home in Radcliffe.<n>She was being turned against the proper procedure at the private home.<n>Carers Susan Logan and Lauren Gillies then lied about what had happened.<n>Mrs Rider was left in agony for 40 minutes before she was spotted by a nurse.<n>She was left in pain and unable to tell anyone what had happened.<n>Logan and Gillies have been jailed for six months each for wilful neglect.

Ava Ciach, from Geelong in Victoria, had to have her skull removed.<n>She had Sagittal Synostosis - meaning the two plates at the front of her skull had fused together prematurely restricting the growth of her brain.<n>In September last year Ava underwent the operation, which involved making an incision from ear to ear and removing her whole skull.

Nestle have compiled a collection of images showing the evolution of the Easter Egg.<n>The collection includes eggs by brands like Caramac, Yorkie, Rolo, Toffee Crisp, Aero and even Polo.<n>The tradition of Easter eggs can be traced back to the years following the First World War.<n>Prior to that chocolatiers had made chocolate fish, chickens and shoes at Easter because these were accepted symbols of the celebrations.

Marc Wabafiyebazu, 15, has been arrested for felony murder and his brother Jean, 17, was shot dead after a gunfight erupted during a drug deal on Monday.<n>Their mother is Roxanne Dubé, the recently appointed Canadian Consul General in Miami.<n>The two boys had driven to a house with a third friend to purchase two pounds of marijuana for $5,000, and then tried to rob the drug dealers.<n>Gunfire erupted soon after they entered, and Jean and Joshua Wright were killed, while Anthony Rodriguez was wounded.<n>Both Marc and Rodriguez were arrested under a Florida law that says anyone who participates in

The Girl In The Spider's Web will be the fourth installment in the best-selling Millennium crime trilogy by Swedish author Stieg Larsson.<n>Book was completed in November by David Lagercrantz based on plot outline left by Larsson before he died of a heart attack in 2004 aged 50.

The mineral veins were found at a site called 'Garden City' on Mount Sharp.<n>They stick up from the rock by up to 6cm (2.5 inches)<n>Scientists believe the bizarre formed in Mars' wet past billions of years ago.<n>The ridges contain both bright and dark material.

Father Damian Maria Montes, 29, from Madrid, belts out the 1997 ballad.<n>He donned his priest's collar and launched himself into the chorus.<n>The audience whooped with delight as the judges sat wide-eyed in amazement.<n>He said he had been singing since he was 16 years old and wanted to be a musical artist.

Fighters from 100 nations have joined militant groups such as Al Qaeda.<n>More than 20,000 have fled to Syria and Iraq to fight for jihadists.<n>The number of foreign fighters worldwide soared by 71 per cent.<n>Panel of experts said flow of foreign fighters ‘is higher than it has ever been’

Promise Tamang has turned herself into Maleficent from the upcoming movie.<n>The YouTube star has previously made videos of herself as Elsa from Frozen and Princess Jasmine from Aladdin.<n>In the new tutorial she shows her contouring to achieve the look.
The perfect pillow is the key to a good night’s sleep.<n>On average, we rest our heads on our pillows for 2,500 hours a year.<n>But which is a pain in the neck and which is a dream come true?

Reading University researcher has said that bees prefer cities to fields.<n>The expansion of farmland has actually been damaging to bee population.<n>Wildlife sites in four English counties saw bee species decrease.<n>Dr Deepa Senapathi believes intensive agriculture is to blame.

Mark Dawe, head of OCR, said pupils would only have a short time to use search engine.<n>Compared it to using a calculator in a maths exam.<n>Today Chris McGovern, chairman of Campaign for Real Education, said idea would lead to a 'dumbing down of standards'

Tom Ballard, 26, plans to conquer the Himalayan mountain 20 years after his mother Alison Hargreaves died descending from its peak.<n>The climber was just six years old when his mother died in 1995.<n>Last month he became the first to solo climb all six of the great north faces of the Alps in the winter season.

Robin Rinaldi demanded an open marriage from her husband after he had a vasectomy.<n>The journalist wanted to have 12 strangers bed her in as many months.<n>She has now written a graphic, tell-all memoir about that year.

Lotatoa 'Lota' Ward was diagnosed with a mature Teratoma brain tumor back in October.<n>The eight-year-old from Layton, Utah, had already run several half marathons before his diagnosis.<n>Lota underwent his fourth brain surgery on April 1, and says he is still going strong.

Four Roma men and women accused of human trafficking in Marseille court.<n>Six others face related charges in what is described as 'two thousands piece puzzle built around four births'<n>All face up to 10 years in prison and fines equivalent to more than £1million.<n>The mother of the baby boy called Tony, Fana Moses, is not in court.<n>The Roma gang members deny the charges against them, saying the babies were 'a gift'

Prince Harry will arrive in Australia next Monday ahead of his four-week stint with the Australian Defence Force.<n>The prince will serve alongside diggers in Darwin, Perth and Sydney.<n>He will also be allowed to spend time off-base, meaning he will have plenty of time for handshakes with his fans.<n>The prince will also join diggers on urban training exercises and bush patrols.

Vijay Chokal-Ingam claims he posed as a black man while he applied to medical schools in 1998 because he believed he had a better chance of gaining acceptance.<n>He claims his sister Mindy Kaling'strongly disapproves' of his book, which he has written about his experiences.<n>He says that he felt he had to change his appearance to get into the St. Louis University School of Medicine and heavily attacks affirmative action policies in the United States.

Astronauts captured the eye of Typhoon Maysak from the International Space Station.<n>The storm is currently a super typhoon with winds of 140mph (225km/h)<n>It is expected to weaken slightly but will still pose a threat to islands in its past.

Kim Sears was spotted working on her wedding tan in Miami on Tuesday.<n>The 27-year-old showcased a golden glow watching Andy Murray play.<n>Murray beat Kevin Anderson 6-4 3-6 6-3 in their fourth round match.<n>The couple will tie the knot at Dunblane Cathedral on April 11.

Victim Shahnawaz was returning home from a family function when he was beaten to death.<n>Five men attacked him with iron rods because he had grazed a car.<n>His children, aged nine and 13, tried to hold back the attackers.<n>When no one came to their father's rescue, the children ran to the cops.

Justus Howell, 17, was shot twice in the back by police in Zion, Illinois.<n>Officers fired one bullet into his heart and another through his shoulder.<n>His mother, LaToya Howell, said her son wanted to be a surgeon.

Scientists warn that older people are more susceptible to emotions.<n>Study found 50% of pensioners panicked and sold investments during financial crisis.<n>Researchers at Texas Tech University found those who did sell had a pension of £100,000 at lowest point eight years ago with £63,000 today.<n>Study comes days before retirees in Britain are given power to decide how to spend life savings for first time ever.

Charlotte Roach, 26, almost died in a car crash in 2010.<n>She was left with punctured lungs, 12 fractured vertebrae, broken ribs and a broken collarbone.<n>Charlotte and business partner Rosemary Pringle, 28, vowed to dress up for Lent.<n>The pair dressed up in Simon Cowell costumes and rated buskers in Trafalgar Square.

The emails that resulted in the firings of two police officers and a court clerk in the city of Ferguson, Missouri were released on Thursday.<n>Seven in particular are remarkably racist, including one that was previously released in which disgraced police officer Richard Henke says of President Obama; 'What black man holds a steady job for four years'<n>In the other emails President Obama is labelled a monkey, welfare recipients are described as 'lazy' and unable to speak English before being compared to dogs and black individuals are First Lady Michelle Obama is called a tribeswoman.

Italian photographer Giovanna Griffo was in Iceland to capture the Aurora Borealis in March.<n>The 42-year-old was blown away by the strongest geomagnetic storm in the current solar cycle.<n>Griffo, who teaches photography in Italy, says the Northern Lights were 'one of my dreams'

Father of one of three teenagers arrested in Turkey works for MoD.<n>He is believed to work in the military's post office.<n>He could have access to names and addresses of all military personnel.<n>He has been put on compassionate leave from his post, source claims.<n>Three teenagers were intercepted in Turkey after parents realised they had fled to join IS.

Sterling has fallen nearly five per cent against the US dollar in past five weeks.<n>A badly hung parliament would be likely to send pound plummeting by ten per cent.<n>The sell-off could accelerate and spread to the stock and bond markets.<n>Lib Dem analysis shows 98 per cent of polls conducted so far this year to a hung parliament.

The RV Flip has been used by the US Office for Naval Research for more than 50 years.<n>The vessel is towed to its location where it 'flips', sinking just 50 feet below the surface.<n>The flip process takes 20 minutes and the vessel is then stable enough to carry on its scientific work.

Lishan Wang, 49, is charged with murder in the shooting of Yale University doctor Vajinder Toor in April 2010.<n>Wang and Toor worked together at Kingsbrook Jewish Medical Center in New York City.<n>It's believed the two had a dispute over Wang's dismissal in 2008.<n>Wang was found in his van with documents referring to his dismissal and Toor.<n>He was originally ruled incompetent in 2010, but was restored to competency after being treated at Connecticut Valley Hospital.<n>A new evaluation was ordered earlier this year after a public defender filed a motion asking for the court to terminate

Egg-shaped device acts as a beacon to help messages move around wireless mesh networks more easily.<n>It takes advantage of a feature that launched in Apple’s iOS 7 called Multipeer Connectivity Framework (MCF)<n>MCF lets you send messages and photos even when a person has no signal by creating what is called a wireless mesh network.<n>Greenstone is designed to help messages move around these so-called wireless mesh networks more easily.

Kristen Bieniewicz of Westland, Michigan has filed a $51 million lawsuit against Bassel Saad.<n>Saad is in prison for throwing a punch that killed her husband during a game last summer.<n>The lawsuit represents $1 million for each of the 51 additional years that John Bieniewicz, 44, could have lived.<n>Saad, 37, was recently sentenced to at least eight years in prison after pleading guilty to involuntary manslaughter.

One-Touch-911 was designed by researchers at Boston-based MIT.<n>Each button on the app triggers a standard call to nearby dispatchers.<n>Calls are placed with the phone's GPS location and user details.<n>If the user doesn't have signal, the app lets them 'roam' onto another network.<n>This is a feature built into most phones already and can be used in 135 countries.<n>App can be used in 135 countries and is compatible with any three-digit emergency number.

Prince Harry is heading for his final tour of duty in the elite SAS headquarters in Perth, Western Australia.<n>The soldier who claims to have shot the Taliban warlord who was intent on killing the royal heir works as a training commander.<n>Corporal Donaldson VC is one of Australia's most highly decorated soldiers.<n>He revealed in 2013 how four years earlier he had been a member of an elite Special Air Services unit ordered to assassinate a Taliban warlord.<n>The Taliban warlord had boasted that he intended to kill Prince Harry.

Caleb Benn developed a $4.99 (£3.24) app for iOS devices using Instagram's application program interface.<n>Called 'Uploader for Instagram', it allows users to upload photos directly from their computer rather than using only their smartphone.<n>An engineer from Instagram allegedly sent Benn an email last week, claiming the app violated the company's terms of service.<n>Benn said doing this would make the app would be pointless.
Danielle Page asked every cabbie she came across to dispense their best piece of relationship advice.

Peter Tarsey and wife Jean, both 77, found dead on Sunday in their villa.<n>Couple were found covered in a raincoat in their front room.<n>Friend of 25 years said she was'still in a state of shock' at the deaths.<n>She said: 'I really don't want to think about it as it's so upsetting'

Fire started in Mojave Narrows Park between Apple Valley and Victorville.<n>Fire started as a controlled burn but soon spread due to high winds.<n>More than 200 firefighters battled the blaze which spread to 70 acres.<n>One shed and one car were destroyed in the blaze which threatened homes.<n>Residents were allowed to return home late Tuesday evening.

Alan Spencer, 67, was tucking into his dinner when he began to choke.<n>His legs gave way and he fell face-first towards the floor.<n>His Labrador Lexi jumped on to his back and dislodging the onion.<n>She then saved his life by saving her owner's life.

Current and former female CIA agents spoke out to the New York Times on Sunday to renounce depictions of CIA women on TV and in movies.<n>The group of women say they are nothing like the honey-pots on these shows who use their sexuality to ensnare terrorists and drown PTSD with booze and pills.

Photographer Seth Casteel has captured 750 babies for his new book, Underwater Babies.<n>Casteel photographed the babies during swimming lessons in ten different states.<n>He photographed them in up-close-and-personal style to capture their playful side.<n>Casteel hopes to use the photos to promote water safety for babies.

Mike Holpin, 56, has three £450 PS4 consoles in his council house.<n>He plays Grand Theft Auto for up to 20 hours a day - all paid for by benefits.<n>At least 16 of his children have been taken into care by social services.<n>He says he wants more children and keeps a family tree tattooed on his back.

Darcy Atkinson, two, died of brain injuries in December 2012.<n>He was rushed to hospital by paramedics and airlifted to Westmead Children's Hospital after throwing up three times and going rigid in the bath.<n>The toddler was covered in bruises by the time he got to hospital, and traces of the stimulant Ritalin were found in his system.<n>Dr Barry Wilkins told the inquest into the toddler's death that he had only ever seen the marks inflicted on a child.<n>He said it was not possible the head injuries the toddler suffered came from a paddle board, as the boy's mother Tara

New book focuses on the evolution of Italian fashion from the Fifties to the present day.<n>It features 300 iconic dresses and archived images.<n>Authors Enrico Quinto and Paolo Tinarelli were the first to introduce vintage style.

A woman has emerged from a Melbourne restaurant where she was held hostage for more than seven hours.<n>A man has been arrested following the 7.5 hour siege at Riverside Quay.<n>A 35-year-old man has been charged with armed robbery, false imprisonment and assault with a weapon.<n>The man, of no fixed address, faced an out of sessions hearing and was remanded in custody to appear in Melbourne Magistrates' Court tomorrow morning.

Police removed the body from the home in the Richmond area of San Francisco.<n>Remains believed to be that of Anna Ragin, who lived with her daughter.<n>Neighbors said the mother had not been seen for years.<n>Police described it as the worst case of hoarding they had ever seen.

The Facebook page of the so-called Disciples of the New Dawn has sparked an internet firestorm as thousands share, and comment on, the group's anti-cesarean memes.<n>The community, led by Father Patrick Embry, is using the images to encourage fellow Christians to shame 'lazy' and 'negligent' mothers who have elected to undergo C-sections.

Ukip leader admits party has'slipped back a bit' in the polls in last few weeks.<n>But he says he expects to recover momentum in run-up to next month's election.<n>Support for Ukip has fallen from 16.75 per cent in November to 12.25 per cent.<n>Voters appear to be switching to the Tories in run up to the election.

Michael Brelo, 31, is facing two counts of voluntary manslaughter for the deaths of Timothy Russell, 43, and Malissa Williams, 30.<n>A rookie cop told the same investigators Brelo spoke with that the 31-year-old Cleveland officer talked about it in the days after the November 2012 shooting.<n>Brelo's footprints were also found on the hood of the beat-up Chevy Malibu where Russell, 43, and Williams, 30, died.

Alexis Tsipras met Vladimir Putin in Moscow yesterday.<n>Pair agreed potential deals over investment in energy and other projects.<n>But Tsipras insisted he had not asked for – or received – financial aid.<n>He said: 'Greece is not a beggar to go around all the countries asking them to help resolve its financial problems'

Ring is an illusion created by the chance alignment of two distant galaxies.<n>Einstein's theory predicts that the gravitational effects of the nearer galaxy will bend the light of the more distant one.

Jamie and Dawn, known only as Jamie and Dawn, appeared on the show.<n>After he refused to take a lie detector test, he proposed on-air.<n>But Dawn then threw the ring back in his face and stormed off.<n>The couple then hurled accusations at each other, with Jamie admitting to having sex with a friend while Dawn took their dog for a walk.

Billy-Anne Huxham, 18, was reportedly woken up by a man at 6am on Tuesday.<n>He attacked her and took her from her Caboolture home.<n>The man is believed to be her former boyfriend Carl Garry Chapman.<n>Police have found the car the teen was forced into at gunpoint.<n>Detectives are searching for the 32-year-old man.

Scientists believe the first complex conversation between humans gradually took place around 50,000 to 100,000 years ago.<n>Much of it involved cavemen grunting, or hunter-gatherers mumbling and pointing, before learning to speak in a detailed way.<n>But a linguist claims human language developed rapidly with people quickly using complex sentences that sound like our own.<n>Professor Miyagawa says single words bear traces of syntax showing that they must be descended from an older, syntax-laden system.

Kevin Blandford won a free trip to Puerto Rico through his workplace.<n>His wife, Bonnie, was unable to join him because she stayed home to care for their six-month-old daughter.<n>Kevin said the idea came to him after a friend snapped a candid photo of him.<n>Photos have been viewed more than two million times on Imgur.

Unnamed Canadian employee shared sick note with friend on Reddit.<n>Pizza Hut requires staff to provide a note even for a single day off.<n>The doctor's note criticised the firm for 'wasting his time'<n>Note has been shared thousands of times and sparked debate on site.

SNP leader says she is prepared to work with Labour to put Miliband in Number 10.<n>But she has refused to work with the Conservatives under any circumstances.<n>SNP projected to win more than 40 seats in Scotland, potentially leaving them holding the balance of power if Labour and the Tories both fall short.

Gerry Adams sparked outrage over comments about Jean McConville's murder.<n>He said abductions like hers happened 'in every single conflict'<n>The mother-of-ten was taken from her Belfast home in front of her children.<n>Her remains were eventually discovered on a beach in County Louth.<n>Adams was arrested last year but released without charge.<n>He has long denied he was even in the IRA.

University of Nebraska researcher has revealed why stress is bad for you.<n> Limited periods of stress are good, as they release the hormone cortisol.<n>This is useful in helping you recover from very tense situations.<n>But too much will lower your immune system and make your bones fragile.<n>Dr Raychelle Burks from the University of Nebraska-Lincoln explains in a video.<n>'Cortisol inhibits some of your immune responses, meaning you’re more likely to get sick and it takes longer for wounds to heal,' she said.

Goldfish and koi carp are among 13 exotic species introduced to WA's waterways.<n>They are eating native fish which are only up to 10cm in length.<n>The exotic fish are also bringing parasites and disease with them.

Animal Liberation Victoria activists broke into Wagner's Poultry Farm in March.<n>They found hens in desperate need of veterinary care and cages covered in dust.<n>The farm sells caged, free-range chicken and duck eggs.<n>Owner has denied claims that the animals were not being cared for.

Prime Minister issues plea to Ukip voters to 'come home' to the Tories.<n>Wars against sending 'a message or making a protest' in the run-up to the election.<n>Wars against Labour winning power 'and putting the economy at risk'

Young adult heroines have been mocked on Twitter for their unrealistic conditions.<n>Many use the hashtag #realisticYA to describe their own experiences.<n>One teen tweets that her boyfriend has 'zits' and she has a'miffin-top'<n>Others look at scenarios with a wry smile and make fun of the main characters.

I was just personally attacked by your wife on Facebook, and I don't appreciate it at all, pal'<n>Rudd had been dealing with the auto body shop for 'the last two months' while trying to repair a leak on her Hummer H2.<n>She said that the voicemail was in response to a scathing review she had written on the shop's Facebook page after her

The first phase of Disney's Polynesian Villas & Bungalows has just been unveiled.<n>The first 20 of the luxury bungalows are now available to rent.<n>Each bungalow has two bedrooms, two bathrooms and a plunge pool.<n>The villas are located steps from the Magic Kingdom in Orlando, Florida.

London Mayor launches Tory campaign in Mill Hill, North London.<n>He claims Miliband is 'hostile' to people who want to own their own home.<n>Also claims Ukip want to turn the clock back to the 1950s.<n>He says if they vote Conservative they will get broadband but if they vote Ukip they will get Miliband.

Angela Postle, from Maroochydore in southeast Queensland, stumbled upon the bizarre spectacle last month.<n>The mother-of-five sent the fruit of to Queensland Environmental Health Branch for testing.<n>But their first round of scientific tests were to no avail.<n>'I am not going to feed my kids something like that. I think it's awful they haven't come up with any answers,' Ms Postle said.

Seven out of 10 FTSE 100 bosses think Miliband would be a 'catastrophe'<n>Poll of 35 business chiefs reveals overwhelming support for Cameron.<n>Comes after 100 bosses signed letter warning Miliband would not be a PM.<n>Miliband has vowed to ban 90% of zero-hours contracts and raise corporation tax.

Kira Hollis was diagnosed with borderline personality disorder three years ago.<n>Had been battling depression and body dysmorphia for a long time.<n>At just 6st, she was deemed clinically underweight by doctors.<n>She was ordered to go to the gym in a bid to gain some weight.<n>Now a healthy 9.5st, she says bodybuilding changed her life and gave her the confidence to overcome her depression.

Robert Dellinger, 54, was sentenced on Thursday to two four-and-a-half to ten year sentences that are to be served consecutively.<n>Amanda Murphy, 24, and her fiance, 29-year-old Jason Timmons, were killed instantly in the December 2013 crash.<n>Prosecutors claimed Dellinger deliberately drove his vehicle head-on into the couple's car because he was depressed and wanted to kill himself.<n>During the second day of the sentence hearing, he was given credit for the 15 months he has spent in jail since the crash.<n>Dellinger could be released in less than eight years

PM insists Coalition has spent five years ‘trying to lift people up’<n>Intervention comes as chief whip Michael Gove says Christians are being dismissed with a combination of condescension and suspicion.
Dozens of items from Davy Jones's estate will go under the hammer.<n>The items include stage costumes, guitars and a tambourine.<n>The singer died of a heart attack in 2012 at the age of 66.

Steve Tempest-Mitchell, 56, from Bradford, weighed 32st before the operation.<n>He had struggled to control his Type 2 diabetes and binge-eated regularly.<n>The former bomb disposal expert says he was almost a recluse when he was at his biggest.

A New Zealand couple bought a $1.5 million house for $125,000.<n>The four-bedroom home near Auckland was listed with a $1 reserve.<n>Real estate agent Tony Keegan said the previous owners were desperate to sell.<n>New owners Donald and Jenny Gibbs said the deal was too good to pass up.

Elizabeth Stewart, Cristina Elrich and Jeanann Williams all made the list.<n>Stewart is the stylist behind Aussie beauty Cate Blanchett.<n>Elrich is responsible for Margot Robbie's glamorous red carpet style.<n>Williams is Naomi Watts' longtime stylist.

Ashley Johnston, 28, was killed in Syria in February fighting against ISIS.<n>He was shot in the head during a clash with Kurdish soldiers.<n>His mother did not know that her son was fighting until she heard of his death.<n>His funeral was held in Macquarie Park, Sydney, on Thursday.<n>His mother paid a touching tribute to her son's final action in life.

The four-day Easter long weekend will be extended by an hour.<n>Clocks will go back an hour at 3am on Sunday.<n>The time change affects all states except Queensland, the Northern Territory and Western Australia, where daylight saving is not observed.<n>For some that will mean an extra hour of sleep, while others will enjoy an extra hour to party.

Man shot himself in secluded area of Hollywood theme park on Friday.<n>Was said to have been stalking ex-girlfriend, who works in restaurant there.<n>Last week he was escorted off premises after damaging her car.<n>Police say he was seen near water slides and shot himself in front of children.

The woman and child were stranded in their vehicle in high water around 9:30 a.m. Friday on a rural highway in Lee County.<n>Around 11:30 a.m., the car was swept away and rescue workers lost sight of them.<n>Residents in Louisville, Kentucky, made more than 100 water rescues and one evacuation was ordered.<n>Up to two more inches of rain are expected throughout the day.

At least 55 carcasses were found in the Coonarr area, near Bundaberg, on Tuesday.<n>The dogs were believed to have been killed before a Four Corners special exposed the horrors of the greyhound racing industry.<n>There were no greyhound training facilities or other connections to the racing industry in the area.<n>A police taskforce was established to investigate the use of live baiting using possums, rabbits and piglets to train competitive greyhounds.

Big cat was seen at Kruger National Park in South Africa attempting to tackle the hefty mammal.<n>But the hippo's angry mother chased the lion away from the calf, leaving the big cat hungry and with dented pride.

Stephanie Fragoso was pulled over by a Nevada Highway Patrol trooper.<n>She was cited for putting on lip balm while at a red light on April Fools' Day.<n>The crackdown is part of a campaign for the state to have zero driving fatalities.

Stock market returns have averaged 16 per cent a year under the Tories.<n>Just under 9 per cent under Labour and just over 9 per cent under Coalition.<n>Figures are a further boost for David Cameron ahead of general election.

The 11,000 square foot penthouse is the largest in Los Angeles.<n>It will feature exclusive art, decor and custom furnishings.<n>Westwood-designed prints and tiles will be available for purchase.<n>Guests will also receive his and her gift bags upon arrival.

Superdrug launches range of creams with ingredients normally found in teenage spot treatments – as well as those for anti-ageing.<n>Poll of 2,000 women in their 30s, 40s and 50s discovered almost half were still being blighted with blemishes well into adulthood.<n>One in three said they even shy away from talking to people because they are so self-conscious about the state of their skin.

Luke Shambrook, 11, has been missing for two nights in a Victorian national park.<n>The autistic boy was last seen leaving his campsite at 9.30am on Good Friday.<n>Police say he may not even know he is lost and is known to frequently hide.<n>He has limited speech and his family says he is probably confused.<n>Police have called in water police to help with the search.

Hollywood's primary concern when banking a major box office is to keep the studios swelling.<n>A small group of stars considered capable of pulling people into theaters in droves can command a major opening.<n>In return, they can ask for $20 million per film.

Choupette is a three-year-old Birman cat and Karl Lagerfeld's pet.<n>Choupette is taking the modelling world by storm and outstripping Cara Delevingne's earnings.<n>Lagerfeld admits to being in love with his feline muse.

Hugo Mbaeri, 25, allegedly handed over customer names and details to gang.<n>Ringleader Olawabiyi Ayanwale, who is not before the court, allegedly set up standing orders by impersonating the victims.<n>Mbaeri is on trial for fraud by abuse of position and conspiracy to commit fraud at the Old Bailey.

Bentley design chief Luc Donckerwolke criticized Ford's new Lincoln Continental on Facebook.<n>He thought the model shared too many similarities with the Bentley Flying Spur.<n>Donckerwolke posted a comment on Lincoln designer David Woodhouses' Facebook page that was subsequently deleted.<n>He wrote: 'Do you want us to send the product tooling?'

China is creating islands in the South China Sea, US Navy claims.<n>Latest artificial island is 1.5 square miles (four square kilometres) in size.<n>It is one of five islands in the region, with two more in development.<n>Land reclamation is being carried out to build airstrips and structures.<n>Experts have told MailOnline the activities could be damaging ecosystems.

Erica Ann Ginneti, 35, pleaded guilty in December to institutional sexual assault and disseminating sexually explicit materials to a minor.<n>The married mother of three will serve 30 days in jail, 60 on house arrest and three years' probation.<n>Ginneti first approached her victim in May 2013 when she chaperoned the senior prom and invited him to come work out at her gym.

Campaign chiefs attempted to rebuff a letter from 100 business leaders.<n>Letter called for a Labour government signed by people 'from all walks of life'<n>Labour removed a signatory after it was revealed she had swindled £30,000.

Temperatures set to rise steadily until Friday, when southern parts of England are forecast to hit 21C (70F) or higher.<n>That would be the hottest this year so far and put many holiday resorts in the shade.<n>Clear skies, lengthening days and warm air from southern Europe will coincide to create glorious weather.

Derek Lowe, 38, and Tina Lowe, 33, were hit shortly before 10am on Sunday.<n>Accident occurred on property owned by Norfolk-Southern in Durham.<n>Train was headed from Charlotte to New York City when accident occurred.<n>None of the 166 passengers on the train were injured, although a man who fell ill during the delay did receive treatment.

Around 75 people were inside the Korean Union United Methodist Church in Rahway when the ceiling collapsed.<n>Thirteen people had minor injuries while one woman was sent to the trauma center at University Hospital with a serious but non-life threatening head injury.<n>The parishioners were from the Manantial de Vida Pentecostal congregation, which rents out the church space.<n>Fire department battalion chief Daryl Rutter said the scene was 'chaotic' when the fire department arrived at the church.

Louis Jordan, 37, released a three-paragraph statement on Monday in which he said he stayed inside his cabin to keep dry and avoid sun, wind, waves and sea spray.<n>Jordan was spotted by a German-flagged boat on Thursday, more than two months after sailing out of a South Carolina marina.<n>He said he rationed food and water and kept his calorie expenditure low.

Police arrested 12 protesters Thursday when they tried to block trucks heading to the peak of Mauna Kea.<n>Native Hawaiian groups do not oppose the Thirty Meter Telescope itself.<n>But they disagree with the location of the construction on the highest point in the state which is considered a home of deities.<n>About 300 people took part in the demonstration and those who were arrested were released after they each posted a $250 bail.

Woman filmed being led away by police in Mexico for suntanning on a beach reserved for foreigners.<n>Laura Alicia Caldero, 26, says she was arrested for sitting under a palm tree on the Mamitas Beach in Playa del Carmen.<n>Friends say she was arrested when she refused to pay a fine of about £70.<n>Video footage of her arrest has caused widespread outrage in Mexico.

Sarah Stage, 30, is eight months pregnant with her first child.<n>The animal rights activist and lingerie model has been posting pictures of her changing pregnancy body on Instagram.<n>Her followers are shocked by her incredible figure and claim it could harm her unborn child.

Ronda Blaylock was just 14-years-old in 1980 when she was found stabbed to death and brutally assaulted.<n>Three days later, her partially clothed body was discovered in a heavily wooded area almost 20 miles away from the parking lot where she had hitched a ride.<n>The man who gave her the ride was never found.<n>Police believe they are close to getting him after her mother called in to ask what progress had been made on her daughter's case.

Jutting, 30, returned to magistrates' court after being deemed fit to stand trial.<n>He faces life in prison if convicted of the murder charges.<n>The former Merrill Lynch Bank of America employee faces life in prison if he is convicted of the murder charges.

Diane McLean, 58, and her three children lost 'everything but their lives' when fire destroyed their East Village apartment last week.<n>The South Bronx mom and her kids Rose, 8, and twins James and Annabelle, 5, had nothing more than the clothes on their backs.<n>A GoFundMe campaign has raised nearly $90,000 to help the family get back on their feet.

Rodrigo Alves, 31, is best known as the new Human Ken Doll after spending more than $265,000 on plastic surgery.<n>The London flight attendant has had 30 operations, including four rhinoplasties, liposuction and six-pack implants.<n>He is set to appear on the new season of E! reality show Botched, this time as a mentor for another patient.

Redlands House in Penarth has been given a colourful makeover.<n>Local residents have described the changes as an 'eyesore'<n>But Vale of Glamorgan council said the colour scheme will help residents.<n>They said it will help with low levels of dementia and poor eyesight.

Jordan Sim-Mutch posted pictures of stolen money and drugs on social networking site.<n>The 24-year-old was part of an armed gang responsible for 29 robberies.<n>He claimed he worked in'midnight removals' in his online profile.<n>Picture of gang in court was illegally taken by a friend in the public gallery.

Memories Pizza in Walkerton, Indiana, closed its doors today after owners Kevin and Crystal O'Connor were abused over the phone and online.<n>Glenn Beck's The Blaze contributor set up GoFundMe page to raise money for the family.<n>Crystal O'Connor told a local news station on Tuesday that the pizzeria would 'have to say no' to gay customers.<n>Her father said he would never cater a gay wedding, but as a Christian he disagrees with gay marriage.<n>The news comes a week after Indiana passed the Religious Freedom Restoration Act, which critics say will allow businesses to openly discriminate.

Ambra Battilana, 22, told police Weinstein asked her for a kiss and then groped her during a 'business meeting' at his Tribeca office on Friday night.<n>The next day she snapped a picture of her matinee ticket to a preview showing of Finding Neverland, which Weinstein is producing, at the Lunt-Fontanne Theater.<n>She posted it on her Instagram and also posted a picture of an empty glass of water from the Tribeca Grand Hotel where the NYPD picked up Weinstein soon after.<n>A movie industry source said Weinstein gave Battilana two $227 sixth-row-center-seat tickets during their

American Eagle Flight 2536 was scheduled to fly about 125 miles from Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport to Wichita Falls, Texas, on Sunday night.<n>The plane left nearly a half-hour late, and when it got to Wichita Falls, the pilot told passengers that the runway lights were turned off.<n>Officials in the city of 100,000 people said that the plane could have landed on an adjacent, 10,000-foot runway that was lit.

Rosetta probe was on a close approach to comet 67P on Saturday.<n>It was taking a closer look at the jets that are being ejected from its surface.<n>But during the manoeuvre, it lost sense of where it was due to dust and gas.<n>This caused it to momentarily lose contact with Earth and be placed into ‘safe mode’<n>Rose Rosetta is continuing to orbit and study the comet.

Charlotte Cobbald, 17, injected herself with antibiotic on farm in Suffolk.<n>She ran away from her father, saying 'let me die', an inquest heard.<n>Paramedics battled to save her but she died from the effects of the drug.<n>She had battled anorexia and depression and was a 'perfectionist'

Party chiefs scrambled to shore up support for Ed Miliband.<n>It emerged dozens of Labour councils and MPs employ staff on zero-hours contracts.<n>Parliament’s expenses watchdog rejected claims by Labour MPs.<n>Unite also lost a humiliating tribunal ruling over an employee who claims he was sacked for complaining about being employed on zero-hours basis.<n>One of the signatories identified herself as someone who had ‘worked on [a] zero-hours contract’, but Labour removed her name yesterday after it was revealed she had been convicted of benefit fraud in 2012.<n>A boss who has used zero-hours workers,

Pete Bennett, 33, from Brighton, won £100,000 after coming first in 2006.<n>He says he squandered his prize cash on ketamine and is now homeless.<n>Nine years on the Tourette's sufferer says his condition has calmed down.

Corinne Gump and her grandparents, Judy and Bill Schmidt, were killed in a house fire in Youngstown, Ohio on Monday - the day her mother's boyfriend was due to go on trial.<n>The girl's mother, Lynn Schmidt, 'had left the girl with her grandparents and moved in with her boyfriend, Robert Seman, Jr.'<n>But she eventually went back to his home.<n>Seman, who allegedly raped the girl over several years, was taken into custody on Monday after he allegedly tried to bribe a witness in the case.

The London Book Fair Author HQ event is a three-day programme.<n>It is packed with informative seminars for budding authors.<n>New York Times bestselling author C. J. Lyons will talk about selling a million books.<n> Eurovision Song Contest 2014 winner Conchita Wurst will discuss her autobiography, Being Conchita.

Researchers in Tokyo found rats flatten their ears, narrow their eyes and puff up their cheeks when they are in pain.<n>They found that Long-Evans rats can read pain on other animal’s faces and use the information to makes decisions.<n>The study suggests that the pained faces of rats may have a ‘communicative function’<n>They may even use expressions to warn other rats of danger or ask for help.

Prison officer Thomas Jordan Driver, 25, David Elliot Moran, 47, and Charles Thomas Newcomb, 42, each face one state count of conspiracy to commit murder.<n>The KKK men believed the prisoner was infected with HIV and hepatitis and he bit one of them during a fight, officials said.<n>The supposed hit man was an FBI criminal informant who recorded those scenes and others over the past year.

Nick Cannon has signed a deal to write a tell-all book about his marriage to Mariah Carey.<n>He already signed the deal last week with major publishing company Simon and Schuster.<n>Nick Cannon is said to be very vengeful and dating other women in public including Nicole Murphy.

Rachel Chepulis, 26, helped Wesley Brown III escape from North Dakota jail.<n>Brown, 35, was awaiting sentencing after pleading guilty to a firearm charge.<n>Chepulis was arrested with Brown in North Bend, Oregon yesterday.<n>She had Brown's initials tattooed on her ring finger when she was found.<n>Brown is married with a child and is thought to have befriended Chepulis.

The average British worker will sit through 6,239 meetings in their career.<n>One in five workers admits to catching forty winks during a meeting, survey finds.<n>70 per cent said they constantly zone out while in meetings.

James Paul Harris, 30, originally was charged with first-degree murder in the 2011 garroting death of 49-year-old James Gerety.<n>Harris pleaded no contest in December to involuntary manslaughter.<n>The victim's brother, Tom Gerety, called the justice system 'a joke' after learning how long Harris would serve.

Apple's Watch goes on sale on 10 April in the US, UK, Australia, Canada, China, France, Germany, Hong Kong and Japan.<n>Customers can pre-order the timepiece on this day, with general sale starting 24 April.<n>On Friday, Apple will also launch the Sport model in the US and UK.<n>Employees working in these regions will be eligible for a 50% discount.<n>This applies to the standard model and the Sport model, but not the Edition.

Secret Garden by Scottish illustrator Johanna Basford is bestseller.<n>Has sold more than 1.4million copies and been translated into 22 languages.<n> Colouring-in titles are said to be outselling cook books in France.<n>Basford says success is down to the fact she is now a mother.

Hudea was pictured in Atmeh refugee camp, near the Turkish border.<n>She and her family had been living there since her father was killed.<n>But two weeks ago they decided to move south towards the city of Idlib.<n>Now, Al-Qaeda affiliate Al-Nusra Front has taken control of the city.<n>The group has promised to bring in Sharia law to the city.<n>This is horrifying news for those living under the group.

Sarkozy, 60, is facing charges over funding of failed 2012 presidential bid.<n>He is alleged to have got UMP party to pay off his personal fine of £500,000.<n>Under French electoral law, Sarkozy should have paid fine himself.<n>On Sunday, his party made massive electoral gains against Socialists.

David Suchet's grandson Todd has the rare genetic illness Tuberous Sclerosis Complex.<n>The 68-year-old actor is fighting for better treatment for those with rare diseases.<n>He has criticised 'disorganisation' in the NHS for slowing down the process.

The camel was found in an Austrian cellar and is the first intact camel skeleton found in central Europe.<n>It is believed to have been left in the town of Tulln for trading after the siege of Vienna in 1683.<n>Genetic analysis of the beast show it was a Bactrian-dromedary hybrid – a breed popular in the Ottoman army at the time.

U.S. District Court Judge Jon Tigar in San Francisco ruled that denying sex reassignment surgery to 51-year-old Michelle-Lael Norsworthy violates her constitutional rights.<n>Norsworthy has been in prison since 1987 serving a life sentence for second-degree murder.<n>She has twice delayed her scheduled parole hearings in recent months.<n>Norsworthy has lived as a woman since the 1990s and has what Tigar termed severe gender dysphoria.<n>The cost to taxpayers for such surgery is uncertain, a spokeswoman for the federal receiver who controls California prison medical care said.

The 16-page original manuscript and notes to 'American Pie' was sold at Christie's in New York on Tuesday.<n>The name of the buyer was not released.<n>American Pie was released in 1971 and was a No. 1 U.S. hit for four weeks in 1972.<n>It refers to February 3, 1959, when rock n' roll icon Buddy Holly and fellow singers Ritchie Valens and J.P. 'Big Bopper' Richardson died in a plane crash.<n>The original manuscript also reveals a deleted verse, which was crossed out and never recorded, about music being'reborn'

A new study found that hospitalizations from car crashes dropped 7 percent between 2003 and 2010 in the 45 states with texting bans.<n>Arizona, Texas, Montana, Missouri, and Oklahoma are the only five states in America that do not have texting at the wheel bans for all drivers.<n>The study found that older drivers were more likely to make a texting and driving mistake than a younger driver.

Mystery man wandered into the London Embassy with no memory of who he is.<n>He does not know how he came to lose his memory or be in the UK.<n>All that he could remember was that he was from Poznan, Poland and has a daughter.<n>He may or may not have come from Denmark within the past few days.<n>The only clue to his identity is a distinctive tattoo of a flower on his arm.
Lu Lu and Zhen Zhen mated for seven minutes and 45 seconds.<n>Pandas mated at Sichuan Giant Panda Research Centre.<n>Breeders watch to understand mating habits and encourage reproduction.

David Cameron was trying to answer question about homeless people.<n>Victoria Prosser, 33, stood up and heckled him about the issue.<n>She later told reporters she wanted to question '1 per cent at the top'<n>Ms Prosser, from Salford, is a 'health and wellbeing' worker.

New book claims Hillary Clinton imposed a blanket of secrecy on her movements during the Monica Lewinsky scandal.<n>Mrs Clinton said she wanted nobody to know when she was going to the pool apart from one usher who was to guide her there.<n>She would spend three and a half hours sitting on her own reading, according to the account.

Karen Wakefield and her husband Paul appeared on BBC's 'People Like Us'<n>The couple took their 13-year-old daughter out of school for six days to go on holiday to Turkey during term time last year.<n>Mrs Wakefield claims she was refused permission by her daughter's school.<n>She said she doesn't like being told what to do and is refusing to pay fines.<n>The mother-of-two said she could be jailed for three months or £1,000.

Two thirds of people taking antidepressants did not meet criteria for major depressive disorder, also known as clinical depression.<n>But 38% did not meet criteria for obsessive compulsive disorder, panic disorder, social phobia or generalised anxiety disorder either.<n>Antidepressants are also prescribed for other psychiatric disorders.<n>They are the most commonly prescribed type of anti-depressant.<n> SSRIs are usually the first choice medication for depression and other psychiatric conditions because they have fewer side effects than most other types of antidepressant.

Schuller died early Thursday at a care facility in Artesia, daughter Carol Schuller Milner said.<n>In 2013, he was diagnosed with a tumor in his esophagus that had spread to his lymph nodes and began treatment.<n>The soaring, glass-paned Crystal Cathedral — the touchstone of Schuller's storied ministry — was sold to the Roman Catholic Diocese of Orange in 2011.

Daisy Davis, now eight weeks old, was born without eyes.<n>Mother Danielle, 24, refused a termination when a scan showed a brain cyst.<n>Baby Daisy suffers from Anophthalmia, a rare condition which means 'lack of eyes'<n>She will never be able to see, but can have prosthetic eyes fitted.<n>Ms Davis says she has 'no regrets' about refusing the termination.

Professor Bryan Sykes of the University of Oxford claims a towering woman named Zana could have been the fabled yeti.<n>Witnesses described the six-foot, six-inches tall woman as having 'all the characteristics of a wild animal'<n>Zana was discovered and trapped by a local merchant who hired a group of hunters to hunt her down in the region of Ochamchir.<n>She was eventually tamed by a nobleman and sold to a local man who used her as a servant.

Crosswater have created a self-tanning shower valve.<n> Hailo have launched a 'piggy back taxi service'<n>Kim Kardashian's bottom has inspired two April Fool gifts.<n>One is a shiny jelly mould inspired by her bountiful behind.<n>The other is a 'bootyful' lollypop with an 18 rating.

Young boy named Gabriel was at a North American zoo when he saw the bear.<n>The bear, believed to be called Cheyenne, approached the youngster and rubbed its nose against the glass.<n>The boy's dad then instructs his son to put his hands up against the glass.<n>The bear then appears to try and bite the youngster through the glass.<n>Gabriel then tells his family 'he wants me to get in there' before walking away.

Actress wants to build a 550ft-long wall to protect her £3.25million home.<n>Natural England has recommended the planning application be refused.<n>They say it may result in the 'direct loss' of natural habitat.<n>The actress' Grade II-listed home backs onto a protected site.

Amy Johnson, 38, was a passenger in a BMW when she went through the McDonald's drive-through at Stanmore in Sydney's inner west.<n>The woman allegedly threw her fries back into the window and demanded a new order.<n>Police say she grabbed the 16-year-old by the neck and scratched her face.<n>Ms Johnson claims that the fries had fallen.

Justus Howell, 17, was shot twice in the back by police in Zion, Illinois.<n>Officers were called to reports of an argument on Saturday afternoon.<n>They found Howell running and he had stolen a gun from another teenager.<n>Police chief Steve Dumyahn said the gun went off during the scuffle.<n>He said Howell then pointed it at another teenager, Tramond Peet, 18.<n>Peet has been charged with aggravated unlawful use of a weapon.

Smokey Da Lamb has been a hit with New Yorkers since he moved into Sandy Dee Hall's apartment.<n>The lamb was abandoned by his mother in upstate New York and Sandy agreed to take him in.<n>The couple have been raising Smokey and bottle-feeding him three times a day.<n>But now the city has demanded that he be sent back to the farm.

The Queen was at Windsor Castle to view the digitised documents.<n>Among them were a book of poetry and letters from Rear Admiral.<n>The papers date back to the American War of Independence.<n>The Queen declared herself'stunned' by the collection.

Bed was dumped in car park of Redland House Hotel in Chester by builders.<n>They were oblivious to its true value and left it to be picked up by auctioneers.<n>It was bought by Ian Coulson, a four-poster bed specialist, for £2,200 in 2010.<n>DNA testing on timber proved it once belonged to King Henry VII.<n>Historian traced it back to 1495, when he visited Stanley family in Lancashire.

Police went to a home in Balch Springs, Texas, on March 26 to do a wellness check and were told a two-year-old child had died.<n>They were told that a 'rising ceremony' had been performed and the child's body had returned to Mexico the following day.<n>The ceremony was an attempt to resurrect the child, police claimed, and took place on March 22.<n>A neighbor said that five children under the age of ten, both boys and girls, were also living at the home and had been taken away by Child Protective Services.

A new infographic from Made.com shows scientifically proven tactics.<n>90% of Britons say their sleep environment impacts their sleep.<n>Make your room symmetrical, install heavy curtains and keep pets out.

Comedian Ben Elton took a swipe at Myleene Klass at Labour rally.<n>He said the singer had made her money'showering in a bikini'<n>Elton said he was 'back with Labour' and should be 'proud' to make a contribution.<n>Eddie Izzard, Sally Lindsay and Joey Essex also attended the event.

Swedish firm says new version uses less energy than pork and beef variety.<n> veggie balls will be rolled out this month, created from secret recipe.<n>Ikea sells one billion of its regular meatballs every year.

Insurance giant Admiral said many youngsters lose out at the very beginning of looking for work because they failed to string a normal sentence together.<n>Cardiff-based insurer voiced fears in evidence to the Welsh Assembly's Enterprise and Business Committee.<n>Report concluded too many young people were confused about how to grab hold of job opportunities.

Party said schoolchildren exposed to 'propaganda' from Brussels.<n>Ukip deputy chairman Suzanne Evans said money was being spent on 'propaganda'<n>Party's campaign chief Patrick O'Flynn said it was 'not a million miles away'<n>He said the party was'strongly against' lowering the voting age.

Mario Ambarita clambered into the wheel housing of Garuda Indonesia flight.<n>The plane took off from the main island of Sumatra and flew at 34,000ft to Jakarta.<n>The 21-year-old was in a dazed state when he crawled out of the wheel well.<n>His mother said he had left home to look for work in Pekan Baru, Sumatra.

Leia, an eight-month-old Boxer from Pennsylvania, was filmed as she lay on the couch and latched on to a baby's pacifier.<n>She then closes her eyes and loudly snoring in her sleep.<n>The video has garnered more than 145,000 likes on Facebook.

Hammerhead shark chases two oblivious swimmers in shallows off Florida.<n>The swimmers stand oblivious as the shark chases the fish in the shallows.<n>The swimmers are shouted at to get out of the water by a group of men.<n>The sharks are largely harmless to humans, but they can attack.

Simona Trasca, 34, said surgeon could not have paid tax on her boob job.<n>Plastic surgeon sued her for making defamatory comments on TV.<n>Ms Trasca, known as 'Romania's Pamela Anderson', ordered to pay £1,500.

Audrey Alexander has been locked in a row with her neighbour for 35 years.<n>She claims the hedge has knocked £20,000 off the value of her house.<n>But Stirling Council has finally ruled that the hedge can stay.<n>The High Hedge Act 2013 allows complaints about hedgerows.

Natalie Whitear, 35, suffers from prosopagnosia, also known as face blindness.<n>Condition means she is able to recognise objects, but not faces.<n>She struggles to pick her husband and children out of a crowd.<n>She can't spot her own reflection or her children when picking them up.

Ringling Brothers Barnum and Bailey Circus announced that it will no longer have elephants in the show starting in 2018.<n>The animals will be phased out of the performance and taken to the Ringling Brothers Elephant Conservation Center in Polk County, Florida.<n>Some will live out their lives at the center, while others will be used for breeding.<n>The population of Asian Elephants has decreased from 100,000 to between 25,000 and 32,000 over the last century.

Marc Benioff, CEO of Salesforce.com, was one of the first corporate executives to react to Indiana's Religious Freedom Restoration Act.<n>He canceled all events and suspended employee travel to the state.<n>On Wednesday he said he was now trying to relocate state employees who are uncomfortable.<n>It is the most aggressive corporate reaction to the controversial legislation yet.

Jo Gilchrist, 27, was left writhing in pain on Valentine's Day when a staph infection invaded her body and attacked her spine.<n>The mother of one was airlifted from her country hometown of Warwick to Brisbane where she underwent emergency surgery.<n>She will spend the rest of her life in a wheelchair caring for son Tommy.

Terrill Wayne Newman, 68, who is vying to become Governor of Kentucky, has legally changed his name to Gatewood Galbraith.<n>His predecessor, who died in 2012 from chronic emphysema, gained a following for his wit, sharp dress sense and support of legalizing marijuana.<n>Galbraith filed paperwork on Wednesday to run as an independent for the state's highest office.<n>The Secretary of State's office says independent candidates must obtain 5,000 signatures from registered voters by August 11 to get their names on the general election ballot.

John Zelepos, 48, pleaded guilty to tax evasion and financial structuring offenses.<n>Prosecutors say he diverted $567,000 from Mystic Pizza's gross receipts into his personal bank accounts and those of family members.<n>Zelepos will forfeit $459,573.51 since the IRS earlier seized $63,084.49.<n>The restaurant opened in 1973 and was made famous in the 1988 movie 'Mystic Pizza' starring Julia Roberts.

Van was carrying 12 people from South Carolina toward Atlanta when it went off Interstate 85 near the town of Commerce about 7am Monday.<n>The driver of the 15-passenger van 'apparently fell asleep and allowed the vehicle to leave the roadway,' Georgia State Patrol said.<n>Members of the Atlanta-based band Khaotika and the Huntsville, Alabama-based band Wormreich were in the van.<n>The conditions of those who survived Monday's crash were not immediately available and families were still being notified.

Cheyenne Mountain Complex was built in Colorado in the 1950s to protect against a nuclear attack from the USSR.<n>The complex was used as the headquarters of the North American Aerospace Command (NORAD)<n>The complex is buried under the Rockies and is protected by 15 three-story buildings buffered by a 25-ton blast door.<n>The complex was used in the 1983 Cold War thriller War Games and 1994's Stargate.<n>It shut down in 2002 but has now been re-opened by the Pentagon as a base for the US Northern Command.

Seven of the world's most endangered crocodiles flew out of Melbourne on Wednesday.<n>The reptiles were conceived and hatched at the Melbourne Zoo.<n>They travelled in custom designed boxes built by the zoo.<n>The arrival of these one year olds to the Palawan Wildlife Rescue & Conservation Centre in southern Philippines is part of a major conservation effort.

Japan has a growing number of 'lonely deaths' where elderly people are left to die alone.<n>In Tokyo, clean-up crews are clearing out the properties of the victims.<n>Often the bodies are badly decomposed and the houses are filthy.<n>In March, a man was found dead in his flat for over a month.

Harvard geneticists analysed ancient human remains to study skin colour.<n>They found that Europeans had dark skin for far longer than previously thought.<n>Hunter gatherers in Spain up to 8,500 years ago still had dark skin.<n>It was not until 7,800 years ago that the first farmers migrated from the Near East through Turkey that two key genes that provide lighter skin appeared.<n>The first Europeans looked dramatically different to most of the fair skinned people that live there today.

Three men, two women and four children were detained by Turkish soldiers.<n>They were trying to cross the border to ISIS stronghold of Raqqa in Syria.<n>The youngest of the four children is two and the eldest is 11, it is said.<n>Turkey is a key staging ground for foreign fighters attempting to reach IS-controlled areas of Syria and Iraq.

Roads around the Missouri city were flooded in the intense downpour.<n>Several crashes followed the atrocious driving weather.<n>Storms also hit further north, barreling into parts of Indiana.<n>There were no immediate reports of injuries.

Asma Fahmi was walking to her car with her sister and ill mother when they were attacked by three men from a balcony.<n>The 34-year-old was with her sister and ill mother when they had hard boiled eggs pelted at their heads.<n>This was the second time that Asma has been attacked in Sydney in four years.
Camoji app lets you record GIFs with filters and text.<n>Can be shared with friends on Messenger.

The 33-year-old Today show correspondent and her husband Henry Hager are already parents to one-year-old Mila.<n>Jenna revealed that Mila told the world that it was her 'baby sissy' when she made the announcement live on this morning's show.

Sir Jeremy Heywood ordered inquiry into claims leaked memo shows SNP leader wants David Cameron to win the Election.<n>Follows allegation Sturgeon told French ambassador she would prefer Tory victory.<n>Claimed she would prefer victory because Labour leader Ed Miliband is not ‘PM material’<n>Scottish First Minister branded report as ‘100 per cent untrue’

Flambards rollercoaster is being tested over the Easter period.<n>The noise levels will be recorded to see if it will impact on residents.<n>The popular Cornwall fun park is next door to a proposed 480-house estate.<n>The new development is being proposed for a series of fields nearby.

Survey reveals women regret their career choices more than men.<n>47 per cent of over 55s surveyed expressed disappointment over decisions.<n>Nearly half of women (47 per cent) admitted that they have suffered mental issues.<n>One in five over-55s surveyed admitted to feelings of depression.

Report says mission could fit within Nasa's human space exploration budget.<n>Would orbit Martian moon Phobos for 30 months and land on Red Planet in 2039.<n>'By reaching consensus on the right set of missions, we can send humans to Mars without breaking the bank,' says Planetary Society CEO Bill Nye.

The former U.S. representative, 44, walked through the airport in California using a cane on Thursday.<n>She was accompanied by her husband, retired astronaut Mark Kelly, on the trip, and a young woman who carried several bags.<n>The couple had watched Mark's twin brother, astronaut Scott Kelly, blast off aboard a Russian Soyuz rocket from the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan last week.

The University of Sydney has run a 17-week diploma for Year 11 students at Scot's College to skip their year 12 exams and 'buy' their entry into the university.<n>The program was a pilot program with eight students who completed the course in 2014.<n>The board of the university has shut down the program over concerns it will be picked up by other elite schools.<n>The pathway is open to all students, but only those who complete the course can apply to university.

Terry Martin, 48, shot his girlfriend Laurice Hampton, 48, after she asked for half of the proceeds.<n>But Hampton, critically injured from a gunshot wound to her chest, was able to call 911 about 6:30am Saturday to report the shootings.<n>Officers found the couple inside their master bedroom at their home on Beaty Street in Fort Worth, Texas, where Martin was pronounced dead from a gunshot wound to the head.<n>Hampton was taken by ambulance to John Peter Smith Hospital but died a few hours later.<n>Police said the couple had known each other since childhood and had lived together for several years

Bowie, 68, performed in the 1976 film adaptation of Walter Tevis' novel.<n>He has written new songs and arranged older music for stage version.<n> Lazarus will be directed by Dutch Ivo van Hove, who used his music in one of his own productions last year.<n>Bowie is not expected to perform in the production, which has been in the works for years.

Domenico Rancadore was convicted in his absence in Italy in 1999.<n>He fled to Britain in the 1990s and was arrested in August 2013.<n>The 65-year-old was told he would be extradited to serve his sentence.<n>But his European Arrest Warrant is to be withdrawn after his sentence was dropped.<n>He will now be allowed to remain in the UK with his wife and family.

Dr Alex Russell, a Sydney-based University lecturer shares his tips for mastering wine tasting in four hours.<n>He says to try different types of wine, try different regions and try wines made from different grapes.<n>The main skill wine experts have believes Russell, is an ability to put a name to the odour or scent.
Gareth Silk let his friends plan a stag do in Benidorm, Spain.<n>They were inspired by the Money Supermarket advert.<n>The men dressed in high heels and denim hotpants earned cheers and laughter.

Memories Pizza in Walkerton faced criticism this week after co-owner Crystal O'Connor expressed support for a new Indiana religious objections law.<n>Crystal and her father Kevin O'Connor went on Fox News on Thursday to discuss their comments and and the backlash they've received.<n>It was revealed that the pizza shop has never catered a wedding before.<n>Crystal and Kevin have gone into hiding but plan to re-open soon.

Kimberly Greenberg, 15, disappeared from her Santa Monica home last week.<n>Teenager became angry and left to walk near her home but never returned.<n>Her mother said the area she lived in was her'safe place' and is distraught.<n>She is described as having the mental capacity of an eight-year-old.<n>Teenager was last seen wearing a red sweater, jeans and ugg boots.

Retired businessman Anthony Bethell wants to restore 180-yard hedge.<n>But the Warwickshire property is owned by St John's College, Oxford.<n>The hedge divides Mr Bethell's plot from 1,200 acres of farmland.<n>He says he has been forced to take the college to court over the issue.

The new 'Skywalk' observation deck has opened to the public in Yunyang County, southwest China.<n>The cantilevered platform in Chongqing has a 720 degree view from a vantage point that stands nearly 4,000 feet above sea level.<n>It is more than 16ft longer than a similar tourist attraction at the Grand Canyon in America.

Epiphany Morgan and Carl Mason produced 365 documentaries in 365 days.<n>The couple visited 35 countries and 70 cities in their year of filming.<n>The idea was only an idea which popped into Epiphany's head for seven months.<n>The couple set a strict budget of $40 a day for their filming.

Amanda Beringer asked her brother Brad Fraser to make a toast at her wedding.<n>Mr Fraser performed a musical toast at her wedding in Perth, WA.<n>It was also a tribute to their father, who died 10 years ago from motor neuron disease.<n>Peter Beringer's funeral was held at the same time as the wedding.

ISIS militants have announced plans for a nursing school in Raqqa.<n>Document says would-be nurses must be fluent in English to work there.<n>They must also pass an entry exam and impress during an interview.<n>ISIS says graduates will be considered for places at the school.<n>But the NHS does not have the same language entry requirements.

Obama said cyber attacks pose'serious national security challenges'<n>He took aim at Russia, China and Iran as he announced sanctions.<n>Order will allow Treasury to freeze or block assets of hackers.<n>Follows a series of high profile attacks, including on Sony Pictures.

Yoko Ono led tributes to Cynthia Lennon who died yesterday at age of 75.<n>She said she was'very saddened' by the news and was 'proud' of their relationship.<n>Cynthia married Lennon after meeting him in college in the 1960s.<n>The pair divorced in 1968 but Cynthia later penned memoirs of her time.<n>Paul McCartney and Ringo Starr have also paid tribute to Cynthia.
