Laura Mary Sumner ordered to leave Russia within ten days over visa violation.<n>The history student was researching Soviet rule from 1917 to 1921.<n>She was fined £23.50 by a Russian court for 'violating visa regulations'<n>Russian media branded her 'Agent Sumner' and linked her to plot.<n>Pro-Kremlin website claimed her work was 'important for West's plans'<n>There has been no suggestion Ms Sumner is involved in espionage.

8,000 women in their 70s are diagnosed and treated for breast cancer.<n>MPs are warning that women will die as a result of the screening age limit.<n>From the end of 2016, all women up to 73 will be invited for screening.

Six in ten full-time working Brits are too busy to clean their homes.<n>One in eight haven't vacuumed at all this year so far.<n>A fifth never polish or dust their home and a quarter have never cleaned windows.

Anthony Ray Hinton will be freed on Friday after prosecutors told a judge they won't re-try him for two slayings.<n>The district attorney's office told the judge Wednesday that their forensic experts couldn't determine if six crime scene bullets came from a gun investigators took from his home.<n>Hindt was convicted of two 1985 murders that occurred during robberies of fast-food restaurants near Birmingham.<n>Prosecutors linked Hinton to the killings through a.38-caliber revolver found at his house.<n>The U.S. Supreme Court last year sent Hinton's case back for a potential new trial

Obama said he can'relate to... the fear a parent has when your four-year-old daughter comes up to you and says, "Daddy, I'm having trouble breathing" '<n>'The fright you feel is terrible,' he said.<n>Obama said the health scare resulted in a single trip to the emergency room for his daughter - who at the age of 16 now lives a full and an active life, inhaler free.

Detlef Guenzel met Wojciech Stempniewicz on a website for cannibal fetishists.<n>The 57-year-old then strangled his victim before chopping up his body.<n>He then buried the remains in his garden in Hartmannsdorf-Reichenau.<n>Guenzel was found guilty of murder and disturbing the peace of the dead.

Prescott, Arizona City Attorney Jon Paladini says he was told the order came just before winds whipped Yarnell Hill into a firestorm.<n>He claims lookout Brendan McDonough heard crew leader Eric Marsh and his deputy Jesse Steed arguing over the dangerous move.<n>Neither Marsh nor Steed are alive to verify the account.

42 per cent of those polled said they supported shale gas extraction.<n>35 per cent disagreed with using the controversial technique.<n>Finding shows greater backing for shale gas industry than other polls.<n>Greenpeace survey found greatest support among men and over-65s.<n>By contrast only 29 per cent of women backed fracking.

The National Defense Reserve Fleet was set up after the Second World War.<n>At its peak in 1950, the fleet consisted of 2,277 ships across the U.S.<n>But as the need for the fleet has diminished, so has the number of ships.<n>Now just over 120 ships remain, posing a risk to the environment.

Hannah Brierley, 16, thought her mother was playing a prank when she spotted the 6ft-long northern pine snake on a bath mat.<n>She stared at it for a few minutes until it moved and quickly called for her mother, Karen Marriott, to come upstairs.<n>Mrs Marriott attempted to call the RSCPA at 7am yesterday morning but after she was unable to get through she panicked and dialled 999.<n>A detective from Rochdale police station overheard the call and offered to help as he has experience with keeping snakes.

Zayn has been accused of cheating on four occasions.<n>The most recent was Swedish model Martina Olsson.<n>The pair have been engaged since November.<n>Like Cheryl and Ashley their romance has been dogged with cheating allegations.

Barrick Gold reached out-of-court settlement when women threatened to file a lawsuit in the US.<n>One of the women was just a 14-year-old girl attending school when she was raped in 2010.<n>She and her classmates had made string bags for police officers who had been moved into the area to increase security around the company’s Porgera gold mine.

Autism Assistance Dogs are a form of 'animal therapy'<n>Pups change the lives of many children with autism.<n>They can provide companionship for the child, as well as social and emotional support for the parent to bring joy and 'brightness' to the household.<n>April 2 is Autism Awareness Day.

Fossils were found in a collection owned by Hugh Miller in the 19th century.<n>They were rediscovered by the president of the Official Loch Ness Fan Club.<n>He saw the resemblance and called for scientists to investigate the creature.<n>Scientists have revealed that 'Pessie' may have lived at the bottom of the lakes that would later become Loch Ness.

The 1-year-old bully breed mix was hit by a car and then struck in the head with a hammer and buried.<n>Days later, the dog showed up sickly and covered in dirt at a nearby farm.<n>The dog is scheduled to go into surgery in a few weeks time after raising money through crowdfunding.

Research led by the University of Montana has found that eating fast food after a workout may be just as beneficial as dietary supplements.<n>During recovery periods between periods of exercise, it didn’t matter what food was eaten, the study found.<n>Performance remained the same after resting for several hours.<n>While levels of glycogen - used by muscles as ‘fuel’ - were actually slightly higher after fast food was eaten as a recovery food.

The patent was filed by the California-based firm in March 2011.<n>It details a method of scanning a user's face using the front-facing camera.<n>If the scanned face matches a previously taken photo, the phone unlocks automatically.<n>Android Lollipop users already have an almost identical feature known as Trusted face in the Smart Lock menu.<n>It is an extension of Face Unlock that launched on Android Ice Cream Sandwich.

New 6.2 mile stretch of Qin Dynasty Great Wall found in Gansu province.<n>Experts say it is the first time the full range of the Wall has been traced.<n> stretch was ordered by Emperor Qin to stop invaders crossing it when frozen.

The United States Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) revealed the recall on Tuesday.<n>The type of baby food being recalled is 'Stage 2 Beech-Nut CLASSICS sweet potato & chicken,' which is sold in 4-ounce glass jars.<n>Jars with the product numbers '12395750815' and ending at '12395750821' are being recalled, all of which have the establishment number 'P-68A'<n>The baby food jars fall under a Class I recall, which the FSIS describes as 'a health hazard situation'

Luke Shambrook, 11, has been missing from a Victorian campsite since Friday.<n>Police have confirmed a beanie believed to belong to the boy has been found.<n>It was located on Monday afternoon, west of the Devil’s Cove and Candlebark campsite in Lake Eildon National Park.<n>Police are still hopeful they will find the boy who went missing from the campsite on Friday.

Typhoon is so accurate that even the movements of the tide can disrupt the jet fighter's positioning and accuracy.<n>To counteract even the slightest shifts in gravitational pull, engineers build the jet on 'floating' concrete rafts.<n>These rafts measure 59ft (18 metres) long and 9.8ft (3 metres) thick.<n>This helps its ‘fly by wire’ computer system to accurately control the aircraft, designed to be unstable but hugely agile.

Scientists at the University of Illinois found that children who ate a diet higher in saturated fats and cholesterol had slower reaction times and a poorer working memory.<n>Children who ate the fatty diet performed worse when they were given a task-switching game to complete.

Aaron Stringer, of Bakersfield, California, Police Department, accused of 'tickling' the feet of Ramiro James Villegas, 22, who was shot dead by cops on November 13.<n>A trainee officer told how Stringer pulled his head back and forth while discussing rigor mortis after the shooting.<n>He then allegedly said he 'loves playing with dead bodies' and told her to lie.<n>Under California law, police officers are allowed to look at dead bodies to assess wounds, but are not supposed to handle them.<n>Prosecutors considered charging Stringer but dropped the case due to insufficient evidence.

Richard Attenborough's possessions are to be sold at Bonhams auction house.<n>The items include unseen photographs, iconic props and scripts.<n>Many of the lots relate to his time in front of the camera.<n>One of the most prized items is the cane used by Hammond in Jurassic Park.

John Foran’s wife Nita was preparing a chicken tikka biryani stir-fry.<n>He found the splinter-covered shard in the £2 ready meal.<n>Iceland said they are carrying out a thorough investigation.

Charmaine Spears was found dead in a bath in a Ghanaian hotel last week.<n>She was four days pregnant and believed to have died of a heroin overdose.<n>Her husband, Eric Isaiah Adusah, has been charged with her murder.<n>Local reports said the mother-of-one died of 'opiate heroin overdose'<n>But Ms Speirs's brother Paul said she had never touched drugs.

The University of Michigan canceled an upcoming screening of the Oscar-nominated drama American Sniper over student complaints.<n>The school tweeted out a statement saying the 'decision to cancel not consistent w/high value @Umich places on freedom of expression'<n>The school will now show an alternative movie, 'Paddington,' at the same time and location.

Google has spent more than $1.6 million on Obama's two presidential campaigns.<n>Google employees have been in the White House more than 230 times since Obama took office.<n>Google has been accused of getting a sweetheart deal from the FTC in exchange for dropping an antitrust lawsuit.<n>The FTC found that Google manipulated search results to favor its own products over those of Amazon and eBay.

J.B. Silverthorn of Orchard Park, New York, was charged with felony DUI, meaning he could serve a minimum of one year in jail.<n>Silverthorn was deemed guilty this week for driving over the limit and crashing his car into the Niagara River on December 29.

Aaron Hernandez was sentenced to life in prison without parole on Wednesday for the murder of Odin Lloyd.<n>He was booked at the MCI Cedar Junction prison in Walpole, Massachusetts, a mile and a half from Gillette Stadium.<n>The maximum-security facility is also where Hernandez used to play for the New England Patriots.<n>Before his arrest, Hernandez lived in a $1.3million mansion in North Attleborough, Massachusetts.

Police are searching for Bhadreshkumar Chetanbhai Patel, 24, in connection to the killing of his wife.<n>Patel's wife, 21-year-old Palak Bhadreskumar Patel, died at the scene.<n>Patel has been charged with first-degree murder, second-degree murder, first-degree assault, second-degree assault, as well as dangerous weapon with intent to injure.

Evita Nicole Sarmonikas died while undergoing plastic surgery in Mexico.<n>29-year-old was on holiday with her boyfriend at the time of her death.<n>Her family flew to Mexico to collect her body after an official autopsy.<n>It has now been revealed Dr Victor Ramirez lost another patient in 2014.<n>American woman Roseann Falcon Ornelas complained of shortness of breath five hours after her tummy tuck.

Ozzie the goose broke his leg and it had to be amputated at the joint.<n>He struggled to cope with only one leg resulting in damaged wings.<n>Animal lover appealed for help and BunnyCorp stepped in to manufacture new limb.<n>New prosthetic leg is believed to be the first of its kind for an animal in South Africa.

The 'Very Blokey Joke Book' was on sale at the high street brand's menswear department.<n>Book contains a joke about a man watching his wife being beaten up.<n>Twitter users branded the joke 'horrific' and'staggeringly offensive'<n>River Island has now withdrawn the book from its shelves.

Game of Thrones has a strong female cast, says Emilia Clarke.<n>The HBO drama is about a kingdom where not even the most powerful man is safe.<n>Clarke says that the show's female characters 'accept who they are'

Christine Bleakley has opened up about becoming a step-mother.<n>The TV presenter is engaged to footballer Frank Lampard.<n>He has two daughters with his ex-wife, model Elen Rivas.<n>Christine says she's been careful to forge a close bond with the girls.

The actress, 58, took to Twitter on Wednesday to thank her supporters, one day after revealing she has breast cancer.<n>She shared the news of her disease through a statement published by People magazine.

Two mothers rescued three girls and a baby trapped by rising tide.<n>But onlookers filming the incident on their smartphones did nothing.<n>Lifeboat crew member Nathan Lee said: 'They thought they were going to die'

Darius the rabbit measures over four feet long and weighs three and a half stone.<n>His son Jeff, who is just six months old, is already 3ft 8in long.<n>The Continental Giants can grow to around 4ft when fully grown.

A concerned mother took a photo of her child's lunch and posted it to social media this week.<n>Virginia’s Portsmouth Public Schools say that their lunches are in compliance with Michelle Obama's federal lunch rules.<n>'Poor lighting and food presentation make this lunch unappealing,' said Food Service Coordinator Jim Gehlhoff.

German police are 'closely monitoring developments' in the Hatton Garden heist.<n>They are keen to find out whether DNA was recovered from scene of raid.<n>And whether it matches forensic samples found in 2013 bank raid in Berlin.<n>In the German case, thieves targeted 294 security vaults during break-in.<n>In the London heist, 72 safety deposit boxes were raided in Easter weekend.

Amit Yadav, 20, was driving his Honda Civic up to 25 miles over the speed limit.<n>He lost control and smashed into an oncoming Renault Cleo in August 2013.<n>Brothers Haider, 20, and Taimur Kayani, 17, were killed in the collision.<n>None of the passengers in the Civic were wearing seatbelts at the time.<n>Yadav denied two charges of causing death by dangerous driving.<n>But he was convicted of one count of causing serious injury by dangerous driving.<n>He was jailed for six years at Snaresbrook Crown Court this month.

Jade Ruthven, 33, was sent a scathing letter demanding she stop posting on Facebook about her baby.<n>The letter claims she is 'p*****g a lot of people off' for her constant updates.<n>It says she is 'SO OVER' the running commentary of her life with her baby.<n>Ms Ruthven was so upset she forwarded it onto comedian Em Rusciano.<n>The pair shared it with thousands of followers on social media.

Gao Yu, 71, was jailed for seven years for 'illegally providing state secrets to foreigners'<n>She leaked a 2013 directive by the ruling Communist party to a Hong Kong media outlet.<n>The document warns of the 'dangers' of multiparty democracy and independent media.<n>The septuagenarian suffers from high blood pressure and her lawyer is'very worried' about her health.

Laurent Stefanini, 55, was asked by French President Francois Hollande to represent their country at the Holy See.<n>But the controversial appointment was met 'with a stony silence' by the Vatican.<n>Le Monde newspaper reported that Mr Stefanini was a practising Catholic but his proposed move had 'not received the agreement of the Vatican's administration'<n>It added: 'The homosexuality of the appointee would have triggered a barrage against him'

The classic steam engines took to the tracks of the North Yorkshire Moors railway today, hauling passengers between Pickering and Whitby.<n>The Spring Steam Gala continues throughout the weekend and vistors can also attend the event during 24-26 April.<n>Star attractions on the first day of the Spring Steam Gala included classic locomotives LNER 61994 ‘The Great Marquess’, LMS 45407 ‘The Lancashire Fusilier’, and LNER 60007 ‘Sir Nigel Gresley’

Queen Margrethe of Denmark was celebrating her 75th birthday on Thursday.<n>She was joined by her sons Crown Prince Frederik and Prince Joachim.<n>The royals were at Fredensborg Castle for a gala banquet and fireworks.<n>The event was a repeat of Wednesday's lavish dinner at Christiansborg Palace.

The former Illinois governor has return to his roots while inside and has been photographed with his still full head of hair a shocking white color.<n>Blagojevich was infamously caught trying to sell Barack Obama's U.S. Senate seat when he was elected president in 2008.<n>He is currently serving a 14-year sentence at the Federal Correctional Institution Englewood near Denver.

Nuku Vanonyi Cudjoe-Calvocoressi was head of politics at St George's School.<n>He was travelling on a Richmond to Reading train when he exposed himself.<n>The woman secretly filmed him on her mobile phone and confronted him.<n>He was convicted of indecent exposure at Berkshire Magistrates' Court.<n>He has now been banned from teaching for at least five years by NCTL.

Children at Wolfson Children's Hospital can play with cats at shelter.<n>Can control three different cat toys with the push of a button.<n>Watch on the TV in their room as the animals react and play with them.

So far, purchased names include Youtube.sucks, Bing.sucks, Visa.sucks, Bankofamerica.sucks, Yahoo.sucks, Telus.sucks and other major brand names.<n>ICANN has sent a letter to the U.S. Federal Trade Commission and Canada's Office of Consumer Affairs to see if the actions of company Vox Populi Registry Ltd. were illegal.<n>Most of the names have been sold by resellers for around $2,000 a year.

Protest letters were delivered to members of Spain's Royal Language Academy.<n>Gypsy Secretariat Foundation, which are leading the campaign, are hoping to use it to raise awareness of discrimination against gypsies.

The FBI has cleared the Tulsa County Sheriff’s department in the fatal shooting of an unarmed black man by a volunteer deputy earlier this month.<n>Sheriff Stanley Glanz said in a press conference on Monday that the special FBI agent in charge of the state of Oklahoma, Jim Finch, had informed him of the investigation's results.<n>He also said there were no civil rights violations in the incident.<n>Robert Bates, a 73-year-old reserve deputy, says he mistook his handgun for a taser and accidentally shot Eric Harris while attempting to help other deputies take Harris into custody.
Bite marks found on fossilised skull of a Daspletosaurus.<n>The species lived around 75 million years ago.<n>It is thought to be a close relative of the more famous Tyrannosaurus rex.

Len Barnes, 75, shed three stone as he battled life-threatening condition.<n>He suffered bouts of diarrhoea, lost his appetite and endured pain.<n>Specialists suggested a faecal transplant to cure him of infection.<n>His daughter Debbie donated her stools to be mixed with warm water.<n>The solution was then transplanted into Mr Barnes' gut via an endoscope.<n>He has now been cured of the infection Clostridium difficile.

Travolta spoke out while promoting his upcoming film The Forger.<n>Said his 40 years in the church have been nothing but positive.<n>Described the documentary as a showcase for ex-members 'who were disgruntled with their experiences' with Scientology.

The two robbers have held up three banks in Pittsburgh area this year.<n>Authorities believe they have military or law enforcement training.<n>The men have threatened kidnappings and have also said they will shoot police.<n>Surveillance footage shows one robber holding his finger just off the trigger, a safety method used by law enforcement.

Account purge was largest ever carried out by the social network.<n>Twitter's 'violations department' suspended 10,000 accounts on April 2.<n>Accounts were being used by ISIS militants and their supporters to tweet violent threats, a representative has said.<n>This is in part due to the 'Operation Anti-ISIS' campaign launched by Anonymous.<n>Anonymous encouraged members to expose thousands of accounts connected with ISIS.

Rachelle Friedman Chapman, 29, broke her neck in a pool accident in 2010.<n>She can physically carry children but her blood pressure is too low.<n>A college friend, Laurel Humes, offered to carry the baby for the Chapmans.<n>The baby is due on April 18.

Lowy Institute report says foreign fighters pose a serious threat to Australia.<n>It says the Abbott government's 'troubled relations' with the Muslim community is undermining efforts at countering violent extremism.<n>The report comes just a day after the death of Melbourne model-turned-jihadist Sharky Jama.

A Savannah baby and a baby in Atlanta has been awarded $1,529 for college expenses as part of a state sweepstake draw before even turning 10-hours-old.<n>Levi Jarrett Millspaugh was born at 2:38 a.m. Wednesday, making him this year’s first Tax Day baby at Memorial University Medical Center.<n>The other lucky winner was a baby named Johnathan, the newborn child of David Choe and his wife Jennifer.

Jeffrey Walker told jurors that the Philadelphia Police Department drug squad targeted 'white college-boy... khaki-pants types'<n>He said squad leader Thomas Liciardello, the lead defendant, 'produced big jobs, a lot of arrests'<n>Walker, 46, said police brass applauded the drug squad because they made big arrests that made them look good.

Study found mindfulness-based cognitive therapy (MBCT) led to similar outcomes as antidepressants when treating the mental disorder.<n>MBCT teaches people to focus on the present moment.<n>It's designed to help the patient develop a healthier, more accepting relationship with their thoughts and feelings.

The guard was shot in the abdomen outside the Suitland, Maryland campus around 8pm Thursday.<n>He was taken to a Washington area hospital but died before 10pm.<n>The suspect was shot several times by police after leading them on a chase back into D.C.<n>The shooting may have been tied to another incident in the Southeast quadrant of the city.

A man in a 'distinctive' cartoon mask robbed a Christchurch dairy.<n>The offender, snapped on security footage, is described as being'very tall'<n>He made off with the dairy's till and about $1500 in cash on Saturday.<n>Police are appealing to the public to help identify the man.

One in four British Muslims have sympathy for those who join terror groups.<n>Eight per cent said they had 'a lot of sympathy' for Jihadi John.<n>Four out of ten British Muslims partly blame security services for radicalising young Jihadis.<n>One in seven non-Muslims had sympathy for those who have joined ISIS.

Defense attorneys released some of the training records Saturday for Robert Bates, 73, who is charged with manslaughter.<n>The records include certificates showing what training he received, job evaluation reports and weapons training and qualification records dating to 2008.<n>Bates has said he mistakenly pulled out a handgun rather than a stun gun when he fatally shot Eric Harris on April 2 as he lay on the ground.<n>He has been charged with second-degree manslaughter.

Hop Theory sachets contain a blend of hops, fruit peels and spices.<n>They promise to turn lager into craft beer in just two minutes.<n>However, the project has been criticised by breweries as misleading.

Kenneth Morgan Stancil III, 20, is awaiting extradition from Florida to North Carolina, where he is accused of fatally shooting 44-year-old Ron Lane.<n>Stancil said Lane tried to take advantage of his 16-year-old brother.<n>He also claimed to have killed three other people, including two in the Wayne County area.

The four-time World Champion used biodegradable powder in the stunt.<n>The Austrian skier had to swerve around poles filled with the powder.<n>The video was shot from 11 cameras, including a hand held one.

Georgina Chapman, 38, seen looking forlorn outside their New York home.<n>She carried their four-year-old daughter India to their car.<n>Police reportedly overheard a phone call between Weinstein and Ambra Battilana.<n>She claims he groped her during a 'business meeting' at his Tribeca office.<n>The Hollywood producer has vehemently denied the allegations.<n>He was seen leaving his New York townhouse on Thursday.

Kyesha Smith Wood, 36, was watching Cinderella with her daughter Ashley.<n>She confronted 13-year-old Lexy and her step-sister after the film.<n>Rebecca Boyd, 36, said that the teenagers were 'rude and obnoxious'<n>Mrs Wood reached out on social media to find the woman and apologize.<n> Lexy has now apologized and both families have had dinner together.

Damon Muller was diagnosed with Juvenile Dermatomyositis (JDM) in November.<n>The rare autoimmune disease means he can't run, ride his bike or play in the sun.<n>Damon, from Gladstone in central Queensland, has almost doubled in size due to swelling and bloating.<n>He has been rushed to hospital once after his neck started swelling so much it almost closed his throat.

Warren Rodwell was held captive by Abu Sayyaf militants for 472 days.<n>He was released in March 2013 after his family raised a ransom.<n>Under Australian law, victims of overseas terror attacks can claim up to $75,000 in compensation.<n>Mr Rodwell fears the Federal government will not award him that amount.

Caretakers of Abraham Lincoln's tomb are on the defensive over an unflattering critique in National Geographic magazine.<n>The magazine called the tomb 'a disappointment' and reconstructed in 'incongruous Art Deco style'<n>The state Historic Preservation Agency that manages sites including the tomb as it currently exists is facing budget cuts.<n>Gov. Bruce Rauner has proposed eliminating the state Historic Preservation Agency that manages sites including the tomb as it currently exists.

Anjelica 'AJ' Hadsell, 18, has been missing since March 2, when she was on a break from Longwood University in Farmville, Virginia.<n>On Thursday, police found the remains 40 miles from her home.<n>They have been sent to the medical examiner's office for identification.<n>Last week, police searched a pond near Carrsville after receiving a tip that her cell phone may be below the surface.

Nick Robinson announced he was taking a break from the BBC to have treatment.<n>The political editor had surgery for a rare lung tumour in March.<n>He returned to the screens last night to analyse Labour's manifesto.<n>His voice sounded weak and strained but he said he was not risking his recovery.

Edward Snowden leaked 1.7million classified documents in 2013.<n>Intelligence files revealed attempts by agencies to view citizens' private information.<n>Report claims at least three Al Qaeda affiliates altered communications.<n>Ex-CIA contractor fled to Russia where he is now living in secret location.

Lacey Spears of Scottsville, Kentucky, was found guilty last month of second-degree murder in the death of her son Garnett-Paul Spears.<n>She was spared the maximum 25 years to life and instead received 20.<n>Garnett-Paul's father, Chris Hill, lashed out on Facebook this week asking that his wife be put in general population.<n>He also noted Spears' complete lack of emotion at her sentencing, writing; 'No emotion what so ever. What the hell!??'

Yazidi teenager tells how ISIS fighters dragged girls by their hair and raped them.<n>Hanan, 19, was snatched from her family and taken to a warehouse in Mosul.<n>She and six others were then taken to a house in a nearby village.<n>A fellow Yazidi girl told them she had been beaten, handcuffed and raped.<n>They were told they would soon suffer the same fate as the other girls.<n>Hanan managed to escape that night but two of them were caught as they fled.

The remains of a woman were found in a cave in Cantabria, Spain.<n>She was buried around 18,700 years ago and was nicknamed The Red Lady.<n>Researchers found spores of grilled fungi and bolete fungi in her teeth.<n>This suggests she ate mushrooms as part of her Stone Age diet.

Xiao Zhengti, five, was born with congenital biliary atresia disease.<n>Mother Yang Haiying donated part of her liver to try and save her son.<n>But complications followed and boy's body rejected the organ.<n>He spent four years in hospital and suffered 200 days of high fever.<n>Father Xiao Kunqing was also a match but surgeons warned against second operation.<n>But yesterday he had 40 per cent of his liver removed and transplanted into son.
72 unprovoked shark attacks around the world last year.<n>Three people killed in Australia and South Africa.<n>Great White, Bull and Tiger sharks account for vast majority of attacks.

James Ritchie was elected as women's officer at the Tasmanian University Union.<n>He was under pressure from a petition and public opposition to employ a male.<n>The union has now introduced a statutory declaration requirement.

Alfie had an MRI scan at the Animal Health Trust clinic in Newmarket, Suffolk.<n>Owner Lynne Edwards noticed a lump behind his ear but thought it was fine.<n>But when she returned she found puss oozing from his back.<n>She took him to a vet where staff exposed the severe burns in his back.<n>She then discovered a pad used to keep him warm had been warmed in a microwave.<n>The Animal Health Trust said they have reviewed their practice and are now using an incubator to heat the pads properly.

Mike Lane, 40, was beaten by balaclava-clad protesters armed with iron bars.<n>A dossier of evidence was given to Wiltshire Police after the assault.<n>It included names of saboteurs and their car registration numbers.<n>The attack took place even though the 30 riders and their hounds were chasing only an artificial scent, rather than a fox.

The capybara called JoeJoe has almost 60,000 followers on Instagram.<n>He lives in Las Vegas with his owner Cody Kennedy.<n>His Facebook page has nearly 5,000 likes and his Twitter account has over 1,000 followers.

The Shire of Montana is a guest house in the north-west corner of Montana.<n>At 1,000 square feet, it is built into a hill and has no mobile phone service.<n>Owners spent $400,000 transforming the property into a destination for fans.

2500 passengers on board the Carnival Spirit are stranded outside Sydney Harbour.<n>The ship has been damaged in wild weather conditions off the NSW coast.<n>The passengers have been told the seas are so high they are in danger of being stranded.<n>The massive swell, seen from video images taken from on-board, reveals just how treacherous and stomach churning the conditions are.

Peter Garrett is selling his charming Victorian terrace in Randwick.<n>The 193 centimetre rockstar’s home boasts beautiful high ceilings.<n>The three bedroom terrace is set over two levels with a beautiful balcony off the master bedroom, looking out onto the street.<n>The property was bought by Garrett for $932,500 in 2010.

The government is set to strip parents of welfare benefits if they don't immunise their kids.<n>The changes will come into full effect in January 2016.<n>Social Services Minister Scott Morrison will announce the reforms on Sunday.<n>Currently around 39,000 Australian children under the age of seven are not vaccinated.

Iona Costello, 51, and daughter Emily, 14, were visiting Manhattan.<n>They were found at 3am by NYPD officers and are in good health.<n>Iona is in the midst of a nasty battle over the will of her late husband.<n>George Costello Sr, 63, died of a heart attack in 2012.

Jack Jordan, 23, proposed to Laura Cant last Christmas from his hospital bed.<n>The pair planned to wed after a bone marrow transplant to prolong his life.<n>But last week Mr Jordan was told he was too ill for the operation.<n>He has just weeks to live and the couple are now set to marry in hospital.

Alex Trebek asked: 'In common law, the age of this, signaling adulthood, is presumed to be 14 in boys & 12 in girls?'<n>The first contestant to press his buzzer was Tom, a freemason, who inexplicably answered: 'What is the age of consent?'<n>Viewers watching at home couldn't contain their horror at what Tom's answer appeared to imply and soon #jeopardy was trending on Twitter.

Warner Bros and DC Entertainment attempted to set a world record for the largest gatherings of people dressed as DC Comics Superheroes.<n>The April 18 event kicked off in Queensland, Australia, with a celebration at the Movie World Australia theme park.<n>Venues in 15 cities, including Los Angeles and Queensland, participated in the event.<n>The largest gathering of people dressed as Superman was 867, according to Guinness.

Elijah Cook was born in January with both his mothers and fathers deaf.<n>Tests confirmed he was profoundly deaf in his left ear and only able to hear 75 decibels in his right.<n>But doctors decided to fit him with hearing aids as soon as possible.<n>Last month, he was able to hear his mother for the first time.

Former education journalist David Turner has written a book about the history of Britain's public schools.<n>He was inspired by David Cameron's comparison to Tom Brown's School Days.<n>Mr Turner says if schools have not improved, Britain is in serious trouble.

Mary Kay Letourneau and Vili Fualaau's 17-year-old daughter, Audrey, and 16-year-old daughter, Georgia, were born while their mother was out on probation.<n>Letourneau, then a 34-year-old married mother of four, pleaded guilty to child rape for her illicit affair with her sixth-grade student.<n>The couple sat down for an interview with Barbara Walters on 20/20, which will air on ABC Friday at 10pm.

Taronga's Asian Elephants were served the record-breaking pumpkin for breakfast.<n>The pumpkins were recycled after being displayed at the show.<n>The 728kg pumpkin was the largest ever seen in Australasia.<n>Keepers hope the pumpkins will stimulate the elephants' curiosity.

The retailer announced on it's website that it 'no longer' has store locations while reminding customers that its 'online store offers the same selection of products'<n>Retail experts say the company has become 'old and stale' and that Victoria's Secret has been a 'home run'

Xue Feng was deported and returned to his family in Houston, Texas.<n>He served all but ten months of his eight year sentence at Beijing's No. 2 Prison.<n>Xue was sentenced in 2010 on charges of illegally gathering information on China's oil industry.<n>American diplomats had lobbied hard for Xue's release.

Matthew Hall, 25, climbed onto balconies in of his victims in Manchester.<n>Asked when confronted 'am I scaring you?' and 'you're dead sexy - can I come in?'<n>Hall was jailed for two years after admitting two attempted burglaries and one burglary.<n>Now banned from area near trendy Northern Quarter for five years.

Perry has opted out of presenting at this year's event.<n>He says he is enjoying a'breather' and is working on his Cruise collection.<n>Perry says he will support his friends Kym Ellery and Johnny Chembri.

Sarah Wilson, 41, opened up about her battle with mental illness.<n>She said anxiety drove her to believe she had reached a stage in her life where she 'couldn't see the point of continuing'<n>Ms Wilson said she had mounting stress, anxiety, her thyroid disease and distant family.<n>She said while she now accepts she is an 'anxious person', when she was younger she watched everybody else coping.<n>Ms Wilson said anxiety is quickly becoming the 'new depression'

Jay Kantaria, 38, jumped onto tracks at his local station in north-west London.<n>He had recently left senior position at Baring Asset Management to start career.<n>Coroner recorded open verdict on cause of death, saying 'doubt' over intention.
Sarah Ivens, 34, wanted to conceive at the age of 34.<n>But her body was failing her and she feared she was too old.<n>She and husband Russell have now had two children.

The inflatable, nicknamed Ba Di Doll, has appeared at Wanda Plaza commercial complex in eastern China's Nanjing city.<n>The attraction features a ball pit, slide and climbing area, and can be accessed via the doll's right foot.<n>The doll is 30 metres long, seven metres tall and six metres wide and has flaming green hair and pink lips.

The National Institute on Drug Abuse in the US has admitted, in its revised publication on marijuana, that the drug offers benefits to some cancer patients.<n>The term medicinal marijuana refers to using the whole unprocessed plant or its basic extracts to treat a disease or symptom.<n>Currently the drug is not recognised by the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) as a medicine.<n>Studies of the chemicals in marijuana - cannabinoids - has led the FDA to approve two medications that contain cannabinoid chemicals.<n>The National Institute on Drug Abuse is urging the US government to recognise the medicinal value of marijuana.<n>The drug may kill cancer

Kenneth Stancil III, 20, made his first appearance in a North Carolina courtroom on Thursday after being extradited from Florida.<n>He is accused of shooting 44-year-old Ron Lane at Wayne Community College on Monday morning before fleeing more than 500 miles south.<n>He told the judge he knew he'd get the death penalty if he killed Lane for making sexual advances towards his 16-year-old brother.<n>When the judge reminded him he could get the death penalty, he swore at him and was kicked out of the courtroom.<n>He returned 30 minutes later and said he wanted an attorney.

Marc Wabafiyebazu, 15, and his 17-year-old brother Jean were living in Miami with their mother Roxanne Dube, Canada's consul general.<n>The boys were allegedly involved in a drugs raid on March 30.<n>Marc is awaiting the outcome of a murder charge against him.<n>Court documents reveal he boasted to investigators of previous raids.<n>The boys attended top private schools in Canada and would drive around in their mother's BMW with loaded guns in the back seat.

David Etzel, 36, of Palm Beach County, Florida, is facing an animal cruelty charge.<n>Etzel's mother said he was drinking and teasing her 10-pound Shih Tzu named Cujo before biting it.<n>The dog's eye was hanging out of its socket.

Supreme Court Chief Justice John Roberts reported for jury duty in Rockville, Maryland on Wednesday.<n>The 60-year-old was called to serve on a case involving a car crash and had to answer a couple of questions about his relatives.<n>When it came to a question about the jurors legal experience the sitting Judge refrained from making Roberts answer, saying, 'Obviously we know what you do for a living, sir'

The Northern Territory Cattlemen's Association held an annual photography competition.<n>The competition asked for images that will illustrate the NT's unique outback lifestyle as well as their distinctive people and landscapes.<n>Marie Muldoon won the competition with a touching photo of her daughter cuddling up to a horse.<n>The winning photograph speaks to the intrinsic link between man and animal.

Rilie Carey learned the popular song at preschool and was halfway through dinner.<n>She decided to perform it for her mom Jessica Carey, from Salem, Oregon.<n>At the end of the clip Rilie leans in for a hug from her mom despite being told ducks do return.

The Republican presidential hopefuls told conservative radio host Hugh Hewitt in separate interviews on Tuesday that they'd enforce federal drug laws.<n>'Marijuana is a gateway drug,' Christie said, citing an 'enormous addiction problem in this country'<n>'And we need to send very clear leadership from the White House on down through the federal law enforcement,' he added.<n>Asked for his position on the topic, Rubio said 'I think we need to enforce our federal laws'

Ashley Pegram, a 28-year-old mother-of-three, was last seen leaving her South Carolina home for a date with Edward Primo Bonilla on April 3.<n>She was seen getting out of his car at a gas station and returning to the vehicle the next morning.<n>But he told her he had kicked her out after she got too drunk.<n>He sent her an apology message on messaging service Kik but surveillance footage shows her returning to the car the next morning.<n>Bonilla has now been charged with obstructing justice.

Photos posted on Instagram account Passenger Shaming by anonymous travellers.<n>They show passengers with annoying habits including a foot wedged in between seats and rubbish being trashed in seat pockets.<n>Also shows a bulldog in a security vest and two passengers wearing face masks.

Haley Fox, 24, of Turner, Oregon, fractured 26-year-old Samuel Campbell's skull with a baseball bat at her home last Wednesday.<n>She has been charged with first-degree assault.<n>Fox and Campbell, of Adger, Alabama, had been in a relationship for around two years after meeting online.<n>He moved to Oregon to live with Ms Fox earlier this month.<n>She allegedly asked him to close his eyes and struck him three times from behind on the head with a metal baseball bat.

Christine Lillico, 47, was trusted with looking after her elderly parents' accounts.<n>But over a six year period she stole £78,000 from John and Audrey Air.<n>Court heard she spent some of the money in shops including B&Q.<n>Her elderly father was left in debt and too poor to afford a telephone.<n>Mother-of-two has been jailed for 20 months and ordered to pay back money.

The 77-year-old woman was struck by lightning while she sat in her car.<n>Days later, her hairdresser noticed she had suffered minor burns.<n>She also noticed her eye sight was blurred - she could barely see.<n>Days later, she visited the opticians and was referred to an ophthalmologist.<n>Mohit Gupta, an opthalmologist at Pilgrim Hospital in Boston, England, used a new technique to scan her retina.<n>He found a hole in her retina, which was caused by the heat from the lightning.<n>She underwent surgery to repair the hole in her retina, after

Kevin Carr, 34, from Devon, ran more than a marathon a day for almost two years.<n>He crossed 26 countries and got through 16 pairs of shoes to complete the feat.<n>He set off from Haytor on Dartmoor in July 2013 and returned last night after 621 days.<n>Mr Carr was the first man to complete the voyage unsupported, and instead of a team, he pushed it along himself in a buggy.

Ashton Wood launched a Kickstarter campaign last year to raise money to destroy his new Jeep Cherokee.<n>He claimed the car had 21 mechanical problems and refused to refund or replace it.<n>The car company requested he apologise for criticising them.<n>Mr Wood will read out his apology on national television tonight.

Lawrence Phillips, 39, is suspected of killing Damion Soward, 37.<n>Soward was found lifeless in his cell at Kern Valley State Prison.<n>Phillips was jailed in 2005 for choking his girlfriend in San Diego.<n>He also drove his car into three teens after a pickup football game.

Joelison Fernandes da Silva, 28, developed gigantism as a child.<n>His height forced him to drop out of school and refuse to leave the house.<n>But true happiness eventually found him in the form of Evem Medeiros.<n>The pair married in a ceremony in their hometown of Paraiba, Brazil.

Kestutis Martuzevicius, 52, accused of 22 crimes in Lithuania, including two murders.<n>He claimed he would face reprisals if he returned to his homeland in Europe.<n>But British judges ruled his extradition would not be unjust because he was depressed.<n>European Court of Human Rights rules his case is'manifestly ill-founded'

Cocktail sausages laced with poison found on a dog walking trail.<n>The sausages were loaded with pellets and found hidden among grass.<n>Police are warning dog owners to be aware when out walking their animals.

Video of the February 19 incident emerged on Tuesday and shows a cop car running into a suspect walking down a street in Marana, northwest of Tucon.<n>Officer Michael Rapiejko was driving the car and was warned by another officer that the suspect was 'definitely loaded'<n>But in apparent defiance of his advice, Rapiejko drives straight toward unsuspecting Valencia.<n>The cop's car then mounts the curb and smashes into the suspect's body.<n>Local police chief Terry Rozema spoke out on Wednesday to defend his officer and argue that deadly force was necessary.

The Ardche region of south central France is known as the gastronomic centre of France.<n>L'Ardéchoise site is a quiet, well-established, family friendly site.<n>It's an hour-and-half's drive from the beaches of the south and Montpellier airport.

The 84-year-old man was attempting to parallel park when he hit his wife.<n>She suffered a serious head injury and was placed in a medically-induced coma.<n>The woman also suffered injuries to her throat and legs.<n>One witness said she was 'covered in blood' after the incident.

Darlene Feliciano, 27, was hiking with a male friend on the Makapuu 'Tom-Tom' trail overlooking Sea Life Park along Kalanianaole Highway in Oahu, Hawaii.<n>She slipped and fell about 500 feet below a hole in the trail known locally as The Puka.<n>The unconscious woman was airlifted from the area but was pronounced dead just after 2pm Friday.

Carwyn Scott-Howell was on holiday with his mother and sister in the Alps.<n>He is believed to have taken a shortcut to the woods from the run down.<n>Family say he was a'very competent skier' who started aged three.

Coles has been ordered to pay $2.5 million in penalties for misleading its bread.<n>The Federal Court slammed the supermarket giant with a three-year ban.<n>The falsely labelled bread has generated a revenue of about $300 million.<n>The bread was often partially baked in factories overseas, frozen, and shipped to Australia months later to be sold as freshly baked loaves.

Prasanna ‘Nick’ Arulchelvam chased the gang through a Costco car park.<n>He jumped through an open door but was pushed out and hit the ground.<n>The man who pushed him to his death was jailed for 11 years today.<n>He admitted all he wanted was 'a few cheap packets of cigarettes'

Four men are interviewed by ISIS militants before being dragged away.<n>They are blindfolded and forced to their knees before being beheaded.<n>Their bodies are then dragged before crowds in central Mosul.<n>Locals say they were later put on public display in the city centre.

More than 7.8 million immigrants live in the UK, according to new data.<n>U.S. has the most immigrants, followed by Russia and Saudi Arabia.<n>London, Leicester, the Birmingham area and Bradford have the highest percentage.<n>Data was released by the United Nations to coincide with World Immigration Day.

The disused Rhondda Tunnel runs 1,000 feet beneath the Welsh hills.<n>It was closed as part of the Beeching cutbacks, a project which spelled the end for thousands and stations across the rail network.<n>Engineers are due to visit the 3,148m tunnel next week to see whether it is safe to use as a cycle route.

The Randolph Hotel, in Oxford, caught fire this afternoon.<n>The Grade II listed Victorian building has been used as a setting for Inspector Morse.<n>Plumes of smoke were seen billowing from the roof of the hotel.<n>The extent of the damage to the Grade II listed Victorian building remains unclear.

Jamie Silvonek, 14, is accused of conspiring with her soldier boyfriend by text message to have her mother killed.<n>Cheryl Silvonek's body was found with stab wounds in a shallow grave about 50 miles northwest of Philadelphia.<n>Jamie Silvonek was sent to the county jail this month after she was charged as an adult and is in the women's housing unit, away from older inmates.

The 2015 Australian Fashion Report has named and shamed some of the worst Aussie clothing brands and companies.<n>The report assessed the labour rights management systems of 59 companies and 219 brands operating in Australia.<n>Amongst the best performers were Etiko, Audrey Blue, Cotton On, H&M and Zara.<n>It found that only two of the companies could prove they were paying a full living wage to the workers in two of the three production stages of their clothing.

Video shows two of the £126million jets approaching RAF Lossiemouth.<n>William Bird captured the clip while out with his stepson Alex.<n>As the second jet disappeared from view the camera was knocked sideways.

Fanny Cornforth was a West-Sussex born model and mistress of Dante Gabriel Rossetti.<n>Records from Graylingwell Hospital in Chichester revealed she died in the asylum in 1909.<n>She was suffering from dementia and'senile mania' at the time of her death.<n>Her biographer tracked her down through the records and laid flowers at her unmarked grave.

Scott Keyes, a 28-year-old writer for Think Progress, is about to travel 20,000miles on 21 flights.<n>Along the way he will be stopping by 13 countries in Europe and South and North America.<n>He rounded up all his airline miles, and the points he had acquired on his 25 credit cards to book his trip.

The twins love seafood, sushi, and spicy foods like ginger, mint, and cinnamon.<n>Daughter Harper prefers'very strong and briny flavors' like oysters, sardines, prosciutto, capers, duck liver, miso, and chocolate.

Nineteen people needed medical treatment after blast at chemical plant.<n>It took 177 fire engines and 829 firefighters to bring the blaze under control.<n>The plant manufactures paraxylene, or PX, a chemical used for fibers.<n>Environmental officials are monitoring the surrounding area for signs of contamination.

Amjad Yaaqub, 16, said ISIS fighters beat him unconscious when they burst into his family home at the camp in the Syrian capital Damascus.<n>ISIS has seized control of 90 per cent of the camp after a bloody assault that has left more than 200 people dead.<n>'I saw severed heads. They killed children in front of their parents. We were terrorised,' said a man who fled the camp with his family.

Cecil Hamilton-Miller was responsible for the convictions of 31 guards.<n>These included camp commander Josef Kramer and Dr Fritz Klein.<n>Mr Hamilton-Miller, who died in 2001, struggled to talk about Belsen.<n>Family photograph shows him watching Kramer being marched to his death.

Jayson McDonald was found hiding under a bed in Amsterdam.<n>Paul Monk was captured at his luxury villa in Alicante on Spanish coast.<n>They were arrested as part of Operation Captura, a drive launched in 2006.<n>McDonald wanted on suspicion of conspiracies to import and supply heroin.<n>Monk wanted on suspicion of conspiracy to supply cocaine and conspiracy to supply cannabis.

David Cameron appeared weary with bags under his eyes and disheveled hair.<n>In one day this week the Tory leader travelled to all four home nations.<n>He has also had to defend outspoken ministers and wade into arguments.<n>Yesterday he got into a muddle over how to eat a scone in Cornwall.

Singh is currently in Djibouti leading the rescue operation from Yemen.<n>The former army chief is quoted as saying that he found the evacuation assignment less exciting than his recent visit to the Pakistan High Commission.<n>The Broadcast Editors’ Association found the tweet to be offensive.

Meter Maids started in 1965 to stave off bad publicity associated with newly installed parking meters.<n>Local business owners say the group is no longer performing a public service as they have become irrelevant.<n>Gold Coast Chamber of Commerce president Peter Yared said the group were now a business.<n>But Meter Maids general manager Michael Yarwood said the chamber of commerce was taking 'a terribly ill-informed position'

Joseph O'Riordan, 73, stabbed his wife Amanda eight times with a knife.<n>He discovered she had been having an affair with a postman.<n>He rang an ambulance after the attack in October last year.<n>O'Riordan wrote to his wife from jail asking her to 'get my things together'<n>He asked her to give him his suit and three ties for his trial.

Sky newsreader reveals 'blood and saliva flying' between her boisterous sons.<n>Mother-of-three describes Easter holiday trip with her three children.<n>She took some time off work to spend with them but turned into a string of tantrums.<n>In a blog post, she also describes 'working mum guilt'

Elijah McCrae died on Monday evening, with his parents by his side.<n>He suffered with fatal genetic disease Type 1 Spinal Atrophy.<n>His parents created a 30-item 'bucket list' for their beloved son.<n>They documented his final days on social media.

Boeing's new overhead luggage bins will be available on 737 planes.<n>'Space Bins' can hold two more bags than existing compartments.<n>The bins have been tested by a group of ‘frequent fliers’ who were hand-picked by Boeing.<n>Two airlines – Delta and Alaska – have ordered the new bins.<n>The bins will likely arrive in Europe within the next few years.

Jacob Phillips, 23, was on a night out with friends in Cardiff.<n>He got into a taxi but the driver gave chase because he couldn't see.<n>Mr Phillips, of Reading, Berks, fell down the cliff in Penarth, South Wales.<n>The accountant had been staying with his mother in upmarket Cowbridge.<n>The inquest heard that he had returned to Wales for Christmas.

The eO PP03 is a one megawatt electric race car by Drive eO.<n>It runs on 50 kWh lithium-ion battery pack and six electric motors.<n>The car can produce 1020 kW (1368 horsepower) and speeds of 160 mph (260 km/h)<n>It is set to compete in the Pikes Peak International Hill Climb.

Zoe Hadley, 19, had been battling an undiagnosed illness since age of 13.<n>Was found dead at a hotel in Putney, south west London last year.<n>Inquest heard how her parents, solicitor Lisa Hommel and her GP father Laurence, struggled to treat her condition.<n>For confidential support call the Samaritans in the UK on 08457 90 90 90, visit a local Samaritans branch or click here for details.

Bernadette Forde was found dead in her wheelchair in June 2011.<n>She had recorded a'suicide note' saying she couldn't live with her partner.<n>Gail O'Rorke is accused of helping Ms Forde to commit suicide.<n>She is also accused of helping her to buy a toxic substance for her death.<n>The 43-year-old taxi driver has pleaded not guilty at Dublin Circuit Criminal Court to three charges.

Titanic star Kate Winslet wears a UK size-nine shoe.<n>At 5ft 7in she has the same foot size as Titanic co-star Leonardo DiCaprio.<n>The average shoe size in the UK has risen from a dainty 412 in 1900 to a roomy six today.

Leanne Bourne, from Essex, was heartbroken when she discovered her sister's affair.<n>Larissa Knipe, who was seven years younger, was in a relationship with her sister's partner.<n>Three years on, Leanne is still struggling to come to terms with what happened.

Islamic State have launched their own rules for social media use.<n>The rules state that any information about the group's defeats is banned.<n>They also state that any pictures of ISIS fighters and the use of tactics are also banned.<n>The rules have been circulated by ISIS supporters after defeats in Tikrit.

Daisy Goodwin has suffered with head lice since she was 19.<n>She has had nits at least 100 times and has had to use a special comb.<n>She says her scalp is 'El Dorado' for lice and she has had to use a special comb to get rid of the varmits.

Shoshana Hebshi, of Sylvania, Ohio, was strip-searched at a Detroit-area airport on the 10th anniversary of 9/11.<n>She was traveling home after visiting a sister in California when was removed from the Frontier Airlines flight after it landed Sept. 11, 2011.<n>She was seated next to two Indian-American men, whom crew members had said spent a lot of time in the plane's bathroom.<n>Hebshi was held for hours before being released.<n>'People do not forfeit their constitutional rights when they step onto an airplane,' said ACLU attorney Rachel Goodman

Peter Reece, his fiancee, mother and six-month-old daughter were parked on an Ocean Shores, Washington, beach on Thursday.<n>The tide came in and trapped the family's car.<n>Reece and his fiancee got out, but his mother and daughter were trapped inside.<n>Seconds after Ocean Shores police officer Kyle Watson saved the woman and baby, a wave hit the car, flipping it and pulling it out to sea.

Oxford University's men's team claimed their fourth win in five years in the 161st men's boat race.<n>The Dark Blues beat Cambridge by six-and-a-half lengths on The Tideway course.<n>Female crews representing Oxford and Cambridge rowed the same stretch of the River Thames in London as the men for the first time.

Three teenagers have been charged with the bashing of a father and daughter.<n>The attackers, two aged 15 and one aged 14, were arrested by on Friday.<n>The incident took place on Sunday night at Charlestown Square shopping centre.<n>Tibor Racsits, 42, and his daughter Kiara, 13, were bashed by a gang of 25.<n>They were attacked as they went to pick up Kiara from the movies.<n>Mr Racsits was dragged across the road by at least three young men.<n>His daughter can be heard screaming as she runs to help, but she is pushed from behind by
Kate Hudson, Pharrell Williams and Keira Knightley all look the same.<n>While many have resorted to plastic surgery, these A-listers are still sporting glowing skin without going under the knife.

Phillip and Gaby Beckle-Raymond had used savings to buy home.<n>They had spent five years working to make it a happy place for their family.<n>But when they sprung a leak, cowboy builders came to fix it.<n>Instead they left the family with no roof and no protection from rain.<n>Rain got into the property causing ceilings to collapse.<n>They were forced to live in one room of the house for six months.<n>It will cost £35,000 to repair the home.

Martin Burgess Clock B based on design by carpenter John Harrison.<n>He thought up idea to solve problem of determining longitude at sea in 18th century.<n>It has been part of 100-day trial at Royal Observatory, in Greenwich.<n>Experts claim it would neither lose nor gain more than a second in 100 days.<n>But it has now been certified by Guinness World Records.

Tories launch poster campaign showing Sturgeon manipulating a puppet Labour leader.<n>Conservative chairman Grant Shapps said: 'Ed Miliband might crawl through the gates of No10 now'<n>Comes as Sturgeon uses article in Scottish Mail on Sunday to claim she can help 'lead the UK'

Jack Cordero, 14, vomited all over floor of Powell's bookstore in Portland.<n>Manager said the mess was 'gigantic' and had to clean it up.<n>But her spirits were raised when he sent a handwritten apology.<n>Letter included a Ben & Jerry's gift card and Jack's name on it.

Florence has 16 million tourists a year, but 350,000 live in the city.<n>Prince Ottaviano de’Medici di Toscana is trying to reclaim the city.<n>He fears that Florence's cultural significance has been radically altered.<n>Has proposed adding Florence, already a World Heritage City, to UNESCO's endangered list.

Amanda Chatel wrote an essay for Your Tango in which she explained why she is pushing for 'yes means yes' laws to be passed across the country.<n>The 'yes means yes' law was first passed in California in 2014 and requires all colleges taking financial aid funding from the state to adhere to the standard for consent outlined by the law.

Nyia Parler, 41, was taken into custody by authorities in Montgomery County, Maryland overnight Saturday on charges including aggravated assault.<n>Police say she traveled to Maryland from Pennsylvania last Sunday or Monday after leaving her 21-year-old wheelchair-bound son in a wooded park with nothing but a blanket and a Bible.<n>Parler's son, who is non-verbal and suffers from cerebral palsy, was found on Friday night lying beneath a rain-soaked blanket and a pile of leaves on the ground, 10 feet from his wheelchair and the Bible.<n>He was hospitalized with dehydration, malnutrition, a cut to his

Philip and Victoria Sherlock have been living out of their car for three months.<n>Philip lost his job as a gardener after a stomach operation.<n>The couple then lost their benefits after Victoria took on more work.<n>They have been sleeping in their car to be closer to Victoria's job.<n>Philip has now started work as a stock manager at a Manchester company.

Aaron Hernandez was a star football player who grew up in a tough neighborhood in Bristol, Connecticut.<n>He was a star player for the New England Patriots and signed a massive contract extension that would pay him nearly $40million.<n>Hernandez was involved in a drug and alcohol problem that led to his desire to be involved in the 'thug life'<n>He had a history of escaping trouble thanks to coaches and cops allegedly covering for him.<n>He was allegedly a member of the Bloods gang and smoked hallucinogen PCP.

Slipper Island, a 2.7 km long, 1.8 km wide landmass located 4 km off the coast of the New Zealand's North Island, has been purchased for AUD $6.75 million.<n>The buyer, Wendy Wei Mei Wu, is reportedly yet to decide what she wants to do with the 217 hectare island.<n>The sale has divided the Needham family who own the island, with some of them claiming it represents' the loss of the family's legacy'<n>Ms Wu made headlines in 2010 for making the biggest private home sale of the year, the $NZ 15 million Fairholm Mansion in the affluent Auckland suburb of Remu

Stacey Johnson, 22, was diagnosed with an inoperable brain tumour in 2007.<n>She has undergone gruelling chemotherapy and radiotherapy.<n>In December 2014, she was told her tumour had grown.<n>Her sister Dannii, 20, had been suffering headaches and felt ill.<n>She was shocked to discover she too had a tumour, although hers is benign.

Christine Davidson was diagnosed with terminal brain cancer in 2001.<n>The mother of two lost her battle to cancer last Thursday morning at an Adelaide nursing home at the age of 61.<n>Her family claims her diamond engagement ring was 'forcefully removed and stolen' from her finger at the nursing home.<n>The family has launched a desperate online appeal in a bid to have their mother's ring returned.

Clarence David Moore, 66, was serving a sentence of more than 10 years for larceny when he broke free June 10, 1972.<n>Moore was living in a tidy red-brick home in Frankfort, Kentucky, with white columns along a tree-lined residential street.<n>He was captured Monday afternoon after calling the Franklin County Sheriff's Office and admitting to being a fugitive.<n>Moore suffers from several medical conditions and cannot walk, but he has no Social Security card of any form of ID.

Adrian Schaffner filmed descending the ski runs of Minschuns in Val Mstair.<n>He was seen ascending the mountain with his dog Sintha on his shoulders.<n>The dog appears to be enjoying the sensation of speed on the run.<n>After a long ski to the bottom, the dog jumps from his shoulders and onto the ground.

More than half of Scots plan to back the SNP in the general election.<n>Poll puts SNP on 52%, Labour on 24%, Tories on 13% and Lib Dems on 6%.<n>Blow for Miliband on day he used Labour manifesto launch to insist he is'ready' to be Prime Minister.

President Barack Obama became the first president to visit Jamaica since President Ronald Reagan in 1982 on Thursday.<n>Prime Minister Portia Simpson Miller told President Obama she loved him, and she loved him as well.<n>Simpson Miller also asked President Obama to exonerate black nationalist leader Marcus Garvey, who was convicted in the U.S. of mail fraud in the 1920s.

Trevor Noah has separated from his long term girlfriend Dani Gabriel.<n>The pair began dating in early 2014 and have known each other for four years.<n>Gabriel, 28, runs her own physiotherapist practice in Cape Town.<n>She told Daily Mail Online that she's'very supportive' of Noah's new fame.

Patrick Morrison raped his niece Sabrina when she was 13 but authorities said there was no evidence of the attack and left him on the streets.<n>He continued to assault her for four years and got her pregnant.<n>The case was re-opened in 2011 and Morrison was arrested.<n>It was one of more than 400 sex crimes not investigated by Maricopa County Sheriff's Office over a three-year period ending in 2007.

Lily Sharp decided to prank her own mother by pretending to be kidnapped.<n>She began by convincing her mother that a stranger had entered their home.<n>She then pretended to tell her mother that the intruder had her phone.<n>She then pretended to demand a ransom of £4000 for her return.<n>Lily then revealed that it was all a joke and sent her mother a text.

Vin Los, 24, gained notoriety last year for his face and body art, which include the names of cities like Baghdad, San Francisco, New York, and Kuala Luampur.<n>The Montreal-based model has now landed a campaign for underwear brand Garon Model.

Jill Scott was sent off for headbutting Arsenal defender Jade Bailey.<n>Scott was dismissed during the Women's Super League clash on Sunday.<n>The England international apologised for the incident after the game.<n>Manchester City Ladies lost 1-0 to Arsenal at the City Football Academy.

Former Olympic swimmer Eamon Sullivan proposed to his girlfriend Naomi Bass in Kyoto, Japan.<n>The couple met in Perth in 2011, and Sullivan proposed to Bass beneath a cherry blossom tree in Kyoto.<n>The proposal took place two weeks ago, and the happy couple are now back in Perth, where they met in 2011.

The Apple Watch is available in both 38mm and 42mm sizes.<n>They come in 24 karat gold, rose gold or platinum.<n>The most expensive version is called the 'Diamond Ecstasy'<n>It boasts a diamond encrusted face and bracelet.<n>And one version has a python skin strap.<n>The Apple Watch will go on sale in Apple shops and selected department stores on April 24.

Poets House is a new hotel in genteel Ely, a three-minute walk from the cathedral.<n>There are 21 rooms, all with copper standalone baths placed near luxurious double beds.<n>The hotel's main dining room is a more formal, carpeted affair with crisp, white tablecloths and huge, bulbous wine glasses.

Hector Valles, 25, was pulled from his burning SUV by officers in Mesquite, Texas just moments before it was engulfed by flames.<n>Valles' clothes were burning as he lay unconscious behind the wheel of his SUV.<n>He remains hospitalized in the intensive care unit as of Monday.

Councils and parks across Sydney are preparing to scatter carrots laced with the deadly calicivirus.<n>The virus is commonly found in feral rabbits and causes bleeding and haemorrhaging in rabbits.<n>Public land managers are desperate to reduce the'significantly rampant population' of the pest.<n>The virus damages the animal's liver and gut and causes haemorrhaging and bleeding.
The Ultimate Collection outsold Ed Sheeran and Sam Smith.<n>Simon's last number one was The Rhythm of the Saints in 1990.<n>He rose to fame as part of Simon & Garfunkel.

Sarah Watson, 34, had a brief liaison with Manchester United defender.<n>But the fling turned into a nightmare after she was falsely accused.<n>She was accused of trying to extort £100,000 from the footballer.<n>High Court has since overturned a gagging order against Ms Watson.<n>She is seen cutting lines of a suspicious-looking white powder in new pictures.

Johanna Powell, 37, was travelling on the Mekong river in Laos on Saturday.<n>Cruise boat she was in hit a rock and sank 'within a minute'<n>Crew, tour guide and other passengers swam to safety, but she disappeared.<n>Emergency services have recovered a body in the search for the BBC Wales worker.<n>Foreign Office confirmed a British national has been reported missing.

Cadbury has snatched two chocolate Fingers from its famous packs.<n>Ploy means shoppers are being subject to stealth price rises in'shrinkflation'<n>Price remains the same when amount in pack is cut, but change comes with price rise.<n>Cadbury chocolate Fingers have come down by 11 grams to 114g.

Bryan Stow was beaten and left for dead outside the LA Dodgers' stadium.<n>The father-of-two was left severely brain damaged by the attack.<n>He was kept in a medically induced coma for several months.<n>The San Jose Giants promised him he would pitch the first pitch of the season.<n>Mr Stow was awarded $18 million in compensation from the Dodgers.<n>His family have yet to receive any of the money due to legal delays.

TV presenter Guy Martin was reviewing the new Aston Martin Vanquish.<n>He said he reached 180mph as he entered the village of Sulby on the Isle of Man.<n>The village is part of the Isle of Man TT race and has a 40mph speed limit.<n>Police have confirmed they are investigating the incident after the review.

Kim Sears is expected to be the centre of attention on her big day.<n>But her mother Judy Murray, 55, has spent months planning her outfit.<n>Leonore Sears, 53, has long been admired by those on the tennis circuit.<n> Dunblane Cathedral has been decked out with trees for the ceremony.

Jerry Tarkanian, 5, suffered a stroke at about 4am on Friday morning.<n>He was taken to University Medical Center of Southern Nevada in Las Vegas.<n>His parents, Danny and Amy Tarkanian, said he's undergoing testing and is showing signs of improvement.<n>Danny Tarkanian said that the stroke was in the back of young Jerry's brain, where strokes apparently do less damage.<n>His grandfather, Jerry Tarkanian, coached the University of Nevada, Las Vegas men's basketball team for 19 years.

Labour leader vows to set up a Home Office task force to tackle exploitation.<n>Promises 100 new staff to work with police and immigration officials.<n>But Nigel Farage and Tory Immigration Minister dismiss ideas.

The second Topshop and Topman store will open in Westfield Miranda.<n>Fashion bloggers will be escort in London black cabs to the launch.<n>The 100 square metre store will stock over 180 new styles a week.<n>The first Topshop store opened in Sydney's CBD in 2012.

Jin Pai, 35, was standing on the rim of a toilet when it collapsed.<n>The passenger was left with deep cuts on his leg and buttocks.<n>He had not wanted to let his bottom touch the seat because he was worried.<n>The man was found bleeding on the toilet floor after he telephoned friends.

Heather Mack, 19, is being held in Kerobokan Prison over her mother's death.<n>She is accused of murdering Sheila von Wiese-Mack, 62, in Bali.<n>Minister Yasona Laoly visited Mack and her baby Stella today.<n>He offered Mack the chance to place the baby with a family to care for her.

A crowd of students from Northwest Prep Academy descended on a gas station in Memphis, Tennessee on Monday.<n>Orden Williams Jr. was outside the store when he was attacked by the teens, who threw gang signs and threw punches.<n>Williams' baby was also almost hit, but was unhurt.<n>Police caught up with the group thanks to the video, and arrested Joe Brittman, 19, on Wednesday.

Wiley Bridgeman, 60, and Kwame Ajamu, 57, were awarded $1.6million on Friday from the Ohio Court of Claims.<n>The brothers were exonerated last year after the prosecution's star witness recanted his testimony.<n>Bridgeman and Ajamu served a collective 66 years in prison for the murder of Cleveland businessman Harry Franks in 1975.<n>Ricky Jackson, 59, was awarded more than $1million in compensation in March.
TV chef, 35, appears with pet cat Kimchi in Puss Puss magazine.<n>Says pet loves anything crunchy, including poppadoms and tortilla chips.<n>Cat is also 'obsessed' with Dreamies cat biscuits.

Tony Morris QC is mounting a legal challenge against Queensland's speed-camera laws.<n>He says he wasn't driving when his Volvo was photographed doing 57km/h in a 50km/h zone last year.<n>Mr Morris says he won't say who was behind the wheel.<n>He has invoked a spousal privilege case from 1817, arguing it's unconstitutional for a Queensland court to fine him when there's evidence he was not the driver.

A 16-year-old born a girl but identifies as a boy has been granted the opportunity to go through male puberty.<n>The teen has been given permission by a Brisbane-based judge to receive testosterone injections.<n>The teen has been taking puberty blockers for a year and has worn a boy’s uniform for two years.<n>A child wishing to change gender has to apply to the Family Court for the second stage of gender-changing treatment.

Luke Shambrook was last seen leaving Candlebark Campground in Fraser National Park, central Victoria at 9.30am on Good Friday.<n>The 11-year old was camping in the national forest with his family.<n>It is understood he wandered off and has not been seen since.<n>Luke has limited speech and his family says he is probably confused.<n>A widespread search is being carried by search and rescue teams.

Toby Perkins, deputy chairman of Labour election campaign, revealed in email that his interns are paid just £4 per day for 12-hour shifts.<n>Labour is trying to get around the problem by saying the interns will be paid nothing at all.<n>Mr Perkins had last week denied employing any interns.<n>Lib Dem candidate for Chesterfield, Julia Cambridge, said: 'This smacks of utter hypocrisy'

Researchers have combined long-term fisheries data with climate projections.<n>They found species won't be able to migrate north to avoid warming temperatures.<n>This means UK fisheries will need to replace current species with those that prefer warmer water.<n>This could increase the price of fish and chips and take some fish off the menu.

Kazi Islam, 18, sent texts to Harry Thomas, 19, who had learning difficulties.<n>Court told he persuaded him to buy parts for a bomb and praised Lee Rigby's killers.<n>But Thomas failed to understand his coded ruse when he asked 'cake'<n>Old Bailey heard Islam also encouraged him to buy a knife to attack soldiers.<n>Islam, from Manor Park, east London, denies preparing for acts of terrorism.

Dave Rickard, 72, and his wife Brenda, 67, were on holiday in Caernarfon, North Wales.<n>Their West Highland terrier Daisy fell 10ft from a quay into the sea.<n>The strong currents began to pull her under.<n>She was pulled from the water by a passing fisherman on a boat.<n>The couple gave her mouth-to-mouth and she has now recovered.

Jarret Stoll, 32, was arrested in Las Vegas on Friday on drug possession charges.<n>The Los Angeles Kings player was reportedly found with 3.3 grams of cocaine and 8.1 grams of Molly in his swim trunks.<n>He was arrested at the Wet Republic pool at the MGM Grand Hotel.<n>Stoll is the longtime boyfriend of Dancing With The Stars host Erin Andrews, 36.

Peter Morris was devastated when his sister, Claire, died in a car crash.<n>He had walked her down the aisle to give her away to her husband, Malcolm Webster.<n>He believed she had died in a tragic accident in Aberdeen in 1994.<n>But it took two decades for the truth to be revealed - she had been murdered.<n>Claire's story was turned into an ITV drama starring Sheridan Smith.

Woman was watching the Pittsburgh Pirates take on the Chicago Cubs.<n>She was making her way back to her seat when she was hit in the head.<n>There was a net in place but, as she was standing so close, she was hit.<n>She was knocked unconscious and placed in a head brace.<n>She was then taken to hospital on a stretcher and regained consciousness.<n>Her condition is currently unknown.

A man was caught on video savagely beating an elderly truck driver along the side of Route 95 near Baltimore, Maryland.<n>The man was angry after the truck driver hit his car as he changed lanes and cut him off, according to the truck driver.<n>Tommy Solis was driving by and filmed the incident, eventually getting out of his car to try and stop the fighting.<n>The man refused to stop and got in the face of Solis' friend, who clocked him and left him passed out cold on the side of the road.<n>The Maryland Transportation Authority is now investigating the incident.

Natalie Swindells, 26, eats four bowls of the cereal every day.<n>She can’t face eating much else and has not tasted a vegetable for 20 years.<n>She stopped eating most other foods from the age of two.<n>She now believes overeating causes more health problems than having a very restricted diet like her own.

Rutherford, 46, claims her children were illegally deported to France when a California Court awarded custody to her ex-husband Daniel Giersch.<n>She pleaded for the order to be reversed.<n>A New York court dismissed her lawsuit with a court order stating it did not have the jurisdiction to force the kids to return to the U.S.<n>Giersch, who is a German citizen residing in France, was deported from the U.S. over allegations of visa fraud.

Peter Kelly, a 34-year-old high school wrestling coach, was fishing with a friend on Tuesday when they heard three men being loud and rude.<n>They asked them to quieten down and for three hours, the argument escalated.<n>One of the men pulled out a knife and stabbed Kelly in the chest.<n>Authorities are still searching for the three men and are asking for help tracking down five others who were in the area at the time of the stabbing.

Pictures posted on Twitter by group who risk their lives documenting atrocities.<n>ISIS prides itself on its well-oiled propaganda offensive.<n>Group's founder Abu Ibrahim Raqqawi paints bleak picture of life in city.

The Channel Islands are celebrating 70 years since the end of World War II.<n>The five-week Heritage Festival will mark the liberation of the islands.<n>The islands will unite in a historic parade on May 11.

MicroCon 2015 is the first gathering of micronations in North America.<n>The leaders of nations like Molossia, Westarctica, Vikesland and Broslavia will gather in Anaheim this weekend.<n>Most of their citizens have a population of less than 10.<n>Many don't even live on the land at all.

Mourners said a TV show that parodied his appearance was partly to blame.<n>Many believed that he was 'hurt' by the show and it was a factor in his death.<n>Dr Frederic Brandt, 65, was found hanged at his home in Coral Gables, Florida.<n>Friends said he had been left 'devastated' by a character based on him.<n>More than 200 friends, family and former patients attended the memorial.

Logan Kehoe, 13, was having a final dip in the pool at a holiday complex.<n>Paramedics performed CPR but they were unable to save him.<n>Police say cause of death was accidental drowning.<n>Logan also played as a centre-half for Birmingham City Football Club’s under 13s.

Ukip leader Nigel Farage was out in Thanet South today to meet supporters.<n>Comes after the Prime Minister and Lib Dem Nick Clegg were snapped with babies.<n>Mr Cameron was overheard telling his wife Samantha they should have another baby.

Liftoff of the 208ft (63 metre) tall Falcon 9 rocket was scheduled for 4:33pm EDT/2033GMT from Cape Canaveral Air Force Station in Florida.<n>But poor weather conditions meant the countdown was halted at the 2 1/2-minute mark.<n>The company will now attempt to launch the uncrewed Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral, in Florida, at 4:10 pm ET tomorrow.<n>If the weather holds out, SpaceX is hoping to guide the bottom stage of the rocket upright onto a platform in the Atlantic Ocean.<n>The main aim of the flight is to deliver more than 4,300lb (1,950

Shona Banda, 37, has said she will continue to fight for custody of her 11-year-old son.<n>Kansas authorities have placed the boy into protective custody.<n>The divorced mother said she did not get custody of her son back following a hearing on Monday.<n>Police found about 114 pounds of marijuana and a lab for manufacturing cannabis oil at her home.

Code spotted on garden sheds in East Kilbride, Lanarkshire, Scotland.<n>Police urge anyone who sees suspicious markings to call them on 101.<n>But officers stress message is for crime prevention guidance and not to spark fear.
Anil Saxena, from Mumbai, uses ingenious retouching to create pictures.<n>He prides himself on his digital manipulation techniques.<n>His pictures blend the everyday with the bizarre.
