Art and photography community BoredPanda has created a thread.<n>Encouraging parents to showcase their 'true nerdy colours'<n>Dressing babies up as sci-fi characters, such as Star Wars characters.

The Cessna 414 crashed near Bloomington, Illinois, shortly after midnight.<n>Four people on board the plane were from ISU and one was a Wells Fargo executive.<n>The party had been at the NCAA championship game in Indianapolis.<n>Bar owner Terry Stralow and ISU associate coach Torrey Ward also killed.<n>Businessman Scott Bittner and ISU's deputy director of athletics Aaron Leetch also died.

Cody the Havana cob was stuck in a ditch in south London for six hours.<n>18 firefighters from London Fire Brigade rescued him from the muddy ditch.<n>Owner Tracey Hannant said Cody looked like Black Beauty when he emerged.
Frances, 24, spoke to Rolling Stone about her documentary Kurt Cobain: Montage of Heck.<n>Said she's not a big fan of Nirvana's music.<n>But admitted she does recognise her late father's genius.

Tommy Connolly, 23, took in his homeless, pregnant 17-year-old cousin.<n>The Sunshine Coast University student let her move into his flat and is helping raise her four-week-old baby boy.<n>He said he didn't think twice about taking her in because he had saved $2800 to pay for his move.

Britain's Got Talent auditions begin tomorrow and run for six weeks.<n>After the show at the Royal Variety Performance is over, they've spent £250,000.<n>Biggest star to come out of the show by far is Scottish singing sensation Susa Boyle.<n>But she didn't actually win the competition.<n>We look back at some of the biggest names to come out of the programme.

St Helena is a tiny speck in the South Atlantic 1,200 miles from the coast of West Africa.<n>It was discovered by Portuguese explorer Juan de Nova in 1502.<n>The island is smaller than central Paris has just 4,200 inhabitants - and 850 of them live in the small capital of Jamestown.<n>Early next year a £218m airport will open and make this British Overseas Territory no longer quite so isolated.

Britain is paying aid workers up to £1,000 a day to work in Africa and Asia.<n>Spending on consultants has doubled to £1.4billion over the past four years.<n>It now makes up more than ten per cent of all foreign aid spending.

Aracely Meza, 49, accused of helping starve boy, 2, to rid him of a 'demon'<n>Witnesses told police they believed boy had a 'demon' inside of him.<n>Meza and boy's parents held'resurrection ceremony' in Texas home.<n>Meza is seen in video reciting prayers while holding the boy in her arms.<n>Police believe child was dead during ceremony but parents took body to Mexico.

Man crushed by garbage truck in Melbourne's west.<n>The truck rolled forward and pinned him against a pole.<n>Paramedics tried to revive him but he died at the scene.<n>WorkCover are investigating the incident.

'Crystal clear' footage handed into Metropolitan Police by worker 50ft from scene.<n>He contacted non-emergency number believing detectives had images of raid.<n>But force has refused to make footage public - despite claims it is best yet.<n>Comes after police were criticised for ignoring alarm that went off on Good Friday.

Morrisons has brought in 36 sweets which are free of animal ingredients.<n>The chain has 10 stores trialling the new scheme around Britain.<n>The sweets include liquorice sticks, cola bottles and jelly beans.<n>The company says it has brought in the idea in response to demand.

James Ward was attacked at his home by intruders wielding an axe.<n>He lost a finger and several other fingers were partially severed in the attack.<n>He needed 38 staples to seal the wounds to his head, legs, and back.<n>Surgeons were forced to reattach his left index finger.<n>Mr Ward is now in hiding and is too afraid to return to his home.

Oxford scientists say a Mercury-like body struck the young Earth.<n>The object would have been the heat source for our planet's core.<n>The same object could have been responsible for creating the moon.<n>It also explains where some rare-Earth elements came from.<n>This could explain why our planet has a magnetic field.

Jessica Knight, four, has Pica, a rare medical disorder that causes an appetite for non-nutritious substances.<n>She devours everything from rocking horses to carpet underlay.<n>Doctors are unable to treat her until she is six years old.

Amanda Taylor, 24, charged with first-degree murder in stabbing death of Charles Taylor, 59.<n>The young widow was apprehended in North Carolina after a multi-state manhunt.<n>She also faces federal attempted murder, assault and weapons charges for allegedly trying to kill her suspected accomplice Sean Ball.<n>The 24-year-old mother of two reportedly blamed her father-in-law for introducing her husband to drugs at age 15.

Bernard Whalen charts the NYPD's rise from it beginnings in 1898.<n>The book charts the 21 men who have led the force through its formative years.<n>It is a tale of kickbacks, mob violence and secret KKK members.

New book claims Bernie Madoff tried to persuade his drug dealer's girlfriend to sleep with him.<n>Madoff met Israeli model 'Leah' at a party with his son Mark, who later committed suicide over his father's fraudulent activities.<n>Madoff is serving 150 years in prison for carrying out a $65 billion Ponzi style fraud.

Almost half of all people who have visited discounters are middle class.<n>They are among the country's highest earners, research has found.<n>News comes on the back of rise in popularity of Aldi and Lidl.

Kim Kardashian: Hollywood is a quest-based adventure game.<n>Reality star's app has been downloaded 28 million times.<n>Users create a character and become friends with Kim.<n>They must also build a celebrity empire.<n>Femail investigates what it's like to 'live' a celebrity's life.

Endrometriosis is a condition where bits of the uterus lining grow outside of the uterus.<n>Most 'normal' period pain can be fixed with ibuprofen or an anti-inflammatory.<n>Extreme pain that over the counter medication can not ease is a sign.<n>Pain during or after sex can also be a key symptom.<n>Binging between periods is another key sign.

Edwin 'Jock' Mee, 46, allegedly targeted 11 cadets on a military base in London.<n>It is claimed he went on to rape one of the cadets at Mitcham Barracks.<n>His alleged victim's cousin told jurors today that she called him after becoming concerned he wanted to start a sexual relationship with her.<n>She said he told her: 'I will give it to her hard or rough'

The explosion on a Pacific Gas & Electric Co. pipe happened while an equipment operator and a group of county jail inmates were expanding a road.<n>It was not clear what caused the explosion at the Fresno County Sheriff's gun range that brought traffic in the area to a halt.<n>The flames shot well over 100 feet into the air, witnesses said.<n>The driver of the front-loader was a county public works employee who had been working at the shooting range all day working on a tall berm that confines gunfire to the range.

Terry McCarty was engulfed with flames after brothers filled bowl with kerosene.<n>He endured 58 operations and cruel taunts from bullies who called him Freddy Krueger.<n>But he was determined to overcome harrowing experience that crippled his confidence.<n>He applied to Washington fire service in 2011 and passed training in 2012.

Sarah Vine says the BBC need to look further than just men for the job.<n>She says women love cars just as much as men and she would make a great Top Gear presenter.<n>She says all the most memorable moments in her life feature the internal combustion engine.

Birth of Prince George sparked a £247m sales boom for royal memorabilia.<n>Experts predict the second royal baby will have a lesser impact.<n>Most of the money will be spent on champagne and cake.<n>Prince Charles' Highgrove shop is already selling baby products.

The unnamed man died from variant Creutzfeldt-Jakob (vCJD) disease in May 2014, just 18 months after he first showed symptoms.<n>He was originally from the Middle East and was a naturalized U.S. citizen.<n>The man was misdiagnosed with psychiatric symptoms before receiving the vCJD death sentence.

Peter Tait, head of Sherborne Preparatory School, said parents must trust schools and teachers.<n>He said parents have become 'dervishes' about their children's education.<n>Mr Tait said interference could end up hindering their natural development.

Dane Bowers, 35, is accused of hitting his ex-fiancee Sophie Cahill, 31.<n>The former Another Level star is said to have caused a bloody nose.<n>He will appear in court next month charged with common assault.<n>The couple got engaged in December 2013 but split in December 2013.

Peter Hiett said staff at Feltham Young Offenders Institution arranged fights.<n>Former guard said inmates were put in cells and left to fight out differences.<n>49-year-old said some workers would even stay to watch the battle unfold.<n>He said gangs controlled entire wings at the jail in Hounslow, south west London.

Ellie Harrison, 37, says she knows she will fall out of favour on show.<n>Admits that she knows that next year someone will be 'hotfooting it'<n>Says that as a woman 'what you get is not down to you'<n>In 2011 she was told to tone down her flowing blonde hair.

Anthony Barbour, 33, from Liverpool, takes his camera everywhere he goes.<n>Once he finds the right location he spends hours slowly rotating in one spot taking 50 pictures.<n>He uses a Canon 1100d DSLR with either a 18-55mm kit lens or a Tokina 11-16mm to shoot the photographs.<n>He then uses PhotoShop to stitch and layer the photos together.

Niamh Geaney, 26, launched social experiment with male friends.<n>She asked them to find their closest lookalike in 28 days.<n>Niamh found her match in Karen Branigan, 29, who lives an hour down the road.<n>Niamh said she was 'ridiculously nervous' about meeting her lookalike.
Swan has just released a top-of-the-range steam generator iron.<n>The luxury model costs £279.99.<n>But does it really make things easier?

Stephanie Scott was a 'favourite teacher' to many students at Leeton High School.<n>Parents have expressed anger over the loss of their children's 'favourite teacher'<n>This comes as police are due to begin an autopsy on Stephanie Scott's body.<n>The 26-year-old teacher was allegedly murdered and dumped in bushland.<n>She was due to walk down the aisle to marry her partner of five years.
The 19-year-old model is one of eight up-and-coming models to appear in the beauty and fashion spread.<n>The images will appear in all 32 editions of Harper's Bazaar.

The 'Fullips' device has been seen at West End parties and is going viral.<n>The plastic device works by creating a mini-vacuum while you suck on it.<n>This draws blood to the surface of the lips, which swell.<n>The inventors claim it can achieve an Angelina Jolie-sized pout.

Douglas Murphy, 47, scraped his leg against a bin bag after a party.<n>The cut was so small it was hardly visible and became infected.<n>He developed necrotizing faciitis - a flesh-eating bug.<n>Surgeons were preparing to amputate his right leg but antibiotics started working.

Lesley Conman's daughter Abbie, 12, was sent messages by online pervert.<n>She challenged the man, pretending to be Abbie, to stop him.<n>In case of Kerry Green's daughter Emily, 13, he threatened to post explicit pictures of her online if she did not play along.<n>Police refused to investigate as no offence had been committed.

Nicola Sturgeon dressed according to the Angela Merkel school of leadership.<n> boxy, androgynous look from woman who had lost her waist.<n>Today she has shed pounds, bleached her hair, squeezed her feet into heels.<n>She rocked a coral two-piece by Scottish design label Totty Rocks.

Zhao Pingan's mother was in labour when she was hit by a truck.<n>Both of his parents were killed in the accident in south-eastern China.<n>The mother gave birth to a healthy boy at the scene of the crash.<n>The baby was given the name Zhao Pingan which means'safe and sound'<n>Pingan celebrated his first birthday publicly on Saturday.

Dina Nemtsova, 13, has appeared in a photoshoot for a Russian fashion label.<n>She is the daughter of assassinated Russian opposition leader Boris Nemtsov.<n>Her mother hopes her new career will help her overcome the death of her father.

Neurio recognises the electronic signature of different devices, such as kettles and washing machines.<n>It plugs into a breaker box in a house where it gradually learns to recognise.<n>It measures both differential voltage and current signals every split second.<n>These signals are used to calculate power and energy consumption.<n>The $250 (£168) device sends the information to the Neurio Cloud.<n>When the algorithms detect that a device has been turned on or off, or a user returning home, they notify the Neurio app and services such as IFTTT.

Ashley Jiron noticed someone had been looking for food in her bins.<n>She decided to try and get in contact with them and offer them a meal.<n>She taped a sign to her diner window appealing to the person to come forward.<n>A customer noticed the message and posted a picture on Instagram.<n>Thousands have since taken to social media to rave about Ashley's actions.

Virginia Roberts is being sued for defamation by US attorney Alan Dershowitz.<n>He says she will have to give evidence under oath and that she will have perjured herself if she repeats her claims.<n>Model agency owner Jean Luc Brunel is also considering legal action.<n>Judge struck claims that she was a'sex slave' to Jeffrey Epstein from record.

Lord Janner was cleared of 22 child sex offences despite evidence of abuse.<n>Theresa May is the first Cabinet Minister to question the DPP's judgment.<n>The 86-year-old's dementia is now too advanced for him to have a fair trial.<n>Former DPP Lord Macdonald said it would have been better if Lord Janner had undergone a procedure whereby a jury can decide on the facts of a case.

Jeremy Clarkson was due to record Have I Got News For You later this month.<n>But the former Top Gear host has decided against hosting the show.<n>Producers say they expect him to return to the BBC later in the year.<n>Clarkson was dismissed from Top Gear after hitting a producer in a 'fracas'

David Cameron will launch a multi-billion pound sale of Lloyds Bank shares.<n>Individuals will be allowed to buy up to £10,000 worth of Lloyds shares.<n>The shares will be offered at a discount of at least 5 per cent on the market rate.<n>It is the latest ‘retro’ Conservative policy to hark back to the 1980s.

Irish tourist Barry Lyttle has pleaded guilty to leaving his brother in a coma.<n>The 33-year-old was charged with recklessly causing grievous bodily harm.<n>His brother Patrick, 31, spent six days in a coma after the alleged attack.<n>The crown declined to downgrade the charge and Barry will be sentenced in Sydney's local court.

Hannah Bluck, 18, has been ruled out of the game for two years.<n>The teen has avascular necrosis in her distal tibia.<n>The condition has caused her shin bone to die from lack of oxygen.<n>Doctors have been baffled by the condition.

Clare Balding has married her partner of 14 years Alice Arnold.<n>The couple returned to the register office where their civil partnership was held in 2006.<n>They did not have a ceremony at Chiswick House, West London, nor did they invite any guests.<n>Miss Balding has always made clear her intentions to marry once gay marriage became legal in the UK.

Joselyn Alejandra Nio is believed to have been killed and dismembered.<n>She gained notoriety in January when a picture of her appeared online.<n>The assassin looks like she is in her late teens or early 20s.<n>She is the third woman with the nickname to suffer at the hands of a cartel.

Dorian Poe, 11, from Burlington, Ontario, Canada, has been sending his Ganz Webkinz bear, Tikko, on a round-the-world mission since January 2013.<n>The toy bear has visited more than 100 countries, sharing his message of understanding and tolerance for those affected by autism.

Motaz Zaid was with friend in Parsons Green, south west London, on Friday.<n>Friend said pair were sprayed with ammonia and assaulted with tools.<n>Mr Zaid, 20, was bundled into a Mercedes and driven off.<n>He was found dumped at side of A3 in Kingston, south west London.<n>Mr Zaid remains in critical condition in hospital.

Darren Humphries, 37, began throwing Cadbury Mini Eggs at wife Claire.<n>He grabbed her by the jaw and threw individual eggs at her head.<n>Humphries was jailed for eight weeks after pleading guilty to assault.<n>Court heard he flipped when his partner of 14 years refused to allow him into her home to see their two children.

Samuel Tushingham, 26, slapped his girlfriend and threw a toaster at her.<n>But he was spared jail by a judge who described him as a 'caveman'<n>She told him he was 'almost too dangerous' to be sent to prison.<n>Instead he was given a 26-week suspended sentence and 80 hours unpaid work.

Six-strong gang captured on CCTV breaking into basement of building.<n>They spent another eight hours cleaning out jewels and cash left there.<n>Scotland Yard refused to confirm to MailOnline whether they had seen footage.

Ocean photographer Lloyd Meudell started taking images of the sea with a GoPro after being an avid surfer his entire life.<n>He formed an obsession with photography and after purchasing all the high end equipment, he began to shoot ocean foam.<n>Mr Meudell grew up on the south coast of NSW and takes most of his shots on Kiama beach spanning to Gerrigong beach.<n>He uses an EOS 5D Mark III DSLR and numerous lenses to achieve the remarkable shots but does not reveal settings he uses to keep air of mystery.

Afrikaner Resistance Movement (AWB) runs military-style bootcamps.<n>It is training thousands of youths to fight for a separate white state.<n>They are pushed to their physical limits with assault courses.<n>Also told of the danger from 'the millions of blacks trying to kill you'

Zbigniew Huminski was indicted for kidnapping, raping and murdering Chloe.<n>38-year-old appeared before a judge on Friday night and did not offer a word of remorse.<n>He was on his way to England when he struck in Calais on Wednesday.<n>Thousands are preparing to take part in a second 'White March' in Calais.

Bjorn Ulvaeus, 69, will open a restaurant inspired by Mamma Mia.<n>The show will feature all the ABBA classics and a couple of not.<n>The restaurant is set to open in central Stockholm in January 2016.

Arnold Breitenbach of St. George wanted to get 'CIB-69' put on a license plate.<n>That would have commemorated both Breitenbach getting the Purple Heart in 1969 and his Combat Infantryman's Badge.<n>Utah Division of Motor Vehicles denied his request, citing state regulations prohibiting the use of the number 69 because of its sexual connotations.

Adam Deacon, 32, allegedly sent abusive tweets to Noel Clarke on Twitter.<n>Court hears he called Kidulthood writer a 'bully' and 'died threat'<n>Last month he was sectioned under Mental Health Act for possessing machete.

Hamish Baillie claims he was molested by Lord Janner during a game of hide-and-seek.<n>The 47-year-old said he was unable to trust adults after the abuse in 1983.<n>He said failure to prosecute the peer for a fourth time was a 'complete travesty'<n>Alison Saunders, Director of Public Prosecutions, concluded dementia made the 86-year-old unfit to plead.<n>Mr Baillie said the decision to not prosecute was 'perverse' and she should step down.

Woolworths' 'Fresh in our memories' campaign has caused outrage.<n>The ad uses an image of a young WWI soldier known as the 'Handsome Man'<n>The Australian War Memorial says it gave the company four images, including three different soldiers and a nurse.<n>But Carrspace chose instead to use the striking image of the Handsome Man.<n>The Memorial says it is 'in breach of these terms and conditions'

Video shows Cher Lair from Apex, North Carolina, cutting into a cake at her gender reveal party with family gathered around.<n>She did not know the sex of her baby and gave the scan results to a baker.<n>After falling back in surprise, she then gets down on her knees repeatedly panting: 'Oh my God'<n>The mother-of-six found out she was expecting a little lady on Monday.<n>A friend, who was told the child's sex, chipped in to bake the pink-colored chocolate cake.

Police in Western Australia are under fire after reports officers unlawfully accessed information relating to the arrests of Ben Cousins.<n>Officers also reportedly accessed files containing information about Daniel Kerr.<n>The pair both made headlines in recent months, for different incidents.<n>The WA Police Union has reacted negatively to the news of an investigation.<n>President George Tilbury said they exhibited 'professional curiosity'

Pound fell to near 1.46 against the US dollar, its lowest level since June 2010.<n>Experts warn of impact on economy of a badly hung parliament.<n>Neither major party can form a stable government, and fears grow of losses.<n>Latest poll shows Labour has taken lead, with Tories trailing in second.

Jackson Byrnes was told by doctors that he had a stage four brain tumour.<n>The 18-year-old and his family searched for a specialist who would perform the risky operation.<n>They found neurosurgeon Charlie Teo who would operate on Wednesday.<n>Mr Byrnes and his family must raise $80,000 by Tuesday night in order to pay for his surgery.<n>After a week of campaigning online, the Casino teenager is over halfway to his goal with two days to go.

Coral Jones, 43, has revealed she receives hate mail blaming her for her daughter's murder.<n>She was branded a 'bad mother' for letting April play in the street past 7pm.<n>April, five, was abducted and killed by paedophile Mark Bridger in 2012.<n>Mrs Jones has suffered from agroraphobia and will not leave the house on her own.
Rona Fairhead, 53, will stay on for 'a further one-year period'<n>Will then leave the bank's board entirely, it is reported.<n>Last month, Margaret Hodge called on her to quit or be sacked.

Mohammed Suleman Khan, 43, was jailed for four years last April for fraud.<n>He was sent to prison after police raided his Birmingham home.<n>Khan was ordered to pay back £2.2m within six months or face ten more years.

Government officials have insisted there is no evidence to support universal screening for Group B Strep, known as GBS.<n>Current guidelines only recommend testing women deemed to be 'at risk'<n>But a programme at Northwick Park NHS hospital in North-West London resulted in not a single case of the bacteria spreading to infants.

The 39-year-old man was shot numerous times while sitting in a car in his mother's Altona Meadows driveway at about 2am on Sunday.<n>He died shortly after paramedics arrived at the scene.<n>The man was known on Facebook under the nickname Karl Kay.<n>Police believe the attack was targeted and confirmed the victim was known to police.<n>The man’s mother, who was ‘extremely traumatised’, was taken to a local police station to help detectives with their investigation.

Scotsman John Logie Baird invented the Baird Televisor in 1928.<n>Two years later he demonstrated a working TV system.<n>The wooden set has a spiral punched scanning disc which has been fully restored and still has its original tube.

Computer glitch in Bloomberg's City of London office caused global chaos.<n>Trench of pounds of trading stopped or diverted and Government's attempts to sell £3billion of bonds delayed for hours.<n>Reports from inside company suggest spilt can of Coke was to blame.

Labour leader was jokingly referred to as the stripper on the bus.<n>He was met by screaming hens and then they posed for a group selfie.<n>The bride-to-be's sister posted the picture of the pair on Twitter.

Marcin Wasniewski, 34, from Coventry, crashed into the back of a lorry.<n>Paramedics and firefighters feared the worst and worked to release him.<n>But they were shocked to see him emerge from the wreckage and walk away.<n>He suffered a serious injury to the left side of his face and injured his arm.<n>Now he believes someone was watching over him that day and saved him.

'When Hillary Clinton travels there's going to need to be two planes, one for her and her entourage, one for her baggage,' Paul said.<n>Paul said that if Clinton wants 'to be the candidate of women's rights,' she after to answer for the Clinton Foundation's acceptance of gifts from Saudi Arabia.<n>He also predicted that she'd soon have new questions to answer about her family foundation's donations from foreign actors.

Living Dead Clothing, a Brisbane based company, has released an exclusive range of Avengers clothing.<n>The range features almost 50 different types of garments, ranging from t-shirts to swimwear.<n>The company has been over-run by orders and enquiries since launching their new line this week.<n>The website crashed due to the huge demand.<n>Estimates suggest the coup by the Queensland clothes-horse last year, will be worth tens of millions of dollars.

First time sales of UK goods have outstripped those to the EU for six months.<n>Previously they have beaten EU exports on a quarterly basis.<n>Figures are a major blow to Tony Blair's claim that leaving EU would damage economy.<n>Eurosceptics will seize on figures as evidence Britain could carve out prosperous future outside the EU.

Lucy Scott, from Edinburgh, had her first baby in 2012.<n>She captured every experience in a new book, Doodle Diary of a New Mom.<n>The collection features 120 illustrations, capturing everything from a baby's first lunch out to a spot-on depiction of the constant sleep deprivation.

The revelation comes just after reports that the former couple are embroiled in a legal fight over her frozen eggs.<n>Loeb claimed Vergara demanded her 44-year-old assistant serve as the surrogate over his 'objections as well as the recommendations of the parties’ doctor'<n>The pair fertilized embryos using Vergara's eggs and Loeb's sperm six months before their split in November 2013.

Boris Johnson urged Ukip voters to'swing behind the Conservatives'<n>He said a vote for Ukip would be equal to a vote for Ed Miliband.<n>The London Mayor was campaigning in Thanet South, Kent.<n>He said Ukip supporters were in 'increasing psychological conflict'

Clinton will announce her presidential bid on Twitter on Sunday.<n>She will then barnstorm the Hawkeye State in what the Associated Press calls a series of'small' meetings with voters.<n>Clinton will fly to New Hampshire after her Iowa swing.<n>She will likely face no substantial competition for the Democratic nomination.

A man drove his Ford Falcon ute into the doors of the Harts Range police station.<n>The 42-year-old man allegedly threw a wheel spanner at a night security patrol car before recklessly driving the car.<n>The station, which was vacant at the time, was damaged.<n>Police are urging anyone who has seen the dark blue Ford Falcon utility, with front and possible rear end damage, to contact police.

Nine out of every ten images of child sexual abuse found online in 2014 showed children aged ten and under, according to the Internet Watch Foundation.<n>Experts removed more than 31,000 web pages featuring vile images of sexual abuse in 2014, soaring 136 per cent from around 13,000 the previous year.

Neill Buchel, 39, was kicked, punched and bludgeoned to death last year.<n>He was cut into ten pieces and dumped in a fishing lake in Dagenham, Essex.<n>Elvis Kwiatkowski and Chas Quye, both 36, were jailed for life today.<n>Court heard they were obsessed with the hit U.S. television show Jackass.<n>Videos on their phones showed Mr Buchel being made to rub scotch bonnet chilli pepper on his genitals.

FBI found images of a 'pre-pubescent blonde girl' being sexually abused.<n>One picture does not show abuse taking place, but man is seen posing with her.<n>Investigators said they are trying to trace the unidentified man to help them identify the victim and her whereabouts.<n>They said he is not suspected of carrying out abuse, but they believe he has 'critical information' to help them find her.

West Midlands Police reveals 617 youngsters under ten suspected of crimes.<n>41 nine-year-old boys investigated for crimes last year including five sexual offences.<n>Nine-year-old girl linked to criminal damage and four-year-old questioned over assault.

Jamie Richardson and Daniel Taylor fined $3,000 for threatening behaviour.<n>Pair were on a Thomson Airways flight from London to Mexico.<n>Pair pleaded guilty to using threatening behaviour in a Bermuda court.<n>They could also face a four-month jail term for their actions.

Patrick Kramer, 33, from Utah, specialises in creating hyper-realistic oil paintings.<n>His paintings are so detailed it's impossible to tell they are not photos.<n>Kramer also paints surreal images, including insects and motion-shots.

AC/DC drummer Phil Rudd has changed his plea to guilty in a New Zealand court.<n>Rudd, 60, was charged with threatening to kill and possession of methamphetamine and of cannabis.<n>The drummer was due to stand trial on Tuesday but changed his plea.<n>Rudd's position with the top-selling band in doubt.

William 'Wild Bill' Wilson, 93, and his wife Lillian Karr Wilson, 89, died just two minutes apart from each other on Tuesday.<n>Both Lillian, 89, and Bill were Alzheimer's patients and for the last couple of years had to live in separate nursing homes.<n>Their son Doug said the family is looking at the deaths as a blessing.

Durham University scientists studied a 'clump' of dark matter.<n>It appears to be lagging behind its galaxy - suggesting it interacts with itself.<n>Until now, it was thought dark matter did not interact with anything other than gravity.<n>This is despite seeming to account for 85 per cent of the universe’s mass.<n>The discovery was made around one of the galaxies in the Abell 3827 cluster, 1.3 billion light-years away.

Columbia University Graduate School issued 12,000-word autopsy Sunday.<n>Report said 'basic, even routine' failures of journalism led to story's collapse.<n>But nobody will lose their job over the 'gang rape' article, publisher says.<n>Jann Wenner described supposed rape victim as 'a really expert storyteller'

The Block's Frank Valentic gives his top tips for a great kitchen.<n>The key is to ensure the practicality of your kitchen.<n>Dea and Darren's kitchen lacked plenty of bench space.<n>Josh and Charlotte's kitchen lacked sufficient lighting.

Shelley Dufresne from St Charles Parish, Louisiana, took a plea deal on Thursday that gets her out of serving any time behind or having to register as a sex offender.<n>However she is still facing charges over a threesome she had with the same student at Destrehan High School and another teacher.

Michael Pulman, 33, a care worker from Walsall, spent £7,500 on a hair transplant.<n>He believes it will boost his self-esteem and happiness.<n>His mother, Joy, never spends money on herself and wears £5.99 shoes from Oxfam.<n>Inside Harley Street is on BBC2 on Monday at 9pm.

Man believed to be from Mozambique was taken to hospital in Johannesburg.<n>He tragically passed away from his injuries after being attacked by machete-wielding gangs.<n>At least six people have been killed and thousands displaced since violence erupted in Durban several weeks ago.<n>President Jacob Zuma has called for an end to the'shocking and unacceptable' attacks on immigrants.

Destiny Cooke, 16, and Lajahia Cooke, 17, were brutally kicked, punched, stomped and shoved around by a mob in Trenton, New Jersey.<n>People can be heard laughing throughout the video and chanting 'they gettin' busy!' or 'let her get her!'<n>Destiny said she was play fighting with her friend at the park on a nice day during spring break before the riot broke out.

More than 42 million children under the age of five are overweight or obese.<n>1.9 billion adults worldwide are overweight, 600 million of which are obese.<n>Should fast food and sugary drink companies be allowed to advertise their junk food to children?<n>Should TV ads promoting unhealthy food and drink be banned until the watershed, or wiped out altogether to save adults' waistlines too?

Labour's deputy leader challenged about claims Tories are 'posh boys'<n>She insisted they were only'standing up for people at the top'<n>But Osborne said 'the posh boy attack always sounds a bit thin'<n>In the 1980s, Mr Osborne attended St Paul's School for boys.<n>Ms Harman went to St Paul's Girls School in the 1960s.

SNP leader will unveil proposals for British foreign policy and welfare.<n>Pledged to slash English tuition fees from £9,000 to £6,000 a year.<n>Also wants to give Ofgem power to force suppliers to cut prices.<n>SNP also wants UK to formally recognise Palestine as a state.

A man was photographed standing up to a swastika-tattooed neo-nazi.<n>The man was trying to stop a fight from breaking out at a anti-racism rally.<n>The dramatic scenes occurred in Melbourne on Saturday.<n>They were part of a national event where protests were held against 'Islamisation' of Australia.

April 26, 2016 marks the 30th anniversary of the nuclear disaster.<n>The Chernobyl explosion site is now a popular tourist destination.<n>The Exclusion Zone is highly regulated and visitors are banned.<n>Some private tour companies offer packages to the zone.

Nathan Brown, 19, was working with his father David at sheet metal factory.<n>He was told to climb up ladder to test lights in roof of building in Rochdale.<n>But he accidentally touched a metal strip which conducts electricity.<n>The shock caused him to fall 12ft head first onto roof of a toilet block.<n>He was airlifted to hospital but later died from his injuries.

Sudan is the last remaining male northern white rhino in the world.<n>He was moved to Ol Pojeta in Kenya in 2009 - but it has failed to breed.<n>Rangers are now protecting him day and night to stop poachers.

Coachella visitors pay an average of £187 per day according to No.1 Currency.<n>The likes of Alessandra Ambrosio and Brooklyn Beckham take in the festival.<n>Tomorrowland in Belgium is the second most expensive, costing £186 per day.<n>England’s Glastonbury is the third most expensive, costing £113 per day.

Rachelle Owen, 16, died after being struck by a train near Hoylake station.<n>Her mother Kay Diamond, 44, was found dead in a flat in Toxteth, Liverpool.<n>Family said they were suffering a 'double tragedy' following her death.<n>A 52-year-old man has been charged with her murder and is awaiting trial.

British photographer John Daniels, 61, from Surrey, has decades of experience working with animals.<n>He used clean white studio backgrounds and comedy props to capture the heart-warming shots.<n>The snaps are the perfect way to celebrate National Pet Day, which takes place tomorrow.

SNP leader says 'direction of travel' is towards independence.<n>But she refuses to rule out a second referendum on breaking up the Union.<n>David Cameron warns of 'frightening' prospect of SNP holding Labour to ransom.<n>He warns Sturgeon would use Labour to break up the Union and punish other nations.

Kevin Bollaert, 28, was convicted in February of 21 counts of identity theft and six counts of extortion.<n>He ran ugotposted.com, a'revenge porn' site where people could anonymously post nude photos of people without their consent.<n>People who wanted to have the photos taken down were directed to changemyreputation.com and charged $250 to $350 to remove the racy content.<n>Bollaert earned about $900 a month in website ad revenue and collected about $30,000 from victims.

Georgina Chapman, 38, is furious and humiliated by the allegations, according to a new report.<n>Fashion designer is said to want the accusations to be dropped so she can concentrate on her business.<n>She has two children with Harvey Weinstein, 63.<n>He has emphatically denied sexually assaulting Ambra Battilana, 22, during a March 27 business meeting at his Tribeca office.<n>A source said Chapman is someone who has 'loved Harry through his charms and flaws'

Danielle and Alexander Meitiv have been cited multiple times for allowing their son Rafi, 10, and daughter Dvora, 6, to roam free.<n>But the Meitivs, both of them scientists, say authorities crossed a line when they picked up Rafi and Dvora and held them nearly six hours without food before allowing them to reunite with their parents.<n>The parents have vowed to sue.<n>Attorney Matthew Dowd, of the firm Wiley Rein, is representing the Meitivs and on Tuesday sent a ointed letter regarding Sunday's events.

Shoe that Grows has adjustable points at the front, sides and the back.<n>It can expand by five sizes by adjusting the straps at the front and back.<n>The design was created by an American charity working in Kenya.

A. Alfred Taubman died on Friday night at his home after a heart attack.<n>He donated hundreds of millions of dollars to universities, hospitals and museums.<n>His business success spanned from real estate and art houses to the hot dog-serving A&W restaurant chain.

Chancey Luna, 17, was found guilty of first-degree murder in the August 16, 2013, death of Christopher Lane.<n>Lane was shot in the back while running along a city street in Duncan, Oklahoma.<n>The jury recommended that Luna be sentenced to life in prison without parole.

The NSW State Emergency Service anticipates calls across the Sydney metropolitan, Hunter and Illawarra regions.<n>Winds of up to 100km/h are expected over the next two days.<n>The SES had responded to about 15 jobs on Monday morning, mainly in Sydney metro area.<n>Rain and damaging winds averaging 55 to 70 km/h with gusts to about 100 km are forecast to develop along the coastal fringe of the Sydney Metropolitan, Hunter and Illawarra regions.

Sergeant Norman Turgel was sent to arrest Gena, 20, at Bergen-Belsen camp.<n>The emaciated Jewish girl was a walking skeleton among the 60,000 inmates.<n>But through the striped and filthy prison uniform, Turgel spotted an eternal beauty.<n>He fell in love with her and told her he was going to marry her one day.<n>Gena and Norman were married two months short of their golden wedding anniversary of 50 years.

Lovingly tended gardens with manicured lawns were once essence of Englishness.<n>But these days we are increasingly using outdoor space for barbecue.<n>Only a handful of traditional flowers still grow in English country gardens.<n>Average one usually contains a mere four species – daffodils, crocuses, roses and tulips.

Fire crews were called to the M25 motorway in Kent after a coach caught fire.<n>Blaze erupted on the A2 slip road to the M25 near Dartford this morning.<n>Fire crews spent an hour tackling the blaze before it was put out.<n>The slip road remains closed while the Highways Agency remove the coach.

Jessica Cleland committed suicide on Easter Saturday last year.<n>The 19-year-old was bullied online by two teenage boys.<n>Her parents are campaigning for cyber bullying to be punished under Victoria's laws.<n>Jessica received a series of disturbing messages the night before she died.<n>Her parents said that she was a vibrant and outgoing girl.

Tortoiseshell Mimi was picked to star in a national TV advert.<n>Her owner uploaded clips of her playing volleyball to Facebook.<n>Mimi was picked to star after her owner shared the video with friends.
Lorraine Kelly, 55, has dropped two dress sizes in a year.<n>She has been attending regular Zumba classes with her instructor.<n>Claims she has more energy and is more confident than ever.

Damon Albarn said modern pop stars are part of a'selfie generation'<n>He said they only sing about themselves and not about what they are thinking.<n>The Blur frontman said they could be using music to make political statements.

Morgan Stanley said SNP-led government would create 'greatest uncertainty'<n>Added its inevitable 'anti-austerity' agenda could lead to an 'earlier bank rate hike'<n>Second major bank, Goldman Sachs, also raised concerns about outcome.<n>Goldman said Labour would be 'dragged to the Left' by the SNP.

Study tracked the decisions of brides and grooms over the past five years.<n>Religious services have fallen out of favour with services at 35 per cent.<n>Just seven per cent of couples allowed bride's parents to pay the bill.<n>A third of married couples in the UK covered their entire wedding bill.

Sir Bruce Forsyth said he would like the right to die 'with dignity left'<n>The 87-year-old said he was convinced by his first wife's dementia.<n>He helped secretly nurse her after she was taken into a care home in 2008.<n>Said it was 'awful' to see her lose her memory and memories.<n>Added that it can be'more cruel to do nothing' if someone wants to die.

Peter Barnett, 43, is said to have caused a loss of £23,000 to Chiltern Railways.<n>He travelled from his Oxfordshire home to London Marylebone.<n>But he pretended to have only gone from Wembley, in north west London.<n>Barnett admits six counts of fraud by false representation.

Some apparently healthy meals are worse for you than demonised junk foods from the likes of McDonald’s, Burger King and Pizza Express.<n>Asda’s Piri Piri Chicken Pasta Salad contains 46.5g of fat – two thirds of the recommended daily intake for an adult.<n>A Pizza Express Classic Margherita pizza has 683 calories and contains only 22.5g of fat.<n>A 624-calorie Brie and Bacon Panini from Caff Nero comes in at more than 100 calories higher than a 518-calorie McDonald’s Quarter Pounder with Cheese.

Nick Loeb has filed a lawsuit in California in a bid to prevent the Modern Family actress from destroying two cryopreserved female embryos created through IVF, according to a report.<n>The couple fertilized embryos using Vergara's eggs and his sperm six months before their split in November 2013, according to court documents.<n>Loeb, 39, is seeking to ensure the female embryos are not destroyed, but Vergara has refused to 'agree to their preservation under all circumstances,' according to the legal papers.<n>The lawsuit also claims Vergara was 'physically and mentally abusive' to Loeb.
Italian artist Johannes Stoetter created the incredible illusion.<n>He painted two naked women to look like a chameleon.<n>The artwork took the artist six hours to complete.

Olivia Marie, Ava Lane, Hazel Grace, Parker Kate and Riley Paige were born last week.<n>They are the first set of all-girl quintuplets born in the U.S. since 1969.<n>Their mother Danielle Busby appeared on Today on Monday and said they are 'doing fabulous'<n>She has only managed to hold two of them so far.<n>Father Adam admitted it was 'overwhelming' changing the babies.

Young boy was dressed in a Star Wars t-shirt and in a wheelchair.<n>He approached R2D2 at Star Wars Celebration convention in California.<n>The robot began spinning in time with the boy and he giggled in delight.<n>The pair then followed each other along a corridor and giggled uncontrollably.

The USS Theodore Roosevelt and the USS Normandy left the Persian Gulf on Sunday and are steaming through the Arabian Sea towards Yemen.<n>The vessels are believed to be joining other U.S. ships that are poised to intercept any Iranian ships carrying weapons to the Houthi rebels fighting in Yemen.<n>The Navy has been beefing up its presence in the Gulf of Aden and the southern Arabian Sea amid reports that about eight Iranian ships are heading toward Yemen and possibly carrying arms.

Toyal Lotus lid uses microscopic bumps to stop yoghurt sticking to lids.<n>It was inspired by the water-repellent nature of a lotus leaf.<n>This leaves the leaf covered in microscopic bumps that force droplets to form into spheres, which can't fit between the bumps.<n>Toyal Lotus lid's name comes from the lotus leaf, hence the name.<n>It has been teamed up with Japan's Morinaga Milk Industry to bring it to consumers.

Dwayne Harvard, 46, of Springdale, Pennsylvania, had an argument with Steven Sutton, 36, Sunday night.<n>Harvard claims he was giving Sutton's girlfriend a ride home.<n>Sutton allegedly hit Harvard's 2002 Ford Explorer with a cinder block.<n>Harvard took off, and Sutton clung to the front of the car.<n>He drove for 11 miles and through seven towns before finally pulling over.<n>Harvard has been charged with aggravated assault, reckless endangerment, and DUI.<n>He maintains he is not the one who should have been arrested.

The giant arrows were placed across the US from 1924, when the US Postal Service began delivering mail.<n>They were painted bright yellow and placed alongside beacons to show pilots the direction they needed to fly in.<n>The arrows formed the first land-based navigation system in the world.

Phillip Buchanon was a first-round draft pick for the Oakland Raiders, and seventeenth overall, when his mother made the request in 2002.<n>He discussed the incident in his recently released book New Money: Stay Rich.<n>Buchanon said he followed the 'unwritten NFL New Money Millionaire' rule and bought his mother a brand new big house, as well as paid for all her finances that did not include food or entertainment.<n>But he soon realized that gift would come with its own problems, paying for mortgage and maintenance payments for both houses for seven years.

Britain is predicted to be hotter than Ibiza, Athens and Barcelona tomorrow as the heatwave continues.<n>Ice cream vendors say they have had their busiest April ever as Britons cool off, with the balmy conditions set to continue.<n>Forecasters warn people to make the most of it before the weather turns for the worse in the second half of this week.

The polished evergreen foliage of Camellias makes for a great contrast with brightly coloured flowers.<n>They are easy to grow, but picky about soil.<n>If your soil doesn't suit, plant in containers in ericaceous compost.

UK deaths per year will rise by 20 per cent over the next two decades.<n>The number of baby boomers will be at its peak, leaving a funeral bill.<n>A simple cremation now costs an average of £3,590, think tank finds.

duffel bag was found at 8am Saturday near a building used by biotechnology company Biogen Inc in Cambridge, Massachusetts.<n>Video surveillance of the area led police to an apartment complex across the street where additional human remains were found in a common area.<n>A person has been arrested but no details have been released.<n>All of the remains are believed to belong to one person, whose death is being treated as a homicide.

The ten houses in Australia that won't sell after being on the market for up to two years.<n>This includes a one-bedroom home in Oberon, central west of NSW, which was listed 800 days ago for $299,000.<n>The historic nine-bedroom property in Ranelagh was listed 730 days ago for about $2 million.<n>In Queensland, a four-bedroom property has seen a 45 per cent decrease in its asking price since it was listed for $1.5 million 247 days ago.

Diane Morris, 46, is engaged to Mike Holpin, 56, who has boasted of having children with 20 different women.<n>She has brushed off claims he still uses dating website Plenty of Fish.<n>Claims the two are 'crazy for each other' and she trusts him 'completely'<n>Says they have a 'great sex life' and she's the only woman he needs for sex.

Luxury concierge service, Bluefish, offers the chance to dive 12,500ft to the wreck of the Titanic.<n>The tour takes in sights like the famous grand staircase, the ship's huge anchors and the Marconi Room.<n>The trip costs £41,000 ($60,000) and takes 11 or 12 hours in total.
Fire crews in South Wales say they have been stretched to breaking point.<n>They have been called to 623 fires in one month alone.<n>The cost of fighting the blazes has risen close to £500,000.

Bird was spotted near the coastal city of Limassol on Cyprus.<n>Normally flamingos have a pink hue caused by levels of beto-Carotene.<n>Experts believe a rare genetic irregularity can generate more melanin.<n>It can turn a flamingo's feathers a dark colour, turning them black.<n>The bird is believed to be heading to Turkey to breed.

The oldest active pilot is a 95-year-old man living in Cameron Park, California.<n>Guinness World Records has confirmed Peter Weber Jr.'s feat.<n>Weber flew in both World War II and the Vietnam War, and also served as a Korean War flight instructor.<n>He pulled off his March 30 flight at the age of 95 years and 143 days, Guinness says.

Boy, 14, from Blackburn, Lancashire, arrested on suspicion of terror offences.<n>He allegedly communicated with Australian men over plan to attack police.<n>Five men from Melbourne were arrested over the planned attack.<n>Arrests came after British authorities tipped off Australian officials.<n>Police are working to shore up security for Anzac Day events in London.

Boeing 737-800 was carrying 59 passengers and eight crew from Varanasi.<n>Crew ordered an evacuation after the plane's left engine scraped along the runway.<n>Passengers slid down the plane's inflatable evacuation slides to safety.

A car plunged off a road into Los Angeles harbor on Thursday, and two children pulled from the submerged vehicle were hospitalized in grave condition until one later died.<n>Two adults were found swimming in the water when rescuers arrived, and resuscitation efforts began immediately.<n>The cause of the accident was under investigation.

Deep brain stimulation is already used to treat Parkinson's disease.<n>Now researchers have shown it could be used to ward off dementia.<n>Tests on lab mice showed improved memory within 24 hours.<n>It also reduced anxiety and depression, promoted improved learning.

Alannah Hill was diagnosed with an invasive malignant melanoma.<n>She broke her foot after trying to shoo her dog out of the way.<n>Hill has had part of her toe removed and a skin graft from her inner thigh.<n>She is taking a three-month break from her clothing label.

Thugs are shooting at each other and at cars with air rifles and BB guns.<n>Families on Sheffield estate say they are being 'held to ransom' by yobs.<n>CCTV footage shows youngsters carrying weapons through estate.<n>One mother-of-three says she has been left 'terrified' by the thugs.<n>She claims one brave neighbour who confronted the youths was fired at.
Video reveals how gin and vodka dilute red wine stains.<n>Vinegar is best at removing mineral deposits on glass.<n>Your own spit can be used to lift food stains in the kitchen.

Parents of nine children involved in plots to travel to Syria should have identities hidden.<n>They include three terror suspects who have all previously been named.<n>Also among the parents are a couple who lied to the authorities about losing their daughter’s passport.<n>Critics argue that the parents should be named because they could be extremists and therefore a risk to other members of the public.

John Coyne, 56, ran the Prince of Wales pub in Harrow Road, London.<n>Victim, 25, had been on a night out with friends and ended night at Coyne's.<n>He fell asleep on a sofa at the pub and woke at around 3am to find Coyne raping him.<n>Coyne fled and the victim called the police who seized CCTV footage.<n>He was convicted of rape and engaging in sexual activity without consent.

Kellogg's is latest US owned multinational to be embroiled in controversy.<n>Company uses complex web of companies to do business in Britain.<n>Its two main UK subsidiaries are owned by an operation in Ireland.<n>It effectively paid no corporation tax in Britain in 2013, figures show.

Beth Hall, 24, from Cambridge, was bullied at school and became obsessed.<n>She would go three days without eating a single thing and lived on 10 calories.<n>She dropped to 4st 13lbs and was forced to drop out of university.<n>But she has now made a full recovery and is a size 8 and studying graphics.

Alexis Keslar was walking along a canal bank with her 18-month-old twins Eli and Silas on Friday when she was distracted by a bee.<n>The boys' stroller rolled away from her and into the canal, where a strong current swept them away.<n>Authorities revealed on Monday that the boys died because their mother was fighting off the bee.

Former Prime Minister said he had 'decades' still in him.<n>He joked that he would 'turn to drink' if he ever stepped down.<n>Blair said his latest ambition was to recruit former heads of government to advise presidents and prime ministers on how to run their countries.

Manuel Garza Jr. received a lethal injection of pentobarbital for killing San Antonio Police Officer John 'Rocky' Riojas in February 2001.<n>He is the sixth convicted murderer to be put to death in Texas this year.<n>Asked to make a final statement, Garza said he was sorry for causing pain to his family, friends and 'especially police officers'

Mark Hamill, who played Luke Skywalker in the original Star Wars films, said he was nervous about J.J. Abrams.<n>He said he was also suspicious because he is a Star Trek guy.<n>But the 63-year-old said Abrams is the first Star Wars director to be borne out of true fandom of the original films.

Joel Wilkinson, three, was diagnosed with Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy.<n>His muscles will slowly waste away and he will need a wheelchair.<n>His big sister Phoebe, five, adores him and takes care of him as much as possible.<n>She plays only'muscle friendly' games and refuses to play school games.

National Grid has revealed the UK's first new pylon for nearly 90 years.<n>Called the T-pylon it is a third shorter than the old lattice pylons.<n>But it is able to carry just as much power - 400,000 volts.<n>It is designed to be less obtrusive and will be used for clean energy.

Apple pledged an unspecified amount of money for a Virginia-based nonprofit, the Conservation Fund, to purchase two large tracts of timberland on the East Coast.<n>Comes as tech giant this year met a self-imposed goal of powering all its U.S. operations with renewable energy.

Jody Marson is a 30-year-old ironwoman competitor from Port Macquarie.<n>She has been named as the prison guard who allegedly had an affair with Kieran Loveridge.<n>Loveridge is serving a life sentence at Goulburn Supermax prison for killing Thomas Kelly in a one punch attack in 2012.<n>Ms Marson was suspended after other staff members claimed they had witness the alleged affair inside the Kempsey prison.

Katie Prager, 24, was diagnosed with an infection in her lungs in September 2009 and is desperately in need of a transplant.<n>Her husband Dalton, 23, who has already received new lungs, is pleading for help.<n>Her insurance company, Kentucky Medicaid, will not pay for the out-of-state treatment she needs at the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center.

Vera Maresova, 50, confessed to killing six patients over four years.<n>She injected potassium straight into the blood stream of her elderly patients.<n>The potassium caused them to suffer heart failure and eventually death.<n>All of her victims were already in intensive care at the hospital in Rumburk.<n>Maersova initially arrested over death of a 70-year-old woman last August.<n>But she has now admitted killing five more people between 2010 and 2014.

Solomon Khoorban, 33, attacked a 16-year-old in a West End nightclub.<n>He then raped a second woman, 32, at knifepoint two months later.<n>The former soldier, who was 21 at the time, went undetected for 12 years.<n>He was jailed for 16 years at Snaresbrooke Crown Court today.<n>Judge said he was a 'violent sexual predator' who ruined his victims' lives.

Zodiac Aerospace spoke to 30 flight attendants from four continents.<n>Their designs aim to maximise the sense of space and privacy.<n>Designs were revealed at Aircraft Interiors Expo in Hamburg last week.

Kristen Lindsey, 31, from Brenham, Texas, posted the image on Facebook.<n>She allegedly hunted the animal down and shot it with a bow believing it was feral.<n>But a local rescue center say the cat, believed to be called Tiger, was domesticated and had been missing for around two weeks.<n>Lindsey later said she didn't lose her job because she is 'awesome'<n>However she later learned she had been fired from her clinic.<n>Local prosecutors are now considering whether she should face criminal charges.

Bill de Blasio 'entering race as leftist alternative to Hillary Clinton'<n>Mayor of New York is backed by Working Families Party, source claims.<n>De Blasio has yet to endorse a candidate for the Democratic nomination.<n>He was campaign manager for Clinton's U.S. Senate bid in 2000.

Christopher Barry, 53, was stabbed to death outside his home in Edmonton.<n>The boy, 13, is a member of the notorious Wood Green Gang.<n>He pleaded guilty to stabbing Mr Barry twice in the chest in December last year.<n>The Old Bailey heard the boy became enraged when Mr Barry would not let the boy and his friends into the block of flats.<n>He pulled a knife from his rucksack and stabbed Mr Barry as he got into a lift.<n>The killer was jailed for more than 11 years after pleading guilty to murder.

Zipporah Lisle-Mainwaring accused of ordering paint job on her townhouse.<n>Neighbours say it is driving them'mad' and likened her to a child throwing a tantrum.<n>But MailOnline can reveal she has fallen out with family over inheritance.<n>Stepson Robert Lisle says she has reneged on commitments and is 'unpleasant'

The video, which surfaced on Reddit on Monday evening, shows Quaid losing the plot after someone appears to wander into his line of sight.<n>'I am acting here, and this d***head wanders onto my set. I can't even get a line out until Dopey the Dick starts whispering in your ear, and you're not even watching anymore,' he screams.<n>As one voice off camera tries to calm the actor down, Quaid yells, 'Don't f**king Dennis me' before storming off the set.<n>The video leaked online, but his reps haven't

Structure of cerebral cortex is 'like a mini-Internet'<n>Networks of neurons layered like the shells in a Russian nesting doll.<n>Two local networks governing vision and learning, and another tapped into bodily concerns like muscle and organ function.

The Downton Abbey creator will give a unique insight into his inspiration.<n>The stellar bill also includes Kate Moss and Sir Ranulph Fiennes.<n>Visitors to the festival will also be able to hear first-hand accounts.

Peter Gale was first male headteacher at Nonsuch High School for Girls.<n>He was fired for'serious breaches' in safeguarding procedures.<n>The school counts singer Katie Melua amongst its alumnae.<n>The soon will start the process of recruiting a new headteacher.

Ethan Czahor has launched ‘Clear’ which removes posts that might cause you problems with your current or future employer.<n>Users can search for keywords such as ‘gay’, ‘black’ or swear words.<n>The program deletes any tweet that mentions them and analyses sentiment.<n>Mr Czahor said he hoped the app would ensure others do not suffer the same fate as he did.

Vincent Stanford, 24, has been charged with the murder of Stephanie Scott.<n>He created an online alter ego called Quetzalcoalt to write science fiction scripts.<n>He also posted videos of himself playing violent video games.<n>He moved to Leeton, 550 kilometres from Sydney, just 13 months ago.

Jeremy Clarkson was sacked by the BBC in March after physical attack on producer.<n>Presenter, 54, has not publicly addressed his dismissal since his sacking.<n>But he today gave his 'heartfelt thanks' to those who have supported him.<n>Clarkson said he would'miss being there' but added it was 'not as much' as he would have missed being on Top Gear.<n>Comes as former presenter Angela Rippon said she would return to show.<n>Ms Rippon, 70, said it would be 'great' if she was invited back.

Louise Shepherd was hiking in the Madidi national park in Bolivia.<n>She was with her sister and college friend when a tree fell on her.<n>Her parents have been left having to choose a burial plot instead.

18-year-old was brutally raped at a bus stop in Leeds last month.<n>Police have now come across CCTV showing three other women being stalked.<n>One woman was forced to flee from the man by bus after walking to her car.<n>Another woman was stalked in the city centre before turning to find herself just an inch away from the rapist.<n>The man was also seen following a third woman into a shop.<n>Police believe he may be from the Pakistani or Middle Eastern background.

The opening day of The Championships has been postponed.<n>The field was empty after officials decided the turf was too dangerous to race on.<n>The Warwick Farm card is unable to go ahead on Monday.<n>The Wednesday program is totally abandoned.<n>Ticket-holders who won't be able to make Monday's event will be given the option of receiving a refund.

It will be the first time in more than 50 years that leaders from the previously estranged countries will have had a lengthy in-person exchange.<n>The two presidents spoke by phone on Wednesday for only the second, known time in as many years.<n>Obama and Castro have separate agendas for most of the day, and the White House had said a private meeting was not on the books.

Harvey Weinsten and his designer wife Georgina Chapman were spotted out together for the first time since the alleged groping incident.<n>The couple attended the premiere of his new Broadway play Finding Neverland on Wednesday night.<n>The play, which stars Glee star Matthew Morrison and Kelsey Grammer, is based on the 2004 film of the same name Weinstein produced starring Kate Winslet and Johnny Depp.<n>The play received disastrous reviews from critics, with New York Magazine calling it 'badly written' and 'frustrating'

A third man has been charged after raids in Melbourne led police to foil an Anzac Day terror plot.<n>The 18-year-old Hampton Park man had his Preventative Detention Order - which allows police to hold a person without charge for up to 14 days - removed.<n>He was re-arrested and charged with 'conspiracy to commit acts done in preparation for, or planning, terrorist acts'<n>The man will appear in Melbourne Magistrates' Court on Tuesday.<n>On Monday a police insider revealed sickening details about the alleged Anzac Day terror plot.<n>The accused men planned to run over a police officer and then

Letter-writing kit designed to woo voters with just 28 days to go.<n>Women are told they are 'vital to the success of the British economy'<n>Pensioners are praised for their 'wealth of experience', according to the pack.<n>Tory candidates told to praise teachers as 'the best we have ever had'<n>The 37-page document also tells women they are 'vital' to the economy.

Japanese cooking show Miniature Space has taken the internet by storm.<n>Cooks up a range of fun-sized food using tiny hobs and mini pans.<n>Latest video shows the chef making a miniature strawberry cake.<n>Covers it in frosting, sprinkles and coloured balls.

Hundreds gather to see naked corpses of four alleged attackers.<n>Authorities drove corpses around Garissa in pickup truck from mortuary.<n>Comes as 19-year-old survivor Cynthia Cheroitich speaks of her ordeal.<n>She hid for two days under a pile of clothes and drank body lotion.
86-year-old Daphne Selfe models for the footwear brand.<n>Appears with Flo Dunn, 22, in the campaign.<n>Daphne started her career in 1949 and earns £1,000 a day.

Elena Curtin of Portland, Oregon, was seven-months pregnant when she was charged with second-degree assault.<n>She struck her boyfriend's ex in the head and arm with a crowbar in November 2014.<n>Curtin found her boyfriend's ex-girlfriend shooting heroin while sitting on her toilet.<n>Oregon law allows for use of physical force against an intruder who won't leave a resident's home.<n>Curtin's defense attorney, Casey Kovacic, said the ex-girlfriend was 'jealous and bitter' that the boyfriend was in a relationship with his client.

The Queen was at Newbury Racecourse for the Dubai Duty Free Spring Trials.<n>She rode her horse Ring of Truth, which came second to the post.<n>The monarch looked horrified as her horse was pipped to the post.<n>She was later left smiling after her second horse came in third.

Paul, who announced his bid for the Oval Office on Tuesday, admitted that he needs to 'have more patience' with reporters.<n>The confession summed up the freshman lawmaker's second day as an official 2016 contestant - a bumpy ride that has so far included a confrontation with the chairwoman of the Democratic Party over late-term abortion.<n>Paul's woes on Wednesday began with an early morning sparring match on TODAY with Guthrie over perceived flip flops on foreign policy issues.

Graham Leonard was returning to Scotland after attending a football match.<n>He grabbed the PA microphone and started singing in the air while drunk.<n>He then caused part of an airport to be evacuated after setting off alarm.<n>Leonard, 46, admitted endangering the aircraft and its passengers.<n>He also admitted setting off the airport alarm knowing there was no blaze.
Ashley Roberts was live on-air for Minnesota's This Morning when her boyfriend Justin McCray popped the question.

Tiny home is sandwiched between two properties on a leafy street in Islington, north London.<n>The property has two bedrooms, a tiny study, shower room, cloakroom, kitchen and a garden.<n>At its widest, it stretches across 8ft 8in, with the estate agency calling it 'well proportioned'<n>At £750,000, the buyer will have to pay £27,000 in stamp duty - the same as a second-hand narrow boat which is 50ft long.

Daria Rose, 18, lost everything when Hurricane Sandy hit in October 2012.<n>Rose and her family lived in several hotels as well as her grandmother's house after being forced to evacuate their home.<n>After more than a year, the family moved into a new home in Baldwin.<n>Rose wrote a college essay about her Hurricane Sandy experience and how reading helped her cope.<n>The essay helped Rose secure a spot in Yale, Harvard, Princeton, Dartmouth, University of Pennsylvania, Cornell, and Brown.

Gnome featured alongside Diana Dors, Bob Dylan and Marlon Brando.<n>Other famous figures include Edgar Allen Poe, Sonny Liston and Laurel and Hardy.<n>John Lennon had wanted models of Jesus and Hitler to be included.<n>But his requests were denied and the cover ended up costing £3,000.<n>Signed by all four band members following the shoot in 1967.<n>It emerged for sale almost 50 years after the album was released.

WI members slaved away for days on end to bake enough cakes to feed 5,000 women attending centenary celebrations at Royal Albert Hall.<n>But the WI has now been told it must pay the venue thousands of pounds to serve the cakes.<n>The idea was that the 5,000 members attending the National Federation of the Women’s Institute’s AGM would find a box of centenary cake on their seats.<n>But organisers were astonished to be told that the gesture would incur a ‘sampling charge’ of £2,500 because the centenary cake has fallen foul of the Hall’s sponsorship rules.

Manchester council makes a 15p profit from every £1.25 hour's parking.<n>240 machines are still not upgraded so drivers must use old coins.<n>New 5p and 10p pieces introduced three years ago are thicker than old ones.<n>This means that many machines reject the new coins, which is a problem.<n>Experts fear the problem could become worse when 12-sided pound coin is released in 2017.

Victor Agbafe, 17, is a student at Cape Fear Academy in Wilmington, North Carolina.<n>He could go to Stanford or Duke because he was accepted at those prestigious institutions as well.<n>Agbafe describes himself as a 'passionate, honest, open-minded individual'<n>Another student, Harold Ekeh, 18, is also accepted into all eight Ivy League schools.
150 Micro Motes can fit in a thimble.<n>Can act as a smart sensor, and give everyday objects computing capabilities.

The quaint capital city put on one hell of a show last weekend for its inaugural CubaDupa festival.<n>Thousands of locals and tourists enjoyed the colourful street party that shut down streets and spanned several blocks.<n>The massive scale festival – the first of its kind in several years - saw lively street performances, circus acts taking over parks and performers dancing in shop windows.

Gerard T. 'The Frenchman' Ouimette was 75.<n>Ouimette was known to his associates as 'The Frenchman'<n>He was convicted of extortion and was the first criminal in New England sentenced to life in prison under the federal 'three strikes and you're out' provision for violent offenders.<n>Ouimette was never convicted of any homicides.

Boy, 14, and girl, 16, arrested on suspicion of preparing acts of terrorism.<n>The boy was held in Blackburn after police raided a house in the town.<n>Girl was arrested after police raided a house in Longsight, Manchester.<n>Both were bailed until May 28 after being held in police custody.

Stephanie Scott's remains were found in Cocoparra National Park.<n>The 26-year-old was last seen on Easter Sunday in Leeton, NSW.<n>Her body was discovered on Friday evening around 5pm.<n>Vincent Standford, 24, has been charged with Ms Scott's murder.<n>Her family were led to the site by the mother and brother of Standford.<n>The school teacher was due to marry her fiance Aaron Leeson-Woolley.

Eileen Mason, 92, and Margaret Seabrook, 75, were targeted by an 'evil looking' man.<n>The would-be robber grabbed Mrs Mason by the arm and reached for her bag.<n>But Mrs Mason shouted 'Oh, no you don't' and slammed on the accelerator.<n>The attacker was knocked to the ground and the pair sped off into the distance.

If all ice were to be spread across the surface of Mars, the entire planet would be covered in more than 3.3ft (one metre)<n>The research was carried out by scientists at the Niels Bohr Institute at the University of Copenhagen.<n>Images from several Martian satellites had revealed the shape of glaciers just below the surface, and confirmed most were made of water-ice.<n>Now the researchers have measured how big the glaciers are, and their similarity to glaciers on Earth.<n>They found that the ice closer to the Martian equator was ‘an important part of Mars’ water reservoir’

Dusan Bako, 18, flew into a rage after his girlfriend switched off her phone.<n>He then punched her repeatedly in the stomach causing her to miscarry.<n>Bako was jailed for two years after pleading guilty to causing GBH.<n>Court heard the girl was living in fear of Bako and his demands.

StatusPeople.com found that 44 per cent of Clinton's 3.6 million Twitter followers are 'good'; 15 per cent are 'fake'; and 41 per cent are 'inactive'<n>Another website found that 18 per cent of her 320,000 Facebook fans are fake.<n>Clinton boasts two-thirds of a million Facebook 'likes,' but more than 46,000 of them list Baghdad, Iraq as their hometown.

Queensland resident Roxy Walsh found the ring while snorkelling in Bali.<n>She posted a photo of the ring on Facebook in the hope of reuniting it with its owner.<n>Ms Walsh has found the owner and will be meeting with them this weekend.<n>The ring has a message engraved on it: 'Darling Joe, Happy 70th Birthday 2009, Love Jenny'

Olivia Bazlinton, 13, and Charlotte Thompson, 14, died at Elsenham station, Essex.<n>They were using the station's unlocked footpath crossing to catch a service.<n>Network Rail was convicted of criminal negligence and fined £1 million.

Video footage shows a white ball being rolled down a positioned cue.<n>It bounces off one side of the red-clothed table and hits the first in a long line of dominoes.<n>One by one the small counters fall down, tapping balls into various pockets as they go.<n>In less than 30 seconds the stunt comes to a close.

Hillary Clinton has given details of her family's joy at the birth of their first grandchild in a new chapter of her memoir, Hard Choices.<n>She said she was 'unabashedly giddy' at the news but her daughter Chelsea was far calmer and better prepared than she was.<n>She said she saw a tear in Bill's eye when they were told they were going to the hospital to greet their first grandchild, Charlotte Clinton Mezvinksy.

Carol Chandler, 53, accused of indecently assaulting boy under 16 in 1980s.<n>Charged as part of Met Police investigation into allegations of sex abuse.<n>Former pupils of St Paul's School in Barnes, London, include George Osborne.<n>Chandler appeared at Westminster Magistrates' Court today and her case was sent to Southwark Crown Court.<n>A total of five people have now been charged by officers from Operation Winthorpe.

David Totton, 36, admitted driving car into doors of Club Liv in Manchester.<n>Came after bouncers refused to let his friend inside the popular nightspot.<n>Totton tried to claim attack was meant as 'a joke' but judge ruled otherwise.<n>He was banned from every pub and club in Manchester for two years.

Anarda De La Caridad Perez Friman, 37, was found dead with her partner and two children.<n>John Joseph Shannon, 31, was initially accused of killing the family.<n>But police believe Perez Friman suffered a 'psychotic incident'<n>She is said to have stabbed her partner and the two children before taking her own life.

Annabel Karmel has slammed Pete Evans' controversial bone broth recipe.<n>She says it is dangerous and ill advised for babies.<n>The UK children's cookbook guru says bone broth is not a good idea.<n>She says it is a lot of work and it's also very low calorie amount of food.<n>'The baby won't have any nutrition they need - it's entirely dangerous and I would definitely not advise that,' she said.

Julie Bishop has sparked a debate over her choice to wear a scarf.<n>The Foreign Minister met with Iranian president Hassan Rouhani and his counterpart Mohammad Javad Zarif.<n>She also donned a hat during the trip, which attracted a number of comments.<n>Bishop said she did so out of respect for the culture.<n> Westerners are not required to cover their heads, but do have to wear a scarf when visiting local mosques.

Ana Elizondo was kidnapped in 2012 from a parking lot near the Mexican border.<n>The psychology graduate student, 27, was blindfolded and transported.<n>She escaped the hands of her captors the following day unharmed.<n>She will open up about her experiences on the documentary show House of Horrors: Kidnapped on Investigation Discovery on Tuesday.

Larry Reid was arrested about 12:30 p.m. Monday on U.S. Highway 95 near the edge of Boulder City city limits.<n>He was charged with DUI, driving across a median, resisting arrest, not wearing a seat belt and possession of a gun while under the influence of alcohol.<n>Senator Harry Reid, who recently suffered an accident while exercising, said last week he would not seek re-election next year.

Lance Corporal Leonard Keysor served in Gallipoli during World War I.<n>He threw live grenades back at the enemy to save his comrades.<n>The 30-year-old received a Victoria Cross for his 48-hour effort.<n> LCpl Keysor caught some of the bombs in mid-air.

Valerie Rutty altered invoices by increasing prices she had commissioned.<n>Then paid difference between actual sums into her own bank account.<n>Cash collected by parents, teachers and pupils over three years at school.<n>60-year-old stole almost £3,500 from fund at Irlam Primary School in Manchester.

Dame Barbara Hakin accused of gagging whistleblower who tried to warn about impact of targets on ordinary patients.<n>Investigation by GMC concluded that there was no case to answer.<n>GMC is now reviewing part of this decision and appointing independent expert to consider if original investigation went ‘far enough’ in respect of patient safety.

Marks and Spencer is stocking a limited supply of the 2014 Miraval Rose.<n>The £18-a-bottle wine has received rave reviews from wine critics.<n>The vineyard is at Chateau Miraval, where the couple married last year.

Just 33 per cent of voters plan on supporting Ed Miliband in election.<n>Tories have jumped three per cent in the last month, according to ICM poll.<n>Labour has dropped two points and Ukip is up three points.

Madonna posted picture of Thatcher and thanked her for her service.<n>Some of her gay fans took umbrage and said she had gone 'a step too far'<n>But Conservative fans praised Madonna for the post and said she was 'back in my good books'

Dr Chris Van Tulleken says over-the-counter medicines market is worth £2.5bn.<n>But he says we should think less about convenience and more about effectiveness.<n>In The Truth About Medicine, Dr Van Tulleken warns we should think less about convenience and more about the effectiveness of medicines.

Cookie the terrier was slashed across the head during aggravated burglary.<n>Joseph Devaney, 23, struck the animal with a meat cleaver during the attack.<n>He and accomplice Kieron Rolstron, 22, demanded money from the couple.<n> Cookie's owners watched in horror as the intruders made off with their car.<n>Devaney and Rolstron were jailed for nine and eight years respectively.

Sheriff Mbye died in hospital two hours after he suffered stab wounds.<n>A 19-year-old was found with stab wounds in a barber shop in Birmingham.<n>Police were called to a KFC restaurant in Northfield after reports of a stabbing.<n>Officers were alerted to fact Mr Mbye had been dropped off outside hospital.<n>He was dropped off in a white Audi which then sped off and was found abandoned.<n>An 18-year-old man from Birmingham has been arrested on suspicion of murder.

Man, in his 60s, died after ride-on lawnmower overturned into a pond.<n>He was believed to have been mowing grass outside his property in Suffolk.<n>Family managed to drag him from the pond but he was pronounced dead.

Jessica Hardy, 23, from Hereford, wanted to remove her ex's name from her forearm.<n>She used acid to burn it off but ended up with chemical burns.<n>She was filmed on Channel 5 show Tattoo Disasters.

Jessica Edgeington, 33, was killed in a dive on Wednesday in DeLand, Florida.<n>She was a professional diver known for a type of high-speed sport called'swooping'<n>It is unclear what type of dive she was maneuvering, but she appears to have run into a problem in the air.<n>Local media reports say Edgeington collided with another diver, causing a problem with her parachute.<n>However the crash is currently under investigation.

The estimated one million pages of paper documents from Stephen Jones now fill 550 file cabinet-sized boxes at the Briscoe Center for American History at the University of Texas.<n>McVeigh considered the bombing of the Oklahoma City federal building 20 years ago a failure because the structure was still standing after the blast that killed 168 people.<n>He also suggested his defense team should receive $800,000 from the government.
