Stephanie Scott was to be married at her wedding venue in NSW.<n>120 guests had been invited to the Eat Your Greens venue in Eugowra.<n>The venue was locked up and deserted on Saturday as guests paid tribute to Ms Scott at a memorial service.<n>Her big day was supposed to take place that day.<n>But it was 275km and three hours' drive away from Eat Your Greens.

Amanda Burleigh convinced clamping the cord within seconds of delivery was wrong.<n>She believed it was unnatural to clamp the cord when it was still pulsating.<n>She contacted other medics and amassed evidence that stopping the blood flow so early could be harmful.<n>NICE now states that doctors should not routinely clamp the cord ‘earlier than one minute from the birth of the baby’

Chelsea Clinton, 35, was just 12 when she first became famous for her frizzy curls.<n>But over the years, her curls quickly faded, appearing more and more controlled as the years wore on, before eventually vanishing completely.

Each tomb was filled with bones of up to 60 mummies, with infants kept in small containers, and others repeatedly ripped to pieces while decomposing.<n>Archaeologists have so far opened up seven of the tombs, recovering 171 broken mummies from the ancient ceremonial site known as Tenahaha.<n>In one tomb, researchers discovered 400 isolated human body parts, including teeth, hands and feet.

Christopher Stefanoni, 50, says his son was demoted for threatening the white ethnic makeup of Darien, Connecticut.<n>He says affordable housing developments he proposed threatened the town's small black population.<n>Darien is 94 per cent white, with 620 Hispanic residents and fewer than 100 blacks, according to the U.S. Census.<n>The town and the Little League both deny that the goings-on of the Little League and Stefanoni's housing plans are linked.

Doug Gregory, 92, was making his daily trip to the shops when he was struck.<n>He suffered a serious head injury and was flown to hospital by air ambulance.<n>But he died two weeks later from his injuries.<n>Mr Gregory was awarded the Distinguished Flying Cross for his gallantry.<n>He only retired from his job as a stunt pilot two years ago.

There were at least three reports of people trying to release gopher tortoises in the ocean because they were mistaken for sea turtles.<n>Gopher tortoises have toes with claws on each toe and sea turtles have flippers with just one or two claws on each fore flipper.<n>Gopher tortoises are protected by Florida law and sea turtles are on Florida's endangered species or threatened survival list.

University of Cambridge scientist has revealed his green source of energy.<n>By using just moss he is able to generate enough power to run a clock.<n>He said panels of plant material could power appliances in our homes.<n>And the technology could help farmers grow crops where electricity is scarce.<n>Dr Paolo Bombelli will present his research as part of the Pint of Science festival, which is running from 18 to 20 May in 50 cities across nine countries.

Gang of four were spotted trying to escape along the M42 after raid in Derby.<n>Police helicopter was following them as they tried to hide under a bridge.<n>The car rammed two police vehicles as they tried to hide under a bridge.<n>They then fled on foot along a busy slip road and were arrested.<n>Gang were jailed at Birmingham Crown Court for conspiracy to commit robbery.

Kathleen Bailey was given power of attorney over her dying life-long friend's finances.<n>The church elder became a carer for her 87-year-old victim.<n>But she helped herself to at least £1,500 and used the money to finance trips.<n>Bailey was handed a 12-month suspended jail sentence after admitting theft.<n>She was also ordered to pay £1,500 to her victim's estate at Bolton Crown Court.

Police say 35-year-old Donnell Graham fatally shot his wife, Shaquana Graham, 33, and another man before turning the gun on himself early Sunday morning.<n>The York County Coroner's Office says the other man, 25-year-old Kristopher Pittman, had been killed by gunshots to the chest.<n>A motel employee said a guest staying in the room next door heard five shots, followed by a pause, which was followed by three more shots before hearing silence.<n>They also reported seeing a bullet hole in the glass on the outside of the building.

The 15 companies, many of them worth north of a $1 billion, include CBS, General Electric and Mattel.<n>Most of those 15 companies received tax rebates in the tens or even hundreds of millions.<n>Citizens for Tax Justice wants changes to the corporate tax code.

Polls suggest election will be too close to call with Tories narrowly ahead.<n>American pollster Nate Silver says both parties will struggle to cobble together any kind of workable majority.<n>He predicts a hung parliament with the Tories winning 283 seats and Labour 274.

Footage shows the seven-day-old foal nuzzling Sunny Bayne's shoulder before pushing her to the ground and lying on top of her belly.<n>The young rider from Kentucky can't stop smiling at the animal's silly antics.<n>'This is the best day of my life,' she exclaims as the cuddling session continues.<n>Bayne later identified the owner of the foal as Florida-based Meg Miranda.

Tom O'Carroll is a former Open University information officer and formerly a key activist for PIE.<n>He attended a Hacked Off rally in the Houses of Parliament on February 25.<n>Organisation is campaigning against what it sees as the ‘biased and unfair’ Independent Press Standards Organisation.

Gray Schultz Middle School in Hempstead, New York.<n> Annika McKenzie, 34, walked into the building without being cleared by security and waited in the hallway for her daughter's math teacher, Catherine Engelhardt.<n>Police say McKenzie believed Engelhardt had 'put her hands' on her daughter earlier in the day.<n>Engelhardt refused to speak with McKenzie, telling her to first get a security pass.<n>A fight then ensued, with the teacher shoved against the wall, placed in a headlock and thrown to the floor.<n>McKenzie and her

Stephen Akers-Belcher said he needed time off for compassionate reasons.<n>But he was pictured the same day aboard HMS Warrior, 323 miles from his patch.<n>He was dismissed from his care manager role in Newcastle for gross misconduct.<n>But he claims he was sacked for whistle blowing and not gross misconduct.

The 22-year-old was recently moved from Emory University Hospital - where she had been treated since being found unresponsive on January 31.<n>On Monday, her maternal grandmother Cissy Houston clarified to People that her granddaughter 'is no longer in a medically induced coma' but is not awake nor expected to ever fully recover.

Swan nicknamed Asbaby has been pecking punters on River Cam, Cambridge.<n>He is said to be the grandson of Mr Asbo, who was moved to a different location.<n>Asbaby was seen attacking tourists and stealing from water bottles.

Ivana Chubbuck, 62, is a part therapist and part acting coach.<n>She is known as the 'celebrity whisperer', and has worked with Brad Pitt.<n>Beyoncé went to Chubbuck when she was about to play Etta James.<n>She was looking to be taken seriously as an artist, and Chubbuck helped her.<n>Within months, she was topping the charts with Single Ladies.

Lelisa Desisa, 25, of Ethiopia won with an unofficial time of 2 hours, 9 minutes, 17 seconds.<n>He beat his previous winning time by more than a minute on a day when security was on high alert for potential threats.<n>His countryman Yemane Adhane Tsegay was second with 2:09:48 in mid-40s weather, and Wilson Chebet of Kenya took third in 2:10:22.<n>Caroline Rotich, 30, of Kenya won the women's division with an unofficial time of 2 hours, 24 minutes, 55 seconds.

Google has been steadily revealing some of the biggest questions its users have typed into the search engine about 2016 presidential candidates.<n>Many of the questions focused on candidates' ages and heights, according to the website.<n>The most popular question typed into Google during that time period was asking how old Hillary Clinton is.<n>The second-most popular was 'Is Hillary Clinton a Democrat?'<n>Clinton is 67 years old and a member of the Democratic Party.

Baylee Almon was one of 19 toddlers killed in the Oklahoma City bombing.<n>She was one of 168 people killed in the April 19, 1995, attack.<n>Her mother Aren saw the picture of her daughter on the front page of the local paper the next day.<n>'I had to see Baylee dead every day. No one should ever have to see that,' Aren said.

Vincent Viafore from Poughkeepsie, New York, was on the rough Hudson River near Newburgh with Angelika Graswald.<n>He was not wearing a life jacket and was unable to get back into the kayak.<n>Graswald managed to make it out of the water and call 911.<n>She was taken to hospital and treated for hypothermia but his is still missing.

Qasr al-Farid or 'The Lonely Castle' is located in the northwestern region of the Arabian peninsula.<n>The ancient remains of the four-storey tomb are the largest of 131 in the area.<n>It is believed to have been constructed in the first century A.D. and stands amidst imposing cliffs.<n>The UNESCO World Heritage Site is believed to have been intended for someone of power.

Sheila Elkan lives in house that featured as Margo Leadbetter's home.<n>Great-grandmother-of-five, 84, has lived in the north-west London home since 1986.<n>She backed David Cameron today after he launched 'Good Life' manifesto.<n>PM promised to help deliver 'greatest sunshine' of job, home and tax cuts.

Kristen Jarvis, 34, is moving on from Washington after seven years as the First Lady's chief of staff.<n>She's now taking a job with the Ford Foundation.<n>Jarvis says she didn't share Michelle's love of D.C. workout craze Solidcore.

Pennyhill Park in Bagshot, Surrey, has attracted many celebrities.<n>Daniel Craig, Nicole Kidman, Cameron Diaz and Lewis Hamilton are regulars.<n>The spa has recently unveiled a £500,000 makeover to its spa.

Rik Mayall died suddenly aged 56 last June.<n>But probate records reveal he had no will.<n>It could mean complications for his wife Barbara and children.<n>Lawyers have always advised that people should have a valid will.

Brayden Travis, 18, was left without medical attention for seven hours after taking drugs at a friend's house in Missouri in March.<n>His lungs and kidneys failed, and he suffered a stroke and severe brain damage.<n>His mother shared a photo of him in hospital to deter others from taking drugs and said he has struggled with addiction since he was 15.<n>He is now conscious and breathing on his own, she said.

Unnamed baggage handler woke up inside Alaska Airlines flight 448.<n>He did not realize until a piece of luggage fell on top of him.<n>The Los Angeles-bound flight was forced to return to Seattle.<n>He called 911 and spoke to a bemused operator for 44 seconds.

Social Services Minister Scott Morrison is researching possible legislation changes.<n>Parents who choose not to vaccinate their children may soon be blocked from accessing welfare payments and childcare subsidies.<n>Parents can seek exemptions if a doctor signs a form showing they understand the risks to their child if they don't get vaccinated.<n>The hard-line approach to immunisation comes one month after the tragic death of 32-day -old Perth baby Riley Hughes who died after contracting whooping cough.

Richie Benaud, 84, died on Friday after battling skin cancer.<n>He had been undergoing radiation treatment for the disease.<n>Benaud had been out walking with his wife Daphne for 40 minutes every morning.<n>He hadn't returned to his commentary job for the Nine Network following a car accident in October 2013.

Luke Shambrook went missing at Lake Eildon National Park, north-east of Melbourne, on Friday.<n>He was found on Tuesday just three kilometres from where he went missing.<n>The 11-year-old was suffering from exhaustion, dehydration and hypothermia.<n>He is now with his family at Royal Children's Hospital in Melbourne.

The NFL has reinstated Adrian Peterson, allowing him to participate in league activities starting on Friday.<n>This after a ban that has been in effect since September 17 of last year following an incident in which he beat his young son with a switch.<n>Peterson met with the NFL two weeks ago to discuss his reinstatement, and he was set to earn $12.75million for the upcoming season.

Alice Kovach-Suehn, 56, from Apopka, was arrested last Friday and charged with elderly neglect.<n>Police say they found the man in her care weighing only 89lbs.<n>The 96-year-old told officers he was being starved and never allowed to eat anything but meat and 'dog feces'<n>By the time police rescued him, the victim could not move his hands and his knees were locked together.

Study reveals a third of men have never washed their own car.<n>Three-quarters of women have never washed their own car.<n>Only five per cent of parents have asked their children to wash cars.<n>Rising cost of car washes and bigger vehicles blamed for decline.

The donor, Josh Dall-Leighton of Windham said that Maine Medical Center officials informed him this week that it has concerns about the amount of money raised for him.<n>Christine Royles, 24, of South Portland, who is suffering from kidney failure, organized fundraisers to reimburse Dall-Leighton for unpaid time away from work.<n>The appearance that someone could be profiting from an organ donation raises ethical concerns because it's illegal to sell organs.

Miley Cyrus this week challenged convention by leaving underarms unshaved.<n>Here, experts reveal why being hairy may be good for you.<n>Hair follicles are rich in stem cells which help the skin heal.<n>Body hair was our only garment, keeping us warm and protecting us from sunlight.

Researchers from Germany, Canada and the U.S. asked people to answer the question and others like it from 6,100 people.<n>They found that men were more likely to kill to save lives in the short-term.<n>But women were more reluctant to do anything harmful in the long-term.

Roxy Walsh found the ring at the Finns Beach Club in South Kuta, Bali on Tuesday.<n>She launched a social media campaign to find the owners of the ring.<n>The ring was returned to its' owners Joe and Jenny Langley on Sunday.<n>Ms Walsh met with the couple in Noosa on Queensland's Sunshine Coast.

Alexis Tsipras will meet Vladimir Putin in Moscow today.<n>Kremlin 'will offer controversial loans and discounts on natural gas supplies'<n>Visit will raise fears left-wing government is looking east for finance.<n>Mr Tsipras condemned West's economic sanctions on Moscow as 'road to nowhere'

Captain Niloofar Rahmani, 23, is Afghanistan's first female pilot since 2001.<n>She has received death threats from the Taliban and her family.<n>She was awarded the U.S Secretary of State's International Women of Courage Award.

Robert Knowles, 68, has clocked up nearly 350 offences since 1959.<n>Pensioner has been in court at least once a year since he was 13.<n>He pleaded guilty to stealing a watch and cuff links worth £50 in March.<n>He was jailed for 16 weeks after his 190th court appearance this year.

The 41-year-old Australian woman was getting ready for a New Year's Eve party when she started to wheeze.<n>She reached into her bag for her inhaler and heard a 'coarse rattle'<n>She thought it was a loose connection, but felt a scratch in her throat.<n>She was rushed to hospital and doctors found a mass in her lung.<n>X-ray and CT scan showed the earring was stuck in her right bronchus.<n>Doctors put a thin tube with a camera on the end into her throat - in a procedure known as an endoscopy - and removed it

By 2013, the average 75-year-old woman could expect to live another 13 years and five weeks – five weeks less than in 2011.<n>For a woman aged 85, the expected span was six years and 42 weeks – two and a half months less.<n>Life expectancy for English women is already among the worst in Western Europe.

Stunning set of pictures was taken in a forest in Langenfeld, Germany, yesterday by body-painting artist Joerg Duesterwald.<n>He spent hours painting his model so she would blend in with her surroundings.<n>Model is captured crouched on a rock covered in green, grey and black paint.

Mahendra Ahirwar, 12, has a rare condition that makes his neck bend.<n>His head hangs from his body at 180 degrees and he can't stand or walk.<n>His parents say they have consulted more than 50 doctors but none can diagnose.<n>His mother says: 'I cannot see him suffer anymore. It's no life'

TV5 Monde was hacked by people claiming allegiance to ISIS for three hours.<n>They cut transmission of 11 channels and took over websites and social media.<n>Director Yves Bigot said the network has restored its signal.<n>But it can only broadcast recorded programs, not live content, he said.

Zbigniew Huminski, 38, has confessed to strangling nine-year-old Chloe.<n>Victim was stripped naked and sexually assaulted in woods near Calais.<n>She was taken from outside school by Pole 'while drunk' on Wednesday.<n>Mother 'heard her daughter's screams' as she was taken away.<n>Huminski was arrested hours later and 'immediately recognised his involvement'

Margaret Bates' daughter Kelly-Anne was tortured to death by James Smith.<n>Smith burnt her with an iron, scalded her with boiling water and gouged out her eyes.<n>Next year marks the 20th anniversary of Kelly-Anne's death.<n>Mrs Bates said she is consumed by one thought - that she wished she had killed Smith when she first met him.

Trend is inspired by popular anime character Hestia.<n>She has a distinctive blue ribbon looped around her pneumatic torso.<n>Women tie it under their breasts and over their arms to boost cleavage.<n>Trend has been copied by cosplayers and ordinary women in Japan.
Princess Eugenie, 25, attended For The Love Of Cinema dinner in New York.<n>The event was held during the Tribeca Film Festival.<n>Attended by Dakota Fanning, Jennifer Morrison and Kelly Brook.

Study on synaesthesia - a condition where two senses are joined together - looked at people born between 1971 and 1990.<n>Data was used to determine which colours are most commonly associated with which letters.<n>Researchers compared these colour-letter matches to fridge magnets sold by Fisher-Price between 1971 and 1990.<n>The results revealed that at least six per cent (400 out of the 6588 participants) learnt'many of their matches' from the toy.

Ian Gibson, 55, was killed by a young bull elephant in Zimbabwe on Wednesday.<n>Gibson was measuring its ivory tusks for a U.S. client when he died.<n>Friends say he fired one shot at the animal, which charged at him.<n>Gibson, who lived in South Africa, was a popular figure in the U.S. safari community.

Roy Day, 29, and Gerard Lundie, 26, targeted 13 homes over four months.<n>Stole £160,000 worth of luxury cars from properties across four counties.<n>Left their DNA at the scenes of some of the crimes they were arrested.<n>Pair jailed for five years and four months at Birmingham Crown Court.

Leanne Kenny, 23, from Northwich, Cheshire, ballooned to almost 20st.<n>She snacked on bumper bars of chocolate, baked goods and fizzy drinks.<n>She was unable to fit into the largest size in a store so decided to lose weight.<n>Leanne joined Weight Watchers and took up walking in a bid to shed the weight.

June Whitfield, 89, will make a guest appearance in EastEnders next week.<n>She will play a nun who will offer advice to Kat Moon, played by Jessie Wallace.<n> Whitfield said it was an 'absolute delight' to work with Wallace.<n>The actress is best known for her role as mother of Edna in Absolutely Fabulous.

John Marshall, son of director Noel Marshall, is opening up about his father's decision to cast him and Melanie Griffith in Roar.<n>The film was released in 1981 and is making a return to the big screen nearly 35 years after its original release.<n>The film was originally released in 1981 and its 11-year production is infamous for the injuries received by 70 members of the cast and crew.

Easter Act 1928 was passed to make sure Easter weekend was fixed in April.<n>It was unable to get the agreement of churches so has never been implemented.<n>Conservative Sir Greg Knight asked ministers if there were plans to implement it.<n>National Secular Society wrote to David Cameron demanding Easter be a set date.

The hit US TV series House of Cards features Francis Underwood.<n>Much of the action takes place on Capitol Hill, home to the Senate and the House of Representatives.<n>Visitors to Washington can learn tricks from the hit series on how to neutralise your opponents.

Marli van Breda, 16, was attacked with an axe in her family's South African home in January.<n>Her father, mother and eldest brother were killed in the horrific incident.<n>She suffered severe brain damage and her throat was slashed.<n>She has no memory of the attack and is suffering from retrograde amnesia.<n>Her family said she is able to walk and talk and has a sense of humour.

Obama announced $200 million in additional U.S. humanitarian aid to Iraq.<n>He declined to say whether Washington would provide Apache helicopters, drones and other arms to Baghdad to help with the ongoing fight against ISIS.<n>'I think this is why we are having this meeting: to make sure that we are continually improving our coordination to make sure that Iraqi security forces are in a position to succeed in our common mission,' he said.

People paying £150 a week to live in flats owned by housing associations.<n>Properties in Mayfair and Covent Garden are now worth millions of pounds.<n>Conservative plans would extend right-to-buy to give tenants chance to own homes.<n>They could get discounts of up to £102,000 after living in plush properties.

Drivers pulled over on Interstate 20 in Albilene, Texas, to pick up the cash.<n>A video posted on Facebook shows motorists frantically grabbing notes.<n>Police have warned anyone caught with money could be jailed.

Hannah Moore, 20, of Broxburn, posted images to boost confidence.<n>Mother-of-two had suffered stretchmarks after having twins.<n>Claims account was deleted two minutes after it was uploaded.<n>Says blocking made her think her body is 'clearly fat, ugly and disgusting'

A photo of a 'drunken' young woman was posted on SOHO nightclub’s Facebook page on April 3.<n>It was a week after Luke Lazarus was sentenced for raping an 18-year-old at the club.<n>The photo’s caption said: ‘We’re throwing an extra special Yeezter event Tonight. Free entry till 10pm and $5 drinks till midnight – get amongst it!’<n>The club agreed that the photo was ‘100 per cent inappropriate’ and removed it.

Chantelle Doherty and accomplice preyed on elderly people in their homes.<n>The 21-year-old was involved in a raid on the home of a 92-year-old man.<n>She bluffed her way in and stole several bottles of whisky, a decanter and a phone.<n>Her friend Martin Lawrence, 27, also targeted a man aged 99.<n>Doherty has been jailed for two years after pleading guilty to burglary and fraud.<n>Lawrence has been jailed for five years after pleading guilty to fraud and burglary.

Jake Shaw was just beginning his gap year when tragedy occurred last year.<n>The 21-year-old had fallen 25ft from the upper floor of the building in Switzerland.<n>He was airlifted to hospital suffering severe injuries but died nine days later.<n>Lincoln Coroner's Court heard he had been celebrating Swiss National Day.<n>Jake had been playing drinking games with friends called 'Power Hour' and 'Ring of Fire' before returning to his room in a'very drunk state'<n>Assistant coroner Paul Smith concluded that Jake's death was an accident.

Audrie Pott, 15, killed herself in 2012 after she was sexually assaulted at a party.<n>Her family said she hanged herself after images were shared around school.<n>Two of her attackers have now apologized and agreed to settlement.<n>They admitted she was unconscious during the assault and did not consent.<n>Also apologized for spreading false rumors that'served to shame and humiliate her'

David Cameron says Tory policies will help get people on to property ladder.<n>Claims seven key policies will help build more homes and cut costs.<n>PM was speaking at a building site in Aylesbury as he launched manifesto.<n>He said: 'The dream of home ownership is alive' with the Tories.

Biso the cat had been stuck behind a wall at a Cairo train station for five years.<n>The feline squeezed into the hole in 2010 but soon became big to escape.<n>He survived thanks to an elderly man called Uncle Abdo who fed him.<n>Uncle Abdo said he fed Biso scraps of food every day at Mohamed Naguib station.<n>Biso's plight came to the attention of animal activists after a picture of the cat's tail hanging from behind the wall was posted on Facebook.

Sheriff Mbye, also 18, died in hospital after being stabbed on Friday.<n>He was attacked outside a KFC in Northfield, Birmingham at around 5pm.<n>Another 18-year-old was arrested on suspicion of murder on Friday.<n>Today a second teenager was arrested at his home address on suspicion of murder.<n>Police are not looking for anyone else in connection with the murder.

Binh Wagner, 3, and her identical twin Phuoc were adopted by Michael and Johanne Wagner around a year and a half ago from Vietnam.<n>The twins suffer from Alagille syndrome, a life-threatening genetic disorder that causes a loss of the bile ducts within the liver during the first year of life.<n>Mr Wagner was a perfect match, but was only able to give a portion of his liver to just one of his daughters.<n>When Phuoc needed a donor more, Mr Wagner chose her to receive his liver, which was a perfect match.<n>Now, thanks to the generosity of an anonymous

Expedition 42 commander Barry Wilmore and flight engineer Terry Virts recorded three spacewalks on GoPro cameras.<n>The spacewalks were in preparation for the arrival of 2017's multibillion pound commercial spacecraft.<n>The astronauts can be seen repairing the robotic arm of the space station and installing a new communication system.

Louise Nesbitt was fired from her job as a bookkeeper in Perth.<n>She accidentally sent her boss a text message calling him a 'd***'<n>She immediately texted him to ask him to delete the message.<n>Ms Nesbitt was fired five days later after her employer claimed it was due to 'gross misconduct'<n>She filed an unfair dismissal complaint with the Fair Work Commission.

Two sets of maps include image mosaics and topographical views.<n>They were compiled by cartographer Trent Hare over a period of four years.<n>The grey and white areas reveal higher peaks, while darker blues show deep craters.<n>To the left of these craters is Oceanus Procellarum, which is Latin for 'Ocean of Storms'

Dante de Blasio, 17, has been accepted into several top colleges including Ivy League universities Yale and Brown.<n>Mayor de Blasio is expected to turn to financial aid to help pay for his son's elite education.<n>His salary of $225,000 and daughter Chiara's $55,000 a year in tuition at Santa Clara University in California make it a good case for aid.

The Palestinian youngster launched a series of missiles at officers.<n>He raced back to safety after launching the assault in the northern West Bank.<n>Violent clashes erupted as Palestinians marked Palestinian Prisoners Day.<n>Israeli forces used tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse the crowd.

Lisa Courtney, 26, has spent most of her life collecting Pokemon memorabilia.<n>Her mother had to move to the smallest room in the house to make room.<n>Lisa's fixation with the characters started at the age of nine.

Justin Jackson 'posed as a host of celebrities to get free goods and jobs'<n>He 'tricked a jeweler into lending him Madonna's jewelry worth $2.4m'<n>He'sent forged letters recommending him for jobs at luxury hotels'<n>Oprah and her network OWN are suing him over the alleged schemes.

Delroy Facey allegedly offered non-league player £2,000 to fix a match.<n>He is also alleged to have told a contact that some teams would 'do' a game.<n>Facey, 34, played for Hull City and West Bromwich Albion in the Premier League.<n>He is accused of conspiring with Moses Swaibu and others to commit bribery.

Shannon Dooley, 30, has founded 'Retrosweat' aerobics class.<n>Inspired by the era of old-school VHS workouts made famous by Jane Fonda.<n>Class has 12 dance tracks and Dooley mixes them up each week.<n>Described as 'freestyle aerobic workout' with a twist.

Anti-fungal agent miconazole and the steroid clobetasol restored movement to mice paralysed by a rodent version of multiple sclerosis.<n>In laboratory tests, they prompted inactive mouse and human stem cells to regenerate myelin, the protective insulation-like coating around nerve fibres.<n>Scientists are confident this can be solved, but have warned patients not to jump the gun by using the drugs prematurely.

Ukip has reduced the number of constituencies where it is concentrating resources as it loses ground in the polls.<n>Party strategist said'something extraordinary' would now need to happen for it to win in places outside its target list.<n>Mr Farage said party could go on to win 'dozens of seats' in the election.

Married father-of-one Maajid Nawaz asked for two private sessions.<n>The prospective parliamentary candidate attempted to touch her arms and thighs.<n>Staff said Nawaz had been pestering the girl all night.

Nicholas and Kseniya Soukeras are having a baby in August.<n>Kseniya wants to name her child Michael, after her late father, while Nicholas prefers the name Spyridon.<n>The couple has turned to the public to help them settle their disagreement.

David Adam Pate from Lancaster, North Carolina, lured Ricky James into some woods with wine in November 2013.<n>He told his mother he enjoyed knifing him 39 times.<n>The 25-year-old serial criminal, who pleaded guilty to the murder on Thursday, told police he just wanted to 'cut his dad gum head off'<n>He blamed the victim for the murder, saying: 'It was his fault'<n>James's two brothers described him as the 'devil' during the sentencing hearing.

Grey seals have been spotted feasting on harbour porpoises off the coast of Wales.<n>The footage was shot by a wildlife cruise company off the coast of Pembrokeshire.<n>Scientists said seals may have developed a taste for porpoises after sampling some caught in fishing nets.<n>They have been seen attacking and killing medium-sized blue sharks.

Alfred Guy Vuozzo, 46, shot dead Brent McGuigan, 68, and son, Brendon, 39.<n>Killed them because they were related to driver who killed his sister in 1970.<n>Cathy Vuozzo, nine, was killed in crash on Prince Edward Island by Herbert.<n> Herbert, who was driving, received nine-month sentence for dangerous driving.<n>On Monday, Vuozzo was sentenced to life in prison for double-murder.<n>As he was led from courtroom, he screamed: 'You've sentenced me to life and I sent them to death'<n>Judge called brutal double

Consortium made the discovery during test drilling in a well near Gatwick.<n>UK Oil & Gas Investments said the site was 'world class' and had the potential for'significant daily oil production' at this proposed drilling site.<n>Experts warned only a fraction of the Weald Basin oil may be accessible for extraction.<n>They also claimed fracking could be required to retrieve significant volumes.

Wak alarm is affixed to the wall behind the bed and sends a beam of light.<n>It sends a beam of light and sound to each person in bed individually.<n>Device creates a ‘personal sunrise’ and emits ultrasonic waves.<n>It works with a phone app that's used to differentiate between sleepers.<n>The alarm clock is hoping to raise $100,000 (£63,00) on Kickstarter.

Ryan Wray, 26, was formally charged with second-degree felony forcible sexual abuse on Friday.<n>He was the president of the Pi Kappa Alpha chapter at USU.<n>Wray faces up to 15 years in prison if he is convicted.
If you're after wild life, a British safari is extraordinarily rewarding.<n>Dolphins are the miracle mammals of Cardigan Bay, Wales.<n>Ospreys have returned to Rutland Water, near Oakham, Rutland.

Wandsworth council is set to remove rule giving automatic place to siblings.<n>Rule will be removed from September 2016 in a bid to make process fairer.<n>Families who move more than 800 metres from preferred school will lose automatic entitlement to a place for younger brothers and sisters.<n>More than 80,000 children face missing out on their preferred primary school.<n>More than 20,000 are at risk of being denied any of their preferred choices.

Yazidi girl, 9, was held captive by Isis for nearly a year.<n>She was'sexually abused by 10 men' while in captivity, aid workers say.<n>Was taken to Germany, where she is now receiving medical care.<n>Comes after 216 Yazidi prisoners were released near Kirkuk, northern Iraq.
Amy Hughes, 26, ran 53 marathons in 53 days last year.<n>Smashed the world record of 1,388 miles.<n>Runs into new love after getting close to support crew member.

The anonymous donor sent the money to Bath Abbey in a plain brown envelope.<n>They said they wanted to help safeguard the church 'for the next hundred years'<n>Church is aiming to raise £20million to repair the collapsing floor.

Jessica Bialek was last seen leaving her home in Coogee, south-eastern Sydney, about 8.30am on Wednesday.<n>Her husband, Sabino Matera, confirmed she was home shortly after 6:30pm on Thursday.<n>Police have confirmed Ms Bialek returned home, and she is now speaking with officers about her disappearance.<n>Her father Michael Bialek had just flown in from Melbourne to front media to appeal for information.

Julia Van Herck, 42, from Fulham, West London, ballooning to 23 stone.<n>Mother-of-three gained weight after suffering post-natal depression.<n>She wore a size 26 to size 28 and would comfort eat tubs of ice-cream.<n>She would also stash treats away in hidden places so her family wouldn't know.<n>She underwent surgery after contracting pneumonia in 2012.<n>Now weighs a healthy 11 stone and is a size 12.

Pete Evans has shared two incredible stories on social media.<n>One woman claims she no longer suffers multiple sclerosis.<n>The other woman says she is much healthier after following the Paleo diet.<n>The celebrity chef has been a proud Paleo advocate.

The map was created by writer Levi Pearson using a UFO sighting dataset from the National UFO Reporting Centre.<n>It begins in 1933 with the first UFO sightings over California and Nebraska in the US, the UK and France in Europe, and locations in Japan and Australia.<n>The number of sightings increases dramatically between the 1940s and the 1960s across the world, according to the map.<n>Explanations for UFO sightings are just as vague as for aliens themselves, and could be down to the development of drones and new aircraft technologies.

St. Louis Blues forward Ryan Reaves pulled out his own tooth after being checked into the glass by Chicago Blackhawks defenseman Brent Seabrook.<n>Reaves sat on the bench as he calmly pulled out the tooth and it eventually fell into his hand.<n>The Blues beat the Blackhawks 2-1 on Sunday, moving them to the top of the Central Division standings.

The Hyalinobatrachium dianae was found in the mountains of eastern Costa Rica.<n>It has a distinctive call and its abdomen is see-though, making its organs visible.<n>The animal’s heart, liver and gastrointestinal tract are easily visible.<n>It's distinguishable from other glass frogs by its long toes and black and white eyes, but it's likely the frog uses it to find a mate in the mountain forests.

Doug Hughes, 61, landed his aircraft on the West Lawn of the U.S. Capitol last Wednesday to protest corruption in Congress.<n>He is currently under house arrest in Florida as he awaits a hearing to determine if he will go on trial for crossing a no-fly zone.<n>His daughter Kathy Hughes said on Monday that she is 'downright proud' of her father.

Stephanie Scott, 26, was last seen at a Woolworths supermarket at Leeton on Easter Sunday afternoon.<n>The drama and English teacher was due to marry her partner of five years on Saturday.<n>Police have launched a state-wide search for the teacher.<n>She was last seen at her workplace, Leeton High School, at about 11am.<n>Ms Scott could be travelling in a red Mazda 3 sedan with registration BZ-19-CD.

Yazidi women and girls as young as eight have been abducted by ISIS.<n>They have been forced into marriage and repeatedly raped, study says.<n>One child interviewed said she was 'owned' and raped by seven men.<n>Study by Human Rights Watch collected the accounts of 20 women and girls.

HSBC announced 1.99 per cent interest rate on a five-year fix.<n>Experts said it was the cheapest ever deal of its kind.<n>Move expected to trigger flood of rate cuts by other banks and building societies.

Isis was deemed inappropriate and removed from the hurricane list.<n>As the name of an ancient goddess of Egypt, Isis had been on list.<n>ISIS is also used to describe the Islamic State militant group.<n>The group stands accused of committing brutal atrocities against civilians.

The trio were chosen from 5,700 hopefuls for the TV competition.<n>They were given a tour of the service's London HQ and met the director general.<n>The'spy school' was set up in the offices of KPMG in Manchester.

YouTuber Dave Hax’s clever solution does away with peelers.<n>Instead, boiling water does all the hard work, leaving the skin intact.<n>The method was uploaded only five days ago and has already received 1.5m views.

Researchers at Hadassah Medical School in Jerusalem found pregnancy helps regenerate tissue.<n>Found in young, non-pregnant mice, 82 per cent of the liver had regenerated after two days.<n>In older, pregnant mice around 96 per cent had regenerated after two days, better than the non-pregnant rodents both young and old.

MailOnline investigation reveals Asiatic black bears are dying at rate of two a day.<n>More than 700 of the animals have been butchered in the past year alone.<n>Farmers claim the bears are dying from disease and old age.<n>But sources say owners are killing them to 'extract the last ounce of blood'<n>They are then sold to make Chinese medicine, sources say.<n>The paws, meat and gall bladders of the'moon bears' are sold for £625 a bear.

Governor Jerry Brown has imposed unprecedented water-use restrictions in the face of the state's historic drought.<n>Many residents are turning to techniques that utilize so-called 'gray water'<n>These techniques include the toilet that doubles as a sink and used washing machine water used to water fruit trees.

Emma Hannigan was diagnosed with the faulty BRCA1 gene in 2005.<n>This increases a woman's chance of getting breast cancer by 85 per cent.<n>She opted to have a double mastectomy and oophorectomy the following year.<n>But despite the drastic surgery, the 42-year-old was diagnosed with breast cancer.<n>She has battled the disease nine times in the last seven years.<n>Mrs Hannigan is now undergoing chemotherapy every three weeks.

Nadine Crooks, 33, was told she was infertile after having her fourth child.<n>She stopped taking contraceptives after learning she had polycystic ovary syndrome.<n>She fell pregnant for a fifth time last November.<n>The triplets will be siblings to her four children.

Students at McGuffey High School in Pennsylvania held a so-called Anti-Gay Day protest last Thursday.<n>The event was a reaction to the previous day's Day Of Silence event for bullied LBGT pupils.<n>Students report that LBGT pupils were physically bullied and Bible verses were pinned to lockers.<n>The organizers of the anti-gay movement have promised further clothing-related protests this week including wearing orange.

Ed Sheeran surprised a fan in hospital for her birthday after she had to give up her tickets to his concert when she was diagnosed with cancer.<n>The British singer, who is currently touring New Zealand, took time out of his schedule over the weekend to help Jess Knight celebrate her 20th birthday.<n>Ms Knight launched a social media campaign to catch Sheeran's attention and beg him to visit her in hospital.

The robot, named BB-8, took to the stage at Star Wars Celebration convention in Anaheim, California.<n>It ran rings around retro droid R2-D2 on its spherical body, leaving spectators applauding.<n>Director JJ Abrams confirmed that a real robot was used during filming, but did not reveal how it works.

Zachary Davis, now 17, is on trial for the murder of his mother Melanie Davis, 46, in August 2012.<n>He bludgeoned her skull 12 times as she slept and then set their Tennessee home ablaze.<n>On Tuesday, a court heard how Davis, now 17, laughed as he killed his mother in August 2012, leaving her bloodied and unrecognizable before fleeing.<n>He is charged with first-degree murder, attempted first-degree murder and aggravated arson.<n>He told police he killed his mother because she knew he had been raped by his older brother Josh.

The ship belonged to King Kamehameha II, aka Liholiho, the second king of Hawaii.<n>It was sunk by a hurricane off Kauai in April 1824.<n>The ship cost $50,000 to build and was considered the first luxury ocean-going yacht in the United States.<n>The treasures will be displayed at the Kauai Museum.

Sir David Nicholson warned Labour's plans will not provide enough cash.<n>He refused to resign over Mid Staffs scandal which led to 1,200 deaths.<n>Labour has paid lip service to the plan, promising just £2.5billion.

Adventurer, author, broadcaster and writer Ben Fogle is a regular at Martinhal.<n>Martinhal Beach Resort is renowned as one of the best in the Algarve for a luxury family holiday.<n>It is the only five-star resort in the area to have direct access to a beach.

Nigel Short, 49, said women weren't suited to chess because it required logical thinking.<n>He said women should accept they were 'hard-wired very differently'<n>Mr Short was the first English player to play a World Chess Championship match.<n>Critics immediately pointed out that he lost a high-profile game against a woman grandmaster.

Flight Lieutenant Stephen Beaumont took teddy with him on every flight.<n>He believed Beaumont Bear brought him luck in the Battle of Britain.<n>The bear, named Beaumont Bear, is expected to sell for £10,000.

Mary Kay Letourneau was arrested for raping her student, Vili Fualaau, in 1997 after falling pregnant with his child.<n>The couple, who have two teenage daughters, spoke about the affair with Barbara Walters on the eve of their 10th wedding anniversary.<n>They met when Fualaau was in her second grade class and she taught him again in sixth grade.

The app was developed by US company Visual Health Solutions Inc.<n>It uses algorithms to calculate what you would look like if you lost weight.<n>Users are shown an original and a slimmer version, with a slider.<n>The makers say it uses algorithms which show the effects of weight loss more effectively than other apps which stretch or pinch images.

When a virus enters our bodies, certain class of immune cells - the T cells0 - jump into action, spreading rapidly.<n>But a week can pass before these T cells start to take their toll.<n>If the immune cells lack repair enzyme Gpx4, the T cells die off as they divide.<n>This means the immune system becomes weak and the infection can be chronic.<n>Researchers have shown that higher doses of vitamin E found in foods such as kale and almonds, can mitigate the stress on immune cells.

Hillary Clinton's armored Chevy van, nicknamed 'Scooby,' stopped in Le Claire, Iowa on Tuesday.<n>The former secretary of state sipped coffee and talked with a panel of six at a local coffee house.<n>On Monday she stopped at an Ohio Chipotle for lunch.<n>She left without being engaged by anyone other than a cashier.<n>The Chipotle manager told Daily Mail Online that 'it's true nobody recognized her'

Mohammed Waqar, 23, and Mohammed Siddique, 60, accused of assaulting youngster.<n>Allegedly assaulted youngster at UK Islamic Mission Jamia Mosque in Birmingham.<n>It's alleged he was slapped repeatedly for mistakes in his studies.<n>It's claimed on one occasion he suffered a black eye.

Just over 60 per cent of Americans believe global warming is happening.<n>Nearly half blame humans for the change, according to a Yale University survey.<n>But opinions on global warming vary wildly between states, local communities, and congressional districts.<n>People in California are far more worried about the warming planet than those in parts of the central US.<n>Concern about climate change ranges from a low of 39 per cent in King County to a high of 61 per cent in Travis County.

Nikki Balovich had taken off her diamond-encrusted silver ring as she was pregnant and her fingers were swollen.<n>When she couldn't find it, she suspected their 90-pound baby mastiff Halli had swallowed it up.<n>Half a year later, she saw a Facebook post saying a wedding ring had been found in an 'unusual place'

Marisa Curlen, 20, a sophomore at James Madison University in Virginia, was found unresponsive in her room at the sorority house.<n>Police were awaiting the results of an autopsy to determine the exact cause of death, but they said there was no evidence to suggest foul play.<n>It could take up to three months to find out what the college sophomore had in her system the night she died.<n>Marisa Curlen became the third member of Rye High School's 2013 graduating class to die in less than a year.

Davion Navar Henry Only, 16, has been stuck in the foster system since the day his mother gave birth to him behind bars.<n>In 2013 he made a plea in front of a Florida church congregation for a family to 'love him forever'<n>He was adopted by a minister in Ohio but sent back into the system after fighting with one of the minister's children.<n>His case worker, Connie Bell Going, has now adopted him after he was sent back into the system after just three months.

Delonte Martistee, 22, and Ryan Calhoun, 23, have been suspended from Troy University in Alabama.<n>The two were arrested this week after police uncovered cellphone footage of the two of them assaulting an unconscious girl at a beach.<n>The video allegedly shows hundreds of people gathered around the girl as the men violate her while she lays on a beach chair.<n>The unidentified victim believes she was drugged before the incident.<n>Police are still searching for two additional suspects in the case and additional arrests are expected.

Nasa has released an infographic detailing the various worlds of our solar system suspected to have subsurface oceans.<n>Nine other worlds in total are now suspected to have some form of subsurface ocean containing far more water than is on Earth.<n>Agency claims we could find life on one of these worlds in the next ten or 20 years.

ISIS has intensified its offensive on the Iraqi city of Ramadi.<n>Iraqi forces have been assisted by coalition air strikes.<n>More than 2,000 families have fled the city.<n>The Iraqi city was once the scene of some of the most bloody battles against U.S. forces during the 2003 Iraq war.

Manchester Airport was forced to temporarily suspend flights today.<n>All flights were halted for about 20 minutes after the potential drone sighting.<n>Police helicopter scoured the area shortly after 11:30am.<n>No evidence that a drone was operating in air space used by airliners.

Letter from White Star Lines to brother of James Moody, who died on board.<n>Tells him the family will have to pay to return his body to Scarborough home.<n>Demands £20 - almost £2,000 in today's money - to transport remains.<n>Mr Moody, 24, died after the Titanic hit an iceberg on its maiden voyage in 1912.

Andras Janos Vass, 25, lured men to the U.S. with the promise of easy work.<n>He then kept them captive in New York City and Miami, Florida.<n>He took their passports and threatened their families, prosecutors said.<n>He faces a maximum sentence of 155 years in prison.

Kendall Schler crept onto the St. Louis marathon course after the last checkpoint and didn't record any of her times electronically along the way.<n>She claims to have removed both the magnetic strips meant to record her times from her race and since no photographs of her were taken along the way there is no proof she is the rightful winner.<n>Her finish time that qualified her to run in Monday's Boston Marathon has now been erased, and her spot in the event has been vacated.<n>Her third-place finish last year also was wiped out after officials couldn't find evidence that she crossed any of that event

Internal report reveals that heavily-militarized guard referred to protesters as 'enemy forces'<n>Guardmen described some as 'enemy forces' including the KKK, the RgB Black Rebels and the New Black Panther Party.<n>Activists in the Missouri suburb were also known as 'adversaries', according to the report.<n>Guard supervisors were worried about how they were being viewed by the public and asked guardsmen to tone down the heavily militarized language.

Cristina Coria, a stay-at-home mom, saw an ad for a blue 2003 Chevy Stepside bed.<n>She arranged to meet the man with her husband at a gas station parking lot.<n>The seller showed up and Coria and her husband stalled him while waiting for police to arrive.<n>Police arrived after a wait Coria said approached two hours and arrested the man.

Swiss scientists say anaesthetic gases have been rising in concentration.<n>They are 2,500 times more potent than carbon dioxide and can store more energy from the sun than carbon dioxide.<n>The gases are also more potent than the greenhouse gases in CO2.

Researchers from Lancaster University screened all seven Harry Potter novels.<n>They selected 120 passages from each of the books and scanned the brains of people reading these passages.<n>In each case, the emotional connotations of the passages were at the start and the emotional contents were unambiguous and consistent.<n>Using a magnetic resonance imaging scanner, each participant rated the passages on a scale of -3 for very negative to +3 for very positive, and arousal.
Four men accused of stabbing Mozambican to death in Johannesburg.<n>Images of brutal attack were published across the world the following day.<n>Government has sent in troops to control the riots.

Almond growers in California are at the centre of a row over water usage.<n>State supplies more than three-quarters of the world's $4.93billion almond market.<n>California is in its fourth year of drought, and residents are angry.<n>Petition has been launched demanding Nestle seizes production of bottled water.

Graham Palmer, 52, has been delivering rhymes since Christmas last year.<n>He even customises the couplets according to the stations his train is passing through.<n>The local hero says the poems are not clever but are 'all a bit of fun'

MHOX has designed a range of synthetic eyes that could be available by 2027.<n>The group plan to combine the biological tissue with microscopic wireless technology to provide additional functions.<n>The synthetic eyes include lenses that improve the image sharpness and can put filters over the vision.

Atlanta Hawks star Thabo Sefolosha was wrestled to the ground by NYPD officers.<n>Was left with a broken leg and torn ligaments after being grabbed by officers.<n>Statement says injury has left him in 'great pain' and 'was caused by police'<n>Added that he is 'extremely disappointed' and will be 'digging for his teammates'

Stocks of the influenza vaccine are arriving a month later than expected.<n>Scientists have included protection against H3N2 and B/Phuket.<n>There was a spike in deaths related to the two strains in Europe and the US.<n>High-risk groups will be able to access free, government-funded flu shots from April 20.

The app was introduced in February as a'safer' place for kids to explore videos because it was restricted to 'family-focused content'<n>But consumer activists say the app is so stuffed with advertisements and product placements that it's hard to tell the difference between entertainment and commercials.<n>In a statement, YouTube said: 'We strongly disagree with their contentions, including the suggestion that no free, ad-supported experience for kids will ever be acceptable'

Dallas nurse Nina Pham contracted Ebola while caring for Thomas Eric Duncan, the first U.S. patient to die from the deadly disease.<n>Pham, who remains employed at Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital Dallas but has not returned to work, seeks unspecified damages in her lawsuit.<n>A hospital spokesman said the company and the hospital acted responsibly to protect their employees.<n>A doctor on October 16 videotaped Pham, who was in a hospital bed, in images later made public.

David Cameron reveals eldest daughter Nancy likens him to Phil Dunphy.<n>The embarrassing dad from US sitcom Modern Family is played by Ty Burrell.<n>11-year-old Nancy has taken to using the putdown 'That is SO Phil Dunphy'<n>Prime Minister admits the comparison is 'not great' with even his fashion.

Cindy Santamaria-Williams, of Stroudsburg, Pennsylvania is covered in bruises and has a broken eye socket.<n>She says she shushed three girls in the dark theater during Fast and Furious 7 because they were cursing loudly.<n>Police are on the hunt for the teenagers and said that they will face assault charges if caught.

Tyrus Byrd, 40, was sworn in as mayor of Parma, Missouri, last week.<n>Her election victory was overshadowed by the departure of the majority of the city's police force, city attorney, clerk and water treatment supervisor.<n>Outgoing mayor Randall Ramsey says the officials all cited'safety concerns' in their resignation letters.<n>Mrs Byrd told Daily Mail Online she still doesn't know why the employees quit.

The Dark Tower is the first of eight novels by the writer.<n>It was originally planned to be made into a movie and TV series.<n>Warner Brothers dropped the project in 2012.<n>But now Sony has announced it will be made into a film.<n>Javier Bardem and Russell Crowe are still rumored to be in the running.

The Wonderland House in Brighton sleeps up to 24, with tea party sets, Queen of Heart themed bunk beds.<n>The Looking Glass Cottage is a more traditional property with a dining room set inspired by the book.<n> Jacqueline Martin, 37, designed the incredible house in less than a year, sourcing the materials online from other countries.

Young Thai boy holds onto a tiny blue and yellow fishing rod.<n>He approaches the water and reels rapidly, but it is not clear if he has hooked anything.<n>As it splashes about, the youngster plucks it out and proudly lifts it up.<n>But experts say it is most likely a Nile Tilapia, which can be caught for 8p each.

Reddit users have been comparing the best punishments their parents did.<n>Many of the schemes are both hilarious and genius.<n>One mother used her son's naughty behaviour as a cheap means to improve her house.

Marilyn Zuniga, a teacher at Forest Street School in Orange, New Jersey, has been suspended without pay.<n>She had her third graders write letters to Mumia Abu-Jamal wishing him well after he was hospitalized last week.<n>The teacher did not seek approval from administrators or parents.<n>Abu-Jamal, who is serving life behind bars for the 1981 murder of a Philadelphia police officer, has since been released from hospital.

Zella Jackson Price, 76, was told shortly after giving birth that her baby had died.<n>But the infant was still alive and had been given up for adoption.<n>Melanie Diane Gilmore, 49, has been reunited with her mother after 49 years.<n>Her children helped her find her mother through a name given to Gilmore through her adoptive parents.

A proposed ban on alcohol in Indonesia could deter Australians from holidaying in Bali.<n>The number of Australians visiting Bali over the past two months was up 16.7 per cent from the same period last year.<n>Indonesia Institute president Ross Taylor says the fate of Bali Nine drug smugglers is probably third on the list of concerns.

Shadow chancellor refused to rule out a five-point rise in corporation tax.<n>Also evasive about the 40p rate of income tax, saying he was unsure how quickly the threshold could be raised.<n>Main rate has been brought down from 28 per cent to 21 per cent.

Collective doggy wedding was billed the first of its kind to be held in China.<n>The 42 pooches were led up the aisle by their owners to ‘exchange vows’<n>Canine couples arrived in BMW convertibles and stretch Hummer limousines.<n>One owner said she was moved by the scene and the outfits.

Cleopatra was known for her love of perfume.<n>Applying lotus and rose oil to her upper lip was a popular way to increase her powers of seduction.<n>Perfume experts claim certain scents make women seem younger.

Morrissey has written a letter to Australian retailer The Just Group.<n> imploring them to stop using angora wool.<n>The Just Group own Just Jeans, Portmans, Dotti, Peter Alexander, Jacqui E, and Jay Jays.<n>The singer will be performing four sold-out shows at the Sydney Opera House.<n>He will post petitions for concertgoers to sign at information booths.

Stefan Stoykov, 18, moved to US from Bulgaria as an eight-year-old.<n>He could not speak English and joined Nora Elementary School in Indiana.<n>Brown, Columbia, Cornell, Dartmouth, Harvard, Penn, Yale and Princeton have all come knocking.<n>He is a senior at North Central High School in Indianapolis, Indiana.<n>He is also valedictorian and secured a perfect SAT score.

Jalin Smith-Walker, 19, is wanted by police after video of her running over a rival with her car in a street fight emerged this week.<n>The incident happened in Muskegon, Michigan on Monday evening.<n>Police have an arrest warrant out for her in connection to the fight, but as of Thursday morning they are still attempting to locate the young woman.<n>In December, Smith-Walker was arrested for dragging a mall security guard several feet when he tried to stop her on suspicion of shoplifting.
The @BarbieStyle Instagram account has more than 730,000 followers.<n>The account's creators have been invited to attend fashion weeks to model Barbie's latest looks.

Loneliness is often associated with elderly people who feel isolated.<n>But new report reveals it is in fact younger people who feel more lonely.<n>More than 80 per cent of young people feel lonely at some point.<n>Chloe Jackson, 19, from Norfolk, said Facebook makes her feel lonely.

Bill originally included language that prohibited companies from discriminating against customers based on sexual orientation or gender identity.<n>Republican Sen. Jason Smalley rewrote the bill to allow drivers to set their own policies.

Tory Defence Secretary Michael Fallon leads ferocious assault on Labour leader.<n>Claims Miliband cannot be trusted not to sell out in 'grubby' deal with SNP.<n>Survey also suggests three-quarters of Labour election candidates oppose Trident.<n>Nick Boles, a close ally of David Cameron, goes further, claiming the Russian president would be pleased to see Mr Miliband enter Downing Street propped up by SNP leader Nicola Sturgeon.

Ophelia Conant was left hanging by her neck as she tried to climb out of cot.<n>Her mother Louise Conant was watching her on a baby monitor at the time.<n>Phillip Dickens, who supplied the beds, was fined £50,000 today.<n>He was given a suspended prison sentence at Amersham Crown Court.

Money expert Michelle Hutchison says there are easy ways to improve the look and feel of your home.<n>She says going to the local hardware store and buying a few tins of paint can make a world of difference in just a few hours.<n>'Get your kids involved, and fix those things that have been broken forever,' she said.

Hattie Gladwell, 19, blogs about her experience of living with an ostomy bag after she underwent emergency surgery for ulcerative colitis.<n>She has called for the new Tips From Former Smokers ad, commissioned by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, to be banned.<n>The advert features Julia, 58, of Mississippi who smoked for more than 20 years before she developed colon cancer at 49 years old.<n>The 30 second ad features her warning smokers that she has to use an ostomy bag taped to a hole in her abdomen as a consequence of smoking.

Robin Esser has worked in national newspapers for 60 years.<n>His best stories are from his days as editor of the William Hickey gossip column in the Daily Express.<n>Essar describes a lunch with an Express editor, during which they drank champagne, a goblet of dry sherry, a bottle of Chablis, two bottles of claret, a couple of Cognacs and, finally, several bottles of claret.

Argentina has accused three British oil firms of working without permission.<n>Philip Hammond pledged to protect the Falklands from 'Argentinian bullying'<n>Comes after president Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner's provocative speech.

Jo Burston, 43, is the founder of leading technology services firm Job Capital.<n>The company turned over $40 million in its first four years.<n>She has now started eight companies and caught the attention of Richard Branson.

Man was found in the streets of Gniezno in western Poland in February.<n>He told police that he has no memory of who he is or where he is from.<n>He has remained in a psychiatric unit but his memory has not returned.<n>Polish police have released images of the man in the hope someone recognises him.

Keith MacDonald, 29, has sired a massive brood with at least ten mothers.<n>He was set to become a father for the sixteenth time but has split.<n>MacDonald, of County Durham, says he's back on the dating market.<n>He said: 'There is no baby - it's not mine and I'm single now'

Victims of crime in some areas are waiting up to 50 per cent longer for help.<n>The average response time has increased by an extra two minutes.<n>Labour's Yvette Cooper said victims were being put at risk by cuts.<n>The number of police officers in England and Wales has fallen by 17,000.<n>The Home Office dismissed the criticism claiming crime levels are falling.

Freddie Gray, 27, died Sunday after he 'had his spine 80 percent severed at his neck' following his arrest last Sunday.<n>The alleged violation that led to Gray's arrest has not been disclosed.<n> Civilian video showed him being loaded into a police van, but did not show the entire encounter.<n>Gray suffered a broken vertebra and an injured voice box.

Dennis Sears changed his will to leave everything to live-in home help.<n>He disinherited his surviving relatives who had been intended beneficiaries.<n>Family claimed carer exploited 'vulnerable' childless widower.<n>But mother-of-one insists Mr Sears had change of heart after falling out.

The Project was promoting their upcoming interview with US comedian Michael Che.<n>They accidentally used two clips of another comic Jay Pharoah.<n>Waleed Aly apologised for the embarrassing mistake, admitting 'we stuffed up'<n>Pharaoh shared viewers’ tweets about the blunder on his own account.

The oceans are still so little-explored that billionaires are buying vessels to explore.<n>The OrcaSub allows you to explore up to 2,000ft below the surface.<n>Migaloo can dive 820ft and has a helipad.

Omura's whale was discovered on a remote Exmouth beach in WA.<n>It is the first sighting of the species in WA and only the second in Australia.<n>The 5.68m juvenile female was at first difficult for Department of Parks and Wildlife staff, who eventually confirmed it was an Omura's whale.<n>The species is usually found in Indonesian waters, the Philippines and the Sea of Japan.

The general election is just over two weeks away.<n>But it's also bought with it a bizarre batch of merchandise.<n>From David Cameron shot glasses to UKIP pendents.<n>Some of the items can be purchased on the official party websites.

Maya Pindeus and Johanna Pichlbauer created the Beautification machine.<n>The robot uses a crank to apply lipstick and an eyeliner applicator.<n>Visitors to an exhibition in France were filmed trying it out.

Robert Ewing, 60, accused of murdering 15-year-old Paige Chivers in 2007.<n>He allegedly had 'inappropriate sexual interest' in schoolgirl before killing.<n>Called police two weeks before disappearance to see how they would react.<n>Paige vanished after a row with her father at their seaside home in Blackpool.<n>Ewing is on trial at Preston Crown Court and denies murder.

Erica Ginnetti, 35, pleaded guilty to institutional sexual assault and disseminating sexually explicit materials to a minor.<n>Montgomery County Court Judge Garrett D. Page reportedly asked 'What young man would not jump on that candy?' before sentencing her.<n>Ginneti will serve 30 days in jail, 60 on house arrest, three years probation and register as a sex offender for 25 years.

All three major political parties have backed calls for an inquiry.<n>The head of the Royal College of Nursing said nurses who had faced five years of pay freezes would struggle to comprehend the six per cent pay rise for their bosses.<n>Patient groups said the packages were indefensible when patients were seeing spiralling waiting times and cuts to routine procedures.

Dave Heeley, 57, ran the gruelling challenge over six days.<n>Father-of-three battled through sand dunes, dried river beds and rocks.<n>Temperatures in the desert can reach 50 degrees during the day.<n>Heeley hopes to raise more than £30,000 for charity.

Deputy Labour leader refuses to rule out above-inflation increases in taxes.<n>She said the party would put up the top rate of tax and not increase insurance rates.<n>George Osborne said remarks showed Labour would bring back the ‘fuel duty escalator’, which raised the levy by the level of inflation plus 1p per litre.

There are now 120 confirmed HIV cases and 10 preliminary positive cases tied to Scott County, about 30 miles north of Louisville, Kentucky.<n>That's up from 106 last week, said the Indiana State Department of Health.<n>Health officials who declared an epidemic last month have said they expect the number of cases to rise as more people are tested.<n>The growing number could put pressure on Pence to extend the 30-day needle exchange program that he approved on March 26.

Bill and Denise Richard wrote an op-ed in the Boston Globe on Tuesday, the two-year anniversary of their son Martin's death.<n>They asked that convicted terrorist Dzhokhar Tsarnaev be spared the death penalty so that they can finally get closure on the darkest chapter of their lives.<n>The penalty phase of the trial starts next week, when the jury will decide whether to sentence Tsarnaev to death or life in prison without parole.
Gemma, 34, unveiled her latest collection at Evans in Manchester.<n>The Only Way Is Essex star has expanded her plus-size range.<n>Gemma says she loves her curves and believes in embracing them.

Friends found Noelle Baynham's body after she failed to answer the door.<n>She was partially eaten by her Jack Russell and Staffordshire Bull Terrier.<n>The dogs are thought to have tried to wake her before becoming desperate.<n>Coroner records a verdict of accidental overdose at inquest.

Puno is higher than any Alpine ski resort and is known for its fiestas.<n>Lake Titicaca is the city's most famous - and most beautiful - landmark.<n>The Yavari gunboat was built in London in 1862 and transported across the Andes.

Eight-inch leather dildo with wooden head found during dig in Gdansk, Poland.<n>Archaeologists discovered swords at the site leading them to suspect the place was once a school of swordsmanship.<n>The artifact has now been taken away for preservation work.

Parking charges topped list of most-loathed fees and charges, poll finds.<n>48 per cent of people said they should be free, while 31 per cent said they are too high.<n>A total of 15 per cent said they are often hidden and 31 per cent said they are too high.<n> ATM cash withdrawal fees and debit and credit card surcharges for booking items such as air travel also feature.
