Teenager from Mossley, Greater Manchester, wanted to obtain abrin online.<n>He was caught after an investigation was launched by the North West counter-terrorism unit in January.<n>He pleaded guilty to trying to buy the toxin at Manchester Youth Court.<n>He will be sentenced later this month for the offence.

USS Theodore Roosevelt among 12 ships deployed to waters off Yemen.<n>Fears raised by presence of Iranian cargo vessels in the country.<n>Saudi-led coalition is helping Yemen's government fight off Houthis.<n>At least 20 killed in fresh bombing raids on capital Sana'a today.

Boy was dragged from scene of attack in Jalalabad, Afghanistan, after bomb exploded.<n>35 people were killed and 125 injured in the suicide bomb attack on Saturday.<n>Group were waiting to receive their monthly salaries when explosive-laden motorcycle detonated.<n>Islamic State has claimed responsibility for the attack, President Ghani said.

Pumpkin seed oil is being touted as the next superfood.<n>Nutrients and minerals can help strengthen hair and even help boost hair growth.<n>Can also help renew skin and help with menopausal symptoms.<n>Gwyneth Paltrow is a fan and uses it in her recipes.

Knightsbridge flat has just three years left on the lease and is in dire need of renovation.<n>But the property is on sale for a fraction of the price of neighbouring homes.<n>It boasts three bedrooms, two bathrooms, a reception room and utility room along with a lift, parking and a communal garden.<n>But if any buyer decides to extend the lease, the property could be worth upwards of £6 million.

Jourdan and Naomi, 44, model Burberry's new eyewear range.<n>Pair first teamed up for brand's spring/summer 2015 campaign.<n>Model the new frames inspired by gabardine, a fabric invented by Thomas Burberry.

Jia Huaijin, 33, now hand-makes swords in rural China.<n>He makes the razor sharp swords with steel that is 3mm thick.<n>The ancient art of sword making gradually declined over the years.<n>Mr Jia made the drastic change in career five years ago at the age of 28.

Abdul Hadi Arwani, 48, was found slumped in a Volkswagen Passat with wounds to his chest on a street in Wembley on Tuesday morning.<n>The father of six was a fierce critic of president Bashar al-Assad.<n>Friends say he may have been assassinated by the governing regime in Syria.<n>Metropolitan Police counter-terrorism officers are now leading the inquiry.

The offspring of some of Sydney's style set have been front and centre at the presentations of Ellery, Alice McCall and Maticevski.<n>The Beckhams and Kardashians have both attended Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week.<n>Style blogger Hass Murad and PR maven Roxy Jacenko were both pictured with their mini-me's this week.<n>Camilla Freeman-Topper brought her daughter along to the Ten Pieces show at Bondi Icebergs on Thursday.

Usually we would still be eating vegetables imported from Spain and South America.<n>But thanks to endless days of sun and temperatures we would not expect until August.<n>Waitrose announced yesterday the early arrival of its first British tomatoes.<n>Strawberries are also already on the shelves - far earlier than normal.

Janek Zylinski posted the challenge online after declaring he had 'had enough'<n>Prince is the son of Polish war hero who fought the Nazis in 1939.<n>He says he has had enough of the discrimination against immigrants.<n>Mr Zylinski says he would like to meet Farage in Hyde Park with their swords.

Labour leader says the bobby on the beat is 'at risk of disappearing'<n>Claims rising numbers of serious criminals 'are being let off the hook'<n>But criminal justice plans are overshadowed by police cover-up scandal.<n>Police and crime commissioners would be axed to fund neighbourhood policing.

The converted four-bedroom home on Lawrenny Court in Toorak was built as a garage to service the generous 57-room mansion Homeden.<n>The blackwood and copperlight archway has been tastefully adapted to suit the light-filled property.<n>The original garage doors open into two distinct living areas while the living quarters upstairs offer three sprawling bedrooms with open fireplaces.<n>The property will open its doors to prospective buyers on Wednesday.

Isabelle Obert, a nutrition consultant, believes a diet rich in minerals, vitamins, essential fats and proteins can prepare both a man and a woman for conception.<n>Says sperm and egg health can affect the outcome of the pregnancy.<n>Here, she reveals her top ten foods to boost fertility, plus tips on how to prepare them.

Petri Kurti, 13, murdered Glynis Bensley, 47, as she walked home.<n>He stamped on her face so hard it left a footprint on her cheek.<n>Co-defendant Zoheb Majid, 20, joined in and helped runsack her pockets.<n>The pair left her for dead in a pool of her own blood in Smethwick, West Midlands.<n>Kurti was jailed for 12 years and will be on licence for life.<n>Majid was sentenced to 10 years behind bars for manslaughter.

Jessica Bialek was last seen on Wednesday morning when she left her Coogee home to walk to the bank.<n>Her husband Sabino Matera confirmed her safe on Facebook.<n>He thanked everyone who helped bring his wife home.<n>Ms Bialek is now speaking with police about her disappearance.

Jeremy Clarkson, 55, said being given warning was'most stressful experience'<n>Top Gear presenter said lump on his tongue was 'probably cancer'<n>He said he 'couldn't do that' and was 'beyond-belief stressful'<n>Clarkson was sacked by BBC after 'unprovoked' attack on producer.

Police have released an image of a bearded young man they want to speak to in relation to a suspected arson attack on a Melbourne church.<n>The fire was started at St Mary's Catholic Church in Dandenong, at 2.15am on April 1.<n>The church is said to be the site of child sex attacks perpetrated by now-deceased paedophile Father Kevin O'Donnell.<n>Two other Melbourne Catholic churches were also set alight in March.

Harry was out with his parents in Cambridge on Bank Holiday Monday.<n>He was caught under a cyclist's wheel and dragged along the path.<n>Angela Buckler said cyclist was not paying attention and was 'not bothered'<n>Harry was left with blood pouring from his face and inside his mouth.<n>Police have urged the cyclist to contact them over the incident.

Green leader insists Jim Jepps is a 'private individual not involved in party politics'<n>He ran a blog called The Daily Maybe which appeared to defend 'rape fantasies'<n>Also questioned why teachers with relationships with pupils were put on sex offenders register.

Linda McLean, 56, was in her classroom at Pine Eagle Charter School in Halfway, Oregon in August 2013 when a masked man burst in with a gun.<n>She had no clue it was a drill to test her 'preparedness' or that the gun was loaded with blanks.<n>'You're dead,' the shooter said. 'You're dead'<n>Now, McLean is suing the school district for reparations over the lingering stress she feels.

Stephanie Scott's father has opened up about the grief his family is feeling.<n>The school teacher was murdered just days before her much-anticipated wedding.<n>Robert Scott said it is especially painful that Stephanie's life has been taken away when she had so much to look forward to.<n>Stephanie and her childhood sweetheart Aaron Leeson-Woolley were due to marry on Saturday April 11.<n>The ceremony was due to take place at the Eat Your Greens venue in Eugowra.

Tesla in early 2013 was on the verge of bankruptcy, according to an excerpt of a new biography.<n>Musk proposed that Google buy Tesla for $6 billion and promise an additional $5 billion in factory expansions.<n>He also demanded that he be permitted to run Tesla as a unit of Google for eight years, or until Tesla produced a third-generation car.<n>Google co-founder Larry Page declined to comment on the matter.<n>Tesla's fortunes changed suddenly in May 2013 when the company reported its first profit.<n>The surprisingly good earnings sent Tesla shares rocketing higher and ended the Google negotiations.

Ancient Egyptians, Babylonians, Minoans and Mycenians were all hit by a 'perfect storm' of disasters 3,200 years ago.<n>Droughts, famines, climate change, earthquakes, invasions and internal rebellions left them unable to cope, claims Professor Eric Cline.

Brothers of men convicted of sex offences five times more likely to commit crimes.<n>Sons of fathers with criminal record for sex offending nearly four times more likely to be convicted of such crimes, study found.<n>Biggest study of its kind suggests sex offending could run in family along male genetic line.
Kate T. Parker, from Atlanta, Georgia, was inspired to create her aptly-titled series Strong is the New Pretty.

Tim Tebow hasn't played a snap in the NFL since being cut by the New England Patriots before the 2013 season.<n>The team announced the contract Monday but did not disclose the financial terms of the deal the club reached with the 2007 Heisman Trophy winner.<n>The 6-3, 236-pound Tebow worked out with the Eagles last month and must have impressed Philadelphia head coach Chip Kelly.<n>He hasn't played in a regular season game since 2012 when he was with the New York Jets.

Grayson Moore, Annabel Jensen and Sara Jade Woodhouse are all transgender.<n>They are members of the Church of Latter Day Saints in Utah.<n>Church doctrine states that anyone who takes gender identity to extent of surgery cannot be baptized.<n>However, the three have found a way to exist within the religion.

Mick Tabone, 74, first came across the 5.2 metre croc in 1989.<n>Gregory had been stealing cattle and had been on the run for a couple of years.<n>Mr Tabone spent six months setting up traps for the huge creature.<n>Rangers had issued a warrant to kill the croc.<n>Mr Tabone helped the farmer who owned the property call in the help of the National Parks.<n>A heavy rainfall meant the trap had moved and turtles had gone in.<n>Gregory then followed the bait, which was set up by Mr Tabone.

The suit is making a special two month appearance at the Elvis at The O2 exhibition.<n>Normally on display at Graceland, the singer’s former home-turned-museum.<n>Presley’s manager Colonel Tom Parker had it ferried to concert venues.<n>The outfit was made for the singer by Hollywood tailor Nudie Cohn.

Max Maisel, son of ESPN writer Ivan Maisel, went missing on February 21.<n>His car was found abandoned on shore of Lake Ontario in New York.<n>21-year-old's body was spotted by a fisherman on Monday 200 yards from coast guard station.<n>Family released statement saying they were relieved but must 'get on with life'

Rafi Meitiv, 10, and his sister Dvora, 6, were picked up by police and Maryland CPS on Sunday in Silver Spring, Maryland.<n>The 7-minute 911 call was made by a man who saw the two kids and followed them for 20 minutes.<n>The Meitivs have been cited multiple times for allowing their children to roam free in their suburban neighborhood.<n>The Meitivs say authorities crossed a line when they picked up Rafi and Dvora and held them nearly six hours without food before allowing them to reunite with their parents.
Mohonk Mountain House is a faux-gothic Victorian castle hotel.<n>It gets its name from the surrounding Mohonk Preserve.<n>The hotel is 90 minutes north of New York City.

Satine Cahill was serving as the Adelaide Crows mascot ahead of their match against North Melbourne at Adelaide Oval on Sunday.<n>The seven-year-old became spooked by the rumbling fans and fireworks.<n>She burst into tears and was pictured in the corner as a Crows staffer tried to comfort her.<n>Taylor 'Tex' Walker stepped up to help calm the schoolgirl down.<n>The touching moment was captured by photographers and has been doing the rounds on social media.

Agnese Klavina, 30, vanished after a night out at Puerto Banus nightclub Aqwa Mist on September 6.<n>Westley Capper, 37, has already admitted driving her away from the nightspot.<n>Police believe 5ft 7in Agnese was forced into the vehicle.

Charlotte Li, 26, from London, launched Healthy Selfie with her husband Joe.<n>The pair both achieved incredible results taking selfies while on a health kick.<n>Charlotte said the idea for the app came after an over-indulgent Christmas.

Justin Welby will say students were 'witnesses' to their faith and suffered 'cruel deaths'<n>Comments follow Pope Francis's denunciation of the'senseless' killings.<n>David Cameron said it was 'truly shocking' Christians were tortured or killed.

Rachel Lehnardt, 35, 'had sex with a 16-year-old boy at her home in Evans, Georgia and later awoke to find him having sex with her'<n>She 'used sex toys on herself in front of the youngsters and later threw him off'<n>Her daughter, 16, defended her mother on Twitter, saying: 'Everyone makes mistakes' and that her mother 'used to be a great mom'

Car is seen being catapulted 100ft into the air after hitting a roadside bomb.<n>Explosion on board or fuel tank causes car to erupt in ball of flames.<n>Latest in a string of videos released by Kurdish forces showing ISIS attacks.

Edwin 'Jock' Mee is accused of attacking 11 victims as young as 15.<n>One woman told court she saw him as a 'father figure' after he helped her join Army.<n>She said he repeatedly asked her if she wanted to have sex with him.<n>But she initially ignored him, and later explicitly told him she did not want to.

Sir Ranulph Fiennes, 71, completed most gruelling stage of race today.<n>But explorer was taken to medical tent because of concerns for his heart.<n>He had to lie down intermittently during last few hours of run to continue.<n>Sir Ranulph is raising money for Marie Curie Cancer Care teams.

Robert Mugabe appeared to be sporting new hairstyle and earrings when he arrived into South Africa for state visit today.<n>However, the photograph emerged after a bit of camera trickery and belonged to a woman standing directly behind him.<n>The comical image emerged amid claims the president of Zimbabwe is lining up his 24-year-old daughter to succeed him.

Darduna family say they were 'tricked' into selling the mural for $200.<n>Bilal Khaled is accused of buying the piece painted on a door without telling them its real value.<n>The mural is now being held at Khan Yunis public library.

Robert 'Bob' Burns Jr was a founding member of Lynyrd Skynyrd.<n>He was killed late Friday in a single-vehicle crash near Cartersville, Georgia.<n>Burns' vehicle went off the road just before midnight as it approached a curve, striking a mailbox and a tree.<n>He left the group in 1974 because he was 'overwhelmed by life on the road'

The Korean Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) is located along the no-man's land between the North and South.<n>Surfers, gangsters, ex-pats and South Korean hipsters can be seen going about their day-to-day duties.<n>The beaches, often filled with foreigners and day-trippers from the capital Seoul, features an 'overlapping' of military installations.

Gerry Pickens, 28, is suing Orting, Washington, for firing him.<n>Was first black officer hired in small town of just 11 people.<n>But claims he was the butt of racist jokes and was then fired.<n>Vandals sprayed 'n****r' and 'Sue cheif' on his Ford Explorer.

Richard Ilczyszyn, 46, could be heard 'groaning' and 'crying' on flight.<n>But staff 'did not seek medical help and let him go on landing'<n>Wife Kelly, a Southwest flight attendant, is filing wrongful death suit.<n>Southwest spokesman said staff are trained to treat such behavior.

Doug Hughes, 61, landed a gyrocopter on the West Lawn of the U.S. Capitol on Wednesday.<n>He spent two years planning the stunt, which involved letters for all 535 members of Congress.<n>Mr Hughes is back in Florida under arrest and will wear an electronic tag until his first court hearing next month.<n>His wife, Alena, has defended him as a 'patriot' and said he is not a mailman.

Ed Miliband announced plans to overhaul Britain's non-domicile regime.<n>Allowed 116,000 foreigners and people with foreign links to pay tax.<n>Labour leader suggested he would 'abolish' non-dom status.<n>But it later emerged that Labour is effectively proposing a time limit.

Tiger Woods hit his club into a tree root on the ninth hole at Augusta.<n>The 39-year-old looked in agony as he dropped his club on the follow through.<n>He then revealed his wrist bone had popped out after finishing his round.<n>This was Woods' best finish in a tournament in over a year.

The clip was from ABC TV show 8MMM Aboriginal Radio.<n>It shows two elderly women painted in ochre dancing in a traditional ceremony.<n>Facebook deemed the clip 'potentially offensive nudity'<n>Fans called the decision 'ridiculous' and'silly'<n>The show's creators reposted the video on the 8MMM Aboriginal Radio Facebook page and encouraged people to share it.

Neil MacGregor, 68, has been director of the British Museum since 2002.<n>He said it was 'a difficult thing' to decide to leave after 13 years in the job.<n>Mr MacGregor previously ran the National Gallery and worked as a broadcaster.<n>His popular Radio 4 series A History Of The World In 100 Objects was inspired by the museum's collection.

Mercury expected to reach 25C (77F) in the South East today, beating Marseille at 22C (72F), Athens at 21C (70F), Rome at 19C (66F) and Madrid at 18C (64F)<n>It will drop slightly tomorrow as fresher weather arrives but days will remain sunny until next week.

Justin Bettman caught the media's attention a few months ago when he began his 'Set in the Street' project.<n>Bettman, sometimes with the help of designer Gozde Eker, would build sets that, in pictures, looked like the inside of a living room, child's bedroom, or a bathroom complete with a clawfoot tub.<n>Jose Luis saw a feature on the photographer in New York Magazine and sent him an email with an idea.<n>Luis asked Bettman to build him a set for the proposal, which Bettman did, and the couple got engaged on Valentine's

David Hibbitt, 33, was diagnosed with bowel cancer in July 2012.<n>He had chemotherapy, radiotherapy and surgery to remove his large bowel.<n>Doctors said he had 18 months to five years to live and he tried cannabis oil.<n>He bought a gram for £50 and says it has helped his recovery.<n>'I feel like the chemo was killing me and I had nothing to lose,' he said.

Kathy Bush was arrested in 1996 after a health care worker suspected she was intentionally making her daughter ill.<n>At the time, Jennifer Bush was in and out of the hospital as she battled chronic illness.<n>Kathy was convicted of aggravated child abuse and sentenced to five years in prison.<n>The two were not allowed to see each other until Jennifer left foster care.<n>Now 27, Jennifer spoke out for the first time on Wednesday, saying she believes her mother was never abused.

Mr Zhang drove to his mother's house but found she wasn't there.<n>He remembered the woman lying by the side of the road and returned.<n>When he got to the scene he found his mother covered in blood.<n>She died on the way to hospital, it was reported.

Mitchelle Blair, 35, is charged with felony murder, premeditated murder and torture.<n>Blair yelled at Alex Dorsey, father of one of the children found dead in the Detroit home.<n>She was removed from court when she failed to stop shouting.<n>State officials are seeking to terminate Blair's parental rights to her other two children, as well as the parental rights of her children's fathers.

Prince Harry was greeted by a enthusiastic crowd at the Australian War Memorial.<n>The royal, who is in Australia for military duty, pulled funny faces at fans.<n>He also declared'selfies are bad' and told a 12-year-old boy to 'take a normal'

First Minister reveals she would regard an 'out' vote in the Tories' proposed poll on EU membership as justification to reopen the question of breaking up the UK.<n>She also revealed that she intends to be in London on May 8 - the day after the general election - to lead the SNP's negotiating team.<n>Miss Sturgeon said she would take charge of any talks, even though she is not running for a Westminster seat and he is.<n>SNP MPs would seek to amend an EU referendum Bill to insist on a 'double majority' - meaning that England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland each vote to leave

Users of Sleep Cycle app found Brits wake up grumpier than others.<n>We get more time in bed than most other nations, but are moodier.<n>Only Japanese, South Koreans and Singaporeans are moodier when day breaks.

Lindsey Vonn was back at Augusta Friday to watch boyfriend Tiger Woods play in the second round of the Masters.<n>Vonn looked stressed at times though Woods played a solid round, carding a three-under-par 69.<n>Woods is 12 strokes behind leader Jordan Spieth, who is bidding for his first major title.

Another man was in the car with Walter Scott when he was pulled over.<n>Police report confirmed the man was detained with Scott and put in a police car.<n>It could shed light on what happened between Officer Michael Slager and Scott.<n>The 33-year-old patrolman has been charged with murder after Scott was shot dead.

David and Sandra Greatrex, 53 and 52, from Plymouth, were harassed.<n>Their wedding was cancelled by David's sister Anne Duffy.<n>She pretended to be her now sister-in-law and sent them threatening texts.<n>The couple took Anne to court and were awarded compensation.

Clarence Taylor, 44, was reported missing by his girlfriend last November.<n>A friend of Taylor's then led police to a wooded area where the man was still bound to a tree.<n>Taylor told police he was kidnapped and tied to the tree by a group of men who stole $2,500 from him.<n>He said he was not injured and had no signs of dehydration.<n>Taylor remains at large.

Nicola Sturgeon wore a dress that divided opinion on Twitter last night.<n>Some viewers thought it was grey, others said it was green and others were more apathetic.<n>One said: 'Wait, Nicola Sturgeon's dress in that debate was green?'<n>Another said: 'Papers have changed the colour, giving a less flattering skin tone'

Clint Gee made the six hour journey from his Brisbane home to Wandoan in regional Queensland to bury his mother and father.<n>He had planned to reunite his mother, Elizabeth Hobbs, with his father, Alex Gee, who died in 1964.<n>Mr Gee said he had organised the day with the Western Downs Regional Council to ensure everything would run smoothly.<n>He also paid a $342 fee, after being upset with the council reduced its usual rate of more than $400.

Shanay Walker was subjected to'repeated acts of cruelty' by her aunt Kay-Ann Morris.<n>Court heard she had food shoved in her mouth and was struck with a hairbrush.<n>The seven-year-old was found cold and stiff in her bed in Nottingham last July.<n>Her aunt is currently on trial for her murder at Nottingham Crown Court.

Grey ‘stealth’ speed traps could be outlawed regardless of which party wins.<n>At least 112,000 motorists given fines or appeared in court for motorway offences last year - a quarter more than in 2013.<n>The increase has been put down to the introduction of ‘smart motorways’<n>The Conservatives are already moving to scrap the controversial cameras.<n>Labour has pledged to repaint them yellow so they are easier to spot.

Daniel Boykin, 33, was sentenced to six months prison in Nashville on Thursday.<n>He was arrested last year after following his coworker for two years.<n>She came forward when she discovered photos of her dog on his phone.<n>He was also found with 92 videos and 1,500 photos of her on his phone and computer.<n>He broke into her home five times.<n>In apologizing for his actions in court, Boykin said he had 'abused and broken a trust that I can never repair'

Icebergs Club pool was drained on Thursday to create a unique catwalk for Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia.<n>The show was for Ten Pieces, a label produced by Icebergs restaurateur Maurice Terzini and his partner Lucy Hinckfuss.<n>The collection of ten is designed to be worn in 20 different ways.<n>Crowds gathered to take in the show from the balcony of the iconic club.

Hassan Munshi and Talha Asmal, both 17, believed to have fled to Syria.<n>Mosque imam says Muslims must talk to friends who'might be looking'<n>He adds: 'We need to show them the barbaric things that are going on there'<n>Teenagers from Dewsbury, West Yorkshire, last seen in Turkey last week.
The 34-year-old mother-of-one said her daughter is 'obsessed' with her make-up.<n>Kim added that North 'gravitates towards really simple things' when it comes to clothing.

Christian Longo murdered his wife and three children in Oregon in 2001.<n>He stuffed their bodies in suitcases and dumped them in coastal bays.<n>Then went on an alcohol-filled Mexican trip before he was arrested.<n>He was sentenced to death and is being played by James Franco in a film.<n>Now he has spoken out from behind bars, saying he can no longer be redeemed.

President Barack Obama and his family attended the service in Alexandria, Virginia.<n>The congregation was treated to a sermon by Rev Howard-John Wesley.<n>He urged them not to shake hands with the president, but to greet their neighbors.<n>The Obamas will be dancing to Uptown Funk at the White House on Monday.

Janet Faal, 57, was out with a friend when she fell down the gap.<n>Was trying to move a wooden pallet to help them reverse out of a car park.<n>She smashed her face on the pallet and was left in a'splits' position.<n>She's been left with two black eyes and a suspected fractured leg.<n>Grandmother-of-four has suffered from agoraphobia for a decade.

Actress Paula Duncan has revealed she attempted to commit suicide at age 43.<n>Her teenage daughter Jessica Orcsik found her after a suicide attempt.<n>Duncan has opened up about her depression and marriage breakdowns.<n>The actress is best known for her role on Spray'n'Wipe.

Alan Lawrence, a Utah photographer, created a photo series in which his 18-month-old son, Wil, who has Down Syndrome appears to be flying.<n>The father created a photo series called 'Wil Can Fly' in which the toddler appears to be flying in many different scenes.<n>Lawrence plans to donate half the proceeds to two Down Syndrome foundations.

Abdirahman Sheik Mohamud, 23, from Columbus, Ohio, has been arrested and charged with supporting terrorism.<n>Mohamud left the US a year ago with the intent to go to Syria and train with a terrorist group linked to al Qaeda in Iraq.<n>He received training in shooting weapons, breaking into houses, explosives and hand-to-hand combat.<n>Mohamud returned to the US in June 2014 with a plot to attack a military base or a correctional facility, targeting people in uniform.

'New Shepard' designed to fly three people and/or a mix of passengers and payloads to altitudes.<n>about 62 miles (100 km) above Earth.<n>Will launch from Blue.<n>Origin's west Texas facility near Van Horn, Texas, southeast of.<n>El Paso.

Kenne Worthen'started flirting with the girl at Longview Elementary School in Phoenix last August and the relationship turned sexual in January'<n>He 'kept in contact with her by messaging her on an iPod app and Google Hangouts and expressed fears she would tell his wife'<n>The relationship was only uncovered when her classmates told other teachers and police.

A new report from Suncorp Bank suggests Australians have spent 50 per cent more on digital devices than they planned in the last year.<n>The report found Australians spent $20 billion on digital devices and services - or on average $2,300 each - in the last 12 months.<n>Men spent twice as much as women on computers, digital accessories, mobile apps, and streaming services.<n>Families with children living at home are spending 50 per cent more to stay digitally connected to the world than singles, couples without children and empty nesters.

Several thousand people gathered outside the city's main railway station Flinders Street at 4pm on Friday.<n>The rally forced the closure of Flinders and Elizabeth streets, where surrounding streets soon became clogged with cars and trams forced to stop.<n>Police, on foot and on riot horses, followed the marchers all the way.<n>This comes as the Queensland Police Service refuses to issue an apology to an Indigenous officer after claims the word 'Abor' was written on his station roster by a senior sergeant.

Those who had watched the most films which featured characters drinking alcohol were 20 per cent more likely to have tried alcohol.<n>Bristol University researchers quizzed 5,000 British teenagers about their drinking habits.<n>Three quarters of popular UK box office films depicted alcohol use - but only six per cent were classified as adult only.

Vijay Chokal-Ingam claims he applied to medical schools in 1998 as 'Jojo', an African American man.<n>He says he wanted to gain more acceptance because of affirmative action policies.<n>Admits his sister did not support him during the application process.

Obama said it is 'personally difficult' to hear criticism from Israel.<n>Said talks are part of a broader foreign policy doctrine that sees American power as a safeguard that gives him the ability to take calculated risks.<n>Comments come days after world powers reached tentative agreement to curb Iran's nuclear program in exchange for sanctions relief.

Lindsay Jo Rimer went missing from Hebden Bridge in West Yorkshire in 1994.<n>Her body was found in a canal five months later, weighing down with a rock.<n>Her sister Kate has spoken of her family's agony as 20th anniversary approaches.<n>She said: 'Every memory of her is tainted - it is so painful and bleeds into everything we do'<n>Police have launched a new bid to find her killer and are appealing for witnesses.

The owner pleaded guilty to a charge of failing to provide appropriate and adequate living conditions for his cats.<n>RSPCA South Australia detailed how the cats at the property were in poor physical condition when they were seized in September.<n>The cats suffered from high-temperatures, flea-allergy dermatitis and significant respiratory issues when they were found at the property.<n>The owner was granted to have two of his cats returned under the RSPCA's supervision.<n>The animal welfare group will be caring and rehoming the third cat.

Scott Carr took the photographs in shallow waters off Heron Island in Queensland, Australia.<n>Images show a shoal of fish making way for a blacktip shark, perhaps proving that they are instinctively frightened of it.<n>Fish keep their distance, creating circles of clear water around the predator.<n>S shoals may be effective means for the majority of fish within them to escape predators’ jaws.

Samantha Fleming and her newborn daughter Serenity were last seen in Anderson on April 5, when they left with a woman who said she was from Child Protective Services.<n>The three-week-old infant was discovered unharmed at a home in Gary on Friday and will be returned to relatives.<n>The body was found in the same home, wrapped in plastic and stuffed in a plastic storage bin.<n>A neighbor said the alleged kidnapper told her she was pregnant with twins and that she had asked her sister to care for the baby.

Jason Warnock, 29, raced to the edge of a cliff in Lewiston, Idaho on Wednesday morning and pulled Mathew Sitko, 23, to safety.<n>He has been identified as the hero who saved the man after he crashed his car and it dangled over the cliff.<n>But Warnock said he had to go to work and had to leave the scene.<n>He calmed Sitko down and asked him to roll down the window.<n>Sitko suffered minor injuries and is recovering.

George was last seen running off in the direction of a caravan park in Wales.<n>He was found on a doorstep in West Yorkshire five weeks later.<n>Owners Steven Davison and his wife Susan couldn't believe their luck.<n>Their daughter Gemma Davison-Lemalle, 30, saw a picture of him on Facebook.
Labour leader spent Easter weekend with his family in Doncaster.<n>But he returned to the campaign trail in Bristol this morning.<n>David Cameron and Nick Clegg also ramped up their campaigning.

Businessman Nick Loeb filed a lawsuit last August over the two embryos.<n>He implied that he wants to use them to have children of his own.<n>The 39-year-old created the embryos through in vitro fertilization in November 2013 and they remain frozen at a Beverly Hills clinic.

Pennsylvania scientists have found evidence that we may not be alone.<n>They found 50 galaxies emitting unusually high levels of radiation.<n>This could be because aliens are harnessing the power of stars.<n>However, further research is needed to confirm that is the case.<n>The energy used by such a race would have to be huge - likely harnessing the power of a galaxy’s stars.<n>This would make them noticeable to Nasa's Wise telescope, used in the study.

Clare Balding has admitted she was on TV too much following Olympics.<n>The broadcaster has vowed to do less after presenting everything.<n>She said it was 'exhausting' to be constantly asked about being gay.

SpiderFab system uses arachnid-like robots to construct large objects in orbit around the Earth by'spinning' building material into shape.<n>Could cut construction costs by only launching raw materials such as carbon fibre into orbit.

The Egyptian-themed mansion, advertised as Pharaoh’s Palace, promises a 'perfect private location' on seven secluded acres in Tampa.<n>An August 2014 adult-themed party dubbed 'Midsummer Night Wet Dream' got the mansion, bought by Canadian millionaire Gordon Lownds, its first noise complaint.<n>The mansion also became where a former adult-themed business investor, ran a modeling agency dubbed Pharaoh's Daughters.

Chelsea Clinton is opening up about motherhood, life in the public eye and why the United States needs a female president in a new interview with Elle.<n>Clinton, whose mother Hillary is expected to formally announce her presidential campaign this Sunday, said it is time the United States had a female leader.<n>'One of our core values in this country is that we are the land of equal opportunity, but when equal hasn't yet included gender, there is a fundamental challenge there that, I believe, having our first woman president—whenever that is—will help resolve,' said Clinton.

Abase Hussen was caught on camera at violent rally in London in 2012.<n>He was marching with hate cleric Anjem Choudary and Lee Rigby killer Michael Adebowale.<n>Now he has admitted taking his daughter Amira to a similar demonstration.<n>Mr Hussen said the rally may have influenced her decision to join IS.

Choc on Choc's limited edition Political Chocolates range.<n>David Cameron's chocolate is studded with blueberry pieces.<n>Nick Clegg's is filled with chunks of honeycomb.<n>Ed Miliband's comes in a red raspberry flavour.

The Art Gallery of New South Wales was transformed into a spectacular set for the Romance Was Born show.<n>The design duo's new collection, called 'Cooee Couture', features bright and colourful designs in loud prints.<n>The models' beauty look featured rainbow dreadlocks and neon make-up designed by Nigel Stanislaus for Maybelline.

Alfie was stolen with another Yorkshire terrier during raid on owner's home.<n>He was found barking in front of RSPCA van in Gerrards Cross, Buckinghamshire.<n>Inspector Stephanie Law pulled over and the dog started licking her face.<n>She was able to trace owner Kirsty Mitton, from Wednesbury, West Midlands.<n>Miss Mitton drove 112 miles to collect her beloved pet from Gerrards Cross.

Kevin Jonas Rojano-Nieto, 20, raped a three-year-old girl in June.<n>The mandatory sentence for child rape is 25-years to life.<n>Judge M. Marc Kelly said that Rojano-Nieto 'did not intend to harm' the girl.<n>He said that Rojano-Nieto 'inexplicably became sexually aroused'<n>The judge said that he was sure that there was 'no violence or callous disregard for the victim's well-being'<n>The prosecution are appealing the decision.

The first 1959 Barbie Doll will go on sale at Myer this Saturday.<n>The dolls are newly produced but modelled on the original doll.<n>The doll features a black and white striped one-piece swimsuit.<n>The first 100 customers at each of the five stores will receive the doll for the original 1959 price of $3.00.<n>The dolls will be on sale for $34.95 after the first 100 customers.

The Spanish Royal Family attended an Easter service in Mallorca.<n>The Easter holiday is one of the biggest in the Catholic calendar.<n>The family have been regular visitors to the island since Felipe ascended the throne.

Ukip leader made remarks after being asked to justify scarcity of black faces.<n>It was suggested the only black face in the Ukip manifesto appeared on a page about overseas aid.<n>Mr Farage said the premise was wrong, with the picture of the party's immigration spokesman Steven Woolfe ignored.

The 69-year-old actress and business magnate collaborated with NBC's Today show to launch the contest.<n>The winning duo will tie the knot at Elvis Presley's Graceland Wedding Chapel inside the Westgate Hotel on Thursday, April 23.

Number of people in work soars to highest level in history.<n>Employment rose above 31million in the three months to February.<n>David Cameron said the Conservatives had overseen a ‘jobs miracle’<n>IMF chief Christine Lagarde and German finance minister Wolfgang Schaeuble praised George Osborne’s ‘wonderful job’ of handling the economy.

Kim Kardashian and her family are in the capital Yerevan, the Armenian capital.<n>The visit is the first to the country for the reality TV star and her family.<n>Kim's father, Robert Kardashian, fled to America after the revolution.<n>The city is culturally rich and famous for its music and dance performances.

Margaret and Gary Mazan had 14 Red Setters seized by RSPCA inspectors.<n>Animals had matted fur, were dehydrated and had not been fed a diet.<n>Three of the dogs were found crammed in puppy cages in garden shed.<n>Couple jailed for 26 weeks and given lifetime ban from owning pets.

Brussels will accuse Google of illegally abusing its supremacy on the market.<n>It will say the search giant has used its dominance to divert internet users from rivals to its own services, including YouTube and Google+.<n>Google currently boasts a 90 per cent share in Europe's search engine market.<n>The EU is also expected to probe Google's operating system for Android smartphones.

Senator Bob Corker, a Republican, said oversight 'doesn't mean there won't be a deal'<n>He added that Congress has a responsibility to scour details of final plan.<n>Negotiators announced a framework deal on Thursday; deal due to be finalized by June 30.<n>Criticized President Obama for previous assertion that deal won't be approved.<n>He said: 'We just set in place a process to ensure that if there's a deal, it's a deal that will stand the test of time, that will keep Iran from getting a nuclear weapon'

Eye contact is the most effective way to signal sexual interest.<n>On average we scan a face for three seconds, scan for four and a half.<n>Tracey Cox gives her advice on how to use your peepers to get attention.

The TSA will 'enhance' officer training for hair pat-downs.<n>New training will commence at Los Angeles International Airport.<n>Complaint was filed on behalf of Malaika Singleton.<n>Singleton said she was subjected to hair pat-down with weeks of each other while traveling from Los Angeles to London in December 2013.

Jordan Sharifi, 17, was arrested on Friday after police say he confessed to giving a gun and ammunition to Raymond Howell, Jr.<n>Raymond was found dead from a self-inflicted gunshot wound in a ditch on Thursday morning.<n>Sharifi 'found the body after Raymond's mother called to ask him if he'd seen her son'<n>He initially denied seeing a weapon but later admitted he had given the boy the gun.

Gang stole £145,000 in cigarettes and cars during two-month crime spree.<n>Used umbrellas to hide themselves as they raided shops in West Midlands.<n>Armed gang threatened staff with hammers, knives and screwdrivers.<n>Four men have been jailed for a total of 27 years for conspiracy to rob.

Georgina Bartter died after taking ecstasy at a dance festival last year.<n>Her best friend Rebecca Hannibal has pleaded guilty to supplying the fatal pills.<n>Ms Bartter is believed to have had an extremely rare adverse reaction to the 'one and a half pills' she took on the night.<n>Ms Hannibal, 19, had previously pleaded not guilty to single supply charge.<n>Matthew Forti, 19, has pleaded not guilty to three counts of supplying drugs and possessing MDMA.

Natasha Elderfield, 41, is accused of murdering Robert Dobinson, 33.<n>Oxford Crown Court heard Mr Dobinson found her in a short dress and stockings.<n>Elderfield then stabbed her boyfriend through the heart, jury told.<n>She then left him to die on the banks of the Thames, the court heard.

Nelson Felippe took a photo of a'scene' on a train platform in Rio de Janeiro.<n>The Brazilian commuter expressed his disapproval on Facebook.<n>The image was shared more than 100,000 times in 24 hours.<n>Felippi's tongue firmly in cheek warns against 'challenging social conventions'

Christians in the US will decline from three quarters of the population in 2010 to just two thirds in 2050, Pew Research Center says.<n>Atheists and agnostics will make up a 'declining share of the world's population'<n>By 2050 in Europe, Muslims will make up one in ten of the overall population.<n>Christians projected to fall below 50 per cent in the UK, Australia, Benin, Bosnia-Herzegov.

Shelly Sterling has been awarded nearly all of the $3 million she had sought to be returned from V. Stiviano.<n>Lawyers for Sterling had claimed that money used to buy V. Stiviano a house, luxury cars and stocks was her community property the couple had acquired over six decades of marriage.<n>Stiviano's lawyer had argued that the gifts were made when Donald and Shelly were separated and that Shelly Sterling couldn't seek them from a third party.

The vaccine is made from pieces of a protein called TARP.<n>It can stimulate the immune system to attack the cancer.<n>The antibodies created by the vaccine can then destroy cancer cells.<n>Researchers are testing it on 70 men with prostate cancer who have had treatment but whose PSA is rising again.

Awel Manyang believes her siblings who died in the crash were eaten by crocodiles in the water.<n>Her siblings - one-year-old brother Bol and four-year-old twins Madit and Anger - died after their mother Akon Guode crashed her 4WD into a lake.<n>Awel, who is recovering in hospital, says she remembers the accident.<n>Her father, Joseph Tito Manyang, says Awel believes crocodiles associate water with them.

British physicist Stephen Hawking has sung Monty Python's Galaxy Song.<n>The song is being released digitally and on vinyl for Record Store Day.<n>It is a cover of the song from 1983 film Monty Python's Meaning of Life.<n>Professor Hawking, 73, appeared on film alongside Professor Brian Cox.<n>He can be seen whizzing through space in his wheelchair in the video.

Jenny Wallenda, 87, died late Saturday at her home in Sarasota, Florida.<n>Wallenda was the oldest daughter of high wire walker Karl Wallenda and grandmother of daredevil performer Nik Wallenda.<n>Karl Wallenda fell to his death in 1978.<n>Wallenda advocated for causes important to the circus community in her later years and helped create the Circus Ring of Fame.

Lee Garlington is opening up about his secret gay relationship with Hollywood star Rock Hudson.<n>Garlington says he was an extra on a movie set when he decided to check out Hudson, having heard rumors the star was gay.<n>Garlington says he would sneak over to the Hudson's house after work, and leave first thing in the morning.<n>This lasted for three years, from 1962 until 1965, and while their sneaking around seemed to work for awhile, Hudson became concerned after learning that a female fan had broken into his home.<n>Garlington says he had no idea how much the actor cared for him until

Marie Hunt of Spring Green, Wisconsin, dropped out of school after completing eighth grade when she found herself unable to get to her high school.<n>Now 103, the centenarian was presented with an honorary diploma by her local high school, 87 years after her classmates graduated.

Matthew Bird, from Ashburton, New Zealand, halved his income by quitting his well-paid job as an agricultural adviser to become a mechanic.<n>He said he was happy to give up is $70,000 a year pay check for a meagre wage of $38,000 a year, if it meant his child support payment dropped to $554 a month.<n>Inland Revenue recently amended their child support formula which was enforced on April 1.<n>Mr Bird has fathered three children and was previously expected to pay $1,300 a month in child support.

Senior Constable Neale McShane is set to retire from his decade long post in the harsh region of Birdsville.<n>Birdsville borders on the Simpson Desert in far south-west Queensland.<n>The 59-year-old has spent 40 years as an officer in three different states.<n>Temperatures in the region can reach over 50 degrees, giving rise to a number of desert rescues that McShane must execute every year.

The actress is selling the Manhattan penthouse she once shared with ex-husband Bruce Willis for $75million.<n>The 14-bedroom apartment includes a 7,000 square feet of living space and wrap around terraces with views of both Central Park and the Hudson River.<n>Over the years, Moore has counted Dustin Hoffman, Diane Keaton, Steven Spielberg as neighbors - not to mention U2 frontman Bono who occupies the north tower penthouse.

Posters were plastered across Cardiff telling Muslims not to vote in election.<n>They read: 'Democracy is a system whereby man violates the right of Allah'<n>Posters were stuck on lampposts and bus stops across Grangetown suburb.<n>Cardiff Council have begun removing the posters, dubbed 'chilling' by locals.

Deaths in Britain will start to go up and increase by 20 per cent over next two decades, a report by a think tank has found.<n>The report suggests that younger people who already feel financially hard pressed in comparison to their parents will still be under money pressure even after their deaths.<n>Younger people are finding it increasingly difficult to afford homes or to start families.

Goldfish have become a problem in Teller Lake in Boulder, Colorado.<n>Wildlife officials say they were dumped in the water two or three years ago.<n>The animals are threatening to over-run the natural species in the lake, which are native to the area.<n>They are also spreading unnatural diseases.<n>Officials are considering two options to remove the fish - one is to drain the lake completely, the other is to electroshock them.

Nicole Mihai was told by New Zealand Immigration that once her Visa expires, she must return to Romania.<n>The 34-year-old was awarded full custody of her son after a two-year relationship broke down.<n>The Family Court have ruled that her young son, Chris, is not able to reside further than 50 kilometres from his New Zealand father.<n>Ms Mihai moved to New Zealand seven years ago and worked as a waitress.

Items on sale in Poundland are up to 50 per cent more expensive than supermarkets.<n>Research found that Kellogs Cornflakes and Galaxy Minstrels are among the pricier items.<n>However, Poundland has said that it is still cheaper than other supermarkets.

Indian salesman, 41, accused of posting 'blasphemous' status on Facebook.<n>He allegedly posted the status after watching a news item about Iraq war.<n>He claims he received the image over Whatsapp, but then admitted to posting it.<n>Faces seven years in prison and a fine of up to £186,000 if found guilty.
Apple Watch goes on sale officially on April 24.<n>Preorders opened on Friday and the gadget is available in stores.<n>Tim Cook said initial orders were 'great'

Ards Borough Council in Northern Ireland will merge with neighbouring authority.<n>It put on lavish banquet and disco to'maintain morale' and encourage workers.<n>Staff feasted on roast turkey and potatoes cooked in duck fat at the party.<n>A further £950 was spent on photo booth, disco and security for 190 staff.

Feidin Santana, 23, filmed Officer Michael Slager shoot dead Walter Scott, 50, on Saturday after he fled from a traffic stop in North Charleston, South Carolina.<n>He then posted the footage online, setting off a firestorm of controversy.<n>On Thursday, he visited the man's family to meet with them and say he was moved by their grief.<n>'Oh, thank you God!' Scott's mother Judy said as she embraced Santana.

Her Majesty's @BritishMonarchy account has 970,000 followers online.<n>Prince Charles and Camilla take second spot, followed by King Felipe and Queen Letizia.<n>Duke and Duchess of Cambridge are fourth and the Netherlands' Queen Maxima is fifth.

The Queen met Canadian Highlanders to mark the bravery of the country's servicemen and women in First World War.<n>Her Majesty was joined by Prince Philip and Princess Alexandra at the reception in Trafalgar Square, central London.<n>The monarch posed for a photograph with The Calgary Highlanders - who were all dressed in kilts.<n>Prince Philip sat for a portrait with The Royal Hamilton Light Infantry.

Abbey, 29, joins Foxes, 25, Victoria's Secret Angel Lily Donaldson, 28, and model Alice Dellal, 27, in the new series of pictures.<n>The campaign, which also stars Alice Dellal, has so far raised £13.5.

Stephanie Scott's funeral will be held next Wednesday in her home town of Canowindra.<n>The parish priest is expecting it to be a very difficult day for everyone.<n>'I know Stephanie’s father relatively well through the time that he taught at the local Canowindra High School,' Reverend Williams said.<n>Ms Scott's burned body was found last Friday around five metres from a road in Cocoparra National Park.

Star Wars director wants to build 224 homes on his Grady Ranch estate.<n>Project would span 52 acres and cost around $200m, according to plans.<n>Neighbors in Lucas Valley, California, opposed film director's plans for studio.<n>Lucas' lawyers say he has the right to build what he wants on the land.

Tamoxifen is a hormone drug used to treat breast cancer and ovaries.<n>Study found drinking two cups of coffee a day can slash risk of cancer returning.<n>Researchers also found caffeine causes breast cancer cells to divide less.

Kendra Moad of Kearns, Utah followed her grandfather out of the house Friday morning and into the driveway.<n>He did not see the toddler and ran her over as he pulled his truck up in the driveway to move the trash cans and ran over and killed the 20-month-old.<n>This is the fourth time since August that a child was accidentally run over and killed in their own driveway by a family member in Utah.

Shaun Worthington, 29, died when his car collided with a truck last year.<n>His car was filmed on a truck's dashcam veering into oncoming traffic.<n>Text sent at 1.04pm was seen on camera as car crashed into oncoming traffic.<n>His mother has appealed to other motorists not to use their phones.

Martha the golden retriever was paddling in the water when she was swept out.<n>Her owner launched their own rescue attempt to save the pet from the sea.<n>But RNLI crew were called and managed to find Martha half a mile out.<n>They managed to grab her collar and pull her into the lifeboat.

Solar Probe Plus will carry four experiments into the corona and study the solar wind and energetic particles as they blast off the surface of the star.<n>The launch window opens for 20 days starting on July 31, 2018.<n>Over 24 orbits, the mission will use seven flybys of Venus to reduce its distance from the sun.

Kuku Kube is available for free on Facebook, Android, iOS and on desktop browsers.<n>On each board, one of the squares is a slightly different shade of the same colour.<n>The aim is to find this odd square by tapping it with your finger or clicking it with the mouse.<n>Players get a point for every correct square identified, but if they click or tap the wrong square they lose a point.<n>It was created by Canada-based Network365 and is available for free on Facebook, Android, iOS and on desktop browsers.

Frustrated listeners say vital last minutes of shows have been left off.<n>They branded the problem 'irritating', 'annoying' and 'frustrating'<n>Shows such as Dad's Army and Hancock's Half Hour have fallen foul of problem.<n>BBC blames on system it uses to record programmes for the problem.

Kendalia Halle was built more than 100 years ago by German immigrants.<n>It's one of an estimated 1,000 dance halls that sprung up around Texas in the 1800s, knitting together German, Czech, Polish and other immigrant communities.<n>About 400 such halls still stand — many unused and decaying — but only two traditional Texas dance halls continue to operate on nearly a daily basis.

Ronald Miscavige, 79, had recently left the Church of Scientology, which has been under the leadership of his 54-year-old son since 1986.<n>The elder Miscavige was allegedly followed by a father-son pair of detectives for 18 months for fear he might reveal damaging information about the inner workings of the church.<n>The allegations came to light two years ago following the arrest of Florida-based private investigator Dwayne Powell.<n>Powell reportedly told police he was hired by the Church of Scientology through a Florida firm to follow Ronald Miscavige on a full-time basis.

Belinda, 56, from Essex, travelled to Turkey for a cheap facelift.<n>But surgeon left her with 'horrendous' scars around her ears.<n>Plastic surgeon says they are'very poor' and dragging down her earlobes.<n>She is now being urged to have another facelift to correct the damage.

Elderflower Fields Festival will be held in Pippingford Park, Sussex.<n>Held in the Ashdown Forest, it's a family-oriented festival for children.<n>The line-up for 2015 includes Danny and the Champions Of The World.

Apps cause stress by making us worry we are abnormal or unhealthy, says GP.<n>Popular apps include MyFitnessPal and Apple’s health app, installed on latest Apple smartphones.<n>But Dr Des Spence warned apps that monitor heart rate, blood pressure and blood oxygen levels could be causing unnecessary worry.

Khayree Gay, 31, was captured on Friday at the Security Inn and Suites hotel in Lake City, South Carolina.<n>He is facing federal charges for allegedly kidnapping a Jewelers Row employee on April 4 in Philadelphia.<n>Gay's two suspected accomplices were not with him when he was arrested.

Sarah Reign, 26, from New York, works as a security guard.<n>She enjoys eating so much, she decided to turn it into a job.<n>She gets paid $1,500 (£1,000) a month to eat on camera.<n>She has also become a'squashing' expert, sitting on men naked.

Claudia Winkleman has been nominated for her first season on Strictly.<n>The 43-year-old is the first presenter of the BBC dance contest to be nominated.<n>Sir Bruce Forsyth and co-host Tess Daly failed to achieve the honor.<n>Mother-of-three will compete in entertainment performance category at next month’s awards with Ant and Dec, Graham Norton and Celebrity Juice host Leigh Francis.

Rachel Lehnardt 'allowed her daughter to bring over friends for a party at her home and played naked Twister with them'<n>She 'had sex with an 18-year-old in the bathroom and later had sex with her daughter's 16-year-old boyfriend in the bed'<n>The mother-of-five told her Alcoholics Anonymous sponsor about the party.

The short story was penned by the future monarch when she was just 10.<n>It tells the story of a 12-year-old girl sent away to boarding school.<n>The tale will be published in June as 'The Adventures of Alice Laselles'

Belinda Bartholomew was buying a chicken for her and her Roosters star boyfriend Aidan Guerra to have for dinner on Monday night.<n>She claims the butcher at Sam the Butcher in Bondi called her a 'f***ing c***' when she asked for a different chicken to the one he had picked up.<n>Ms Bartholomew claims the butcher then told her to 'go to a f***ing Aussie butcher'<n>The butcher has hit back saying Ms Bartholomew is 'lying' and trying to ruin the business.

Dave Sim, 36, has been training for months for his audacious attempt.<n>He hopes his stunt will inspire others to get out and ride their bikes.<n>Mr Sim has completed long rides on his Raleigh Chopper before.

Britt Lapthorne, from Melbourne, disappeared in the Croatian coastal town of Dubrovnik in 2008.<n>Her body was found in nearby Boninovo Bay, where it was found almost three weeks after she disappeared on September 18.<n>A Victorian inquest into her death will be closed on Thursday.<n>The Lapthorne family believe Ms Lapthorne was murdered, her body weighted down and dumped at sea.

The decline of working class jobs and the rise of mobile phones is to blame.<n>A third of people say they are listening to music instead of whistling.<n>In the 70s and 80s whistling was still popular in many pop songs.<n>The era of master whistlers is still not completely dead and Britain can still boast at least one.

Part-time worker ordered to pay more than three quadrillion pounds in contributions.<n>Bill is more than a thousands times the whole of Germany's annual GDP.<n>The £3.35 billion is also enough to pay the UK government debt.<n>Pensions office worker accidentally copied customer number into form.

Kareem Abdul-Jabbar underwent emergency heart surgery on April 16.<n>The Hall of Famer had quadruple coronary bypass surgery at Ronald Reagan UCLA Medical Center.<n>Abdul-Jabbar, 68, is expected to make a full recovery after the operation.<n>He led UCLA to three consecutive titles and was named the Most Valuable Player of the NCAA tournament for three straight years.

A survey of 1,000 Americans found that 64 per cent think they spend more when they shop with friends.<n>The main reasons were said to be'showing off in front of friends' and'succumbing to peer pressure'<n>Nearly half blamed the fact that they get carried away by excitement.<n>Nearly two-thirds admitted they would prefer to shop by themselves.

Colleen Harris, 73, was found guilty of first-degree murder on Wednesday after shooting her husband while he was sleeping in 2013.<n>It took the El Dorado Superior Court jury in less than two hours to convict her.<n>She will be sentenced on June 5 and stands to receive 50 years to life for first-degree murder with a firearm.<n>In 1985, Colleen Harris shot dead her second husband and father of her three children, 46-year-old James Batten, after claiming he had been abusive towards her.

Scientists say the lethal ring is leaving tens of thousands of creatures with severe, and often fatal injuries.<n>The map uses data from the California Roadkill Observation System, a volunteer-submitted database of instances where wildlife and vehicles collided.<n>Major hotspots include the Sacramento area where I-80 and I-5 run across bypasses along the Pacific Flyway.

Neil Tuckett, 58, is selling one Model T a week at his garage in Buckinghamshire.<n>Customers include TV and film industry who have used them in shows such as Downton Abbey.<n>They don't require road tax or an MOT and are cheaper to maintain than modern cars, he says.<n>Mr Tuckett, who has about six, says he can't keep up with demand for cars.
Dr Ros Altmann will be appointed as Minister for Consumer Protection.<n>She will take responsibility for protecting people from rip-off charges.<n>Dr Altmann went on to head over-50s group Saga.

Catherine Grove, 28, disappeared in July 2013 from her home in Fayetteville, Arkansas.<n>She then returned to the Church of Wells in Wells, Texas, weeks later.<n>Her parents believe she was brainwashed by the church, which has been accused of sexual abuse, kidnapping and human trafficking.<n>But she has now announced she will marry a church elder.

Baroness Brady joined David Cameron at National Grid training centre.<n>She helped him with his jacket as he stood to speak at Newark site.<n>But she was instead left politely holding his jacket on the sidelines.<n>They were announcing creation of 16,000 new apprenticeships.

Yervand Garginian, a 60-year-old bus driver from Melbourne, filmed himself cooking chicken on an open charcoal barbecue.<n>He uses a traditional 'khorovats' recipe to cook the chicken.<n>His daughter Elizabeth posted the video to Reddit and it has since been viewed more than five million times.

Tracey Taylor, 34, went on violent rampage after breakdown of 20 year relationship.<n>She attacked ex-fiance and his new girlfriend before breaking into her home.<n>She smashed the windscreen of a BMW with a rock and scratched the paintwork with a key.<n>She received a 12-month jail sentence suspended for two years.

Admiral Mike Mullen served as Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff from 2008 to 2011.<n>Mullen allegedly told three comrades of Bergdahl that the soldier was a deserter.<n>Bergdahl was captured by the Taliban in June 2009 and held for five years.<n>The claims cast a huge shadow over the deal to swap five Taliban commanders for Bergdahl.

Mr Scott, 50, was gunned down by Officer Michael Slager on Saturday.<n>Pop star Michelle Williams tweeted: 'Once again... #WalterScott'<n>Singer Janelle Mone said: 'This brought tears to my eyes. #WalterScott'<n>Rapper Big Boi simply tweeted an image of a black square with the words: #WalterScott.

Tiffany Gay thought she was being led outside for a routine fire drill but instead she found her biggest crush, junior Luis Velasquez, holding a bouquet of flowers.<n>Gay is a special needs student who struggles with a genetic disorder called Prader-Willi Syndrome (PWS) that causes sufferers to have an insatiable appetite.<n>'When you meet her,' Jessica said,'she has that infectious smile and you’re just like, "Oh, my God, I want to hug you"'

Cheryl and Robert Prudham, from Gravesend, Kent, plan two-week break.<n>Couple, who have 11 children, will renew wedding vows in lavish ceremony.<n>They visited local Thomson travel agents to book the luxury trip.<n>Couple, who split last year, also took £7,000 holiday to Menorca, Spain.

Mark Ward Faville, of Christiansburg, Virginia, was found guilty of voluntary manslaughter in the death of his wife Anne, who died in 2000.<n>After the verdict was read, Faville was taken away in a sheriff's car and then took his own life in the courthouse.<n>It is not known how he did this, though the court was put on lockdown until 5pm and an investigation is underway.<n>His wife died after being suffocated in a homicidal manner, something he claimed she choked on a piece of chicken.

Mass brawl broke out at Fat Tuesdays bar at Resorts World Casino.<n>Witnesses said two women clashed during long wait for drinks.<n>Brawl went on for several minutes, with chairs and poles thrown.<n>Three men were arrested after the fight which injured four security guards and a police officer.

Arias was sentenced to life in prison on Monday for murdering ex-boyfriend Travis Alexander in 2008.<n>She has now been photographed in a new mugshot as she begins her sentence.<n>In her first mugshot, taken in 2008, Arias flashed a smirk to show her annoyance at being photographed.<n>She later said she did it because her victim would have done that, and'so why not?'

New railway could be built between China and Nepal by 2020.<n>It would create a crucial link between China and the huge markets of India.<n>Chinese foreign minister visited Kathmandu in December.<n>He said the line could be extended to the Nepalese capital.<n>It would create a tunnel under the world's tallest mountain.

Acetaminophen is the main ingredient in the over-the-counter pain reliever Tylenol.<n>This is the first time that this side effect has been discovered.<n>Researchers don't know if other pain relievers have the same effect.

Henry and Donna Lou Rayhons married seven years ago in their northern Iowa hometown.<n>But their domestic routine unraveled as Donna's health began to fail.<n>Last year, the 78-year-old woman was moved into a nursing home, suffering from dementia and Alzheimers.<n>Dispute developed over how to care for Donna Lou Rayhons, culminating in a meeting in which staff told Henry Rayhons that his wife was no longer mentally capable of legally consenting to have sex.<n>On Wednesday, he will stand trial for sexually assaulting his wife, who died last August.

Two houses have been filmed being swept away by floodwater in NSW.<n>One was filmed in Dungog, north of Sydney, while the other was in Lake Macquarie.<n>Three people have already died during the storms that have hit the region.

Report into the Iraq war was expected to be published after election.<n>But it is now thought to be delayed until at least 2016.<n>Tony Blair is expected to be come under intense scrutiny for sanctioning the war.

Laurene Jobs, 51, said Hillary Clinton is 'one of America’s greatest modern creations'<n>She added that it's not just because she's a woman - but 'the type of woman she is'<n>Mrs Clinton announced her intention to seek the Democratic nomination on Sunday.

Lloyd Dennis has been charged with 28 offences against two children.<n>The 32-year-old taught at a number of primary schools in Hampshire.<n>He is accused of offences including rape and sexual activity with a child.<n>Dennis will appear at Southampton Magistrates Court later this month.

Michael Keith Spell, 25, of Parachute, Colorado, was sentenced following a hearing in Sidney, Montana.<n>He pleaded guilty in October to killing Sherry Arnold, 43, after attempting to abduct the popular math teacher as she was jogging near her home in 2012.<n>Arnold's body was found months later buried in a shallow grave in a rural area near Williston, North Dakota.<n>Co-defendant Lester Van Waters Jr. was sentenced in December to 80 years in prison on a charge of deliberate homicide by accountability.

The fatberg was found beneath Draycott Avenue and Walton Street in Chelsea.<n>It was so heavy that it caused the 1940s sewer in the area to break.<n>The 40 metre long lump was made up of congealed waste including wet wipes.<n>So far Thames Water have removed the equivalent of five Porsche 911s.<n>A £400,000 repair is now being carried out to the sewer to fix it.

Brian Nicol, 32, died while staying in a villa in Nueva Andalucia.<n>He dived into the pool but failed to resurface on Easter Sunday morning.<n>His friends dragged him out of the water but he could not be saved.<n>Police said early evidence suggests his death was a tragic accident.<n>But they are investigating whether he suffered a blow to the head.

Artist Alison Nastasi has collated a collection of intimate portraits of well-known artists with their furry friends.<n>The images see the artists in rarely-seen settings, with many of them posing in a relaxed fashion with their beloved pets.<n>One intimate shot shows famous french Impressionist painter, Henri Matisse casually sat up in bed with his covers pulled up to his knees.

Nurhayada Sofia was out shopping with her mother at a mall in Malaysia.<n>CCTV footage captured the tragic moment she disappeared through a gap.<n>The youngster then plunged five floors and died on impact from head injuries.<n>Her mother was on the phone to her husband at the time of the accident.
