Donald Graham, 62, killed heiress and property developer Janet Brown, 45.<n>He stole £300,000 of her savings, her Land Rover and Porsche, took her horses and tried to siphon off thousands of pounds from her estate and that of her family.<n>Prosecutors wanted to reclaim ill-gotten gains, which they said totalled £816,127.86p, under the Proceeds of Crime Act.<n>But Newcastle Crown Court heard Graham, previously referred to in court as the Prince of Darkness, now has no available assets.

3.7 million of the short-fused gun owners also confessed to carrying weapons.<n>Majority of angry gun owners were young or middle aged men.<n>Study by Harvard, Columbia and Duke University quizzed 5,500 people.<n>Comes in the wake of a number of high-profile gun tragedies in the US.

Mohammed Morsi sentenced to 20 years for ordering arrest and torture.<n>But a Cairo court acquitted the 63-year-old leader of charges.<n>14 others were convicted on the same charges, with most also sentenced to jail.<n>Morsi came to power following the 2011 ouster of Hosni Mubarak.<n>But he was toppled by then-army chief and now President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi.

Grant Hackett's father has revealed his son's sleeping pill addiction was triggered by a death threat.<n>Neville Hackett said his son was threatened by a 'well-known associate of criminals' two years ago.<n>The threat led Hackett to hop on a plane to his parent's home in the Gold Coast.<n>The addiction to Stilnox led Hackett's personal life to fall apart last year.<n>It also began around the time he divorced Australian singer Candice Alley in August 2013.<n>The 34-year-old made a come back last Sunday when he earned a 2015 world titles relay team berth

The man, known only as Donor 7042, carries a defective gene known as neurofibromatosis 1 (NF1)<n>It can pass on a life-limiting condition to his offspring.<n>He is understood to have fathered 99 ‘Viking babies’ across the world.<n>The case has raised questions about Denmark’s booming sperm export trade.

Scott and Mayo Shirley and son Phoenix were flying back to Washington DC.<n>After putting luggage on the floor of the cabin, they noticed it was wet.<n>Mrs Shirley noticed the liquid and loudly pronounced it to be vomit.<n>Cabin staff told family a passenger had been sick and that the area had been cleaned.<n>Family were forced to remain in their seats because Mrs Shirley had to go to work next day.

Kevin Gill, from Naples, Florida, found the alligator injured outside his home and gave it to his son, 13, to nurse back to health.<n>But when deputies were serving a search warrant on the home for an unrelated issue, they found the baby gator and told Gill it was illegal.<n>It is a felony in Florida to keep an alligator without a license, regardless of its size.

The Library Hotel in Manhattan was designed around the Dewey Decimal System.<n>Each floor is dedicated to one of the system's 10 major categories.<n>Room categories include erotic literature, economics and Native American religion.

Stewart announced the date on his final show on Comedy Central.<n>He joked that he would be wearing a suit and be showered for the occasion.<n>Comes after he revealed he was becoming depressed watching cable news.<n>He will be replaced by comedian Trevor Noah, 31, who has been accused of antisemitism for comments made about Jews in tweets dating back to 2009.

Pageant models walked along one-metre wide footpath on cliff in Henan Province.<n>Judges said it was a 'test of their composure' as they walked up cliff pathway.<n>Models were competing in the Miss Bikini of the Universe contest.

Raul Castro was Arizona's only Hispanic governor and served from 1968 to 1986.<n>He was also an American ambassador to three countries including El Salvador, Bolivia and Argentina.<n>He is survived by his wife, Pat and his two daughters.

Dr Donald DeWitt, 65, charged with attempted sexual assault, child endangerment and criminal sexual contact.<n>Dewitt is a teacher at Bergen County Academies in Hackensack, New Jersey.<n>Victim's sister discovered DeWitt's lewd emails and told their mother, who then called police.<n>Dewitt is married with one son and one daughter.

A dummy was spotted on a boat sailing down the Thames with a fake missile.<n>The dummy was wearing a balaclava and had holes cut into his face.<n>A passer-by reported seeing the missile on a barge in Reading.<n>Police and an Army bomb disposal team responded to the call.<n>They confirmed the dummy was a fake and the weapon was 'purely ornamental'

Jerry Hugel, 83, his wife Marianne Hugel, 80, and Gloria Greco, 70, were found dead in their Queens home on Friday.<n>Walter Vondthadden, 76, and their friend were also found dead.<n>Police say the four died of apparent carbon monoxide poisoning.<n>The Hugels had lived in the home for 40 years and had five children.<n>The Hugels were described as a 'great family' very active in the local German community.

Kibulu the African lion cub was rejected by his mother at the NSW Zoo.<n>He was taken to Zambi Wildlife Retreat in Western Sydney.<n>Kibilu has shared director Donna Wilson's bed since he arrived nine months ago.<n>He still carries his teddy bear around with him and loves to suck on people's thumbs.

Hitler seems ill at ease with his hands, squeezing them into his lederhosen pockets in one photo, and perching them awkwardly on his hips in another.<n>In one ridiculous picture, he tilts his head and tries a mean and moody stare to camera, topped off by a military cap.<n>Rare archive photo discovered in a Hitler ‘fan magazine’ from the Thirties.
The House of Lies star also shares how her views on vaccinations actually changed after the birth of her daughters, Lincoln, two, and Delta, just four months.

Lauren Hill was diagnosed with inoperable brain tumour after 18th birthday.<n>Doctors told her she had just two years to live but she refused to give up.<n>She played four games for Mount St Joseph University in Cincinnati this season.<n>She raised $1.5million for childhood cancer and was honored by sports writers.<n>Hill died four months later after her condition worsened and she was too ill to play.

Man seen staggering towards 63-year-old before knocking him to floor.<n>Victim left lying on the floor and needing medical attention after incident.<n>Man, 34, questioned by police after coming forward to officers.<n>He was released this morning pending further inquiries.

Jade Walters, 21, loaned her beloved horse Magic to a family to help her learn to ride.<n>But the family who looked after the animal sold him at auction for £200.<n>Miss Walters has now launched a social media campaign to find Magic.<n>She said: 'He could be anywhere by now, I don't know how to find him'
The 56-year-old performed a stand-up routine on The Tonight Show on Thursday.<n>The routine did not go down too well and Madonna was criticised.<n>She wore Giuseppe Zanotti wedges for the show.

Holly Littlefield, 16, was arrested and held in a police cell for 14 hours.<n>She was accused of sending email threat to blow up school where she worked.<n>Zoe Gregory, 26, pleaded guilty to sending hoax email at Norwich court.<n>She is now likely to receive a lengthy jail term after admitting charge.
Giant sperm whale swam to inspect the robot sub.<n>Encounters between sperm whales and ROV's are 'quite rare'

Jonny Bucknell, 58, was eating in the chamber of Camden Council in London.<n>A Labour rival alerted other councillors and the mayor told him off.<n>Mr Bucknell claims he was unaware eating was banned and wants rule change.<n>He previously slept in his car at the Tory party conference.

The British actor was appointed on Tuesday as the first global advocate for the United Nations' Mine Action Service.<n>Craig will spend the next three years raising awareness for the U.N. Mine Action Service and political and financial support for the cause.<n>Last year, the United Nations said it destroyed more than 400,000 land mines and explosive remnants of war and more than 2,000 tons of obsolete ammunition.

Dog was discovered in play area of animal shelter in Antioch, California.<n>It has injuries to its ears and stomach and is named Fireman by rescuers.<n>It is believed the animal was burned by chemicals at a foster home.<n> Kristy Keusch from Umbrella of Hope is now caring for the dog.<n>She said: 'It’s hard not to get attached, I’d love to keep him'

In real life, 007 would have perished several times in his most recent movie.<n>One incident before opening credits would have 'turned his lungs out'<n>Other characters in other top films would also have struggled to escape.<n>They include John McClane in Die Hard and the serial killer in Halloween.

Yanomami are an indigenous ethnic group in the Amazonian region of South America.<n>There are about 26,000 Yanomami living in Brazil and 15,000 in Venezuela.<n>Researchers sequenced the microbiomes of Yanomami people living in a remote Amazon village in Venezuela.

Will Allen and his business partner Susan Daub are facing civil fraud charges from federal regulators.<n>They're accused of reaping more than $31 million in a Ponzi scheme.<n>The Securities and Exchange Commission announced the charges Monday against William D. Allen, Susan Daub and their Capital Financial Partners investment firms.<n>The SEC said Allen and Daub paid about $20 million to investors but received only around $13 million in loan repayments from athletes.<n>The pair used some funds from investors to cover personal charges at casinos and nightclubs, the agency alleged.

Silver the Jack Russell was banned from meeting the Prime Minister.<n>Prime Minister had greeted voters in the street after a speech in Cheltenham.<n>But aides ordered that the puppy be kept well away from the Tory leader.

Global music sales fell slightly in 2014 to $14.97 billion.<n>Digital formats have now caught up with physical sales for the first time.<n>The vinyl format has had a renaissance and now accounts for 2 percent of revenues.

Camino de Santiago pilgrimage route takes pilgrims nearly 500 miles to Santiago.<n>The long route begins at various points in north-western Spain.<n>But some residents have complained about pilgrims defecating outside homes.<n>Someone has put up signs warning pilgrims not to defecate on the trail.

Richard Hammond has released a ten-minute video on YouTube.<n>It follows the former Top Gear presenter as he learns to herd sheep.<n>The clip has already been watched 230,000 times on the video-sharing channel.<n>Comes after James May released a series of videos showcasing his jobless life.

Bruno Fernndez has been arrested in connection with disappearance of Adriana Giogiosa.<n>The 55-year-old was reported missing by her brother in Madrid, Spain.<n>Police found blood and a meat grinder at his home in Majadahonda, Madrid.<n>Neighbours have described how he was involved in apparent satanic rituals.

Hawaii scientists say a supervoid may account for an anomaly in the cosmic microwave background radiation of the universe.<n>In 2004 astronomers first found the 'Cold Spot' - a region 20 per cent less dense than elsewhere - and may now have an explanation for its formation.<n>A supervoid is a region of space that has less matter than other parts of the universe.<n>For this reason it can ‘sap’ the energy of light that is passing through it.<n>If confirmed, the supervoid would be the largest single structure ever found by humanity.

Unison member says nurses forced to work long hours treated like'slave labour'<n>Union has called for more research into effects of long shifts on staff health.<n>Comes as long shifts are now more common amid NHS staffing shortages.

Hiroshi Ueda invented the selfie stick after struggling to take pictures with his wife in Europe.<n>He came up with the idea after his camera was stolen by a child in the Louvre Museum in Paris.<n>He designed an extendable stick with a tripod screw at the end which he used to take pictures of himself and his wife.<n>The extender stick failed to become a success - mainly due to the poor image quality it captured.<n>But he kept using it and compiled a family album of'selfies' using his invention.
Amy, 24, has unveiled summer range of pastels and florals.<n>Says she loves curves and works out to keep her figure in shape.<n>Admits she has faced Twitter trolls.

Wealthy holiday home owners would 'chip in a bit' to protect services.<n>One in 10 homes are vacant for much of the year leaving locals priced out.<n>The Lib Dem leader said second home owners would 'like to chip in a bit'

Labour leader in Edinburgh to claim Tories are in 'desperation and panic'<n>But YouGov poll shows just 25% of Scots plan to back Labour in election.<n>49% of people plan to vote for the SNP, with just 25% backing Labour.<n>Result robs Mr Miliband of any chance of an overall majority.

Washington, DC-based company United Space Structures wants to create a new space station.<n>Their giant cylinder could apparently replace the ISS.<n>It would rotate four times per minute to create artificial gravity.<n>It would be 1,300ft (400 metres) long, cost £200 billion ($300 billion) and take 30 years to build.<n>Theory is that artificial gravity is required to support long term living in space.

Dr Mehmet Oz, 54, is the vice chairman and professor of surgery at Columbia's College of Physicians and Surgeons.<n>The Harvard-educated doctor joined the faculty at Columbia in 1993.<n>The doctors accused Dr Oz of pushing'miracle' weight-loss supplements with no scientific proof that they work.
Glenn Mason, 56, plundered the accounts of nine pensioners.<n>He was jailed for 15 months in November last year.<n>Mason has said he will pay back the whole £185,000 out of his pension pot.

Farm worker spotted urinating in a field of vegetables in Lincolnshire.<n>Member of the public took a picture and informed field owner TH Clements & Son.<n>The company said the worker was sacked with immediate effect.<n>Spokesman said he failed to follow company procedures which request all workers use the toilets provided.

Residents in Oldham, Manchester, had noticed rubbish piling up.<n>They were stunned to discover a binman had been dumping bags there.<n>The bin man was filmed lifting them out of dustbins before throwing them.<n>Council workers arrived days later and searched bags before issuing stickers.<n>Residents could face fines of up to £50,000 for not disposing of rubbish properly.

Scientists in California have described how to create artificial auroras.<n>They said a particle accelerator could be sent 185 miles (300km) up into space.<n>It would then fire high-energy beams back at Earth's atmosphere.<n>The beams would excite atoms and create colours which we see on the ground as auroras.<n>And the machine could also create lightning in the atmosphere.

Prince Abdul Malik and Dayangku Raabi'atul 'Adawiyyah Pengiran Haji Bolkiah married yesterday.<n>Prince William and Kate Middleton spent £24 million on their big day.<n>Kim Kardashian and Elizabeth Taylor have had multiple marriages that failed.

George Osborne met the doppelganger during a campaign stop in Somerset.<n>The Chancellor was given a tour of the Numatic factory where the machines are built.<n>He was promoting the Government's plan to create 16,000 new apprenticeships.

Casey Veal's son Zayden was just 10 months old when he was bludgeoned to death by a drug-crazed burglar.<n>The culprit was 19-year-old Harley Hicks who bashed baby Zayden more than 30 times with a homemade baton.<n>Hicks left the home with nothing more than a wallet and a pair of sunglasses.<n>He unplugged the baby monitor before unleashing the vicious attack on the defenceless baby while Ms Veal and Zayden's brother Xavier, then aged three, slept.

Ed and Justine Miliband first met at a dinner party hosted by Stephanie Flanders.<n>She was the glamorous then economics editor of BBC2's Newsnight.<n>Ed Miliband was chief economics adviser to the Chancellor, Gordon Brown.<n>Mrs Miliband said she was 'furious' when she found out he was'secretly dating'<n>The story offers a fascinating insight into the somewhat caddish character of the Labour Leader.

Brazil's 24 hour drugs market Crackland has become home to people from all walks of life.<n>From teenage mothers and fathers to truck drivers and homeless addicts, the market has become a haven.<n>Ketellin Silva, 17, the mother of a 3-year-old girl and baby boy, poses for a portrait in the open-air crack cocaine market.
Sheila Secker, 78, had not used her mobile for some time.<n>Vodafone retired her number without warning.<n>Grandmother collapsed in her home and died in hospital days later.

Stephen Howells, 39, and Nicole Vaisey, 25, were charged last summer with sexually exploiting the Amish girls and other children.<n>They 'abducted the girls, then seven and 12, from their family's farm roadside vegetable stand on August 13 and shackled them to a bed and sexually abused them'<n>The girls were released 24 hours later and found safe at a home 20 miles away.<n>The defendants have now been offered a plea deal that would spare the girls from testifying, the district attorney said.

For U.S. moms, the typical time between pregnancies is about 212 years but nearly a third of women space their children too close, a government study shows.<n>Experts say mothers should wait at least 18 months to give their body time to recover and increase the chances the next child is full-term and healthy.<n>The study released on Thursday by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention found that about 30 percent of women who'd had a child became pregnant again within 18 months.

German Field Marshal Erwin Rommel gained respect from his foes.<n>He was the one German leader the British regarded with honour.<n>During the battle for North Africa Rommel gained an iconic wartime figure.<n>He became known for his stylish goggles across his peak cap.<n>Now the story of how the German came to be in possession of them can be told for the first time.

Geralyn Ganci, 32, worked as a dispatcher for US Limousine on Long Island.<n>She said manager Raymond Townsend sent her lurid texts over a year.<n>Townsend said that she lost her job because she'refused to have sex with him'<n>He also sent her texts saying that he 'had to pull over to the side of the road and masturbate thinking about me', she said.<n>She was fired after he put his hand up her shirt in a bathroom on a day when his wife was not at work, she said.<n>Townsend and US Limousine are now liable

Thomas Cain, 83, assumed there was no surviving photograph of his mother.<n>She died when he was just 13 and he thought there was no record of her.<n>But his granddaughter Andrea Ferrell, 29, tracked down an old image in Florida.<n>Footage shows moment he sees the picture for the first time in 70 years.<n>Mr Cain is seen in the image as a teenager, which dates from the 1920s.

Letter reveals Darrell Issa asked about use of personal email in 2012.<n>But Clinton refused to answer - even after she left the State Department.<n>Issa wrote to the department to ask about its email policy.<n>But the reply did not go into detail - instead going into detail about Clinton.<n>It comes as Clinton begins her bid to become the Democrat's 2016 presidential candidate.
Memo for members of Congress says'special relationship' is over.<n>Wars that the UK faces turmoil if there is a hung parliament.<n>Uses the phrase coined by Winston Churchill in 1944.

Lawsuit filed by Joyce Kuhl accuses SeaWorld of 'false, misleading practices'<n>Claims orcas are kept in 8ft deep holding pools, leaving them 'essentially roasting'<n>Also alleges that chlorine used in their tanks is'many times stronger than household bleach'<n>Second lawsuit against SeaWorld in less than one month.

First Minister says she will back calls for all tax powers to be devolved.<n>But she admits MPs will vote for fiscal autonomy next year despite collapse in oil revenues.<n>Move would leave Scotland with £7.6billion black hole in its budget.<n>Labour leader Jim Murphy warns this would leave a 'catastrophic hole'

Bristol County Sheriff Thomas Hodgson said Hernandez knows how to use his charm and manipulate better than anyone he has ever seen.<n>'He would make every effort to get extra sandwiches,' Hodgson said. 'He would just try to convince the officers to give him more than what they otherwise could get'<n>Hernandez was convicted April 15 of the 2013 killing of Odin Lloyd, who was dating the sister of Hernandez's fiancee.

Nyia Parler, 41, allegedly left her quadriplegic son, 21, in a Pennsylvania park with just a blanket and a bible on Monday.<n>Relatives contacted by his school frantically replied to Parler's Facebook message on Tuesday, 'How the hell you happy?!? Call me!'<n>She was arrested in Maryland on Saturday and charged with assault and neglect.<n>Police say she will be arrested as soon as she is released from hospital.

Nicola Sturgeon has demanded an official investigation into leaked memo.<n>The SNP leader has denied telling French ambassador she would prefer Cameron.<n>She said account of private meeting with Sylvie Bermann was 'untrue'<n>Civil servant said Ms Sturgeon would 'almost certainly' have a large number of seats' in the Scottish Parliament if there was a hung parliament.<n>But she also suggested that Ed Miliband was not Prime Minister material.

Georgina Chapman, who is married to Harvey Weinstein, shared an Instagram image of a large bouquet of flowers he had bought for her on Tuesday.<n>It comes four days after it emerged Weinstein would not face criminal charges for allegedly groping an Italian model in his Manhattan office.<n>Ambra Battilana, 22, told police he touched her breasts and put his hand up her skirt during a 'business meeting' at his Tribeca Film Center office on March 27.<n>The Manhattan District Attorney's office investigated the model's claims but announced last Friday that it has decided not to prosecute Weinstein.

Blackburn, 72, says he never liked Savile but knew something was odd.<n>Claims most of his colleagues in the industry were 'just working hard'<n>Says he is outraged at how Gambaccini was treated after allegations.

Shiraz Nawaz, 36, was walking to his local takeaway in Shirley, Solihull.<n>He heard buzzing and saw black smoke billowing from manhole just seconds earlier.<n>As he turned around he noticed charred ground and watched on as flames shot out.<n>Firefighters extinguished the blaze which they said was caused by a fire in an underground link box - which distributes electricity.

Amber Phillips of Los Angeles expressed her support for the right to die law introduced in California on Tuesday.<n>Phillips said that her mother Connie Phillips would have wanted to end her own life to reclaim her dignity and autonomy.<n>Phillips said that her mother asked about ending her life via physician assisted suicide on numerous occasions but it was not a legal option for her.<n>'The pain and suffering took some of her dignity away when she became so ill that she was not able to work,' said Phillips of her mother who died in the summer of 2012.

Ashya King's parents took him abroad for proton beam therapy last year.<n>They then said he did not need chemotherapy and took him to Prague.<n>Family say he is now in remission and that there is 'no evidence' of tumour.<n>But doctors say he should have had chemotherapy within six weeks.<n>Consultant Peter Wilson said this would have halved Ashya's survival.

Amie Cox, 33, of Victoria made the ready admission of the sensory bond she has for son Alex, 5, over her older boy William, 7.<n>She said she has been attacked and been called 'a freak', but that she is 'a normal loving Mum'<n>Ms Cox said she didn't want anyone else to touch him or 'rub their smell on him' because it would interfere with his unique and special smell.<n>She said she doesn't like people to rub their smell on him by touching him and that continued for his first six to 12 months.

North Korean dictator pictured climbing Mount Paektu at sunrise.<n>The mountain is considered a sacred place in Korean folklore.<n>Kim Jong-Un said the climb gave him'more powerful than nuclear weapons'

Study found almost 30 million health records nationwide were involved in criminal theft, malicious hacking or other data breaches over four years.<n> Compromised information included patients' names, home addresses, ages, illnesses, test results or Social Security numbers.<n>Most involved electronic data and theft, including stolen laptops and computer thumb drives.<n>Experts say thieves may try to use patients' personal information to fraudulently obtain medical services.

Abdul Hadi Arwani, 48, was found dead in his car in Wembley last week.<n>Today CPS announced that Leslie Cooper, 36, would be charged.<n>He appeared before magistrates in Camberwell today for a brief hearing.<n>Cooper, from Brent, will appear at the Old Bailey later this week.<n>Scotland Yard said tonight that a second man, 61, had been arrested.

George Osborne was booed at the Paralympic Games in front of his children.<n>The Chancellor says he never felt low but it was difficult to explain.<n>He has since gone on to be credited with helping the economy.

Queen's Hospital, Burton, ran out of space over the Easter weekend.<n>Bosses didn't tell relatives about arrangement to store bodies in refrigerated lorry.<n>Spokesman said it was normal practice across the country.

Married couple John and Karen Copleston claim Paul Phillips, 67, 'constantly harassed' them over a petty dispute.<n>Retired Mr Phillips accused the Coplestons of putting gate up on communal land and took matter to council planners.<n>When couple challenged him they say claim embarked on a campaign of misery that forced them to install CCTV cameras to catch him in action.<n> covert footage caught Mr Phillips fiddling with gate's lock, waving and smiling at the camera and repeatedly setting off a motion sensor.<n>But the case against Mr Phillips was dismissed, although a three-year restraining order was imposed on him

Video was taken from a plane yesterday and shows the booster hitting the barge.<n>The 14-storey booster manages to hit the platform, before a gust of wind sways it to one side.<n>The maneuver was attempted following the launch of the Falcon 9 rocket.<n>It was launched from Cape Canaveral in Florida and was headed to the space station.

Harley Jo Skorpenske, from Ohio, suffers from lupus, an autoimmune disease which causes the body to attack its own tissue.<n>A stranger left a note on Harley's car claiming she had no right to park in a disabled space, despite her handicap tag.<n>Harley's mother Corinna Skorpenske took to Facebook to publicly shame the person who wrote the note.

BBC drama Wolf Hall was broadcast in the USA for the first time.<n>Review by Catholic News Service said it was 'prejudice-laden'<n>It said the show 'adopts a narrow, revisionist and anti-Catholic point of view'<n>It also said the depiction of Sir Thomas More was 'not a pretty sight'<n>Follows criticism from clergy in the UK for its 'perverse' depictions.

Wayne Heneker shot dead a gunman who tried to rob him last year.<n>The security guard was delivering money to a local tavern in Queensland.<n>He only realised seconds after the shooting that the gunman was his friend.<n>The father-of-two says he is still haunted by the attack which took place last year.

Muslim couple Hafeez Batthi, 33, and his wife, Khalida, 26, have been described as 'hardworking, honest and kind' by members of the local Islamic community.<n>The couple were abused by a middle-aged woman on a Sydney train on Wednesday afternoon.<n>Stacey Eden, 23, overheard the ranter insulting the Muslim couple as 'ISIS terrorists' and was recorded on video standing up for the couple.<n>The couple's mosque in Brisbane has offered Ms Eden and her partner an all-expenses-paid trip to visit the Gold Coast for a night and to see their mosque.
Stevie McCrorie won The Voice UK 2015.<n>Previous winners have failed to break into the top 100.<n>Leanne Mitchell was dropped by her record label.<n>She now works as a holiday camp performer.

Thomas Buckett, 21, plunged 15ft after friends dared him to jump on a skylight.<n>He had broken into the tuck shop and stolen food and drink in May 2010.<n>Staffordshire County Council ordered Mr Buckett's family to pay £150,000.<n>But judge said the family could be left with a huge legal bill after failing to sue.

Jessica Kemp says teachers threatened to remove her son from class.<n>Claims teachers at Seminole County Elementary said the oils smelled.<n>The 32-year-old says she applies the liquid to her son's head and neck.<n>Claims it helps him keep calm and focused and is a positive for him.<n>However, the school district has said it will not suspend him over the issue.

Leaked affidavit says prisoner heard Gray 'banging against the walls'<n>Claims he could not see what Gray was doing, since they were separated by metal partition.<n>Report was leaked to Washington Post under proviso prisoner remains anonymous.<n>Questions about accuracy and favorable light which it shines on Baltimore police force.

New Horizons spacecraft has taken its first colour image of Pluto.<n>Taken from a distance of 71 million miles (115 million km), it doesn’t reveal a huge amount of detail - but it is a sign of things to come.<n>On 14 July 2015 the spacecraft will begin its historic encounter with Pluto.<n>It will map the surface of Pluto and its moon Charon to a resolution of 25 miles (40km) - far better than anything possible before.<n>The mission will officially end in 2026, but the images will continue to improve until the spacecraft flies by.

Angela Kelly, 67, from Croydon, suffered from arthritis in her knee.<n>She wore high heels for many years and was left in constant pain.<n>A new study suggests they can put pressure on knee joints.<n>This can wear away cartilage and increase the risk of osteoarthritis.

Andrew Sadek's body was found in a river with a bullet to the head.<n>He had been working as a confidential informant for a drug task force.<n>His mother, Tammy believes that he signed his death warrant when he began working for the force.<n>Investigators haven't concluded whether Sadek was slain or killed himself.

Women are most popular at 25 years and 10 months, study shows.<n>Men hit the friendship high point a little later at 27 years and three months.<n>Third of adults met their closest friends at school and a fifth at work.

Vladimir Putin appeared on Russian TV today to insist there were no troops in Ukraine.<n>His appearance is radically different to how he was previously pictured.<n>In both photographs the skin of Putin's face is more saggy.<n>In both photographs the skin has visible dark circles under his eyes.<n> persistent rumours he has undergone cosmetic surgery.

French model is filmed and photographed as she 'ages' an average of five years throughout a typical working day.<n>The Parisian public observe her appearance and judge her as older as the day progresses.<n>The working mother-of-two is seen drying her hair first thing, dropping her two young children off at school, working out, working on a computer in the office, food shopping and more.

A beachfront property with summer and winter cottages has gone on the market for £3million in Cornwall.<n>Smugglers Cottage in Smugglers Cove, near Portreath, has a summer and winter cottage, cleverly linked via a lift.<n>The property has seven bedrooms, six reception rooms and seven bathrooms.<n>It has direct access to the beach and an amazing view of uninterrupted coast and open sea.

Jason Rezaian, 39, has been detained in Iran for eight months.<n>He is the Washington Post's Tehran bureau chief.<n>Iranian officials announced in January that he would stand trial.<n>But they did not elaborate what the'security charges' were.<n>Iranian news agency claims he has been accused of 'espionage'<n>Report alleges he sold Iran's economic and industrial information to Americans.

The Sigma Alpha Epsilon fraternity at Clemson University in South Carolina has been put on probation for two years.<n>The group held a Christmas theme party that flared up racial tensions on campus.<n>White students threw stereotypical gang symbols while dressed in red and blue bandanas, T-shirts with images of the late rapper Tupac Shakur and fake 'thug' tattoos.<n>The party was also reportedly attended by female students from several sororities.

A man has been rescued twice in the same night from Darling Harbour.<n>Paramedics were called to Cockle Bay Wharf on Saturday night.<n>The man was on the boat dock when emergency services were called.<n>He was fished out of the water but lost his footing and fell backwards.<n>The man was disorientated after both of his falls and was treated at the scene.

Craig and Bonnie Morgan want their son Craig Jr, nine, to have a private education.<n>They are selling their home in Hastings to pay for his prep school fees.<n>The Morgans also slashed their weekly grocery bills by more than half.<n>They are hoping members of the public will help them achieve their dream.

Pope Francis made the comments at a 100th anniversary Mass on Sunday.<n>Turkey said it was 'deeply sorry and disappointed' in the pope's comments.<n>It added that his comments had caused a 'problem of trust'

The Chilkoot Trail in British Columbia was used by thousands of men.<n>Thousands of men and animals died on the 32-mile hike during the Klondike Gold Rush.<n>The trail is now a memorial to the men who lost their lives on it.

Scientists found traces of compounds in camomile and yarrow in Neanderthal teeth.<n>They say the plants may have been used to make food more palatable.<n>This is despite previously believing they used them as self-medication.<n>Neanderthals may also have cooked their food in the skins of animals.

The coyote was spotted on the grounds of a co-op building next to a church in Chelsea, New York, around 9am on Tuesday.<n>NYPD officers arrived at the scene but the animal did not surrender.<n>It was eventually captured more than an hour later when cops shot it with a dart laced with Ketaset.<n>The coyote was placed in a containment box and transported to an animal control facility for evaluation.<n>It is the second time in less than two weeks that a coyote has been sighted in New York.

Woman boarded bus in Ozone Park, Queens, and recorded driver.<n>She said he was driving with his wrists and forearms in his hand.<n>Papers were timetables used to make sure he was stopping at correct junctures.<n>Bus was replacing part of a closed subway line during the weekend.<n>Driver could face possible termination or retraining depending on his history.

The bodies of a 37-year-old woman, a 2-year-old girl and an 8-year-old boy were discovered by police Monday night.<n>Investigators were trying to determine the circumstances surrounding the deaths.<n>The victims have been identified as Christie Fradeneck, her daughter Celeste Fradeneck and her son Timothy Fradeneck.<n>Charges aren't likely until Wednesday at the earliest.

The Sydney Harbour Bridge has topped the list as the most photographed Australian landmark on Instagram.<n>It is followed by Sydney's popular Bondi Beach which has been ranked second with 261,911 photos.<n>The famous tourist attractions were listed in the 20 most 'Instagrammed' places in Australia.<n>Others include the Twelve Apostles along the Great Ocean Road in Victoria, Uluru and the Big Banana in Coffs Harbour.

The unnamed teacher is accused of giving his students the eight-page handout at Foster High School in Richmond, Texas.<n>The handout, entitled Islam/Radical Islam (Did You Know), made unsubstantiated claims like: '38 percent of Muslims believe people that leave the faith should be executed'<n>It also mentioned Sharia Law, jihad, and had a section entitled; 'If taken hostage by radical Islamists, what to do'<n>Authorities haven't yet released the name of the teacher at Foster High School or what discipline he faces.

90% of bets placed on the sex of the new royal baby have been in favour of a girl.<n>Alice and Victoria are the current favourites for the title.<n>The 25th April due date is also proving popular with betting fans.

Stephanie Scott's funeral will be held next Wednesday at the venue where she planned to wed childhood sweetheart Aaron Leeson-Woolley.<n>A memorial will be held at the Eat Your Greens function centre in Eugowra, near Ms Scott's home town of Canowindra in rural Central West NSW.<n>Ms Scott was excitedly preparing the last minute details for her wedding and her honeymoon to Tahiti when she disappeared on Easter Sunday.<n>She was set to tie the knot last Saturday at the Eat Your Greens centre, instead her life will be celebrated in the same place at a memorial at 1pm this Wednesday

Sol Campbell is part of a new campaign to encourage minorities to register to vote.<n>Former Arsenal and England defender has joined forces with David Harewood, musician Tinie Tempah and Paralympic medallist Ade Adepitan.<n>The campaign, run by Operation Black Vote, features the stars in striking photographs ahead of the voting registration deadline on April 20.

Edward Fride is the pastor at Christ the King in Ann Arbor, Michigan.<n>He suggested parishioners attend concealed pistol classes.<n>He warned that crime had gone up in the area while budget cuts meant that there had been a'significant reduction in the availability of an armed police response'

London-born street artist Plastic Jesus erected several 'No Kardashian Parking Anytime' signs around Los Angeles this week.<n>The signs were erected in front of the Dash clothing store, the Ivy Restaurant and Cecconi's on Melrose.<n>Plastic Jesus says he came up with the idea after a Kardashian shopping trip on Melrose brought traffic to a standstill.<n>He says the stunt was not meant to target the Kardashians specifically but the reality TV star obsession in general.
The 37-year-old model and her husband Alex Mehran are currently enjoying a family vacation in a tropical destination.

Temperatures in the South could reach 23C (73F) by Wednesday, forecasters say.<n>Five flood alerts in place today for Devon, Cornwall, Somerset, Bristol and Cumbria.<n>Tomorrow will see mist and low cloud disperse from most parts of Britain in the morning to leave a bright day.

Aidan Turner set hearts aflutter with shirtless scything scene in Poldark.<n>But scything experts say his 'excessive grunting' and 'terrible technique' are wrong.<n>They say in real life, Turner would have run out of breath long before mowing.<n>Scything expert Chris Riley says his own physique is more like Iggy Pop.

Marks & Spencer is stocking the Bouea macrophylla – or mango plum.<n>The fruit has a bright orange edible skin and will go on sale this weekend.<n>It has a sweet taste similar to an Alphonso mango but with a softer texture.

Liam Linford Oliver-Christie, 29, caught with drugs under floorboards in raid.<n>Officers uncovered haul and 'drugs paraphernalia' with help of sniffer dog.<n>He was jailed in August 2012 for 'turning blind eye' to drug dealing at home.<n>Son of former Olympic sprinter Linford Christie has previous burglary conviction.

The Army gave the Purple Hearts to survivors and relatives of the dead in a somber ceremony on the Texas military post on Friday.<n>Thirteen people were killed and 31 were injured in the 2009 attack carried out by an Army psychiatrist who is now on military death row.<n>Top military commanders recalled tables that became makeshift stretchers to transport the wounded and dying.<n>But words of gratitude from military leaders and elected officials gave way to medal recipients pressing and chastising the Pentagon over combat benefits.

Virgin Australia has launched complimentary food on all domestic flights.<n>The airline will also offer free checked baggage on all flights.<n>Virgin hailed the move as further proof as another step in its transformation into a premium, contemporary, full service airline.

Nikko Jenkins, 28, tried to carve '666' into his forehead with a mirror.<n>But with a series of upside-down 9s, the numbers came out backwards.<n> symbol is described in the biblical book of Revelation as 'the sign of the beast'<n>It comes amid ongoing appeal that he is mentally unstable and ineligible for death penalty.
DJ denies nine charges of indecent assault and two of sexual touching.<n>Alleged attacks on three girls and three women over 23 years.<n>Former Pop Idol judge, 53, of Chelsea, London, granted bail.

Ben Parson, 34, of Brighton, East Sussex, proposed to Anna Jefferson, 36.<n>She was watching him run in the Brighton marathon with their children.<n>Ben carried on with the race and completed his sixth Brighton Marathon.

Ken Broskey, 69, of Livonia, Michigan, has been diagnosed with stage 4 cancer and has been urged to check into hospice care.<n>Instead, he has taken a job as an Uber driver, hoping to earn enough money to pay off his mortgage before he dies.<n>Now he is getting a little help too from Uber after they heard about his story and donated $5,000 to him and $1 to a GoFundMe campaign set up for him.

Ham is currently on exhibit at the Global Sources spring electronics show in Hong Kong.<n>The robot is made using soft-bodied mechanical engineering and nanotechnology.<n>It can recognise and respond to a number of human facial expressions.

Xavier Denamur sparked fury after he exposed France as a country of microwave cheats.<n>He said almost three quarters of all dishes served in French bistros are microwaved.<n>He also compared it to being the culinary equivalent of a low-cost airline.<n>France's crown as the world's culinary king has been slipping for some time.

Mohammed Tahir, 53, of Leytonstone, east London, got off his train at Mile End.<n>He followed a young woman onto a train, unaware that officer were watching his every move.<n>Tah Tahir was convicted of sexual assault after a two-day trial at the Old Bailey.<n>Judge Rebecca Poulet QC said that the experience was 'frightening and shocking'

Gilberto Valle, a former New York police officer, was arrested in 2012 for allegedly plotting to kidnap, torture, and eat his wife and other women.<n>In the HBO documentary Thought Crimes, he talks about his arrest and his stomach-churning fantasies.<n>Valle insists throughout the film that he never intended to actually hurt anyone.

Craig Roberts, 36, was told he had to leave his guide dog outside.<n>He explained his two-year-old Golden Labrador Retriever Cross was a guide dog.<n>But the employee allegedly still insisted he should be left outside.<n>Mr Roberts was left feeling 'angry and shocked' at the treatment.<n>He has only 30 per cent vision in one eye which means he can't work.

Emma Forbes, 49, made a handsome profit on sale of previous flat in Chelsea.<n>She and hedge fund boss husband Graham Clempson bought it for £18.5m in 2007.<n>They spent large sums on revamping it and moved in in February.<n>One neighbour described it as looking like a 'downmarket mortuary'

Photographer Denis Budkov, 35, captured the heartwarming scenes in Kamchatka, Russia.<n>The family of bears were pictured playing and sleeping on the banks of a lake.<n>One cub clambered on to the mother's back to take a nap while the other snoozed.
Less Than 100, a Pittsburgh pop-up shop, is not-for-profit and aims to highlight the wage gap between the sexes.

Violet Price, 80, had been missing from her home in Moustier village since last week.<n>Her son was unable to reach her by phone after she attended dinner party.<n>Police immediately started looking for the 80-year-old widow.<n>A 32-year-old man has now been arrested and charged with murder.<n>He told police where to find body parts and was known to Mrs Price.

The island, Por-Bajin, was found in the centre of a remote lake high in the mountains of southern Siberia.<n>It is unknown for certain what the rectangular island and its labyrinthine ruins, located in a lake in deepest Siberia, was actually used for.<n>Historians and scientists are divided, but some experts believe the isolated area may have been built to attract people instead imprisoning them.
Millie Marotta, 36, from Tenby, West Wales, has sold 500,000 copies.<n>The colouring book features intricate designs and patterns.<n>Took Millie eight months to complete the illustrations.

Biologist Karstein Erstad found the worms while skiing in the mountains.<n>He said they appeared dead when he found them, but when he put them in his hand he found they were alive.<n>There have been multiple reports of worm rainfall in Norway.

Jonathan Krueger, a junior at the University of Kentucky, was shot and killed early Friday morning.<n>Police say he was shot in the chest during an attempted robbery.<n>Justin Smith, 18, has been charged with Krueger's murder.<n>Police are still looking for more suspects.

Freddie Gray died Sunday after he 'had his spine 80 per cent severed at his neck' during an arrest in Baltimore last Sunday.<n>Police documents filed Monday said that the man was arrested by Officer Garrett Miller for having a switchblade knife after being stopped because he 'fled unprovoked'<n>The mayor said Monday that she is frustrated by the lack of answers given in the police report.<n>Six officers have been suspended, but investigators say they still don’t know how it happened.

Robert Fidler built house in Salfords, Surrey, without planning permission.<n>The 66-year-old hid behind hay bales and used tyres to hide it from authorities.<n>He unveiled it officially in 2006 when he thought he could exploit legal loophole.<n>But local authority refused retrospective permission and he has now lost nine-year legal battle.<n>Home on Green Belt land is worth more than £1million if sold on open market.

Memorials to British colonialists defaced by mainly young black protesters.<n>Vandals poured paint over statues of Queen Victoria and King George V.<n>A bronze rider marking the Anglo-Boer War from 1899 to 1902 was toppled.

Tina Fey was spotted for the first time since the suicide of Dr. Fredric Brandt on Friday.<n>The writer, actress and producer was on a school run with her youngest daughter Penelope and husband Jeff Richmond.<n>Dr. Brandt took his own life on April 5 and was said to be devastated over a caricature of him, Dr. Franff, on Fey's show Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt.<n>Fey has yet to publicly speak about Dr. Brandt's suicide.

Mohammed Dahbi ordered Kassie Thornton and her TV partner Christy Spitzer to stop kissing and 'keep that behavior for the bedroom'<n>When they got out, he called them 'b*****', 'c****' and 'whores'<n>He was ordered to pay the couple $10,000 in damages and attend anti-discrimination training.

Expert says films and TV shows depicting 'beautiful young vampires' are driving a new generation of people dabbling in the occult.<n>TV shows True Blood and Twilight are said to be encouraging the surge.<n>Such incidents are considered a form of demonic possession by the Vatican.

Karen Gaynor appeared at Rotherham Magistrates Court accused of causing criminal damage by pruning a tree.<n>Her neighbour Kay Daye complained to the council about the tree near her home in Rotherham.<n>Magistrates took just 15 minutes to find Ms Gaynor not guilty of the charge.<n>They said she had acted with good intentions and had exceeded her legal excuse.

Bullock called 911 after spotting a man in her home heading for the attic.<n>The roughly 15-minute conversation with a 911 dispatcher was played in court Thursday.<n>Joshua Corbett is charged with stalking and breaking into Bullock's home last summer.<n>A judge is currently deciding whether there is enough evidence for Corbett to go on trial.

ComRes poll reveals 54% want Sturgeon kept out of next UK government.<n>And 59% want SNP as a whole to play no part in running the country.<n>SNP has set out demands for as price propping up Labour government.<n>Pledged rest of UK would have 'hand of friendship' in next government.<n>But Miliband and Sturgeon have ruled out formal coalition with SNP.

David Cameron will announce the move today as he pledges to commit £8billion to fund the health service.<n>The figure named by NHS boss Simon Stevens as the amount needed to plug a £30billion hole in the health service’s accounts.<n>The Prime Minister said last night he was ‘utterly committed’ to the health service.

Tom Ryan, 40, was making deliveries on Staten Island when he was hit.<n>His other leg was hanging by a thread and witnesses used a shirt as tourniquet.<n>He was taken to hospital and is expected to survive, UPS said.

Mercedes Benz Fashion Week Australia showcased punk fashion on Tuesday.<n>Khim Hang, Phoenix Keating, Alice McCall and Zhivago showcased the collection.<n>Punk fashion featured fishnets, tattoos, stocking caps and leather harnesses.

Giggs apologised to Rhodri for affair four years after it was revealed.<n>Brothers are now reconciling in an attempt to rebuild their relationship.<n>Rhodri's wife Natasha had an eight-year affair with Ryan.<n>Ryan tried to silence Imogen Thomas by getting a High Court injunction.<n>His attempt backfired when an MP named him in parliament.

SNP leader sparks outrage by refusing to rule out a second vote on independence.<n>Lib Dem leader Nick Clegg warns the entire country would suffer.<n>Ms Sturgeon has spent the day campaigning in a nursery in Loanhead.

Bookies are seeing a flood of cash on the Tories ahead of the general election.<n>One bookie alone has taken five bets for more than £10,000 on Tories.<n>Not a single bet of this size on Labour, MailOnline can reveal.<n>Polls suggest voters expect Cameron to remain Prime Minister.

Patrick O'Melia was on patrol in DeLand, Florida, when he was flagged down.<n>He found Justin Braddock, 34, slumped in front seat of a car unconscious.<n>Mr O'Melia gave him CPR for seven minutes and revived him.<n>Braddock fled from officers in hospital but was caught as he ran away.<n>He was later charged with neglect and his sister was also charged.

Larung Gar Buddhist Academy is home to 40,000 monks and nuns.<n>The colourful settlement has sprung up in the 1980s and is now a haven for religious devotees.<n>The wooden huts are built so closely together, they look like a red sea spreading up the hilly terrain.

Documents found in home of former Iraqi Army colonel Haji Bakr.<n>He was a close advisor to Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi and was executed in 2014.<n>ISIS militants are being led by former Baathist officials and strategists.

The 223ft Explorer comes with its own helipad, infinity pool and plenty of space for supercar and jetski storage.<n>The concept yacht from British yacht designer Tony Castro has space for 12 lucky guests on board.<n>According to Tony Castro Design, the superyacht costs approximately 40million euros to build.

Gemini 4 mission in June 1965 was first US spacewalk.<n>Astronauts had to open and close the hatch of the spacecraft.<n>Blood was found on checklist after one of them cut their hand.<n>Had they not been able to lock hatch, they would have been lost in space.<n>Document is expected to sell for £80,000 ($120,000) at auction.

Andrei Lunev was injured while reporting on fighting in Shyrokyne, East Ukraine.<n>He suffered serious head and lower extremities wounds after stepping on tripwire.<n>Incident took place in the wake of several exchanges of fire overnight.<n>Conflict between Russian-backed rebels and Kiev government forces has claimed more than 6,000 lives.

Steve Esmond and his wife, Dr Theresa Devine, and their two teenage sons fell seriously ill during their stay on the island of St. John.<n>The family were airlifted to separate hospitals in Philadelphia suffering major respiratory trauma.<n>The US Environmental Protection Agency said it is contacting people including employees at Sirenusa resort in St. John to determine how many others might have been exposed to the pesticide.

Mary Day, 60, fraudulently claimed £16,500 of income support and disability allowance.<n>She used the money to go on luxury holidays to the Indian resort of Goa.<n>Day's savings were £11,000 above the £16,000 threshold for savings.<n>She was caught after an anonymous tip-off to benefits officers.<n>She was sentenced to three months in prison, but suspended for 12 months.

Two women knocked out and a reveller arrested after mass brawl at Pontins.<n>Police called after teenagers started 'running riot' and women threw chairs.<n>Fight started in main hall before spilling out to an outside area, say holidaymakers.<n>Man, 26, arrested on suspicion of section 47 assault and police are investigating.

David Nellist, 38, of Keswick, Cumbria was caught on CCTV beating his dog.<n>A neighbour heard the young spaniel cross called Coco'screaming'<n>Nellist was sentenced to two months in prison, suspended for 18 months, banned from keeping animals for five years.

The white-cheeked macaque was discovered in the remote highland forests of south-east Tibet.<n>It has a rounded penis rather than the arrow shaped genitalia found on other species in the area.<n>The monkey has been named Macaca leucogenys after its pale whiskers on its chin and the side of its face.

Bradley Manning, 27, was convicted of espionage in July 2013 for leaking a trove of classified documents to WikiLeaks.<n>He was sentenced to 35 years prison.<n>One month after being found guilty, Manning announced that he had always identified as female.<n>In February, after suing the Defense Department, Manning was approved for hormone treatment, allowing the former Army private to make the transition into a woman while serving out her sentence.<n>In the new interview, Manning describes the 'painful and awkward' process of transitioning from a man to a woman.

Labour leader Ed Miliband has jumped ahead of the Prime Minister in ratings.<n>Labour has also taken a commanding four point lead over the Tories.<n>Poll comes in the wake of a furious political row over the Labour leader's character.

Shadow business secretary Chuka Umunna said he was opposed to 'taxing for the sake of taxing'<n>Remarks highlighted divisions in Labour's top ranks over the 50p rate.<n>The rate was introduced for the last few weeks of Gordon Brown's government as a trap for the Tories.

A survey by Skout found that grilled cheese lovers have more sex.<n>And that they are more charitable than those who don't like the snack.<n>The most popular filling is American cheese, followed by cheddar.

Dave Hughes called radio broadcaster Derryn Hinch a 'w**ker' on national television.<n>Hinch was on the Q&A panel with Hughes on Monday night.<n>The pair were discussing alcohol and depression after a video surfaced of Prime Minister Tony Abbott skolling a beer in a pub.<n>Hughes said he would not recant his comment about Hinch.

The Harewood Arms in Wakefield, West Yorkshire, has publicly revealed its support for UKIP.<n>The pub, known for proudly flying the gay pride flag outside its premises, declared its support for Nigel Farage's party.<n>It has left regular customers stunned and provoked a 'Marmite' reaction of divided opinions.

Blanca Cousins, 15, fell to her death from the 21st floor of a luxury apartment block in Hong Kong.<n>Police say she had locked herself in bathroom and was found by her mother.<n>Her father Nick Cousins, 57, is the managing director of Jardine Lloyd Thompson's Hong Kong office.<n>Mr Cousins and his partner Grace Garcia Cousins were arrested on suspicion of causing death by dangerous behaviour.<n>The couple were also being questioned over claims Mrs Cousins had overstayed her visa.

Activity in parts of Reynosa, a city across the Rio Grande.<n>from McAllen, Texas, ground to a halt on Friday afternoon.<n>Three suspected assailants were killed during the confrontations and two state police.<n>were injured.<n>Earlier in the day, federal police and marines captured 'El.<n>Gafe,' a leader of the Gulf cartel.<n>On Saturday, Mexican authorities confirmed the capture of Jose Tiburcio Hernandez Fuentes.

Jake Castner, 19, went into hiding last week after a warrant was issued for his arrest in relation to a string of thefts.<n>The troubled teenager’s Facebook page is littered with drug references including offers of ‘bud for cash’ and an image of him smoking a glass pipe.<n>Joked about the ‘nightmare’ title a magistrate gave him last year when he pleaded guilty to 33 offences.<n>He begged for a lift to hospital and asked for his mother’s phone number.

Albert the grey cat has racked up 44.1k followers on Instagram.<n>Named after famous physician Albert Einstein due to his wild hair.<n>He is a breed of Selkirk Rex cat, known for their wild, curly hair.

Kelly Watson, 41, was diagnosed with early-onset dementia on her 41st birthday.<n>She said the joys of watching daughter Holly grow up had been'stolen from her'<n>Kelly and Holly moved in with her mother Moira after her condition deteriorated.<n>She now attends a dementia support group five days a week.

Training is 'heavily geared' towards young people, leaving older workers behind.<n>Over-55s have same literacy and numeracy skills as those aged 16 to 24.<n>But they are worse at these skills than colleagues in their 30s and 40s.

Kent Sprouse was convicted of killing two people in 2002.<n>One was a customer at a gas station and the other was a police officer.<n>Sprouse was put to death by lethal injection Thursday night.<n>He died 22 minutes after being injected.

The Shcherbakov family adopted the cub after it wandered up to their gate.<n>The family matriarch feeds it porridge and milk from a refashioned beer bottle.<n>The bear, nicknamed Mishutka, will soon become a massive beast.<n>Wildlife experts caution against bringing an orphaned bear into the home.

A 20-year-old man flipped a Holden Commodore during a police chase on the Gold Coast.<n>Officers can be seen extinguishing the flames and administering first aid.<n>One woman pleads with police to save her boyfriend, who is trapped inside.<n>But rather than gratitude, some friends of the injured can later be heard threatening police.<n>'Take off your badge, let's go, come on,' says a shirtless man.

Anna Foord convinced victims to buy low grade gems overvalued by 2,000%.<n>The 30-year-old even flew to New York to shop in Fifth Avenue boutiques.<n>She was part of a gang of fraudsters who lived lavish lifestyles.<n>But they were arrested and Foord was convicted of conspiracy to defraud.
Rye Silverman, 32, is the latest real life model to star in the label's Fashion Truth campaign.

Lorraine Valentine, 42, has erythropoietic protoporphyria (EPP)<n>It causes her skin to burn and become unbearable itchy when exposed to sunlight or UV light.<n>Mother-of-four was hospitalised for six days during a holiday abroad.<n>Even a small dose of sun on her skin leaves her in pain and in need of a fan.<n>She is desperate for a drug that can help her as temperatures rise.

Experts say it is better to manage our energy consumption than to try and work it off afterward.<n>For four solid mini chocolate Easter eggs it would take 30 to 40 minutes of walking to work off the 550 kilojoules.<n>A female of average weight would need to walk for the full 40 minutes, whereas an 80 kilogram male could burn it off in 30 minutes.<n>Two hot cross buns takes up to 50 minutes running and if you have lathered it with butter and jam, it would take 80 minutes of running.

Ronald Reagan asked Mikhail Gorbachev for support in event of alien invasion.<n>President asked Soviet leader for help at a peace summit in Geneva in 1985.<n>Reagan repeated the warning when he spoke to a group of students.<n>His subsequent speeches were examined by his advisers to remove any mention of aliens in them.

Gina Maria Schumacher, 17, was one of the participants in the NRHA European Futurity Horse Show in the Bavarian town of Kreuth.<n>The horse show continues until Saturday evening, when she is expected to take part in the grand final.<n>Michael Schumacher's daughter looked every inch the professional rider throughout the tournament.

The Duchess of Cambridge is due to give birth later this week.<n>She has seen the Anmer nursery given a Beatrix Potter theme.<n>The paint for the pots is thought to have come from Dragons of Knightsbridge.<n>The nursery at Kensington Palace will also have a Beatrix Potter theme.

Kieron Power was stopped by police after taking pictures of two vehicles.<n>His wife had previously been given a £110 ticket for stopping in same place.<n>Mr Power was questioned under anti-terror laws after taking pictures.

Geraldine Schultz, 67, died when tornado struck her home in Fairdale.<n>Image showing her with husband Clem, 84, was found 35 miles away.<n>It was taken in 1980 and was taken to feature in a church directory.<n>Facebook group set up to reunite owners with their property led to it being claimed.

Homes such as these in China are known as 'dingzihu' or 'nail houses' because they stick out and are difficult to remove.<n>One house in Wenling, Zhejiang province, had a main road built around it when the owner refused to move.<n>Another image shows a house sitting alone in a crater at the centre of a construction site in Chongqing Municipality.

Mary Kay Letourneau and her husband Vili Fualaau will talk about their marriage in an interview with Barbara Walters on Friday.<n>They will also discuss how they make their marriage work despite the 21-year age gap and how they hope to teach again.<n>Letourneau was arrested for having a sexual relationship with Fualaau when he was 12 and she was 33.<n>She fell pregnant with his child when he was 13 and served seven years in prison - but they married and have two daughters.

This is according to cuts seen on fossils dating back 57,600 years.<n>Marks were found on the bones of two adults and a child unearthed in France.<n>They show Neanderthals may have eaten deceased friends or family.<n>Similar marks have been seen at other Neanderthal sites.

Alison Sharland, 47, agreed £10.35m settlement in deal with Charlie Sharland.<n>She believed it was half his fortune, but his firm AppSense was later valued at £132m.<n>Court of Appeal found Mr Sharland had deliberately hidden information.<n>But he refused to overturn the divorce settlement and will now take case to Supreme Court.

Cheryl Rios, who runs the company Go Ape Marketing, posted her views on her Facebook page on Sunday.<n>'With the hormones we have, there is no way [a woman] should be able to start a war,' she wrote in her post.<n>Rios said that she supports equal rights for men and women but thinks that, 'there’s an old biblical sound reasoning why a woman shouldn’t be president'<n>Rios responded to the venom on Twitter by posting, 'Will say this and leave it at that. I believe in what I believe'

Audrey Pekin, 19, has detailed the alleged rape and attack she suffered in Bali.<n>She was on Christmas Eve with her family when she was attacked.<n>She says she was lured to a remote home by a man she met at a bar.<n>He lured her there, locked the door and raped her twice.<n>She says he then followed her as she tried to flee and raped her again.<n>Police have not arrested Henry Alafu, who they believe attacked her.

Brianne Altice, 35, is accused of having sex with three students at Davis High School in Utah.<n>She was ordered last month to stand trial on 14 felony charges, including rape and sodomy.<n>A second student has filed a lawsuit against the school district accusing officials of failing to fire Altice before she started the affair.<n>The student, then 16, claims he met Altice through her martial problems and they began texting and kissing.<n>The lawsuit follows a $647,000 lawsuit brought by another alleged victim in March.

Theatre director Glen Walford, 75, has spent two years fighting council.<n>She was told by judges her mother Mary, 100, was not in the house at the time.<n>Council said £205,000 house should be used to recover cost of her mother's care.<n>Miss Walford had planned to retire to the property in Stourpour-upon-Severn.<n>But she became embroiled in legal battle with Worcestershire County Council.<n>Council has won right to force Miss Walford to use equity in house for care home fees.

Lee Keeley grabbed woman and hit her head against wall at Lincoln County Court.<n>38-year-old chased her round courtroom and tore out clumps of her hair.<n>He launched chair at her and barristers had to step in to break pair up.<n>Victim suffered cut to her right ear, bruising and swelling to the ear.<n>Keeley jailed for two years and given indefinite restraining order.

Google's new tool locates missing handsets simply by searching for the term 'find my phone' on the search engine's homepage.<n>It works with all Android phones that have the latest Google app installed.<n>It appears to only work when the user is signed into their Google account on Chrome - although this hasn't been confirmed.<n>The same Google account must be signed into on the phone.<n>Users will need to install the Android Device Manager app.<n>Both tools override the selected sound profile, too, meaning that even if a phone is on silent it will still ring at full volume for

Dawn Williamson, 39, from Scotland, was cured of her lifelong phobia of snakes on ITV's This Morning today.<n>She could not even confront a plastic snake without panicking.<n>Therapy involved 'proving' to Dawn that her fear was irrational.

Sulinh Lafontaine told a blogger she was the only female stunt driver on the film.<n>Lafontaine even Photoshopped herself into a poster of the film, wedging her picture between Michelle Rodriguez and the late Paul Walker.<n>A stunt supervisor on Furious 7 said Lafontaine worked as an extra.

Andrew Steele, 40, has pleaded not guilty by reason of mental disease in the shooting deaths of his wife, 39-year-old Ashlee Steele, and her 38-year-old sister, Kacee Tollefsbol.<n>Dr. Doug Tucker testified that a rambling note Steele wrote about suicide and sexual relations with his wife and sister-in-law is delusional and shows Steele's brain was deteriorating because of ALS.<n>The former deputy claimed he had had a sexual relationship with his sister-in-law and enjoyed 'numerous threesomes' with Kacee and his wife.

The House In The Sea sits on a tiny island just off the coast of Newquay.<n>The house is connected by a 100ft suspension bridge, which stretches 90ft above the ground.<n>The pad has a master suite bedroom, which is connected by a private staircase.<n>The island is also equipped with a fully equipped bar, with 40" TV and a billiards table.

Roxy Walsh found the ring while snorkelling at Finns Beach Club in Bali.<n>She shared a photo of the ring on Facebook in the hope of reuniting it with its owner.<n>The message has been shared 23 thousand times.<n>The Bali Bible travel blog shared the post to more than 171 thousand followers.

Marie Surprenant was eight-months-old when she was admitted to Children's Healthcare of Atlanta with more than 14 fractures, numerous bruises and a spinal cord injury that left her paraplegic.<n>Her biological mother and her boyfriend were arrested.<n>Marie was placed into foster care and later adopted by Michele Surprenant.<n>'I want to thank you for making me happy by giving me a new warm and safe environment,' she wrote in her letter.
