Raymond Lee Fryberg Jr. was arraigned in Seattle on Thursday.<n>His son Jaylen, 15, shot dead four classmates at Marysville Pilchuck High School in October before taking his own life.<n>He is accused of lying about a restraining order against him when he bought a Beretta pistol in January 2013.<n>The order was filed in 2002 by a girlfriend who said he had threatened her.<n>But it was never entered into a criminal database.

Jesse Norman allegedly gave out cake while campaigning in Hereford.<n>West Mercia Police investigating reports of breach of Representation of the People Act.<n>It bans Election candidates from providing food, drink or entertainment.<n>Mr Norman described allegations as 'nonsense' and said he gave out chocolate muffins.

Students at Wellington College, Berkshire, spent a year studying different text.<n>The mistake only came to light when mock papers arrived and no questions.<n>School has apologised and launched an investigation into the blunder.

Lesbians4Hillary is the nation's largest lesbian political action committee.<n>It is co-chaired by tennis great Billie Jean King.<n>King, who was outed as a lesbian in 1981, was a leader of the group 'Women for Hillary' in 2008, as well.<n>Many gays and lesbians point to Clinton's 2011 speech in Switzerland as Secretary of State in which she declared: 'Human rights are gay rights and gay rights are human rights'

CYG-11 seaplane uses aerodynamic 'wing-in-ground' effect to glide.<n>Two prototypes were tested this week off the coast of Haikou in China.<n>Engineers behind the CNY 5 billion (£500 million) project say aircraft are capable of flying 62 miles (100 km) on 28 litres of fuel.

Trevor Noah was photographed with Jerry Seinfeld, Larry David and Matthew Broadrick at Citi Field on Monday.<n>The quartet were all present at the game between the New York Mets and the Philadelphia Phillies.<n>Earlier Noah and Seinfeld had been photographed filming a segment for Seinfeld's acclaimed Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee online series.

Sean Heslop, 47, has been suspended from two academy schools in Kent.<n>He is accused of abusing his position of trust after affair with former pupil.<n>The woman, now 18, became pregnant after leaving school and starting university.<n>Despite police investigation, family members say he is 'happiest he's ever been'

The Justice Department said Tuesday it has opened a civil rights investigation into the death of Freddie Gray.<n>Meanwhile, Baltimore police officials released the names of six officers who were involved in Gray's arrest and the van transport of the 25-year-old.<n>The protesters rallied site of Gray's arrest and then marched to a police department a couple of blocks away, chanting and holding signs that read: 'Black Lives Matter' and 'No Justice, No Peace'<n>The crowd outside the Western District Police Station on Tuesday included 53-year-old Pricilla Jackson, carrying a sign reading, 'Convict Freddie'

Asif Malik, 31, his partner Sara Kiran, 29, and their four children reported missing.<n>They were last seen in Slough, Berkshire, on April 7 and are feared to be in Syria.<n>Mr Malik is reported to be a member of banned group Al-Muhajiroun.<n>Police have released CCTV footage of family at busy ferry port in France.<n>Family left without mentioning any holiday or travel plans to relatives, it is claimed.<n>Mr Malik's family say they are 'totally distraught, upset and in shock'

Cheryl Heineman, 45, a third-grade teacher from Florida, was arrested outside Central Avenue Elementary School in Kissimmee.<n>She is accused of selling acid and Xanax pills to an undercover cop last month.<n>Her suspected lover, 20-year-old Jack Lindsey, is facing the same charges.<n>Police launched six-week investigation after informant tipped off them that Lindsey has been known to deal drugs.

Lenny Mordarski, 68, was stabbed with a blue ballpoint pen on a flight.<n>He said the woman was'smirking' when she attacked him as he slept.<n>The incident delayed the Chicago-Manchester flight for two hours.<n>The woman was removed from the plane and put on a later flight.
Hutcherson, 22, looked remarkably like Eastenders actor James Alexandrou.<n>Eastenders also has a number of lookalikes, including Ross Kemp and Gillian Taylforth.

The former US President says he has lost his natural flair for political campaigning, adding that becoming a grandfather has helped him become calmer.<n>'I've told Hillary that I don't think I'm good [at campaigning] anymore because I'm not mad at anybody. I'm a grandfather, and I got to see my granddaughter last night, and I can't be mad,' he said.

The booster appears to have landed but Elon Musk said that 'excess lateral velocity' caused it to tip over.<n>Musk had put 50-50 odds on the attempt being successful and said that improvements to the design would happen throughout the year.<n>The 208ft (63 metre) tall Falcon 9 rocket, carrying a Dragon capsule, thundered off its seaside launch pad at Cape Canaveral Air Force Station at 4.10pm.<n>It is on now its way to deliver 4,300lb (1,950 kg) of food, clothing and science experiments to the ISS.

Horace Mitchell Primary School in Kittery Point, Maine, read I Am Jazz during a lesson on tolerance and acceptance.<n>Some parents are unhappy with the school after their children came home with questions about gender and wondering if they too might be trans.<n>One mom was so angry she contacted conservative pundit Sean Hannity after she felt that the school ignored her initial complaint.<n>Superintendent Allyn Hutton admitted that parents should have been first notified.

The five women were arrested the weekend before International Women's Day.<n>They were preparing to hand out leaflets about sexual harassment.<n>Charged with 'picking quarrels and provoking trouble' and detained for more than a month.<n>Now face being jailed for up to five years if they are charged.<n>Their families have issued a plea to authorities for their release.

Bab al-Aziziya palace in Tripoli was the headquarters of Colonel Gaddafi's regime.<n>It boasted a zoo, fairground and pool, and Libyans would walk around in fear.<n>The compound was destroyed in a NATO air strike in 1986, and was bulldozed by rebels in 2011.<n>Now the grounds are a wasteland, with only shabby outbuildings left on the grounds.

Three studies have provided different theories for what happened after Earth was struck by a Mars-sized object called Theia, 4.45 billion years ago.<n>What is agreed on, though, is that the impact actually happened.<n>This is known as the giant impact hypothesis.<n>Two theories have been presented in the journal Nature.<n>One is that Theia was similar to Earth, and another that Earth and the moon were showered by debris following the collision.

Chancellor refused to rule out further cuts to child benefit if Tories win.<n>More than a million households lost out when Coalition introduced the measure.<n>The controversial measure was brought in two and a half years ago.<n>Mr Osborne was asked if he could 'rule out depriving more people' of benefit.

Lizzie Cochran, a student at Columbia University, came up with the idea for Epidemia Designs after studying biology under a microscope.<n>The line will feature images of diseases from recent history and will also offer phone cases with eye-catching patterns.

At least six men were arrested in Minneapolis and San Diego on Sunday.<n>US Attorney's Office said arrests were made but there is no threat to public safety.<n>Three of the men were already known to authorities, according to reports.

FBI director James Comey wrote opinion piece for Washington Post.<n>In it he said Poland played a role in Nazi Germany's Holocaust genocide.<n>Poland's president said comments showed a 'lack of historical knowledge'<n>US ambassador Stephen Mull has apologised for the comments.

JNCO, the brand responsible for the huge wideleg 'rave' jeans, is set to make a comeback.<n>The impractical jeans featured giant leg openings approaching 50in.<n>Femail rounds up the worst offenders from the Nineties and Noughties.

Publication of Sir John Chilcot's inquiry had already been pushed back.<n>Report is expected to criticise dozen of senior figures involved in 2003 conflict.<n>But it was pushed back because it was too politically sensitive to publish.<n>Now sources say 'nobody thinks it will come out this year'

Threat against flight 826 from Cologne Bonn to Milan's Malpensa airport.<n>Pilot was taxiing along runway at time of threat on Sunday evening.<n>Threat was emailed to the airport 15 minutes before scheduled departure.<n>Passengers and crew were evacuated from the plane.<n>Police said sniffer dogs found no sign of explosives.

Terrifying dashcam footage has emerged of cars enveloped by a raging wildfire.<n>One vehicle drives past with its roof on fire, the situation too hazardous for the driver to stop and put them out.<n>Wildfires in Siberia have been raging since March 19, with the death toll this week climbing to 30 and leaving 500 injured.

Kenneth Morgan Stancil III, 20, was arrested on Tuesday after hitching a ride from a woman to Florida.<n>He was found sleeping on the beach in Daytona Beach, Florida, with a knife in his hand.<n>He is accused of killing Ron Lane, 44, a community college worker who was his supervisor at Wayne Community College in North Carolina.<n>Stancil confessed to the killing in an obscenity-laced statement in court on Tuesday.<n>He said Lane had been'messing with' one of Stancil's family members.

The six Somali-American men were arrested Sunday in Minneapolis and San Diego.<n>They have been charged with conspiracy to provide material support and attempting to provide material support to a foreign terrorist organization.<n>The men met secretly to plan their travels to Syria, and lied to investigators when they were stopped.

Lorna McCarthy, 50, was stabbed through the heart by her husband.<n>Barry McCarthy, 51, had confronted his wife about using dating websites.<n>She had agreed to take her profile down but did not want to try to save relationship.<n>McCarthy then entered her bedroom and stabbed her 13 times, court heard.<n>He then handed himself into police, telling them he had killed his wife.<n>McCarthy has been found guilty of murder at Norwich Crown Court.

Sophie Ryan-Palmer, 12, Fabian Bates, nine, and Chloe Balloqui, three, are patients at Great Ormond Street Hospital.<n>They are the youngsters featured in a ground-breaking TV documentary.<n>The film reveals they are the first children in the world to go through a pioneering treatment called immunotherapy.

Douglas Mark Hughes, 61, flew through restricted airspace over the capital.<n>He landed on the west lawn of the US Capitol carrying 535 letters.<n>Hughes said he expected to be intercepted as he flew over the National Mall.<n>He said: 'People were not frightened at all. That part of it was surreal'

Four tourists caught a shark off the coast of New Zealand.<n>They dragged the shark into shore and then posed for photos with it.<n>The activity is completely legal in New Zealand.<n>It is a terrifying but competitive sport.

Alix Bussey, 23, was hit by a car and died on holiday in Riviera Maya, Mexico.<n>She was a teacher at Bowburn Infants School, County Durham.<n>Her family said she was devoted to the education and welfare of the children.<n>She was on her first holiday abroad with boyfriend Jonathan Boyle, also 23.<n>Her parents Colin and Penny said she had lived life to the full.

Coleen, 28, and Nadine, 29, are supporting Cancer Research's Race For Life.<n>The race raises money that goes towards research into over 200 types of cancer.<n>The ladies have also lent their faces to the ad campaign for the drive.

The agreement was announced on Tuesday by a judge in an Orlando, Florida courtroom.<n>Lolita Grayson was married to another man when they wed.<n>The Democrat and highly successful trial lawyer, said his wife's marriage to Robert Carson was not dissolved until 1994 in Broward County, Florida.<n>Lolita Grayson is a stay-at-home mother with five children.

More than 25million live in constituencies where the result can already be predicted.<n>650 seats up for grabs on May 7, with Labour and Tories needing more than half to secure a majority.<n>Some 70 per cent of seats in East of England are considered safe.<n>In Scotland, the SNP is expected to make sweeping gains.

Prevention of Terrorism Act allows authorities to detain suspected terrorists.<n>It allows for indefinite detention without trial, but not charge or trial.<n>It effectively reintroduces the controversial prospect of indefinite detention.<n>Ruling regime's majority in parliament meant bill passed without doubt.<n>Human Rights Watch described it as 'a giant step backwards for human rights'

Three's Feel at Home covers 18 destinations in Europe, Australia, the United States, Asia and the Middle East.<n>The deal also covers France, Italy, Austria, Switzerland, Ireland, Denmark, Norway, Sweden and Finland.<n>It covers two-thirds of Three's customers' overseas trips.

31million people in work, biggest total since records began in 1971.<n>Figure is up from 29million in spring 2010, before Tories and Lib Dems went into coalition.<n>But Cameron warns recovery would be 'put at risk' by Labour-SNP'stitch-up'

Royal Mint will mark birth of Duke and Duchess of Cambridge's second child.<n>Silver coin will be minted with the one penny's Royal Shield design.<n>It will be presented in a special white box tied with a purple ribbon.<n>Royal Mint produced 10,000 silver crown-sized £5 coins, which cost £80 each.<n>Also produced 2,013 22-carat gold sovereigns, which cost £800 each.

Ahmed Shaheed has posted a picture of his new tiger cub on social media.<n>The 28-year-old Sydney fighter is a freelance fighter based in Syria.<n>He confirmed that he bought the cub from a small village near Aleppo.<n>The tiger will remain with its mother until it is old enough to be his pet.<n>Shaheed previously tweeted pictures of three other potential pets.<n>The tiger was the first animal that took the fighter's interest.
Sam Pearce, 24, of Milton, Massachusetts, was discovered on the F train in New York City and now juggles his career as an eighth-grade English teacher with a side job modelling for top designers.
Handset can understand handwriting in 82 languages in 20 distinct scripts.<n>Can work with both printed and cursive writing input.<n>Even allows users to draw emoji they want to send.

More than 6000 people attended sold-out dance party 'Midnight Mafia'<n>Police arrested 20 people at the event at the Sydney Showground.<n>A 22-year-old Marrickville man was allegedly found in possession of 441 MDMA tablets.<n>A 23-year-old Peakhurst man was allegedly found with 124 MDMA tablets.<n>A 25-year-old Allambie Heights man was similarly charged.<n>A 22-year-old Jesmond man was found with 35 MDMA tablets.<n>A further 16 people were charged with possession of MDMA tablets.<n>Three others were issued Criminal Infring

Arthur and Mo Kreitenberg have created a robot, called the Germfalcon.<n>It uses ultra violet light to kill bacteria throughout the cabin.<n>The robot is the size of a drinks cart and patrols the aisles.<n>It spreads its two 'wings' over the seats on either side.

Lord Janner signed letter saying he wanted to remain a peer.<n>Comes a week before he was ruled unfit to face child sex charges.<n>CPS faced widespread criticism for announcing he would escape prosecution.<n>It emerged he was apparently well enough to sign his name in a note.

MailOnline Travel spoke to experts to debunk some of the myths about planes.<n>Starting a plane is 'a little more complicated’ than starting a car, says pilot.<n>Flight attendants eat the same meals as passengers if the airline bothers.

Molalla Log Cabin was built in 1795 and is one of the most intricate structures found in Oregon.<n>Experts believe it could have been built by a group of Russians sent to Oregon to feed fur trappers in Alaska.<n>The log cabin's intricate construction is not consistent with pioneer building methods, suggesting it was created by foreigners.

Jesse Kidder was chasing Michael Wilcox, who allegedly gunned down is fiance and best friend, in New Richmond, Ohio, on Thursday.<n>The 27-year-old accused killer then started sprinting towards Kidder, asking him to shoot.<n>The rookie cop refused and eventually surrendered.<n>He has been praised for'restraint and maturity' in the face of the incident.

Dr Sally Norton reveals which fruits and seeds are worth adding to your basket.<n>Sour cherries contain high levels of antioxidants and can help a person sleep.<n>Avocados are a great source of healthy, mono-saturated fats.<n>Cranberries have been used for years as an aid against urinary tract infections.

Almost all GPs polled said they do not think their practice should open on weekends.<n>Two-thirds not willing to join groups to ensure one was open on Saturdays.<n>Government has tried to encourage GPs to offer out-of-hours appointments.<n>But a trial period opening surgeries seven days a week found the numbers going to A&E dropped by between 8 and 10 per cent.
Handset will go on sale on April 10th.<n>Samsung used more of its own chips to power the new Galaxy S6.<n>Blow to U.S. chip supplier Qualcomm.

Captain Robert Lewis wrote letters following the mission which killed 150,000.<n>He said: 'If I live a hundred years I'll never quite get those minutes out of my mind'<n>Collection also includes hand-drawn flightplan of mission to drop bomb.<n>It is being sold by the son of Captain Lewis who was on Enola Gay bomber.<n>The plane dropped the 'Little Boy' atom bomb on Japan on August 6, 1945.

Sharon Winters was looking for her soulmate when she met Kevin Hawke.<n>But less than two weeks later she was dead after he stabbed her.<n>Her brother Stephen Robinson is now warning other women to be careful.<n>He said: 'That animal preyed on her caring nature'<n>Hawke was jailed for 17 and a half years for the brutal attack.

Hernandez was given the prison number W106228.<n>He is being held separately from other prisoners and is on suicide watch.<n>He is now equipped with green prison scrubs and his tattoos are being examined for gang affiliations.<n>Sources said the brute, found guilty of murdering Odin Lloyd, was using the dangerous drug for at least a year before the victim was shot dead.

Zheng Gong Hospital in Henan Province, China, was under threat of demolition.<n>Building is 1,700 square metres in size and needs more than 1,000 wheels.<n>Engineers aim to push the entire structure south by 17.5 metres.<n>Project is expected to be completed in the next couple of days.

Nicholas Dematteis, 39, flew into rage at restaurant Bocca East during brunch.<n>He spewed homophobic slur at manager, 34, before grabbing his neck.<n>Dematteis then slammed manager against bar and threw him into elderly woman.<n>He was arrested and charged with assault following incident on Saturday.

The Vin Diesel-led fast car sequel earned an estimated $29.1 million over the weekend.<n>It has now earned $294 million in the U.S. alone.<n>The movie, which is also starring Jason Statham and Paul Walker, has now become one of the top twenty grossing films of all time worldwide.

Jennifer Pagonis, 29, from Chicago has Androgen Insensitivity Syndrome (AIS), a very rare disorder which prevents a womb from growing and causes testes to grow in the abdomen.<n>The intersex artist and activist was born with an enlarged clitoris, no uterus and a partial vagina that surgeons later extended so that she might have normal sexual intercourse.<n>She's now an artist and intersex activist who works to address the legal rights of intersex individuals.

Sophia Adams, 21, has won Curvy Kate's 'Star in a Bra' competition.<n>Beat 1,000 hopefuls to land modelling contract with Bridge Models.<n>Will star in brand's Spring/Summer 2016 catalogue shoot in Mediterranean.

Transavia France is selling cheap flights with packets of crisps and gummy bears.<n>Customers can book flights to Barcelona, Lisbon or Dublin with a voucher.<n>The campaign was supposed to launch last month but was delayed.

Ukip leader says it is a'reasonable proposition' to charge people.<n>Admits he is finding the election campaign 'knackering'<n>Backers should consider switching to the Tories in areas where they cannot win.

Researchers from the University of Maryland found flour made from peanut kernel significantly stimulated the growth of Lactobacillus casei and Lactobacillus rhamnosus.<n>The friendly bacteria out-competes the harmful bacteria by occupying space on intestinal walls and by producing antimicrobial substances.<n>But when the scientists tested the peanut skin, however, it had the opposite effect, inhibiting the growth of good bacteria.

Peter O'Toole was on set for the last time for Fall of an Empire: The Story of Katherine of Alexandria.<n>The actor was suffering from a long-term illness that would eventually prove fatal.<n>Fall of an Empire: The Story of Katherine of Alexandria has been dubbed one of the biggest independent films for decades.<n>It features Steven Berkoff, Edward Fox, Joss Ackland and Nicole Keniheart.

The woman calls herself Zhu Diandian online and her pet is 187lb.<n>She dresses the pig up and even shares a bed with it every day.<n>The porker's owner is understood to be 'tolerant' of the relationship.<n>But her pet dog often peers enviously at the pig through a baby gate.
Gwyneth Paltrow sells a sun proof T-shirt in her Goop shop.<n>Swim Tee by Land's End provides UPF 50 sun protection.<n>The fabric is supported by The Skin Cancer Foundation.

Researchers found certain music can enhance flavours in certain foods.<n>These flavours include sweet, salty and bitter, according to psychologists.<n>The Beatles' Abbey Road and Nessun Dorma can enhance coffee.<n>Piano in Autumn in New York can help emphasise pumpkin pudding flavour.<n>People enjoyed wine more while listening to music than sitting in silence.

Manjinder Virk will play pathologist Dr Kam Karimore in the ITV drama.<n>It is the first significant role for an ethnic minority actor in the show.<n>In 2011, executive producer Brian True-May described the show as the 'last bastion of Englishness' because it had no black or Asian characters.

Social media users have taken to Snapchat to share their rainy day adventures.<n>The video-sharing site has compiled a list of the best from Sydney.<n>The list includes a boat parked between two cars, a man windsurfing on his skateboard and NRL players struggling to hold onto the ball.

Sabrina Rubin Erdely is set to apologize for a Rolling Stone article published in November.<n>The article focused on a University of Virginia student named Jackie who claimed to have been gang raped by seven men at the campus' Phi Kappa Psi fraternity two years ago.<n>But a recent investigation by the Charlottesville Police found no evidence to support her story.<n>Erdely is expected to release an apology in a statement Sunday night.

Joseph O'Riordan, 73, was a Polegate Town Council councillor at the time.<n>He grew suspicious his wife Amanda, 47, was having an affair with the postman.<n>He hired a private investigator to follow her and a GPS tracker to track her.<n>O'Riordan stabbed her eight times with a seven-inch kitchen knife, court told.<n>He admitted a charge of attempted murder and will be sentenced on Monday.

Property was teeming with black widows, rats, feces and 300 bottles of urine.<n>Police described it as the 'worst we have ever seen'<n>The house will be sold at a live auction by Tim Hawko of Zephyr Real Estate.

Noor Ellis admitted to a role in the killing of her 60-year-old husband Robert Ellis in Bali last October.<n>The Balinese national told a court that she wanted to teach him a lesson because he refused to give her money or grant her a divorce.<n>Her husband of 20 years was found wrapped in plastic with his wrists and feet bound, and dumped in a ditch.<n>Mrs Ellis faces the death penalty if found guilty of murder.

Colby Ramos-Francis was born with a small, heart-shaped growth.<n>But it quickly developed into a large benign tumour that continued to expand.<n>His parents claim NHS doctors were unable to treat the growth.<n>They claim they were forced to beg for help abroad.<n>Colby has now had the tumour removed free-of-charge thanks to the US-based Little Baby Face Foundation.

US researchers discovered that a single gene called TcSAD1 is responsible for the melting point of cocoa butter.<n>Plant geneticists say their finding could also lead to new varieties of climate change-resistant cocoa plants.<n>Cocoa butter with altered melting points may find new uses in specialty chocolates, cosmetics and pharmaceuticals.

Jenny-Lee, 28, was diagnosed with leukaemia seven months into her pregnancy.<n>Doctors at Sydney's Prince of Wales Hospital told her she could give birth via a caesarean section and undergo chemotherapy.<n>She refused both options as they required her to receive a blood transfusion.<n>The Jehovah's Witness believed the treatment would harm her unborn child.<n>Her mother Heather has said her daughter gave up her life for the baby.<n>Jenny-Lee's brother David blamed the religion for how his sister died.

The goose at first appeared to make it successfully through the operation at a bird and wildlife clinic Wednesday but then died a short time later.<n>The bird's skin had healed around the arrow and made the process more difficult.<n>Animal control officers started getting calls on April 5 about the bird and found it after a call from Hole 5 at the Anaheim Hills Golf Course on April 8.<n>A worker at the Anaheim Hills Car Wash befriended the goose several days ago by feeding it bread crumbs and was able to catch it and turn it over.<n>She said the animal was shot intentionally at least a week ago.

Nine in teens admit to going online every day, according to a US study.<n>More than 70 per cent of teens use more than one social media site.<n>Facebook remains the most used with 71 per cent of teens using it.

David Serbeck, 42, was found guilty in 2012 of three felony counts of unlawful sex with a minor.<n>He was paralyzed in 2009 after the girl's father shot him and accused him of stalking his daughter.<n>Serbeck's attorneys are asking the Utah Court of Appeals to either throw out his conviction or reduce his sentence.<n>They say his lawyers should have pushed harder to exclude allegations tying his 2007 relationship with the 17-year-old victim to his shooting.

Luke Munro, 19, and Dylon Thompson, 21, raided shop in Cleveleys, Blackpool.<n>Used'realistic looking' handgun to point it at owner, wife and toddler.<n>Pair refused to hand over cash, and then threw sweets at the family.<n>Munro and Thompson were jailed for a total of 10 years at Preston Crown Court.

Theresa May says migrants will have to pay tax and national insurance.<n>Unemployed EU migrants in Britain will be banned from receiving state support.<n>Home Secretary says the plans will be part of a new deal with Europe.

Joanna Biggs's new book is a look at the world of work.<n>She has interviewed workers from all walks of life.<n>She makes it clear that for many people today 'good work brings a good life no longer holds'

Police in Tahlequah, Oklahoma, got a tip and intercepted a package.<n>The package was headed to Carolyn Ross's home.<n>When cops sliced open the bunny they found two condoms filled with the drugs.<n>Ross is being held at the Cherokee Detention Center on $75,000 bond.

Kenneth Stancil, 20, is a former student who did not graduate from Wayne Community College in Goldsboro, North Carolina.<n>He allegedly entered the building at 8am on Monday and fired one shot.<n>One person was killed, a long-time employee in the college print shop.<n>It is not known if Stancil and the victim are connected or related.

Tola Ore, 32, fitted a keyboard video mouse to the USB port of her computer.<n>The device allowed fraudsters to remotely access the computer.<n>The gang attempted to deposit £1,274,000 into 12 different accounts.<n>The bank's losses in Palmers Green, north London, stopped at £147,678.<n>The court heard that Ore only took part because the gang threatened her daughter who was aged two.

Don McLean's lyrics have been puzzled over for decades.<n>They were sold at auction in New York for more than $1 million.<n>The lyrics are hand-written in 1971 by a young folk singer called Don McLean.

Chester, a 6-year-old Pit Bull mix, had been living at the North Fork Animal Welfare League on Long Island.<n>The poor pooch had been living in New York state shelters since 2010.<n>A picture of Chester that was shared online garnered sympathy from across the country.<n>On Friday, Dana Dor and her family welcomed Chester to their home.

Andrew Anderson, 43, was accused of forcing Julie McGoldrick to floor.<n>Father-of-three'strategised' his shopping and grabbed TV near bottom of pallet.<n>But 53-year-old grabbed same one at same time and ended up on floor with wrist injury.<n>Mr Anderson cleared of any wrongdoing by Manchester Magistrates' Court.

The ink illustration appears to show the Jedi knight Yoda on the pages of a religious document.<n>But in fact, the drawing is part of a bizarre representation of the Biblical story of Samson, one expert claims.<n>The Yoda like image comes from a 14th-century manuscript known as the Smithfield Decretals.<n>It also includes a bizarre image of a rabbit shooting a leaping dog with a bow and arrow.

Two-inch-long hornets have killed at least six people in France.<n>They pick off bees as they leave their hive until colony is so exhausted they can runsack it.<n>Threats posed by hornets to be discussed at beekeepers' summit.

Mike Cannon-Brookes has bought a $12 million mansion in Sydney's east.<n>The IT entrepreneur co-founded Atlassian 12 years ago.<n>He is Australia's equal richest self-made billionaire under 40.<n>The home was originally designed by architect Donald Esplin for former lord mayor of Sydney Sir Allen Taylor.

The drone was being used to film the Royal Burgers Zoo chimp enclosure.<n>It was armed with a long stick which it was able to use to spy on its prey.<n>But when it got too close, the chimp pounced and knocked it to the ground.<n>The zoo said the 'intelligent primates' quickly overpowered the 'prey'

Video appears to show Thabo Sefolosha being wrestled to the ground by NYPD.<n>Moments later, teammate Pero Anti is also seen being led away in handcuffs.<n>Both were arrested for trying to prevent police from setting up a crime scene.<n>It happened on the same night that Indiana Pacers player Chris Copeland was stabbed.

Former head of Scotland Yard's Flying Squad says raid and fire could be linked.<n>John O'Connor said the power outage and proximity of raid were deliberate.<n>He also said that the raid must have been helped by inside help.<n>The underground fire ripped through London last week and took 24 hours to put out.

FAA gave green light to an Amazon prototype drone in March.<n>But the company told U.S. lawmakers less than a week later that the prototype had already become obsolete.<n>The FAA granted Amazon's request to test its new delivery drones.

The clip was filmed on Saturday in Shortandy village, 40 miles north of Astana.<n>It shows a mysterious 100 metre-wide black ring of smoke floating in the sky.<n>The cloud hovers for 15 minutes before suddenly vanishing without trace.<n>Video has been viewed more than 50,000 times on YouTube since Saturday.<n>Some YouTube users believe it is definitive proof of extra-terrestrial life.<n>Others think it was a naturally occurring weather event or cigarette smoke.<n>Experts say the cloud was likely to have been a ring of smoke generated by factories.

More than 20,000 pupils passed ten or more GCSEs with either an A or an A* grade.<n>In 2009, the number of students who managed to get straight As was 15,791.<n>This rose to 16,983 in 2010, 18,468 in 2011 and 18,829 in 2012.<n>GCSE grades are used by universities to decide who to admit to courses.

Dustin Wayne South died Wednesday night in Louisville, Kentucky.<n>He was seen waving a gun in the air and fighting with a woman in the street.<n>Two bullets fired by police struck South, but neither was lethal.<n>He died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound to the head.<n>The officers involved are on administrative leave pending an internal investigation.

Sandstorm caused chaos in Soligorsk, Belarus, on Monday afternoon.<n>Within minutes, the storm had blocked out the sun, plunging the city into darkness.<n>About 100,000 residents were forced to stay indoors as a result of the storm.<n>The sandstorm was caused by a cold front moving in from the Ukraine.

Route 1 is a 500 mile coastal road from San Francisco to LA.<n>It's a great way to see California's most famous beaches and landmarks.<n>The route is very scenic, with only one lane in each direction.

Sara Martin, 37, diagnosed with terminal brain cancer in 2010.<n>Health deteriorated rapidly this winter, prompting hospice care.<n>One day recently, she uttered word 'Florida', prompting family to drive her there.<n>She will likely be driven to south-west coastal city today for final holiday.<n>Mrs Martin has three children - Carlie, 12, Gretchen, 11, and Connor, 9.

Girl airlifted to hospital with serious injuries after falling from cliffs.<n>Her father was said to have witnessed the incident and called emergency services.<n>The incident happened at the Blue Dolphin camping site near Filey, North Yorkshire.

Fred Hatch, 76, was brutally killed by his neighbour Alan Rogers, 73.<n>Mrs Hatch, 70, ran to find him but discovered blood splattered walls.<n>Rogers was sentenced to a hospital order under the Mental Health Act.<n>He may never be released and Mrs Hatch said her life was 'destroyed'

James Koryor, 41, has been arrested in connection to the death of his two-year-old son.<n>Police say he took the boy and his five-year-old son to get haircuts Monday afternoon, but instead went to a liquor store.<n>He bought a bottle of gin and drove around with the boys in the car, before going home and falling asleep.<n>He then left the boys inside the house, where his family believed he was sleeping.<n>The boy's mother went outside and found him in the car.<n>The boy was pronounced dead at Phoenix Children's Hospital

Felix the cat was discovered at JFK airport after being on the loose for two weeks.<n>The two-year-old tabby's crate was travelling in an airline-approved carrier.<n>It was damaged so badly that Felix was able to get out and run away.
Sources tell TMZ that Madonna decided to smack Drake's face.<n>The singer spent at least three seconds making out with the 28-year-old hit maker.

Scientists have long suspected eye-spots on butterfly wings are mimicry.<n>They help insects scare away predators by mimicking the eyes of larger species.<n>But the role has never been clearly tested by biologists in Finland.<n>They tested the theory by showing owl butterflies pictures and watching their reaction.<n>The butterflies reacted more to the presence of the eye spots than the pictures.

The former Olympian and reality TV star, 65, will speak in a 'far-ranging' interview with Sawyer for a special edition of '20/20' on Friday April 24.<n>The interview comes amid growing speculation about the father-of-six's transition to a woman.<n>It follows closely behind his involvement in a deadly car crash in California in February.<n>While the Kardashian women are known for enjoying center stage, they will not be stealing Bruce's spotlight because they will be in Armenia.

Claudia Martins, 33, gave birth alone at her sister's flat in Bristol last year.<n>She kept her pregnancy secret from her family and friends.<n>Paramedics were called after she was found in the bath with 'a lot of blood'<n>Martins was found guilty of manslaughter by reason of diminished responsibility.<n>She was acquitted of a single charge of murder at Bristol Crown Court.

Michael Rogan, 42, was rushing his wife Niki to hospital for the birth of their eighth child when a deer flew through the windshield.<n>The former marine died instantly, but Niki and their seven children suffered minor injuries.<n>The family attended Mass on Sunday, two days after the accident.<n>Within three days almost $190,000 has been raised to cover the family's funeral expenses.

The Melbourne office of Moose Toys has a cubby house meeting room at the top of a beanstalk.<n>It comes complete with toy testing rooms, table tennis table, aerobics room, gym and a custom staff lunch room.<n>Staff can scribble their ideas on walls made out of whiteboards while the Employee of the Year gets a gold crown and cape.<n>But there's one catch for their employees - they're not allowed to sit at their desks when they're having lunch.
Revlon's new advert is titled Love Is On.<n>Is part of the cosmetics giant's major rebrand.<n>Is said to signal it's intention to inspire love and connect with people.

Mummified remains found in Hungary's Dominican church in Vc were infected with TB.<n>Researchers isolated DNA of 14 strains of the disease from the mummies.<n>They traced the strains back to a single germ that infected people in the Roman period.

Conrad Clitheroe, Gary Cooper and Neil Munro were arrested in February.<n>The three men were stopped by police for writing down numbers.<n>They were told they would not be detained but were jailed anyway.<n>The three men have now been told they will be freed and return home.<n>Family of the men say they will be able to go home on May 9.

Chris Brugger was diagnosed with Hodgkin's Lymphoma in November.<n>He relapsed in December and was told he had just three weeks to live.<n>The 35-year-old from Griffith, NSW, was given the non-taxpayer subsidised treatment Brentuximab Vedotin.<n>Chris's family launched the 'My Name is Chris' campaign to raise money for the treatment.<n>The Brugger family are hoping that the new treatment will mean there are happier times ahead.

Man found dead with apparent self-inflicted wound at M Resort Spa and Casino.<n>One adult who heard the gunshot and fell while running away was taken to the hospital with minor injuries.<n>Car fire reported at the same time in the parking garage.

Dickerson is the Chief Political Correspondent of Slate Magazine.<n>He will take over from Bob Schieffer, 78, who announced his retirement last week.<n>He is expected to make his first appearance on the show this summer.<n>Schiffer began hosting the show in 1991, and has worked for CBS since 1969.

Beverley Davis was a carer for D-Day veteran Ray Warren, 89.<n>But she tricked him into handing over his bank cards to steal £9,164.<n>The 35-year-old used the money to buy takeaways and pay for creche fees.<n>Mr Warren was so traumatised by the theft he stopped going out.<n>He died just five months after his crime was discovered.<n>Davis was jailed for a year at Portsmouth Crown Court.

New Zealand couple Justin and Jola transformed a truck into a castle-home.<n>The house features a rooftop bathtub, huge kitchen and fold out baby chair.<n>The couple said the house was perfect for their travelling lifestyle.

SNP leader also pledged to form alliances with minor parties such as Greens.<n>She said she would make a decision on an issue-by-issue basis.<n>Ms Sturgeon said she could never support a Tory government.

SNP leader said she would try to 'lock David Cameron out of Downing Street'<n>She said offer stood'regardless of who is the biggest party' in Commons.<n>Comments raise prospect of Miliband becoming PM despite fewer seats.<n>Comes amid fallout from claims she told French diplomat she wanted Cameron to remain as Prime Minister.

Abby Swinfield, 18, was rushed to hospital after a house party in Tamworth.<n>She was placed in a coma but died a week later from multiple organ failure.<n>It is believed the mother-of-one took the illegal drug M-Cat at the party.<n>Miss Swinfield's mother, Kay, said her daughter suffered two heart attacks.<n>Her cousin, Lydia Moore, said Miss Swinfield's drink was spiked.<n>Police have arrested one girl for supplying drugs but Miss Swinfield's cousin says she didn't take the drug voluntarily.

David Starkey says disabled and ethnic minorities should not 'assume status of victim'<n>He also says women are only of average intelligence and men are'very, very bright or very thick'<n>The 70-year-old TV presenter also says fears of Islamophobia are victimising Muslims.
Aaron, 24, and Sam, 48, met on the set of Nowhere Boy in 2009.<n>He was 19 when they first met and she was 42.<n>Friends call him Benjamin Button after Brad Pitt's character in 2008 film.

The sum dwarfs payments for troops seriously wounded on battlefield.<n>One soldier received £411,000 after psychological problems caused by harassment at the hands of senior troops.<n>Last year, the MoD gave a total of £81.9million in compensation to members of the Armed Forces for injury, death and property damage.

Brock Guzman was found safe and well about two miles away from his Northern Californian home in the abandoned car.<n>Police said a hapless car thief likely stole the 2001 Toyota Corolla after the boy's father left it running and briefly unattended.<n>But the car thief clearly didn't notice the boy curled up fast asleep as he sped away with the vehicle.
Debenhams has a range of £199 bridal gowns.<n>Vera Wang is synonymous with luxury and her designs cost £1,000.<n>Can you tell which is which?

Georgina Gosden, 25, allegedly punched a 21-year-old woman in the face.<n>The incident took place at Townsville's Mad Cow Tavern in December.<n>Gosden is also accused of punching a 25-year-old woman in the face last April.<n>The most recent victim withdrew her complaint, but police are pursuing charges.

The train hit a top speed of 375mph (603 km/h) during a test run near Mount Fuji.<n>It travelled for almost 11 seconds at speeds above 373mph (600km/h)<n>The run beat last week's speeds of 366mph (590kph), which in turn beat the train's previous 12-year record of 361mph (581km/h)<n>Maglev trains use magnets to lift the carriages above the track.<n>They are expected to link Tokyo and Osaka in just 67 minutes.

Wendy Stokes, 74, had given up hope of ever seeing Toby again.<n>He was picked up by a passing driver and taken to a rescue centre.<n>Six months ago, he was re-homed with a couple in Margate, Kent.<n>But they felt they needed to find out who Tony belonged to.<n>Wendy immediately arranged to collect him.

Apple is in talks with Florence and the Machine to give Apple limited streaming rights to a track from their album set to be released in June, Bloomberg said.<n>The company has also approached Taylor Swift and others about partnerships.<n>Beats Music will be re-launched in coming months.<n>There will be a $9.99-a-month subscription for individuals and a family plan for $14.99.<n>Apple bought audio equipment and music streaming company Beats for about $3 billion in May 2014, hoping to catch up in fast-growing music streaming industry.

Pensions Freedom Day came into force today allowing over-55s to cash in pension pots rather than being forced to buy a fixed monthly income.<n>But the Government has appealed for caution, perhaps fearing that some people will quickly exhaust their funds and be forced to rely on the State.<n>Mr Webb said over-55s ‘don’t have to rush this’ and insisted there was ‘a case for waiting and seeing’

Adam Leheup, 34, was accused of raping a 25-year-old hours after meeting her.<n>The pair had met on the 'Let's Date' app and had been on a date.<n>He told the jury the woman 'freaked out' when he tried to comfort her.<n>Leheup was cleared of rape and sexual assault by a jury today.
Jeremy Hunt promised crackdown if Conservatives are re-elected.<n>Said abuse of off-payroll contracts was 'clearly being abused'<n>Comments led a storm of reaction from all political parties.

Legendary French chef has been wining and dining a string of glamorous blondes.<n>The coterie includes a former flame, an artist, a hospitality manager.<n>He is said to be'smitten' with Nataliya Lutsyshyna, 41, a former cloakroom attendant.<n>He has also been meeting up with British landscape artist Lynne Moore.

Doctors at University College London Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust are able to start vital treatment much sooner using a single procedure.<n>A finger-width flexible tube called an endobronchial ultrasound (EBUS) allows doctors to see inside the lungs and take a tissue sample.<n>The procedure involves inserting the EBUS down the throat, guided by a tiny camera fitted to the tube.<n>Findings from a three-year trial at UCLH reveal that the method halves the time it takes between a patient’s first hospital appointment and for a decision to be made.
Amanda Lamb stars in new Air Wick fragrance campaign.<n>The TV presenter says that fragrance can transform a home in seconds.<n>The campaign was captured by renowned Vogue photographer Willy Camden.

Luca Railton was born with bones missing from his legs.<n>Doctors said condition - which affects one in three people - meant he would have his right leg amputated or fused straight.<n>But his loved ones refused to accept grim prospects, which would have left Luca severely disabled for life.<n>Instead, they found an American surgeon who assured Luca's parents his leg could be saved.<n>Now, Luca is walking unaided – without the stints he formerly needed - and can even play cricket and tennis.
Patrick Bamford scored Middlesbrough's second goal in the 3-1 win.<n>Boro remain in the Championship's top two after the win.<n>Aitor Karanka's side have four games remaining.

Administration officials as high up the rung as the president last week made calls to more than 130 federal lawmakers.<n>The president's spokesman said a two-week break in congressional activity has meant 'that we have not been able to have as many face-to-face conversations as we would like'<n>With the newly returned lawmakers scheduled to tomorrow take the first in a series of votes setting the perimeters for a deal, the White House said administration officials would hold classified briefings with Members of Congress aimed at 'helping' them understand 'commitments Iran has made so far'

Steven Nelms penned the essay celebrating his wife and everything she does for their family as a stay-at-home mother to their two-year-old son Ezra.<n>He says he can't afford his wife to be a stay-at-home mother because of the high child care costs.<n>He breaks down the monetary value of everything she provides in the essay.

Anand Iyer, 36, worked for fashion site Threadflip in San Francisco.<n>Felt he wasn't spending enough time with his daughter Ava.<n>In January, he handed in his notice and is now spending time at home.

SNP leader Nicola Sturgeon has left boxy jackets and severe suits in the past.<n>She proved her new style credentials with a stunning appearance yesterday.<n>The 44-year-old looked particularly glamorous on her way to BBC’s Andrew Marr Show in a fuchsia column dress that flattered her slimmed-down physique.

Ukip leader booed by voters at Westminster's Methodist Central Hall.<n>He said audience was'remark-worthy even by the Left-wing standards of the BBC'<n>Farage said something had gone 'wrong' with the process of selecting audience.<n>ICM, which hired pollsters, today defended process 'using random location selection techniques'

Sir Ranulph Fiennes, 71, has become oldest Briton to complete race.<n>The explorer ran 256km in six days through the Moroccan desert.<n>He ran for more than 30 hours in temperatures topping 50C.<n>Sir Ranulph has previously suffered two heart attacks and a double bypass.<n>He said the event is 'not set for old geriatrics like me'

Ryan Heritage, 18, from Wiltshire, posted message on Trowbridge police's page.<n>He was wanted for alleged fraud and theft and was out for a night out.<n>Police re-posted message and said: 'His luck ran out #arrested'<n>He was arrested the following morning and charged with theft and burglary.

Flight ACA-877 was travelling from Frankfurt to Toronto when it diverted.<n>Plane was 600 miles north west of Shannon when it was forced to land.<n>The 87-year-old woman was restrained by cabin crew until the plane landed.<n>She was met by Irish police and taken into custody.<n>MailOnline Travel advised she has since been released without charge.

Wendell Steiner, his wife, and their four children were stopped by police in Akron, Ohio during their 300-mile journey from Nova, Ohio to Pennsylvania.<n>Dozens of concerned drivers called 911 and police pulled over the car.<n>The mixed-breed puppies were wind-battered and huddled together in the cage when they were rescued, but had no injuries.<n>The Mennonite family 'had no idea what they were doing was wrong'

Next has overtaken Marks & Spencer on profits.<n>The High Street giant has an impressive line in designer copies.<n>They sell for a fraction of the price of the big labels.<n>Victoria Beckham, Zara and Topshop are all victims of Next's trick.

The Great Dying wiped out more than 96% of the world's creatures.<n>Volcanic eruptions released huge amounts of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere.<n>This changed the chemical composition of the oceans and made them more acidic.<n>This caused vinegar-like acid rain to cover the Earth and soar in temperature.<n>And the amount of carbon added to the atmosphere to trigger the mass extinction was 'probably greater than today's fossil fuel reserves'

Liz Norden's adult sons, JP and Paul, each lost a leg in April 2013 attack.<n>Men were shielding friends from second of two bombs detonated by Tsarnaevs.<n>They are now in their mid-thirties and use prosthetic legs.<n>But Norden says planned film by Wahlberg is 'way too soon' for her.

The presidential hopeful's motorcade arrived at a suburban Des Moines, Iowa fruit processing company with a second Scooby.<n>The first van – nicknamed Scooby after the Scooby-Doo cartoon show – sports a mustard-yellow New York tag.<n>The second has blue and white plates of a different design.<n>It’s common for U.S. Secret Service to employ 'decoy' vehicles, identical in design, in order to inject some mystery into VIPs' travel plans.

The U.S. Coast Guard snapped the images during a routine helicopter patrol this month.<n>The Manitou Passage of Lake Michigan is home to dozens of shipwrecks, most of which were grounded at the turn of the 20th century.<n>The 121-foot brig James McBride ran aground during a storm on October 19, 1857, and is now lying in 15 feet of water.

Julie McKenzie, 53, from Herts, developed back pain in the spring of 2013.<n>GP told her she had scoliosis and that she should try Pilates to build up strength.<n>But an MRI scan showed she did have some scoliosis.<n>Her discs had signs of wear and tear, suggesting arthritis.<n>Radiographer spotted that her coccyx - the bone at the tail of the spine - was slightly enlarged.<n>It contained a tumour.
Elizabeth Scarborough, 21, is a student at the University of South Carolina.<n>She started impersonating Taylor Swift six years ago when she was 15.

Paula Dunican, 49, bought the coat from Asda in Canterbury, Kent.<n>She noticed a stain'seeping through' from the coat's lining.<n>When she opened it she found a squashed four inch-long gecko on the lining.<n>Asda apologised and offered her a £40 voucher to return the garment.

Reverend Andrew Dotchin was celebrating the end of Lent at The Wine Bar.<n>He was refused entry because a glass could fall on his foot.<n>The 58-year-old was told there were health and safety concerns.<n>The vicar, who preaches at Whitton Parish Church, has vowed to wear sandals again.

Clem Schultz's beloved wife Geraldine died in the blast.<n>Schultz thought his dog Missy suffered the same fate as his partner but after Missy was spotted by a ConEd worker, police called Schultz and reported the sighting.<n> Missy was so traumatized by the storm that she ran 2.5 miles from her Schultz and his grandson Tyler Rowan before they were able to catch up with her.

150 business leaders have signed letter warning against a 'change in course'<n>Among new signatories is Simon Woodroffe, founder of Yo! Sushi.<n>Others include executives from two FTSE-100 firms and 10 from FTSE-250.<n>Announcement of new names will heap pressure on Labour.

CCTV footage has captured a woman stealing a donation box.<n>The woman is seen walking out of the Caulfield RSL in Elsternwick, south-east of Melbourne with the box on Wednesday night.<n>The empty room prompted the woman to bring her vest over the box.<n>She then casually walks out the glass entrance door.<n>The RSL general manager has posted the footage on social media in a bid to track down the woman.

Charles Barnhoorn took hundreds of canisters of nitrous oxide at a party.<n>He was found dead in his bedroom at the family home in Devon by his mother.<n>Coroner recorded that his death was self-inflicted after he died from asphyxiation.<n>His mother has now spoken out about the dangers of taking legal highs.

Anti-racism protester Jacob King was snapped staring into the eyes of a bald man with a swastika tattooed behind his ear.<n>He said he had his arms spread out because he thought the man was going to attack him and his fellow protesters.<n>Mr King said he was born and grew up in a multicultural part of Melbourne where he was exposed to racial tensions.

Heather Mack, 19, is accused of murdering her mother Sheila Von Wiese-Mack in Bali last August.<n>Her uncle, Wiese-Mack's brother, and trustee of her estate are said to have blocked Mack from accessing the $1.3million trust fund.<n>Her attorney has filed court documents for her client agreeing to turn over funds for the care of four-month-old Stella.<n>The baby has urgent needs, including clothing and baby wipes.

The cute moment was captured by 19-year-old Ranajit Roy in India.<n>The palm squirrel was spotted asleep on a coconut leaf in the early morning sun.<n>Ranajit spent five minutes snapping the photographs before the squirrel ran off.

Sgt. George Hildebidle barricaded himself inside his Grand Oaks home Thursday morning.<n>Police evacuated surrounding homes as negotiations started.<n>Hildebidle was found dead when a SWAT team entered the home.<n>The officer had been on the force since 2003 and was married with two children.

Carwyn Scott-Howell got lost on slopes in Flaine and walked off-piste.<n>He was holidaying with his mother, brother and sister when accident happened.<n>Police believe he was killed instantly after falling down 320ft-high cliff.<n>Search and rescue workers found his tracks in the snow leading to cliff.<n>His body was recovered from the bottom of the cliff by a helicopter.

Domanik Green allegedly accessed a computer at Paul R. Smith Middle School in Holiday, Florida, without permission by using an administrator's password.<n>He then allegedly altered the image to two men kissing.<n>The Pasco County Sheriff's office have claimed he illicitly made his way into the encrypted system, had access to personal files and could have altered his classmates' grades.<n>But the youngster maintains it was an innocent prank.<n>He was arrested on Wednesday and detained at the Land O'Lakes Detention Center until he was released into the custody of his mother later the same day.<n>Green

Robin Williams hanged himself in August 2014, a death which sent shockwaves through the celebrity world.<n>Actor, 63, had been diagnosed with Parkinson's and was prone to insomnia.<n>He also spent final 24 hours frantically looking up drugs online, convinced he had another illness.<n>Post-mortem examination revealed he had been suffering from Lewy body dementia.<n>But pathologist Dr Richard Shepherd says actor may have known 'there was something else wrong with him'<n>Dr Shepherd made claims in episode of Channel 5 show Autopsy, which will reconstruct final hours of actor's life.

John Truong agreed to babysit 2-year-old Ronnie Tran on Tuesday.<n>He says his sister Alyssa Chang dropped off the boy and said it was her boyfriend's son and they wanted to go on a date night.<n>She promised to pick him up the next morning, but never did.<n>Truong read an Amber Alert on Facebook that was issued for the boy that morning and called police.<n>The boy was found safe and sound at his home.<n>Chang has since been arrested in connection to the kidnapping.

The 37-year-old rapper covers Paper magazine's April issue.<n>In an essay for the glossy, he explained that he is sick of people pinpointing celebrities as members of the secret group The Illuminati.<n>He also said that if there was an actual Illuminati, 'it would be more like the energy companies' - not Hollywood stars.

Deborah Steel, 37, ran the Royal Standard pub in Ely, Cambridgeshire.<n>She was last seen alive just after 1am on 28 December 1997.<n>Police believe she was killed and recently reclassified investigation as murder inquiry.<n>The search has the full consent of the present landlord who is not connected with the investigation.

Yorkshire Ripper Peter Sutcliffe has spent three decades in Broadmoor.<n>He is to be moved to a low-security Priory unit in Berkshire woodland.<n>Families of his victims are furious about the move, which they say'rubs salt into the wounds' of their wounds.

Myuran Sukumaran and Andrew Chan were arrested 10 years ago.<n>They were found guilty of smuggling 8.3kg of heroin to Australia.<n>Pair are awaiting fate on Execution Island in Java.<n>Sukumaran has been a painter while in jail.<n>His cousin is holding an exhibition of his artwork in London.

Honza and Claudine Lafond, from Sydney, run a worldwide yoga studio.<n>They post photos of their yoga poses on Instagram, attracting 251,000 followers.<n>The couple pose in front of landmarks from the Eiffel Tower to the Colosseum.

Kim Roberts admitted stealing antiques and paintings from her employer.<n>The housekeeper worked for the Countess of Bathurst in Cirencester.<n>Roberts stole a Picasso sketch and pewter plates from her London home.<n>She also stole antique vases and a 4x4 Volvo from her employer.<n>The 58-year-old was told to prepare for a stretch in prison at Gloucester Crown Court.

Kylie Gulliver, 29, is the designer behind Melbourne label Elliott Label.<n>The brand is making waves in Hollywood with A-listers including Kourtney Kardashian and Drew Barrymore wearing the leather.<n>Gulliver met Robin Antin, founder of The Pussycat Dolls, through Instagram.<n>Antin requested samples for her pop group GRL and the rest is history.

Bobby Cole Norris has thanked an anonymous donor who came forward.<n>The reality star was left heartbroken last August when doctors revealed his mother Kym had just one hope for survival - a stem cell transplant.<n>Bobby launched the #savebobbysmum appeal to urge people to sign up as stem cell donors last August.

John Allan warns promise of in-out referendum risks backfiring.<n>Claims the cart is'very firmly before the horse' over EU membership.<n>Suggests large firms could move their head offices to other sites in Europe.
Danny Alexander was pictured with call girl Brooke Magnanti.<n>The two were snapped at Bar One in Inverness on Friday.<n>The two were snapped at the Nip festival, which celebrates gin and whisky.

Man in his 20s struck by Northern line train at Stockwell station this morning.<n>Commuters watched in horror as he bent down to pick up his bag from platform.<n>Station was shut while medics tended to the man who was taken to hospital.

Josh and Vanessa Ellis and their eight-month old baby Hudson were killed on Monday when a concrete barrier fell onto their truck.<n>The tragic accident happened underneath the Route 410 overpass in Bonney Lake, Washington.<n>Authorities initially thought only one person had been killed by the slab, which weighed 'tons'<n>The damage to the family's pickup truck was so great that it took hours to extract the bodies.

Duke of York visited offices of AkzoNobel in Slough, Berkshire.<n>Smiled broadly as he chatted to employees and toured paint range.<n>Visit comes five days after sex claims against him were struck off record.<n>Alleged relationship with Virginia Roberts was denied by the Duke.

Carol Lloyd was left covered in blood after rocks were thrown at her car.<n>Violent protests spread to Johannesburg, threatening more killings.<n>Police fired rubber bullets and tear gas to disperse crowds.<n>Six people have been killed in the violent protests which started two weeks ago.

Rhiannon Langley, from Melbourne, is undergoing a nose job in Thailand.<n>The 24-year-old hairdresser has an almost 200,000-strong following on Instagram.<n>She is sharing every step of the journey with her followers on #RhiannonGetsRhino.

The charity announced on Wednesday that it has decided to continue to look abroad for millions of dollars while limiting donor nations to a select group of six.<n>The change in policy comes as former board member Hillary Clinton undertakes her presidential campaign.<n>The foundation's reliance on funding from several Middle East governments that suppress dissent and women's rights sparked criticism.<n>Clinton resigned from the foundation's board last week.

Poppy Moore married childhood sweetheart Sam Myers yesterday.<n>The bride wore a knee-length white dress and carried a bouquet of white roses.<n>She had a reception for 50 at the Mayfair Hotel before returning to Chelsea.<n>Her father Dean died in 2011 aged 43 from bowel cancer.

Fan scaled grandstand and ran across start-finish straight.<n>He then made a bid for the pit wall before running into Ferrari garage.<n>The man was handed over to the authorities and taken away.<n>Mathematically, it is strictly prohibited to enter the Shanghai Circuit.

Evan Summerfield had just learned how to giggle and take his dummy out.<n>But just hours later he was fighting for his life after waking from a nap.<n>His great-grandmother carried out the 'glass test' and saw rash didn't fade.<n>He was rushed to Derriford Hospital in Plymouth but died soon after.<n>His death has devastated his family, who are unable to comprehend how quickly he fell ill.

Bethany Farrell, 23, drowned on her first scuba diving trip in Queensland.<n>Fellow travellers claim photos of the British backpacker were deleted.<n>Ms Farrell was on her first ever scuba diving trip when she tragically drowned.<n>The young woman was just one week into her dream gap year in Australia.

AleXsandro Palombo is an Italian activist and artist.<n>He is hoping to send out a more serious message with his latest work.<n>Women write messages on pairs of pants and share via social media.<n>Messages range from cheeky 'My balls bigger than yours' to very simple 'No Rape'

Plane was struck by lightning and autopilot ignored pilot's commands.<n>Aircraft began to plunge and fell to 1,100ft before pilot regained control.<n>Flight from Aberdeen to Shetland was put off by thunderstorms and winds.

Julia Ware, who was 15 at the time of the accident, appeared at Wayne County Court in Honesdale, Pennslyvania, on Wednesday.<n>The families of Shamus Digney, Cullen Keffer and Ryan Lesher - who were all 15 - watched her admit to five of the 12 counts she was charged with.<n>After the hearing, a grieving father branded Ware, of Pleasantville, New York, a murderer.

39-year-old Lianna Barrientos married ten men in eleven years - and married six of them in one year alone.<n>Barrientos was nabbed by authorities after saying her 2010 marriage - the tenth time she tied the knot - was actually her first.<n>According to reports, all of Barrientos' marriages took place in New York state.<n>She could be sentenced to a total of eight years stemming from her two charges.

Austin Bird says he and two other young Iowans were asked to meet with the former first lady by her campaign's political director.<n>The three were then driven to a coffee shop in LeClaire, Iowa to sit at a table with Clinton and talk for about a half-hour.<n>'We were just asked to be there by Troy,' Bird said of campaign director Troy Price.<n>Bird is a frequent participant in Iowa Democratic Party events, and was tapped to chauffeur Vice President Joe Biden around Davenport in October.

The rate of bankruptcy, 15.7percent, remained the same no matter how long the players were in the league or how well they were paid.<n>Despite earning millions - sometimes tens of millions - former players go broke at about 1.1percent per year, the same rate as the rest of Americans.<n>Though bleak, the 15.7percent figure is dramatically lower than a widely quoted statistic that 78percent of retired players are bankrupt or under 'financial stress' within two years of leaving the league.

UKIP supporters are the most likely to want to holiday in a warmer climate.<n>Greens supporters are most likely to rent a car and pack the speedos.<n>Thirty-four per cent of Liberal Democrats love cruise holidays.

Esther McVey has demanded Ed Miliband condemns the attacks.<n>The employment minister has been branded'murderer McVey' in graffiti.<n>She also had an election song written about her by rivals.<n>Miss McVey won her Wirral West seat in 2010 with a majority of 2,436.

Adele Sarno, 85, has been living in her two-bedroom apartment in Manhattan's Little Italy neighborhood for more than 50 years.<n>She received a letter five years ago seeking to increase rent to the market rate of $3,500 a month, far more than the retired shopkeeper can afford.<n>Her landlord is the Italian American Museum which is dedicated to the legacy of Italian-Americans and is situated below her home.

Burnt material was uncovered by Oxford Archaeology in Landford, Essex.<n>It was placed into a pit with a diameter of about three feet (one metre)<n>Remains are around 7,614 years old and fall within the the late Mesolithic.<n>They are thought to date to 5,600 BC and show Mesolithic burial practices.<n>It hints people respected the dead enough to cremate them and not simply abandon them, as has been previously believed.

The tracks were found in Ileret, northwest Kenya, in sediment that had once been the shoreline of an ancient lake.<n>They are the oldest human footprints in the world and were discovered in 2009.<n>Analysis of the prints showed they had been made by a early human.<n>They were likely left by males hunting for antelope or wildebeest.<n>The tracks represent groups hunting for antelope or wildebeest, researchers say.

Rogue planets are sun-less and could still have liquid water on surface.<n>This is because ice on planet's surface acts as strong insulator.<n>This heat would have to come from its interior, says Sean Raymond.<n>This is because planets need to keep warm for liquid water to form.<n>If the sun was to die, this heat would have to come from the planet's interior.<n>This is the reason why PSO J318.5-22 was identified as a rogue planet.

Photographer Dieter Klein has travelled the world to find the strange resting places of abandoned cars.<n>He has found a range of unusual graveyards including one in Belgium where the Allies left a fleet of vehicles.<n>The Jaguar XK120, which could be worth £82,000, is among the vehicles that have been claimed by nature.

The Australian descendants of eight ANZAC veterans have proudly showed off their relatives' wartime medals and photographs.<n>Photographer Mark Kolbe travelled around Australia to meet the grandchildren, great-grandchildren, sons and daughters of just some of the brave members of the Australian armed forces who landed in Gallipoli nearly 100 years ago.<n>Amongst the keepsakes held by the relatives are letters sent by soldiers informing their loved ones of their discharge from the Australian Imperial Force.<n>Black and white photos show the servicemen on horseback and playing with their army football teams.
Average temperature of 56.4F (13.6C) was the hottest March on record.<n>This is 1.5F (0.85C) above the average for the 20th century.<n>NOAA blames the heat on El Nio and climate change.
Jameela Jamil, 29, had amalgam fillings removed and replaced with white ones.<n>Tests suggested she had high levels of mercury.

Shinjiro Kumagai is a'mild mannered' clergyman at a local Buddhist temple.<n>But after the days work is done, he dresses up as iconic Japanese sci-fi TV hero Kamen Rider 1 and takes to the streets to lay down the law.<n>Unlike some superheros, Kumagai has the full support of police and even dons an armband certifying him as an official drink-drive patrolman.

Bridesmaids star Rose Byrne and Gracie Otto are two of five Aussie women who have launched a film production company.<n>The Doll House Collective will collaborate on films, share ideas and creative advice, and even provide financial support to each other's projects.<n>The five women want to bring a female body to the film-making industry.<n>They liken it to the female equivalent of Blue-Tongue Films, four men who have collaborated to produce a film-making company.

Kyle Major, 14, punched father-of-two Paul Walker in the back of the head.<n>Mr Walker, 52, was found face down in a pool of blood by a passerby.<n>Court heard Major had been 'allowed to run wild' on New Year's Day.<n>He pleaded guilty to manslaughter and was jailed for three years.

Sonnenspeicher uses a lithium iron phosphate battery to store solar energy.<n>This energy is used throughout the day, but can be stored when sun goes down.<n>Rather than selling this electricity back to the grid, homeowners can use stored supply to power their home until the sun rises again.<n>It features an intelligent management system that automatically controls the charging and discharging current.

The Park Hyatt New York hired Michelle Obama's favourite designer, Narcisco Rodriguez.<n>The Shangri La Hotel in Toronto opted for local designer, Sunny Fong.<n>The JW Marriott Houston Downtown hired American designer, David Peck.

Gavin Tobeck was playing in the backyard with his mother's neighbor when the dog attacked him.<n>The boy was left with a broken cheekbone, jaw and nose bridge and needed sections of a rib to repair his eye sockets.<n>He was hospitalized for six days and doctors thought he would not make it.<n>He was released late on Tuesday and has begun returning to a normal life.<n>Smash, the pit bull, is scheduled to be euthanized by Thurston County Animal Service on Saturday at the Tobecks' request.

Doug Hughes, 61, landed a gyrocopter on the U.S. Capitol lawn Wednesday to protest campaign finance laws.<n>Hughes' wife Alena says she is proud of her husband and that he is a 'patriot'<n>Hughes has been released on his own recognizance and is allowed to return to Florida under certain conditions.

Annah Sophia Stevenson ordered a Big Mac from Blenheim McDonald's.<n>After taking three bites of her burger she found a cockroach in her mouth.<n>The 26-year-old took to Facebook to post her horrible experience.<n>McDonald's have organised to pick up the evidence from Ms Stevenson.

The men were part of a group of five divers from the East Coast and San Francisco.<n>They dove into rough waters off of Mendocino County, California, on Sunday.<n>Two of the men were pulled from the water and were given CPR on the beach.<n>The third man's body was found after a five-hour search.<n>The annual abalone season started April 1 and the mollusk is a prized delicacy that sells for up to $70 per pound.

Chanel, 19, is a freelance model who is terrified that the effects of aging will stop her from continuing her career.<n>She claims to have eaten placenta, gone on fasts and put her body through many detoxes in her quest to stay young.
With the rouble in trouble, Russians are freezing at home in Goa.<n>But the beaches are more relaxed and the restaurants are quieter.<n>Goa has 11 hours of sunshine a day at this time of year.

Chamali Fernando, candidate for Cambridge, made the startling suggestion.<n>She said wearing wristbands would help doctors, lawyers and police officers.<n>Ms Fernando, a barrister for 12 years, said: 'They do not realise the person may have a mental health or other condition'<n>Deputy Prime Minister Nick Clegg slammed the'shocking' suggestion.

Two supercars were written off and wrecked in a major traffic accident in Beijing.<n>Both drivers have been charged with dangerous driving and detained.<n>Chinese internet users speculate the pair were racing in a tunnel.<n>The crash occurred two hours before 'Fast and Furious 7' broke the record for midnight screenings on its launch in China.

The unnamed airport worker had dozed off inside the plane at the end of his shift Monday and only awakened when it was in the air.<n>The plane was forced to turn around and return to Seattle-Tacoma International Airport.<n>The man's frantic 911 call was released Thursday.

Brian Karl Brimager, 37, was indicted by a federal grand jury in San Diego, in connection with the death of Yvonne Lee Baldelli.<n>The 42-year-old woman from Laguna Niguel, California, was last seen in September 2011 when she arrived in Panama with Brimager.<n>Her family reported her missing the following January.<n>The indictment alleges that Brimager murdered Baldelli, dismembered her body and disposed of her body parts in a remote jungle area.

Ed Balls and Andy Burnham warned NHS 'cannot survive' another five years.<n>They said there had been a 'dramatic decline in standards' in the NHS.<n>By 2020 millions more will face long waits in A&E and long waits to see GPs.<n>Ambulance response times will rise to over nine minutes, 500,000 fewer older people will receive social care and 600,000 people will be forced to wait for more than four hours on trolleys on A&E.

Viv Nicholson became rich overnight when she scooped £152,319 in 1961.<n>She and husband Keith splurged cash on cars, designer clothes and holidays.<n>But tragedy struck when Mr Nicholson died at the wheel of his Jaguar.<n>She was declared bankrupt and lost most of her husband's wealth.<n>Mrs Nicholson, 79, has now passed away following a long battle with dementia.

Daniel, five, inadvertently wades into row about Labour leader's kitchen.<n>He declares it 'the best' in his £2.7million home in ITV interview.<n>It is the fourth time the Milibands have appeared on screen during campaign.<n>But it backfires as he claims controversy about kitchen'makes me laugh'

Syrian Journey game often ends with players dying trying to flee war-torn country.<n>Grim outcomes include being separated from your family by human traffickers.<n>Game was criticised by experts for turning suffering of millions into a 'children's game'

Dr Fredric Brandt, 65, was found dead at his Miami mansion on Sunday.<n>Police confirmed that the death was a suicide by hanging.<n>Joy Behar and Kelly Ripa tweeted their grief on Monday.<n>Dr Brandt was reportedly 'devastated' by comparisons to Dr Franff, a character on Tina Fey's Netflix show, Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt.

Greece says Germany owes it nearly 279billion euros for war reparations.<n>The demand comes just days before Greece is obliged to pay 450million euros of its debt to the International Monetary Fund.<n>PM Alexis Tsipras raised the reparations issue when he met German Chancellor Angela Merkel in Berlin last month.
The 30-year-old gave birth to James Hunter on Tuesday.<n>She came under fire during her pregnancy for posting sexy selfies.<n>The newborn was born at a healthy 8lbs and 7 ounces.
UK stylist Lily Melrose shows you how to update your wardrobe.<n>She has created 15 DIY tips to make your wardrobe 2015 style.<n>Lily has also included tips on how to update your sunglasses.

The Whole Damn Farm is the creation of Sam Longhurst, head chef of Splendid Kitchen, Manchester.<n>It contains two beef burgers, a whole chicken thigh, ham chunks, barbequed pulled pork and bacon rashers.<n>The mega meal costs £13.50 and is served between two brioche buns.

Prince Harry visited the remote township of Wuggubun in Western Australia.<n>He was on a training exercise with a Norforce unit when he stopped by.<n>Locals described him as 'a real delightful chap' and said he'd like to move there.<n>The prince arrived in Australia on Monday for his month-long secondment.

Original manuscript and lyrics to be auctioned in New York today.<n>Don McLean says American Pie is about 'heading in the wrong direction'<n>Famous song refers to the death of rock icon Buddy Holly in 1959.<n>A deleted verse also reveals McLean wrote about music being'reborn'

A video has emerged showing the horrific moment two French tourists set alight an Australian quokka.<n>The men were on a working holiday and were spending three months in Rottnest Island working as cleaners.<n>The men pleaded guilty to animal cruelty at Fremantle Magistrate's Court on Friday.<n>They were each fined $4000 and will be held behind bars for seven days if they fail to pay the fines.

Jeff and Joey Stallings, both in their twenties, fell seriously ill earlier this month.<n>They collapsed after smoking synthetic marijuana, which is sprayed with chemical.<n>Pair were placed in medically-induced comas and had to be put on life support.<n>But they were able to return home on April 13, but are now facing serious issues.<n>Mother, Karen Stallings, has appealed to others not to smoke the drug.

Illinois Rep. Luis Gutierrez is at the head of a group of representatives who are creating a 'Family Defender Toolkit'<n>The pamphlet includes a bilingual card that lists reasons a person should not be deported under expanded policies.<n>The card should be shown to immigration officers when an undocumented immigrant is in an emergency situation, Gutierrez said.<n>The two-page booklet details President Barack Obama's expanded Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) and Deferred Action for Parents of Americans and Lawful Permanent Residents (DAPA) policies.<n>Those policies are currently on hold by a court order.
Victoria Beckham posted a picture of her husband sporting grey hair.<n>Trend is becoming more popular with men.<n>Top stylists say celebrities are to blame for changing attitudes.

NHS handed out 404,500 prescriptions for suncream at a cost of £13million in 2014.<n>Another 4.7million prescriptions for indigestion pills cost £29million, analysis found.<n>Critics said it was 'ludicrous' items were being handed out when NHS was rationing routine treatments.

The teenager from the Henan province in central China has been labelled 'too beautiful too look at'<n>She has gained over 400,000 followers on her Chinese social media account.<n>Some have hinted the photographs may not be real or are digitally enhanced.

thorn was charged with the murder of his second wife, Toni Bertolet, 51, last November.<n>Police have reopened their investigation into the suspicious death of his first wife, Lynn Rishell, some 20 years earlier.<n>Grace Rishell was Herald Henthorn's first wife Lynn Rishell's sister-in-law.<n>She said that the FBI told her about a secret $400,000 life insurance policy Henthorn had taken out on her.

Chipotle removed carnitas pork from roughly a third of its stores in January.<n>Restaurant says it does not know when it will have enough meat for all stores.<n>Fewer than five per cent of pigs in the US are raised in a way that meets Chipotle's standards.

Milton Vieira Severiano, 32, dragged wife Cicera Alves de Sena, 29, into garden.<n>He slammed her head into concrete 11 times before punching her in face 10 times.<n>He then returned with handgun and shot her in face five times at pointblank range.<n>Cicera Alves de Sena belonged to a dance troop called Jaula das Gostozuedas.<n>Police found four handguns, a shotgun and a bullet proof vest in getaway car.
