The 4-foot-tall plaster bust of Edward Snowden was erected in Brooklyn's Fort Greene Park early Monday morning.<n>The anonymous artists spent six months and $30,000 on the effigy of the 31-year-old whistle-blower.<n>The bust was removed from a Revolutionary War memorial shortly after daybreak.

Sharista Giles of Sweetwater, Tennessee woke up on Wednesday after being in a coma for five months.<n>Giles, 20, was five months pregnant when she was injured in a car accident and doctors said she would never recover.<n>A month later, doctors were forced to deliver her son, who the family calls Baby L, who she saw for the first time Wednesday.<n>Baby L is doing well, but still in the neonatal intensive care unit at the University of Tennessee Medical Center.

Thursday's commemoration in Appomattox, Virginia, included a reenactment of Lee's last clash with Grant's troops and of the Confederate surrender.<n>In April 1865, however, the troops weren't as calm. Lee's forces were in a state of growing disarray in the hours before Lee formally called it quits.<n>Ragged, hungry Southern soldiers, many straggling and on the run from federal forces, began giving up alone and in small bunches.

Luigi Costa, 71, is accused of killing his elderly neighbour Terrence Freebody in 2012.<n>He is alleged to have cut his throat and stabbed him multiple times in the dining room of his home in Red Hill, Canberra.<n>A psychiatrist told the court that Costa was suffering dementia and alcohol abuse at the time of the attack.<n>The jury can return a not guilty verdict if Costa's unstable mindset at time of the attack can be proven.

Martin Richard, 8, was the youngest victim of the April 15, 2013 blast.<n>His family joined city officials and others to unveil four orange banners at the site on Tuesday morning.<n>A moment of silence was held at 2.49pm, the moment the first bomb exploded.

Nick Cousins left court clutching the hand of his Filipino wife Herminia Garcia.<n>She is charged with wilful neglect following death of daughter Blanca.<n>The 15-year-old plunged 19 storeys to her death in an apparent suicide.<n>Mr Cousins was also arrested on suspicion of 'ill treatment' after it emerged Blanca's birth had not been registered.<n>He has not been charged and is currently on bail.

Education Secretary Nicky Morgan orders officials to start'mapping' pressures.<n>Comes after Ofsted warned schools faced an 'influx' of migrants.<n>Mrs Morgan admits immigration is a 'big issue' for voters in the election.

Kevin Dixon, 35, offered to take friend's Akita-type dog for a walk.<n>But he was worried it might bite one of the children sleeping at the house.<n>He then hit the animal seven times with an axe - killing it.<n>Dixon convicted of causing the dog unnecessary suffering.<n>Given suspended prison sentence and banned from keeping animals.

Joshua Vaughan, 17, was struck by a train at Chapeltown, Sheffield.<n>His girlfriend had sent a message to his mother on Facebook saying he was going to end it.<n>His mother Stacey Vaughan called the police but by the time she got to the station, her son had already been struck.<n>Mrs Vaughan said her son had been suffering relationship problems.
Study found overweight people less likely to develop dementia.<n>Being underweight increased dementia risk by 39 per cent.<n>Separate U.S. study found overweight people live longer.

Brae Carnes of Victoria, British Columbia, has begun a social media campaign protesting a proposed amendment to a Canadian transgender rights bill.<n>The amendment would allow business owners to determine if they want to allow transgender individuals to use facilities corresponding with their gender.<n>'I’m actively showing them what it would look like if that became law and how completely ridiculous it is,' says Carnes.

Scott Kemery, 44, was rushed by helicopter to Stony Brook University Hospital on Long Island with first and second degree burns.<n>He had been informed by a friend that the best way to kill bedbugs was to douse them in alcohol.<n>Police said that Kemery started the blaze with his ill-timed cigarette break in the parking lot of the King Kullen supermarket in Eastport.

Kelly Kreth, 44, has written to men and women behind bars who she believes fit the bill of a sociopath.<n>Kreth says she's learned that a sociopath is a person 'who wants to feel like the smartest person in the room'<n>The list of the killers Kreth interacted with include Michael Swango, a doctor who poisoned as many as 60 patients in a variety of different hospitals for over two decades.<n>'I love it: the sweet, close, husky smell of indoor homicide,' Swango wrote in a notebook presented by prosecutors in 2000.

CCTV footage shows man casually approach a white Range Rover.<n>Within seconds he opens the door and climbs into the drivers seat.<n>He then starts the engine and reverses the car off the driveway.<n>Hackers use hand-held devices to bypass security systems.<n>Police are now appealing for information to trace the thief.

Kimberly Waddell Macemore, 25, of Wilkesboro, South Carolina, was sentenced on Tuesday to a total of not less than 12 months nor more than 34 months in prison.<n>Macemore had a casual sexual relationship with one of the young men, but had enjoyed a longer and more involved relationship with the other.<n>The teacher had a casual sexual relationship with one young man, but had enjoyed a longer and more involved relationship with the other.<n>Macemore was also ordered to perform 72 hours of community service, register as a convicted sex offender for the next 30 years, receive a sexual offender psychological assessment and

Olive Fowler was caught by police at JFK airport on April 12 after taking a Caribbean Airlines flight from her hometown in Guyana, South America, to New York.<n>Authorities said they spotted her'sweating profusely' and 'avoiding eye contact with officers' so they pulled her aside to conduct a search.<n>After patting her down in a private room, investigators reportedly felt a 'dense hard material' under her clothes.<n>The packages tested positive for cocaine.<n>It's estimated the drugs found in her panties have a street value of more than $73,000.

Councillor Ben Grower refused to deal with constituent because they supported Ukip.<n>Pensioner Alan Roberts wrote to Bournemouth Borough Council complaining about a lack of action over fly-tipping.<n>He signed off his email with: 'That's why I'll be voting Ukip'<n>Mr Grower, leader of authority's Labour group, responded: 'As you now appear to be a supporter of a racist party please do not send me any further emails'<n>A formal complaint has been lodged against Mr Grower and the council is investigating.

'The Diggers are Dole Bludgers' has attracted more than 360 likes since the page started in late January.<n>The administrator of the page claims that those in the armed services are 'being paid with money stolen from the taxpayer to do a job that is unnecessary'<n>Despite multiple reports to Facebook as 'hate speech', the page remains live.

Norwich scientists have developed an adaptor for colour blindness.<n>Eye2TV can be plugged into any HDMI port on a TV or a computer monitor.<n>A remote control or app then adjusts the colour adjustment.<n>It allows colour blind people to watch shows they otherwise couldn't.<n>And the effect is so subtle that people with normal vision will barely notice any change in the picture.<n>The team is seeking £100,000 ($150,000) of funding on Kickstarter.

Jericho Scott was shot dead in New Haven, Connecticut on Sunday.<n>He became an internet star in 2009 after being banned from pitch because of his 40mph fastball.<n>Scott had five no-hitters in the first eight games of the season before being told to sit out.<n>The other team refused to play after the ban and lawyers were hired.

Cadbury's has shrunk two of its chocolate fingers by 14 per cent.<n>They join Creme Eggs, PG Tips teabags and John West tuna in the shrinking club.<n>But manufacturers and supermarkets don't pass on the cost saving to consumers.

Rihanna Cooper, 21, from Hull, was Britain's youngest sex swap patient.<n>At 16, she became youngest person to be accepted for gender reassignment.<n>But she has now called a halt to her transition and is paying for it herself.<n>She says working as an escort is the only way to fund her dreams.

Female student pictured on campus writing 'n*****s' on a whiteboard.<n>Reasons included 'incompetent professors', 'ratchets' and 'overpopulated campus'<n>But at the top of the list was the word 'n*****s', she was also heard to say.<n>Girl was a member of the university's Kappa Delta Chapter sorority.<n>She has now been suspended - and is also facing a USC code of conduct inquiry.<n>Shocking image marks third racially-charged incident on college campus in past week.

Stoke's Charlie Adam scored a stunning 66-yard strike against Chelsea.<n>The Scottish midfielder belted the ball into the net after seeing Thibaut Courtois well off his line.<n>The shot, travelling at 45.1mph, was hit such power that the back-pedaling Courtois was unable to deflect it away.<n>Adam later told the BBC: 'I never knew I had that much power, to beat a quality goalkeeper like that is something special'

Elizabeth Sedway, 51, from Granite Hill, California, was flying home to California with her husband and two sons Monday.<n>The mother of two suffers from multiple myeloma - a rare form of plasma cancer.<n>Alaska Airlines representative asked her if she needed anything because she had put on a surgical mask to shield herself from germs.<n>The family of four eventually boarded the plane and were awaiting takeoff when airline representative announced Sedway could not fly without a note from her doctor.<n>Sedway said Wednesday that the airline has refunded her family's airfare, which will be donated to research.

Former BBC economics editor Stephanie Flanders broke silence over fling.<n>She described it as 'fleeting and very costly' in brief message on Twitter.<n>Last week it emerged she had been'secretly' dating Ed Miliband in 2004.<n>Mrs Miliband revealed the couple had first met at a London dinner party.

The Queen, who turns 89 today, is a regular rider and loves equestrian sport.<n>She was filmed 'jumping out of a plane' during the 2012 Olympics opening ceremony.<n>Her sense of humour was on display last week when she was spotted at the races.

Kenyatta Leal was one of 15 prisoners selected for The Last Mile program.<n>It is the world's only prison-based tech incubator.<n>It teaches inmates how to code and build a business for when they are paroled.<n>Leal was jailed for a third strike for unlawful possession of a firearm.<n>He was released in 2013 and is now lobbying for the program to be expanded.

Two TSA employees have been fired after they used the airport body scanner inappropriately to allow the male worker to fondle male passengers' genitals.<n>The pair allegedly worked as a team to manipulate the results of a full body scanner at a security check-point in Denver International Airport last year.<n>According to a Denver Police Department report seen by Daily Mail Online, the TSA received an anonymous tip in November last year that an employee had admitted to 'groping' men who came through security.<n>The female employee was questioned and admitted she had taken part in the assaults on unsuspecting passengers a total of 11 times.

Margaret Hesketh was riddled with tumours, her children will claim at inquest.<n>The family claim she was put on discredited Liverpool Care Pathway-style treatment.<n>Had fluid and nutrition drips removed six days before she passed away.<n>But post-mortem found no sign of cancer and she died of pneumonia.
Andrea Dossena was arrested on suspicion of shoplifting at Harrods.<n>The 33-year-old was later bailed by the Metropolitan Police.<n>Dossena is currently on a short-term contract with Leyton Orient.

Floyd-Henry Morley has a rare form of dwarfism called Achondroplasia.<n>His parents Jade and Ross were told he had the condition when he was five months old.<n>The couple decided to tell their friends and family about Floyd.<n>Less than two years later, Floyd is a big brother to three-week-old twins.

Research by YouGov found 31% of men named Nigel voted Ukip.<n>The figure went up from 16% to 31% among men with the same name.<n>The three most likely to vote Tory were Charlotte, Fiona and Pauline.<n>Those least likely to vote Tory were Sharon, Samantha and Clare without an i.

The Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sex Abuse in Rockhampton heard from alleged victims who suffered at the hands of nuns and priests.<n>One woman was allegedly raped by a broom handle and a retired nurse was punched and slapped repeatedly.<n>Another woman was allegedly gang raped by employees and then had a child at 14 years of age.<n>About 4000 children passed through what was known as St Joseph's Orphanage between 1885 and 1978.

Officer Michael Slager is being kept in isolation and can not walk down a hall without the entire cell block being cleared first, according to his lawyer.<n>His attorney Andy Savage told CBS that Slager is housed in a room with one small window and does not have any interaction with any other detainees at Charleston County jail.<n>Slazer, 33, is charged with murder after opening fire on Walter Scott, 50, after reportedly stopping him over a broken tail light in North Charleston, South Carolina, on Saturday.

Poll: Nine out of ten people feel stressed if their phone battery run out.<n>There’s even a word for it — ‘nomophobia’, the fear of being without a working mobile.<n>Sir James Dyson is attempting to solve the problem by investing £10 million in U.S.-based battery experts Sakti3.

Justin Whittington, 23, was arrested on Friday in Bakersfield, California, and charged with child cruelty.<n>He was initially charged with 'cruelty' but his charge was changed to 'endangerment' and his bail was lowered from $1 million to $20,000.<n>On Saturday, Whittington posted bail and will be released by Sunday morning.

A Tumblr blog called Conversation Sparks has been created by Ryan Chapman.<n>The cartoons are designed to help kickstart a conversation during an awkward silence.<n>They include: 'Tall men marry earlier but short men stay married longer'

Ryan Reynolds was the victim of a hit-and-run in a hotel parking lot, according to his publicist and Vancouver police.<n>The 38-year-old was struck by a car while walking in the residential parking garage of the Shangri-La hotel, but he was left uninjured.<n>The Vancouver-born actor, who earlier this year became the father of a baby girl named James, has been in the city for weeks shooting his new film, Deadpool.

The car, which was carrying 12 passengers, crashed when a blown tire caused the 2006 Ford Expedition to overturn Saturday in Martin County, on central Florida's Atlantic Coast.<n>38-year-old Uriel Miranda died at the scene and his 2-year-old daughter Yaretsi Miranda died Saturday evening at a hospital.<n>Eight-year-old Yordi Miranda died Sunday at a hospital.<n>Authorities said Uriel and the toddler were not wearing seatbelts.

USS Independence found off California's Farallon Islands with hull and deck very well preserved and clearly visible.<n>Veteran ship even survived an atomic bomb test after being chosen as a 'target vessel' for Operation Crossroads on July 1, 1946.<n>Controversy surrounds its sinking as some believe the ship was loaded with barrels of radioactive waste.

Tokyo's Narita Airport has installed cushioned running tracks in its new Terminal 3.<n>The tracks were designed to celebrate the 2020 Olympics, which will be held in Tokyo.<n>The airport says the innovative tracks were installed to save money.

Joanna Flynn, 50, worked at Georgian Bay General Hospital in Ontario.<n>She has been charged with manslaughter and criminal negligence.<n>The name of the patient has not been formally released, but her husband said she was the 39-year-old mother of two who died at the hospital last year.<n>The hospital's CEO said: 'A criminal charge involving someone at our hospital is... highly distressing'

The Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute in New York has pushed back its planned screening of the controversial Iraq war film.<n>It said it will still show the Oscar-nominated movie but with an educational forum follow-up to allow students to discuss the film.<n>The postponement was made in response to complaints from the RPI’s Muslim Students’ Association.<n>A number of students have said the postponement was an act of censorship and an attack on free speech.
Emma Watson turned 25 yesterday.<n>The Harry Potter star has carved a career that many can only dream of.<n>Here FEMAIL charts her 14 years in the spotlight that have made her an icon.

Tewksbury Police Department came under attack by criminals in December.<n>They infected their network with a form of Internet malware called CryptoLocker.<n>Program infects through an e-mail and then scrambles the data on the computer.<n>It caused police systems to be down between four and five days.<n>Cops were forced to pay a $500 Bitcoin ransom to decrypt the files.
Digby was abandoned on street next to bins and was close to death.<n>But he was rescued by RSPCA and taken to a centre in Hertfordshire.<n>He quickly became inseparable from 9st mastiff Nero.

Lucy Gransbury wrote a two-page rant claiming her neighbours were keeping her awake at night.<n>She then dropped a thank you letter and gifts over the fence to her neighbours.<n>After a month of not hearing back from any of her boisterous neighbours, Jershon Witehira posted an equally cheeky reply on his Facebook page.<n>He claimed only the deaf and 'those buried in the cemetery' would have any concerns with the noise coming for his home.

Brendan Rodgers rented a £69,950 terrace house in Accrington.<n>The Liverpool manager was ordered to pay £400 and £375 costs.<n>Rodgers and his business partner Judith O'Hagan were found guilty of ignoring an improvement notice issued by Hyndburn Council.<n>The pair had been ordered to fix the windows, doors and roof, and to remove the rubbish from the house's garden.

Henry Howes, 4, got stuck in arcade game at swimming pool in Staffordshire.<n>He had tried to pick up a Despicable Me toy but slipped under the trap door.<n>It took staff half an hour to free him as they searched for the key to machine.<n>His brother Harvey, nine, witnessed the accident and called their mother.

Man, 44, recently returned from holiday in Algeria.<n>He wanted to complain about the 'too hot' weather in the country.<n>Greater Manchester Police tweeted about the incident.<n>Police warned public against wasting time.

Ukip candidate Kim Rose is being investigated by police over sausage rolls.<n>The 57-year-old is running for Nigel Farage's party in Southampton Itchen.<n>He laid out the snacks at an event, which also featured snooker star Jimmy White.<n>Under electoral rules food and entertainment cannot be provided by candidates.<n>Mr Rose branded police involvement as 'absolutely ridiculous'

Study analysed DNA from 21,566 men convicted of sex offences in Sweden.<n>Sons and brothers of convicted sex offenders were four to five times more likely to be convicted of sex crimes than men in the general population.<n>Genetic factors were also found to be stronger for child molestation.<n>This is because genetic traits are developed through interaction between genes and the environment.

Dr Unt Tun Maung, 43, assaulted the vulnerable teen during routine exam.<n>Asked her to remove bra before cupping and squeezing each of her breasts.<n>Defence lawyer said Maung had lost all respect of community after attack.<n>Judge said only an immediate prison sentence was appropriate for the crime.

There are DIY tricks you can use to prolong the life of your blooms.<n>With simple tricks recommended by a professional florist, you can make your flowers last.<n>From spraying them in hairspray to keeping them far away from fruit and electricals, we've gathered a handy list of seven unlikely tips from Serenata Flowers.

Michael Munday has taken to social media to post love notes dedicated to his ex-girlfriend, Melissa.<n>The Sydney man has posted 135 tweets about his ex-girlfriend and has about 23k followers.<n>He says by gaining retweets, 'likes' on his Facebook page and using hashtags #michaellovesmelissa it will prove how much he loves Melissa.<n>Yet some users were not entirely convinced by Mr Munday's plea for help, describing his messages as 'creepy and inappropriate'

The Kardashian-Wests arrived early on Monday in Jerusalem's Old City.<n>Kim took to Instagram to share pictures from inside the Armenian St. James Cathedral.<n>The visit was to baptize their daughter North.

Samantha Cameron revealed her love of alternative group Polia.<n>Band specialise in psychedelic rock and their songs feature violent imagery.<n>Mrs Cameron joined the crowd at a recent gig in Shoreditch, East London.

Angela Morales was diagnosed with anencephaly, a birth defect in which babies are born without parts of their brain and skull.<n>Sonia and Rony Morales decided to 'keep her no matter what'<n>She celebrated her first birthday on March 23 alongside their four-year-old daughter Elizabeth.

Woman flew to region twice after falsely claiming to be teacher's cousin.<n>Newspaper in Halterner said she flew to the region twice after the crash.<n>Police are investigating the possible fraud and the alleged culprit will be questioned.<n>All 150 people on board the Germanwings flight died in the crash last month.

Michael Gove said he could not rule out further cuts to child benefit.<n>The Tory chief whip said he would not cut benefits for the disabled or pensioners.<n>But he refused to rule out cutting child benefit to reduce the deficit.<n>Comes after George Osborne refused to rule out further cuts to child benefit.

Jared Quirk, 18, was on a school trip to Greece when he died on Friday.<n>Was walking with friends in Athens when he collapsed.<n>Authorities have not revealed the cause of death for the athlete.<n>It is the third death of a student at Rockland High School in six months.<n>Joshua Rose, 17, died suddenly on October 1, and Patrick Sullivan, 17, died in a car crash on New Year's Eve.

An estimated 957,000 shoppers in the US alone ordered Apple Watches.<n>This popularity surpassed expectations - even Apple's.<n>In a leaked memo from the firm's Angela Ahrendts, the retail chief said that customers won't be able to buy an Apple Watch in store 'through the month of May'<n>It was expected to launch on 24 April.

Baby elephant was walking alongside its herd at Whipsnade Zoo.<n>The mammal uses its trunk to hold onto another elephant’s tail.<n>But when it got in between the last two elephants, it broke their chain.

The video depicts the 918 Spyder clocking 350km/h as it rockets down a dead-straight stretch of road.<n>The car was driven by New Zealand professional race car driver Craig Baird.<n>The video is part of a promotional tour from Porsche to promote their 918 Spyder, a limited edition $900,000 supercar.

Teenager filmed meowing in distress as he threw Tilly against door.<n>He claimed he was 'accidentally' high on super-strength cannabis.<n>Tilly was held by her tail and dangled in bathwater by her tail.<n>RSPCA inspectors found her that she had to be put to sleep.<n>Owner Sarah Reeves was also given a ten-year ban from keeping animals.

Bosnian town Buzim has more than 200 sets of twins in a population of 20,000.<n>Local officials want to turn the high number of multiple births into a tourist attraction.<n>Local journalist Nedzib Vucelj noticed the phenomenon when his wife gave birth to twins during the 1992-95 civil war.<n>He has identified at least 200 sets of twins and wants to turn the phenomenon into a tourist attraction.

Private hospital in Harley Street says increasing numbers are seeking help.<n>Hospital says it is now time for the industry to be 'taken to task'<n>Law graduate Lois Roberts said surgery to correct her short-sightedness left her in agony.

Mohammed Khubaib, originally from Pakistan, convicted of child sex offences.<n>Married businessman 'hooked' girls with vodka in attempt to make them 'compliant'<n>43-year-old would pursue interest 'away from his home and family'<n>Jury found him guilty of forcing 14-year-old girl to perform sex act on him.<n>Also convicted of nine counts of trafficking for sexual exploitation.<n>His friend Manase Motaung, 32, cleared of raping a 16-year-old and seven trafficking charges, involving six girls.

Schieffer, 78, announced his retirement at the Schieffer School of Journalism at Texas Christian University.<n>He began his career at CBS News in 1969 and has hosted 'Face the Nation' since 1991.<n>On Wednesday, Schieffer tweeted 'Great talking journalism at @TCU tonight. Also really happy to be in my hometown, where it all started, to announce my retirement'

Nancy Kanwisher, 56, is a professor at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.<n>Clip shows her chopping at her shoulder-length bob with scissors.<n>Graduate student then uses an electronic razor to shave the rest off.<n>Short video was posted on Brain Talks website designed to teach people about the different methods of studying the brain.

A new jihadi video has emerged on social media showing a group of female jihadis firing machine guns and practising drills.<n>The women are seen shouting religious slogans and shouting at each other.<n>Some of the women appear to struggle with the cumbersome weapons.<n>The group of women are believed to be from Syria and could be British nationals.

Sign erected outside a university building in Cambridge telling cyclists to leave bikes at the side of the road.<n>But the message contains grammatical errors, according to one expert.<n>It warns bikes will be'removed or destroyed' if they are left behind.

Mohammed Emwazi planned to join al-Shabaab in Somalia, source says.<n>But he changed his mind after two of his friends were killed, source says.<n>Emwazi believed they were betrayed by al-Shabaab members, source says.<n>Instead he travelled to Syria and became synonymous with ISIS.

Floriane de Lassee has been photographing cities of insomnia for ten years.<n>Her photos capture the stillness of the night as people look out from windows.<n>She found her inspiration in the'recreation room' of her apartment in New York.

Grace Rebecca Mann, 20, was found dead in her Virginia home on Friday.<n>She was a student at the University of Mary Washington.<n>Her roommate, Steven Vander Briel, 30, was home at the time.<n>He fled the scene and was arrested two hours later in a church parking lot.<n>He has been charged with first-degree murder and abduction.<n>Mann is the daughter of a juvenile and domestic relations court judge.

Tesco still has the biggest share of the premium ale market.<n>But discounter Aldi has increased its share by a third in the last year.<n>It's believed Aldi is luring customers away from Tesco with cheaper prices.<n>Tesco has had a troublesome year, with its year-on-year share price down 18%.

Stephanie Scott's remains have been transported to Glebe Morgue in Sydney.<n>The NSW Coroner has ordered that an autopsy be carried out this week.<n>Police will reportedly make inquiries with authorities in the Netherlands.<n>Vincent Stanford, 24, was charged with Ms Scott's murder on Thursday.<n>The teacher was last seen on Easter Sunday.<n>A memorial was held for Ms Scott on Saturday at Mountford Park in Griffith.

Spain's Queen Letizia, 42, was at the Woman Awards held in Madrid.<n>Wore a sequinned cocktail dress with a clearly defined back.<n>Also unveiled a glamorous new bob haircut at the event.<n> Presenter Salma Hayek, 48, was also on hand to receive an award.

Mandy Fortuna, 21, died in September 2014 after receiving an overdose of Botox for spasms caused by cerebral palsy.<n>Her parents, Mike and Susan Fortuna, are accusing Allergan of failing to warn of dangers, negligence and breach of the Vermont Consumer Fraud Act in treating their daughter.<n>In November, a Vermont jury awarded a New York family $6.75 million in their lawsuit against Allergan.

The auction house was set to sell the collection of 450 photos and artifacts from internment camps.<n>Thousands of Japanese-Americans and groups like the Heart Mountain Wyoming Foundation protested the sale.<n>The Star Trek actor, who lived in an internment camp as a child, helped stop the sale.

Five people have died since vigilantes started looting and attacking shops.<n>Immigrant gangs confronted vigilantes in Johannesburg last night.<n>Police fired stun grenades and rubber bullets as immigrant gangs confronted vigilantes.

Mackenzie Moretter, of Shakopee, Minnesota, has a rare genetic disorder called Sotos Syndrome that has delayed her development.<n>She told her parents she wanted a 'big-girl party' for her tenth birthday.<n>But after her parents sent invitations to Mackenzie's classmates and heard no response, her mother Jenny Moretter took a different approach.<n>She posted in groups asking girls Mackenzie's age to stop by their family home to celebrate on Saturday and the response was overwhelming.

Newington College in Sydney's inner west notified parents and students of the allegations in an email sent out on Monday.<n>The headmaster said the case referred to alleged incidents from more than 35 years ago and asked anyone with grievances to come forward.<n>It comes after the principal of St Ignatius' College Riverview sent a letter to its old boys last month informing them a former student had made allegations of 'child sexual abuse over 30 years ago'

KGI Securities analyst Ming-Chi Kuo said the next iPhone will feature Force Touch.<n>Apple describes Force Touch as the'most significant new sensing capability'<n>It recognises scrolling and pinching gestures, but tracks pressure.<n>Rumours suggest the next iPhone could be substantial improvement on iPhone 6 range.

Dogs can detect prostate cancer with 98 per cent reliability, study shows.<n>The research was carried out by the Department of Urology in Milan.<n>It backs up tests carried out by the charity Medical Detection Dogs.<n>Prostate cancer is the most common cancer in men in the UK, with more than 40,000 new cases diagnosed every year.

Teresa Swarbrick died on April 8 after reportedly getting into trouble in the water near Julian Rocks off the coast of Byron Bay in NSW.<n>Lifeguards and paramedics were unable to revive her with CPR.<n>Her husband Alan has posted a heartbreaking tribute to her on Facebook.

Richard Graham faces contempt of court proceedings if he fails to take down tweets.<n>The Old Etonian former diplomat was accused of posting tweets to 'ingratiate himself' with voters by 'whipping up local feeling'<n>The 19-year-old was killed in a machete attack outside a pub in Gloucester.

Palaeontologists at the University of Alberta examined a pair of fossils found in Mongolia, which were first described in 2001.<n>They found signs of sexual dimorphism in the length and shape of blade-like bones called chevrons.<n>They suggest male oviraptors had broader and longer chevron bones in their tails so they could shake their feather-tipped tail to woo potential mates.

Rebecca Sedwick, 12, leaped to her death from the roof of an abandoned Florida concrete plant in September 2013 after'malicious harassment' from two schoolmates.<n>The sheriff's office filed charges against Katelyn Roman, 12, and Guadalupe Shaw, 13, but they were later dropped when they could not find any evidence.<n>On Wednesday, Katelyn's family filed a lawsuit naming the sheriff's office and accusing them of using Rebecca's death for'media attention'<n>The sheriff's office said the claims 'have no merit'

Ofcom received 21 complaints over the act, while ITV received 35.<n>The RSPCA said it would be contacting BGT 'to ascertain what methods were used'<n>French ventriloquist Marc Metral insists Miss Wendy 'loves performing'

ISIS released video showing three men being executed in Deir ez-Zor, Syria.<n>The men were blindfolded and driven to execution point in van.<n>They were forced to kneel on to their hands and knees before being beheaded.<n>Initial reports suggested the men were working for the Syrian regime.

Sidonie, a well known band from Catalonia, created a tongue-in-cheek tune.<n>The group composed the tune after experiencing a 'lack of respect'<n>Song was dedicated to Ryanair and its flight attendants.<n>Ryanair told MailOnline Travel the song was 'like sit down mate'

Claudetteia Love, a senior at Carroll High in Monroe, Louisiana, says she will not attend her senior prom because the principal won't let her wear a tuxedo.<n>Love's mother said the principal told her faculty members said they wouldn't supervise the April 24 prom if girls wore tuxes.<n>The school's dress code is not anything personal, principal Patrick Taylor said.<n>Love was going to go to the prom with a group of friends and no date, but all of them have decided not to go after Taylor made his rule.

The city of Naypyidaw was built in 2002 and is shrouded in secrecy.<n>The government moved the capital from Yangon in 2005 with little explanation.<n>The population is reported to be 924,000, but photographs would beg to differ.<n>The roads are super-sized and the buildings are organised into four-storey blocks.

Noelle Reno has broken her silence four months to the day since Scot Young's death.<n>The tycoon was killed after falling 60ft from his multi-million pound apartment.<n>He had been engaged to Reno for five years and they were due to marry.<n>She labels his death a'suicide', pre-empting any coroner's verdict.

Preston Wright, 23, killed his girlfriend, Sarah Owen, 21, with a knife.<n>Owen arrived at a house in Norman, Oklahoma, to move her things.<n>However an argument escalated and Wright stabbed her several times.<n>He then turned the weapon on himself at the house on Madra Street.<n>Police arrived on the scene and found the couple dead on the floor.

A recent surge in jellyfish numbers has moved tourism group Stay In Cornwall to reassure swimmers that the water is fine.<n>Jellyfish are not as harmful as they may appear, says Matt Fletcher, Stay In Cornwall's Matt Fletcher.<n>For the majority of cases, stings are mild or are easily treated.

Julie Walters, 49, has been jailed for two and a half years for her crimes.<n>She posed as trusted officials to dupe elderly victims out of money.<n>Was caught by police after she was spotted on CCTV loitering in retirement home.<n>Was caught on camera asking for money from 80-year-old man in February.<n>Then struck again on March 2 at home of 80-year-old man who lives in another retirement home.<n>She falsely claimed she was from the church which convinced him to let her inside.<n>Walters was identified on CCTV footage by a beat police officer.

Robbers used sledgehammer and axe to try and break into Wigan jewellery shop.<n>But a worker barricaded the door and they fled on motorbikes.<n>Police have appealed for the public to help them identify the offenders.

People with rapid eye movement sleep behaviour disorder (RBD) move around in their sleep and 'act out' their dreams.<n>Up to 90 per cent of people with the condition will develop a neurological condition, a study found.<n>RBD is usually noticed when it causes danger to the sleeping person, their bed partner, or others they encounter.

Celebrities have tried-and-tested techniques to flatter their figure.<n>They all follow simple styling hacks to make the most of their figure.<n>Navy and black is the season's hottest colour combination.

Around 1.3 billion Chinese people marked the Qingming Festival, a three-day holiday in China, by travelling home.<n>Families descended on graveyards to clean their tombs and honour their loved ones, burning fake paper money and leaving their favourite food and drink.<n>In Shaanxi Province, a huge outdoor celebration was held in honour of the 'Yellow Emperor' Huangdi.

The Air Malta passenger jet took off from Malta's international airport.<n>The Airbus A319 flew two circuits around the island before skirting the coast.<n>The flight was to celebrate the wedding of two of the airline's crew.<n>The happy couple were accompanied by their family and friends.

Blaze broke out at boathouse overlooking River Avon at Warwick Castle.<n>Tourists had gathered to watch cannonball fired from trebuchet yesterday.<n>But sparks from fireball ignited roof of boathouse, causing it to erupt.<n>Building, which was unoccupied at time, has now been destroyed.

Puren was youngest brother of final Qing monarch Puyi, who ruled until 1912.<n>He died on Friday after being taken to hospital with pneumonia in February.<n>One of his sons said Puren was 'almost deaf' and 'couldn't recognise people'

Todd Phillips, 40, was struck at full speed as he flags down one of his drivers during Sunday's inaugural Indy Grand Prix of Louisiana.<n>Surveillance footage shows him flipping forward and performing a somersault before co-workers rush over to check he's okay.<n>He sustained minor injuries to his leg which required six stitches.<n>Phillips of Franklin, Wisconsin, only sustained minor injuries to his leg which required six stitches.

Kate made the revelation during a party to celebrate Goring Hotel's birthday.<n>She chatted to guests including luxury travel agent Claudia Gordon.<n>The Duchess of Cambridge stayed at the hotel night before wedding to William.

Mikaela Jane Davidson was born April 4 at Brigham and Women's Hospital.<n>Dr Michael Davidson was shot dead January 20 by Stephen Pasceri, a patient's son, at the hospital.<n>Pasceri's relatives said he was angry over the death of his mother.<n>Dr Davidson's wife, Dr Terri Halperin, is seven months pregnant with their fourth child.

HBO NOW is available in the US for $14.99 (£9.90) a month.<n>It will include all past, present and future HBO programming.<n>Service is available on Apple TV, iPhone and iPad from today.<n>It will then move on to other web-based systems for three months.<n>This includes streaming on a Mac similar to Netflix.<n>Game of Thrones will premiere on Apple TV on April 12.

Shadow Welsh secretary Owen Smith said Trident could not be scrapped.<n>Around three quarters of Labour candidates back scrapping Trident.<n>But the party has committed to maintaining the deterrent in manifesto.

Labour has jumped to 35%, up one point from last month, according to Ipsos MORI.<n>But just one in three voters think Miliband is 'capable', poll shows.<n>Only a third see Labour leader as a 'capable leader', according to poll.<n>Only a quarter think he would be 'good in a crisis', according to the survey.<n>Ukip is now languishing on just 10%, according to the poll, two points ahead of Greens.

Barack Obama made an unscheduled stop at the Bob Marley museum.<n>The president was in Jamaica for a meeting with Caribbean leaders.<n>He is the first U.S. president to visit Kingston since Ronald Reagan in 1982.

Model Chrissy Teigen posted a picture of her stretch marks on Instagram.<n>Fans were happy that she was showing them off and praised her for it.<n>Singer Pink hit back at critics who fat shamed her for an outfit she wore.

Hamza Parvez, 22, is living with a group of unmarried fighters in Raqqa.<n>He travelled to Syria in May 2014 and hasn't found a wife.<n>He is living with a group of English speaking fighters, originally from Europe.<n>One of his friends, a Belgian fighter, recently wrote: 'U another brother got married... The pain... LOL I'm happy for him but still... The pain...'

The Australian navy is allegedly returning up to 50 asylum seekers to Vietnam in a secret operation.<n>The asylum seekers were intercepted earlier in April, and are being returned through the port of Vung Tau.<n>The HMAS Choules would cost $2.8 million to operate for the two-week return journey.<n>The Federal government maintains that returning illegal maritime arrival detainees is consistent with Australia's obligations.

McDonnell and his wife, Maureen, were convicted in a joint trial in September of accepting more than $165,000 in gifts and loans from former Star Scientific Inc. CEO Jonnie Williams.<n>The couple remains free while they pursue separate appeals.<n>McDonnell was sentenced to two years in prison and his wife to one year and one day, but they remain free while they pursue separate appeals.

Police arrested 53 people as pro-cannabis protestors gathered in London.<n>Campaigners were seen openly smoking marijuana and comparing size of joints.<n>They were holding annual '420' event - a global celebration of cannabis reform.<n>Four officers were seen rushing towards man at Hyde Park entrance and taking him down.

Several people were injured during the violent protests in Melbourne.<n>Two people were arrested after they attempted to break through a police barricade that separated the groups.<n>More than 100 police officers, eleven mounted on horses were used to form the separation wall.<n>The 16 rallies were held across Australia against Sharia law and halal tax.

Remy Dufrene, 3, of Raceland, Louisiana, was killed after being swept away in a drainage ditch Tuesday afternoon.<n>The boy was in the kitchen with his grandmother when he ran out the back door as she was pouring him a glass of milk.<n>The grandmother tried to chase after the young boy, but soon after there was a loud scream as he fell into the drainage ditch.<n>His father searched for the boy's body but it took him 15 minutes to find his son in the ditch.

Wardens at Windsor Castle have voted for industrial action over pay.<n>Staff claim they are expected to carry out extra duties for no extra money.<n>Union said they are asked to perform extra duties for free such as speaking foreign languages to overseas visitors.<n>Public and Commercial Services Union said Queen should not 'abuse' staff's goodwill.

Liam Dawe was shaken as a four week old baby and suffered health complications ever since.<n>He died last year from 'intra-abdominal sepsis' after being admitted to hospital.<n>Police are considering manslaughter charges after he died two decades later.<n>Coroner said his health was 'compromised' by the assault and he died 'earlier than expected'

Dylan Lauren, 40, and her husband Paul Arrouet welcomed their son Cooper Blue and daughter Kingsley Rainbow on Monday.<n>The couple confirmed to People that their parents, fashion icons Ralph and Ricky Lauren, are 'overjoyed' to welcome their first grandchildren.

Tanguy Pepiot, a steeplechase runner for the University of Oregon, had a clear lead on Meron Simon, a runner for the University of Washington.<n>But with less than 100m to go, Pepiot raised his hands in celebration.<n>Simon, who was second by a tenth of a second, stormed past.<n>The home crowd roared as Simon flashed past Pepiot, who collapsed.

Between Friday and Sunday 5,629 migrants were picked up in the Sicilian Channel.<n>Nine bodies were recovered after a boat carrying more than 150 people capsized off the coast of Libya.<n>Italy is the first port of call for migrants seeking new lives in Europe.

More than half of industrialised nations reduced aid budget between 2013 and 2014.<n>Britain's failure to follow suit means its overseas aid spending is double the average level of the other nations in the group.<n>Britain was one of 13 countries which increased its budget despite straitened times.

The California-based music festival has installed permanent restrooms on the grounds, but even nicer-looking facilities can spread germs.<n>Attendees are at risk of catching diseases like influenza, Norovirus, Salmonella, and hepatitis A.

Foreign-born blacks made up 8.7 per cent of the black population in 2013.<n>They were 3.1 per cent in 1980, but are now about 50 per cent.<n>Most of the immigrants are from Jamaica and Haiti.<n>Numbers are increasing as US-born blacks trace their heritage to slaves.

Esher and Walton is home to Gary Lineker, Frank Lampard and Mick Hucknall.<n>Residents have seen average income tax bills jump by 8 per cent in a year.<n>They paid the most income tax in 2012/13, with bills averaging £16,900.<n>The average annual income is £59,600 - more than £30,000 above average salary.

Google Wallet says it has changed its policy when storing users' funds as they will now be federally-insured.<n>Currently, Google's user agreement says funds are not protected by the FDIC.<n>With the new change to its policy, funds in Wallet Balance are protected if anything were to happen to the company like bankruptcy.

Young soldiers were slaughtered by ISIS at Camp Speicher in northern Iraq.<n>Families had been left wondering what became of their sons and brothers.<n>But now it seems their final resting place may have been discovered.<n> ID cards belonging to the army cadets were found at Saddam Hussein's compound.

Afzal Khan accused of conning customers and financial firms at his dealership.<n>32-year-old, originally from Edinburgh, may have fled the US, FBI fear.<n>Accused of obtaining loans for cars he never delivered, but for which purchaser was still responsible.<n>Also accused of offering to sell cars for customers, and then neither returned the cars nor provided any money from car sales.<n>Khan appeared on US reality series The Real Housewives Of New Jersey among clients.

Jackson Byrnes was diagnosed with a stage four brain tumour three weeks ago.<n>Doctors said the tumour was too deep and aggressive to operate on.<n>His family turned to crowd funding to raise the money for surgery.<n>Mr Byrnes is less than a day away from reaching his $80,000 target.

Nicolas Diaz, 81, allegedly stabbed to death Kevin Rivera, 21, on Sunday.<n>Came after couple got into dispute at their home in Brooklyn, New York.<n>Relatives said Diaz wanted to break up fight; he allegedly stabbed Rivera.<n>Mr Rivera was rushed to Woodhull Medical Center, but later died.<n>Diaz has been charged with manslaughter; police launched manhunt.<n>Couple had recently separated and had a baby daughter, Aeralye.

Russia justified in deporting 45-year-old man for breaking immigration laws.<n>He went to live there more than 20 years ago and has Russian wife and son.<n>But Strasbourg court said Russia had not breached father's right to family life.<n>Follows years of Tory frustration over ease with which illegal immigrants can dodge deportation or delay it for years.

Girl, 6, sexually assaulted by boy of same age in classroom and playground.<n>Police powerless to act because age of criminal responsibility in England is ten.<n>Girl's mother says school officials refused to remove boy from class.<n>She says she has now had to move her daughter to another school.<n>Mother is also asking for change to law as children are'sexualised'

Timothy Norris-Jones, 59, left his mother with bruises on her face and a cut on her right wrist that needed stitches.<n>He had previously attacked her on two occasions and was arrested after the victim's carer returned home and called police.<n>Judge Noel Lucas branded the attack 'horrific' and added: 'It is pretty unforgivable to strike an elderly lady'<n>Norris-Jones was handed a restraining order banning him from spending any time alone with his mother for the rest of her life and from visiting her house in Guildford.

Jennie Anne Kehlet, 49, and Raymond Keith Kehlet, 47, were last seen on March 22 in an area called Table Top near the gold prospecting and mining town of Sandstone.<n>Police are focusing on a search area of 10 square kilometres, however a search aircraft with forward looking infrared equipment has examined an area of 625 square kilometres so far.<n>Police are searching disused mine shafts up to 20 metres deep.

Raheem Sterling filmed apparently inhaling legal high nitrous oxide.<n>Drugs charity Re-Solv has called on the Liverpool star to apologise.<n>Spokesman said it was'very disappointing' and urged him to apologise.<n>Comes days after he was pictured puffing on a shisha pipe.

Lawyers have warned differences in defamation law in Northern Ireland mean controversial US expose HBO's 'Going Clear' might not be broadcast.<n>The Alex Gibney-directed film alleges abusive practices at the religion's US headquarters.<n>The show was due to premiere in the UK earlier this month to coincide with its American release.<n>But the fact that Northern Ireland is not subject to the 2013 Defamation Act means Sky is set to postpone or cancel the show entirely.

Kim Copeland, 52, was walking home from Sainsbury's in Coventry.<n>She threw used cigarette on ground before two council officers came'sprinting'<n>Grandmother was issued with £50 fixed penalty notice following incident.<n>But she refused to pay it within ten days in protest at how she was treated.<n>After failing to pay she was ordered to appear at Nuneaton Magistrates' Court.<n>She was fined £304 and ordered to pay £200 court costs after hearing.

Sources told the Wall Street Journal the four-man team spends its days devising and testing different technologies.<n>These include the flexible, wearable and electric cars.<n>Google has been working on similar projects since 2012.<n>It has been working with experts at AllCell Technologies to develop batteries that function at subfreezing temperatures.

Governor Andrew Cuomo issued state health alert Friday.<n>'Spice', also known as 'K2' or 'Mojo', is a synthetic marijuana product.<n>It is sprayed with a chemical to produce a similar sensation to marijuana.<n> 160 people have been admitted to hospital in nine days from April 8.<n>120 of those people were admitted to Emergency Rooms in same week.

Annabel Karmel has written a book called Complete Baby and Toddler Meal Planner.<n>She says that it's easy to become locked in a battle of wills when it comes to feeding your children.<n>Here she shares her tips on how to make children love eating veg.

Campaigners, police chiefs and MPs have accused Alison Saunders of ignoring rights of victims and failing to clear speculation of a cover-up.<n>Even her one of her predecessors said the horrific allegations should have been resolved in the 'full public glare of a courtroom' rather than her London office.<n>Ms Saunders said it is her job as head of CPS to make'very difficult decisions' which are not necessarily popular.

Culture and Media Secretary Sajid Javid promises legislation to force distributors to put effective age verification technology in place.<n>If porn websites fail to comply, they will be blocked by a powerful new regulator which will be able to issue financial penalties.<n>Mr Javid's pledge is a victory for the Daily Mail's Block Online Porn campaign.

Artist Catalina Viejo, 31, paints miniature pictures from paparazzi shots.<n>In total she has completed 42 miniature works, which cost up to $90 (£60)<n>Bite-sized series is titled 'A View of the End' and on display at SHAG Gallery.

Russell Brand has urged his nine million Twitter followers to sign up to the mercy campaign to save Bali Nine duo from facing death row.<n>He labels Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran's heroin smuggling as 'daft drug smuggling'<n>The British comedian also encouraged his fans to attend an exhibition of Sukumaran's work organised by his cousin who lives in London.<n>Sukumaran will turn 34 on Friday which is exactly ten years since his arrest as a ringleader in the Bali Nine drug smuggling operation.

Women's race has been held since 1927 but men have won for the last three.<n>Oxford, who entered the race as favourites, took an early lead.<n>They finished six-and-a-half lengths and 19 seconds ahead.

Levar Jones, 36, was shot in the stomach by a white police officer in South Carolina last September.<n>The horrifying incident was captured on the officer's dash cam.<n>The officer, Sean Groubert, has been sacked and charged with felony assault.<n>Mr Jones said he wants non-lethal body cameras for police.<n>He said the death of Walter Scott, who was shot dead by a white officer in South Carolina last week brought home the horror of his own shooting.

Brittany Cherokee Dawn Bell of Bartlesville, Oklahoma, appeared in Washington County District Court via video monitor from jail on Monday.<n>The charge of child neglect was pursued by authorities over homicide as the Medical Examiner's Office could not determine the cause of death.<n>The baby was found on the floor of the roach infested apartment with bites on her legs and head.<n>Bell said the baby might have been smothered by her 18-month-old twins out of jealousy after she had fallen asleep while watching a movie with them.

Danny Alexander is on course to lose his seat to the Scottish nationalists.<n>He would be one of the highest-profile casualties of the SNP surge.<n>Plan is to keep the 42-year-old MP as Chief Secretary to the Treasury.<n>Mr Alexander could serve as a minister in a second coalition.

Dutch and Canadian scientists asked 100 people to fill in a questionnaire.<n>They were asked to talk to someone for at least five minutes.<n>A fifth of the 1,000 meetings recorded took place over a meal.<n>Participants felt friendlier, listened more, gave more compliments and were more likely to make compromises.

Francis Pusok, 30, was chased through desert by San Bernardino County officers.<n>Seconds later, he falls off horse and is Tasered by two deputies.<n>They then catch up to him and beat him for two minutes, video shows.<n>As camera rolls, officers apparently kick Pusok in head and crotch.<n>Ten deputies have now been placed on paid administrative leave.<n>Sheriff John McMahon said video had 'disturbed and troubled him'

UK-wide conspiracy offered cheap erectile dysfunction pills online.<n>Gang made up to £60,000 a week selling the fake drugs to unsuspecting customers.<n>Judge described it as a 'highly organised, large-scale criminal enterprise'

Churchill Downs has banned the devices from the 141st running of the Kentucky Derby on May 2.<n>The iconic Louisville track joins a growing list of museums, music festivals and sports venues around the world that ban the pole-like contraptions.<n>The ban is a safety measure to protect the horses and the massive crowd on Derby Day, track spokesman John Asher said.

Elena Udrea, 41, is accused of accepting £1.3 million in bribes.<n>The former tourism minister is also accused of abusing her position.<n>Udrea, who finished fourth in presidential election, strongly denies any wrongdoing.<n>She has accused the anti-corruption prosecution agency of being linked to the secret service.

Face wipes have long been a lazy part of our beauty regime.<n>But a new range of wipes promise to remove eyeliner and mascara.<n>They also promise to retexturise and brighten skin.<n>In some cases, they even do away with fine lines and age spots.<n>Lauren Libbert puts some of these latest new-generation wipes to the test.

Hollywood legend, 71, has been a long-time supporter of the Democratic Party.<n>Said if Clinton is voted into the White House there will be 'no surprises'<n>Goodfellas star added: 'She’s a woman, which is very important'<n>In 2012, he caused controversy by saying it was 'too soon' for a white First Lady.

Map shows the variations in the way people in different states say things.<n>Some people in California think nothing of saying 'here's you a piece of pizza'<n>Others in Florida use the phrase, 'I ain't never had no trouble with none of 'em'<n>Researchers at Yale University used crowdsourcing to study the language.

Abdul Hadi Arwani, 48, was lured to an upmarket street in London on pretence of providing a quote for some building work.<n>But when the imam arrived, the killer got into the rear seat of his Volkswagen Passat and shot him several times.<n>Scotland Yard counter-terrorism officers are investigating whether Mr Arwani, a fierce critic of Syrian president Bashar al-Assad, was murdered on the orders of the regime.

ESPN sports reporter Britt McHenry has been suspended for one week after video of her berating a tow truck company employee surfaced online.<n>The 28-year-old was filmed berating the woman in Arlington, Virginia.<n>She had her car towed from the parking lot of a Chinese restaurant.<n>McHenry told the woman she was in the news and would sue her.<n>She also insulted the woman's looks, education and job on-camera.

Swastika and word'scum' were sprayed in white paint on the window.<n>'Q' added to blue front door, which some people said stands for quisling.<n>Ross Thomson, a Scottish Conservative Councillor, posted images on Twitter.<n>He said the party was'really upset' and said it just wanted people to engage in democratic debate.

Lawrencium, which was first discovered in 1961, sits at bottom of table.<n>But researchers have for the first time measured ionisation potential.<n>They found the element may have properties similar to sodium and potassium.<n>This may fuel arguments that it should be placed in the main table.<n>If it is redraw, chemistry students could have to relearn order.

Prime Minister Harold Wilson feared terrorists would target the heir to the throne.<n>Met police officers were sent to Wales to run a secret unit to spy on extremists.<n>Files show Wilson’s government approved plans to send officers from the Met to Wales to run the secret unit.

Birmingham officers responded to a phone call about a burglary in progress on the 300 block of Memphis Street in Wylam around 8:45 a.m. on Sunday.<n>The suspect, who hasn't been named, was quickly apprehended but not before he had driven the best part of a mile, abandoned the car and attempted to flee on foot.<n>The man had been attempting to hide in weeds behind an abandoned home.

Map reveals average yearly counts of lightning flashes per square kilometre from 1995 to 2013.<n>The Democratic Republic of Congo was found to have the most over the period.<n>According to the satellite observations, lightning occurs more often over land than it does over oceans.<n>And it also seems to happen more often closer to the equator.

Kevin Rudd and wife Therese Rein have sold their family home in Brisbane's east for $1.14 million.<n>The tropical Queenslander home still managed to sell for over three times what the couple paid when they bought the house in 1994.<n>The house was snatched up by applied economics Professor Uwe Dulleck, who already owns a home in the area with his wife Monica.<n>The polished but warm home is the place the former Prime Minister and his wife Therese Rein raised their three children.

Ryan Skivington took the pets, called Ant and Dec, out of their cage.<n>The 26-year-old boxer then squeezed the life out of them before throwing them out.<n>Girl's mother witnessed the attack during a row with Skivington.<n>Skivington also admitted assaulting his former partner during the attack.

The Eco Experts has created maps plotting which countries have the most threatened mammals.<n>The firm used the World Bank's World Development Indicator for deforestation and biodiversity figures.<n>Indonesia tops the list because deforestation in the region is leaving many species at risk, including orangutans.<n>Madagascar is second on the list with 114 endangered mammals, while Mexico sits in third with 101.

Beatrice 'Dee Dee' Spence, 24, lost her leg after Precious Richardson Coleman, 29, ran her down in her SUV.<n>Coleman, who believed Spence was trying to steal her boyfriend, drove off and fled from the scene.<n>The hit and run caused a housefire that destroyed Spence's home and a neighbor's, as well.<n>Coleman turned herself in to police Saturday and is being held on $750,000 for attempted murder and related charges.

Monsour Alshammari, 27, is in the U.S. on a Saudi government student sponsorship.<n>He was picked up by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement on Friday.<n>A judge in Provo signed an arrest warrant on Monday to extradite him back to Utah.<n>He is being held at a facility in San Diego until he can be extradited to Utah.

Rupert Brooke's poem The Soldier made him famous outside of literary circles.<n>His death at 27 from blood poisoning en route to Gallipoli cemented his image as the poster-boy of heroic self-sacrifice.<n>The Second I Saw You tells the story of Brooke's love life.

Caribbean island of Providenciales named the best in the world by TripAdvisor.<n>Rankings based on reviews from users around the world, with winners determined by algorithm.<n>No island in the UK or Australia managed to crack the top 10.

Amanda Butler, 42, had a normal pregnancy until her waters broke at 25 weeks.<n>Baby Callum was born weighing just 1lb 9oz and with translucent skin.<n>He underwent heart surgery, lumbar puncture, laser eye surgery and 10 blood transfusions.<n>Mrs Butler was later told she had bacterial vaginosis (BV)<n>The condition is caused by disruption of the balance of bacteria in the body.<n>It can also cause miscarriage and can increase risk of STIs.<n>Mrs Butler said she was angry she had never heard of the condition.

Sarah Hulbert, 59, worked for Bates President A. Clayton Spencer for a little longer than a month in the summer of 2012.<n>Hulbert claims Spencer expected her to jog with her at 5:30 a.m. but that she could not because she had surgery on her right foot in the past.<n>Hulbert claims that Spencer asked her to participate in tennis lessons but again she said she would'reluctantly' try because of the injury to her foot.

Judges gave the award to The Mail on Sunday ahead of The Sunday Times.<n>Mail on Sunday's formula for success includes two superb magazines, a fabulous pullout sport supplement and the biggest puzzles section of any newspaper.<n>Ben Ellery's report on Miliband's feminist t-shirts earned a Scoop of the Year nomination.<n> Literary critic Craig Brown was nominated as Arts Reviewer of the Year.

Kim Rose, 57, was alleged to have bribed voters in Southampton.<n>He was questioned by police over an alleged criminal offence of 'treating'<n>Mr Rose, who is standing in Southampton Itchen, will face no further action.<n>But he says he could be arrested if he tries the sausage rolls again.

Nasa's Dawn probe captured the images from 28,000 miles (45,000km) away.<n>They show two bright spots on the dwarf planet have different thermal properties.<n>The spots, named feature 1 and 5, appear to show different flashes.<n>The images were revealed as part of the first colour map of Ceres.

Madonna's new handbag has caused a stir for its seemingly drug-related slogan.<n>The word 'dealer' is spelled out in bling diamond lettering.<n>Rihanna has been seen with guns and cannabis-themed bags.

Cathleen Hackney is on trial at Stoke-on-Trent Crown Court.<n>The 56-year-old is accused of lying about the cremation of her son.<n>She allegedly told two funeral directors there were no objections.<n>But the court heard her ex-husband Paul Barber would have objected.<n>No-one attended the early morning cremation of Paul Moreland in 2010.

Trinity Culley, 10, watched the programme in her bedroom against her parents' wishes.<n>When her mother went into labour two weeks early, she sprang into action.<n>She collected towels and reassured her mother everything would be okay.<n>Within minutes she had helped deliver her baby sister, Jasmin Elizabeth-Rose.

Youngster's mother left buggy in lobby of building in Langley Park, Maryland.<n>It's easier to carry her son to second floor apartment when she leaves it there.<n>But when she went to retrieve it the following morning, it had disappeared.<n>Police have released CCTV footage of a person pushing the empty chair.<n>They're offering a cash reward for information about the theft.

Alexandra Allen, 17, from Utah suffers with the condition aquagenic urticaria.<n>It is so rare it affects just 35 people in the whole world.<n>The symptoms can last from a few hours to a week after exposure.<n>She developed hives after spending time in a hot tub while on vacation.

Three Afghan prisoners accused of murder executed by Taliban fighters.<n>They were handcuffed and sat on a barren hilltop, with their hands clasped.<n>Gunmen then shot them in the head at point-blank range, leaving them lifeless.<n>Hundreds of locals gathered to witness public killings in eastern province of Ghanzi.

Tony Hatch and Jackie Trent wrote hits for Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin.<n>They were dubbed 'Mr and Mrs Music' after composing for stars.<n>When Trent died last month, Hatch was expected to be at her funeral.<n>But her second husband, Colin Gregory, has banned him.<n>He says she never forgives Hatch for the infidelity that ended their marriage.

Family of ducks followed staff back to their office in Sutton Coldfield.<n>They drank from water bowls and wondered around the corridors.<n>Staff at Midas recruitment firm said it had the whole office in stitches.

Jason McDonald, 34, walked the thin rope line over a pool containing more than 50 alligators at the Colorado Gator Farm.<n>He said he got the idea after watching a friend walk slacklines several hundred feet up in the air.<n>Mr McDonald, who treats and cares for the rescued animals, said he has plans to walk over the top of four albino alligators.

The Bouvier's red colobus monkey was thought to have died out more than 50 years ago.<n>But scientists have now discovered the primate alive in the rain forests of the Democratic Republic of Congo.<n>They have captured the first ever photograph of the monkey, which appears to show a mother and her young.<n>Researchers now hope to study the monkey in an attempt to learn more about it.

The newly-opened Maison Souquet is located steps from the Moulin Rouge.<n>The hotel is a 'temple to hedonism' and boasts a swimming pool under a starry ceiling.<n>The property's luxurious interiors were designed by Jacques Garcia.

Farryn Johnson was fired from a Maryland Hooters in 2013.<n>She has said the restaurant had an issue with her blonde highlights.<n>An arbitrator recently ruled in Johnson's favor.<n>She has been awarded $250,000 for both her legal fees and lost wages.

Authorities ordered the slaughter of 250,000 birds in Telangana, India.<n>Eggs infected with the H5N1 virus were destroyed and dumped in a pit.<n>Bird flu killed nearly 400 people in Asia and Africa in 2005-2006.

Scientists in China are rumoured to have modified human embryos.<n>They are using gene editing techniques to alter DNA in the cells.<n>This means changes can be passed on to future generations.<n>Many scientists are concerned that this could be misused by parents.<n>They fear it could allow people to'select' genes they will pass on to grandchildren.<n>But others argue it could be used to rid families of diseases.<n>For example, cancer-causing ovarian tissue could be used to repair eggs.<n>This could then be used to create healthy human embryos.

New technology allows commuters to make calls and send texts over Wi-Fi.<n>Calls and texts automatically connect to the internet when there is no signal.<n>Samsung Galaxy S6 and S6 edge will also have the feature on EE network.

Ruben Costa, 35, pleaded guilty to impersonating a member of the police force.<n>He pretended to be a police officer investigating a crime over the phone.<n>The father told a taxi company he was looking for a woman who abducted a boy.<n>The taxi company put a call out to all staff and located Costa’s wife and son at women’s shelter.<n>Costa was spared a prison sentence due to his ‘remorse, work ethic and high standing in the community'

Khloe, 30, has been revamping her look in recent weeks.<n>Revealed she's lost 13 pounds in three months thanks to intense gym regime.<n>This week showcased flawless blonde locks and cleavage-baring outfits.

Officer Jared Forsyth, 33, was shot by a coworker during firearms training at the Lowell Correctional Institution in Ocala, Florida, on Monday.<n>Forsythe was wearing a bulletproof vest, but the round entered through his arm and went through his chest.<n>He was rushed to Ocala Regional Medical Center in critical condition and taken into surgery, but he later died.<n>The Florida Department of Law Enforcement is investigating the incident.

Jessica Kensky and Patrick Downes lost limbs in the 2013 blast.<n>This week a jury will decide whether to sentence Tsarnaev to death or life in prison without parole.<n>Kensky and Downes said their position is 'intensely emotional and profoundly practical'

Avril Lavigne told ABC News on Thursday that she had a hard time getting diagnosed for Lyme disease.<n>She was bedridden for five months and noticed fatigue and shortness of breath in the summer of 2014.<n>'I was up against a lot of doctors that told me I was crazy and that my problems didn't exist,' she said.<n>She is now trying to raise awareness about the disease and wants to help others who are in the same situation.

Aldi has 5.3 per cent of the market, up from 4.6 per cent in three months.<n>Waitrose has 5.1 per cent, up from 5 per cent, according to research.<n>Lidl claimed Britain's middle classes had become the 'Lidl Classes'

Chrissy posted a picture of her stretch marks to Instagram this week.<n>Hundreds of women have shared their own pictures of the marks.<n>The campaign has been running since last year and is called #loveyourlines.

Darwin woman Natalia Moon has become a TV sensation in the Philippines.<n>The 23-year-old moved to the country in 2012 after struggling to find work as an actress in Australia.<n>She became fluent in the local language, Tagalog, in the hope of becoming a star.<n>The Aussie, born Natalie Stewart, has taken to the role with lavish.<n>She is known as 'the blonde Filipino' and will attend the Golden Screen TV Awards on April 26.

Move would apply in pubs, clubs, supermarkets and off-licences.<n>Scottish Government’s health promotions agency put forward proposal.<n>If introduced it would mean legal minimum age for buying alcohol would be higher in Scotland than it is in the rest of Britain, where it is 18.

Gabrielle Yinka Saunders, 32, used colleagues' credit cards to pay for lavish spending.<n>She used £600 for flowers, £270 on a new watch, £210 on a new outfit.<n>Saunders was convicted of fraud twice before - but was spared jail.<n>She married David Osborne in Dulwich, south London, last September.<n>But she was arrested at Heathrow when the couple returned from their honeymoon.

Michelle Manhart, 38, was arrested at Valdosta State University, Georgia.<n>She was surrounded by protesters who were trampling on flag.<n>Manhart grabbed the Stars and Stripes and refused to give it back to them.<n>She was handcuffed and driven off in a patrol car by police.<n>She was a Staff Sergeant in the Air Force, but was demoted for Playboy.
Princess Eugenie, 25, looked every inch the hipster in New York.<n>Wore charcoal leather-trim coat and Nike hoodie.<n>Carried brown quilted studded leather bag by Rebecca Minkoff.

Narcocon, a Scientology-backed drug rehab network, is trying to build a center near Camp David in Maryland.<n>The company has been trying to get the land designated as historic so that it can conduct its program.<n>Current zoning laws do not permit medical use on the 40-acre plot of land.<n>Opponents say the designation is a trick to circumvent the laws and create a dangerous drug rehab program.

The trio of bikers were captured taking huge leaps as the sun went down over Portland Rock, an island off the coast of Weymouth, Dorset.<n>Professional trial bike riders Jack Gear, 25, Andrei Burton, 29, and Joe Seddon, 19, were unfazed by the choppy waters.<n>The group included renowned professional trial bike riders Jack Gear, 25, Andrei Burton, 29, and Joe Seddon, 19.

Marc Macrae was election agent for SNP’s Westminster leader Angus Robertson.<n>He said the party showed compassion for the Lockerbie bomber but ostracised him.<n>Mr Robertson has not even contacted him to ask how the treatment has gone.

Café in Hangzhou, eastern China, has installed eight air purifiers.<n>The one yuan (11p) surcharge is being charged on top of normal bills.<n>Customers are happy to pay extra for breathing healthier air.

Students at a Melbourne high school were drinking treated sewage water from a bubbler on campus for more than a year.<n>The bubbler had been dispensing recycled water for 16 months– from December 17 2013 until April 1 2015.<n>The water was inadvertently connected to an outdoor drinking fountain.<n>The bubbler has since been shut down and the other 20 bubblers at the school have been tested and none show traces of recycled water.<n>An investigation has been launched by the Department of Health and Human Services to assess the extent of the possible health impact on the students.

Stockton's Kingston Road is the backdrop for the latest series.<n>Neighbours claim housing bosses have given it a makeover.<n>They say it will look 'completely different' to anyone visiting after show.<n>Local council deny the works were planned in advance of the release.

Tabitha Anne Bennett 'drove her daughter to meet the older girl and encouraged her to fight'<n>She'sent a Facebook message to the girl claiming she was going to bring her daughter to fight the girl because she had been bullying her'<n>Two bystanders filmed the fight and Bennett 'kicked the girl in the face and pulled her by her hair'

Harrison Coogan, Hunter Coker, Carson Buckner and Brandon Barber, all 19, told police they were heading to Gulf Shores for spring break.<n>Officers found 106x18 packs of Natural Light beer, five cases of Corona and a five-litre box of Franzie White Zinfandel.<n>The frat boys are all members of the Phi Kappa Psi fraternity at LSU.

Mikenzy Snell was photographed with her best friend Matt Pliska at their junior prom in Waupaca, Michigan.<n>The pair were holding a sign that read: 'Real friends don't count chromosomes', referring to the fact that Down syndrome occurs when an individual has an extra copy of chromosome 21.

Jenna Louise Driscoll lashed out at a photographer outside court on Saturday.<n>The 25-year-old hit the man on the forehead with a plastic bottle.<n>She was charged with three counts of bestiality last year.<n>Police found three videos of her allegedly having sex with a dog on her phone.<n>She was released on conditional bail and will face court again on April 27.

Lib Dem leader promises to'spread the burden' of deficit reduction.<n>Plans for £5billion in new tax rises, £7billion raised from a crackdown on tax avoidance, £12billion in public spending reductions and a £3billion cut from welfare.<n>But he scaled back his plans for a mansion tax amid concern it could cost the party support in key seats in affluent parts of London.<n>Cap rises in working age benefits at 1 per cent to two years;.<n>Make changes to the universal credit benefits system and take winter fuel payments and free TV licences away from wealthy pensioners;.<n>A crackdown on tax avoidance

Robert Kirkland died on Saturday morning in Union City, Tennessee.<n>He founded Kirkland's home decor stores with his cousin Carl in 1966.<n>K Kirkland's expanded into a chain of more than 300 locations in 35 states.<n>He donated millions to found the Discovery Park of America education center and tourist attraction in Tennessee.

Iceland has become an increasingly popular filming location in recent years.<n>The country's waterfalls and glaciers translate beautifully to the silver screen.<n>Fans will recognise the north of Iceland, namely Thingvellir National Park.<n>The Jokullsar is the setting of the battle of the Hound and Brienne.

Robyn Exton, 28, from Kent came out to her family as bisexual in her 20s.<n>She struggled to find a girlfriend so decided to create her own dating app.<n>Dattch is designed for lesbian, bisexual and curious women.<n>She has secured investment from media mogul and co-founder of Bebo Michael Birch.<n>How To Be A Young Billionaire will be on Channel 4 on Monday at 9pm.

Sharky Jama has reportedly been killed in Syria while fighting with Islamic State.<n>The Melbourne man's father, Dada Jama, confirmed his death to SBS Radio.<n>The Department of Foreign Affairs was unable to confirm his death.<n>A spokesman said consular assistance was no longer available within Syria 'due to the extremely dangerous security situation'

Marie Csaszar, 45, died last September after a 10-year battle with a tumour.<n>She had worked for the BBC's financial centre in Cardiff for seven years.<n>Her husband Paul says she was forced out of her job after drawing attention to management blunders which cost licence-fee payers £150,000.<n>He has asked the BBC under the Data Protection Act for her emails.<n>But the Corporation has refused, saying personal data is only for living people.

Glenn Ford was wrongly convicted of a 1984 murder in Louisiana and put on death row for 31 years.<n>He was released from prison in Angola last year and was diagnosed with stage 4 lung cancer shortly after.<n>Marty Stroud, the prosecutor who put him there, apologized to him at his home last week.<n>Stroud wrote a letter of apology last month admitting he was to blame for putting Ford in prison.

Stephanie Scott's sister Kim Scott asked attendees of a memorial picnic on Saturday to 'wear yellow' in her memory.<n>The hashtag #WearATouchOfYellow quickly trended on social media platforms.<n>Hundreds of women shared images of their wedding dresses, balloons, ribbons, flowers and posters under the hashtag.<n>Police found a body, that they believe to be the high school teacher, on the night before she was die to wed her partner of five years.

Paul Harris, 47, arrested last July on suspicion of perverting course of justice.<n>He has now been released from his bail conditions after providing information to detectives.<n>Miss Lawrence, who was 35 when she disappeared, was last seen in 2009.<n>Detectives began reviewing case in 2013 and have since carried out a number of searches.

Rona Fairhead, 53, has said she wants to stay for a at least another year.<n>But two major investors and a leading shareholder group have voted to get rid of her.<n>HSBC’s Swiss operation helped wealthy clients hide billions from taxman.

Comics must go through lengthy process to get jokes on air, BBC editor says.<n>Some jokes even have to be looked over by director general Lord Hall.<n>Corporation is extra-wary about causing offence, Chris Sussman said.<n>Comments come after 'difficult few years' following Sachsgate scandal.

Tulip Siddiq accused of failing to tell voters she met Vladimir Putin.<n>She was at Kremlin with her aunt, the leader of Bangladesh.<n>Ms Siddiq was pictured alongside Putin and Sheikh Hasina.<n>Tories last night accused Ms Siddiq of trying to conceal links to Putin.

Wikileaks founder Julian Assange has compiled the emails and documents stolen in the Sony hack into a searchable database.<n>The information is now available online in a searchable form.<n>Assange and Wikileaks said that the correspondences have a public interest.<n>The hack was carried out by a group calling itself Guardians of Peace.<n>They hacked Sony Pictures in retaliation for the Kim-Jong-un assassination film, The Interview, starring Seth Rogen.<n>The group has since caused the resignations of Amy Pascal and Michael Lynton.

The Microsoft co-founder has created a new company, Vulcan Aerospace.<n>It will look after the space programs of Stratolaunch Systems.<n>This includes an ambitious project to launch spacecraft and probes into orbit from of a huge carrier aircraft with a wingspan of 385ft (117 metres)<n>The plane will climb to 30,000 feet and launch a rocket at high altitude, avoiding the huge fuel costs of launching from Earth.<n>This will then go into orbit as normal and deliver a satellite.
