Daisy, 26, stars in new campaign for Rodial's contouring range.<n>The IT girl was chosen by the brand last year for her 'quintessentially British edge'<n>FEMAIL caught up with Daisy to discover her beauty secrets.

Grant Allen, 38, travelled around the world with girlfriend Gaynor Godwin.<n>He used money from mortgage fraud scam to buy holiday home in Spain.<n>Spent £8,700 on holiday to Florida with girlfriend and children in 2009.<n>Jailed for six years for mortgage fraud and money laundering at Old Bailey.<n>Judge orders him to pay back £491,000 as proceeds of crime.

Jason Cotterill, 42, bombarded his victim with abusive messages over the internet.<n>He sent revenge porn to her daughter and threatened to post a sex video.<n>The terrified woman said her life became a living 'hell'<n>Cotterill was jailed for 12 weeks and ordered to not contact woman again.

The Mudgeeraba Caravan Village is home to more than 100 people.<n>The site has a history of drug abuse, violence, and poverty.<n>Ambulance officers will now only enter the caravan park under police protection.<n>Residents have told of the horrific levels of violence in the park.

The Todd family - a 36-year-old father and his seven children aged six to 15 - were tragically killed as they slept in their Princess Anne home.<n>Father Rodney Todd was raising the children after divorcing their mother in November.<n>The six-hour funeral service brought 1,200 people to the Ella Fitzgerald Auditorium at the University of Maryland Eastern Shore on Saturday.<n>The children's mother, Tyisha Chambers, 36, sat in the front row of the auditorium and did not speak during the service.

The TV personality is one of many celebrities who wrote a letter for the new book A Letter to My Mom.<n>Sarah Ferguson, Kristin Chenoweth, will.i.am, and Shania Twain also penned letters for the book, which was published last week.

Fanuc's robot uses integrated vision technology called iRVision.<n>It stops if it touches a human and is protected by a green covering.<n>This is down to the integrated vision which lets it'see' human employees.<n>It's designed to work alongside humans without the need for safety fences.<n>The robot can lift up to 77 lbs (35kg) and could be used in a number of industries, from warehouses to production lines.

Victorino Chua, 49, wrote 'bitter nurse confession' in 13-page document.<n>He said he might 'explode' at any time and that he had 'a devil in me'<n>Also wrote that he sometimes felt like killing himself, jury told.<n>But he said he feared he would 'go straight to hell no questions asked'<n>Chua is accused of killing three patients and poisoning 18 others.

A federal jury in Salt Lake City on Thursday awarded more than $270,000 to Marcia Eisenhour.<n>The jury found former Justice Court Judge Craig Storey liable for some $240,000 of the damages and the county liable for the rest.<n>Storey wrote in 2007, 'I'd love to harvest your sweet grapes,' and called Eisenhour the'most gorgeous thing alive'

Princess Beatrice seen at Bahrain Grand Prix, her fourth holiday in a month.<n>According to witness, she was with long-term boyfriend Dave Clark.<n>Princess Beatrice receives no public funding for her jet-set lifestyle.

Indianara Carvalho, 23, shot to fame after winning the Miss BumBum contest in 2014.<n>She had hymen surgery last year to'restore' her virginity so she could enjoy her first time all over again with'someone special'

Award-winning photographer Lee Thompson captured these wacky images in Vietnam and Cambodia.<n>The Flash Pack co-founder was on a 14-day tour of southeast Asia and couldn't help but marvel at the clever packing.<n>In Vietnam alone there are more than 37 million motorbikes or scooters.

Claudia Martins, 33, suffocated her newborn baby daughter.<n>She hid the infant's body in a suitcase and stuffed toilet paper down her throat.<n>Martins was convicted of manslaughter on the grounds of diminished responsibility.<n>She was cleared of murder but convicted of manslaughter on grounds of diminished responsibility.

Kurt Ludwigsen, 43, is accused of kissing, harassing and touching 13 players.<n>He was fired from his job at Nyack College last month after allegations.<n>He is facing 44 counts of forcible touching of another's sexual parts.<n>49 counts of harassment involving unwanted physical contact.<n>One count of sexual abuse was also charged against him.

Gloria Ross, 84, found with distorted face when visited by grandson Wayne Wilkins.<n>Nurses at Whipps Cross Hospital, North East London, said she was 'just tired'<n>Mrs Ross was finally assessed by doctor an hour later but died two weeks later.<n>Hospital put into special measures last month over series of failings.

Earl Olander was found beaten to death in his home in Minneapolis, Minnesota.<n>Police say he was covered in cuts and bruises and home had been ransacked.<n>Friends described him as a'stand-up person' and a wonderful role model.<n>Carver County Sheriff's Office said the exact and manner of death had not yet been established - but they believe there was more than one killer involved.

A man from Mittagong has struck gold after scoring a massive $20 million lottery win.<n>The winning punter came from the southern New South Wales town.<n>He said he and his wife had been'struggling' before the win.<n>The winning Oz Lotto entry was purchased from Mittagong Newsagency.

Vijaya Gadde said Twitter had let internet abuse go 'unchecked'<n>She said the social network did not recognise the scope and scale of the problem.<n>A study found that 88 per cent of abusive behaviour happens on Twitter.

Gang of three vandals caught on camera destroying dozens of vehicles.<n>They kicked off wing mirrors and smashed windscreens with a large cinder block.<n>Owner Freddy Ali discovered the carnage when he returned to work.<n>He is now offering a $1,000 reward for information leading to arrest.

Gulnaz was only 16 when she fell pregnant with her rapist's child.<n>She was sentenced to two years in prison for 'adultery by force'<n>The Kabul court reduced the sentence to 12 years following an appeal.<n>But Gulnaz decided to marry her depraved attacker Asadullah.<n>Now she is pregnant with his third child.<n>Gulnaz said she married him to save her daughter's life.

The prank was carried out by a member of staff at DFAT in Canberra.<n>30 low-ranking employees were told their jobs would be moved to Melbourne.<n>The announcement was made on a big TV screen for five hours.<n>It comes as DFAT plans to cut 500 jobs by June this year.

Megan Huntsman, 40, admitted to killing six of her children.<n>Told police she strangled them after they were born, then strangled the rest.<n>Was sentenced to six years to life in prison today in Utah.<n>But family rallied round her - and letters from her daughters defended her.<n>Said she was a loving mother - and killer was 'not my Megan'

Annette Edwards has held the record for the world's biggest rabbit since 2008.<n>Five-year-old Darius is 4ft long and weighs just under 3st.<n>He is the size of an average eight-year-old child.<n>Darius is set to lose his title to his son, Jeff, who is one.

Passenger on board American Airlines plane captures moment.<n>Two planes touch down on adjacent runways at the same time.<n>The landing is known as 'closely spaced parallel runway operations'<n>Richard Toomer, from the British Airline Pilots Association, says it is a'very interesting view out of the window'

Cpl. Burt Hazeltine, 36, was directing traffic on US 90 in Paradis, just west of New Orleans, Thursday morning.<n>A man pulled up in his pickup truck and opened fire on the cop, striking him in the face, elbow and eye.<n>Paul Devillier, 56, was arrested after a brief 'tussle' with police.<n>Police say Devillier and Hazeltine got into a verbal spat because the deputy refused to stop traffic and allow his 2014 Silverado to make a turn.

Zeus, a German Shepherd, served with Ridgefield Police Department for eight years.<n>He was honored in a grand procession on Wednesday before he was put down.<n>The 11-year-old dog had a severe degenerative hip disorder and declining health.

The treatment comes from the U.S. and is offered at clinics nationwide.<n>It involves using tuning forks on specific parts of the face.<n>They are said to tighten sagging skin and eradicate dark circles.

Shadow chancellor says he will not make 'unfunded and uncosted commitments'<n>Comes after David Cameron pledged to give NHS whatever it needed.<n>But he refused to say how he will find the money in his 2015 budget.<n>Labour will unveil its manifesto in Manchester this morning.

The unidentified woman walked on to the Kosciuszko Bridge from the Brooklyn side just before noon on Monday.<n>She climbed over the railing and stood on a section of metal piping 125 feet above Newtown Creek.<n>Police arrived on scene at about 11.50am and spent more than two hours talking to the woman and trying to calm her down.<n>At about 2pm the woman agreed to be rescued and police officers were able to grab her by the arms and pull her to safety.

Fiona Cullum sheltered Hassan Hussain and Yassin James after murder.<n>The pair gunned down Sabrina Moss in Kilburn, north west London, in 2013.<n>Cullium then lied to police when quizzed about Hussain's whereabouts.<n>She was today handed a suspended sentence for harbouring Hussain and lying.

Annegret Raunigk, 65, is set to become the oldest woman to give birth to quadruplets.<n>The German primary school teacher already has 13 children and has seven grandchildren.<n>She became famous in Germany when she had her youngest child Leila, then 55, ten years ago.<n>Ms Raunigk, who is in the 21st week of her pregnancy, said she was'shocked' when an ultrasound scan showed she was carrying quadruplets.

Prince Charles led tributes to Hayley Okines at her funeral today.<n>He described the 17-year-old progeria sufferer as 'an inspiration to millions'<n>There are 74 known cases of progeria around the world and only 4 in the UK.<n>It causes people to age eight times faster than the usual rate.

A company has copped a spray after making the 'tasteless decision' to link its product to the tragic murder of school teacher Stephanie Scott.<n>Mortein posted a picture to the account of its mascot, Louie the Fly, along with '#putyourdressout', which was a widely shared hashtag in support of Ms Scott.<n>The post was quickly attacked by people who dubbed it insensitive.<n>A spokeswoman for Mortein said the post has since been removed, and apologised for any offence caused.

Smart Boy case adds the Game Boy's directional arrows and A and B buttons.<n>It was originally designed as an April Fool's joke by Los Angeles developers.<n>But demand for a real product was so high, the firm has announced plans to sell it.<n>The attachment will come in the classic '80s grey', with more colours to follow.<n>It will feature an eight-way D-pad, two action buttons, a Start and Select button, and a battery that can be charged through the phone.

Yaakov Naumi, 32, grew up in an ultra orthodox Jewish home in Israel.<n>He has revealed the fascinating rituals, ceremonies and customs of his community in a series of images.<n>The photographer admits that some of the rituals, when viewed with an outsider's eyes, 'look strange'

Davion Only, 16, had spent his entire life in foster care after his mother gave birth to him behind bars.<n>He made an emotional plea for a family to adopt him at his church in 2013.<n>He has now found a permanent home with his former caseworker Connie Bell Going and her family.

Matt Stopera misplaced his cellphone in New York City and the only clue that gave a whereabouts to its located was when some unusual photos of orange trees and fireworks started appearing on his Photostream.<n>The phone had made its way half way around the world to southeastern China and into the hands of Li Hongjun.<n>Mr Hongjun had received the phone as a gift but whoever had presented it to him forgot to wipe its contents.<n>The pictures that were being taken in China were automatically uploaded to Mr Stopera's new phone and as an editor for BuzzFeed, he began writing and Tweeting about it.

Malijah Grant was taken off life support Saturday night.<n>She was shot in the head in a drive-by shooting outside Seattle on Thursday.<n>Police say the shooting was not random and they are seeking two suspects.

Godfrey Elfwick was recruited to appear on the BBC World Service programme.<n>He said the films were full of social problems 'rooted in homophobia'<n>Described C-3PO as a 'camp, neurotic coward' and Princess Leia as a 'horny space slug'<n>He also said Darth Vader listens to rap music and is a 'bad racial stereotype'<n>BBC has apologised for the hoax saying 'the force was not with us'

This is according to a study which claims the Kola fireball had a 'disturbingly similar' path to asteroid 2014 UR116.<n>Spotted on April 19 last year, researchers used camera footage to help recreate its trajectory and hunt down any remaining fragments.<n>They determined the fireball's path by studying its flight and the meteorite's final impact site, before creating a computer model.<n>It compared the orbit of Annama, a 1,100lb (500kg) rock, with the evolution of a dozen orbits of near-Earth asteroids.

Deputy PM says control of Department for Education would be key demand.<n>Clegg wants to avoid a repeat of battling against 'ideological gimmicks' of Gove.<n>Mr Gove was demoted from running ministry in last year's Cabinet reshuffle.

Kelly Nash, 25, went missing from his home January 5 after waking up coughing and sneezing.<n>Nash's body was found in Lake Lanier in early February after a fisherman spotted his decomposed body.<n>The former college basketball player left his wallet, ID card and keys to his truck at his home.

Humans of New York project captures people living in the city.<n>Photos are shared on Facebook with a statement from a name-sharer.<n>Beyonce says she hates her name because it draws attention to her.<n>Photo has received almost 300,000 shares and thousands of comments.

The White House said today that Bernard would depart after a state dinner next month held in honor of the Japanese Prime Minister.<n>The first lady said in a statement she was 'lucky to have such a talented individual on my team'<n>'I am equally lucky to have made a lifelong friend in Jeremy,' she added.

The U.S. Census Bureau released the updated figures online Tuesday.<n>Childlessness rates for women ages 15 to 44 were the highest ever at 47.6 percent.<n>For women ages 20 to 24, the rate was 75.2 percent.<n>For women ages 25 to 29, the rate was 49.6 percent.<n>Childless rates for women in their thirties increased last year, but they did not break records.<n>28.9 percent of women 30 to 34 years old were childless in 2014, as opposed to 28.2 percent in 2012.<n>Those with a graduate or professional degree had the highest childlessness rate

Chris Roberts, of One World Labs, was pulled off a flight in Syracuse, New York.<n>He was questioned for four hours by FBI agents and two uniformed officers.<n>Roberts was coming to speak at an aerospace conference about vulnerabilities in airplane systems.

Jean-Marie Le Pen, 87, angered his daughter over his extreme views.<n>She said he should step down as honorary president of the party.<n>But he has refused, saying it would be a 'crazy idea' to do so.<n>He is a convicted racist and anti-Semite.

Cle 'Bone' Sloan, 45, was crushed beneath the wheels of Knight's truck.<n>He was left with two fractured ankles and wounds to head, knees and shoulder.<n>But he told the court on Monday that he does not remember specifics of the confrontation.<n>He said: 'I don't want it to get misconstrued that I told on this man'<n>Knight is accused of murdering Terry Carter, 55, and trying to murder Sloan.

Couples around the world share their intimate proposal moment via HowHeAsked.com and Instagram account HowHeAsked.<n>Alongside the thousands of pictures are the couples' touching proposal stories.<n>One proposal was captured at the top of a steep hiking trail in Hawaii, known as Stairway to Heaven.

Kaden Lum was gunned down in his home in Bremerton, Washington, on March 28.<n>Heather Kelso, who was sharing a room with the youngster's mother, Jalisa, was also killed.<n>Two weeks on from the horrific incident, the Kitsap Sun printed the controversial illustration on their opinion page.<n>It depicts Kaden as an angel next to a caricature of a devil dressed as Uncle Sam.<n>The boy's grandfather believes the decision to print the cartoon, designed by veteran cartoonist Milt Priggee, was in 'bad taste'

The gooey deliciousness of a cake fresh from the oven is unbeatable.<n>But they can dry out and get stale very quickly so freeze them.<n>The process boosts the moisture, so you get an even creamier centre.<n>Fresh herbs in the freezer will intensify their flavour.<n>Creeps can also be frozen and left out for a few hours to keep crunchy.

Stephen Dodd tweeted picture of Asif Bodi and Abubakar Bhula.<n>He wrote: 'Muslims praying at half-time at the match yesterday'<n>The tweet was reported to police, who investigated but decided no criminal offence had taken place.<n>Liverpool have promised to take 'appropriate action' against Dodd.

Jake Boys, 19, surprised girlfriend Emily-Victoria Canham, 18, with tickets.<n>But he ended up booking flights to Republic of Ireland instead of Wales.<n>Boyfriend is now planning to buy a new pair of train tickets to see band in Cardiff.

Carolyn Thorpe, 62, was killed when a tree fell on her in Hiers-Brouage.<n>The tree was planted 200 years ago to mark the birth of Napoleon I's son.<n>Ms Thorpe's family have now received £86,000 in compensation.<n>Investigation found the tree was ridden with parasites that rotted the wood.

Lawrence Tynes is seeking $20million in lost future earnings and $15,000 in damages after he contracted the deadly infection in 2013.<n>The lawsuit was announced on Monday and alleges that the Buccaneers 'failed to disclose and actively concealed ongoing incidents of the infection'<n>The 36-year-old was in training camp with the team when he contracted the infection following a surgery on an ingrown toenail.<n>He has not kicked a football since 2012 and says the infection has ended his career.

Messenger is currently 18 miles (29.1km) above the planet's surface.<n>It is expected to smash into the surface of Mercury on 30 April.<n>It has sent back some of the most detailed images ever obtained of the smallest planet in our solar system.

Women routinely ask for £4,000 less for a typical job, study finds.<n>But this widens to up to £10,000 less in more senior industries such as accountancy.<n>On average, women ask for almost a fifth less than men, it is claimed.<n>Research found women also ask for below what they could expect to earn.

Edwin 'Jock' Mee allegedly locked woman in room and raped her in 2010.<n>She claims he called her a'sweet woman' and then raped her in the office.<n>The woman, now 27, says she became pregnant and later had an ectopic pregnancy.<n>Mee is accused of carrying out sex attacks on 11 victims as young as 15.<n>The divorced father-of-five denies 17 counts of sexual assault and three rapes.

Timothy Eli Thompson was born without any nasal passages or sinus cavities.<n>His mom put a photo of him on Facebook and it was removed by the site.<n>A pro-life group put an ad about the baby boy on the social media site.<n>Facebook has since reversed its decision after public protest.

Sir David Nicholson says Labour is the only party not to back NHS budget.<n>Wars on'substantial financial problem' at the heart of the health service.<n>Says it is vital for parties to sign up to the NHS's five-year plan.<n>Says it is crucial for the NHS to have a 'political consensus' over budget.<n>Jeremy Hunt says Labour must explain why it is not finding the cash.

Hillary Clinton flew from Omaha, Nebraska to Newark, New Jersey on Thursday on a United Airlines regional jet.<n>The plane has narrow seats and no middle seat, unlike the luxury jets she's used for her speeches.<n>The flight was a 3-hour journey instead of the 20-hour drive to her Chappaqua, New York home.<n>The Clintons have been trying to reposition her as an 'everywoman' eager to meet with ordinary people.
Dr Ram Manohar, 38, is alleged to have inappropriately touched nurses.<n>He is accused of touching one nurse's breast and saying 'you bad girl'<n>The doctor denies four counts of sexual assault.

The armed robbery took place at a service station in Watervale, Victoria.<n>The robber was dressed as a woman and had a fake gun.<n>He demanded money from the till before fleeing the store.<n>Police have released an image of a man that may assist with their enquiries.

Curiosity detected salts called perchlorates, which can absorb water from the atmosphere and turn it into briny liquid.<n>The soil lowers the freezing point so the water does not freeze into ice, but is liquid and present in very salty water.

Rev Richard Coles rose to fame as half of the pop band The Communards.<n>He now presents Radio 4's gentle human interest show Saturday Live.<n>Last year he published a frank memoir detailing his rise to fame.<n>It detailed his enthusiasm for 'dogging' and taking drugs.

Leo Bernal, 8, was released from Ronald Reagan UCLA Medical Center with 23 staples in his head.<n>Doctors had to open his skull to extract the bullet and shave his scalp.<n>Gunman broke into the boy's home in Culver City, California, Sunday night and shot at his father as he tried to shield him.

Randy Linn, now in a California federal prison where he's two years into his 20-year sentence, said that he can't believe that he tried to destroy a place of worship.<n>Federal prosecutors said Linn drove about two hours from his home in St. Joe, Indiana, to suburban Toledo on September 30, 2012.<n>He broke into the mosque where he poured gasoline on a prayer rug and lit it on fire.<n>Linn had several firearms in his car and carried a gun into the mosque, which was empty at the time.

Researchers in Singapore found those who frequently dine out or feast on takeaways are more likely to have pre-hypertension.<n>Eating out is associated with higher calorie, saturated fat and salt intake – all causes of high blood pressure.<n>A team at Duke-NUS Graduate Medical School found 27.4 per cent of the population suffered from pre-hypertension.

The Jane Doe was found in a wooded area in Volusia County, Florida, on April 23, 1990.<n>Her remains had been there for up to eight weeks.<n>The death was ruled a homicide and the case remains open.<n>Police have used the latest technology to create a lifelike, computer-generated image of the woman’s face.<n>She is described as between 25 and 40 years old, about 5-feet 4-inches in height and of a medium build.
The GR20 trail runs down the mountainous spine of Corsica.<n>It happens to be the toughest trek in Europe.<n>The trail started in the remote Golo Valley and is five to seven hours long.

The Gold Moto 360 is available to pre-order online from O2 from 20 April.<n>Customers making orders before 10pm BST on 20 April will receive the watch the next day.<n>It will then go on general sale online and exclusively from O2 stores on 23 April.<n>The original Moto 360 has a 22mm black leather strap and costs £199.<n>The Gold version has an 18mm stainless steel band and costs £249.99.<n>Apple is set to unveil its official Watch on 24 April in California.

Kevin Morton gave Kye Backhouse, 13, a super-strength morphine tablet.<n>The teenager was found dead at his home in Barrow-in-Furness, Cumbria.<n>Morton, 49, admitted killing his son by giving him the painkiller.<n>He said he will 'have to try and live with it for the rest of my life'<n>He could now face jail after pleading guilty to manslaughter at court.

Dominika Petrinova was furious after her boyfriend Erik Meldik's prank.<n>He told her that their pet dog Sam had accidentally been put in the wash.<n>So she decided to exact her revenge by gluing wax strips to a chair.<n>She then led her naked boyfriend into the room and onto the booby-trapped chair.<n>Mr Meldik cried and screamed as he tried to free himself from the chair.

Facinet Keita was representing Guinea at the 2012 Olympics in London.<n>He was knocked out in the qualifying stages of the Men's +100kg judo event.<n>After the loss he fled the Olympic village and was locked up in a detention centre.<n>He was released in March 2014 but is now applying for asylum again.

At the Namale Resort & Spa in Fiji, couples are 'kidnapped'<n>Staff at the Jersey's The Club Hotel & Spa polish sunglasses.<n>A'sunshine butler' is on hand at the hotel's spa to provide fresh sunscreen.

Pain and Gain report reveals home resales recording a gross loss were at an all time low.<n>32.3 percent of properties had shown properties selling for more than double their original price.<n>Sydney recorded the lowest loss-making resales at just 2.4 percent over the quarter.<n>Perth and Melbourne also saw extremely low resale losses of 5.5 percent and 5.6 percent respectively.

Duli Hembrom, 13, wrote to her teacher begging her to stop the wedding.<n>She said she took an oath not to marry before she turned 18.<n>The wedding is due to take place in two days, according to reports.<n>Nearly 52 per cent of girls are married before they are 18.

Amir Khan posted pictures on Snapchat while driving in California.<n>Pictures are of him driving in the city of Fremont close to San Francisco.<n>According to Californian law, using a mobile phone while driving is an offence.<n>Police are yet to say if they will be looking into the snaps.<n>Comes eight years after Khan was convicted for driving without due care.

Countdown co-presenter Rachel Riley looked embarrassed on a recent episode.<n>Two contestants came up with the same eight-letter double entendre.<n>Host Nick Hewer was left in fits of giggles as he tried to stifle his laughter.<n>Fortunately celebrity guest Dr Phil Hammond saved the day with nine-letter word.

Xavier Morales, 48, has been placed on indefinite administrative leave.<n>Female agent alleged he assaulted her at agency headquarters.<n>She said she was attending a party with Morales when he said he loved her.<n>After the two returned to the office, Morales tried to kiss her and grabbed her arms when she resisted, according to two people briefed on her statement.<n>Morales was due to start his new position this week.

More than 1,000 crimes created by Coalition in frenzy of law-making.<n>Include ban on washing clothes in Trafalgar Square and queue-jumping.<n>Tories and Lib Dems pledged to roll back Labour's'state intrusion'

Almost half of headteachers have vacancies in English, maths and science.<n>Some posts are attracting only one or two applicants for core positions.<n>School leaders warn the 'bleak' situation is likely to worsen.<n>They say pupil numbers and 'greater competition' among employers are to blame.

Boeing 777-300ER was travelling from Guangzhou, China, to Addis Ababa.<n>After refueling it departed for the Ethiopian capital but turned around.<n>Plane returned due to engine trouble and passengers disembarked for repairs.

Hizb ut-Tahrir (HT) has reportedly attacked civil activists in Aleppo.<n>Around 100 HT members, one armed with a sword, attacked activists last week.<n>Several British men linked to ISIS are known to have been in contact with the group while studying at UK universities.

Cortez Berry, 18, was serving time at the Burruss Correctional Training Center in Forsyth, Georgia, for his role in a 2011 carjacking and robbery.<n>The disturbing image was uploaded to Facebook Friday using a cellphone that had been sneaked into the jail.<n>It shows the teenager hunched down with a swollen eye in front of two shirtless young men, one of whom is holding the leash.<n>Two Burruss inmates involved in the photo incident were also removed from Burruss.<n>Berry has been removed from Burruss and placed in protective custody at Macon State Prison.

The Greek island of Kefalonia has been a haven for invaders for 2,000 years.<n>The beautiful beaches and rugged mountains are still a draw.<n>The island is a two-centre holiday destination, with its own little villages.

Eric Holder sent a memo on Friday to Justice Department employees reminding them that soliciting prostitutes is against agency rules.<n>His memo came weeks after a scathing inspector general's report found the Drug Enforcement Administration had mishandled allegations.<n>The ten DEA agents had the alleged parties 'at government-leased headquarters,' and three of the special agents 'were provided money, expensive gifts, and weapons from drug cartel members'<n>Holder said the department's prohibition on soliciting prostitutes applies even when employees are off duty or in foreign countries where prostitution may be legal.

Footage shows dust storm sweeping over Belarus, turning city to night.<n>China has suffered four sandstorms since the start of the year.<n>Earlier this month Britain was shrouded in a cloud of Saharan dust.

A virulent strain of bird flu continues to hammer the Midwest and the virus recently took its biggest toll yet after it hit a farm in Iowa.<n>The H5N2 bird flu virus had been found at a farm in northwest Iowa's Osceola County - prompting a massive bird cull.<n>The confirmation means up to 5.3 million hens there must be destroyed in a state that produces one in every five eggs consumed in the country.<n>Seven other Midwestern states have also been hit by the virus, dooming nearly 7.8 million turkeys and chickens since March.

surrender order issued by Hitler's successor to be auctioned in New York.<n>The typed dispatch was sent by German president Karl Doenitz.<n>It was found on Luftwaffe chief Robert von Greim when he was arrested.<n>Doenitz told officers to abandon fighting or face the Allies' wrath.<n>The note is expected to fetch £21,000 when it goes under the hammer.

Lib Dems will vow to protect the entire education budget in next parliament.<n>Unlike Tory and Labour plans, spending would rise per pupil.<n>An extra 460,000 schoolchildren expected in the next five years.<n>It is understood that Mr Clegg will say this is a deal-breaker in any future coalition talks after May 7.

Arlette Ricci, 74, is one of the richest women in Europe.<n>She was 'particularly determined' to stash money in Swiss accounts.<n>She denied hiding the equivalent of more than £15million.<n>But she was heard boasting in bugged phone conversations about changing banks to escape prosecution.
ARTY water is extracted from Californian artichokes.<n>Birch water is made from the sap of silver birch trees.<n>Sibberi and Nordic Koivu both contain saponins.

Sofinar Gourian, popularly known as 'Safinaz', fined £15,000 by Egyptian court.<n>She was found guilty of 'insulting the Egyptian flag' after wearing tight dress.<n>Dancer, who lives in Egypt, paid £10,000 bail and is appealing sentence.<n> Insulting the flag was made illegal by decree of President Adly Mansour.

Irish student, 22, told how she used 'every ounce of strength left inside me' to throw Jason Lee off whilst he violently assaulted her.<n>Victim said she kneed Lee, an ex-Goldman Sachs managing director, in the groin during the struggle.<n>She sobbed and said she was left in a state of 'disbelief' and begged her friends to take her home.<n>Lee, 38, who is married, has denied first-degree rape, sexual misconduct and third-degree assault and faces up to 25 years in jail if convicted.

Malia Obama's driving lessons were provided by the U.S. Secret Service, Michelle Obama told celebrity chef and daytime talk-show host Rachael Ray.<n>Mrs. Obama said in an excerpt of the interview that was released by Ray's program that the Secret Service wouldn't let her drive with Malia.<n>Malia also drives herself around Washington, Mrs. Obama said.

Bradley Dew, 26, had been drinking with his friend at a pub in Faversham, Kent.<n>He borrowed his mobile phone but returned later claiming he had lost it.<n>As the friend said he was about to go out he was struck across the face.<n>Dew then stole £10 from his wallet and fled the scene in March last year.<n>He was found by police hiding in a pub toilets hours later and jailed.

Tara and Gavin Hills, from Kanata, Canada, have been anti-vaxxers for six years.<n>Their seven children between the ages of 10 months and 10 years contracted whooping cough.<n>Mrs Hills wrote on her blog that she and her husband stopped vaccinating their children because they didn't trust the health care system.

Kim Richards was arrested early Thursday morning after allegedly attacking a police officer.<n>The 50-year-old reality star was hanging out at the Polo Lounge at The Beverly Hills Hotel.<n>Law enforcement were called to The Beverly Hills Hotel at approximately 1:30am where the mother-of-four was hanging out.<n>Kim allegedly cursed at officers and 'passively resisted arrest'<n>She was issued a citation for trespass, resisting arrest, battery on a police officer and drunk in public and was later released on $20,000 bail.

A tweet from a purported 2UE account appeared on Twitter on Thursday.<n>It said: 'Apologies for the s*** news service these days'<n>The tweet was in reference to 2UE's former newsreader Steve Blanda.<n>The tweet has since been removed from the @2UENews Twitter account.<n>2UE said they were aware of the posting but denied it came from their account.<n>Last week 2UE merged with rival station 2GB.<n>The merger meant job losses from the newsroom and redundancies nationally.

Annabel Beam, now 12, fell 30ft down a hollow tree while playing outside.<n>She hit her head three times and was rushed to hospital in a helicopter.<n>Doctors said she was lucky to be alive with only'superficial bumps and bruises'<n>Her mother, Christy, believes she visited Heaven after the fall.<n>For the first time in her life, she can eat solid food.

Chelsy, 29, radiated health thanks to bronze glow as she laughed with friends.<n>Wore ripped jeans and beige blazer for night out in Mayfair.<n>Second night out this week for party girl.<n>She was seen at launch party for new London restaurant on Tuesday.

Operation Xeres will focus on allegations relating to abuse at Skegby Hall.<n>The home near Mansfield was a former children's care home.<n>The inquiry will also look into nine other centres in Nottinghamshire.<n>The centres are all of which have either closed or changed their use.<n>Three of the 23 allegations relate to a former youth detention centre.<n>The oldest claim dating back to the 1940s was made at the centre.

Naz Shah claims she was forced into marriage aged 15 by her cousin.<n>But Respect Party claims to have a copy of her Pakistani 'nikah', or marriage certificate.<n>Mr Galloway accused her of lying at a hustings in Bradford on Wednesday.<n>He said she had 'only a passing acquaintance with the truth'<n>Ms Shah hit back, saying there are two copies of her Nikah.

Realtors in Indianapolis are looking to unload what's likely the Midwestern city's gaudiest and most famous home--a 26,000 square foot castle built of ranch homes.<n>The home was the creation of Jerry A. Hostetler, a 24-year-old pimp known to police as Mr. Big who became a local construction mini-mogul.<n>After he died in 2006, the home became a spectacle when no longer attached to its creator.

Grenada is a popular Caribbean island, and a great place to escape to.<n>It is full of fresh produce and is a great place to try new recipes.<n>The island is also a great place to relax on a beach, with great bars and restaurants.

Richard Howarth says he gets agitated when he sees Ukip leader.<n>35-year-old says he sweat and shakes when he sees Farage on TV.<n>He says he has to change the channel or become ill when he sees him.<n>Mr Howarth says he has always had a keen interest in politics.

Waverley mayor Sally Betts wrote a reference for convicted rapist Luke Lazarus.<n>Lazarus raped an 18-year-old woman in an alleyway outside his father's nightclub.<n>Now Cr Betts is developing a program to teach young women about 'risky behaviour'<n>She said: 'Let's try and close that loophole'

Teachers investigated over alleged links to Trojan Horse scandal.<n>It is understood up to 100 Islamic teachers could be banned from schools for life.<n>Allegations include extremist Islamic views being forced on pupils and staff.<n>Teachers allegedly copied al-Qaeda style video and punished pupils by making them kneel on tiles.<n>Investigation follows probe into Islamic plot last year which found anti-Western rhetoric and intolerance towards gays.

Dover police say a man they believe to be the so-called 'rat burglar' who cut holes to tunnel into buildings has been arrested in Maryland.<n>Thomas K. Jenkins, 49, was arrested last month by deputies with the Prince George's County Sheriff's Office.<n>He is accused of robbing 18 Dover businesses.<n>Police say Jenkins had cut a hole in the roof of a commercial business in Maryland on March 9 and deputies arrested him as he fled.

Bogan Shire Council, in western New South Wales, wants to erect a 'big bogan' statue.<n>The statue would be a 3.6m tall steel figure cut out of 5mm steel plate.<n>It would show abloke wearing shorts, thongs and a singlet with a fishing rod and a tuckerbox.<n>Locals and visitors would also be able to sit on it and take photographs.

Dr Bav Shergill, a consultant dermatologist, gives his verdict on these high-tech suncreams.<n>Dr Skin's lotion and sun drink comes with liquid food supplement shots.<n> Ladival is first product to protect against infra-red A rays as well as UVA and UVB.

Mario Draghi held his hands up for protection when demonstrator leapt on podium.<n>Woman yelled 'End the ECB dictatorship!' before being bundled off by guards.<n>She flashed V-for-victory sign and smiled as two men carried her away.<n>She was formerly associated with Feminist activist group Femen, she said.

Photographer Vincent Cianni, 63, spent three years traveling the U.S. photographing and interviewing gay veterans and servicemen to share their stories.<n>He wanted to better understand why homosexuals would enlist in the military to begin with.<n>Many were discharged because of their sexuality, others were raped, assaulted and bullied, causing ongoing psychological damage.

Chelsea bun is best paired with a creamy latte, cinnamon swirl or pain au raisin.<n>Espresso is best paired with chocolate truffles or a mini raspberry coulis.<n>Flat whites are best accompanied by a blueberry muffin.

Ricky Dearman was branded the leader of a satanic cult which trafficked children.<n>His children said they were tortured by their mother and her partner.<n>Scotland Yard investigated 'baseless' claims but found they were made by them.<n>Mr Dearman said his reputation was shattered and he received death threats.<n>He now hopes to win custody of his children, who are eight and nine.

Hundreds of payday lenders will be wiped out by tougher rules, experts predict.<n>Comes as Wonga reveals it racked up a £37.3million loss last year.<n>City watchdog forecast just three or four of 400 lenders will be left standing.<n>They include a daily interest cap of 0.8% and stricter affordability checks.

The IMF said Britain will still be running a budget deficit at the end of the decade.<n>The global watchdog said the state will continue to spend more than tax.<n>Projection underlines how hard it will be for next government to eliminate deficit.<n>The annual deficit hit a record £153billion under Labour in 2009-10.

Julie Bishop met up with shoe designer Jimmy Choo in Perth.<n>The pair were at a luncheon for families of SAS members.<n>Ms Bishop is a huge fan of the Malaysian designer.<n>She 'wore one of Choo's designs', according to a spokesperson.

Police are hunting for Kellie Cherie Phillips, 38, and Jondrew Megil Lachaux, a 39-year-old ex-convict.<n>The 17-year-old mother of the hospitalized child and sister of the dead child is being held as a juvenile on child abuse and neglect allegations.<n>Police believe Phillips and Lachaux abandoned the house several weeks or months ago, leaving the 17-year-old girl with the two younger children.

Sonia Pereiro-Mendez claims she was cheated out of millions of pounds.<n>She claims she was denied millions in pay and bonuses when pregnant.<n>She claims men were promoted ahead of her and she was'mocked'<n>She also claims she was subjected to derogatory comments about childcare.<n>She is suing her employer for sex and maternity discrimination.

Joseph Goebbels' family suing Random House Germany over royalties.<n>They claim publisher used extracts from his diaries in biography.<n>Goebbels was Adolf Hitler's minister of propaganda and died in 1945.<n>His daughter Cordula Schacht is representing his estate in the case.<n>Her father was Hitler's minister of economics and later minister of propaganda.

Norfolk Southern train derailed in rural South Carolina on Friday night.<n>Several cars overturned and leaked, prompting 1.5-mile-wide evacuation.<n>At the time, the train was carrying highly toxic anhydrous ammonia.<n>Also transporting non-hazardous ammonia nitrate, officials said.<n>No one was injured in the derailment, which occurred at 8.30pm.

Trevor Brooks is an associate of Islamist firebrand Anjem Choudary.<n>He was told it was not in the public interest for him to have a passport.<n>Home Office letter says he is an extremist linked to Al Muhajiroun.<n>Brooks was released from prison last month after serving part of his term.

UK clocked up growth of 2.8 per cent in 2014 – the strongest in the Group of Seven industrialised nations.<n>This was enough for Britain to leapfrog socialist France and become the second most powerful economy in Europe, behind Germany.<n>IMF is forecasting ‘solid’ growth of 2.7 per cent this year and 2.3 per cent in 2016.

Anthony Mann, 78, stabbed his wife Janet to death at their home in Warwickshire.<n>He told police she had begged him to end her suffering and was'screaming'<n>Mann was given a two year suspended sentence after admitting manslaughter.<n>Court heard Mrs Mann had dementia and was in chronic pain when she died.

Annegret Raunigk, 65, from Berlin, is due to give birth to quadruplets in weeks.<n>The German primary school teacher already has 13 children.<n>She was artificially inseminated using both donated sperm and eggs.<n>Mother-of-13 is in her 21st week of pregnancy and 'feels fit'

PM will be absent when Mr Miliband and four other party leaders take part.<n>He has agreed to just one direct confrontation with his rival in race for Number 10.<n>Mr Miliband accused the PM of 'ducking' chance to defend his record.

Tuah was born at Salt Lake City's Hogle Zoo in March.<n>His parents Eve and Elijah passed away just a few weeks after his birth.<n>Keepers improvised with a vest made from fleece jackets to simulate an orangutan's fur.<n>After four months of round-the-clock care, Tuah is thriving.

Burger King has launched three new burgers as part of its Party in the Park menu.<n>Pret A Manger has introduced a new evening menu at its London branch.<n>Diners can order at the tills but be served at tables decked out in silverware.

1,500 mourners attended memorial service at Cologne Cathedral today.<n>They were among the relatives of those killed in the crash last month.<n>German President Joachim Gauck said tragedy provoked grief and sorrow.<n>He added: 'We're being confronted with a disturbing act of destruction'<n>Flags flown at half-mast across Germany as leaders attend touching service.

A two-metre South American boa constrictor is on the loose on Queensland's Gold Coast.<n>Police found the snake at the base of a tree on a footpath in Surfers Paradise and then released it into the wild.<n>Snake catcher Tony Harrison warned that if the large-predatory boa has Inclusion Body Disease 'it can be unbelievably contagious if that gets loose in Australia'<n>He believes the snake will be found 'within a month' but there are fears if the boa is pregnant there could then be up to 30 live young on the loose.

William Beggs is serving a life sentence for murdering Barry Wallace in 1999.<n>The 18-year-old's dismembered body was found in Loch Lomond and his head dumped in the sea.<n>Beggs, 54, was described by police at the time of his conviction as a'serial killer in the making'<n>He screamed in pain as boiling water was thrown over his face and hands.<n>Alleged attacker was due for release this year and has since been moved.

There is a rising number of firms in the US that sell dog and cat biscuits containing cannabidiol, or CBD, taken from hemp.<n>CBD is a compound found in hemp and has been known to alleviate joint pains, treat mood disorders and even help pets lose weight.<n>Research has also suggested that CBD can relieve pain and discomfort in dying pets and calm animals down.
The Hague is home to Holland's royal family and parliament.<n>It is also the home of the Mauritshuis and the Escher gallery.<n>The city is a hidden gem, but is worth the journey to see it.

Flay, 50, filed for divorce from Stephanie March, 40, in April.<n>Page Six claimed Flay has been seeing Elyse Tirrel, 28, for three years and that March learned of the relationship just after Thanksgiving 2014.<n>A friend of March told the gossip site that she was'sobbing uncontrollably' at her home after finding out.<n>Flay's business partner Laurence Kretchmer dismissed the claims.

Siti Zainab was executed in the holy Islamic city of Media this morning.<n>She was sentenced to death in 1999 after confessing to stabbing her employer.<n>But her family were not notified before her execution this morning.<n>Amnesty International says her killing'smacks of a basic lack of humanity'

Only 53% know the Duke of Wellington led the British forces in 1815 battle.<n>One in seven believe that it was the French who were victorious.<n>Young people are more likely to associate Waterloo with the Abba song.<n>June 18th this year is the bicentenary of Waterloo.

Scientists have joined individual 30 to 60 mile (50 to 100km) wide strips to create a single complete 3D map of Mars.<n>The new map allows astronomers to'stand' on planetary surfaces and could help explain how water and lava once flowed across the red planet.<n>The first mosaic, pieced together by the German Aerospace Center (DLR), comprises 1.4 million square miles (2.3 million square km) of the surface.

Annual study by Tel Aviv University said 766 violent anti-Semitic acts were carried out around the world last year.<n>In France, the number of anti-Semitic attacks rose to 164 in 2014 compared with 141 in 2013.<n>Britain registered 141 violent incidents against Jews in 2014, after 95 a year earlier.

Experts say women are abandoning diamonds for more fashionable coloured stones.<n>The value of some coloured stones has increased by 2,000 per cent in a decade.<n>Celebrities such as Kate Middleton have driven the craze for exotic gems.

Walter Scott, 50, was shot dead by North Charleston police officer Michael Slager after he fled a traffic stop on April 4.<n>He was going to have a cookout with his friend Pierre Fulton at his home.<n> Fulton's attorney said that the men did not know why Scott ran from the car but said there was no confrontation.<n>Scott was behind $18,000 in child support payments and family members have said he may have run because he was worried about going to jail.

Rachel Simpson, 15, has a one-in-a-million genetic condition.<n>Doctors say it will eventually give her cancer if untreated.<n>The rest of her family are now waiting on tests which could reveal which of them also have a mutation of the GATA2 gene.

Rare formation appeared over Glen Cove LIRR station early Tuesday.<n>Two vivid, primary rainbows can be seen to the left of the image, while dimmer reflections, which have the order of the colors reversed, appear further to the right.<n>Curits posted the image on Twitter hoping that it would bring her luck - and the picture was promptly shared hundreds of times.

The socialite has been slammed for 'promoting the cruel whaling industry'<n>Pippa Middleton said she ate whale carpaccio at the Juvet Landscape Hotel.<n>The hotel is located in north-west Norway.<n>The meat is illegal in Britain but legal in Norway and Japan.

Ukip leader said he was 'jealous' of how the Tory leader has reversed the greying process while in Downing Street.<n>Mr Cameron, 48, has previously been accused of visiting stylists and even trichologists to keep his hair looking youthful.

Police release images of three of the Hatton Garden raiders but refuse to release ringleader.<n>Criminologist Richard Hoskins says raid is very similar to novel Black Echo.<n>The Michael Connelly novel is based on a gang who struck three LA vaults.<n>Gang, dubbed 'The Hole In The Ground Gang', struck in 1986 and 1987.<n>Criminologist says raiders must have researched the robberies in LA.

Robert Bates, 73, shot dead Eric Harris, 44, on April 2 during a botched sting operation in Tulsa, Oklahoma.<n>He turned himself in to face manslaughter charges on Thursday and appeared on the Today show on Friday to apologize to the man's family.<n>He said he was shocked when the gun went off and that he had no desire to take anyone's life.

The £260,000 GT is Ford's first supercar and will be rolled out across Europe next year.<n>The first models have already been shipped to China and will be on sale next year.<n>A stunning light sculpture in Milan's Piazza de Fidele showcases how the design team came about creating the prototype.

Girl attends Lone Hill Middle School in San Dimas, California.<n>Has been kept home by her mother since the threats began this week.<n>Sheriff's department says nobody else is in danger, but they are looking for poster.

Amanda Lukoff, from Arlington, Virginia, is raising money for her documentary The R-Word on crowdsourcing website IndieGoGo.<n>She hopes to raise $200,000 and has already signed on Scrubs actor John C. McGinley and Glee actress Lauren Potter, who has Down syndrome.

A woman was reportedly spotted threatening people with 'a dildo in each hand' during an altercation outside Roches Family Hotel.<n>Eye-witnesses said a fight broke out inside the pub before it spilled out onto the street.<n>Police attended the scene but no one made a formal complaint.

Kyle Wittstock, 22, died on Monday afternoon after his paraglider crashed into a garage door.<n>The 22-year-old posted photos from the air just hours before the accident.<n>He left behind a fiance and a nine-week-old daughter.

Sean Donohoe, 30, plundered the woman's life savings over two years.<n>He spent tens of thousands on trips to the Snowdome and in shops.<n>Builder even persuaded widow to change her will so he could reap benefits.<n>He has now been jailed for 21 months after admitting fraud and theft.

Khadijah Dare's mother has made a plea for her daughter to return home.<n>Victoria Dare says her daughter was a devout Christian as a child.<n>But she turned to Islam while at college and changed her name.<n>D Dare, 22, is notorious for threatening to be the first woman to behead a Westerner.

The 1991 Ferrari 348 smashed into a tree in Adelaide on Wednesday night.<n>The driver, who was uninjured, had only purchased the car a week ago.<n>The passenger was conscious when paramedics attended the scene and was taken to Flinders Medical Centre.<n>The car is worth between $90k and $110k and sporting 'Plesur' number plates.

Some have been awol from Ford Open Prison for as long as 10 years.<n>One of the escapees from the 500-inmate jail is violent killer Robert Donovan.<n>His disappearance only emerged last year, four years after he left.<n>Ford, near Arundel, Sussex, has the worst record for prison escapes.

France has passed laws banning the promotion of extreme thinness.<n>The reforms include fining agencies employing models with a BMI under 18.<n>They also criminalise pro-anorexia web content.<n>But experts say the laws may not have any effect on anorexia.

Iona Costello, 51, and daughter Emily were visiting Manhattan.<n>They were last seen on March 30 near their home in Greenport.<n>Stepson George Costello Jr, 45, was staying nearby at the time.<n>He has a long history of drug arrests and is currently in jail in Florida.<n>George Jr insists Iona was with him the whole time and never got on with him.

University of Cologne scientist led research proposing a new theory.<n>It suggests temperatures at Earth's equator were -40C (-40F) 2.4 billion years ago.<n>The reasons why the whole planet was frozen are not understood.<n>But it could have implications for finding life on frozen moons like Europa.<n>And it could suggest there are many more planets that resemble ours.

1,000 British companies questioned in survey on obesity in the workplace.<n>Almost half said they are less inclined to hire an obese applicant.<n>Feared 'they're lazy' and 'unable to fulfil roles as required'<n>Comes after European court ruled obesity a disability in case of Karsten Kaltoft.<n>25st childminder claimed he was sacked by his local authority in Denmark.

Actor, 89, is selling 238 lots at auction in Gloucestershire this Saturday.<n>He is selling off a 3D diorama of the Battle of Agincourt commissioned for him.<n>Other items include a yew longbow, furniture, swords and crystal chandeliers.

Ed Miliband announced plans to change rules on non-dom status on Wednesday.<n>He initially suggested he would 'abolish' the status if Labour wins election.<n>But it emerged he is proposing a time limit on it of between two and five years.<n>It's claimed the announcement has already had a negative impact on the capital's property market.
Dubai is renowned as the playground of the rich and famous.<n>It is a melting pot of decadence in the Middle East.<n>Despite restrictions of local religious laws, it's still 'bling'

Joshua Van Haften, 34, of Madison, Wisconsin, was arrested Wednesday night at O'Hare International Airport in Chicago.<n>He has been charged with attempting to provide material support to a foreign terrorist organization.<n>The criminal complaint alleges that Van Haften talked to people about his plan before leaving the United States in August for Istanbul.<n>In one post, Van Haften complained that the people who were supposed to help him just wanted his money and that he was dropped off on a road in the country and never picked up.

Ministry of Defence 1, also known as ‘Churchill’s Toyshop’, was a weapons laboratory set up in 1939 by Winston Churchill.<n>He encouraged his scientists to trial even the most absurd of inventions - many of which never made it beyond the drawing board.<n>The panjandrum was an unlikely-looking weapon, made up of two large wooden cartwheels with a ton of explosives sandwiched between them inside the axle.<n>After extensive trials, the prototype had a disastrous final test in which it veered dangerously off course and disintegrated in the sea.

Lloyd Byfield, 48, pursued relationship with Leighann Duffy, 26, before he launched frenzied attack.<n>He burst into her flat in Walthamstow, east London, with claw hammer and knife.<n>Judge Nicholas Cooke told him he may never be released after he was sentenced to life with minimum term of 26 years.

The £1.49 ($1.99) iOS app was developed by Germany-based firm esooka.<n>It uses a mathematical model developed by scientists and meteorologists.<n>The app tracks personal radiation from changes in a person's location and flights.<n>It can measure all the relevant types of radiation, in particular neutron radiation.

Eiffel Tower has been closed due to strike action by French workers.<n>Workers are supporting the unions strike against government austerity measures.<n>Air traffic controllers also walked out yesterday in a separate action.<n>Thousands expected to take to the streets in a main rally in Paris.

Tourists are pointed towards the local abattoir in Dornoch, Scotland.<n>The sign was posted on Twitter and retweeted by Scots crime writer Ian Rankin.<n>The local butcher said the abattoir has been derelict for four or five years.

Emily Reay, 17, claims she has sported same ginger hair for three years.<n>But on her return to school teachers have told her to tone it down.<n>She says she is banned from lessons until she changes her hair.<n>Talented musician Emily says her ginger hair is her trademark.

Michele Leonhart has run the DEA since 2007.<n>She testified last week that there was 'no evidence' sensitive information had been leaked but it's 'absolutely' possible that information had been compromised.<n>A report by the Justice Department's Inspector General said DEA agents, including senior supervisors, had'solicited prostitutes and engaged in other serious misconduct'<n>A DEA supervisor told the Inspector General's office that it was 'common for prostitutes to be present at business meetings involving cartel members and foreign officers'

Mohamed Badie and 13 other defendants were handed their sentences.<n>The sentences were confirmed by a Cairo judge on Saturday.<n>The defendants were found guilty of plotting unrest after Morsi's overthrow.<n>American-Egyptian Mohamed Soltan was sentenced to life in prison.

Glenna Kohl of Barnstable spent years in the sun as a Cape Cod lifeguard and countless hours laying in indoor tanning beds while at college.<n>She was diagnosed with melanoma just after graduating from a Rhode Island college in 2005.<n>Three years later, at just 26 years old, Glenna would be dead after a painful cancer battle.

Phil Primmer, 42, reportedly died after collapsing on Thursday.<n>He had just been to see a doctor to seek treatment for neck pain.<n>He was given CPR but it was too late by the time emergency services arrived.<n>The body-building community is in shock after the premature death of Phil.<n>He leaves behind his wife and two children, including son Shannan.

False-positive mammograms cost $2.8bn and overdiagnosis $1.2bn.<n>Overdiagnosis refers to treatment of tumors that are unlikely to cause problems.<n>Breast cancer is the second most common cause of death from cancer among American women, claiming nearly 41,000 lives a year.

PM said voters were not ‘fully sure’ about the Tories at the last election.<n>But he claimed they would back the party this time and said they would vote.<n>He said he only needed 23 seats to win a majority and would feel 'failure'<n>Cameron made the remarks in an interview with the BBC's Evan Davis.

The six soldiers were killed in October 1914 near the city of Ypres.<n>Bodies were found in a farmer's field and have never been found by relatives.<n>They were laid to rest in a cemetery near Ypres this morning.<n>Ceremony included the hymn Jerusalem in Flanders Fields.

Lorenzo Simon forced Michael Spalding to decorate his flat before attack.<n>Simon, 34, stabbed handyman in the neck before hacking up his body.<n>He stuffed his remains in two suitcases and dumped them in a canal.<n>Simon was today found guilty of murder at Birmingham Crown Court.

Acai Berry Bowl Cafe opens in London this week.<n>The £6 fruit bowls are served with different toppings and fruit accompaniments.<n>The aca berry is a rich purple fruit indigenous to the Amazon rainforest.

Mandy Dunford, 54, was followed around her farm by Kenneth Ward, 67.<n>Military historian was jailed for five years in 2011 after admitting exposure.<n>He was also banned from being within 200 metres of Miss Dunford.<n>But Ward has now been released and allowed to return to his home.<n>Miss Dunford said she feels forced to leave her home in North Yorkshire.

Putin said Russia and U.S. have a common agenda of general efforts directed at making the world economy more democratic.<n>He appeared to soften his anti-American rhetoric after being highly critical.<n>Relations between Moscow and Washington, and other.<n>Western powers, have soured over the conflict in Russia's.<n>neighbor Ukraine.

Francis Pusok, 30, fled his home in San Bernardino County on Thursday after Sheriff's deputies showed up to arrest him on identity theft charges.<n>He led cops on a two-and-a-half hour horseback chase before they shot him with a taser and he fell to the ground.<n>Footage from a helicopter captured the beating, which was caught on camera by another cop.<n>Pusok was arrested on Saturday and released from jail on Sunday.<n>On Monday, he spoke out for the first time about the beating and how a deputy whispered into his ear at the end that '

Local Government Association said some fruit juices have more sugar than can of cola in a single serving.<n>Cans of fizzy drinks contain almost twice the recommended daily sugar limit.<n>Ocean Spray Cranberry Classic drink had 11g of sugar per 100ml.<n>PomeGreat ‘Super Juice’ had 12.1g, more than the amount in Coca-Cola.

Timothy Eli Thompson was born without any nasal passages or sinus cavities.<n>His mother Brandi McGlathery put a photo of him on Facebook.<n>It was removed by Facebook after a pro-life group tried to post it.<n>The story was shared 30,000 times in six hours and the ban was lifted.

Nasa scientists in California have released new images of Ceres.<n>They were taken by the Dawn spacecraft from a distance of 21,000 miles (33,000km)<n>The spacecraft is beginning to move closer and closer to Ceres.<n>And it will soon study the whole planet - including its mystery bright spots.<n>The images have not yet revealed what the mystery ‘bright spots’ on the surface of the world are.<n>However, they are the highest-resolution views so far.

Philip Kirby was jailed for eight years for raping Gemma Redhead.<n>He was released after serving only half his sentence.<n>He defied a restraining order to phone Miss Redhead after release.<n>The call'reawakened all of the fear and terror of the attack'

Rosemary Taylor, communications director, fired from job in Georgia.<n>Allegedly stopped photo shoot with black and Asian models at Cherry Blossom Festival.<n>Said they were 'not the image I want for the city' and their mouths 'dropped'<n>Later, she was asked to leave festival by a city official, it is claimed.<n>Ms Taylor has now released statement saying she was wrongly accused.<n>Claims she was fired for lack of professionalism, not racism.
Sex by Numbers is a book that investigates sexual statistical claims.<n>It also separates myth from reality.<n>Here, Tracey Cox, investigates the latest research on the penis.

Labour leader Ed Miliband said he would 'abolish' non-dom status.<n>But shadow chancellor Ed Balls said it would cost the country money.<n>Mike Keen, the Labour leader's cousin, said he was 'officially confused'

Turia Pitt was 64 per cent burned during a 2011 ultramarathon in Kimberley, Western Australia.<n>She watched in horror as surgeons from the Australian charity, Interplast, saved the sight of a little boy burned by boiling water.<n>The inspirational burns survivor said she would have died if she lived in a country like Laos or Bangladesh.<n>She is hosting a fundraising gala on Thursday to raise funds for more volunteer medicos to head overseas to save lives and livelihoods.

Robert Bates, 73, shot dead Eric Harris, 44, after he was confronted during an undercover operation in Tulsa, Oklahoma on April 2.<n>He has been charged with second-degree manslaughter and is out on $25,000 bond.<n>The judge has allowed him to take a previously planned vacation to the Bahamas.<n>Harris' family said that the vacation sends a'message of apathy'
Downton Abbey star has worn £300,000 worth of frocks, shoes and jewellery.<n>Includes £35,000 gown and £40,000 necklace.<n>Eight-week shopping spree includes trips to Moscow, Milan and LA.

Kenyan elite troops called in from Nairobi to Garissa as early as 5.30am.<n>But they did not arrive until just before 2pm, local media reports.<n>Government defended long response time, comparing it to being a goalkeeper.

French MPs calls for increase in use of 'doggy bags' to reduce food waste.<n>MP Guillaume Garot says doggy bags could save France £14 billion a year.<n>He has previously seen bags as 'embarrassing' but says change is needed.<n>Chefs have previously seen bags as 'degrading' towards their dishes.

Britt McHenry, 28, was suspended for one week after berating Advanced Towing clerk Gina Michelle.<n>She told her she should 'lose some weight' and 'f---ing fly' in rant caught on camera.<n>But in a blog post, she says she is a champion of women's rights.<n>She says she is concerned about women feeling 'comfortable in their own skin'<n>She also laments the pressure women face to appear a certain way.

Hollywood siren Ava Gardner lived in the apartment in Knightsbridge for over 20 years.<n>The five bedroom apartment is now on the market for £10,500 per week.<n>The property is a short walk from Harrods and Hyde Park.

The film could make over $2 billion, according to box-office analysts.<n>It's already predicted to rake in a global $500m on its opening weekend.<n>The trailer for the new Star Wars film was released on Thursday.<n>It was unveiled by director JJ Abrams at the Star Wars Celebration in Anaheim, California.

A California homeowner's surveillance video captured footage of three burglars who broke into their home.<n>One of the burglars, a boy, stared directly into the camera and it captured a visual of his face.<n>Police believe the three burglars are between 17 to 20 years old.<n>A 5ft safe and a number of firearms were stolen from the home.

Robert Penny, 83, appeared at Melbourne Magistrates Court on Monday.<n>He is charged with murdering Claire Acocks and his wife Margaret Penny.<n>The women were found brutally murdered at a hair salon in Portland, Victoria on May 3, 1991.<n>Penny was remanded in custody to appear in the Melbourne Magistrates Court for a committal mention on July 6.<n>He is expected to apply for bail in the Supreme Court on Monday afternoon.

Robert Durst appeared in court in New Orleans, Louisiana on Tuesday and pleaded guilty to a new charge of gun possession.<n>The millionaire was arrested on March 15 in New Orleans, Louisiana, just hours before the final episode of 'The Jinx' aired on HBO.<n>He was charged with the murder of his friend Susan Berman in California in December 2000.<n>The killing was allegedly related to her discussing the disappearance of Durst's first wife in 1982.<n> Durst's lawyers say he is innocent.

David Cameron was in Bristol and Poole, Dorset, on Monday.<n>He was in the sun and looked uncomfortably hot in his suit and tie.<n>But the PM was there with George Osborne, Chancellor of the Exchequer.

Timothy Rogalski 'left four messages on the school's answerphone and the fifth time he called, he spoke to an administrative assistant'<n>He 'accused staff of being behind the December 14, 2012 shooting that left 20 children and six female educators dead'<n>The calls were traced back to his home in Wallingford, Connecticut, about 40 miles from where the massacre took place.<n>He has been charged with harassment and disorderly conduct.

Buyers must now increasingly treat asking prices as a starting point.<n>Average sale prices are about £207,000 in the UK, advertised asking prices are typically £74,000 higher at £281,000.<n>Online estate agent eMoov said many sellers still believed they were selling at the market’s peak.

Seven of Michael Slager's fellow cops responded to his call forback-up.<n>But they did not see Walter Scott's five bullet wounds to the back.<n>Officers also told an internal report that they gave Scott CPR.<n>But the video only shows them checking his pulse and standing over his body.<n>Scott's father said of the incident: 'It would have never come to light [had video not emerged]'

Iona Costello, 51, and her daughter Emily, 14, have been missing since March 30.<n>The pair were last seen near their home in the wealthy seaside village of Greenport.<n>Their car was found in a parking garage on 42nd street in Manhattan.<n>Emily did not return to her East Hampton school from Spring Break.<n>Police do not expect foul play and have no hard evidence that the pair are in danger.
Helen Dunn, 78, was shocked to discover her cover images for Span.<n>The grandmother was 17 years old at the time of the raunchy shoot.<n>She went on to marry Manchester United footballer Alan Dunn.

The question, 'So when is Cheryl’s birthday?' was one of 25 questions set in the Singapore and Asian Schools Math Olympiad.<n>It asked: Albert and Bernard just became friends with Cheryl, and they want to know when her birthday is.<n>Cheryl gives them a list of 10 possible dates.<n>Albert and Bernard rule out nine of the dates in a number of steps.<n>To reach the answer, it is possible to work through the information both men known to rule out.

Property prices are predicted to fall by up to 10 per cent in some states.<n>Economists say there is a likelihood Perth, Canberra and Adelaide will see declines.<n>Goldman Sachs predicts population growth will slow to 1.25 per cent due to low birth rates, high death rates and falling net migration.<n>This will create an oversupply and see property prices fall by between 5 and 10 per cent in markets where construction supply has been strong.

Suzy Howlett, 54, specialises in teaching foreign-born children English.<n>She embarrassed husband and wife team Derek Tanswell and Sharon Snook.<n>They promise to 'take back control of our boarders' - so she wrote in red.<n>One section said: 'I think you mean borders, not residents of a school'<n>Another said: 'If you vote Ukip your get Ukip' - so the marker wrote: 'You'll?'<n>Mr Tanswell said his former party 'hacked' his emails for information.<n>But a party source said the leaflet is genuine and Ukip have

Odds on second royal baby being called Sam have been slashed.<n>Bookmakers say it is after the Duchess' close friend Sam Waley-Cohen.<n>The jockey helped rekindle the Duke and Duchess' romance in 2007.<n>Prince George's brother or sister is expected to be called Sam later this month.

Labour leader visited Praise House Community Church in Croydon.<n>He bowed his head while church leaders 'put their hands forward'<n>Last year Miliband described himself as a 'Jewish atheist'<n>All party leaders are now trying to reach religious groups to win votes.

Charlie Kwentus, 42, from Webster Groves, Missouri, was granted his dying wish by the Annie's Hope Bereavement Center for Kids.<n>The charity provided all of his family with star treatment for the day, with black tie makeovers and a limousine included.<n>Tear-jerking footage from the special event shows Kwentus dancing with his daughters Maren, aged nine, and Zoe, 13, before stopping to give a heartfelt speech.

David Cameron will amend Working Times to allow three days paid leave.<n>Will apply to 15 million workers in private and public sectors.<n>But Institute of Directors says it will have 'no impact' on costs.

Keith Boudreau, 42, of Quincy, Massachusetts was pronounced dead on Friday morning following the March 23 attack.<n>Paul Fahey, 43, allegedly beat Boudreau for just staring in his direction during the 'unprovoked attack'<n>Fahey was arrested last Thursday following the attack after a witness identified him, but was scared for his life due to Fahey's reputation as a 'dangerous person'

Clinton Cash, written by political foe Peter Schweizer, will be released May 5.<n>Claims there is a trend of donors finding U.S. policies favorable to them.<n>This included free trade agreements and development projects.<n>Author Schweizer says he has'meticulously' documented his sources.<n>Claims made in book that will raise'serious questions of judgment'

Latika Bourke was born in an orphanage in the slums of India.<n>She was adopted from India along with two of her siblings.<n>Her parents had three children then adopted her and their sister Rani.<n>Latika was taken to Australia and raised in regional country Bathurst.<n>She never wanted to explore her origins until she watched Slumdog Millionaire.<n>The film led her back to where it all began and she is now a permanent resident.

The East Coast Low has not hit NSW since 2007.<n>It is characterised by gales or storm force winds that can damage buildings, fell trees and powerlines.<n>The stormy weather system, formed in the Tasman Sea, hasn't hit NSW this strong since 2007.<n>It is expected to be one of the longest lasting ever.

Xiao Ying, 17, dumped her newborn child in a toilet after giving birth.<n>She then went back to work on a shoe production line in Wenzhou City.<n>The teenager said she hid the pregnancy because 'no-one cared'<n>She denied giving birth, but came clean when managers saw that she had blood on her shoes.<n>The father of the baby is 18 years old and the family have said they will not raise her.

British company Flow IFE has created a virtual reality device called Flow VR.<n>It uses accelerometers to show a horizon that mimics the movements of the aircraft.<n>Device could help combat problems like air sickness and jet lag.

Patrick Randall was 16 in May 1990 when he held a knife to Gregory Smart's throat as his friend Billy Flynn, shot him in the head.<n>Now 41, Randall won parole Thursday at his first hearing - he won't be released until after June 4.<n>Pamela Smart was media coordinator at Winnacunnet High School in Hampton, where both boys were students, when she first seduced Flynn.<n>Flynn testified that she told him she needed her husband killed because she feared she would lose everything if they divorced.

Residents on Greville Street, near the scene, say they had suspicious power outages a week before the heist.<n>They also claim to have heard 'drilling' noises on Good Friday night.<n>But they thought it was simply a continuation of road works that had been taking place in recent weeks.<n>It has also been alleged that the thieves returned a day after the initial robbery to steal more loot after becoming 'greedy'

The video shows how Angelo West, 41, immediately jumps out of the car and shoots Officer John Moynihan, 34, under the eye at close range.<n>West then fires at the other officers as he runs across the busy street.<n>Boston Police Commissioner William Evans said that 'during this particular incident' the officers had no other choice.

Robin Ellis, 73, was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes in 1999 aged 58.<n>Had no symptoms such as increased thirst or urination.<n>He had smoked 20 roll-ups a day for 20 years and ran 5 or 6 miles a day.

Andy Murray and Kim Sears are preparing to marry in Dunblane Cathedral.<n>The tennis star and his girlfriend will wed on Saturday.<n>The town has been getting involved in the run-up to the big day.<n>Messages and decorations are featured in many of the shop windows.<n>The couple have also been seen carrying trees into the cathedral.<n>They were seen at the wedding of Prince William and Kate Middleton.

Kealeigh-Anne Woolley was just seven months old when she was shaken.<n>She was left blind, unable to talk and severely brain damaged by Colin Heath.<n>Spent most of her life in a wheelchair and could only eat through a tube.<n>Heath, now 43, was jailed for three years and two months for manslaughter.
The offensive shirt is thought to be a play on the Fatboy Slim song Eat Sleep Rave Repeat.

PayPal said that the devices would be powered by stomach acid and include mini computers.<n>Global Head of Developer Evangelism at PayPal, said he wants to ‘put users in charge of their own security’<n>He said passwords as they are now were not working and that users need to ‘harden it with something physical behind it’<n>Other possibilities include silicon chips which are put under the skin and ‘wearable computer tattoos’ which send information via a wireless connection.

Lisa Morgan, 40, altered Top of the World Roofing website to expose cheating.<n>She said she grew suspicious when Sean Meade, 45, didn't return home.<n>She said she found calls to another woman and his phone bill was upended.<n>She also contacted his estranged wife Joanne who said he had cheated.

Conrad Clitheroe, 54, was arrested in February with two friends.<n>They were detained for writing down aircraft registration numbers.<n>Mr Clitheroe's wife Valerie says he has run out of blood pressure medication.<n>She claims guards 'don't care' and her family is 'worried' about his condition.

Craig Hicks, 46, is charged with three counts of first-degree murder in the February 10 killings of Deah Shaddy Barakat, 23, his wife, Yusor Mohammad Abu-Salha, 21, and her sister, Razan Mohammad Abu-Salha, 19.<n>Hicks is accused of shooting the three students over a parking dispute.<n>A superior court judge in North Carolina ruled on Monday that Hicks is 'death penalty qualified'<n>The victims' families are adamant that they were targeted because they were Muslims and have pushed for hate-crime charges.

Our willingness to learn is significantly influence by our genes, according to a study by Goldsmiths University in London and Ohio State University.<n>More than 13,000 twins aged nine to 16 took part in the research.<n>Genetics and non-shared-environment factors were found to have the largest effect on the children’s motivation to learn.<n>The study found that the shared environment had negligible impact.

Exam board officials unveiled a draft syllabus for 14 to 16-year-olds.<n>Some students will be asked to study a review of a gritty 15-rated foreign film.<n>Others will look at Spanish tweets on the Olympic Games.<n>The proposals aim to rid classrooms of ‘tired phrases’

Chris Ball made the heartbreaking video to his family before taking his own life.<n>His brother Jayden and stepfather found Chris on September 14 last year.<n>The family have shared the video to raise awareness of depression.

A shark swam into Papamoa Beach in the Bay of Plenty on Saturday.<n>Onlookers got out of the sea sharpish to take photographs.<n>'Look at it, it's huge,' shouted one boy from the shore.<n>The shark soon had enough of all the attention and swam back out to sea.

Maureen McDonnell and her husband, former Gov. Bob McDonnell, were convicted in a joint trial in September of accepting more than $165,000 in gifts and loans from former Star Scientific Inc. CEO Jonnie Williams.<n>Among the gifts were almost $20,000 worth of designer clothing and accessories for Maureen McDonnell, vacations, golf outings and $15,000 for a daughter's wedding.<n>McDonnell's attorneys argued Monday in a 101-page court filing that her public corruption conviction should be overturned because it was based on an overly broad definition of bribery.<n>Bob McDonnell was sentenced in February to two years in prison and his wife to one year

Ralph Cramer, 70, and his wife, Lynn, 59, were returning home from the Creekside Café in Mount Joy at about 9 p.m. on Sunday.<n>First responders arrived to find that the couple had died from multiple traumatic injuries suffered in the crash.<n>The 1923 Model T Ford convertible had been rebuilt and had new elements.

Andrew O'Clee, 36, married Michelle Agbulos in 2008 and had a daughter.<n>But he began an affair with Philippa Campbell in 2011 and had a baby with her.<n>He then married his second wife in 2013 and even forged divorce documents.<n>His first wife discovered the deception when she saw a video of him on Facebook completing the ice bucket challenge.<n>O'Clee has been jailed for eight months after a court heard about the web of 'lies and forgery' lasting four years.

Samantha says she's 'utterly peeved' at Dove's latest campaign results.<n>How humiliating to film women in a public place 'choosing' to walk through a door marked either 'beautiful' or 'average'<n>Most women would rather strut out in public as naked as the day they were born than freely admit that they're good-looking.
