Researchers at Sheffield University analysed people with a BMI of 30 or more.<n>They found obese people fall into one of six categories:.<n>The scientists said their findings suggest that clinicians and policy makers should not target obese people as a whole, rather treat them according to the 'type' of obese person they are.<n>The 'younger healthy females' - also the youngest group.<n>The 'affluent and healthy elderly' - the least deprived group.<n>The physically sick but happy elderly - the most obese group.

Several DEA agents were taking part in alleged'sex parties' in Colombia starting in 2001 according to a new report.<n>The report was released by the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform at a hearing on the misconduct.<n>This news comes two weeks after a report found that at least 7 agents admitted sleeping with prostitutes while on overseas assignments.

Driver, 47, pulled out his own firearm and shot Everardo Custodio, 22, multiple times in the legs and lower back.<n>Custodio was taken to a local hospital for treatment.<n>The driver, who has a firearm owner’s identification card, acted in self-defense and the defense of others, prosecutors say.<n>Custodio is facing charges of aggravated battery with a firearm and illegal possession of a firearm.

Dramatic rescue earlier in the week led to 210 mainly-Burmese nationals being identified.<n>Those who said they wanted to stay did so because they claimed they were owed years of back pay from their bosses.<n>Those found Thursday by a team, which included Myanmar officials, remain in Benjina.<n>Last week, Indonesian authorities rescued around 330 migrants from Benjina, bringing them to the island of Tual.

Tony Lopez Lozano, 35, was charged with the August 2013 murder of his boyfriend, Brian Romo.<n>Lozano pleaded guilty to first-degree manslaughter as part of a plea deal and a judge sentenced him to 10 years in prison on Monday.<n>The victim's mother, Kathleen Tapia, said at the sentencing that she doesn't forgive Lozano and never will.

Chief executive George Whitesides has said the new spacecraft is nearly ready.<n>He said it could begin test flights by the end of this year.<n>Its predecessor was destroyed in the Mojave Desert on 31 October 2014.<n>Co-pilot Michael Alsbury was killed and pilot Peter Siebold was injured.<n>Virgin Galactic has not named this vehicle yet.

Researchers in North Carolina claim that zapping the brain with a mild electric current can boost creativity by nearly eight per cent.<n>They tested their theory using a 10-Hertz current on the brain's of 20 volunteers to stimulate the brain's natural alpha wave oscillations.<n>As well as creativity, these oscillations - or the lack of them - are linked with depression.

Police have returned to the home of Bill Spedding for the third time this year.<n>The 63-year-old's home had been searched earlier in the year, in January and March.<n>It was revealed he was due to fix William's grandmother's washing machine around the time the boy vanished.<n>Police searched the 63-year-old's home in March and businesses in nearby Laurieton in January, seizing various items, including cars, a mattress and computer.

Bernadette Fox, 57, and her 27-year-old daughter Sarah were found dead.<n>Mrs Fox died of asphyxiation, while Sarah was repeatedly stabbed.<n>Police are now hunting for Mrs Fox's son Peter, 26.<n>They say they want to speak 'urgently' with him in connection to deaths.<n>Merseyside Police have issued a photograph of Mr Fox.<n>He is described as white, between 5ft 2in and 5ft 5in and of slight build with short, dark hair - no longer shaved - and brown eyes.

Cathryn Parker, 72, has lived under at least 74 aliases in Los Angeles.<n>She has been skipping legal hurdles for 15 years.<n>Parker was arrested after giving police a false name during a traffic stop.

Dermatologist Dawn Marie Davies warns herpes can survive on sunbed.<n>She says bacteria can survive in the heat, despite the UV light.<n>The virus can reactivate every so often, causing a new herpes flare up.

A dramatic road rage incident between a truck driver and two young men has been caught on camera.<n>The footage was taken last Monday in Forrestville in northern Sydney.<n>The driver of the truck tailgated the car and nearly crashed into it.<n>The driver spat out the window and yelled abuse at the men.<n>The incident continued for 8.5km until both the car and the truck were forced to stop at a red light.

Jesse and Melissa Meek announced they are expecting a child in a rap video they made set to the theme from '90s television sitcom 'The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air'<n>The clip, which features Jesse and Melissa Meek rapping as they drive in a car, has been viewed over 1.7 million times on YouTube.<n>The original song for the popular NBC sitcom, sung by star Will Smith, details how his character grew up in West Philadelphia, where he got into a neighborhood fight.

A driver was confronted by three young people after ramming into another car.<n>The incident was captured on a dashboard camera in Melbourne.<n>One woman pulled out a dagger and stabbed the bonnet of the car.<n>The driver has been suspended for 12 months and fined $2000.

Sue Sim came to national prominence as Northumbria Police dealt with Raoul Moat manhunt.<n>She was to be investigated by her Police and Crime Commissioner's office.<n>Her style has been compared to her predecessor Sir John Stevens.<n>Ms Sim said she was'sad' to leave but was retiring to spend more time with her family.

Aydian Dowling has 40,000 votes to win annual Ultimate Guy Search.<n>Magazine said he embodies 'well-rounded, active, health-conscious guy'<n>Aydian, who started taking testosterone in 2009, lives in Oregon with wife.

Players including Steven Gerrard and Theo Walcott could face probe.<n>They were among around a dozen players sponsored by firm to tweet sale.<n>Comes amid concern celebrities are cashing in by turning Twitter into advertising platform.

Stacey Eden, 23, stood up for a Muslim woman and her partner on a Sydney train.<n>The woman was racially abused and called them 'terrorists'<n>Ms Eden switched on her mobile phone camera to record the vile rant.<n>The Muslim man who was racially abused has thanked Ms Eden.<n>'God bless Stacey Eden who supported us,' Hafeez Ahmed Bhatti said.

Christine Lagarde and Leanne Wood both wore pink for live debate.<n>Samantha Cameron also wore pink on the campaign trail last May.<n>High street is responding to the demand for pink with Topshop, Next, H&M and Marks & Spencer all featuring the colour.

Shezoy Bleary, 22, allegedly attacked 31-year-old Chris Copeland and two women with a switchblade in the early morning hours outside a Chelsea nightclub.<n>Copeland, a former player for the New York Knicks, was slashed in the elbow and abdomen and underwent surgery to repair the wounds on Wednesday.<n>Copeland's wife Katrine Saltara, 28, was also stabbed during the early-morning altercation after they left popular New York club 1 OAK.<n>Another woman, Catherine Somani, 23, was also stabbed in the abdomen as she apparently tried to break up the fight.
The 34-year-old is keeping 'everything' in clear plastic bags.<n>Kim said she wants North to inherit her wardrobe when she gets older.
John Tuite, 22, and Carlos Santolalla, 25, go by the nickname Jarlos.<n>The couple have been signed to Fusion Models, the first openly gay couple to be represented by a modeling agency.

Kim Hill, 31, was abused by her step-father from the age of four.<n>She was made to dress up in her mother's lingerie and watch porn.<n>For years she bottled up the painful memories until she met her husband.<n>He asked if she had been abused due to her withdrawn nature.<n>Kim confessed to him and he helped to put her attacker behind bars.

Swiss researchers measured the temperature of 'Hot Jupiter' HD 189733b.<n>They found the temperature reaches up to 3,000C in the atmosphere.<n>And wind speeds are in excess of 620 miles per hour.<n>The findings were made using a novel technique relying on sodium signals.<n>It suggests we may soon be able to examine other distant worlds in unprecedented detail.

Nasa scientists in California have revealed new images of the dwarf planet Ceres.<n>They reveal new views of the two brightest spots in a crater.<n>However, scientists are still not able to explain what they are.<n>One theory is that they are salt flats that are reflecting sunlight.<n>Another is that they are regions of ice, again reflecting sunlight.<n>Dawn will begin its first science orbit around Ceres on 23 April.
Poundland has become Europe's largest single-price discount retailer.<n>Company began as a single shop in Burton-on-Trent 25 years ago.<n>It has now opened 60 net new stores in the UK and Ireland.

Jason Edward Harrington worked with the government agency for six years.<n>He said staff will 'bending the rules' so they can inappropriately touch passengers.<n>Added they will also conduct bag checks on people they simply do not like.<n>Comments follow revelations two TSA workers were fired for manipulating body scanners in Denver as part of a scheme to pat down men.

Matthew Whelan, 35, from Birmingham, has spent £40,000 on tattoos.<n>He officially changed his name to King of Inkland King Body Art The Extreme Ink-ite.<n>But he says prejudice against body modifications has affected his career.<n>He is now planning to set up his own business and says he will strike out on his own.

The test was carried out by iPhone repairs specialist iPhoneFixed.co.uk.<n>It used a sapphire screen from a 38mm Apple Watch for its experiment.<n>Two out of the three models of Apple Watches have sapphire glass screens.<n>The only one that doesn't is the Sport model, which has a stronger Ion-X glass.

According to Nielsen ratings, ABC's World News Tonight with David Muir attracted 84,000 more viewers for the week ending April 3.<n>NBC's 288 consecutive week winning run had stetched back to September 2009.<n>The drop from the top spot comes two months after anchor Brian Williams received a six-month suspension for misleading viewers.<n>NBC remains ahead for the season with an average of 9.2 million total viewers compared to ABC's 9.1 million.

Annegret Raunigk, from Berlin, is already a mother of 13.<n>She decided to expand her family after her youngest child told her: 'I want to have a little brother or sister'<n>Britain's older mother, Sue Tollefsen, from Essex, has one daughter.<n>She gave birth to her only child, Freya, in 2008 when she was 57.<n>Sue, now 64, revealed she considered having another child.

Gang covered white Dodge Charger in gasoline and lit it on fire.<n>Driver and two passengers were not hurt in the incident at a gas station in South Los Angeles.<n>Fire department is investigating the incident as an arson.
Four in ten Britons have an average of £77 of unwanted good.<n>Most people say it is simply too inconvenient to return the item.<n>A fifth of people are too busy, believing it takes half an hour.

Actress says she watched as her grandmother Margaret Booth developed the illness.<n>The former teacher struggled to use her knife and fork at the time.<n> Mulligan said there is a'shame or humour' attached to the illness.<n>The 29-year-old said her gran hasn't recognised her in at least five years.

The one ton animal was spotted on a highway near the city of Round Rock.<n>Police used their patrol vehicles to steer the buffalo, named Big Boy, off the road.<n>Despite the detour, the buffalo made it home safely free of injury.<n>His owner, 79-year-old Joe Don Kotrla-Chipps, said Big Boy has got into bad habits recently and has taken to jumping over his fence.
Gary told MailOnline that Jason is excited to come and see his former bandmates on their new tour.<n>The trio will hit the road as a trio in Glasgow on April 27.

The Maldives are a popular honeymoon destination, with its cerulean sea.<n>The Dhaalu Atoll island of Niyama is a 40-minute seaplane flight from Malé.<n>Niyama is a superlative beachfront studio, bigger than Penny's flat.

A new report has shown that truck drivers in Victoria are dealing drugs from the behind the wheel of 60-tonne rigs.<n>The report revealed that one in every 12 truckies tested positive for drugs while out on the road.<n>It was revealed that they are using their log books to roll out lines and smoke ice.<n> 156 truck drivers tested positive for drugs on Victoria's roads in the past year alone.
Lindex is a fresh-to-the-UK clothing brand.<n>Opens first UK store in Westfield Stratford on March 27.<n>Campaign shows that true beauty comes from what you do as well as how you look.

Cle 'Bone' Sloan told police Suge Knight growled 'I'll kill you' before 'everything went black'<n>Police say that was the moment before Knight killed Terry Carter.<n>He has denied killing Carter and trying to kill Cle 'Bone' Sloan.

Five members of extended Czech Roma family on trial for trafficking.<n>Prosecution say victims were lured to Britain with promise of 'better life'<n>But they were forced to work for free in dog food factories and car washes.<n>They were also made to urinate in buckets and live outside in winter.<n>All deny charges at Plymouth Crown Court and the trial continues.

The Mole Urban project aims to reduce the level of road freight within urban areas.<n>It would see freight pipelines carrying goods in capsules to edge of town consolidation centres, where they would be collected.<n>The development project is set to last nine months and if successful could be rolled out in other towns.

Zeynab Daghastani, 13, was shot dead as she fled Al-Yarmouk Camp, Damascus.<n>Teenager was reportedly trying to make her way to a nearby neighbourhood.<n>Relief worker said she was killed by ISIS snipers on Tuesday.<n>Thousands of Palestinians have been trying to escape Yarmouk since ISIS captured it.

Darren McGrady said princes were fed up with traditional English food.<n>He said they swapped instructions from nanny for their own in which they asked for fast food.<n>He said that his 'juvenile handwriting gave their identity away'

Families in the UK are more indebted than many other major developed nations.<n>IMF said this was mainly due to borrowing to buy expensive homes.<n>Britain was singled out as having a problem with household debt, along with Portugal.

Unite leader Len McCluskey conducted a two-day tour of the Principality.<n>His gospel of traditional hard-left socialism goes down well with the converted.<n>But the union is a potent, sinister force in British politics.<n>It is seeking to use its financial and organisational muscle within the Labour movement to drag Britain back to the dark days of the 1970s.

Norma Esparza, now a psychology professor in Europe, testified Thursday in the trial of Gianni Van, 45, who is charged with the 1995 murder of Gonzalo Ramirez.<n>Esparza says Van intimidated her into pointing out Ramirez, who she claims was her rapist.<n>Ramirez's body was found blindfolded, bloodied and with 30 blows to the head with a cleaver.<n>Prosecutors say Van killed Ramirez as revenge for raping his on-and-off girlfriend Esparza.

Holly Beard and Steve Hancock tipped the scales at 41st between them.<n>The couple from Staffordshire got engaged in January last year.<n>But Holly was bullied at work after her boss brought in a cake.<n>A member of the public shouted at her: 'She doesn't need a cake - look at the size of her'<n>The couple joined forces and lost a combined weight of 11st between them.

Jodie Bredo, 26, from Essex, has been a Kate lookalike for six years.<n>She says Duchess of Cambridge dresses 'too boring' for her age.<n>Miss Bredo, who is single after splitting from her boyfriend, fancies Prince Harry.

Honest allows users to pose questions, remain anonymous and get feedback.<n>One user asks: 'My long term girlfriend is bad in bed...shall I tell her?'<n>Another says: 'You should tell her for the long term good of the relationship'

Aidan Fraley, 16, says he believes everyone on the Tulsa police force is to blame for his father Eric Harris' April 2 death.<n>His mother, who calls Harris her'soulmate'--has already forgiven his killer, 73-year-old Robert Bates.<n>Bates has said he mistakenly pulled out a handgun rather than a stun gun when he fatally shot Eric Harris on April 2 as he lay on the ground.

Liverpool players Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe pictured smoking shisha pipes.<n>The pair were seen smiling and joking as they held on to the pipes.<n>It is the second time in a few days that Sterling has been pictured smoking.<n>The England international has been subject of a club probe into why he was taking the legal high.
Andreja Pejic, 23, underwent gender-confirmation surgery last year.<n>She is the new face of Make Up For Ever.

The marine mammal was discovered bleeding from its head along the south end of Sharp Park State Beach in Pacifica on Tuesday.<n>On Wednesday scientists and biologists sought to determine how the massive animal died.<n>It is the seventeenth dead sperm whale to beach along the North Coast of California in over the 40 years.

Joel Burger and Ashley King accepted BK's payment proposal on Monday.<n>Couple have been known as Burger-King since they were in fifth grade.<n>Burger and King said they'shaking' and 'blown away' after getting the good news.

Researchers have shown it's possible to convert 100 per cent of the sugar in corn stalks and husks – a by-product of farming – into hydrogen gas.<n>Breakthrough could see the fuel being produced locally and drivers stopping to refuel their vehicles at roadside bioreactors instead of pumping petrol into their motor.

The Department of Veteran Affairs has barred organisations from using the Anzac brand.<n>40 items were rejected for a range of reasons, including it was too commercial or its name was inappropriate.<n>The Church of Scientology, Woolworths, and online sites Teespring, Zazzle and Redbubble were reprimanded for using the word Anzac.<n>The AFL was allowed to use Anzac to brand its games and merchandise as it donated to the RSL.<n>Victoria Bitter was allowed to use the term in its 'raise a glass' campaign.

ComRes survey of 4,000 undecided voters found slim majority impressed with performance of Prime Minister.<n>Separate poll of marginal seats by Lord Ashcroft suggests Ukip’s vote is being squeezed in key constituencies.

Lisa McElroy, 50, who teaches legal writing at Drexel University, reportedly sent the inappropriate message on March 31.<n>When recipients opened the enclosed link, they were directed to a video of 'a woman engaging in a sexually explicit act'<n>The college has since issued an apology to students.<n>Married mother-of-two has been placed on administrative leave.

Gang broke into aviary and bundled 200 birds into sacks and containers.<n>They dumped them on floor before kicking them and forcing them out of windows.<n>Birds were also jammed into drawers, squeezed to death and even chased by a dog.<n>One resident reported dead bird posted through letterbox while others were dropped through windows.<n>Three men and a youth have been convicted of their involvement and will be sentenced next month.

Dawn Milosky, 45, of Beachwood, New Jersey, has been charged with driving while intoxicated and having an open container of alcohol in the vehicle.<n>She has been airlifted to Morristown Medical Center, but police say she is now doing okay.<n>Dashcam footage shows police in the borough of Kinnelon race to the incident just after 6 p.m. on Thursday following a tip-off about someone driving erratically.

The world's largest cattle station is for sale in South Australia.<n>Anna Creek Station covers an enormous 23,000 square kilometres.<n>The eleven cattle farms cover over 100,000 square kilometres.<n>All of the farms include the original equipment as well as the stock.<n>The sale is being handled by Ernst and Young Adelaide.

Jessica Silva killed her ice addict partner James Polkinghorne in 2012.<n>She stabbed him five times with a kitchen knife after he attacked her.<n>She said she believes she would have been dead if she hadn't stabbed him.<n>Ms Silva has begged Mr Polkinghorne's father to forgive her.

Michelle Obama and her mom, Marian Robinson, enjoyed a five-course Italian lunch at Lupa restaurant in New York on Saturday.<n>The menu, priced at $65 per person, plus $49 with wine pairings, is a five-course set meal.<n>The First Lady's mother is the 'Grandmother-in-chief' to President Obama.<n>Mario Batali, the restaurant mogul who owns the eatery, was heard describing Michelle as 'a lovely woman'

Aeman Presley, 34, faces charges for the killing of two homeless men in Atlanta, another man sleeping outdoors in DeKalb County and a hairdresser in a parking garage.<n>Presley had taken a Greyhound bus from Los Angeles to Atlanta last May 'hoping to rejuvenate his beleaguered acting career'<n>He bought a Taurus.45 revolver 'on the street' to use in robberies.<n>After killing Calvin Gholston, 53, he felt a'self-described adrenaline fueled high' and went on to shoot Dorian Jenkins, 42, while he slept on the sidewalk.<n>Presley is set to appear in court today and district attorneys

Neil Moore, 28, was on remand at Wandsworth Prison when he sent email.<n>He posed as a court clerk manager and said he had been granted bail.<n>Moore then escaped, only to be discovered three days later.<n>He was jailed for seven years at Southwark Crown Court.

Vulcan will use new engines, mid-air recovery and a new upper stage.<n>New upper stage is aimed at enabling complex on-orbit manoeuvres.<n>Company appears to have timed announcement to overshadow SpaceX' launch of Falcon 9 today.

Alanna and Stephan Goetzinger lost their daughter during a stillbirth in 2012.<n>The couple, from Kanungra in south-east Queensland, have spoken out against the coroner's report which blames their midwife.<n>The report found that the midwife failed to adequately prepare for the Rana's birth, allowed the delivery to take place in 'unsafe conditions' and failed to provide proper medical assistance.<n>The couple are adamant that their daughter Rana died 'during or shortly after birth'

More than a third of mothers clothed second baby in one or more hand-me-downs.<n>Only 23% have a keepsake for their second, a report by Debenhams found.<n>Over eight out of ten mums have a memento of their first child.<n>Prince William has 124m images and mentions on social media of him as a toddler.

Cassandra Cassidy was shot in a drive-by shooting in Las Vegas on Friday.<n>She had been trying to help two women 'afraid of men in a car'<n>The 24-year-old fashion design student was shot but not the women.<n>Ms Cassidy was taken to hospital but died shortly afterwards.

Tipu Sultan was gunned down at the back of the Herbs n Spice takeaway.<n>The 32-year-old was originally from Bangladesh and lived in Sunderland.<n>Police believe he was targeted and are appealing for witnesses to the shooting.<n>Officers have taped off a lane behind the takeaway in South Shields.

Sri Lanka is high on the list of places to visit in 2015.<n>Gareth Huw Davies enjoys the new stability on the teardrop-shaped island.<n>The holiday industry is recovering, and expanding with smart new hotels.

House-sitting is one of the easiest ways to trim costs on a trip abroad.<n>House-sitters can provide food and transport in exchange for taking care of the person’s home and pets.<n>Bloggers have been house-sitning around the world for six years.<n>Cruise ship workers can see the world but should be prepared for long shifts.

Kim Sears watched Andy Murray lose to Novak Djokovic in Miami Open.<n>Wore a black silk dress for the third time during the tournament.<n>The outfit was identical to two others she has worn during the tournament.<n>The 27-year-old will marry Andy in Dunblane Cathedral on April 11.

Two women aged 47 and 22, and two men aged 24 and 22, held at Manchester Airport.<n>They were among eight relatives stopped at Turkish border with Syria on April 1.<n>Group is understood to include Waheed Ahmed's aunt, two male cousins, his cousin's wife and two of their children.<n>Four children on the trip aged one, three, eight and 11, have also been flown back.

University of Kentucky Wildcats were kicked out of the NCAA tournament Saturday night after a 71-64 loss to the University of Wisconsin Badgers.<n>A crowd of more than a thousand fans gathered near the school's Lexington campus to vent their disappointment.<n>Police in riot gear arrested 31 people on charges of public intoxication and disorderly conduct.<n>Another three people were taken to the hospital for non-serious injuries.<n>The Badgers will now face off against Duke in Monday's final.

'The only money we should waste on you is the cost of a bullet,' Jackson County Chief Circuit Judge Thomas Wilson told'monster' James Tingley of Michigan.<n>Tingley was convicted on March 3 of heinous sex crimes against two girls over a six year period.<n>Police know of at least five other girls Tingley abused but they believe there may be more.

Mai Mach, 60, and her grandson Alistair, 4, were stabbed to death last Tuesday.<n>A fundraising page was set up to help pay for their funeral expenses.<n>It has raised almost $50,000 in less than a week.<n>A Chinese tourist, Cai Xia Liao, 45, has been charged with their murder.<n>She appeared in Melbourne Magistrates Court on Thursday and will reappear on July 22.

Starmer ran CPS for five years and was in charge of Operation Elveden.<n>He pushed the use of a law unheard of in the 13th century to prosecute journalists.<n>Jurors have almost universally refused to convict despite best efforts.

Alan Davey controversially laid bare difficulties of station's top job.<n>He said classical music broadcasting has become more challenging.<n>He was asked about changes to general classical music knowledge.<n>Mr Davey said modern audience might not be getting same education in music.

Mario Valencia is captured walking along street in Marana, Arizona, with gun.<n>Police officer in other car tells him to'stand off', but he drives straight toward him.<n>Seconds later, car mounts curb and smashes into suspect's body.<n>Officer Michael Rapiejko emerges from vehicle, shouting: 'Oh! Jesus Christ, man down'
Owner Safer Hassan has 30 days to get rid of the plate.<n>Texas Department for Motor Vehicles said it was 'offensive'<n>Mr Hassan said he plans to appeal the decision.

Nina Louise, a pit bull, went missing in December 2013.<n>She was found during a cockfighting bust in South Carolina this past Saturday.<n>Her owner April Morris was shocked to see the pup's ten puppies on local news.<n>She called the local Humane Society to claim the dog and identified her by detailing two white spots in the fur behind her head.<n>Nina Louise is now back at home with her family where she is being nursed back to health.

Mrs Merkel and her husband Joachim Sauer are on the island of Ischia.<n>The couple have been spending Easter on the island for over a decade.<n>Due to the lack of sunshine, Mrs Merkel has avoided the pool and lounges.<n>She has reportedly hired a private Pilates instructor and enjoyed vegetarian meals.

Mei Ru, 50, was going shopping in the Chinese city of Fuzhou.<n>Husband Song Ming, 53, climbed out of the car and stood behind it.<n>CCTV shows Mrs Ru reverses, knocking Mr Ming to the ground.<n>She then backs up over his body as passers-by rush over to hold couple.<n>Mr Song was rushed to hospital but died from internal bleeding and broken ribs.

Royal County of Berkshire Polo Club has become one of Britain's most elite sporting venues since it was founded in 1982.<n>Prince Charles was the first member and is now one of its most famous.<n>Its celebrity members include Prince William and Harry, actress Stephanie Powers and Rolling Stone Bill Wyman.<n>But attempts to cash in on this elite status by launching a brand of fashion and polo-related goods have been scuppered by the European Court.

One third of Brits buy new clothes to avoid being tagged online.<n>Men spend £61 more than women on social media proof outfits.<n>Average adult has 338 Facebook friends, meaning style selfies are reviewed.

Exercise can increase grey matter in the brain, a study found.<n>This increases the size of areas that contribute to balance and coordination.<n>The changes in the brain may have health implications in the long-term.<n>It could reduce the risk of being immobile in older age, the researchers said.

Haute Montagne guests asked for two grand pianos and a horse and carriage.<n>Another wanted six helicopters and a £2,450 lily-of-the-valley bouquet.<n>Customers of Bramble Ski also requested special touches.

Laura Stevens, 38, from Paris, asked friends to pose for the series.<n>The photographer, who is single, said it helped her deal with her own emotions.<n>The title of the series 'Another November' refers to the month in which she and her partner separated.

Jerusalem syndrome affects a small percentage of religious pilgrims.<n>First identified in 2000, it is characterised by anxiety, agitation and nervousness.<n>Sufferers are consumed by a need to be clean, before donning a toga-like gown.<n>Condition often affects people with no history of mental health problems.<n>Experts believe it may be the result of an underlying mental illness.

Tracy Spraggins, 39, has Lupus and was told she would die if she didn't get a transplant.<n>Husband PJ, 265lbs, was a perfect match but blood pressure was too high.<n>He embarked on a year-long dieting and exercise regime to lose weight.<n>Finally, in December 2014, he was given the green light to undergo surgery.

Manziel and Colleen Crowley were spotted together in public for the first time since he entered rehab when they attended Tuesday night's Texas Rangers game.<n>The pair appear to remain very much an item, but Crowley has been taking heat on Instagram for refusing to give up her wild ways while Manziel was being treated for his unspecified problems.<n>On Tuesday, Crowley posted a video on her Instagram page of the Texan socialite enjoying a drunken night out with friends.

Shares in BG Group rose by nearly 30 per cent to 1,153p last night.<n>Rise came after oil giant Royal Dutch Shell announced plans to buy BG Group in a £47billion deal.<n>British Gas was privatised by Margaret Thatcher’s government.<n>Shares sold off after hugely successful ‘Tell Sid’ advertising campaign.

The Lindens in New Addington, near Croydon, was bulldozed in 2013.<n>Two new houses have been built which will be numbered 19a and 19b.<n>Neighbours say old house was a constant reminder of the evil that happened there.

Sirens wail across Israel on Thursday as the country observes Holocaust memorial day.<n>All traffic comes to a standstill as the two-minute silence is sounded across the country.<n>The day commemorates the six million Jews killed by the Nazis during World War Two.

Flashgap is free for iOS and Android devices and was created by Julian Kabab.<n>During a night out, photos and videos can be taken using the app.<n>Each shot lasts for just three seconds before it disappears.<n>All of this 'evidence' is added to an album that collects photos and images taken by any attendee.<n>This album remains hidden until midday the day after the event.<n>At this point, all attendees are notified that the album is ready to be viewed.<n>Any photos deleted from the album are deleted from all users' accounts.

Lauren Perry, 25, had her waters break just 23 weeks into her pregnancy.<n>She was forced to deliver her twins via caesarean 10 weeks early.<n>Doctors feared the worst and Mason and Chloe spent two months in intensive care.<n>Eight months later Mason was admitted to hospital to have his colostomy removed.<n>He nearly lost his life to a dangerous flesh-eating virus.

The toddler's mother was holding him and another child when he slipped.<n>He fell between 10 to 12ft and into the pit at the Cleveland Metroparks Zoo.<n>The child was rescued by his parents before firefighters and paramedics arrived.<n>He is listed in stable condition after being taken to MetroHealth Medical Center.<n>The cheetahs did not approach the boy or his parents while in the pit.<n>Zoo officials plan to press child endangerment charges against the family.

Jarod Kasner said Friday that police no longer think that's the case after further investigation.

Porche Wright, 27, was scheduled to appear in court on Tuesday afternoon on attempted murder charges.<n>Neighbors say they saw Wright pour gasoline on her daughter then light her with a match.<n>The girl is expected to survive but she is suffering from severe wounds.

Australian PM Tony Abbott said EU should 'urgently' follow his lead.<n>He sends naval gunboats to turn back asylum seekers before they reach Australia.<n>His hardline policy has proved controversial but he said it was the only way to prevent disasters such as the loss of 900 lives.

Charlotte Cosby has lost over two and a half stone in the last year.<n>She has also lost four dress sizes and is now looking very slim.<n>But some of her Geordie Shore fans are concerned she has taken things too far.

Pictures taken between 1850 and 1855 by photographer Hugh Owen show city's waterfront, city centre and church.<n>The Fourteen Stars Tavern building was pulled down in 1857 and replaced by The Bristol Brewery Georges.<n>Many of the buildings pictured have changed dramatically between the 19th century and today.<n>The albumen prints were made in the 1870s from the original paper negatives of the early 1850s.

Kenneth Wanamaker Jr, 37, pleaded guilty to reckless endangerment.<n>His daughter's teeth were in such bad shape they posed a potentially fatal threat to her health.<n>Fourteen of the girl's 20 teeth were abscessed, and two more needed to be pulled or had severe root and tooth decay, the dentist said.<n>Wanamaker also pleaded guilty to false swearing and is eligible for parole.

Gang accused of posing as children online and then beating up men.<n>One teenager told police he was beaten up by the group in Atherton.<n>Another man was attacked in Wigan and has admitted grooming a girl.<n>Police are now hunting the vigilante paedophile hunters.

Ricky Ricardo Chiles III, 27, killed himself with a single shot as police closed in on him at a motel in Lyon, Illinois on Thursday.<n>Chiles III was suspected of fatally shooting 40-year-old Archie Brown Jr and 15-year-old Rasheed Chiles on Sunday.<n>Brown struck and killed Chiles' two-year-old nephew Damani Terry after he darted into the street in front of Brown's van.<n>Police believe Chiles III decided to exact revenge and took the law into his own hands.

Pooch Mavis was brought to Arlington Park in Mobile sometime last weekend by her owner for a fishing trip.<n>Mavis was reportedly close to the park's boat launch as the alligator attacked her after it jumped out of the water.<n>The alligator involved in the attack is being looked for by wildlife officials.

The rock protrusions consist of soft rock topped by harder stone.<n>They have been created by gradual erosion of Entrada sandstone.<n>Once known as the Mushroom Valley, the area was first discovered by cowboys searching for cattle.

Sophie English was one of thousands of babies who was born at the height of the Vietnam War and adopted by an Australian family.<n>Ms English has been searching for answers about her heritage for more than 40 years.<n>ABC journalist Sally Sara travelled to Vietnam to help her find closure.<n>Ms English met another adoptee, Le My Huong, who has since found her mother and moved back to Vietnam.

The last black woman to cover Vogue Paris was model Rose Cordero in March 2010.<n>Mrs Kebede fronts the French fashion magazine's May issue.

gipsy group have won another legal battle to stay in their illegal camp.<n>The 78 Irish travellers had refused to budge despite three courts.<n>They had been accused of trashing their leafy village in Lancashire.<n>But the Supreme Court has ruled they can take their case to the High Court.<n>The group claimed the eviction 'violated' the human rights of children.<n>But locals branded them the 'neighbours from hell' and accused them of fly tipping.

The Rosehall Estate near Inverness boasts a 22-room main house along with 700 acres of land and five separate out buildings.<n>It was built in 1820 but its most colourful period was during the 1920s after it was bought by the Duke of Westminster.<n>Miss Chanel would love to fish on the estate's river, catching more than 50 salmon, according to Winston Churchill, who stayed with her.<n>The French designer painstakingly decorated each room in subtle, elegant hues, much of it based on the look of her Paris apartment.

Jason Rezaian was detained in Tehran on July 22 last year.<n>He has been charged with espionage and collaborating with hostile governments.<n>The White House and the Post have branded the charges 'absurd'<n>His lawyer Leila Ahsan said the charges contained 'no justifiable proof'

Indian Creek Island Road, Miami, has a median house price of $21.48million.<n>It tops the list of America's richest streets, compiled by Zillow.<n>Its 86 residents include four of America’s top 500 richest people.<n>The island has its own police force which guards all of the amenities.

Finley Lamb suffers from rare brain abnormality Periventricular Nodular Heterotopia.<n>It means many of his 'grey matter' cells have not migrated to the correct position.<n>It left the boy, from Merseyside, unable to walk and talk.<n>But he defied the odds last year and now enjoys walking the two miles to school.

Labour leader said it was unacceptable to abandon immigrants boarding boats.<n>He also called on the UK to take a 'fare share' of refugees fleeing civil war.<n>Around 1,300 people are believed to have drowned in the past two weeks.

Garnet, Montana, was established in the 1860s by miners looking for gold and silver, but it was abandoned after a fire in 1912.<n>Local folklore says the area is haunted by former residents, with visitors saying they heard music and laughter, even in winter.<n>Now the U.S. Bureau of Land Management is offering free food, housing a job to people willing to live in Garnet and work as a tour operator.<n>There are four positions, with some workers operating as tour guides and others keeping the grounds.

The Edwardian-style building and shopfront on Brunswick Street in Fitzroy was once owned by Wei Tang.<n>She was convicted in 2006 of keeping five Thai women as sex slaves.<n>The brothel, formerly known as Club 417, has six bedrooms each with its own shower or spa.<n>It has been listed for sale through Barry Plant Real Estate and is being marketed on its potential for a range of uses.

Charmain Adusah, 41, was found face down in a bath by hotel staff.<n>It is believed she had been lying for four days.<n>Her husband Eric Isaiah Adusah, 28, is a self-proclaimed prophet.<n>He told hotel managers his wife was ill and did not want to be disturbed.<n>Mr Adusah, originally from Ghana, is being held in police custody.

Ranulfo Perez, 48, was arrested after a 16-year-old claimed he groped her.<n>She was outside Toys R Us in Times Square with tour group when incident happened.<n>Perez was dressed as the Cookie Monster and allegedly grabbed the girl.<n>He was charged with forcible touching and harassment but released.<n>Girl said she was 'beyond upset' and the DA's decision to drop case was 'disgusting'

People who have never been divorced can expect a retirement income 13% higher than a colleague who has been through a divorce.<n>It means an extra £2,100 a year – £17,800 rather than £15,700 – to anyone who has kept their marriage intact.<n>One in five divorcees who stop work this year will retire with debts to drag down their disposable income and lifestyles.

Silverman claimed she was paid $50 less than her male friend for a gig.<n>She said it was because she was a guest on the show and wasn't meant to receive anything.<n>But the New York Comedy Club owner revealed the story was false.<n>The comic has since publicly apologized and revealed she fabricated the story.

More than 2,000 labial reduction procedures performed on the NHS in 2010.<n>Trend reflected in Australia where procedures have more than doubled.<n>Some women dissatisfied or distressed about appearance of their labia.

Teachers say youngsters have been playing truant as they try to find stardom.<n>For the first time producers have held auditions at secondary schools.<n>The move has helped reduce unauthorised absence levels in some schools.

Kim has revealed what she eats every day in an extract from her book.<n>Star works with nutritionist to come up with meal plans for her and Kanye.<n>Breakfast includes eggs, oatmeal or a protein shake.<n>For lunch and dinner, a professional chef will serve her dishes.<n>Kim also drinks iced tea in the afternoons.

Toppins went missing about 6pm Friday in Washington Court House, Ohio.<n>His parents reported him missing after he disappeared while playing with siblings in the front yard.<n>His body was found in a pond at an abandoned quarry about 7pm Saturday.<n>Police believe the toddler wandered off by himself.

The 46-year-old suffered a potentially life-threatening complication shortly after giving birth to daughter Grace, now 11.<n>She suffered massive blood loss and was forced to undergo a painful procedure whereby the doctors manually tore her placenta free.<n>Her experience inspired her to launch Every Mother Counts in 2010.<n>The organisation is dedicated to making pregnancy and childbirth safe for mothers around the world.

Hannah Overton, 37, will not be charged with murder again in the death of her four-year-old adopted son, Andrew Burd.<n>Overton was released from prison before Christmas after spending seven years in prison for the boy's death.<n>A court overturned her conviction last year, saying her trial was 'problematic from the beginning'<n>Nueces County District Attorney Mark Skurka has decided not to try Overton again, saying he will not pursue capital murder charges.

Jamie Toms and Aaron Jones built the boat for free and took it out to sea.<n>They had already set up their rods and haul in some fish before the incident.<n>But an oar snapped 200 yards off Jaywick, Essex, and they had to call 999.<n>A lifeboat crew arrived to find neither man wearing a lifejacket.<n>One of the anglers has now pledged to return to the water with another boat.

Deputy Prime Minister says he would not allow Tories to impose welfare cuts.<n>Says he would veto any Coalition if Tories insist on £12billion cuts.<n>Clegg also suggested he would veto a new deal unless Tories agreed new taxes on the rich.
Daniel P. Finney, 39, of Iowa, started out weighing 563lbs and has lost 20lbs in a month.

The FBI say they have recovered a 26-pound gold bar - worth up to $500,000 - somewhere in South Florida.<n>The bar was stolen in a heist last month in North Carolina.<n>Three armed men in a white van stopped the armored truck on the highway and tied up the two security guards.<n>They then marched the guards into nearby woods and took 275lbs of gold.<n>The gold totaled $4.8 million, but the truck was carrying about $10 million worth of metal, so the thieves left half the load - mostly silver - behind.

Leah Williamson scored England's penalty in their first-leg last Saturday.<n>The match was played in an 18-second break after the first penalty.<n>It was the first time in history that a penalty had been awarded in this way.<n>The Arsenal player scored again in the 65th minute to secure a 2-2 draw.<n>England will now play at the European Championships this summer.
The Brazilian beauty, 34, walked for Colcci during So Paulo Fashion Week.

Alan Greaves was caught with almost 20,000 images of child abuse.<n>Police raided his home in Colne, Lancashire in September 2013.<n>They found the disturbing images on a digital storage device.<n>The father-of-eight claimed the images were 'framed by the Illuminati'<n>He pleaded guilty to two offences of making indecent images.<n>He was jailed for 21 months at Burnley Crown Court.
