State introduced law allowing it to use nitrogen gas to kill death row prisoners.<n>It is now the state's second choice if lethal injections are unavailable.<n>Proponents say it is 'fast and painless' and is 'foolproof'<n>But opponents say there's no way to know whether it is painless or effective.

The Light Dragoons marched through the town of Dereham in Norfolk today for the final time.<n>Around 250 men and women from the reconnaissance unit were supported by more than 4,000 people.<n>The regiment is set to leave Robertson Barracks in Swanton Morley this summer and move to Catterick, North Yorkshire.

20 million people in the UK are expected to suffer hayfever symptoms this summer, up a third from last year.<n>By 2030, that figure is expected to surge to 31.8 million sufferers, experts told MailOnline.<n>Grass is the main culprit pollen for hayfever in the UK, with pollen levels high in warm, dry weather.<n>Hayfever seasons are becoming longer, as warmer weather in spring and autumn means pollen is rife from March to the end of August.

Aracely Meza, the wife of Texas pastor Daniel Meza, has been arrested in the case involving an attempt to resurrect a two-year-old boy.<n>Aracely Meza, who is reportedly not the child's mother, was taken into custody on Monday and has been charged with injury to a child by omission.<n>She is currently being held on a $100,000 bond, a police spokesman told Daily Mail Online.

Sergio Barrientos-Hinojosa was arrested late Saturday.<n>Police say he had his 13-year-old son take him to buy beer at the gas station, where he got into an argument and started shooting at another customer.<n>No one was injured.

Police in Clinton, New York, said a suspicious package at the Kirner-Johnson building was harmless.<n>Students and staff were told to stay inside and lock doors.<n>Bomb threat and threat of a shooting were received by phone at 9.45am.<n>Police evacuated McEwen, Milbank, Babbitt, Cafe Opus and Schambach buildings while K-9 units were brought it to search the campus.

Munira Khalif, 18, from Minnesota, has been accepted to all eight Ivy League schools.<n>She is the daughter of Somali immigrants who fled the civil war.<n>She has also received a U.N. award and wants to improve education across the world.<n>The other three students are from Indiana, North Carolina and New York.

The statue of Lucille Ball was unveiled in Celoron, New York, in 2009.<n>It sparked a Facebook campaign to get it removed, which attracted 600 likes.<n>But it isn't the only offensive artwork that has missed the mark.<n>A whole host of ugly effigies have made appearances around the world.

Hilary Border, 54, had power of attorney over her mother Dorothy's affairs.<n>Mother-of-three required to pay £300-a-week for 83-year-old's care.<n>But when it doubled to £600 the money was either late or stopped.<n>She pleaded guilty to fraud and was sentenced to 16 months in prison.

Primatologists at Iowa State University recorded 300 hunts by chimps.<n>They found female chimps were using tools to capture prey in 60% of the observations.<n>Males tend to prefer to use their hands to capture prey.<n>Research may provide tantalising hints at how humans first learned to use weapons to hunt.

Michael Brelo, 31, is charged with two counts of voluntary manslaughter for the deaths of Timothy Russell, 43, and Malissa Williams, 30.<n>His attorney Patrick D'Angelo conceded that his tactics could be called into question given that Brelo exposed himself to danger when he stepped onto the hood of a beat-up Chevy Malibu to fire 15 rounds into the windshield of the suspects' vehicle.<n>But Brelo and 12 officers who shot a total of 137 rounds into the car in November 2012 had ample reason to believe that Russell and Williams were shooting at them, he said.

Dell 'Super Dell' Schanze, 45, was sentenced to one year of probation on Friday after pleading guilty to two misdemeanor counts.<n>His admission of guilt follows a plea deal that fell through on Thursday after he refused to admit to the 2011 crime.<n>Schanze was scheduled to go to trial on April 20 and would have faced a maximum of one year in federal prison and more than $100,000 in fines if convicted.<n>On Friday, he returned to the court to plead guilty.
Robin Wright won Best Actress in a Drama for her role in House of Cards.<n>She eschewed Hollywood fame to raise her two children instead.<n>She wore Reem Acra to the Golden Globes.

McDonalds advert appears to show Italian children prefer Happy Meals.<n>The ad shows a small boy asking his parents which pizza he would like.<n>A voice says: 'Your little boy had no doubt' and ends with Happy Meal.<n>Top Italian chef describes the advert as 'blasphemy' and threatens legal action.

KFC allowed hundreds of people to tour the back of 219 stores across Australia and roam from freezer to fryer on Saturday.<n>The fast food giant hoped to dispel myths around the quality and freshness of their ingredients.<n>Daily Mail Australia attended an earlier tour of the KFC store outside Sydney's Airport in Mascot.

A mother was kicked out of an Easter egg hunt after swearing at volunteers.<n>She was at Melbourne's Greatest Ever Easter Egg Hunt on Saturday.<n>The woman in her mid- to late 30s was escorted out after taking too many eggs.<n>Event organiser Allan Turner said she was a major problem at the event.

Castle Toward, near Dunoon, was used to ready soldiers for landing at a beach.<n>Training included jumping from landing craft and clambering up the beach.<n>It was commissioned as HMS Brontosaurus in 1942 and was visited by Churchill.

Boy's body was found floating in a pond in Norfolk in June 1988.<n>Police exhumed body as part of a case review and DNA led them to mother.<n>She was arrested on suspicion of infanticide but charge was dropped.<n>Charges could still be brought against her by the CPS.

Huma Abedin, 38, was seen dining with husband Anthony Weiner and son Jordan.<n>The family went to Tortara Mexican restaurant in New York on Saturday.<n>It is Abedin's second Mexican meal of the week after Chipotle.<n>She and Hillary Clinton came under fire for not paying tip at Chipotle.

Robert Durst, 72, was arrested in March on a murder warrant out of California.<n>His lawyers say he got the money legally and it is not needed for evidence.<n>Durst is accused of killing his friend Susan Berman in 2000 to stop her from talking to authorities about his first wife's disappearance.<n>Authorities found $44,000, marijuana and a revolver in Durst's hotel room.<n>They also found maps of Florida and Cuba, leading some to believe he was ready for a life on the run.

Molly Schuyler, a 120-pound mother-of-four, set a new world record at the Big Texan Steak Ranch in Amarillo, Texas on Sunday.<n>She ate three 72-ounce steaks, three shrimp cocktails, three baked potatoes, three salads and three rolls in just 20 minutes.<n>The four teams of two that competed against her didn't even come close to winning.

Nigeria's new President said he could not promise they would be found.<n>More than 200 schoolgirls were abducted by Boko Haram a year ago today.<n>Protests were held in Abuja and in New York to mark anniversary.<n>Almost 300 girls were taken from their school in Chibok by militants.<n>They were forced to convert to Islam and marry group members.

The Detective Camera was produced between 1883 and 1887 using a dry negative which was already loaded into the device.<n>It was the first time people really had the opportunity to take a photograph without their subjects knowing.<n>The word snapshot emerged from this style of photography and the photographers were called snap shooters.<n>The camera was loaded, focused and ready to take a photograph at around six feet away.

Jake Castner, 19, went into hiding last week after a warrant was issued for his arrest in relation to an alleged string of thefts.<n>On Sunday, on his fourth day on the run he boasted on Facebook: 'We don't talk to police!'<n>On Monday morning Victoria Police say they arrested and interviewed Castner 'in relation to burglary and theft related offences allegedly committed in Bacchus Marsh and Ballarat areas'<n>The troubled teenager’s Facebook page is littered with drug references including offers of 'bud for cash' and an image of him appearing to smoke a glass pipe.

Tommy Thompson led a team to the SS Central America in 1988.<n>The ship sank off the Carolina coast in 1857 with 21 tons of gold.<n>Thompson and girlfriend Alison Antekeier, 42, were arrested in January.<n>They have both admitted contempt of court in Columbus, Ohio.

Christopher Furniss-Roe found in his bedroom by his father just 15 minutes after 'childish' argument with his younger sister.<n>His father Jason desperately tried to save his son's life but he died the next day in hospital.<n>Coroner ruled it was a tragic accident - saying the eight-year-old was probably looking for'sympathy and forgiveness' after the row.

Susan Monica, a 66-year-old pig farmer and welder from southern Oregon, went on trial on Tuesday in Medford.<n>She has been charged with killing two handymen living on her 20-acre pig ranch and dismembering the bodies.<n>Both victims were shot in the head and dismembered in what prosecutors allege were separate murders committed more than a year apart.<n>Monica appeared in court dressed in skirt, blouse and short wig.

First four episodes of season five leaked on torrent download sites on Saturday.<n>They are titled The Wars to Come, The House of Black and White, High Sparrow and The Sons of the Harpy.<n>HBO said it is investigating how the episodes leaked from a group approved by the company.<n>The series is the most illegally downloaded program in the world.

People with sleep apnoea saw a mental decline more than a decade earlier.<n>Researchers said onset of Alzheimer’s might be accelerated among those with sleeping problems.<n>At least half a million Britons suffer from sleep apnoea.

Paramedics found Kyle Hargreaves kissing a girl on a stretcher in the back of the vehicle.<n>The ambulance crew had left the doors open while they collected a 92-year-old man with chest pain from inside the property.<n>Hargreaves told paramedic Michael Newman: 'What's your problem? We are just trying to have sex'

Carwyn Scott-Howell plunged 160ft to his death in Flaine, France.<n>He was skiing with his mother and siblings after becoming separated.<n>Prosecutor Pierre Yves Michau said death was 'a tragic accident'
Thomson Airways flight was en route to Cancun from London Gatwick.<n>The Boeing 787-8 landed in Bermuda at 12:55pm yesterday.<n>Two men were removed from the aircraft and arrested by police.

The once notorious jail in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania was closed in 1996.<n>Inmates were subjected to brutal clinical experiments on a variety of dangerous substances.<n>One author claimed that inmates were exposed to herpes and athlete's foot while being tested.

René Dee watched as his wife Eileen slipped away at Royal Sussex County Hospital.<n>Eileen, 68, had been battling cancer but had received a positive prognosis.<n>She caught a lethal infection from a hospital room left filthy by staff.<n>Mr Dee is now suing the hospital trust for clinical negligence.

The 29-year-old woman was chased by police through Pattaya region.<n>She drove the wrong way down a busy road and clipped a motorbike.<n>The driver did not stop - instead carrying on driving the wrong way.<n>She hit 13 vehicles and injured two people during the 30 minute chase.<n>Police broke the front window of her car to arrest her when she refused.<n>American tourist was given a 'hefty' traffic fine and ordered to pay for damages.

Jade Wimsey, 24, from Goole, East Yorkshire, would down up to seven cans a day.<n>Her fizzy habit cost her £11,000 and caused her weight to rocket to 17st 6lb.<n>She is now a slim size 12 having shed six stone in 18 months.

U.S consumer advisory group says planes should have minimum space for humans.<n>Says government should 'take a stand' for 'humane treatment of passengers'<n>FAA tests how much space passengers have before they are allowed off plane.<n>Some airlines now offer as little as 28 inches between rows of seats.

Muhammad Naviede, 60, was killed instantly in a plane crash last year.<n>He sent a text to a relative saying his aircraft was going down.<n>The experienced pilot continued in flight for two minutes before it crashed.<n>Investigators found no fault with the aircraft and said weather conditions were unlikely to have caused the crash.<n>Mr Naviede was jailed in 1995 for nine years for a £45million fraud.

Labour leader admits his party had been 'too timid' on immigration.<n>Promises 100 new staff to crack down on exploitation of migrant workers.<n>Says migrants must learn to speak English, especially in key services.<n>But Tories say there is nothing in Mr Miliband's plans to reduce net migration.

Lord Neuberger said judges and courtrooms should allow women to wear veil.<n>He said they should'show, and be seen to show' respect towards different customs.<n>Judges should be'sensitive' to fact they are from 'privileged' sector of society.<n>He said they should have understanding of 'different cultural and social habits'

Huma Abedin has worked for Hillary Clinton since 1996, when she was a White House intern.<n>She became her deputy chief of staff when she became secretary of state, and has been a key figure in the Clinton White House campaign.<n>She has been photographed leaving a Norwalk, Iowa fruit processing company on Wednesday ahead of Clinton.<n>She was last seen on Monday at an Ohio Chipotle restaurant, where she and Clinton were both wearing sunglasses.<n>She is married to disgraced former New York Democratic Congressman Anthony Weiner, who fell from grace after he had sex with several women.

Actress Glynis Barber has been working with nutritional therapist Fleur Borrelli.<n>She has changed her diet and her health in the past two years.<n>She has dropped a stone in weight and gained lean muscle.<n>She says she has vastly improved her energy levels.

Leo Grand launched his app Trees for Cars in August 2013.<n>He was offered $100 in cash or daily coding lessons by Patrick McConlogue, the man who taught him how to code.<n>Grand picked the latter, and was also provided a laptop, office space and coding books.<n>But Grand is still homeless and says the number one question people ask him is why he's still homeless.
FBI agent claimed family had'many connections' to 9/11 hijackers.<n>Some family members said they knew about the attacks.<n>But FBI said report was 'unsubstantiated' and 'poorly written'

Aldi has requested the ability to make employees work more than 38 hours.<n>The supermarket chain has submitted a request to the Productivity Commission.<n>The Transport Workers' Union has condemned the request.<n>National Secretary Tony Sheldon accused Aldi of trying to'reintroduce serfdom'

London Mayor was mobbed by fans in Ramsgate, Kent, as he campaigned.<n>He was given a big kiss on his right cheek and even had a selfie with a fan.<n>Mr Johnson was joined by Tory Craig Mackinlay, who is defending 7,600.<n>The pair ate icecream in Tory party blue and handed out leaflets.

Ian Gibson had his kneecap blown off in combat more than 30 years ago.<n>He is now suing his employer after he was nicknamed 'Hoppy' by a colleague.<n>The 60-year-old claims he was subjected to a tirade of 'horrible harassment'<n>He told an employment tribunal he was overlooked for an office job.<n>Mr Gibson said he was offered an admin role but was told it would not be permanent.

A virtually cloud-free satellite image from the European Space Agency’s MetOp-B satellite has been released.<n>Parts of Scotland and Wales experienced the warmest temperatures today, with highs of 16.6C.<n>Thousands flocked to the beaches in Brighton which to enjoy the sunny weather and highs of 14.9C.

Nantucket wooden chair was salvaged from wreck of Titanic in 1912.<n>Was given to Captain Julien Lemarteleur, who worked on Mackay-Bennett.<n>Anonymous seller kept it by window overlooking sea at his home.<n>It was sold at auction in Devizes, Wiltshire, to a UK buyer.

Chris Rowe, 31, was plagued by an irritating cough for six months.<n>He visited doctors five times in two months, with the same conclusion.<n>Doctors said he was most likely suffering a'simple' virus.<n>But after coughing up blood, he was taken to A&E where an X-ray revealed a tumour on his lung, which had spread to his liver and bones.<n>Mr Rowe is now undergoing gruelling chemotherapy to prolong his life.<n>His wife Kate, 28, is due to give birth to their second child in June.

Fenerbahce team bus was shot at on Saturday night.<n>The driver suffered a head injury and was taken to hospital.<n>Former Liverpool midfielder Dirk Kuyt was among 40 players and officials on board the bus.<n>Caykur Rizespor midfielder Ludovic Obraniak was taken to hospital with a suspected heart problem after being substituted.

Australian designers We Are Handsome are among the fashion houses rejecting traditional skinnier models in favour of strong, fit girls.<n>The designers will debut their first Active Swim range on Tuesday night at Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia.<n>The models will include Instagram sensation Sjana Earp, Kate Kendall, Amanda Bisk, Juliet Burnett, and Lindy Klim.

Carwyn Scott-Howell was on holiday with his mother, sister and brother.<n>He became separated from his mother and fell over a 164ft drop in the Alps.<n> Footprints in the snow eventually led police to his body.<n>His family said he'made life full of laughter with never a dull moment'

Baby was found crying in toilet of a Chinese burger bar in Chengdu.<n>Staff noticed a woman visiting the toilet and called the police.<n>They identified the woman as Yuan Yen, 34, and arrested her.<n>She was found to have blood on her and refused to see doctors.<n>The baby was taken to hospital and declared healthy.

Ukip leader was due to attack government over defence spending.<n>But he was trapped in chauffeur-driven car while attending farm event.<n>Farage faced ridicule last year after blaming immigrants for M4 jams.
Mary, 43, visited a farm in Kirke Hyllinge with her three children.<n>The family met a tiny Holstein Friesian calf during the visit.<n>The outing came days after Queen Margrethe II's 75th birthday.

Fitness tests introduced amid fears over agents' expanding waistlines.<n>Those who fail will have marks noted on their annual performance review.<n>FBI chief James Coney said the force depends on its agents' ability to 'run, fight and shoot'

Carlton Tavern in Maida Vale, west London, was the only building in its road not destroyed by bombs during the Blitz.<n>But developers CLTX Ltd have knocked it down without warning to make way for luxury flats.<n>Landlady Patsy Lord was told to close for an 'inventory' on Easter Monday but returned two days later to find the pub no longer standing.<n>West Westminster City Council is now considering legal action against the developers.

The FBI and NYPD said on Wednesday that a reward of up to $115,000 is being offered for information leading to an arrest and conviction in the March 2008 bombing.<n>No one was injured in the blast which occurred seconds after people walked past.<n>Officials said the explosion may be connected to earlier unsolved bombings at the British and Mexican consulates.

Katie Cope, 17, was forced to close her mother's vintage clothing store.<n>She had to detain the shoplifter for three hours until police arrived.<n>Officers arrived nine minutes after Katie made a formal complaint.<n>They then asked to drop the case because the thief had offered to apologise.

Turkish court imposed blocks because images of siege were being shared.<n>They were 'deeply upset' by the death of Mehmet Selim Kiraz.<n>The 46-year-old prosecutor died in hospital after being taken hostage.<n>Members of the Revolutionary People's Liberation Party-Front stormed courthouse.<n>They were holding him hostage to protest his investigation into death of Berkin Elvan.

Tyler Grant, a junior at the University of Texas prefers to be referred to by neutral plural pronouns such as 'they' 'them' or 'their'<n>Video footage posted to Twitter from early on Sunday morning shows a restaurant manager telling Grant and a friend not to enter the fast food restaurant because Grant was dressed in 'inappropriate attire'<n>Grant believes the restaurant was discriminatory because of Grant's gender identity.<n>Whataburger claims they denied Grant not because of gender identity but because Grant was wearing too revealing an outfit to be let inside.

Celebrity chef will present Simply Nigella on BBC 2 for first time in three years.<n>The show will focus on 'a new pared-down approach to cooking and eating'<n>It will be Nigella's first solo venture with the broadcaster since her marriage broke down and she gave evidence in the fraud case involving her two assistants.

Volunteers carried the creatures back to the ocean in slings on Friday.<n>Coastguards and officials called off the rescue operation as darkness fell.<n>Remaining of the melon-headed whales are 'dead or dying', officials said.<n>Scientists believe the creatures got lost and washed up on the beach.

Kent Sprouse, 42, was sent to death row for a 2002 shootout at a Ferris, Texas, convenience store that killed police Officer Harry Steinfeldt III and customer Pedro Moreno.<n>He would be the fifth inmate executed this year in Texas, the nation's most active death penalty state.<n>Medical tests showed Sprouse, a Boone County, Missouri, native, had taken illegal drugs within the previous 48 hours.

Lord Stevens to be investigated over claims he failed to hand over information to the Macpherson Inquiry.<n>Regulator probe stems from complaint from Stephen's father Neville Lawrence.<n>Former Met Police chief was deputy commissioner from 1998 to 2000.<n>He then served five years as the UK's most senior policeman.

Wigry National Park, in north-east Poland, is furthest outreach of Masurian Lakes.<n>It is also exceedingly well set-up for outdoor pursuits.<n>The area is unspoiled, but it is also exceedingly well set-up.

Leonie Granger, 25, lured Mehmet Hassan, 56, to his death with a promise of drinks and gambling.<n>But she left his flat unlocked so her boyfriend and a second thug could get in.<n>They tied up the father of three and kicked him to death as they ransacked his home to find his hidden winnings.<n>Granger wept as an Old Bailey jury cleared her of murder but found her guilty of the manslaughter of Mr Hassan.

Ogle-2014-BLG-0124Lb was detected by the Spitzer Space Telescope.<n>It is half as massive as Jupiter and is 13,000 light-years away.<n>Most of the planets we know about are around 10-100 times closer.<n>The discovery demonstrates that Spitzer can be used to help solve the puzzle of how planets are spread out in our galaxy.

Police Scotland's Edinburgh division posted pictures of Lego figures on Facebook.<n>The campaign is to raise awareness of the dangers of housebreaking.<n>But the move has received a backlash from victims and politicians.

Paul Bakewell, 35, from Walsall, West Mids, secretly designed a poster.<n>He then had emblazoned it on the 20ft-tall advertising hoarding and covered over.<n>Tara Barber, 32, was driven past by her boss who pretended they were going to a business meeting on Friday morning.<n>The billboard featured pictures of the couple and the words: 'Tara you've changed my life. Will you marry me?'<n>Romantic Paul then went down on one knee and proposed to Tara.

The Australian Charities and Not-for-profits Commission made the announcement about Get Rid of Sids Project on Wednesday.<n>The organisation is run by Brisbane anti-vaccination campaigner Stephanie Messenger.<n>Earlier this year, it invited US anti-vaccination campaigner Sherri Tenpenny to speak at a number of seminars across Australia.<n>Dr Tenpenny had to cancel her trip due to consistent threats of violence from 'anti-free-speech terrorists'

Francis Pusok, 30, was seen riding the horse through desert on Thursday.<n>Officers tried to serve an identity-theft warrant on him but he fled.<n>They caught up with him and he fell off the horse, they stun him with a Taser.<n>He tried to get up but they stunned him again before starting beating him.<n>Eight deputies kicked him in the groin and fists were thrown at him.<n>NBC film crew followed them as they beat him in San Bernardino desert.<n>San Bernardino County sheriff, John McMahon, has ordered an inquiry.

Four-bedroom property in central London's Farm Street has all the trappings of modern luxury.<n>Was once the site of a milking parlour and was built in the 18th Century as a depot.<n>Developers knocked down the structure in 2011 to build the luxury home which is on the market for £25million.

Phylise Davis-Bowens, 42, is suing her former college because she was not allowed to try out for the 14 Karat Gold dancers in 2009.<n>The substitute teacher said she was discriminated against because of her weight and missed out on part of the academic experience.<n>Mrs Davis-Bowens lost her sister at the age of 37 to a gastric bypass because she was obese and felt under pressure to quickly lose weight.

UN officials say procedure should only be carried out when'medically necessary'<n>Just over a quarter of women giving birth in England now have a caesarean.<n>Plans cost NHS an average of £2,369, compared to a natural birth at £1,665.
The man was spearfishing off Jupiter Inlet in Palm Beach, Florida, when he was bitten.<n>He was airlifted to St Mary's Medical Center's trauma unit.<n>The victim has not been identified.

Josiah Duggar, 18, has revealed that he has entered into a courtship with 17-year-old Marjorie Jackson.<n>The pair officially began their courtship on April 6 - the same day his older sister Jill gave birth to her first child.

Tristram Hunt was filmed asking year six pupil who he would vote for.<n>The 10-year-old said Ukip was'very good' and wanted to get 'all the foreigners out'<n>The child's mother has now told MailOnline she is 'embarrassed' by the exchange.<n>She said: 'I don't really think my son understands the impact of what he said'<n>Labour admitted they were'surprised' by the schoolboy's remarks.

Jack Black the friendly jackdaw is a popular member of the community.<n>He often pops into houses and joins residents for Christmas dinner.<n>He has also accompanied children to school perched on their shoulders.<n>One fan has set up a Facebook page for him with over 450 members.

The Aerodrome Manual was published on the Ministry of Defence's website.<n>The document has the exact GPS co-ordinates of RAF Mount Pleasant.<n>It also contains information on the depth of concrete on the runway.<n>The MoD admitted the manual was available but denied it was sensitive.<n>Argentina is considering leasing 12 Russian long-range bombers to attack the islands.

The 24-year-old is one of the most in-demand models in the industry.<n>Hennessy has lucrative contracts with Calvin Klein and Diesel.<n>He has landed Down Under to start work on a new campaign with Windsor Smith shoes.<n>The model says he is only recently single.

Chris Copeland, 31, and his wife, Katrine Saltare, 28, were talking in the street just before 4am on Wednesday when a man interrupted them.<n>Copeland 'told the man to back off and he pulled out a knife'<n>He then stabbed Saltare in the breast, buttocks and arm - she is in stable condition.<n>Another woman, Catherine Somani, 23, was also stabbed as she tried to break up the fight - she is in hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.<n>Copeland and his wife are both listed in stable condition at Bellevue Hospital.<n>Atlanta Hawks players Pero

Xiao Gao, from Fujian Province in south eastern China, has not said a word in five days.<n>He claims the girl who gave him the water let him drink it and then said 'You will die after drinking this'<n>But medical experts are at a loss to explain his sudden inability to talk.<n>They say the combination of water, perfume and dust should not have caused that type of damage.

Ashley Dodds, 29, ordered mocktail for daughter Dennon, 10, at Manchester restaurant.<n>But staff served her daughter a drink with alcohol in it.<n>Restaurant blames Ms Dodds for leaving her daughter alone.

Footage shows Carmarie and Kanya sat buckled into the device at the Indy Speedway park on Panama City Beach, Florida, over the weekend.<n>At the start they seem pretty calm but when the carriage tilts back and fires 300ft-high panic sets in.<n>Both appear to pass out several times due to the extreme force, with their eyes glazing over and rolling back.<n>To date the clip of their traumatic theme park outing has been watched more than 17 million times on Facebook.

Robert Cusanelli of WHDH-TV was banned from the Bristol County courthouse after two jurors told the court they were followed by a van.<n>The van was allegedly behind the jury bus as it headed towards an off-site parking lot where the jurors are dropped off at the end of the day.<n>The station was told to 'investigate' the matter before reporting back to the court.

Captain claims co-pilot misbehaved and struck him in cockpit.<n>Incident occurred before flight AI611 was due to take off from Delhi.<n>Airline insists there was no physical violence and the argument was verbal.<n>Indian aviation officials have launched an investigation into the incident.

In 84 days from November 2013 to January 2014, the area around Azle, Texas, shook with 27 magnitude two or greater earthquakes.<n>Scientists believe these earthquakes were the result of high-pressure injection of drilling wastewater into the ground.<n>The oil and gas industry uses injection wells to get rid of wastewater, which can have chemicals, heavy metals, salt and radioactive material.

Shakespeare described Richard III as a 'poisonous bunch-back'd toad'<n>But research on his skeleton found he had a distinctive scoliosis.<n>This condition was probably not known about until after his death.<n>Tailoring and specially fitted armour probably helped to disguise it.

Kirk Pingelly and Layne Beachly won their case against their neighbour.<n>Wendy Goyer claimed her'small but charming view' would be obstructed if Mr Pengilly and Ms Beachley's addition was built.<n>The couple's home was purchased in 2007 for $2.6 million and features extensive views of Freshwater and Queenscliff beaches.<n>Warringah council approved plans for additions to be made to the home back in August 2013.<n>Ms Goyer was ordered to pay the costs of the council as well as the couple's legal fees.

Justice Diana Bryant has spoken out about surrogacy laws in Australia.<n>She said that commercial surrogacy is banned in Australia.<n>She believes this forces hopeful parents to enter into unlawful arrangements.<n>Her statement is backed up by a recent bout of child abandonment cases.

Security research firm Bitglass created an excel spreadsheet of 1,568 fake employee credentials and placed it on anonymous file sharing sites.<n>By day 12, the file had received over 1,080 clicks had spread to 22 countries.<n>Data was viewed more than 1,000 times and downloaded 47 times.<n>Traffic patterns suggest the fake data was shared among members of the syndicates to vet its validity and subsequently shared elsewhere.

Amelia-Jane Harris, 20, developed Crohn's disease at the age of 14.<n>She weighed 27st 10lbs and was called 'Fatty Bum Bum' by bullies.<n>Developed Crohn's disease and lost 18 stone in 20 months to become a slim size six.<n>Says her 'dream body' is a nightmare as she cannot eat and vomits daily.

New poll reveals 49 per cent of Britons think Camilla should be Queen.<n>But 35 per cent believe she should be given a lesser title out of respect.<n>Poll by YouGov ahead of Charles and Camilla's 10th wedding anniversary.<n>When the couple became engaged in 2005, only 7 per cent thought Camilla should be Queen.

Kyle Iveson, 24, held up shop with a 12in knife in Clitheroe, Lancashire.<n>He tried to hide his identity by lowering his voice but Karen Brown recognised him.<n>Mrs Brown is the mother of Iveson's ex-girlfriend and grandmother of his child.<n>Iveson was jailed for three years after pleading guilty to robbery.

The former president made the comment while on a visit to Oklahoma City.<n>He was speaking at a ceremony marking the 20th anniversary of the car bombing that killed 168 people.<n>The former secretary of state launched her campaign last week.

Kim Richards is speaking out for the first time since her shocking arrest last week following a drunken altercation at The Beverly Hills Hotel.<n>The former child star turned Real Housewife discusses her demons in an emotional interview with Dr. Phil set to air April 28.<n>Among the topics the 50-year-old is slated to discuss is her longtime struggle with alcoholism.<n>Currently, Kim is scheduled to appear at the Los Angeles Superior Court on May 10 following her April 16 incident at the Polo Lounge.

Sarah Stage, 30, from Los Angeles, is expecting her first child with boyfriend James.<n>The underwear model and animal rights activist came under fire last month for her unusually trim and toned figure during her pregnancy.

Zookeeper Elad Hershkowitz filmed animals drinking from a GoPro camera.<n>He placed the camera in the animals' water troughs and filmed them.<n>The footage was recorded for a total of 30 hours and is four minutes long.<n>Animals include a rhino who almost kisses the surface of the water.<n>A lemur delicately licks the surface of the water with its tongue.

John Pat Cunningham, 27, was shot by the Army in a field in County Armagh.<n>A 73-year-old suspect has now been detained in England.<n>He is being taken to Northern Ireland for questioning.<n>The case was recently re-opened by the Police Service of Northern Ireland.

Betty Johnson, 86, was a Kansas City Chiefs ticket holder since 1986.<n>She was known as 'grandma' by players and received a kiss from wide receiver Dwayne Bowe every game.<n>Johnson had been in hospice care since April 7 and her health had been deteriorating after breaking her hip in February.<n>Her last wish was to see her team before taking her last breath.<n>Chiefs Hall of Famer Nick Lowery visited Johnson on Thursday and shortly after the visit, she passed away.

Tonya Stack, wife of Lt Gov Mike Stack, allegedly made obscene gesture.<n>State representative Kevin Boyle claims she then threw soda over him.<n>The pair were at fundraiser in honor of a slain Afghanistan veteran.<n>Boyle and Stack are at the center of a political struggle over a vacant seat.

Chen Yuntao, 38, is begging on the streets of Hefei City dressed as a horse.<n>He is asking people to ride him for five yuan – the equivalent of 54p.<n>The family are in huge debt after son Minghao underwent chemotherapy.<n>The nine-year-old has now had 20 courses of treatment and the cancer has returned.<n>Mr Chen said begging on the street was a 'last resort' but he would 'gladly do anything' for his son.

Katie Hopkins has praised Tony Abbott's government for stopping the boats.<n>She has suggested the UK follow Australia's approach and 'threaten them with violence'<n>'They threaten them with violence until they bugger off, throwing cans of Castlemaine in an Aussie version of sharia stoning,' she wrote.<n>Her comments have led to a backlash on social media and a campaign to have her removed from her column.

Timothy Fradeneck, 38, was arraigned on first-degree murder and child abuse charges in the deaths of his wife and two children.<n>The bodies of Christine Fradeneck, 37, and the children, Celeste Fradeneck, 2, and Timothy Fradeneck III, 8, were found Monday evening.<n>Fradeneck told a judge Wednesday that he wants to plead insanity.<n>The judge ordered him jailed without bond, and appointed him an attorney.

Elmo and Dr Murthy explain why getting vaccinated is so important.<n>In response to anti-vaccination campaigners, Elmo asks why everybody doesn't get a shot.<n>The campaign videos have been released in the wake of a measles outbreak.

gale force winds have battered the east coast of NSW this morning.<n>Commuters are mourning the loss of their umbrellas on social media.<n>Workers have begun posting photos of their broken umbrellas scattered in gutters and discarded in bins along with the hashtag #umbrellageddon.

ISIS has released a list of punishments for anyone who insults God or his messenger or blasphemes against Islam.<n>Top of the list is 'death' for anyone who insults God or his messenger.<n>Also punished are those who have sex before marriage and thieves who commit highway robbery.<n>The list, which is based on Sharia law, has been circulated on social media in recent months.

Jaime Singleton saw the baby elephant, Nadia, tied to a pole outside a restaurant at Marina Phuket Resort in December.<n>The change.org petition has received 50,627 signatures since it was launched a month ago.<n>It is the second time in a month an elephant has been ridden by drunken tourists at a Thai resort.<n>Ms Singleton said the animals are forced to pose for pictures and be ridden by guests at the resorts.<n>She said the elephants are bought at a very young age by these groups, so that they can be 'trained' for the job and are often forced to live in appalling conditions

Stephen Hogger, 55, was sacked after 17 years at St Peter and St Paul Church, Suffolk.<n>The 13 choristers have now quit in'solidarity' over the sacking.<n>Walkout means the 14th century church will be without a choir for the first time in 200 years.

Chancellor refuses to rule out offering help to Britain's top earners.<n>Those earning over £50,000 currently pay 45p rate of tax.<n>Labour wants to raise the threshold to 50 per cent of income.<n>Osborne says raising allowance to £12,500 is also a priority.<n>But he refuses to commit to spending 2 per cent of the budget on defence.

Raffaele Sollecito was seen shopping for lingerie in Rome, Italy.<n>The 31-year-old was with a blonde companion browsing through shops.<n>Comes a week after he was seen looking at a £105,000 BMW in the city.<n>Sollecito and former lover Amanda Knox were acquitted in March.<n>Both are reportedly planning to seek compensation for time wrongly spent.

Images released on social media under the title Leveling Graves And Erasing Pagan Symbols.<n>Group said graves above the ground suggested that the dead person was closer to Allah than the living.<n>One expert said that Isis released the video to mock the West, to show that it is powerless to stop the group doing whatever it wants.

A 4WD containing four children and an adult has crashed into a lake.<n>Three children have died at the scene and one is in a serious condition.<n>The fourth child was flown by air ambulance to the Royal Children's Hospital and remains in a serious condition.<n>The driver was transported via road ambulance to the Royal Melbourne Hospital.<n>The relation between the female driver and the four children are not yet known.

Richard Sherman and girlfriend Ashley Moss have shared a photo of them cradling their son Rayden.<n>Rayden was born on February 5, just a few days after Sherman and the Seattle Seahawks lost the Super Bowl to the New England Patriots.<n>Sherman will return to the field in August, as the Seahawks will play the Denver Broncos in their first preseason game.

Emily-Jane Clark, who runs How to Survive a Sleep Thief, has compiled a list of ways that visitors can avoid annoying a new mother.<n>She says not arriving unannounced is a no-no.<n>Also says that presents are not appropriate and that the baby needs to be fed alone.

Jafar Adeli, 32, arranged to meet a girl he believed to be 14 for sex.<n>But he was caught by police when he turned up at a bus station.<n>He had been duped by paedophile vigilante group Letzgo Hunting.<n>Police filmed the moment he was arrested and posted it on Facebook.<n>Adeli was jailed for 27 months after admitting attempting to meet a girl under 16.

The Handbag Clinic has opened in Chelsea to cater for well-heeled clientele.<n>Famous clients who have indulged in the luxury treatment include Imogen Thomas and Made in Chelsea stars Sophie Hermann and Stephanie Pratt.<n>The company say they are now repairing bags worth £20,000 every day.

Jon Czerniecki set up trail cameras to spot deer on his grandparents' farm.<n>He was shocked to find a kangaroo being attacked by two dogs.<n>The nine hour vision shows the canines ganging up on the injured marsupial.<n>Mr Czerniecki has contacted the council and Parks Victoria in hopes of notifying the owners of the dogs.

Airline Visual Identity 1945-1975 is a 436-page coffee table book.<n>It revisits a time when the skies were dominated by the likes of Pan Am.<n>Adverts feature beautiful women, landmarks and beauty spots.<n>Posters reflect eras in which they were created by some of the best creative minds of the time, including Ivan Chermayeff.

The tiny copper coin is smaller than a penny and dates from the Iron Age.<n>It was found in silt after the River Avon burst its banks between Bristol and Bath.<n>On one side is a horse’s head, while the other bears the image of the goddess Tanit, the chief deity of Carthage.<n>Experts have dated the coin to between 300 BC and 264 BC and say it came from the Western Mediterranean - probably Sardinia or ancient Carthage.

Dawn Bainbridge led a 'family business' stealing clothes from high street stores.<n>The 47-year-old and her two daughters made almost £50,000 from the scam.<n>They sold the stolen goods online and even had a debters' book.<n>Mother was jailed for 30 months, daughter for 20 months and sister for 16 months.<n>The women were ordered to pay back just £1 each at Newcastle Crown Court.

Joanne Bolton was repeatedly knifed in the head by her violent boyfriend.<n>The 35-year-old did not believe she was going to survive the seven hour ordeal.<n>Steven Young was jailed for 18 years after admitting attempted murder.<n>Miss Bolton begged Young to put her to bed so she didn't die on the floor.
The 18-year-old model is the daughter of actor Stephen Baldwin and has been friends with Kendall Jenner since she was starting out.

Sharon Edwards, 55, was last seen on March 14 in Grafton, NSW.<n>Her car was left parked in her driveway and her clothes were thrown in the washing basket in her bedroom.<n>Her son Eli said his family was struggling to come to terms with her disappearance.<n>Police have confirmed it is a homicide investigation.

Researchers from Manchester University working with drug development company Evgen Pharma have developed a new combination of drugs.<n>They are testing the drug Sulforadex in the most common type of breast cancer, affecting 70 per cent of patients.<n>Many women go on to develop resistance and the disease comes back.

Many parents said their children were not mature enough to learn life-saving skill.<n>And 65 per cent said their children did not know difference between 999 and 911.<n>Survey of 757 parents was carried out by Mumsnet, the UK’s largest internet community for parents.

Researchers found coffee can stop the growth of tumours in women who have already been treated with the drug tamoxifen.<n>Tamoxifen is the main hormonal therapy drug given to women who have not been through the menopause.<n>Study found those who drank two cups a day had smaller tumours.<n>Also found caffeine caused breast cancer cells to divide less frequently.

11 extra seats will be added to the middle section of the Airbus 380.<n>The configuration will be the same as the current 10 seats.<n>A fourth class will be introduced in response to the new dreaded middle seat.<n>The new configuration will come into place in 2017.<n>Emirates rejected the configuration but two manufacturers will deliver the seats.

Jason Warnock, 29, was driving Wednesday morning in Lewiston, Idaho when he saw debris near the road and looked up to see a vehicle crash into a chain-link fence on the edge of a cliff.<n>He then parked his car, ran up a pedestrian footbridge and pulled driver Matthew Sitko, 23, out to safety.<n>War Warnock remained a mystery for 24 hours as the photo of the self-less rescue went viral online.<n>He has now come forward to identify himself and speak more about the incident which he wants no credit for.
Brazils is one of the best sources of selenium.<n>They are 100 per cent of our daily required dose of 75 micrograms.<n>Peanuts are nutrient dense and have a low glycaemic index.

Andaz Liverpool Street is a swanky boutique hotel in central London.<n>It is on the site of England's first mental health hospital, built in 1247.<n>Beyonce, Lady Gaga and Lil Kim are fans of the hotel.

Kate Major Lohan arrested for 'drunken attack' on husband Michael Lohan.<n>She was reportedly drunk when police arrived at the couple's home.<n>She was charged with battery and taken to the Palm Beach Country Jail.

Christianne Boudreau of Calgary, Canada lost her son Damien Clairmont last year when he was killed fighting for ISIS in Syria.<n>Ms Boudreau thought her son was going to Egypt to study Arabic in 2013.<n>But he instead crossed the border to Syria to join ISIS.<n>The mother is now working with other families worried about their vulnerable children being radicalized by the extremist group.

Tykeran Hamilton, 25, borrowed a BMW and drove around Gloucester.<n>He spotted a friend waiting for a bus and shouted 'watch this'<n>Moments later he crashed into cyclist Alan Knight, 64, who died instantly.<n>Hamilton has been jailed for 11 years after admitting causing death by dangerous driving.

Eve Addison, 24, developed a strange swelling in her collarbone after drinking.<n> assumed she must have an allergy to the tonic and switched brands.<n>But when switching brands failed to help, she developed night sweats and a rash.<n>Tests revealed she was suffering Hodgkin Lymphoma - cancer of the lymphatic system.<n>She endured six months of chemotherapy and has now been given the all clear.

Wylie Brys, 5, and his dad Tim Brys were digging for fossils near a grocery store when Wylie found the bones.<n>It's believed the bones belong to a nodosaur, a pony-sized herbivore with scaly, plated skin.<n>The bones could be 100million-year-old and weigh up to 2,000 pounds.

Betty Willis, credited with designing the 'Welcome to Fabulous Las Vegas' sign, died in her Overton, Nevada, home on Sunday.<n>The 91-year-old artist's often-copied sign sits in a median in the middle of Las Vegas Boulevard south of the Strip.<n>Willis also designed neon signs for the Moulin Rouge casino and Blue Angel motel in Las Vegas.

Labour leader said second independence poll 'ain't going to happen'<n>He said it would 'not happen' even if he becomes Prime Minister with SNP MPs.<n>Intervention came as former PM John Major warned SNP 'waiting for excuse'<n>Mr Miliband accused Tories of 'threatening integrity of the United Kingdom'

Catherine Gerhardt is a safety expert who has been bullied online.<n>She uses her experience to educate adults and children on how to deal with online 'flamers'<n>A 'flamer' is a troll who sends a message with the intention of hurting the recipient and getting a reaction.<n>Ms Gerhardt teaches her children to follow ICE: Ignore, Communicate and Exit.<n>She also advises adults and children who witness others being 'flamed,' to employ 'ACT'

Builders are building a mountain road in Pingjiang County, Hunan province, with no ropes or safety harnesses.<n>They are pictured perched on rusty scaffolding poles as they hammer the poles into the rock to extend the walkway.<n>Officials hope the road will attract more tourists to the area, which is dominated by the Mufu Mountain range.

Rony John, 15, drowned in the River Great Ouse in Cambridgeshire last year.<n>Teenager jumped into water despite being unable to swim, inquest heard.<n>Coroner Belinda Cheney said she would write to Government chiefs over issue.<n>She said: 'Swimming is not a difficult skill to learn yet it is a critical life skill'

Lidia Quilligana was arrested in Danbury, Connecticut last month after police viewed a video that allegedly showed her choking and beating a 3-year-old girl.<n>This after the girl's family set up a nanny cam thinking that something was happening to the girl.<n>Quiligana is charged with first degree assault of a child under 10 years old and criminal mischief and will appear again in court on April 22.

Kezzia French, 46, will hold a second funeral for her baby daughter tomorrow.<n>Six-month-old Andrea was killed by her father Meyrick Fowler in 1999.<n>He was convicted of manslaughter and jailed for four years.<n>Ms French thought she had laid her to rest in 1999 but police kept organs.<n>She was only told two years after audit that her vital organs were held.

Would-be Siennas must have right measurements and be expert in yoga.<n>Must also be prepared to cut their hair into a messy bob like Miss Miller.<n>Advert for Austrian water brand Vslauer will star the Hollywood actress.

Pictures taken by East Germany's secret police show people trying to flee the Communist regime.<n>The pictures were used as evidence in show trials against those caught.<n>They were also used to train border guards so they knew what people would do.<n>The pictures were found in the archives of the Stasi, the East German secret police.

Many motorists unaware that old paper documents are now automatically cancelled when a vehicle changes hands.<n>Critics allege that the DVLA has been operating a'money-making scam'<n>DVLA accused of 'heavy-handed and Draconian' behaviour.

Tom Schweich shot himself in the head on February 26, just moments after telling an Associated Press reporter he was about to go public with anti-Semitism allegations.<n>Schweich was a Christian, but had Jewish ancestry.<n>He had been prescribed a number of pain relief and Crohn's disease drugs.<n>Police say they have found no evidence that Schweich's death was anything other than a suicide.
Almost a quarter of Brits prefer their pet dog to their in-laws.<n>One in 10 families now live in 'blended’ families.<n>Over a third said that their family’s happiness was their top priority.

Pictures show French soldiers dropping into hostile territory near terrorist havens on the Libya-Niger border.<n>Taken during an airborne operation at the 'Salvador Pass' at the border between Libya and Niger.<n>Part of the anti-jihadist operation in the Sahel – the desert region which stretches across North Africa.

Arizona is leading the way with plans to create artificial rain clouds.<n>They hope the technology will allow them to mitigate some of the worst impacts of climate change.<n>But not everyone is convinced and some scientists are concerned.

Four Vincenti sisters were removed from their mother's home on the Sunshine Coast in 2012.<n>The girls were taken from Italy and sent back to their abusive father.<n>The girls' mother, Laura Garrett, claimed the girls' father Tomaso was an abuser.<n>The girls were returned to their father in Italy legally.<n>Now, two of the girls, Emily and Claire, have spoken to 60 Minutes.

The all-gender restroom has opened in the Eisenhower Executive Office Building.<n>Spokesman Jeff Tiller said it fits in with the administration's stance on LGBT issues.<n>Spokesman said it is in line with Obama's executive order on LGBT discrimination.
Hotel industry insider Jacob Tomsky shares his hotel secrets.<n>From the most common items to take to the minibar, he explains.<n>Tomsky reveals that it is possible to steal a hotel room robe.

Dale Forrest, 26, would drink 12 pints of beer a night on nights out.<n>He would also consume shots, sugary alcopops and greasy takeaways.<n>After seeing a photo of himself out with friends, he decided to lose weight.<n>He gave up booze, fatty readymeals and takeaways and went to the gym.<n>Dale, from Bolton, has now lost 10.5 stone and is happier than ever.

Robert Tomanovich is under fire from unhappy neighbours in Livonia, a suburb of Detroit, after he hung a Confederate flag and nooses at his two properties.<n>Tomanovich, 55, has denied his actions are racist, although an employee has admitted that the second noose was a deliberate move to antagonise locals.<n>Wife Lindy told local media that the noose was a tribute to a friend of her husband who had hung himself.

Scientists at Brandeis University, Massachusetts, believe the process of converting short-term memory to long-term ones, is best carried out when a person is asleep.<n>They focused on dorsal paired medial neurons, well-known memory consolidators in fruit flies.<n>The neurons cause the flies to fall asleep, as they begin to convert short-term memory to long-term memory.<n>This is similar to the hippocampus in humans, where our memories are stored.

Fulton County Superior Court Judge Jerry Baxter had delayed sentencing by a day and encouraged all to negotiate deals with prosecutors.<n>But only two agreed to deals.<n>In both cases, Baxter followed the state's recommendations: He gave a former teacher a 7 p.m. to 7 a.m. curfew at home for one year and a former testing coordinator six months of weekends spent in jail.<n>They'll also serve five years on probation.<n>A state investigation found that as far back as 2005, educators from the 50,000-student Atlanta school system fed answers to students or erased and changed answers on tests after they

Tavon Watson, 24, was doing 100mph at the Exotic Driving Experience at Walt Disney World in Orlando when he slammed the $220,000 Lamborghini on the passenger side into a guardrail.<n>Gary Terry, 35, was killed at the scene while Watson was taken to Celebration Hospital where he was later declared stable.<n>Florida Highway Patrol is investigating whether the Lamborghini was speeding in the wrong direction around the track.

Michelle Heale of Tom's River, New Jersey broke down on the stand during her murder trial this week as she reenacted the moment she claims 14-month-old Mason Hess died.<n>She claims she was burping him when he began choking on his applesauce and that his neck snapped when she took him of her shoulder.<n>Mason would die on September 1 after being airlifted to Children's Hospital of Philadelphia.<n>The mother of twins was babysitting Mason and her twins, who were then three years old, at the time of the incident.

Mouth ulcers may seem like a minor ailment but can actually be distressing.<n>The pain can severely impact on quality of life, as eating and drinking are significantly affected.<n>As many as 20 per cent of people suffer with the occasional single mouth ulcer.

Video shows four party leaders forming boyband called Coalition.<n>The song, Change The Tune, features comedians playing the four leaders.<n>The video is designed to show that all parties are singing the same tune.

Ukip's vote has fallen in nine of 10 battleground constituencies polled by Lord Ashcroft.<n>Support for party has more than halved in two seats and by a third in others.<n>Comes after leaked poll revealed Ukip leader is on course to lose in Kent.<n>Ukip support has fallen by 25 per cent in the last six months alone.

Iranian officials made the decision following claims two of its citizens were abused while returning from an off-season pilgrimage at Jeddah airport.<n>The announcement comes amid escalating tensions between the two regional powers, particularly over Saudi-led airstrikes in Yemen.<n>Iran's Foreign Ministry has said the two boys, aged 14 and 15, were abused by airport security after they were separated from other passengers for body searches.

There are thousands of apps for food and drink, but how do you know which ones are the best?<n>Apps that tell you where to get free cocktails and help you plan meals are included.<n>Jamie Oliver's app comes with easy recipes and videos.

James and Hope Ben Canaan left their Christian commune last month.<n>The family of twelve left Gloriavale on New Zealand's West Coast.<n>They are now living in the town of Timaru, 320km away.<n>A relative said the family are adapting well to life in a new community.<n>The commune is home to around 500 people who follow a literal interpretation of the New Testament and reject the outside world.

Annegret Raunigk, 65, is set to become the world's oldest woman to give birth to quads.<n>The schoolteacher from Spandau, Berlin, is expecting the babies in the next few weeks.<n>Her doctor tells MailOnline that she is'very well placed to be a fit mother'

McCain, responding to the supreme leader of Iran's proclamation yesterday that there would be no formal pact unless sanctions relief is 'instant,' said he had'sympathy' for Iranian Ayatollah Ali Khamenei.<n>'I think John Kerry tried to come back and sell a bill of goods, hoping maybe that the Iranians wouldn’t say much about it,' the Republican lawmaker told radio host Hugh Hewitt.<n>The White House on Monday indicated that negotiators left Switzerland last week without coming to an agreement about the pace at which sanctions would be removed.

Rajul Patel, 35, targeted wealthy victims as they worked out at gyms.<n>He obtained memberships using the stolen driving licence of a doctor.<n>Patel stole a man's wedding ring, first-year anniversary ring and a 40th birthday bracelet.<n>He was caught when a gym member spotted him returning to lockers.<n>He tried to escape arrest by running from the gym into a nearby shop.<n>But he was discovered hiding behind a clothes rack and was jailed today.
Hannah Moore, 20, from Broxburn, posted images of her stretchmarks.<n>But the photo-sharing site vetoed the shots 'within two minutes'<n>She claims the rebuttal had taken her confidence away.

Andrew Robb battled depression for 43 years.<n>He revealed one of the unusual methods he used to stave off depression.<n>Mr Robb said he would force himself to sneeze by looking at the sun.<n>The sun would give him a 'hit of endorphins', which helped him get through the day.

Rebecca Calder, 24, was jailed for a year today after pleading guilty to theft.<n>She was caught after victims' family installed a camera and filmed her.<n>At her peak she was draining up to £300 a day from her victims' accounts.<n>Couple in their 80s who have now died suffered from mental and physical disabilities.<n>Calder had previously worked for a care company but was not part of team.

The Pentagon announced Tuesday it would exhume the bodies of nearly 400 sailors and Marines killed on the USS Oklahoma in the 1941 attack.<n>The move is apparently a part of a new Pentagon policy on disinterring the remains of unknown troops.<n>According to the new policy, bodies may be exhumed from Punchbowl or any other permanent American military cemeteries.<n>But they can not be removed from any U.S. Navy vessel that is being used as a national memorial, like the USS Arizona which remains sunk and on display in Honolulu.

Tavon Watson, 24, was driving the Lamborghini Gallardo on Sunday at the Exotic Driving Experience at Walt Disney World in Florida.<n>He was taking racing advice from instructor Gary Terry, 36, who died at the scene.<n>Terry was the operations manager at the track.<n>Watson was taken to hospital and later declared stable.

PC Ronnie Lungu was singled out as 'a marked man' by Wiltshire Police.<n>Tribunal found he was passed over for promotion in favour of white colleagues.<n>Mr Lungu, 40, was the only black candidate out of 20 officers to go for the role.<n>He was told his internal assessments were secretly downgraded to make him appear unworthy of promotion.<n>Wiltshire Police had denied the claims and said Mr Lungu was not promoted.

Liam Marshall-Ascough is standing to be an MP in Stoke-on-Trent central.<n>He is pictured on Facebook appearing to lick a female friend's breasts.<n>The candidate, who is gay, insists the pictures show him being sociable.<n>He said: 'I'm a normal person. People want politicians who are normal people'

Margaret Gretton, 46, has been barred indefinitely from the profession.<n>Referred to job applicant as a member of the terror group in an Asian accent.<n>She also mocked special needs pupils by calling them 'cuckoo'<n>Disciplinary panel said she showed no remorse for 'deliberate' and'repeated' actions.

The former New England Patriots football player, 25, has pleaded not guilty to murder and firearms charges in the death of Odin Lloyd.<n>If convicted, Hernandez faces a maximum penalty of life in prison.<n>The defense argued that he saw his PCP-taking friends kill Lloyd but did not commit the murder himself.

Iain Duncan Smith criticised for 'Marie Antoinette' comments.<n>Tory Cabinet minister said zero-hours contracts should be re-named 'flexible hours'<n>Labour says the 'Marie Antoinette' moment shows Tories are 'out of touch'<n>Ed Miliband launches Labour's manifesto for young people in Lincoln.

Fox News Sunday anchor, 67, made comments on radio show on Friday.<n>Said that he should have spoken of singer's'remarkable talent', not her weight.<n>Wallace said that Clarkson could'stay off the deep dish pizza for a while'<n>Later issued apology, saying he 'admired her remarkable talent'<n>Came the same day, Clarkson spoke of criticism about her weight on Ellen.

Geelong man Trevor Vale posted a video on Tuesday while driving from Darwin to Melbourne.<n>He became frustrated at the lack of interest from Australians in paying respect to the Anzacs.<n>Mr Vale's wife fought as a soldier in Timor and Afghanistan.<n>The video has been viewed over 800,000 times.

The Vatican is training up ordinary doctors, teachers and psychologists.<n>They are being taught to cope with a rising tide of demonic possessions.<n>The Vatican has gathered a team of experts including practising exorcists.<n>The tenth edition of the annual course began this morning at Rome’s Regina Apostolorum University.

NYPD families were joined by Mayor Bill de Blasio at a time when his relationship with the police department is again coming under scrutiny.<n>Officers Rafael Ramos and Wenjian Liu were murdered on patrol in Brooklyn on December 20 by a crazed gunman.<n>The NYPD families were joined by the widow of American Sniper Chris Kyle, Taya Kyle, who pitched for the San Diego Padres.

Yaphet Kotto said James Bond role should only be portrayed by white actor.<n>He said Ian Fleming created the role for a white actor and should be so.<n>Kotto starred as Dr Kananga in the 1973 Bond installment Live And Let Die.<n>He said a black man could play 003 or 006, but could not be 007.<n>Comments come after Roger Moore said Idris Elba could not play Bond.

Max Muggeridge, 19, from Coomera in QLD caught a four metre shark.<n>He was camping at Tweed Heads just across the NSW border with his girlfriend.<n>The teen spent three hours trying to reel in the beast.<n>He said it was a once in a lifetime opportunity.

Toddler fell at Cleveland Metroparks Zoo on Saturday afternoon.<n>Witnesses claim the mother was holding him and another child.<n>The boy was rescued by his parents before paramedics arrived on the scene.<n>He suffered minor bumps and bruises and is in stable condition.<n>Zoo plans to press child endangerment charges against the mother on Monday.

The 16th edition of the festival was held in the southern California desert on Friday.<n>This year's lineup includes rapper Drake, Florence and the Machine, FKA Twigs, David Guetta, The Weeknd, Kasabian, alt-J and Toro y Moi.<n>The festival is the first big arts and music festival of the summer season.

Two strippers dressed in underwear performed at a Taiwanese man's funeral.<n>The exotic dancers showed off their moves to Maroon 5's Moves Like Jagger.<n>The deceased's wife hired the strippers as a final gift to her husband.<n>Mourners were more interested in filming the sexy dancers.

Princess Salwa Aga Khan has given birth to a son, Prince Irfan.<n>The 26-year-old model married Aga Khan's son Prince Rahim in 2013.<n>She has been known as Princess Salwa since then.<n>The couple welcomed their first child into the world last Saturday.<n>Prince Rahim said in a statement that the couple are doing well.

Whitney Fetters'sent the boy sexually suggestive texts and naked photos last year and they exchanged explicit videos and pictures'<n>She 'planned to invite him over to her house so they could have sex'<n>The boy, now 14, deleted the photos and videos when approached by principals but police were able to recover them.<n>Fetters turned herself in in February but was released on $10,000 bail.

Leeds-based Direct Line is running a competition called #EverydayFix.<n>They asked groups to design products to deal with common problems.<n>These include forgetting to lock the door and forgetting to pay for an item.<n>The winner will be made into an actual product, funded through Kickstarter.

The 22-year-old model is offering 20 girls between the ages of 13 and 18 free tuition to the Flatiron School's software engineering program.<n>Karlie attended the same two-week coding course last summer, which costs $2,000 per student.

Bec and Bridge unveiled their SS16 swimwear line on the catwalk on Monday.<n>The 120 piece ready-to-wear collection was inspired by the 1970s.<n>Animal prints and metallics feature heavily in the collection.<n>Fishnets and foil pieces were also featured on the runway.

Jessica Mejia was killed in a car crash in 2009 when her ex-boyfriend lost control and smashed into a pole.<n>Her mother Christina filed a lawsuit against the Cook County Sheriff's Office for taking photos of her daughter's body without permission.<n>She said the photos left her feeling 'violated' and that the deputies' actions caused her emotional distress.<n>But the sheriff's office said the photos were taken to gather evidence that helped convict Nicholas Sord.

More than 140 children have been removed from their classes in Washington.<n>Officials say they could not prove they had had the required vaccinations.<n>Comes after health experts warned of the danger of a measles pandemic.<n>Calls for children to be vaccinated to prevent the spread of the virus.<n>Around 100 people have been diagnosed with the virus in 15 states.

Moira Gemmill, 55, was cycling to work at St James's Palace yesterday morning.<n>She collided with a tipper lorry near Lambeth Bridge in Westminster.<n>Ms Gemmill had recently left her position as director of design at V&A.<n>She had been chosen to oversee a programme of renovations at Windsor Castle.<n>Brother Andrew described her as an 'extraordinary' woman who lived a'modest life'

Deputy Prime Minister heckled by tuition fees protesters in London.<n>Clegg was campaigning in Surbiton, south-west London, today.<n>He was met by protesters who chanted: 'Nick Clegg lied to me'<n>Clegg ignored protesters as he stuck to message that only the Lib Dems can be trusted to balance the budget without hitting the poor.

The world's last male white rhino, Sudan, is now under 24-hour guard.<n>Poachers are trying to sell his horn which can make up to £47,000 a kilo.<n>Conservationists are campaigning to save the species from extinction.

Dustin Irons, 26, was in court after being arrested for assault.<n>He appeared over video-link from jail when he became disgruntled.<n>Irons flashed a judge - despite being in handcuffs.<n>He was given an extra 30 days in jail for contempt of court.
