Shannon Hamilton was arrested on Sunday attempting to build a barricade on a bridge in Georgia where his daughter had died.<n>Cecily Hamilton, 16, and her friend Taylor Swing, 18, died on March 15 when their car plunged off the bridge in White County and into the water below.<n>Hamilton, together with friends and family members, had traveled to the bridge to errect a temporary barrier he had created to prevent cars from driving off the roadway.<n>But before he could complete the work, Hamilton was arrested by deputies.<n>His 18-year-old son, Kale, captured the moment his father was charged with interference with

Wei Guiyi, 76, guides blind husband Huang Funeng, 80, around using bamboo.<n>Huang lost his sight to degenerative eye condition 30 years ago and Guiyi became his eyes.<n>The couple married 55 years ago but were never able to have children.

The aluminium battery was created at Stanford University, California.<n>It is said to be the first high-performance aluminium battery that is 'fast-charging, long-lasting and inexpensive'<n>The technology is both greener and safer than current batteries.<n>And it can withstand more than 7,500 cycles without any loss of capacity.

Christian migrants forced to deny faith or face death at hands of ISIS.<n>Haben, 19, told MailOnline: 'If you are Christian they take you away and kill you. They cut off your head or shoot you'<n>He and his brother Samuel, 14, arrived in Sicily a week ago after dangerous journey.<n>Comes after ISIS released video of 30 Christians being beheaded and shot.

Stephanie Scott's body was found in a national park north of Griffith, NSW, on Friday afternoon.<n>A post-mortem was completed at Glebe Morgue in Sydney and a report is in the hands of the coroner.<n>The Department of Forensic Medicine has made contact with Ms Scott's family to provide specialist grief counselling.<n>The 26-year-old's father Robert said it is especially painful that Stephanie's life has been taken away when she had so much to look forward to.

Vera Baird awarded £500,000 to charity she runs alongside Northumbria's chief.<n>She is director of Victims First Northumbria and sits on its top table.<n>Chief Constable Sue Sim is also a director of the charity, records revealed.<n>Pair now face Ministry of Justice probe as critics accuse them of'soap opera'

A mansion that resembles an alien spaceship in the rain forest of Far North Queensland is on the market for $15 million.<n>The property is located within 73 acres of Daintree Rainforest and fringes over 600 metres of beachfront.<n>It was designed by Port Douglas architect Charles Wright and won The Australian Institute of Architects House of the Year for Queensland in 2014.<n>The six bedrooms are placed in pods at the end of each 'arm' of the house, with five fitted with their own balconies.<n>The house and land is the only place in the world where two World Heritage listings intersect.

Alan Turing wrote the 56-page book at Bletchley Park code-breaking headquarters.<n>It is believed to be the only extensive Turing manuscript in existence.<n>Turing is best known for cracking the Enigma code used by Germans in WWII.<n>The notebook was sold at auction in New York for $1,025,000 (£698,000)

Shelley Dufresne, 32, was arrested in September after a 16-year-old student at Destrehan High School in Louisiana started bragging about sleeping with two teachers.<n>Dufresne and 24-year-old English teacher Rachel Respess were both charged with having sex with the teen.<n>In exchange for her plea deal, Dufresne will not have to serve any jail time or register as a sex offender.

The Apple Watch is available to pre-order in nine countries.<n>The cheapest model is the 38mm Sport version for £299 in the UK.<n>In the US, the same model costs $349, but this doesn't include sales tax.<n>The most expensive Edition model costs up to £2,500 more in the UK.<n>At the lower end of the scale British buyers pay up to £63 more for the Sport.
Almost one in four said that they are in pain on a daily basis.<n>As gadgets get smaller, users lean over them more.<n>This puts the neck and shock-absorbing discs under added pressure.

BMW driver rammed shirtless man in the street after furious road rage row.<n>One man emerged from his black BMW with no shirt on before the argument.<n>He then tried to punch the driver of a white BMW through his car window.<n>Distressed onlookers tried to intervene in the clash in east London.<n>The 25-year-old driver of the white BMW was arrested on suspicion of actual bodily harm.

Maya Angelou was honored by the US Postal Service on Tuesday with a Forever stamp in her honor.<n>One of her famous quotes, 'a bird doesn't sing because he has an answer, he sings because it has a song' was featured on the stamp.<n>However, the quote was actually written by Joan Walsh Anglund in her 1967 children's book A Cup of Sun.

Singer, 19, announced as face of Batiste's 2015 'Ready For It' campaign.<n>This will be the first time the X Factor finalist has worked with a brand.<n>The campaign sees her styled her hair in a variety of styles.

Royal Caribbean's Legend of the Seas reported 135 passengers took ill before it docked Tuesday.<n>Just one day prior, the Celebrity Infinity cruise liner docked in the Southern California city with 106 sick.<n>Both ships are owned by Royal Caribbean.<n>Crews immediately got to work scrubbing down and sanitizing both ships.

Marc Carn, 29, from Plymouth, vanished during stag do in Barcelona.<n>The father-of-four failed to turn up for his flight back home on Saturday.<n>Family became concerned after he did not hear from him for two days.<n>Taxi driver dumped him'miles away' from his hotel and told him to find own way.<n>Mr Carn walked for 20 hours to try and get home and handed himself in today.<n>His family said they were 'ecstatic' he was safe and had not missed a birthday.

Peter Endean re-tweeted image with caption mocking Mediterranean refugees.<n>The Plymouth candidate said: 'Labour's new floating voters'<n>Around 1,300 people are believed to have drowned trying to reach Europe.<n>Ukip deputy chair Suzanne Evans described situation as a 'devastating tragedy'

French air traffic controllers are striking in a dispute over retirements.<n>EasyJet and BA are among major airlines expected to scrap hundreds of flights.<n>Experts fear up to half of all flights between the UK and France could be axed.

Facebook is testing the new Sidebar status feature in Taiwan and Australia.<n>From today, users of the app will see short status messages under their friends’ names, complete with an illustrative picture.<n>The sidebar can be accessed by swiping right on the screen and brings up a user’s most messaged friends.

Former Chancellor says Tories 'haven't been able to win an election for 23 years'<n>Clarke warns against offering 'blank cheques' to NHS and foreign aid budgets.<n> criticises Tory leadership for making personal attacks on Ed Miliband.

Zakiur Rehman Lakhvi was allowed to leave Adiala Prison in Rawalpindi.<n>Indian officials called his release an 'insult' to the victims of the attack.<n>LeT's charitable wing, Jamaat-ud-Dawa, confirmed Lakhvi's release.<n>It comes after nearly four months of wrangling over Lakhvi's detention.

Cell phone footage, recorded by the unnamed customer, starts with the woman repeatedly asking to speak to the manager.<n>After four separate requests to speak to a manager, the customer finally got the employee's attention.<n>The customer then asked for a refund, but the exchange quickly descended into a heated argument.<n>'Baby, you're about to get it,' the employee is heard saying. 'Just wait. You're gonna get your s***'

The $2 coin was released to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the Gallipoli landing by the Anzacs.<n>It has an image of poppies - symbolic of remembrance - among crosses similar to those that mark the graves of fallen soldiers.<n>The words 'Lest We Forget' also appear on the coin.<n>There will be about one and a half million coins released into circulation over the coming weeks.

Eloise Parry, known as Ella, 'burned up from the inside' after swallowing DNP.<n>The 21-year-old student had taken the highly-toxic substance on April 12.<n>She began feeling unwell and drove herself to the Royal Shrewsbury Hospital.<n>Doctors carried out a toxicity test and discovered she was in grave danger.<n>Her metabolism began to soar and she started to overheat.<n>Despite doctors desperately trying to stabilise her, she died three hours later.<n>Her mother Fiona, 51, has now issued a stark warning about buying diet pills online.

Court records show he was $7,500 behind on child support when he was pulled over on Saturday and had already been jailed three times for missing payments.<n>But there was no warrant out for his arrest when he was pulled over.<n>His family believed he fled over fears he would be arrested for the debt.<n>Dash cam footage shows him running from Officer Michael Sager.<n>He was shot dead by the officer minutes later.

A new survey revealed that seven per cent of American women have had allergic reactions to salon treatments.<n>The top five treatments women most favor are manicures, pedicures, hair coloring, teeth whitening, and perms.

Rachel Lehnardt, 35, 'allowed her daughter and her friends to drink alcohol and smoke marijuana in front of her at their Evans, Georgia home'<n>She 'wakes the next day and realizes she was raped by her daughter's boyfriend'<n>Her lawyer said Lehnardt, who is a life-long Mormon, turned to drink after divorcing her husband James, who returned from Iraq with PTSD.

Alan Turing's notebook contains his thoughts on the tricky 'Leibniz notation dx/dy'<n>It was written at the Bletchley Park code-breaking headquarters in 1942.<n>Thought to be the only extensive Turing manuscript known to exist.<n>Turing's notebook was among the papers he left in his will to friend Robin Gandy.<n>Gandy kept the notebook, using its blank pages for writing down dreams.<n>Turing's notebook is expected to fetch up to $1million (£690,000) at auction.

Prague Airport has to hire porters to carry passengers' luggage up 32 stairs at Nadrazi Veleslavin station.<n>The airport construction project didn't budget for an escalator between the metro station and bus terminal.<n>More than three million airport customers use the bus every year, choosing not to go by car or risk being ripped off by one of Prague’s notorious cab drivers.

Carrie Fisher, 58, who is reprising her role as Princess Leia, and Mark Hamill, 63, who is Luke Skywalker, were arm in arm on the stage in Anaheim on Thursday.<n>Not on hand was Harrison Ford, who is the franchise's Han Solo.<n>Producer Kathleen Kennedy explained the 72-year-old was'resting' after miraculously surviving a March plane crash in Los Angeles.

Maria Kukucova, 25, was arrested in April last year after death of Andy Bush.<n>Gold dealer Mr Bush, 48, was found shot to death in Costa del Sol villa.<n>The model had gone on the run but was tracked down to her family's home.<n>Her parents Lubomir Kukuca, 50, and Danka Kukucova, 51, are selling up.<n>They say they feel hated in their own village and are selling up to pay lawyers' fees.

Eight Nauru guards have been suspended after posting anti-Islamic messages on social media.<n>The men were pictured with Pauline Hanson at a Reclaim Australia rally.<n>Transfield Services, which operates the detention centre, said the employees were contravening a company policy that they display 'cultural sensitivity'<n>The guards were found to be promoting the rallies against Islamisation and the influence of'minorities' and 'radical extremism'

Drew Hollinshead, 21, stopped to help woman in Bournemouth, Dorset.<n>He pulled into disabled bay and was slapped with £70 ticket by traffic warden.<n>'I asked him why and he said it gives me no great satisfaction,' he said.

Horry County Police said the mother turned herself in on Thursday night after seeing herself on television in pictures released by the police.<n>The woman is currently in hospital and will be charged once she is released, police said.<n>The baby girl was found trapped in a tied plastic bag inside a dumpster in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina, on Thursday afternoon.<n>She is listed in stable condition in hospital and is in the custody of the social services department.

Prime Minister embarks on first walkabout of election campaign in Alnwick.<n>He was told to 'f*** off back to Eton' by a woman and 'be a good boy' by a busker.<n>Tory leader has been criticised for a dull campaign featuring a lack of ordinary voters.

Marcus and his nine-year-old sister Aaliyah were trapped in a second-floor bedroom after the fire broke out on the first floor of their home in Clinton.<n>The boy called 911 shortly before 7am after he smelled smoke and told the dispatcher the siblings were trapped in the room because it was too hot to get out.<n>He stayed calm throughout the 11-minute call and told the dispatcher that his older brother, mother and step-father were also in the home.<n>Marcus was able to stay calm throughout the call and he was rescued along with his 9-year-old sister.

Klaus-Dieter Scheurle urges aviation industry to develop system to prevent repeat of Germanwings crash last month.<n>Investigators believe Andreas Lubitz locked captain out of cockpit and deliberately crashed plane into French mountainside, killing all 150 people on board.<n>Mr Scheurle says system could be used in emergency on ground to take remote control of plane and safely land it.<n>But pilots associations are sceptical, saying idea of remote control from ground could be open to abuse.

The former California governor wrote an op-ed for The Washington Post.<n>He said the bill is a 'distracting and divisive' law that only hurts the GOP.<n>Schwarzenegger said the party must 'be an inclusive and open party, not a party of divisions'

Oskar Groening, 93, is set to go on trial charged with complicity.<n>He was 'bookkeeper' for the camp and met victims bringing them there.<n>Between May 16 and July 11, 1944 he was on duty when 450,000 Hungarian Jews were transported there, with 300,000 being gassed just after arrival.<n>Auschwitz survivors and relatives of those murdered there filed into court today for the trial of Groening.<n>They spoke of their pain, pride and duty in confronting this 'cog'

Linden Adkins was caught on camera getting out of his minivan and screaming at a motorist at Kent State University in Ohio on Wednesday.<n>The 56-year-old, who works in the College of Applied Engineering, can be heard shouting: 'What kind of moron are you?'<n>He then tries to grab the windshield wipers but is pulled to ground when the van drives off.<n>Adkins was charged with menacing, a fourth-degree misdemeanor.<n>He will appear in court April 21 and plans to plead guilty.

Darcy has visited 11 countries and 23 destinations including New York, Berlin, Stockholm, Milan and Paris.<n>She has travelled nearly 25,000 miles since 2011 - making her a real-life Phileas Dog.<n>Miss Darcy and her owner May Wong have been joined on their trips by Miss Wong’s new dog, George.

Hoda Muthana, 20, left Hoover, Alabama, to join ISIS in Raqqa, Syria.<n>She married Australian jihadist Suhan Abdul Rahman a month later.<n>Now she has called for drive-by shootings in America on Memorial Day.

Faysal Mohamed, 18, filmed a police officer threatening to break his legs.<n>The officer pulled Mohamed and his two friends over on March 18 in south Minneapolis.<n>Mohamed claims the three teens were pulled over because of their race.<n>The three were cuffed and held on the side of the road for 45 minutes.<n>Mohamed says they were searched and a background check was completed.<n>The Minneapolis Police Department has launched an investigation.

National Union of Teachers calls for 'positive portrayal' of gay relationships.<n>Says MPs have a duty to tackle 'homophobia, biphobia and transphobia’ in schools.<n>Critics accused NUT of 'thought control' and said proposals risked 'oversexualising' children at a young age.

Pupils’ excessive consumption of energy drinks is fuelling deteriorating behaviour, it has been claimed.<n>Teachers say some children drink excessive amounts of Red Bull, Monster and Relentless, causing ‘hyperactivity’ and an ‘inevitable crash’<n>Teachers are now working with drug and alcohol charity to provide pupils, parents and schools with advice on energy drinks.

Quavious Marshall, 24, Kirschnick Ball, 20, and Kiari Cephus, 23, arrested.<n>All three have been denied bond - meaning they might not fulfill tour dates.<n>Police 'found multiple guns, marijuana and another undisclosed drug'<n>Arrests took place at Georgia Southern University mid-performance on Saturday.<n>They were performing at a university-sponsored event where over 1,000 students were congregated.

Music lovers paid nearly £40 to see the rapper perform in Canterbury.<n>But they waited for more than three hours for him to arrive at 11pm last night.<n>He then spent just a few minutes on stage, playing two of his songs.<n>Audience left early and club bosses have accused him of breaking his contract.

25-ft long wreckage was discovered floating west of Ona Beach in Lincoln County.<n>Several live yellowtail jack fish, native to Japan, were found inside the boat.<n>Remains will be removed from the water and taken to a landfill.

Spending in restaurants has increased by 17 per cent in the last 12 months.<n>Emerged in a study of people's spending habits by Barclaycard.<n>It comes as official figures are expected to show Britain has entered its first period of deflation since 1960.

Michael Slager, 33, can be heard laughing nervously while talking with a senior officer following the incident in North Charleston on April 5.<n>The senior officer told Slager during the conversation to go home and relax, assuring him that he would not have to answer questions about the shooting for days.<n>Scott was shot five times in the back as he ran away from the traffic stop.

Wikipedia user 'Contribsx' edited pages linked to politicians including Grant Shapps.<n>Deleted embarrassing references to Tory figures while adding praise for Mr Shapps.<n>David Cameron has defended the Tory party chairman, saying he 'does a great job'

Tennessee Supreme Court vacated the execution dates of the last four men on the state's death row as new lethal injection methods are challenged.<n>The state tried to jump-start the process with a new one-drug lethal injection method and the reinstatement of the electric chair as a backup.<n>On Friday, the court postponed the last of the scheduled execution dates.<n>It will set new dates after the legal questions are settled.

The body of a New York woman was left dangling from a fire escape for more than an hour Sunday after she hung herself.<n>One man, who declined to give his name, said he awoke to find the woman's body hanging outside his apartment.<n>The woman's identity has not been released pending notification of her family.

Jessica Silva was convicted of manslaughter for stabbing her abusive husband to death.<n>She walked free from court last month despite being convicted of manslaughter.<n>60 Minutes conducted an interview with Silva on Sunday night.<n>She reveals she hopes her husband's family can one day forgive her.<n>She says'my head is just full, I can't live with it, I need forgiveness'

Twins were studied by the Department of Twin Research in the UK.<n>They were born in the UK and were broadly representative of the population.<n>The aim was to explore how much nature and nurture influence our party political allegiances and potential voting preferences.<n>Twins were found to vote the same way as non-identical twins.<n>This suggests there is an underlying genetic influence for political alignment.

Skeletons of a woman and a man were found in a tomb from the 5th to 6th century.<n>Experts believe the tomb was intended for a noblewoman.<n>The man is thought to have been killed so he could be buried with her.<n>No precious possessions were found with the male body, leading experts to speculate that he was a human sacrifice and possibly, her lover.
Insurgent actress Shailene Woodley cooks beetroot for lips.<n>Blake Lively uses mayonnaise on her hair before showering.<n> Lupita Nyong'o loves avocado to combat dry skin.

Joseph O'Riordan, 76, left wife Mandy, 47, with life-threatening injuries.<n>He stabbed her nine times with a kitchen knife after discovering affair.<n>Postman lover Nick Gunn, 41, had previous affairs with women on his rounds.<n>Former girlfriend said he cheated on her with woman he was delivering post to.

Rev. Sharpton preached at the Charity Missionary Baptist Church.<n>He addressed the case of Walter Scott, who was shot by police.<n> Elected officials and police from North Charleston were in attendance.<n>Senator Marlon Kimpson was also there to hear Sharpton speak.<n>He gave credit to North Charleston Mayor Keith Summey for firing Michael Slager, the officer who killed Scott.

Poll of 2,000 Britons found 68 per cent had hurt themselves doing DIY.<n>One in 30 suffered after getting paint or chemicals in their eyes.<n>Eight in 100 had fallen off a ladder, says research for Deep Heat and Deep Freeze.<n>But many admit they know where they are going wrong.

Nafir Afzal said teenagers are at risk of 'jihadimania' and warned of '7/7'<n>Former head of CPS said children are'manipulated' by Islamists.<n>He said Britain needs a new approach in the way it deals with radicalisation.

Spanish researchers say climate change impacted human migration.<n>Until 1.4 million years ago it was too cold to inhabit southeast Spain.<n>But then the climate warmed to 13C (55F) and became more humid.<n>This enabled hominins - our distant ancestors - to move to new regions.<n>The research was led by Dr Jordi Agusti from the Catalan Institution for Research and Advanced Studies.

London-based designer claims to have made the world's safest bike.<n>Called the Babel Bike it has a host of features including a roll cage.<n>The bike also has foot protectors and an electric motor.<n> Crispin Sinclair is seeking £50,000 of funding on site Indiegogo.

London Mayor will make high-profile joint appearance with PM next week.<n>Growing calls for Mr Johnson to be 'weaponised' as party seeks to break away from Labour.<n>One poll put Tories on 34%, Labour on 33%, Ukip on 17% and Lib Dems on 7%.

Obama and Castro shook hands yesterday at a brief meeting in Panama.<n>The two leaders are both attending the Summit of the Americas.<n>The White House has set expectations for a'substantive' exchange today.<n>Speculation is high that a result of the exchange could be the official removal of Cuba from the State Department's list of state terror sponsors.

Holly Barber, 25, woke up feeling unwell and had chest and neck pains.<n>She chalked it down to a bad hangover and went to bed feeling fine.<n>But when she started coughing up blood she knew something was wrong.<n>Rushed to hospital where doctors found 13 pulmonary embolisms in her lungs.<n>They were blood clots blocking the main artery of her lungs.<n>A year later medics found another melon-sized blockage in her right lung.<n>She now takes blood-thinning medication to prevent future clots.<n>But the shock of the ordeal has led her to completely change her lifestyle

Malaga is one of Europe's hippest cities, with a thriving cultural scene.<n>Pop-up version of the Pompidou Gallery has just opened in the city's harbour.<n>The city also hosts a Picasso museum and a variety of museums.

Noel Biderman, 43, came up with idea for Ashley Madison in the 1990s.<n>He now wants to raise money from British investors to fund launch of services in Russia, Ukraine and the Baltic states.<n>Ashley Madison claims to be the world's second-largest dating website.<n>Mr Biderman believes infidelity can actually save relationships.

Sandra Mathis, 52, was charged with murder in the stabbing death of her 48-year-old husband.<n>Police say Mathis repeatedly stabbed her husband in the upper torso after an argument.<n>The couple were homeless and Mathis had a drinking problem.

Yvonne Camargo, 39, of Victorville, was arrested on suspicion of willful cruelty to a child on April 3.<n>The video was filmed April 1 in a parking lot after a man identified as Edward Moneyhanz saw the woman 'pulling this kid by his hair out of the khols store'<n>Camargo can be seen wiping the young boy's face as he cries before reaching behind him and hitting him in the face.<n>Camargo is oblivious to the fact that she is being filmed until the cameraman and another woman begin asking her what she's doing.<n>She is then seen

Coachella 2015 has seen a number of suspect outfits at the California festival.<n>From the couple who wore matching American flag leotards to the man who sported a loincloth over Speedos, could this be the worst year for Coachella street style yet?

Chris Brynarsky was killed in his custom car detail shop in October 2006.<n>His friend Mark Cosentino repaired the bumper and wrote an inscription on the inside dedicated to his slain friend.<n>On Good Friday, John Brynarsky was working on a car when he took off the bumper and found the message.

Jamal Kiyemba, 36, was detained in Uganda over the murder of a prosecutor.<n>He was awarded £1million in compensation by the British government.<n>Kiyemba, who grew up in London, was held at Guantanamo Bay for four years.<n>He was one of 16 former prisoners awarded £20million in compensation.

One in six is considering going part-time and 7% are contemplating quitting.<n>Senior GPs say they are facing 'incredible' pressures brought on by ageing population.<n>National recruitment crisis and many surgeries are short-staffed.<n>GPs in England earn an average of £105,000 a year.

400 Zimbabweans including pregnant women and babies arrived in Beitbridge, Zimbabwe.<n>They were among 400 Malawians who also fled attacks that have left seven people dead in recent days.<n>Their plight emerged as South Africa's influential Zulu King Goodwill Zwelithini denied whipping up the xenophobic hatred.

Hayley Grimes found Baby Peter's body in pond in Norfolk in 1988.<n>She was accused of being his mother after the discovery in Weasenham St Peter.<n>Yesterday, it emerged his mother had been arrested 27 years later.<n>Police used DNA profiling to trace back to his family.<n>Ms Grimes, 42, said she was glad 'nobody can blame me anymore'

Historians have long believed Julius Caesar collapsed at the battle of Thapsus in 46BC and had to be carried to safety.<n>Symptoms such as vertigo, dizziness and weakness in his limbs were thought to be caused by an epileptic attack.<n>But new research suggests he may have been suffering from mini-strokes.<n>Doctors at Imperial College London took a new look at Caesar's symptoms described in Greek and Roman documents.

Baroness Hale wants bitterness taken out of most matrimonial disputes.<n>Currently couples have to cite one of five reasons for divorce.<n>They include adultery or unreasonable behaviour.<n>Lady Hale also wants couples to sort out arrangements for children and money before obtaining a divorce.

Marla McCants, from Nashville, Tennessee, was on the verge of death when she appeared on last night's season finale of My 600lb Life.<n>The 43-year-old refused to let medical professionals help her stand up.<n>After a series of hospital stays and gastric bypass surgery, the mother-of-three was discharged because of her lack of cooperation.<n>Her daughter Sierra begged her doctor to come to her apartment and convince her mom to get up.

Gang built wooden cabinet to hide one man from jeweller in Manchester.<n>He would show real cash to jeweller in briefcase and then switch it for fakes.<n>Man would then place briefcase on floor and walk off with stolen jewellery.<n> Luigi Arcuri, 73, Nikolic Giuliano, 37, and Antonino Ballistreri, 45, jailed for two years and eight months.<n>A 17-year-old boy, who cannot be named for legal reasons, given 16 months.

Police hunting Peter Fox after his mother and sister found dead.<n>Sarah Fox, 27, was found dead on Thursday night in Merseyside.<n>Her mother Bernadette, 57, was found dead on Friday morning.<n>Detectives have released CCTV images of Fox leaving Liverpool Lime Street.<n>He is believed to have travelled to London and arrived at Euston station.<n>Police say they want to speak 'urgently' with him in connection to the deaths.

The dogs were found last Saturday in the barn in Manchester, Tennessee.<n>Animal Rescue Corps described the conditions as the worst they've ever seen.<n>The property owner, Caroline Irby, 64, has been charged with 10 counts of animal cruelty.
Olivier Rousteing says he never had a reference to a mixed-ethnicity couple.<n>Kim and Kanye are 'among the most talked-about people'<n>He says they embody the idea of a modern family.

Presidential candidate spoke to Face The Nation after admitting he would attend same-sex wedding of someone he 'cared' for.<n>Last week he said he would attend even if he didn't agree with decision.<n>Rubio said he believes people are 'born with a sexual preference'<n>But he insisted same-sex marriage should not be a constitutional right.

The tunnels were dug into sandstone cliffs in Stockport in the 1930s.<n>They were originally intended to provide car parking spaces.<n>But the Second World War meant they were needed as air raid shelters.<n>The shelter was so popular that season tickets were issued limiting how many people could seek refuge there.

Jarret Stoll was arrested on Friday in Las Vegas, Nevada, on drug possession charges.<n>The Los Angeles Kings forward, 32, is the longtime boyfriend of Dancing With The Stars host Erin Andrews, 36.<n>He was arrested for possession of cocaine and MDMA, also known as Molly, at the Wet Republic pool at the MGM Grand Hotel.<n>Stoll was booked into the Clark County Detention Center and was listed as having a hearing on Saturday after posting $5,000 bail.

Kelly Parsons, 35, from London has donated 50 eggs to childless couples.<n>Mother-of-two has already enabled two couples to have twins and another woman to give birth to a boy.<n>In the space of 11 months, the 35-year-old's eggs have become twin girls, twin boys and a baby boy.<n>Kelly injected herself twice a day with drugs to stop her period and stimulate her ovaries.

The unidentified child caused the presidential residence to be closed off for a few moments on Sunday afternoon.<n>'Child was fine and was safely reunited with parents' following the incident, Secret Service spokesman Brian Leary told CNN.<n>The incident is the second lockdown in Washington only a day after a man shot and killed himself on Saturday.

French coach driver was forced to perform a U-turn on slipway in Dartmouth.<n>He was trying to board a ferry but was turned back by the ferry company.<n>The driver had to perform the manoeuvre on the seaweed-covered slipway.<n>Terrified Gallic customers clung onto their seats as he shunted forward.

Tania Rahman, 27, applied to run a stall at St George's Day in Salisbury.<n>But she was told her Indian stall Chit Chaat Chai was not 'English-themed'<n>Salisbury City Council sent her a letter saying it was 'English themed only'<n>Council has now apologised for the 'discriminatory' letter and invited her to stand.

Waheed Ahmed, 21, was arrested with eight relatives in a remote Turkish town.<n>He is the son of Labour councillor Shakil Ahmed and pictured smiling.<n>It is understood he is now returning to the UK and will fly from Dalaman.<n>Eight other members of his family will remain in Turkey until Tuesday.

Jack Jordan, 23, has battled leukaemia since 2013.<n>Laura Jordan, 24, was told he had just weeks to live on April 11.<n>The couple got engaged at Jack's hospital bedside just two months ago.<n>Laura married Jack in Torbay Hospital Chapel yesterday, April 16.<n>Jack is hoping to spend his final weeks at home with his wife and daughter.

William Ziegler was jailed in 2001 for killing Russell Allen Baker.<n>Witnesses reported seeing him and two accomplices at a party the night of the killing in Mobile, Alabama.<n>However his conviction was quashed in 2012 after a judge blasted his initial trial.<n>Key witness later recanted testimony, leading to the conviction being overturned.<n>Zimmerman, now 39, has now been freed after striking a plea deal.<n>Judge sentenced him to 15 years and 50 days in jail for aiding and abetting murder.

Marc Gasol of the Memphis Grizzlies was heading back to the locker room after the team beat the New Orleans Pelicans 110-74 on Wednesday night.<n>He stopped to chat with a young fan on the sidelines, who animatedly talked and pointed to Gasol before they exchanged a high five.<n>The young child is a devoted Grizzlies fan and popular with the players.

Candice Bergen, 68, played the title role in the hit CBS sitcom, Murphy Brown that ran for ten years starting in 1988.<n>She kept her salary a secret from her famous father, Edgar Bergen, who was best known for as ventriloquist who's sidekick was dummy Charlie McCarthy.<n>Charlie McCarthy was willed $10,000 with the proviso that the funds be managed, invested and reinvested to fund ventriloquist performances in the future.<n>When Edgar died in 1978, Candice's father left his only daughter out of his will - but not Charlie.

Niamh Geaney, 26, found her doppleganger in Karen Branigan, 29.<n>Niamh launched a social media campaign with two friends called Twin Strangers.<n>The aim was to see which of the three could find their closest lookalike.<n>Niamh found Karen in just two weeks - just an hour away.

Le Manoir aux Quat'Saisons is Raymond Blanc's Oxfordshire cooking school.<n>The 15-century manor house is set in stunning grounds in the Chilterns.<n>The Michelin-starred restaurant has two Michelin stars for the best part of 30 years.<n>Lucy Verasamy was invited to a special seven-course taster menu.

Terry Cooper, 79, was enjoying sunshine in his garden with his dog Sam.<n>Huge animal burst through a hedge with two cubs and dragged him indoors.<n>Mr Cooper, from Curry Rivel, Somerset, fears he could have been attacked.<n>National Farmers' Union has issued advice for residents on protecting their property from invading badgers.

Community Technology Alliance is giving away free Google handsets.<n>They come loaded with apps that help homeless find shelters and food.<n>The phones are also designed to help people apply for jobs and find housing.<n>The Bay Area has one of the most acute homelessness problems in the U.S.

Customer called in police after witnessing kitchen staff butchering a dog.<n>The dog was later intended to be served up as pork in the next chow mein.<n>Police found caged dogs in the kitchen and a decapitated puppy in the trash.<n>Owner Yu Yu Chou admitted killing the dog but said it was for his own use.<n>Five people have been arrested at the restaurant in Tijuana, Mexico.

Shona Banda, 37, is fighting for custody of her son after he spoke out against marijuana at his school presentation.<n>Police searched her home and found marijuana in plant, oil, joint, gel and capsule form along with paraphernalia for the drug.<n>The boy was given temporarily to his father, who is separated from Banda, but returned to state custody on Thursday.<n>Banda wrote a book about how she uses cannabis oil to treat her Crohn's disease.

Munroe Bergdorf, 27, from east London, was a boy called Ian.<n>She began her transition at the age of 19, and was offered hormones at 25.<n>Now a DJ and model, she says she hopes her story will help others.

Sponge Bobby the seal was rescued in November with breathing problems.<n>She was released off the coast of Dorset but was run over on Monday.<n>The seal suffered horrific injuries to her face and back.<n>It is feared she was struck by a boat or jet ski.

Mr Miliband will allow Scotland to set a more generous benefits system.<n>He will hand Scottish MPs the power to set a higher state pension.<n>He will unveil the radical proposals in his manifesto tomorrow.<n>But the move will lead to fears it could put the future of the Union at risk.

French customs officials found 46lbs of cocaine in a suitcase at Nice airport.<n>The drugs were discovered after a flight from the Dominican Republic.<n>A tourist had his name on the bag but didn't belong to him, officials said.<n>The bag was left on baggage carousel and was not checked in by him.<n>Officials are satisfied he had nothing to do with the drug smuggling attempt.

Marion 'Suge' Knight was chained down to a chair and wheeled into a California courtroom on Wednesday.<n>During his appearance in the Los Angeles courtroom, the Death Row Records co-founder complained to Judge Ronald Coen and said he could walk.<n>Knight, a 49-year-old diabetic with a blood clot, fell and hit his head at a previous bail hearing.<n>His lawyer, Matt Fletcher, said authorities put Knight in the chair and chained him down as part of a 'ploy' to 'humiliate' his client.

Westerners are ranked well below battle-hardened foreign jihadis.<n>They believe ultra-violence is the only way to rise up the ranks in Iraq and Syria.<n>Most common job for Western jihadis is guarding prisoners.<n>Syrian former prisoner reveals how foreign fighters are shocked by organisation.

Laura Everley, 36, experienced bloating, back pain and constipation.<n>She also frequently needed to urinate and had a hard time sleeping.<n>She put the symptoms down to irritable bowel syndrome and endometriosis.<n>But when she saw a Facebook post describing all her symptoms, she realised she had an aggressive ovarian tumour.<n>In October 2014, she underwent a hysterectomy to remove her womb and ovaries.<n>Tests revealed the cancer had already begun to spread.<n>She is now undergoing chemotherapy and doctors are confident she can beat it.

Yvonne Deegan, 77, said she was 'perfectly happy' with the care provided by Dr Rory Lyons.<n>Her husband Bernie Deegan, 70, died suddenly earlier this year following a 12-year cancer battle.<n>Police told Mrs Deegan that his death is one of four on the small island of Alderney being investigated as part of a probe into Dr Lyons.

Colleen Ann Harris, 73, was found guilty of killing her third husband Robert, 72, in 2013.<n>She was acquitted in 1985 of killing her second husband, James Batten, 46, with a shotgun.<n>Mrs Harris could get 50 years to life in prison when she is sentenced in June.

Doaa and Umm were smuggled from Raqqa to southern Turkey earlier this year.<n>The pair said they used to be heavily involved in punishing others.<n>They gave 60 lashes to those who tried to flee and 40 to those who didn't.<n>The women are now living in Turkey illegally and fear ISIS will find them.

Federal health officials say 106 passengers and six crew members aboard the Celebrity Infinity cruise ship were sickened by the gastrointestinal illness norovirus.<n>The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said in a Monday news release there were 2117 total passengers on the ship and 964 total crew members.<n>The agency said the main symptoms for those affected were diarrhea and throwing up.<n>The ship was on its journey from March 29 to April 13, federal health officials said.

Luke Watson, a police officer in Toronto, Ontario, dyed his hair hot pink in support of the annual Day of Pink event.<n>The event is held every year to raise awareness about homophobia and bullying towards LGBT people.
Kim, 34, shared her beauty essentials on Instagram.<n>Also includes a hairbrush from her own brand, Kardashian Beauty.

Gavin Thorman, 36, ran drugs empire from HMP Altcourse in Liverpool.<n>He boasted in Welsh he would make'millions' when he got out of jail.<n>Drugs worth £200,000, luxury cars, guns and even a boat were seized.<n>Thorman jailed for 12 years after being caught out talking to contacts in Welsh.

Blake Cronkhite, 5, and Jayden Secrest, 3, drowned in pond in rural area of Northern California.<n>The boys' father, Brandon Cronkhite, jumped into the water and pulled the children ashore but could not revive them.<n>The California Highway Patrol is investigating how the boys ended up in the pond and how well adults were supervising them.
Kutner travelled to the Ulusaba Game Reserve in South Africa.<n>The reserve is Sir Richard Branson's private reserve.<n>He photographed rhinos, a bush lion and a leopard on his trip.
The 54-year-old actress also defended the former senator and secretary of state's varying hairstyles over the years.

The Kentucky senator's campaign store now includes an array of unconventional SWAGs.<n>Fans can buy 'Rand on a Stick' Macbook skins, 'Rand on a Stick' blankets, 'Rand on a Stick' flip-flops and 'NSA Spy Cam Blocker'<n>Paul announced this morning that he would run for president in 2016.

Prince William has finished training as an air ambulance pilot 'earlier than expected'<n>He will now take six weeks paternity leave after the birth of his second child.<n>Prince Harry will return to the UK this weekend to present medals at the London Marathon.

Alan Rogers, 73, smashed the skull of his neighbour Fred Hatch, 76.<n>Mr Hatch's wife Enid then discovered Rogers standing over her husband.<n>Rogers then calmly called the police and told them: 'I have just killed one of my neighbours and I have hit his head with a hammer'<n>Rogers later admitted manslaughter at Cardiff Crown Court.<n>He told police he had killed Mr Hatch because he was involved in witchcraft.

Cecil Rhodes statue set to be removed from University of Cape Town.<n>The bronze sculpture was removed after weeks of protests.<n>Council heard that black students felt uncomfortable with it.<n>Critics say the 19th century imperialist helped pave the way for apartheid.<n>Government has backed the decision to move the statue.<n>But white solidarity groups are protesting over the move.

Police were called to a reported break in at a house in Hagerstown, Maryland before using a Taser on a black man who was staggering around outside.<n>Children inside the house called 911 after the man, who was not carrying identification, refused to get down.<n>Witnesses said the officers acted professionally in taking Brown down as he cursed at police and ignored their commands to get down.<n>He was pronounced dead shortly after midnight at the nearby Meritus Medical Center.<n>Police said the man appeared to be under the influence of drugs.<n>Washington County Sheriff's Office is investigating both the actions of the officers as well

The Optimal case was designed by Israel-based Amited.<n>Sensors in the case monitor the phone's temperature.<n>If it gets too hot, Optimal will cool the device using two built-in micro-fans.<n>And if it gets too cold, it can also heat the phone using resistance coils.<n>Auto mode can be disabled and users can also manually track temperature changes using an app.

Charlene Mess, 48, was arrested on Monday after her husband of 30 years, 52-year-old Douglas Mess, was found killed at their farm in Attica, New York.<n>Her son, Douglas Mess, Jr., 29, reported his father missing on Sunday.<n>It took seven hours to locate his body, which was stashed in a mound of manure at the back of the 300-acre farm.<n>Mrs Mess was charged with second-degree murder and has been arraigned.

Bridget Klecker, 42, was struck by a car in a crosswalk and died at the hospital on Friday night.<n>The car was fleeing from police after it committed the latest in a series of robberies while armed with handguns.<n>The three suspects are still at large.

Victoria Wasteney, 38, was given a written warning for misconduct.<n>She was suspended from her job as a senior occupational therapist.<n>Her Muslim colleague Enya Nawaz accused her of trying to convert her.<n>Miss Nawaz made a formal complaint and Miss Wasteney was suspended.<n>She denies she was trying to make Miss Nawaz convert to Christianity.<n>Her lawyers have now submitted a challenge to an employment tribunal.<n>They argue that the tribunal broke the law by restricting her freedom of conscience.

Luxury yacht stopped as it approached the Italian coast.<n>Police arrested three Syrian men who were at helm of the vessel.<n>Thought the crew had charged migrants $8,500 (£5,700) each for the journey.<n>Police estimate the cargo was worth around £536,000 to the organisers.

Richard Lapointe, 69, was released from prison today after spending 20 years behind bars for the rape and murder of his wife's grandmother.<n>A court ruled last month he was deprived of a fair trial for the 1987 killing.<n>He was photographed walking out of the hearing alongside his attorney and another supporter with his weakly arms raised in the air.<n>His attorney said he will stay under a 7pm to 7am curfew with a couple in East Hartford.

Tim Tebow will sign with the Philadelphia Eagles on Monday, just in time for the off-season program.<n>The agreement with Tebow, 27, stems from a framework that was put into place when he worked out with the team last month.<n>Tebow's last regular-season NFL game was in December 2012 with the New York Jets.<n>He has also played college football at Florida and last year as a college gridiron television commentator.

Bradford Brewing Company owner Matthew Halliday tweeted George Galloway.<n>He asked the Respect Party candidate if he was'still a thing'<n>Mr Galloway, who doesn't drink, responded: 'What does that mean?'<n>Owner said throngs of people have turned up at the brewery's Brewfactory bar.<n>He said the spat has even sparked inspiration for a new brew named after him.

For The Love of Cars returns for a second series on Channel 4.<n>Host Philip Glenister and car designer Ant Anstead restore classic cars.<n>New series sees the pair work on more than one vehicle per episode.

Gold and silver bars had been loaded in Murmansk onto HMS Ulster Queen.<n>The case of precious metals was to be paid for arms shipped to Russia.<n>But it slipped from the ship and fell into the muddy waters of the Clyde.<n>Incident only come to light thanks to a secret diary kept by engineer.

Education Secretary Nicky Morgan signals she would quit Cabinet if Tories enter power-sharing deal with Ukip.<n>She said Nigel Farage is 'not my cup of tea' and would question whether she was 'happy to serve' with the Ukip leader.<n>David Cameron has urged Ukip supporters to 'come home' to the Conservatives.

Dr Teresa Belton is the author of Happier People Healthier Planet.<n>She believes that there are simple things we can do to increase happiness.<n>These include inviting a lonely person out for a cup of tea and joining a choir.<n>Suggests these activities can help boost your general wellbeing.
The Nefertiti lift is the latest celebrity beauty craze.<n>It is designed to firm up the jaw line.<n>Dr Barbara Kubicka sees a host of celebrities at her Knightsbridge clinic.

The group of 40 visitors were given fake passports and travel documents.<n>They were then taken to an airport where they were given fake stamps.<n>The group were then taken to Napo Province, in the Amazon rainforest.<n>Costa Rica complained to the authorities and Ecuador issued an apology.

Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum plans to build car park for 114 cars.<n>The car park will be built next to Battersea heliport by the River Thames.<n>The car park would have two basement floors and six storeys above ground.<n>Neighbours are worried the car park will be spoilt by the number of cars.

Ben Powers played the character of Thelma's husband Keith in the show's sixth and final season between 1978-1979.<n>He passed away at his New Bedford, Massachusetts home on April 6 at the age of 64.<n>His family has not revealed the cause of his death.<n>Powers also had guest appearances on shows like Gimme a Break, Flamingo Road, The Greatest American Hero and Laverne & Shirley.

Google is offering users the option of downloading their entire search archive.<n>It also allows users to delete part, or all, of the record.<n>To download a history visit history.google.com and log in with a Google account.<n>The settings button on the top right corner can download the database.<n>The feature exports your searches to Google Drive in a ZIP archive.

Samantha Fleming, 23, went missing from her home in Anderson, Indiana, on April 5.<n>Her body was found Friday in a plastic tub in a house 180 miles away in Gary.<n>Police believe a woman posing as a social worker lured Fleming there.<n>She told her she had to attend a court hearing and that she could murder Fleming and steal her baby.<n>Fleming's three-week-old daughter, Serenity, was found safe and is now with her family.<n>Suspect's sister told police she had been asked to care for the baby.

DIY brain stimulation kits are being sold online for as little as $55 US.<n>The kits are being used to motivate children who are struggling in school.<n>Experts have voiced concerns over the equipment.<n>They say it poses a risk to children and amateurs.

Ed Miliband is paying an Argentinian company which attacked American bankers to help him become Prime Minister.<n>Argentinian company Tectonica is responsible for the websites of more than 200 Labour parliamentary candidates.<n>It is best known for its aggressive campaign against the US in a row over Argentina’s debt crisis.

Aviation expert says 'external electronic hacking' could have been to blame.<n>Matt Andersson - president of Chicago-based Indigo Aerospace - made claim in letter to Financial Times.<n>He says public should'patiently wait for a through, multi-party professional air safety investigation' before making any conclusions.<n>French investigators say co-pilot Andreas Lubitz locked himself in cockpit and deliberately crashed jet killing all 150 on board.

Amanda Casey, also of North Carolina, was married to Michael Wilkie for four years and had a daughter with him before the couple divorced.<n>He went on to marry his third wife, Shelby Wilkie.<n>Michael Wilkie was found guilty of first-degree murder in January for the 2012 killing of Shelby Wilkie and is serving a life sentence without parole.<n>Casey said she 'had thoughts' that Michael Wilkie would kill her,'mainly because he told me he would kill me'

Homaro Cantu, the owner of Chicago's Moto restaurant, was found dead Tuesday from an apparent suicide.<n>Cantu, a married father of two, was found hanging inside Crooked Fork Brewery, the new restaurant he was opening up with his business partner.<n>A month before his death, Cantu was hit with a lawsuit by an investor in Moto and failed restaurant iNG.<n>The investor accused Cantu of commingling Moto's funds to keep his other business ventures afloat.

Abdul Hadi Arwani was found dead in his car in Wembley, north west London.<n>The 48-year-old Syrian national was an outspoken critic of the Assad regime.<n>A 46-year-old has been arrested in Brent on suspicion of conspiracy to murder.<n>He is being questioned at a central London police station.

Chernae Noonan founded eyebrow shaping business The Brow Bar in 2003.<n>She has blocked BeneFit Cosmetics from using 'Brow Bar' exclusively.<n>BeneFit is owned by luxury goods company LVMH, run by Bernard Arnault.<n>Mr Arnault is the 13th richest person in the world, according to Forbes.

David and Samantha Cameron were 'falling apart' with the pressure of looking after son Ivan.<n>Ivan was born with Ohtahara Syndrome, a rare brain disorder.<n>He was left in a wheelchair, needing to be fed through a tube and suffering from cerebral palsy and severe epileptic fits.<n>He died aged six in 2009 and his parents have spoken of their grief.

Major Nidal Hasan opened fire on November 5, 2009, killing 13 men and women.<n>Authorities initially classed mass murder as 'workplace violence'<n>But it has since been acknowledged that attack was act of terrorism.<n>Victims will be honored with Purple Hearts - awarded in name of President.<n>But one victim claims he is still going without financial support.<n>Staff sergeant Shawn Manning was shot six times with two bullets still in body.<n>But Army rejected his claims that injuries were sustained in line of duty.

Michael Kimmel, 40, was arrested after police say he was found under the influence while riding a horse on US 23.<n>Kimmel dismounted and ran away, but was found on horseback again.<n>He refused a breath and blood alcohol test and was unsteady on his feet.<n>He is currently+ in the Floyd County jail on $5000 cash bond.

Jackson Byrnes developed a lump three weeks ago.<n>He visited a doctor who requested an MRI.<n>The 18-year-old was diagnosed with a stage four brain tumour.<n>He was told it was too deep and aggressive to be operated on.<n>His girlfriend Jahnae Jackson knew they needed a second opinion.<n>She hunted online for a specialist who was willing to perform Jackson's surgery.<n>The couple have raised over $80,000 from community generosity.<n>Jackson's surgery will be performed on Wednesday by renowned neurosurgeon Dr. Charlie Teo.

The move comes in response to an online petition posted on the White House website following the death of 17-year-old Leelah Alcorn.<n>The petition currently has over 120,000 signatures.<n>The transgender teen committed suicide in December and left behind writings mentioning religious therapy.

'Battle for Sevastopol' is co-production between Russia and Ukraine.<n>It is about female sharpshooter Lyudmila Pavlichenko who reportedly killed 300 Nazis.<n>Film launched last week with glitzy gala premieres in both Moscow and Kiev.<n>Director Sergei Mokritsky hopes it will 'unite people for two hours'

Evansville in Comanche County, Kansas, was once home to a post office, grocery store and even a school house.<n>But now, the ghost town is home to rancher Larry 'Dee' Scherich and his wife, Phyllis, who tend to the site's cattle.<n>They do not have to worry about unexpected visitors, nor noisy neighbors; instead, they encounter only hired workers.<n>Town was once headquarters of largest cattle ranch in Kansas's history, but has now been abandoned.

Hollywood thriller Child 44 was due to be released in Russia today.<n>It tells the story of a serial killer who targets children in the Stalin era.<n>Russia's culture ministry said the film distorted history.<n>It said it would air as the country celebrates its victory over Nazi Germany.

Dr Adam Cobb was arrested on Friday in Portsmouth, New Hampshire.<n>He was charged with receipt and distribution of child pornography.<n>If convicted he faces 20 years' jail in the US.<n>Cobb was in the US working as a research professor and director at the prestigious US Naval War College in Rhode Island.<n>He worked on the 1999-2000 East Timor crisis with Major General Cosgrove.

The Post and Courier of Charleston, South Carolina scooped the top award for its photo series entitled 'Till Death Do Us Part'<n>The paper's powerful photo series on domestic violence scooped the top award for its exploration into why South Carolina is among the deadliest states for women.<n>The Pulitzer prize for journalism is one of the most prestigious honors bestowed upon journalists and people in the arts.

Gerald Whalen visited KFC with his wife April and their two children.<n>Family meal was interrupted by sounds of what appeared to be pornographic film.<n>Sex scene featured full nudity and strong sexual content.<n>KFC has since apologized and pledged to ensure channels will no longer be able to be accessed.

Pastor George Hamilton said Scott's death was'motivated by racial discrimination' at funeral in Summerville, South Carolina.<n>Chief Apostle of W.O.R.D. Ministries also attacked officer Michael Slager, who killed Scott last week.<n>Cell phone video shows Scott being gunned down as he tried to run from Slager.<n>Hamilton said: 'It's one thing to have a loved one die... It's another to have to watch them die... and see how they died'

Plane reported missing around 30 miles east of Oban this afternoon.<n>Emergency call made when plane lost radar contact near Beinn Nan Lus.<n>Police and coastguard launched search operation in Argyll woodland.<n>At around 8pm two bodies were discovered amid wreckage of plane.<n>It is understood plane was travelling from Scotland to Tiree in the Hebrides.

Harley Renshaw was diagnosed with cancer in his kidney, neck, lungs and bones.<n>He donned a Ninja Turtle mask to help him feel stronger during radiotherapy.<n>After his story became famous, Nickelodeon sent him a box of presents.<n>He has now been given the all clear after a year-long cancer battle.

A-list couple want to install air-con in five rooms at £31.5 million home.<n>Neighbour was furious with proposals, claiming it 'will affect historic character'<n>But Kensington and Chelsea Council has approved plans subject to minor conditions.

DPP Alison Saunders abandoned the trials of nine reporters accused of paying.<n>Decision sparked ugly blame game as architects of £20m 'witch hunt' turned against each other.<n>Three Sun journalists and one former Daily Mirror reporter cleared.

Residents of Charleston, South Carolina, have said the shooting of unarmed black driver Walter Scott was preceded by previous unheeded complaints about the police.<n>Officer who shot Scott, Michael Slager, had little in his file to suggest excessive force.<n>'We've had through the years numerous similar complaints, and they all seem to be taken lightly and dismissed without any obvious investigation,' the Rev. Joseph Darby said.
Hot Dudes With Dogs has 148,000 followers on Instagram.<n>Aims to showcase men with the cutest pups they can find.<n>Started by writer Kaylin Pound who also runs Rich Dogs Of Instagram.

Hillary Clinton's family tree suggests she was brought up in a poor Welsh village.<n>Ystradyfodwg, pronounced Ust-rady-vod-ug, was home to Mrs Clinton's great grandmother.<n>She was a poor woman who defied social conventions to escape poverty.<n>Mrs Clinton's great-grandmother was born in Merthyr Tydfil in the Welsh Valleys.<n>She married a coal miner and the family moved to Scranton in Pennsylvania.

Mackenzi Sue-Rose Miller, 21, allegedly struck and killed Trinity Bachmann, 13, on February 28 in Apopka, Florida.<n>Miller's blood alcohol content levels were 0.114 and 0.110, while Florida's legal driving limit is 0.08.<n>Trinity was sitting in the road after an argument with her mother when she was killed.<n>Miller reeked of alcohol, had glassy, bloodshot eyes and had an open bottle of Mike's Hard Lemonade in the car, police said.

Julio Acevedo, 46, was convicted of manslaughter and criminally negligent homicide in the 2013 crash.<n>Nachman and Raizel Glauber, 21, were killed instantly when his BMW was T-boned by their Toyota Camry in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.<n>Acevedo did not get out of his car to help the young family and left on foot.<n>Doctors were able to deliver the couple's baby but the child died the next day.

Martin and Jessica Castillo lost their wedding ring while scuba diving in Playa del Carmen, Mexico, during their honeymoon in February 2013.<n>A Massachusetts man found the ring and returned it to the couple last year, after a year-long search.<n>Now, the couple have renewed their vows in the same town, where they had their honeymoon, in honor of the lucky reunion.

Bobby Brown spoke for the first time about daughter Bobbi Kristina.<n>He appeared close to tears as he referenced his daughter's battle.<n>The 46-year-old performed a set of his old hits for 4,000 fans.<n>It was his first public appearance since Bobbi Kristina fell into a coma.

Ronald Anderson, 48, was arrested after he kidnapped a woman, shot a Census Bureau guard and led police on a car chase.<n>He was cornered in an exchange of gunfire that left him and a police officer wounded.<n>Anderson had previously been convicted with manslaughter and was recently charged in an assault case involving his 'visibly afraid' girlfriend.<n>The guard, identified as Lawrence Buckner, died at a hospital in Cheverly, Maryland, at 7:19 p.m. Thursday - his age is not known.

Shamima Begum, Amira Abase and Kadiza Sultana believed to be in Syria.<n>They are believed to have joined al-Khansa, an all-woman militant group.<n>The group is said to be brutal and has been accused of torture.<n>Women are said to be armed and to patrol the streets with automatic weapons.

Ukip leader booed by voters at Westminster's Methodist Central Hall.<n>He said audience was'remark-worthy even by the Left-wing standards of the BBC'<n>Farage said something had gone 'wrong' with the process of selecting audience.<n>ICM, which hired pollsters, today defended process 'using random location selection techniques'

Former SNP leader said Labour leader would find it difficult to avoid a deal.<n>He said Miliband was 'foolish' to rule out a coalition after the election.<n>Comes after SNP leader Nicola Sturgeon warned Miliband he would not be forgiven if he allowed David Cameron back into Downing Street.
Holly, 34, and Davina, 47, star in Garnier Nutrisse campaign.<n>Can be seen cuddling up and larking around in new shoot.<n>Davina's hair is in perfect shade 4.3.

Little Rosannah Gundry was diagnosed with stage three neuroblastoma cancer.<n>The tumour is growing around her spine and vital organs.<n>The 19-month-old had been misdiagnosed with scoliosis.<n>Her family is searching for treatment in the United States.

Sisters Yogita, five, Anisha, three, and Harsh, 18 months, are among the world's heaviest young children.<n>They weigh 5st 5lbs (34kg), 7st 8lbs (48kg) and 2st 5lbs (15kg) respectively.<n>Father Rameshbhai Nandwana, 34, of Gurjarat, India, is planning to sell his kidney to fund life-saving treatment for his morbidly-obese children.

Mohammed Ali Malek, 27, was arrested on Sicilian soil last night.<n>He has been charged with multiple manslaughter and aiding illegal immigration.<n>Prosecutors claim he contributed to disaster by ramming boat into merchant ship.<n>Boat overturned after migrants shifted position, causing it to overturn.

ComRes survey shows Lib Dems are now equal with UKIP on 12% in polls.<n>It is the first time since 2013 that UKIP has not outpolled the Lib Dems.<n>Farage claims that support for Ukip has 'rallied' since last week's debates.<n>But poll will ease Tory jitters as Tories lead Labour on 34% to 33%.

Details of George Osborne's plans are unclear, but it is thought that minimum wage earners would be exempt from paying any income tax.<n>The minimum wage currently stands at £6.50 an hour, rising to £6.70 in October.<n>Labour's Ed Miliband pledged that he would help low earners by raising the level above £8 an hour by October 2019.
Frankie Ruttledge, 24, from Strensall, Yorkshire, weighed 18 stone 7lbs.<n>The size 28 consultant was a bridesmaid three times.<n>She dropped to a size 10/12 and is now planning her own wedding.
Sienna Miller is a yoga fan.<n>Her mother started one of the first London yoga schools in the Seventies.<n>Actress works with a personal trainer, power-walking and jogging.

Brad Allan took the image while fishing in Cape York, far north Queensland.<n>The 50-year-old describes it as 'the sunrise digger who's been watching over us for 100 years'<n>The image was taken about two weeks before the 100th anniversary of the landing on Gallipoli.

Dana Marie McKinnon, 24, charged with DUI manslaughter and vehicular homicide in May 2013 crash that killed Vihn Vo, 42.<n>Vo was the owner and CEO of Vector Planning & Services, a Virginia-based defense contractor.<n>Tests showed that McKinnon's blood-alcohol level at the time was.163 - more than twice the legal limit.

David Axelrod masterminded two presidential election victories for Obama.<n>He was hired by Labour leader amid great fanfare last year.<n>Mr Axelrod makes infrequent visits to the UK to meet Mr Miliband.<n>He also offers advice by phone and Labour confirmed it pays him in dollars.

A union plumber, a school teacher and a survivor of the 1999 Columbine High School massacre were among the 19 women and five men chosen.<n>Holmes is charged with shooting dead 12 people and wounding 70 others in the July 2012 attack at a Century movie theater in Aurora, Colorado.<n>Jurors will decide whether he was legally insane at the time.<n>They must also decide whether he should be put to death or sentenced to life in prison without parole.

Lack of iron, especially in women, is known to trigger hair loss.<n>But should you take iron pills to treat it?<n>Dr Vicky Jolliffe says there is published evidence for and against it.<n>She says she sees women with low ferritin levels who shed hair.<n>Dr Philip Kingsley says eating sufficient protein is vital to strong hair.

Northern Territory’s Chief Minister Adam Giles and Minister for Children and Families John Elferink made the threat after a recent rise in youth crime in Alice Springs.<n>Parents will also be fined $298 if their child is found on the streets during school hours.<n>The manager of Jesuit Social Services in Alice Springs, John Adams, said the government's announcement was a 'knee-jerk' reaction.

Rob MacFarlane captured photos of the raccoon on his crane in Toronto.<n>The critter, named 'Little Mac', climbed almost 700 feet up the ladder.<n>MacFarlane has seen raccoons on his crane before and has found 'evidence' of their presence in the past.

Rebecca Exton-Russell, 37, was formally a size 18.<n>But Derby-based model was secretly'repulsed' by her body.<n>Checked into military-style fitness camp and lost three stone.<n>Went down from 14 stone to just below 12 stone.

Dr Rory Lyons' surgery was raided by police and he was suspended.<n>Investigation launched after deaths of Karen and Colin Cosheril.<n>Mr Cosheril's sister said she complained to Guernsey's health service.

Abdulkadir Zeyat, 45, his 43-year-old wife Antika and their six children were all found dead.<n>The family, who included six younger siblings, were found at their home.<n>Authorities believe they died of food poisoning or exposure to poisonous gas.<n>El father had returned from work to see his family when he died.<n>El son Kemal, 19, is now receiving counselling for the devastating loss.

The study was conducted by scientists at Purdue University in Indiana.<n>They were investigating how to reduce bird to aircraft collisions.<n>They outfitted a model aircraft in blue lights to capture the attention of birds.<n>When the plane was stationary, the birds became more alert.<n>But when the lights were on, their response slowed - and they only became more alert when the lights were turned on.<n>And the birds were also more likely to get out of the way of the aircraft when the lights were pulsing, rather than being continuous.<n>The lights could be off during taxiing but on during take-off

Billy Mitchell was born with Apert syndrome, a rare genetic condition.<n>It causes malformations of the skull, face, hands and feet.<n>He has undergone more than 50 operations to have his face rebuilt.<n>The surgeries carried risks including meningitis and brain damage.<n>But now his parents say he absolutely loves his new face.

Mahendra Bavishi, who lives in Sudan, said detectives have asked to put some'sensitive' questions to his British-based son who runs the business.<n>He said the robbers almost certainly had some inside information because they appeared to know several CCTV cameras were not working.<n>Mr Bavishi described the robbery as a 'tragedy' for his family after the business had just started to make a small profit following years of losses.

Campaigners call on councils to draw up their own maps of loneliness.<n>They can be used to target areas where pensioners are most at risk.<n>Being socially isolated can lead to health problems such as dementia.

The 47-year-old man from Warwick, 150km south-west of Brisbane, has been charged with 145 child exploitation offences.<n>Police allege the man used a range of social media sites to prey on children under the age of 16.<n>He allegedly took some of his victims to hotel rooms where he allegedly raped them.<n>So far 28 victims have been identified from Queensland, NSW and Victoria, but police believe there may be others as far away as Western Australia.

The federal government has pledged to scrap the religious exemption from welfare benefits for parents who don't vaccinate their children.<n>Parents who refuse to immunise their children are set to lose up to $15,000 a year for every child.<n>The changes will come into force from January 1, 2016.<n>Parents who do vaccinate their kids are eligible for the $7,500-a-year childcare rebate, $200-a-week childcare benefit and the $726 Family Tax Benefit Part A end of year supplement.

Liana Barrientos, 38, was arrested for allegedly using an emergency exit door to evade a subway fare.<n>She was released without bail and her niece's case was dismissed.<n>Barintos is accused of running a wife-for-hire immigration scheme.<n>She is accused of marrying 10 men over the course of 11 years.<n>One of the men she wed was deported back to Pakistan in 2006 for making threatening statements against the United States.

Christine Lynn Smith, 50, was arrested Tuesday after the bodies of 10 dogs and three cats were found decomposing in her home.<n>The home had been auctioned off and a new owner was checking out the property when he found a dead dog inside the doorway.<n>Police had to air out the home due to the stench of ammonia.<n>Smith had worked at the shelter for two months in 2012, but was fired within her six-month probationary period.

A Dartmouth College judicial committee has 'derecognized' Alpha Delta after several pledges received brands on their backsides.<n>The fraternity has until next Monday to appeal the decision.<n>A sophomore pledge of Alpha Delta reportedly agreed to be branded on his backside in the fall of 2014.<n>He went to the doctor after his brand became infected.<n>The doctor found it was infected and he had to be hospitalized.<n>Alpha Delta acknowledged a small group of members voluntarily chose to get brands on their backsides.<n>But its attorney said the practice was never a condition of membership and has since stopped.

Bio security measures are being stepped up at Brisbane International Airport.<n>Planes coming from South-East Asian countries are being routinely fumigated before luggage is removed.<n>The blood suckers were discovered in the international baggage terminal on February 17, March 30 and again on March 31.<n>Authorities said if the troublesome mosquitoes hadn't been detected they could have become a serious threat to the health of those living around the airport.

Waheed Ahmed, 21, is the son of councillor Shakil Ahmed.<n>He was caught trying to cross the border into Syria with four young children.<n>Ahmed is said to be a member of extremist group Hizb ut-Tahrir.<n>The group advocates a global Muslim caliphate, similar to IS.

Art collector was in a taxi which was stuck in traffic after arriving at airport.<n>Three thieves 'appeared from nowhere' and smashed rear window of car.<n>They made off with handbag containing numerous valuable items.<n>Included a single ring worth close to £1million, as well as around 12 other pieces.<n>Victim was on her way to loan some of the jewels to National Museum of Modern Art.<n>But museum later denied knowing anything about the intended delivery.

Italian musician Andrea Furlan was captured on camera in Milton Keynes.<n>He was holding a ‘butterfly landscape’ designed instrument to his mouth.<n>The herd of cows stand and enjoy the music for some time.<n>They remain transfixed as if hypnotised by the sound of the didgeridoo.

The Minister for Communications is set to feature on the front cover of GQ Australia's May issue.<n>He is photographed in a blue suit with a pinstriped shirt and a contrasting red tie.<n>In an eight page interview, he confirmed rumours that he had planned to run for Prime Minister if Tony Abbott had been successfully toppled in February's leadership spill.<n>His appearance in the high profile magazine has sparked criticism and accusations that the minister if fishing for votes.

Ronald and Miriam Pearson met during the Second World War.<n>Mr Pearson was a sergeant in the RAF police and Mrs Pearson a driver.<n>They married in 1943 and lived in Broughton near Chester for 72 years.<n>Mrs Pearson died last month aged 95 and her husband two days later.<n>Their daughter Jenny Ledger, 68, said they were buried next to each other.

Stephanie Scott, 26, was last seen on Easter Sunday.<n>She was due to marry her partner of five years this Saturday.<n>Family and friends were flying in from around the world to be at her big day.<n>But now they face the devastating task of planning her funeral.<n>A 24-year-old cleaner has been charged with her murder.

Labour leader refused to guarantee his deputy the role if he wins.<n>Miss Harman said on Sunday she intended to take the role if Labour win.<n>Miss Harman has previously criticised Gordon Brown for not making her Deputy PM.

Nationwide Building Society is giving anyone up to 70 chance to take out loan.<n>Pensioners will only be paid off when they are 105, stoking fears of buy-to-let boom.<n>Tens of thousands of savers tempted to put money into property.<n>This surge of ‘silver landlords’ is likely to push up house prices.

A student turned to prostitution after her student loan failed to cover her rent.<n>The student says that living in London was too expensive.<n>She says that working as a prostitute enabled her to afford a place of her own.<n>The student says that it had been beneficial to her studies.

Patrick and Marianne Charles were without heating during blackout last year.<n>Couple, who had been married for 53 years, sat down with wine and barbecue.<n>Within minutes the conservatory filled with smoke and the couple were unconscious.<n>They laid dead for 16 days before their son found them in their home.<n>Coroner records conclusion of accidental death at inquest into deaths.
NFL star recorded 61-inch standing box jump.<n>Video released as part of Reebok endorsement deal.

Ukip leader protested audience was 'even by Left-wing standards of the BBC'<n>He said they were 'a remarkable audience even by the Left-wing standards'<n>Farage heckled by members of the audience at Westminster's Central Hall.<n>David Dimbleby, presenting the broadcast on BBC1, intervened to explain.

Lillian Bustle, from New Jersey, believes that 'fat' shouldn't be used as a synonym for 'ugly'<n>She says that the more people are exposed to body diversity, the more they accept and prefer different body types.

Perth Glory have been kicked out of the A-League finals for breaching the salary cap.<n>The club was fined $269,000 and relegated to seventh spot on the table.<n>Perth exceeded the cap by around $400,000 this season alone.<n>The club has filed with the Supreme Court of Western Australia seeking an injunction against FFA's verdict.<n>If that falls flat, Glory will go through the FFA's appeals process in a bid to either overturn the decision, or reduce the penalty.

Almonds have become California’s second biggest agricultural commodity after milk.<n>The nut is often used in the Bible as a symbol of fruitfulness and promise.<n>But the nut guzzles water on a monumental scale as it needs water all year round.

The hilarious manufacturing mistake was spotted during a training course.<n>Two officers have decided to continue wearing the tops with the mistake.<n>Hampshire Police Federation chairman burst out laughing at the error.<n>He said it will 'boost morale' within the force and 'could be worth some money'

The shroud went on display in Turin's cathedral for the first time in five years.<n>It is believed to have been used to wrap Jesus' body.<n>More than one million people have already made reservations to see it.

The Massachusetts Senator said she doesn't believe convicted Boston bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev should be sentenced to death.<n>'Nothing is ever going to make those who were injured whole and it's been a terrible thing but this is a step toward justice,' Warren said.<n>Tsarnaev was found guilty on all 30 charges related to the Boston Marathon explosions which killed three and injured hundreds at the finish line.<n>The penalty stage of the trial could begin as early as Monday.

Flight from Kansas City to Denver diverted due to bad weather.<n>Took just an hour and a half to get to Colorado Springs - then lingered.<n>Passengers told they could deplane - but would have to make their own way.<n>Were finally taken to their destination by bus after six hours on tarmac.

Louise Smith, 38, was eating with a man and a young girl in Carlisle.<n>She plucked the girl's hair and put it in her pork roast at the Crown and Thistle.<n>Staff investigated and found her standing over the girl and pulling hairs.<n>Smith was convicted of fraud at Carlisle Magistrates' Court this week.<n>She denied it in February but failed to attend the trial so was convicted in her absence.

Migrant workers say they are denied basic hygiene facilities while working.<n>They are also forced to use bushes near where vegetables are grown as toilets.<n>Some live in filthy shacks made of wood and plastic sheeting near fields.<n>Claim they are treated like slaves by agencies who hire them to produce salads and vegetables that end up on supermarket shelves in Britain.<n>Also say they are made to work around dangerous pesticides causing some to fall ill.

The family had left a waterfront restaurant Thursday night when their sedan ran off the road alongside a working dock at the Port of Los Angeles.<n>The boy's parents swam to the surface, but the children were stuck in vehicle.<n>They weren't breathing when rescuers brought them up.<n>The teen died at the hospital several hours later.<n>The eight-year-old boy died Friday afternoon.<n>The two children pulled from the submerged vehicle by firefighters were hospitalized in grave condition, authorities said.<n>The adults were described as being in fair condition but 'clearly emotionally distraught'

Marshall County Board wants former Rep Aaron Schock to pay for elections.<n>Schock resigned last month amid questions about extravagant spending.<n>The 33-year-old redecorated his Washington office in style of Downton Abbey.<n>Also took a private jet to watch an NFL game and took interns to a Katy Perry concert.

Tate Ricks, nine, was fishing with his grandma's boyfriend on Saturday.<n>Their boat was hit by a wake and capsized, sending them into the St Johns River.<n>The boy went under and the man with him was able to make it to shore.<n>Authorities said they are using sonar and thermal imaging in the water.<n>They also plan to continue the air search later in the day bringing in divers.

Welch warned that this increase in middle management is driving up the cost of higher education.<n>He said: 'Why should these lazy professors hang out getting fat on money while kids are going broke graduating? 'It's dumb, it's stupid, and it has to be broken'

Former Secretary of State will announce her intentions via video on Sunday.<n>Show portrayed her as aggressive and driven, saying things like; 'Citizens, you will elect me'<n>She is also seen recording the video with one of her advisers, played by Vanessa Bayer, in a bid to make her appear more approachable.<n>The scene includes a cameo from her husband Bill, played byDarrel Hammond.

Leah Rogers and Ryan Flanaghan were selling toys at car boot sale in Cornwall.<n>Pair spotted a rare Princess Diana Di Beanie Baby at another seller's stall.<n>Mr Flanaghan, 22, recognised the purple teddy as a collector's item.<n>But he was stunned to find it was one of just 100 made around the world.<n>Bear is now up for sale on eBay with a starting bid of £20,000.

The bill would also ban welfare recipients from using their debit cards to withdraw $25 per day.<n>Republican Gov.
