Sam Brownback is likely to sign the measure, despite opposition from Democrats.<n>Program is designed to help the poor by providing them with money to spend on things like tattoos, cigarettes and vacations.

Data firm also offering names of those suffering from stress and hair loss.<n>Details of dieters and those who have had plastic surgery appear on list.<n>Whistleblower passed details to the Mail because he was worried about who else might have access to it.<n>A company called Pharmacy2U passed information on NHS patients to Alchemy Direct Media.<n>A data firm called Sequester is offering to sell data on people suffering from 43 different health conditions.<n>A company called Alchemy Direct Media is offering to sell data on NHS patients.<n>A data firm called Sequester is offering to sell data on people suffering from 43 different

CN Tower in Toronto is the third tallest tower in the world at 1,815ft.<n>Cliff in Norway has a flat top that provides a setting for the ultimate selfie.<n>Visitors to the Grand Canyon in Arizona were forced to stand perilously close to its rim for centuries.

Raymond Charles Laing has spent the past three years behind bars.<n>He has been convicted 26 times for drink-driving, and a further 31 times for driving while disqualified.<n>Laing sent a letter to the parole board that said 'I am a high risk offender and danger to the community'<n>He will be forced to live at an approved address after his release.

Shannah Kennedy and Lyndall Mitchell are teaching their Masterclass Of Wellness to CEOs and executives across Australia.<n>They teach skills such as dealing with stress, being aware of trains of thought, and accumulative mindfulness.<n>The pair's workshop, aptly named the Masterclass Of Wellness: The Boardroom Retreat, is a way for executives and their staff to learn a set of skills that will help them every day.

Bodies of three women and two women were discovered in a northern suburb of Phoenix, Arizona on Thursday afternoon.<n>Police believe 50-year-old Driss Diaeddinn shot his brothers, their mother and his sister-in-law before taking his own life.<n>His wife and two children, aged three and 10 months, were able to escape and shed called 911.

Paul, a Kentucky senator, blasted TODAY host Savannah Guthrie for asking him if he's changed his views on foreign policy.<n>'Why don't we let me explain instead of talking over me, OK?' he demanded.<n>Paul launched his presidential bid Tuesday in Louisville.

Vicky Pryce, 62, has five children and two failed marriages.<n>Has written a book about life in women's prisons.<n>Says she would rather have an au pair than a husband.<n>Admits she misses her children when she returns to work.

The Italian-inspired mansion in the mountains of Vail, Colorado was built in 2008 using materials collected in Italy.<n>The 17,000-square-foot main residence has seven bedrooms, seven full bathrooms, a gym, an elevator and a home theater.<n>The entire property has eight bedrooms and eight full bathrooms over two buildings.

Taylor Alesana of Fallbrook, California took her own life on April 2 after being bullied because she was transgender.<n>The 16-year-old had a popular YouTube channel in which she discussed her struggles and the bullying she faced.<n>She is the second transgender teen who sought services at the North County LGBTQ Resource Center to die by.

An Australian couple abandoned a boy born in India in a surrogacy deal.<n>They returned to Australia with a baby girl while leaving her twin brother.<n> FOI documents show staff at the Australian High Commission in India and Government officials in Canberra were aware the couple was from New South Wales.<n>The couple travelled to India in late 2012 and sought citizenship for a baby girl.<n>They told consular staff they would be leaving her twin brother behind because they could not afford him.<n>The couple was told the boy would be left stateless if they followed through on plans to abandon him.<n>India does not recognise

13-year-old Stephanie wanted to send a message to her astronaut father.<n>She enlisted the help of car manufacturer Hyundai to make the earth drawing.<n>The message was drawn on the land in Nevada’s Delamar Dry Lake.<n>The car company used eleven sedans to draw the message.<n>The Guinness World Record has now declared it the largest tire track image ever.

Police raided the house of John Koepke, in Wittmann, Arizona.<n>Found 54 dogs and 18 cats living in disgusting, cramped conditions.<n>Footage showed the animals clambering across the furniture.<n>One of the cats was found nursing a set of three young Chihuahua puppies.<n>Koepke was banned from keeping pets in 2011 after animal hoarding case.

Louisa Steckenreuter, 35, was diagnosed with Osteosarcoma last year.<n>The rare cancer affects the bone and is usually non-life-threatening.<n>She needs to raise $100,000 to access potentially life-saving treatment.<n>The drug Keytruda costs $6000 a month, but is not subsidised on the Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme.

Cuban beauty Kathy Ferreiro, 21, is a Miami-based bikini-loving babe.<n>Her Instagram and Twitter accounts are attracting new followers.<n>The Latina is being tipped to be Cuba's answer to Kim Kardashian.<n>She says her curves are 100 per cent natural and not photoshopped.

Shah Jahah Khan and Ibrahim Anderson deny inviting support for ISIS.<n>The pair are accused of setting up a stall on Oxford Street last year.<n>They are alleged to have handed out propaganda leaflets to shoppers.<n>The court heard that the leaflets related to ISIS and asked for support.<n>Both men pleaded not guilty to the charges at Westminster Magistrates Court.

Michael Easy, 29, from Southampton, sparked a major police manhunt.<n>He went on the run after attacking a woman at a party and was found.<n>Posed in wig and glasses under the name Michelle on Facebook.<n>He was jailed for 15 months but went on the run again in December last year.<n>Is now facing four months in jail after breaching a restraining order.

Doug Hughes, 61, landed his gyro-copter on the West Lawn of the US Capitol on Wednesday afternoon.<n> Capitol authorities revealed that they had him in their sights and were prepared to open fire.<n>Hughes claims he informed the Secret Service and Capitol police of his potentially lethal stunt into the no-fly zone.<n>The stunt was designed to draw attention to campaign finance reform and government corruption.

Leo Schofield, 79, moved to Hobart to set up a Baroque music festival.<n>He decided to relocate back to New South Wales after the Tasmanian Government cut the festivals funding by 25 per cent.<n>Mr Schofield said he was offered $300,000 for the 2014 festival which was a reduction from the $400,000 the government offered in the previous year.<n>He suffered acute depression after the ordeal.

Clinton's shift in position comes just before the presentation later this month of oral arguments in several cases before the Supreme Court on the matter.<n>The shift puts Clinton's views in line with the Obama administration's Justice Department, which in January 'committed to ensuring that the benefits of marriage are available as broadly as possible'

Todd Larson, 55, said he parked his Dodge Challenger worth $30,000 in the driveway of his Taylorsville, Utah home on March 25.<n>Moments later an ice chunk crashed onto his car at 1.53am.<n>He said the FAA found an A1 aircraft that matched within two minutes of the time of the incident and when the plane was flying above his home.<n>Mr Larson said the hole in his windshield is about 12.5 inches in length and that the size of the piece of ice that went through was the size of a cinder block.

Italian astronaut Samantha Cristoforetti wore the uniform on Friday.<n>Together with Nasa astronaut Terry Virts she captured the spacecraft.<n>On board it had 4,000lbs of supplies - including a coffee machine.<n>It will remain at the ISS for a month before returning to Earth.

The eight-year-old girl who died in a horrific accident in NSW has been identified as Piper.<n>She was travelling with her mother, Chantelle Boddy, and two brothers when the accident happened.<n>The car aqua-planed and spun out of control before colliding with a ute.<n>The seven people involved in the crash were all trapped in the wreckage.<n>Two boys, aged nine and 12, were airlifted to The Children's Hospital at Westmead.<n>The younger boy remains in a critical condition while the older boy is now stable.

Nigel Jackson, 59, is accused of murdering his wife Brenda Davidson, 72.<n>Body of Mrs Davidson was found in a shallow grave outside their home in January.<n>At the time Jackson claimed she had committed suicide after cancer diagnosis.<n>But he has now written a letter from jail explaining how he believes she died.<n>In it he admits burying her in the garden but says she must have died during a burglary.

Public subsidy paid to 5.2million workers in form of tax credits and benefits.<n>Campaigners say companies making huge profits rely on taxpayer.<n>Next had the highest average subsidy of £2,087 per head.

Study focused on POMC neurons, which are a structure called the hypothalamus, that send and receive signals to regulate appetite.<n>When POMC neurons are absent, or not working properly, animals and humans grow dangerously obese.<n>Team looked at how a protein called a transcription factor, and two small stretches of DNA called enhancers, act as triggers for the Pomc gene.

The idyllic two-bedroom log cabin is nestled down a private country lane in the heart of the New Forest.<n>It is made entirely from timber imported from Norway and has 141,000 acres of forest surrounding it.<n>The cabin is worth more than twice what a similar bolthole would be worth elsewhere.
The septum ring is a popular fashion trend this summer.<n>Rihanna, Lady Gaga and Pixie Geldof have adopted the look.<n>The piercing has been used for years in different cultures.

The Labor Department reported on Thursday that the number of jobless Americans in their 20s armed with a four-year or advanced degree rose to 12.4per cent last year from 10.9per cent in 2013.<n>Despite the recent news, in a survey of employers last fall by Michigan State University, the employment center found that hiring of graduates will rise 16per cent this year.<n>The overall unemployment rate has fallen to 5.5per cent in March from 6.7per cent at the end of 2013.

Lib Dem leader wants existing phone appointments extended to include video.<n>Officials stressed patients would not be forced to use the service.<n>But they said it could be used for update appointments or progress checks.<n>Mr Clegg also wants repeat prescriptions and booking appointments online.

Solomon Bygraves, 29, was jailed for 30 months for mugging Stanley Evans.<n>The pensioner was knocked to the ground and robbed of his wallet.<n>Bygraves towered over his victim and stole £5 from him.<n>Mr Evans said he was left in pain for ten minutes and is still suffering.<n>He said Bygraves should be locked up for a 'long time' for his 'cowardly attack'

Jacob Church, 21, and Joe Tobin, 29, were at art exhibition in Cardiff.<n>They were locked in vault when its door shut behind them at 1am.<n>Pair were fed water through tubes while police kept in contact with them.<n>Emergency crews had to drill through thick concrete wall to free them.

Shayna Hubers, 24, is on trial in the October 12, 2012, shooting death of her boyfriend, 29-year-old Ryan Poston.<n>Prosecutors say she shot Poston six times inside his Highland Heights, Ohio, condominium after the attorney tried to end their relationship.<n>Hubers told police she shot Poston in the face so that he wouldn't suffer and that she gave him the 'nose job he wanted'

Patricia Jannuzzi was put on administrative leave last month and was asked to disable her Facebook page when her comments drew wide publicity.<n>She also compared a lesbian relationship to news of Egyptian men being beheaded and said that'secular materialists (are) making our country so weak we cannot fight the dictatorship of Militant Islam'<n>Monsignor Seamus Brennan, pastor of the Church of the Immaculate Conception, said in the letter that Catholic teachers should communicate the faith in 'a way that is positive and never hurtful'

Shane O'Byrne and wife Jaimie received the fine after taking baby out for first time.<n>In process of getting out of car the ticket fell on floor just underneath driver's seat.<n>Couple explained to authorities what had happened but were not let off fine.<n> exchanged a number of letters with council over next two years.<n>Row escalated from £25 fine to bailiffs knocking on door and demanding £400.

Duke of Kent, 79, injured himself while staying at Balmoral on Saturday.<n>He was admitted to Aberdeen Royal Infirmary on Monday with dislocated hip.<n>Was discharged from hospital this afternoon and walked to daughter's car.<n>Bucks Palace said he was'successfully' treated for the injury.

Jarret Stoll, 32, was arrested on Friday in Las Vegas, Nevada, on drug possession charges, according to reports.<n>Stoll, a Los Angeles Kings forward, is the longtime boyfriend of Dancing With The Stars host Erin Andrews, 36.<n>The charges include possession of Class 1, 2, 3 and 4 controlled substances, including cocaine and ecstasy.<n>Stoll was booked into the Clark County Detention Center and was listed as having a hearing on Saturday after posting $5,000 bail.

Loretta Reinholdt, 54, and Andy Wasinger, 46, were on their second day into a trip from Belize to the Honduran island of Roatan.<n>Four men with guns and knives boarded the sailboat and took all of their money after waving down the sailboat by asking for gas.<n>They also took gasoline, the radio and drinking water from the boat.<n>The pirates pushed the sailboat to the shoreline of a remote beach in Jeanette Kawas National Park, cut the main sail and tore out the engine wire.<n>The couple and captain made SOS messages with branches along a park trail, which was discovered by

Hanghang, 12, was using old phone as an alarm when it exploded.<n>He said: 'The phone felt hot then it suddenly exploded'<n>He had 4cm injury to his face which exposed part of his jawbone.<n>Also had trauma to his left hand as well as lower legs and knees.

Police in Surrey have released CCTV images of two raiders who stripped off.<n>The men were caught on camera attempting to rob an Esso petrol station.<n>The men were seen in the footage stripping off during the hottest day of the year.<n>The men were among three who burst into the station in Caterham last Wednesday.<n>They forced their way into the manager's office and ransacked the room.<n>A member of staff disturbed the men and they fled with a mobile phone.<n>A third man, in his 20s, has been arrested and released on police bail.

Leon Yeaman, 55, was allegedly killed by a single punch in the head from 28-year-old shift worker Phillip Pama.<n>The Samoan man was ordered to surrender his passport, aherre to a curfew from 6pm to 2am and will have to report to the local police station twice a week.<n>The case is due to return to court on May 18.

Bergen-Belsen was the final resting place of 50,000 Jews, Gypsies, homosexuals, Nazi opponents and the disabled.<n>It was liberated by British and Canadian troops in 1945 and burned to the ground by a crowd of people.<n>The camp was adorned with the German Reichskriegs flag and a portrait of Hitler, which was later removed.<n>The images were taken by Reverend Charles Martin King Parsons, who was one of a handful of British Army chaplains who made it inside.

Lisa McElroy, 50, a law professor at Drexel University in Philadelphia, appeared on the game show in 2010.<n>She got tripped up on the $12,500 level and walked away with $5,000.<n>She's now being investigated after allegedly sending students a link to a pornographic website.

A monster crocodile has been caught devouring a one metre long lizard.<n>The reptile was caught at the Mary River near Pine Creek in NT.<n>The three-metre reptile was spotted by fishing guide Carol Gleeson.<n>It was the 58th crocodile removed from Top End waters this year.

A car crashed through a fence and into the front bedroom of a Breakwater house on Sunday night.<n>A man who was inside the house at the time allegedly attacked the driver.<n>The four-month-old girl was airlifted to the Royal Children's Hospital in Melbourne where she remains in an induced coma with life-threatening head injuries.<n>A man and a woman in their 20s, who were in the bedroom at the time of the crash, are in Geelong Hospital with minor injuries.

Bishop Robert Finn pleaded guilty to failing to report suspected abuse.<n>He was sentenced to two years' probation in 2012 after failing to report the Reverand Shawn Ratigan.<n>Ratigan was eventually sentenced to 50 years in prison after pleading guilty to child pornography charges.<n>Finn, who leads the Diocese of Kansas City-St. Joseph in Missouri, got into trouble after he waited six months before notifying police.<n>Children's rights advocates are urging Pope Francis to do much more to deal with clergy who become embroiled in child sex scandals.

Cledford Hall in Cheshire is being knocked down to make way for gipsy camp.<n>Villagers say travellers could 'intimidate' nearby pensioners and ruin area.<n>£3.2million project has been approved by Cheshire East Council despite protests.<n>Plans include conversion of Grade-II listed barn into 'washing and toilet' facilities.<n>Also include office accommodation for a resident warden at the expense of taxpayers.

Brothers Marc and Shanon Parker have built a fleet of movie-inspired vehicles.<n>They include Batman's Tumbler and the Ghostbusters' Cadillac.<n>The car-crazy brothers from Port Canaveral, Florida, started building versions four years ago.

Emanuel, 55, defeated Cook County Commissioner Jesus 'Chuy' Garcia, 44 per cent to 44 per cent.<n>The mayor's victory was the first mayoral runoff since the city changed the way it conducts elections about 20 years ago.

Rachel Sandridge, 29, from Maryland, was due to undergo the surgery.<n>Had to lose weight to qualify and then underwent a routine endoscopy.<n>During the procedure her doctor was concerned at signs of inflammation.<n>Took a biopsy to sample and Sandridge was then told cancer had been found.<n>Two years earlier her father had died from cancer.<n>She is now cancer-free and has dropped her weight from about 430lbs to about 288lbs, including about 50lbs before her gastric bypass.

The family arrived at the Saint James Cathedral in Jerusalem's Old City.<n>Archbishop Aris Shirvanian, an Armenian church official, confirmed the baptism.<n>Afterwards, the family dined with Jerusalem mayor Nir Barkat at Mona Restaurant.

Cumnock, in NSW, was the first town to implement the Rentafarmhouse initiative.<n>Christine Weston set up the scheme in 2008 to bring life to the dwindling town.<n>She says some farmhouses are being offered at low rent because they need renovating.<n>Others need a caretaker to look after the farm and others need children to save the school bus run.

Aimee West, 24, is said to be in a relationship with Major Paul Draper.<n>The pair have formed a close bond since Fusilier Rigby's death two years ago.<n>Major Draper was a mourner at Miss West's fiance's funeral.<n>His ex-wife Jane said they were not surprised by his new relationship.

Five firefighters and one's girlfriend were arrested on sexual assault charges.<n>Chief Gavin Satterfield and Assistant Fire Chief Billy Getzendaner suspended after allegedly telling victim to stay quiet.<n>The victim came forward in March to report the alleged attack.<n>In recording, men can be heard 'yelling and laughing with excitement'<n>The group first tries to sexually assault him and then decides upon sausage.

Fredric Brandt, a cosmetologist, killed himself on Easter Sunday.<n>Friends claim he was offended by character on The Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt.<n>In it, Martin Short plays a caricatured white-haired cosmetologist.<n> Brandt identified the resemblance - but most claim he jovially pointed it out and laughed.<n>However, another friend, hair colorist Kyle White, said his reaction was a front.<n>'He never thought it was fun,' he said. 'He was about putting on a happy face in public'

Pretty Agnese Klavina, 30, vanished after leaving a nightclub in Marbella.<n>Older sister Gunta has made an emotional video appeal for information.<n>She described her sister as'very beautiful' and spoke of her despair.<n>Comes after Westley Capper and Craig Porter were summoned to court.<n>Pair are being investigated on suspicion of Agnese's illegal detention.

Keurig Green Mountain's single-serve capsules in 2014 hit over $3 billion in US sales.<n>The finding was unveiled in a CBS News report by Susan Spencer on one such company that manufactures them, the Vermont-based Keurig Green Mountain.<n>Keurig's chief technology officer Kevin Sullivan has said that single-serve coffee has 'found the hidden need - the need that people didn't know they had'<n> 1/3 of homes in the US now feature single-serve coffee machines.

David Cameron will warn English voters the SNP's new powers could impact their lives.<n>Prime Minister will say the decision by Holyrood could have a 'big impact'<n>He will call the idea the 'Carlisle Principle' to reflect the sort of border communities in the rest of the UK that could be particularly badly affected.

Piper Kulk, 8, and brother William, 9, died in a head-on crash on Saturday.<n>They had spent the day at the Royal Easter Show in Sydney.<n>Their grandmother, Helen Boddy, 54, was driving when she aqua-planed and swerved into the path of an oncoming ute.<n>Her other two children, Daniel, 12, and mother Chantelle, 31, are in hospital.<n>A Gofundme page has been set up to help the family.

A man stormed the runway at Ellery's Mercedes-Benz Fashion Week Australia show at Carriageworks in Sydney on Sunday night.<n>The man, understood to be a neighbour of the venue, walked onto the runway while designer Kym Ellery was taking her bow.<n>He was overheard to tell security that the music was a 'disgrace' and that show organisers had 'no respect for the local community'<n>Ellery ran out of the venue 'livin' at the end, aside from that it all went perfectly, says a guest at the show.

Andrew O'Clee, 36, jailed for eight months after being caught cheating on first wife.<n>Michelle O'Clee discovered he had married second wife Philippa Campbell.<n>Profile on Plenty of Fish matching O'Clee's description found online.<n>It describes a 'adventurer' who is 'looking for a relationship' and is 6ft 3in.

With just 23 days to go, the 2015 general election looks to be picking up a nickname of its own - the'selfie election'<n>Conservative MPs were told at the start of campaign to pose for'selfies' as often as possible.<n>David Cameron has been seen donning cheesy grins on numerous occasions, as he poses beside voters during his country-wide visits.<n>Ed Miliband, Nick Clegg and Nigel Farage have also been getting in on the action at every opportunity.

A Game Of Thrones fan had a toilet built for him that was a replica of the Iron Throne that features in the hit TV show.<n>The loo was made using plywood by a team of top Hollywood prop makers.<n>It was presented to self-confessed Game Of Thrones geek John Giovanazzi and installed in the toilet of the bar he runs in Glendale, California.
Princess Diana's will among 41 million available to order online.<n>Winston Churchill and George Orwell's wills also available to view.<n>Qarid Ahmed runs secure Iron Mountain facility in Birmingham.

Historic road in Bristol is being ripped up to make way for cyclists.<n>The area dates back to the 19th century when Bristol Floating Harbour was built.<n>Council says it received 'overwhelming support' from cyclists, pedestrians and wheelchair users for the scheme.<n>But Grade II listed area has been slammed for appearance of the area.

Post Office failed to properly investigate why money went missing from branches.<n>Many were sacked, stripped of savings and even jailed after shortfalls were recorded.<n>Review said some criminal cases were'motivated primarily' by desire to recover money.

Ella Dawson, a recent graduate of Wesleyan University who resides in New York City, was diagnosed with herpes two years ago.<n>She says she's been dropping the 'herpes bomb' about six months after she had her first outbreak.<n>Dawson said that even though herpes is often the bud of the joke in popular culture, it's a real issue affecting at least one in six Americans.

A 32-year-old man from central Queensland has been charged with torture.<n>The man was arrested after another man went to hospital with injuries.<n>The 29-year-old victim was admitted to Bundaberg Hospital on Saturday.<n>He had fractures, head injuries and burns to 15 per cent of his body.<n>The victim claimed to be suffering from amnesia.<n>Police launched their own investigation and charged the other man.

Zeke Celello burst into tears when Hillary Clinton announced she was running.<n>He told his mother that 2016 is the year he will ascend to the presidency.<n>But Constitution prohibits anyone over 35 from holding office until 35.

Erica Kinsman filed the lawsuit two weeks before the April 30 NFL draft.<n>It seeks damages from the former Seminoles quarterback.<n>Winston has denied the allegations and prosecutors declined to file charges against him in late 2013.<n>He also was cleared by the university following a two-day student conduct hearing last year.

Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said 'nothing has happened yet' and that he 'neither supports nor opposes' the interim deal.<n>He warned that the US may be trying to restrict Iran in the details of the agreement.<n>The White House said Wednesday that Iran will be allowed to keep some sanctions in place for six months in exchange for curbs on its nuclear program.<n>Khamenei said that the sanctions should be lifted immediately, and that Iran will continue to insist on a complete withdrawal.

Ashley Mote, 79, of Binsted, Hampshire, denies 11 fraud-related offences.<n>Some of the money allegedly made went towards funding legal costs.<n>He was prosecuted in UK for benefit fraud offences, Southwark Crown Court heard.<n>He is also accused of falsely claiming £5,000 a month for work done by Estonia-based company Icos.

Teachers tend to see black pupils as more likely to cause trouble in the future if they have misbehaved in the past, according to new research.<n>Teachers were more likely to judge black students more harshly than white pupils.<n>Researchers at Stanford University say this may explain why black children are often disciplined more at schools.

Third graders in Orange, New Jersey, and high school students in the Philadelphia Student Union have sent letters to Abu-Jamal.<n>The letters were written and then delivered by Johanna Fernandez, a professor of history at Baruch College.<n>Abu-Jamal, 60, was hospitalized last week after collapsing in the bathroom of the State Correctional Institution at Mahanoy.<n>Untreated diabetes is said to be the reason for his hospitalization.<n>The letters have caused outrage among political commentators who claim his illness is a fraud and clamor for attention.

Joy Webb, 17, took her 80-year-old grandfather James Drain as her date to prom this past Saturday.<n>Webb asked her principal for permission to bring her grandfather since he never got to attend his own prom.<n> Drain enlisted in the Navy in 1951 at the age of 17 and would have been serving in the Korean War when his own prom happened.

Groups such as California-based Wings of Rescue or South Carolina-based Pilots N Paws recruit pilots to volunteer their planes, fuel and time.<n>The two non-profits say their concept has been a roaring success with the numbers increasing year-on-year.<n>It's estimated that more than 4 million U.S. pets are euthanized every year.

Dominique Granier said the 'unbearable' smell was a health risk.<n>Said it was caused by Roma using the bus service in Montpellier, France.<n>Bus company TAM has now outsourced part of the route, it is claimed.

Loren Mathieson filmed her pet Boston Terrier, Gizmo, performing the gravity-defying stunt one day at home after he tried on a set of new booties.<n>He can be heard taking a few steps forwards before planting down his front feet and launching his back legs vertically in the air.<n>When he reaches laughing Mathieson on the floor, he eventually steps back down to four paws.

Girl, around six or seven, is filmed firing machine gun at ISIS fighters.<n>Tells man behind camera she has killed 400 of the Islamic extremists.<n>He encourages her to kill more, saying: 'Kill, kill' in Kurdish.<n>But it is unclear exactly what she is shooting at in minute-long video.

Eric Lee Gates and his adult daughter, Chalena Mae Moody, had asked the appeals court to overturn a decision for the baby to be put in foster care.<n>The baby boy was taken away just four days after he was born in Oregon.<n>In March, Moody, 25, was sentenced to 10 days in jail on the incest charge, but got credit for time already served and did not have to serve any additional days behind bars.<n>Gates, 49, is currently serving a six-month jail sentence for violating his probation by moving back in with Moody after he was originally convicted of incest in

A 160kg man who fell down a stormwater drain was rescued by 15 firefighters.<n>It took an hour to get him out of the hole in Meadowbank, west Sydney.<n>The man was taken to hospital with shoulder and leg injuries.

The pups came from as far away as New Jersey and Tennessee in hopes of landing a new nickname: 'Beautiful Bulldog'<n>They were all defeated by a native who likes eating snow and watching turtles.<n>Tank, a 2-year-old dog from Des Moines named Tank won the 36th annual Beautiful Bulldog contest Sunday at Drake University.

Queen Margrethe of Denmark was celebrating her 75th birthday today.<n>She was joined by her son Crown Prince Frederik and his family.<n>The royals were joined by her daughter Princess Mary and her children.<n>Prince Henrik, the monarch's husband, was absent due to illness.

Ukip leader Nigel Farage said audience was prejudiced 'even by the BBC'<n>When he said they were, the audience booed him further.<n>Figures suggest supporters of the Tories and Ukip were under-represented.

Michael Shepard, 35, served 15 years in prison for molesting two boys, age six and nine, at a roller rink in 1998.<n>He was released in June 2013 and told parents he was in prison for a 'Romeo and Juliet romance' with a preacher's daughter.<n>Authorities say he did everything he could to win the confidence of the parents at Cedar Hollow apartments in Pinellas Park so that he could prey on their children.<n>He allegedly tempted them with video games, candy and trips to McDonald's.<n>He also drove young children to his 'hideout' in the woods where he

Locals from the island of Kudahuvadhoo in the Maldives reported witnessing 'a low-flying jumbo jet' on the morning of March 8 last year.<n>The reports come as acoustic scientists from Curtin University refuse to rule out the possibility that 'distinctive' data recorded from the area at the assumed time of the crash may have come from the impact of the aircraft as it hit the Indian Ocean.<n>Locals from the island believe they identified red and blue markings, similar to those of the missing plane, on a large passenger jet.

Kat Lee's desperate plea on Facebook has gone viral as she appealed for witnesses to come forward.<n>She said a group of five, including four teenagers and an adult, attacked her son over money owed for a hot dog.<n>Her son, Jaidyn, had surgery for his broken jaw in two places and fractured cheekbone.<n>Police are investigating the incident at Alberton train station, north-western Adelaide, on Saturday night.

More than 1.4 million people waited longer than target time in the past year.<n>It is the worst on record since figures were first recorded in 2004.<n>It is now 89 weeks since hospital A&Es met their waiting targets.

Shaun Ingram, 50, booked his Ford Focus ST in for major service and MOT.<n>When he went to collect his car, he was shocked to discover mechanic had taken it for a spin.<n>Footage captured by dashcam showed him driving car at 57mph in 30mph zone.<n>Mr Ingram, from Saltash in Cornwall, says it shows it was pre-planned.<n>He said: 'The mechanic was abusing my car and my trust'

Julie Creffield, 37, from Stratford in East London, completed marathon in 2012.<n>Now through her website, The Fat Girl's Guide To Running, she's encouraging other women to take up the sport regardless of their size and ability.<n>She appeared on today's This Morning with sub-three hour marathoner Nell McAndrew to launch the ITV show's Run For Your Life campaign.

Yingying Dou, 30, reportedly ran the MyMaster website which charged up to $1000 per assignment.<n> Fairfax Media revealed that dozens of students across NSW universities had used the site.<n>The University of Sydney was provided with evidence that its students had ordered 40 assignments from the MyMaster website.<n>But internal emails show just five students have been found guilty of cheating.<n>A University of Sydney spokeswoman said'substantially more than the reported five students' are currently under investigation.

Charity Bite-Back says one in five Chinese restaurants are exploiting loophole.<n> loophole allows people to bring 20kg of shark fin into the UK for personal consumption if it is for the soup.<n>Royal China Club in central London was raided by trading standards officers after boasting of selling the soup and another dish made from ground shark teeth.<n>Charity says restaurants are either disguising the soup as 'fish fin soup' or are offering it to Mandarin speaking customers if they ask.
Emily Thornberry has come out against right to buy policy.<n>But she bought a housing association property worth almost £1million.<n>She has retweeted an article attacking the policy.

Peter Mutty was caught with alcohol in his car while driving home in Saudi Arabia.<n>He was sentenced to six months jail and 75 lashes.<n>Mitty received 28 of the 75 lashes he was sentenced to have.<n>He has been banned from travelling out of Saudi Arabia.<n>Mitty says he received little assistance from the Australian embassy.

Emmanuel Sithole was attacked by three men in Alexandra township near Johannesburg.<n>One man beat him with a wrench and another stabbed him repeatedly.<n>A third attacker then entered the fray, running over and kicking him.<n>Mr Sithole managed to stumble along the road pleading for help.<n>But he was left bleeding to death in a gutter because medical centre was closed.

Labour leader Harold Wilson feared voters would stay at home to watch Steptoe and Son.<n>He approached BBC Director General Sir Hugh Greene to express his concerns.<n>Mr Wilson thought the planned repeat would cost him 20 seats.<n>The BBC is releasing archive footage of Sir Hugh and Mr Wilson.

Dale and Debra Krein of Rogue River, Oregon, filed a suit in 2012 against their neighbors and their giant Tibetan mastiffs.<n>Jury ruled in their favor, ordering defendants John Updegraff and Karen Szewc to have the dogs debarked within 60 days.<n>The Kreins' property is less than 300 meters from Updegraff and Szewc, who claim to keep livestock on their sprawling land.

Jeff Richmond, who is an executive producer on Tina Fey's Netflix show Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt, spoke exclusively to Daily Mail Online.<n>He described the death of Dr Fredric Brandt, 65, on Sunday as'very sad'<n>A friend said Brandt was 'definitely hurt' by the portrayal of himself in the show, which had a high-pitched laugh impediment and absurd habits.<n>But the friend added that it did not cause Brandt's suicide.

Izzat Ibrahim al-Douri was a former right-hand man of Saddam Hussein.<n>He was the leader of the Naqshbandi Order, an important ISIS faction.<n>He was killed in a skirmish with government troops in Salahuddin province.<n>Pictures of his dead body show teeth missing and unkempt beard.

Tokyo researchers have proposed a laser system to attach to the ISS.<n>It would be used to shoot down pieces of debris in Earth orbit.<n>The system would have a range of 62 miles (100km) and could target things less than 0.4 inches (1cm) in size.<n>The impact of the laser beam on debris would create a force that reduced its velocity, causing it to fall into Earth’s atmosphere and burn up.<n>The group plans to deploy a small proof-of-concept experiment on the ISS, with a small, eight-inch (20-centimetre) version of the EUSO telescope

A third of people aged 16-34 have deleted their Facebook accounts.<n>Increasing numbers of older users turn to the social network.<n>Facebook has even started running television adverts to entice the so-called ‘silver surfers’ to join.

Company has been hit by new rules on payday lending and a series of scandals.<n>Wonga wrote off the debts of 300,000 customers and paid out compensation to fake legal letters sent to customers.<n>Chairman Andy Haste says the firm may change its name to repair reputation.

Green support falls to 15% from 28% in February, according to a new poll.<n>Since September, the proportion of students who dislike Natalie Bennett has doubled to 24%, according to YouthSight.<n>Greens have been overtaken by the Conservatives who are on 25%.<n>Labour is the main beneficiary, with 35% saying they will vote for Ed Miliband.

Richie Benaud has passed away after a battle with skin cancer.<n>The former leg spinner turned cricket commentating into an art form.<n>He earned the title of 'the Voice of Cricket' and his signature one liners dropped to a simple word: 'Marvellous...'<n>Benaud was modest about captaincy, saying: 'The hallmark of a great captain is the ability to win the toss, at the right time'

Bobby Brown told an audience at a concert in Dallas on Saturday that his daughter Bobbi Kristina is 'awake'<n>The singer didn't elaborate on if her consciousness had regained or if he was talking instead about her spirit.<n>But Whitney Houston's family insists the 22-year-old is not awake and is the same condition she was when she entered the facility.<n>Bobbi Kristina's aunt Pat Houston and grandmother Cissy Houston both believe that the time has come to take her off life support.
PM will say Labour and SNP are'really on the same side'<n>Want'more borrowing, more debt and more taxes', he will say today.<n>Analysis will show SNP has trooped through lobbies with MPs.

Italian Alex Bellini will live atop an iceberg in Greenland starting next year.<n>He will live inside a contained ball, with no means to escape for 12 months.<n>The capsule will be 10ft (three metres) wide and could fit 10 people.<n>But Mr Bellini will remove all of the seats apart from one, for himself.<n>Aim of the stunt is to highlight how global warming will melt icebergs.

Plane's left main landing gear came off due to heat damage to chrome plating.<n>Plane skidded along the runway for 380ft before coming to a stop.<n>Plane's captain and co-pilot escaped injury in the incident.

Joel Burger, 24, proposed to Ashley King, 23, in New Berlin, Illinois.<n>The pair have known each other since kindergarten but are still teased.<n>They plan to serve drinks in personalized Burger King cups.

Second election 'extremely likely', Professor Paul Whiteley of Essex University said.<n>Other experts also warned that a'messy and unstable' left-wing alliance was likely to be in power even if the Conservatives won more seats.<n>The disastrous Lib-Lib pact of the 1970s ended with Labour Prime Minister James Callaghan losing a vote of no confidence.
Change4Life promoting dishes with up to 29g of sugar per serving.<n> Apricot Bread Pudding has slightly more sugar than Snickers bar.<n>Cardiologist Dr Aseem Malhotra said advice was 'disturbing'

Viewers searched Google for 'Why is David Cameron not at the debate?'<n>Analysis of search terms reveals viewers wanted to know why he was a no-show.<n>The 90-minute TV debate saw five opposition party leaders go head-to-head.

Charlie Linville, 29, from Boise, Idaho, is using a specially designed metal foot outfitted with a climbing boot and another one with crampons in his quest to conquer the 8,850-meter (29,035-foot) summit next month.<n>He was an explosives expert serving in Afghanistan in 2011, when he went to investigate an explosion that wounded his colleague.<n>He was hit by another explosive device and seriously wounded, and two years later, had his right leg amputated below the knee.<n>His quest last year was thwarted following the deaths of 16 Sherpa guides in April, the beginning of the climbing season, when an avalanche

Jannik Andersen, 23, was struck and killed by a freight train on Saturday.<n>Incident occurred just a few miles from Coachella's California site.<n>It remains unclear why student was on train tracks instead of at festival.<n>On Monday, friends paid tribute to 'genuine' and 'happy' man.

Waheed Ahmed, 21, is the son of Labour councillor Shakil Ahmed.<n>He was arrested on suspicion of terrorism offences after trying to sneak into Syria with eight relatives.<n>Four of his relatives have now been released without charge.<n>A fifth man, 30, was arrested in Rochdale but later released.

First robot to be sent into the radioactive reactor of Fukushima has stalled.<n>Images offer the first glimpse into the melted reactors after 2011 disaster.<n>The robot was supposed to function for 10 hours at levels of radiation.<n>But it stalled before it could complete its operation and had to be abandoned.<n>A second robot mission scheduled for Monday was postponed.
The limited edition copies of Kim's book sold out in less than one minute.<n>Kim's 352-page collection of selfies will be released in May.

Kendall and Baylee Martin were born three months ago with very different skin tones.<n>Their father is half-Jamaican, while their mother is white.<n>Twins were non-identical, meaning they inherited different genes from parents.<n>Their mother says that it is hard to believe they are related.

Me-Bai was sold to provide rides for tourists in Thailand when she was three-and-a-half years old.<n>She didn't see her mother, Mae Yui, for three years and left the tourism trade.<n>The pair were reunited after a 62-mile (100km) trek through the jungle.

The new restrictions, regarding Kansas applicants, have inspired national criticism and mockery from The Daily Show.<n>Jon Stewart suggested that in accepting federal funds, Kansas should be forced to give up items like roads 'paved with luxurious asphalt'<n>At least 23 states have their own restrictions on how cards can be used, mostly for alcohol, tobacco, gambling and adult-oriented businesses.<n>Massachusetts prohibits spending on jewelry, bail bonds, or 'vacation services'

Danielle Davies, 21, gave birth to Harley at nearly 12lb following an eight hour labour.<n>She insisted on a natural birth - not realising she was about to deliver a massive baby.<n>Midwives were so surprised they had to weigh him twice.<n>Baby Harley from Morecambe, Lancs, weighs 11lb 5oz.

Police charged 34-year-old Paul Johnson-Yarosevich of Acton, Maine, on Monday with prohibited use of computer.<n>The investigation started in December after the father of a pre-teen girl told police about the contact.<n>Police said they determined the girl thought she had been communicating via social media with another female student around her age.<n>Authorities soon learned that the girl was sending the photos to a grown man.

Carlos Boente, 33, was serving time at HMP Birmingham for similar offences.<n>He contacted woman, 19, after getting her number from a cellmate.<n>Initially asked her to change his Facebook password as a favour.<n>Then bombarded her with thousands of texts and calls.<n>Told her he had no family and nobody visited him in prison.<n>Then sent her abusive calls telling her she was going to die.<n>Sent three men to her aunt and uncle's home before boasting on Facebook the gang were his'soldiers'
Michelle, 27, unveils summer range for Lipsy.<n>Full of lace dresses and playsuits.<n>Currently working on new TV projects.

Oratilwe Hlongwane, from Johannesburg, South Africa, has become a worldwide phenomenon thanks to his DJ skills.<n>The two-year-old, who still wears nappies, plays bass-heavy house music on DJ decks after learning how to use an iPad.<n>His capabilities have earned him special appearances and sponsorship deals with fans desperate to hear him.

Caron Wyn Jones underwent a hip operation at a private clinic in Bridgend.<n>He paid because the Welsh NHS could not perform the operation soon enough.<n>Mr Jones snr., 76, said his son, Welsh First Minister Carwyn Jones, opposed his decision.

Lord Prescott said Prince Charles has 'an awful lot to offer this country'<n>He said he cannot see a problem with the future King writing to ministers.<n>The intervention comes after the Supreme Court backed a ruling.<n>It paved the way for the publication of Prince Charles's 'black spider' memos.<n>The letters were penned between September 2004 and March 2005.

Reports of child sex abuse have soared by more than 60 per cent since 2011.<n>Figures reveal 9,000 reports were filed in 2014, up from 4,600 in 2011.<n>South Yorkshire saw the largest increase with a 577 per cent rise.<n>But number of arrests have fallen by nine per cent prompting accusations of a 'national scandal'

Angelina Santini from San Diego, California, filmed her nine-month-old son Marcus getting carried away in his bouncer one day.<n>The comical clip shows the youngster lurching back and forth with the device almost touching the floor.<n>Four years on, videos show that the youngster has swapped his passion for bouncing with playing the guitar.

Patricia Ebel, 49, was driving her 10-year-old grandson home after a day at the pool in Naples, Florida.<n>She crashed her black BMW into a car that was stopped at an intersection.<n>Ebel was captured on video staggering as she failed all field-sobriety-tests administered by Collier County Sheriff’s Deputies.<n>She is facing DUI charges including driving with a.15-or-greater blood alcohol content with a minor in the car.

Linda Hogan purchased the 23.63-acre property for $3.5 million a year after she divorced the WWE Hall of Famer in 2009.<n>The compound encompasses a hilltop near the 16th and 17th tees at the gated Wood Ranch Golf & Country Club community.<n>It has five bedrooms and 5.5 bathrooms and includes an award-winning swimming pool, complete with fountains, waterfalls and a water slide.

Former Philadelphia District Attorney Lynne Abraham collapsed on stage during a debate Tuesday night.<n>She was heard falling as Senator Anthony Williams answered a question.<n>A doctor backstage told Abraham she probably suffered a sudden drop in blood pressure due to the unforgiving stage lights.<n>She sat out the rest of the debate and later said she was embarrassed but feeling well.<n>Abraham is running for mayor of Philadelphia and is scheduled to face Senator Anthony Williams in the Democratic primary on May 19.

Robert Durst was indicted Wednesday on the two weapons charges that have kept him in New Orleans.<n>His lawyers say he wants to go to Los Angeles as soon as possible to face a murder charge there.<n>A grand jury charged Durst with possession of a firearm by a felon, and possession of both a firearm and an illegal drug: 5 ounces of marijuana.<n>Until his indictment Wednesday, Durst had been arrested but not formally charged in connection with the.38-caliber revolver authorities say was found in his hotel room.

Carpets were replaced at Dome of the Rock, Judaism's holiest site.<n>But when they were removed, they revealed previously undocumented designs.<n>Jewish scholars say they could point to where the Ark of the Covenant was buried.<n>But Muslim authority in charge of site says they were fitted 'behind their backs'

Faith Myers, 14, from Nebraska, was filmed by her mother as she woke in bed still 'high' from the procedure's anesthesia.<n>She was quizzed about what she would like to eat, with the thought of a shake clearly filling her with dread.<n>Her mother then asks her if she 'wants any boys in her yard? Will your milkshake bring all the boys to the yard?'<n>Faith replies: 'Yeah, I don't want them here'<n>She then declares that she will 'bring out a shotgun' if any boys come into her yard.

Shayanna Jenkins, 25, sobbed and hugged Aaron Hernandez's mother after the guilty verdict was announced on Wednesday.<n>Her sister Shaneah, 23, sat across the aisle from her and the girlfriend of victim Odin Lloyd.<n>The sisters shared an apartment in Bristol, Connecticut but have not spoken since it became clear that Hernandez had a role in Lloyd's brutal death.

The Tiger of Mysore ruled India in the 18th century, before being defeated by the Duke of Wellington.<n>After his death, troops plundered the city and the palace, returning with gold, jewellery, arms, armour, clothing and even Tipu's grand throne.<n>This month, a collection of the historic artefacts will go on sale at London auction house Bonhams.

Alex Impey is breaking the law selling marijuana to help those suffering from serious illness.<n>He says he receives 20 new requests for help each week at his hemp store, Gnostic Hemporium, on the NSW Central Coast.<n>Some cancer sufferers can use up to a gram each day as treatment with costs of the oil between $80 to $150 per gram.<n>Parents of children with serious illnesses are being taught how to grow their own marijuana crops.

Elijah Overcomer, 26, left Gloriavale, a town of about 500 on New Zealand's west coast, with his wife, Rosanna, 29, and their children in late March 2013.<n>The Overcomers have lived outside Gloriavale for two years.<n>Mr Overcomer said the commune was like being in a 'wicked' thriller movie.<n>He said he had been told there was 'a lot of sin' and 'bad things' in the greater world.

Two senior advisers said on Saturday that Hillary Clinton's presidential campaign will center on boosting economic security for the middle class.<n>They said the former senator and secretary of state is a 'tenacious fighter' able to get results.<n>President Barack Obama all but endorsed her saying 'I think she would be an excellent president'<n>The advisers said Clinton will argue that voters have a similar choice in 2016.

Rhodri Giggs, 37, was found guilty of driving a Mercedes without insurance.<n>He was forced to hand over his licence having already racked up six points.<n>He was banned from driving for six months and fined £110 at court yesterday.<n>In January, Giggs spoke for the first time about his brother Ryan's affair.

Scott Waring says he has spotted an extra-terrestrial spacecraft in a Nasa photo.<n>He says it was taken as part of the US' first mission to put men in space.<n>Scientists say claims such as this are down to pareidolia.<n>Pareidolia tricks the brain into seeing familiar objects in random places.
Adidas Ultra Boost trainers on sale for £130.<n>FEMAIL tested them against Aldi's budget £19.99 pair.<n>Marathoner Lucy Waterlow tested them out.

Couple convicted of noise pollution and harassment for 'raucous screams'<n>Neighbours first took them to court in 2009 and described wails as 'deafening'<n>Man, who has not been named, sentenced to four months in prison in 2011.<n>But couple appealed the sentence and have now been ordered to pay £9,000.

CNN reported Tuesday that high-level Russia hackers breached White House computer system last year.<n>Hackers reportedly accessed President Obama's non-public schedule, which is considered highly sensitive information.<n>White House said Tuesday that report was'speculating' about source of cyber activities disclosed last year.

Director Gareth Edwards took to the stage at the Star Wars Celebration in Anaheim, California, on Sunday to reveal a few details about Rogue One.<n>The first of the standalone Star Wars films, Rogue One is due out in December 2015.<n>It is being directed by J.J. Abrams and stars Felicity Jones, Riz Ahmed, Jiang Wen, Donnie Yen, Mads Mikkelsen, Riz Ahmed, Jiang Wen, Riz Ahmed, and Diego Luna.

No Man's Land Fort, a Victorian sea fort in the middle of the Solent, is set to open this month.<n>The sea fort has been transformed into a luxury hotel with a rooftop hot tub, shops, restaurant and nightclub.<n>The hotel can sleep 44 guests with a capacity of 200 for parties and events.

The 4th District Court of Appeal in San Diego upheld a lower court ruling that tossed out a family's lawsuit trying to block the Encinitas Union School District from teaching yoga.<n>The lawsuit brought by Stephen and Jennifer Sedlock and their two children claimed the school district's yoga classes promoted Hinduism and inhibited Christianity.<n>The court upheld the previous ruling in a 3-0 opinion.

Abdul Hadi Arwani was found dead in his car in Wembley on April 7.<n>Leslie Cooper, 36, has been charged with his murder and Burnell Mitchell, the brother of Boney M's lead singer, has been arrested on suspicion of terror offences.<n>A woman and man, 53 and 61, were arrested this week.

Sheree Morgan, 25, and Sophie Morgan, 21, allowed money to be transferred.<n>Pair allowed bank accounts to be used to accept stolen money.<n>Elderly couple were conned out of £36,000 by fraudster posing as a policeman.<n>Pair from Nelson, Lancashire, admitted money laundering but escaped jail.

Violet Pietrok, from Portland, Oregon, was born with frontonasal dysplasia, a malformation of the face and head that is developed in the womb.<n>The condition caused a widening of Violet's facial features, specifically her nose and the space between her eyes.<n>Plastic surgeon-in-chief Dr. John Meara of Boston Children's Hospital spent months preparing for Violet's surgery, specifically with molds of her skull that were made using a 3D printer.<n>The molds allowed Meara and the other surgeons to see what possible problems could arise with certain methods.

Michael Buckley, 60, died after being hit by a shopping trolley at M&S.<n>Court heard shopper Melanie Buck, 33, became frustrated and 'deliberately rammed' him with her trolley.<n>Mr Buckley, who suffered from diabetes and weighed only 8st, fell to the floor.<n>He broke his thighbone and wrist and was put on life support on Christmas Day.<n>Two months later, the decision was taken to turn off the machine.<n>Buck, from Bromley, denies causing death by dangerous driving.

Jemma Peacock, 31, has a rare form of stomach cancer called wild-type gastrointestinal cancer.<n>She is currently taking three drugs to try to prolong her life.<n>The third and most effective - regorafenib - costs the NHS around £1,000 a week.<n>It has been removed from the health service's approved list of treatments.<n>Mrs Peacock says she cannot afford to buy the drug privately.<n>She has set up a 100,000-strong petition for regorafenib to be funded.

Cat meat is illegal in Vietnam but is a delicacy in some rural areas.<n>Restaurants serving the meat - known as 'baby tiger' - are springing up.<n>Demand is so high the owner has already slaughtered 31 cats that day.<n>Cat knappers are paid anything between £37 to £52 per animal.<n>Animal welfare groups blast the illegal trade.

Jeremy Trentelman, 36, of Ogden, Utah, built the castle last week for his three-year-old son Max and two-year-old daughter Story.<n>The father, who works as a florist, received a letter from city code enforcement saying the fort must be taken down.<n>The family says it will leave the fort up for the maximum 14 days, before receiving a $125 fine.

Three quarters of parents still have at least one adult child living with them.<n>But only 42 per cent charge their children rent, according to a survey.<n>Eight out of ten parents still buy their children's groceries.<n>Sixty per cent cook dinner for them each night, according to the study.

Nearly 90per cent of U.S. adults now say they have health insurance.<n>When tracking began in 2008 roughly 14per cent of citizens were uninsured, peaking at 18per cent in the third quarter of 2013.<n>But for the first three months of this year the rate dropped to 11.9per cent.

Britney E. Montenegro, 20, was arrested early Saturday in Orlando, Florida.<n>She was covered in blood, but police say it was not her own.<n>The fight is believed to have started inside a bar.<n>It spilled onto the streets and involved'multiple individuals'<n>Montenegro was restrained by police.<n>She was charged with disorderly conduct.

Scientists have found vast deep water gas hydrates in the Arctic.<n>These are reservoirs for abiotic methane - a deadly gas created by chemical reactions in the crust beneath the seafloor.<n>The reservoirs are secure, and scientists don't believe they will impact climate change.<n>Instead, they say similar formations could someday be used to store methane, that can later be used as fuel.

Ed Miliband will today pledge to cut the deficit every year if Labour wins election.<n>He will claim ‘not one policy’ in the manifesto would be funded through borrowing.<n>Labour's manifesto contains a commitment to a 'Budget Responsibility Lock'<n>Mr Miliband infamously forgot to make any mention of the deficit in his party conference speech last year.

160 melon-headed whales washed up on two beaches north-east of Tokyo.<n>The mass stranding triggered fears of an impending earthquake.<n>The whales are in fact a species of dolphin and are not believed to be frightened.<n>Officials are still investigating the cause of the strandings.

The average Australian sheds the equivalent of a 50 gram packet of chips every week in dry skin.<n>Dust mites are the number one cause of allergies in Australian homes.<n>They increase two to three fold during late autumn to winter.<n>Insects feed off human and animal dead skin.<n>They produce approximately 2000 droppings in their lifetime.

Martina Levato and Alexander Boettcher accused of carrying out acid attacks.<n>Court heard they planned to throw 'corrosive liquid' at men she had been linked to.<n>The 23-year-old also tried to castrate a man's genitals while in his car.<n>One of their plans was to travel to London to carry out an attack on a man she flirted with in Ibiza, the investigating judge said.

Tony Degrafreed, of Indianapolis, Indiana, has been charged with murder for allegedly beating to death wife Rebecca Degrafreed, 47, at their home on July 20, 2014.<n>Marion County prosecutor's office filed the request on Monday, for life without the chance of parole for Degrafreed.<n>In January 1994, Tony Degrafreed was arrested and charged with murder, two counts of attempted murder and illegal possession of a handgun.<n>He shot his estranged 26-year-old wife, Stacy Degrafreed, in the chest and thigh, she died in hospital.

Dozens of anarchists have made their squalid home in a litter-strewn shanty town.<n>Camp is just yards from where King John sealed the Magna Carta in Runnymede.<n>The Queen will visit the historic site in June to celebrate the document's 800th anniversary.<n>The squatters are linked to the Occupy London movement that caused chaos in London when they set up camp outside St Paul's Cathedral in 2011.

The Suzy Lamplugh Trust (SLT) said the T-shirts play into people's fear of being laughed at, which prevents victims from seeking help.<n>One of the offending garments reads: 'Some people call it stalking. I call it love!'

Gianni Van, 45, is on trial for the 1995 murder of Gonzalo Ramirez, whose blindfolded, bloodied body was found on the side of an Irvine, California road.<n>Ramirez had been kidnapped, beaten and chained up before being dumped on the side of the road.<n>Prosecutors say Van killed Ramirez as revenge for raping his on-and-off girlfriend Norma Esparza.<n>Esparza was arrested in 2012 when she re-entered the United States for an academic conference.

Six-storey building collapsed 'like a pancake' in central London today.<n>Hundreds of staff at Royal Courts of Justice and LSE evacuated after collapse.<n>Workman, 56, taken to hospital with head injuries and broken arm.<n>Building was being demolished behind LSE and Royal Courts of Justice.<n>It is just yards from where cable fire caused chaos in central London earlier this month.

Gavin Munro, 39, grows trees directly into plastic moulds.<n>He then prunes and guides branches into shape before grafting them together.<n>The method has been dubbed botanical manufacturing.<n>He's currently tending a crop of 400 tables, chairs and lampshades.

Female stars including Nancy Dell'Olio, Josie Gibson and Jamelia shared selfies.<n>The #SelfieEsteem campaign is in aid of Good Morning Britain's initiative.<n>Women take an average of six selfies before posting one online.<n>Men take four, such is the pressure to look their very best on social media.

Volvo teamed up with a Swedish start-up to make the reflective spray.<n>Life Paint is designed to react to a car’s headlights to alert drivers.<n>It’s invisible by daylight but reflects light in the dark.<n>The spray can be used on clothes, helmets, pushchairs and dog leads.<n>It washes off but can last for days on bike frames.<n>Some of the cans given away for free in London are now on sale on eBay.

One in five NSW families admit to sedating their children before long road trips.<n>Four in five families use technology to deal with bored children.<n>Another 70 per cent give their kids treats to sweeten the ride.<n>Medical community warn sedative Phenergan can cause breathing problems.<n>Family therapist Michael Hawton condemned the trend labelling it 'extraordinary' and 'horrible'

Lisa Webb, 34, is a former assistant elementary school principal.<n>She moved to France in 2009 with her husband and their daughter.<n>During lunch time, she saw children eating everything in front of them.<n>Her daughter, three, refused to eat vegetables and ate foie gras, saucisson, lapin.

Rochelle Coulson, 21, has not worked for five years because of her weight.<n>She suffers from sleep apnoea - a condition often linked to obesity.<n>She says she would be a 'danger' in the workplace if she worked there.<n>Taxpayers' Alliance says benefits system should not become a 'comfort blanket'

Unnamed man was knocked to the ground during bullrunning in Spain.<n>He was trying to escape behind an iron bar when he was gored in the legs.<n>Incident happened during the annual fiesta in Teulada, on Spain's Costa Blanca.

Michelle Woods, 44, was alerted to the reptile by her daughter Elisha Mann.<n>The pair went to check the bathroom and came face to face with the snake.<n>Ms Woods called the RSPCA but they were unable to help - so she posted an appeal on Facebook.<n>A local snake expert identified the reptile as a corn snake.<n>She then came to the house and took away the snake so Ms Woods and Elisha could get a good night's sleep.
MailOnline caught up with the world's most extravagant 18 to 26-year-olds.<n>They blew their cash in Miami, New York, Marbella and Monaco.<n>Travel on private jet, yacht and Bentley Continental.

University of Manchester researchers have revealed an HD dark matter map.<n>It shows clumps of mystery particles across 0.4 per cent of the sky.<n>The goal is to eventually map 12.5 per cent over five years.<n>And the map was released today at the April meeting of the American Physical Society in Baltimore, Maryland.<n>Dr Bridle told MailOnline the map shows 150 times the area of the full moon.<n>And it is the first in a series of maps that will eventually allow a 3D view of dark matter across one eighth of the night sky.

Mike Fregoe of Massapequa Park, New York built a snowman in January that has been melting snow since the beginning of April.<n>The snowman grew to be more than 9-feet tall, but has since melted as temperatures hit 70 degrees.<n>Fregoe and his daughter Rebecca started a Facebook page asking people to keep the snowman alive.<n>The snowman became an internet celebrity before it melted this weekend.
The Goop founder will be raising awareness and funds for New York's food banks.

Three dogs - a Husky, a Springer Spaniel and a black and white Springer Spaniel - take their positions on the make-shift stage.<n>The trio harmonising with one another kick the performance up a gear.<n>The howling goes on for quite a few seconds with none of the dogs letting up.

Passenger on board Alaska Airlines flight 448 recorded video of the banging.<n>Pilot turned back to Seattle 14 minutes into flight when he heard screams.<n>The temperature and pressurized cargo hold where the worker was trapped was not freezing or running out of oxygen.<n>The baggage handler was pulled from the cargo hold and walked off the plane talking to airport staff.<n>He was taken to a hospital as a precaution but appeared to be fine.

International Monetary Fund predicts UK economy will grow by 2.7% this year.<n>It is also predicting 2.3% growth in 2016, beaten only by the United States.<n>Low oil prices are expected to help bolster steady growth in the UK.

Met Office has predicted warmer-than-average temperatures for April, May and June of this year in long-range forecast.<n>Winds of more than 75mph were recorded in north Wales today, and snow was also reported to have fallen on high ground.<n>Today will be largely dry and bright across the South, but it will turn windy with a fresh south-westerly wind.

Sharmeena Begum, 15, was raised by her uncle Shamim Miah, 38.<n>He encouraged her to pray each dawn before classes at Bethnal Green Academy.<n>He blames the airport authorities, police and her school for letting her flee.<n>Controversially, he has turned for advice to Cage, the hardline human rights group whose leaders have said IS executioner Jihadi John is a ‘beautiful young man’

The co-authors of Pete Evans' baby cookbook have defended his decision to release the book independently.<n>The book was dumped by publishers Pan Macmillan last month.<n>Pete Evans' cookbook was branded with major health warnings.<n>The co-authors said they are 'confident' about the changes they have made to the book.

Chancellor repeatedly ducked questions about how cash would be paid for.<n>Said it would come from Conservatives’ ‘balanced plan’ for the economy.<n>But declined to go into further detail on how the cash would be found.

Craig Stoner, 24, Darren Smalley, 35, Joshua Finbow, 23, and Simon Radford, 31, each charged with one count of sexual assault.<n>Alleged attack took place at military barracks near Halifax, Nova Scotia.<n>The sailors are due to return to court on Monday.

David Atherton, 65, went to put his meal in the oven when he found snake.<n>California king snake was hiding inside oven and he scooped it up.<n>He placed it in a plastic food recycling box before alerting the police.<n>His sister Margaret, 73, has an extreme phobia of snakes and needed hospital treatment.<n>RSPCA officers collected the snake and it has been given a temporary home.

The former rap music mogul struck two men with his pickup truck in January, killing one and seriously injuring the other.<n>A judge ruled on Thursday that he will stand trial on murder and attempted-murder charges.<n>Knight was transported to a hospital from the downtown courthouse for an unspecified medical emergency.

Judy Murray, 55, has revealed she 'can't wait to be a granny'<n>Tennis coach helped her son Andy and his brother Jamie to sporting success.<n>She also said she would be a'very active granny' and has plans to introduce grandchildren to tennis.

Shay Mitchell posts photos of her travels to India and Morocco for charity.<n>London's Julie Falconer showcases the best of the English capital.<n> adventure photographer Joe Greer posts stunning Pacific Northwest images.

Hobart International Airport website hacked and defaced with statement.<n>Hackers posted the message on the site on Sunday morning.<n>Message said: 'Islamic State Lists to restore the rights of Muslims who have been killed by your governments'<n>Airport management has disabled the site.

Replica of the warship that carried France's Marquis de Lafayette to help American colonists in their war of independence sets sail for the United States.<n>Lafayette crossed the Atlantic on the original Hermione in 1780 to tell his friend George Washington, commander of the American insurgents against British imperial rule.<n>The replica fired its cannons as it sailed up the French river Charente on Saturday to the military shipyards of Rochefort.<n>French President Francois Hollande paid a brief visit to the warship, which was due to set sail later in the day.

Video appears to show fans singing a homophobic chant about Ashley Cole.<n>The video was apparently filmed by a supporter at the Green Man pub.<n>Metropolitan police are assessing the footage.<n>The video has since been deleted from Twitter.

Mangu Ram, now 82, fled to Kashmir as a refugee when India was partitioned.<n>He lives in a slum house within the Muslim-majority state.<n>He is one of 100,000 refugees denied citizenship rights in Indian Kashmir.<n>Ruling body has refused them right to own property or vote in state elections.<n>Now, after Hindu nationalist party won a share of power, Ram hopes for change.

Scientists at Hebrew University of Jerusalem studied the movement of octopuses.<n>They found that the orientation of the creature's body and the crawling direction are controlled independently in the brain.<n>Octopuses use unique locomotion strategies that are different from those found in other animals.

Islamic extremists drove cars to a mosque in remote village in Borno state.<n>Told locals they were there to teach Islam and then opened fire.<n>Killed 24 people and set fire to houses that were filled with unsuspecting families.<n>Comes as new pictures showed teenagers being encouraged to draw pictures of previous Boko Haram slaughters.

Tania Watts likely to see daughter's stepmother at funeral of 16-year-old.<n>Anje Galsworthy was also stepmother to Becky and is accused of murder.<n>Ms Watts said she is'still in the back of my mind not accepting' not seeing her.<n>Becky vanished from her father's Bristol home on February 19.<n>Police found her body parts at a house in Barton Hill, Bristol, on March 2.<n>Her stepbrother, Nathan Matthews, 28, is set to go on trial for her murder.

Paula McKay was told her daughter Natasha would be disabled after mistakes.<n>But when she became pregnant with her second child, she was reassured the same mistakes would not be repeated.<n>But 17 months later, when she gave birth to her son, Patrick, the same mistakes were made.<n>He was left brain damaged and severely disabled like his older sister.<n>Ms McKay has been awarded £13 million in compensation for her children.<n>She has also won a £7 million care package for her son, who is now 22.
Alex Gray, 27, from Atlanta, weighed 354lbs at his heaviest.<n>He lost 160lbs in 20 months and has since gone from a size 24 to a size 12.

Older people find it harder to reach a deeper sleep.<n>This is because they have more of the brain's short-term memories.<n>But they still need just as much sleep as younger people.<n>Avoid catnapping - catasing during the day - and avoid caffeine.<n>A regular bedtime is also important as this gives the body the cues it needs to feel sleepy.

Twiglet the lurcher ate the unidentified substance while on a walk.<n>He seemed to think he was being chased and had dilated pupils.<n>After 45 minutes of drooling at the mouth, he seemed back to normal.<n>Vet Nick Fisher believes Twiglet may have ingested something hallucinogenic.

Lib Dem leader reveals he struggled with maths and science at school.<n>He told children he was better at languages and art when he was at school.<n>Clegg will launch his election manifesto tomorrow to promise a'stronger economy and a fairer society'<n>Promises to'spread the burden' of deficit reduction with cuts to benefits and Whitehall budgets along with tax rises aimed at the very wealthy.

Cui Hongfang, 73, died after she was knocked over by a Canadian tourist.<n>Mrs Hongfang's family said the tourist was running down steep steps.<n>Police in Beijing have ruled the Chinese woman's death an accident.

Sarah Harper was in a relationship with Christopher Lane, 22, when he was gunned down while visiting in the city of Duncan in August 2013.<n>He was born in Melbourne, Australia, but was in the United States on a baseball scholarship when Chancey Allen Luna allegedly murdered him.<n>Harper sat and listened to the forensic pathologist who performed the autopsy on him, claiming that only a'miracle' would have saved the talented sportsman.

Former PM attended fundraising dinner for 15 Labour target seats.<n>Only one Shadow Cabinet minister, Chuka Umunna, could be bothered to attend.<n>Dinner held in Indian banquet hall in Morden, South London.<n>Dinner was littered with errors and even misspelt Umunna’s name.

Niamh Geaney, 26, and Karen Branigan, 29, found their doppelgngers last week.<n>London journalist also found hers in Birmingham and two London students.<n>Retired priest Neil Richardson, 69, found his doppelgnger in Braintree.<n>Pair are both grandfathers-of-four and are now friends after meeting.

Many people can no longer afford to keep and look after a horse.<n>Many are left to fend for themselves or tied up on busy roadsides.<n>Animal welfare charities are full to capacity.<n>The RSPCA launched an urgent appeal to rehome some of the horses.

The aerial images show intense recent Chinese construction over seven reefs and shoals in the Spratly archipelago.<n>The Philippines voiced alarm about Chinese 'aggressiveness' in the area as it launched giant war games with the US.<n>President Benigno Aquino is set to ask Southeast Asian leaders to issue a collective.<n>statement denouncing the reclamation activities.

Sarah, 23, has always thought Phil was her real father.<n>Last year her mother told her he wasn't her biological parent.<n>Pair appeared on Jeremy Kyle Show to have DNA test.<n>Results revealed Phil is not her real father.

Hedione - derived from the Greek word 'hedone' - is found in Dior aftershaves.<n>It activates the hypothalamus - an area of the brain responsible for triggering the release of sex hormones in women.<n>Scientists found Hedione creates'sex-specific activation patterns' in the tissue found in the nasal cavity which connects to the brain.

Melanie and Vanessa Iris Roy decided to each carry a child one year apart.<n>They took photos at each stage of their respective pregnancies.<n>The couple then uploaded the images to Instagram and they quickly went viral.<n>The women say they are shocked but thankful after people said the pictures were an 'inspiration'

Nick Woodman, 39, was granted 4.5 million restricted stock units last year.<n>This was valued at $284.5 million and won him the top spot on the Bloomberg Pay Index.<n>Chenerie Energy's Charif Souki was valued at $281 million.<n>GoPro cameras are used by professionals and hobbyists conquering six-foot waves, treacherous ski slopes, scrappy dirt track races and bungee jumps.

Two adults and four children pictured riding on same motorbike in Argentina.<n>Man was pictured holding handlebars while children straddled petrol tank.<n>Comes just weeks after a similar case of family riding without helmets.<n>Police say they are looking for the parents and condemn 'irresponsible behaviour'

Elizabeth Jane Howard amassed a spectacular collection of ancient jewellery.<n>Pieces include Greek, Egyptian and Roman pieces up to 3,500 years old.<n>The Cazalet Chronicles author died in 2014 aged 90.<n>Now the collection is to go under the hammer at Bonhams in London.<n>The nine lots include rings, bracelets, pendants and earrings.

ByHours.com allows users to book stays of three, six and 12 hours.<n>The company has signed up 25 hotels in London so far.<n>App allows users to select their area, and then their time slot.<n>Company has been so successful in Spain it has switched focus to UK.

Justin D. Smith, 18, and Efrain Diaz, 20, have been charged with murder and robbery in the death of Jonathan Krueger.<n>Krueger, a junior at the University of Kentucky, was shot dead Friday in what police are calling a robbery turned deadly.<n>The coroner's office said Krueger died of a gunshot wound to the chest.

John Helinski, 62, lived in a cardboard box on the streets of Tampa Bay.<n>He then tried to apply for a place at a homeless shelter, but struggled.<n>A cop and a case manager then looked into his past.<n>They found a lost bank account with enough money to buy his own house.

Memories Pizza in Walkerton, Indiana, opened on Thursday.<n>It was closed for eight days after owner Kevin O'Connor said his religious beliefs wouldn't allow him to cater a gay wedding.<n>A crowdfunding campaign started by supporters raised more than $842,000 with donations from 29,160 contributors in 48 hours.<n>O'Connor said he hasn't received the money yet, but said he plans to give some to charity and use some money to make improvements to the restaurant.

Naomi Jacobs was 32 when she woke up one morning having lost her memory.<n>She had been struck with Transient Global Amnesia overnight in 2008.<n>The condition, brought on by stress, wiped out 'episodic' part of her memory.<n>But her semantic memory was still intact meaning she could remember things she had repeated over time.

Recorder Philip Cattan, 65, fell asleep during the rape trial of John Quingley.<n>The child abuse victim was giving evidence via videolink because of her age.<n>A retrial had to be ordered and with the child having to give evidence for a second time.<n>The judge was confronted with the claim that he had slept through part of the cross-examination of the witness.<n>The cost of the abandoned trial and the retrial is believed to have cost the taxpayer £10,000.

Kyli Wolfson was 26 when she woke up in excruciating pain and went to the hospital, where doctors said she had acute pancreatitis.<n>Three months later, she was diagnosed with chronic pancreatitis, a rare condition that causes the pancreas to become inflamed.<n>Her weight dropped to 80lbs, and she had to postpone her wedding.

Mysterious black boot apparition appears behind little girl in Japan.<n>One Reddit user suggested they could be samurai boots.<n>Others suggested it was a trick of the light or a real-life human being.

Kestrel and barn owl caught fighting over nesting box in North Yorkshire.<n>Owl swooped on box after kestrels left and tried to claim it for its own.<n>But the kestrel was forced to seek an alternative home for its mate.

Alice Dreger attended class at East Lansing High School earlier this week.<n>Her son asked her to sit in on it so she could hear what was going on.<n>She took to Twitter to express her horror at what she heard.<n>Claimed the class was filled with stories of people who had pre-marital sex.<n>Also complained of incorrect information being handed out by teacher.<n>But school has denied it only teaches abstinence, saying it was just that day's lesson.

Cloud formation resembling the Wi-Fi symbol appeared in the sky of Xiangtan city in Hunan Province.<n>The cloud appeared to perfectly mimic the global symbol for wifi.<n>Chinese internet users have shared and commented on Shi's photo thousands of times on Chinese social media.

Asabi Barner, 37, is suing Black Ink tattoo parlor in Harlem, New York City for a chest tattoo that left her scarred.<n>She says she went to the parlor after watching the reality show which features the shop on VH1.<n>The Harlem tattoo parlor's owner and artists star in their own reality show, Black Ink Crew.
