Michelle Knight was speaking at the Cleveland Rape Crisis Center's Faces of Change Luncheon on Wednesday.<n>She said she does not want her heart 'chained to the situations that I went through'<n>Knight was rescued from Ariel Castro's Cleveland home on May 6, 2013.<n>She has a new book out, Finding Me: A Decade of Darkness, a Life Reclaimed, and is working on a second.<n>While signing copies of the book, she revealed to readers that she has a boyfriend.

Photos taken between 1900 and 1911 during the Qing dynasty show Beijing's famous landmarks with barely any visitors.<n>They are some of the earliest holiday snaps of the Chinese capital and show landmarks almost devoid of visitors.<n>The origin of the photos is not known and they are some of the earliest images of the Chinese capital.

Canadian duo Mitchell Moffit and Greg Brown present AsapSCIENCE.<n>They discuss how being the first, middle, youngest, or an only child affects us.<n>According to Mitchell and Brown, first-born children are expected to be higher academic achievers and more ambitious.<n>Oldest children tend to be ambitious and have strong leadership skills.<n>Middle children tend to be more co-operative, flexible and sociable.

Thousands of silver fish have died in Rodrigo de Freitas lake in Rio.<n>The lake is set to host Olympic rowing and canoeing events in 2016.<n>There is an overwhelming stench coming from the lake and rubbish collectors are scooping tons of dead fish from the water.<n>Biologists and authorities have argued about the cause of the deaths.

Study shows condition triples risk of developmental problems in children.<n>Hyperemesis gravidarum causes constant vomiting and crippling weakness.<n>About 10,000 women a year in the UK are affected by the condition.

Veronica ‘Roni’ Gonzalez and her fiance Ely Alba Gonzalez were returning from their engagement party when they stopped on Interstate 30 to help a group in trouble.<n>Four were killed instantly in the collision.<n>One later died in hospital from their wounds.<n>Two young children travelling with them survived the incident.<n>The 18-wheeler Ryder truck later careered into the earlier crash.<n>It then burst into flames.

Mountain lion, known as P-22, found living in crawlspace under Los Feliz home.<n>Has so far resisted attempts to get him to move out - including firing tennis balls.<n>P-22 is best-known for being pictured in front of Hollywood sign in 2013.

Flakka can be injected, snorted, smoked, swallowed or taken with other drugs.<n>It resembles a mix of crack cocaine and meth and has a noticeably foul smell.<n>Users have nicknamed the drug '$5 insanity' because hits often cost less than $10.<n>There were more than 670 Flakka occurrences in Florida in 2014, up from 85 in 2012.

Photographs show teenagers and people in their early 20s kissing in public, drinking alcohol and living openly gay lifestyles.<n>Some of those pictured are even seen wearing clothing adorned with the Stars and Stripes.<n>Young people represent the largest societal bloc in Iran, with over 63 per cent of Iran's population of 73 million people aged under 30.
Barcelona midfielder lists his Spanish vineyard on Airbnb.<n>The property is located in Castilla-La Mancha, Spain.<n>The vineyard stay comes with a guided tour of the area.

Shiba the dog uses his nose and paw to open a sliding glass window.<n>He greets customers and tourists at a shop on the outskirts of Tokyo.<n>One YouTube video of his customer service skills has more than two million views.<n>Visitors have travelled from as far away as England and Taiwan to meet him.

'Our Planet' will focus on the Earth's last wilderness areas and the animals living there.<n>Eight-part series will take four years to make and is planned for a 2019 debut for Netflix customers internationally.<n>Silverback company directors Alastair Fothergill and Keith Scholey, whose credits include 'Frozen Planet' and 'African Cats,' will lead the production.
Michelle, 27, unveils summer range for Lipsy.<n>Shows off her curves in new campaign imagery.<n>Full of lace and floral dresses.

A young woman who was subjected to years of abuse by Bega Cheese boss Maurice Van Ryn has told a court of the impact it had on her life.<n>The wealthy NSW businessman has pleaded guilty to 12 sex offences.<n>The young woman told Sydney's District Court on Monday that she is scared for her future relationships.<n>She said she hadn't spoken up about the abuse until the day she heard he had been caught.

Studies that surveyed personnel found'major misconceptions' about whether women should be brought into the male-only jobs.<n>Some of those concerns were not limited to men, researchers found, but also were found among women in special operations jobs.<n>The main survey went to about 18,000 people who are in positions closed to women, and the response was about 50 percent.

The images were taken by Esa's Rosetta spacecraft on 12 March.<n>The first image shows a bright light from the comet's surface.<n>The second shows a spectacular jet erupting from the dark underside of the comet.<n>It is unusual because such activity has only been seen on the day side.<n>It is not clear if this caused the jet - or an explosion of material caused by ice sublimating (turning from solid to gas) underground.

Diane James praised Putin's nationalist credentials on LBC radio.<n>She said he was forced into invading Ukraine because of the EU.<n>Mrs James is considered a potential successor to Nigel Farage as Ukip leader.

Archie Brown Jr, a father-of-four, struck and killed a 2-year-old boy Sunday evening in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.<n>While at the scene of the accident, an unidentified gunman shot Brown and a 15-year-old boy dead.<n>Brown Jr was pronounced dead at the scene, while the 15-year-old died at a local hospital.<n>Police have not identified the shooter or made any arrests.

More than 730,285 Reddit users have pressed The Button since 1 April.<n>Only people who registered before this date are eligible to click The Button.<n>They are awarded a colour, known as a 'flair,' which represents the time period at which they clicked The Button, ranging from zero to 60 seconds.<n>It is not yet known what happens when the timer reaches zero and users can only click The Button once.

Street art features portraits of Clinton with phrases including 'Dont Say Secretive' and 'Don't Say Entitled'<n>The signs appeared in Brooklyn on Saturday night near Clinton's new campaign headquarters.<n>The descriptive terms that Clinton's fan club said it does not want applied to their candidate include 'polarizing, calculating, disingenuous, insincere, ambitious, inevitable, entitled'

Four-month-old Roscoe was caught on camera this week at the Asheville Humane Society in North Carolina taking some of his first steps.<n>He was born with a deformity which caused his front to legs to be bent backwards at the knees.<n>Thanks to more than $3,000 in public donations, the canine was able to have the life-changing operation he needed.

The last two 'Doolittle Tokyo Raiders' presented the group's Congressional Gold Medal for permanent display at the National Museum of the US Air Force.<n>Retired Lt Col Richard 'Dick' Cole, age 99, gave the medal to the museum's director in a ceremony at the museum attended by military and political officials and relatives of the original 80 Raiders.<n>The medal, awarded by Congress earlier in the week, arrived in a ceremonial B-25 flight.

David King, 70, from London, was found dead in village of Pierres, Normandy.<n>Unnamed 28-year-old Frenchman has been charged with his murder.<n>Prosecutor says Mr King may have confronted man over stolen vegetables.

Robert Charles Bates, 73, accidentally shot and killed Eric Courtney Harris.<n>Harris, 44, was allegedly meeting undercover officers to buy drugs and a gun.<n>Police say Bates was trying to 'get the situation under control' when he shot Harris dead in Tulsa, Oklahoma.<n>Officers say Harris was being restrained by an undercover officer when Bates opened fire.<n>Police say Bates accidentally pulled out his service weapon instead of stun gun.

Helen Flanagan, 24, has completely transformed her maternity style.<n>The Coronation Street actress wore a slinky clinging midi dress recently.<n>She is one of the stars who has opted for a more reserved style.

Anna and Indi have been surfing since they were 10 weeks old.<n>The border collies use their low centre of gravity to keep them stable.<n>They have drawn crowds at competitions in Queensland, Australia.

Group of yobs filmed swearing and singing on flight from Glasgow to Alicante.<n>One man was escorted off the plane after it landed in Spain last week.<n>Passengers said group drank heavily and refused to sit down when plane landed.<n>Video shows woman arguing with group and grappling with them in aisle.

Anna Broom, 33, has not worked since she was 19 and has claimed £100,000.<n>She wants £10,000 government loan to fund 'dream wedding'<n>She also wants £2,000 honeymoon and champagne for 50 guests.<n>Claims it is her 'basic human right' to be a bride.

Dale Cregan is on hunger strike for the second time in a bid to be moved.<n>The 31-year-old was reportedly transferred to solitary confinement in HMP Manchester a month ago after being caught smuggling a mobile phone and cannabis into his cell.<n>But in a desperate attempt to get himself moved Cregan, who was jailed for life after shooting police officers Fiona Bone and Nicola Hughes in 2012, has apparently stopped eating.<n>He is hoping to be transferred from the Category A prison to Ashworth Hospital, a high-security psychiatric unit in Maghull, Merseyside.

James May was responding to Sue Perkins's death threats on Twitter.<n>He said Top Gear fans who sent threats should 'kill themselves'<n>May has now backtracked, saying he doesn't want people to kill themselves.<n>Perkins announced she was leaving Twitter in response to abuse.

Cyclist was taking part in the first stage of a 100 kilometre ride in Russia.<n>The truck passed him and clipped his bicycle as he rode past.<n>The truck continued along the road for 100 metres before stopping.<n>The rider suffered a broken leg and pelvic injuries in the accident.

Pets prefer programmes featuring other animals while shunning reality shows.<n>Two-thirds of goldfish owners put the bowl in sight of the TV.<n>Even the owner of a micro pig lets their pet watch 28 hours of TV a week.

The castle dates from the 13th century and was refurbished in the 19th century.<n>The property features its own swimming pool and boasts 14 en-suite bedrooms.<n>The castle is only 15 minutes from the local airport which has regular flights.

David Potchen, 53, robbed a bank in Merrillville, Indiana, last June.<n>He waited for police to arrive so he could go back to prison for food and shelter.<n>Potchen had served 12 and a half years for a bank robbery but had trouble finding a job after his parole last year.<n>He is now employed and living with the support of his estranged relatives.

Researchers say antibiotics are used to make farm animals put on weight.<n>Add that they may also be fattening our children.<n>Third of 10-11 year olds and a fifth of 4-5 year olds in England are overweight.

Around 50 obese pupils at Jianxin Primary School are being sent to classes.<n>Teachers have named the classes Kung Fu Panda in order to make fitness fun.<n>A survey revealed that 5 per cent of the school's pupils were obese.

Prince William will take two weeks paternity leave when Duchess of Cambridge goes into labour.<n>He will work throughout April in three sites – Cambridge, Norwich and Gloucestershire Airport.<n>The Duchess will largely be based at Kensington Palace.<n>Prince faces a two-hour hospital dash back to London from Norfolk.

Unnamed person was arrested after climbing over the fence last night.<n>The package was 'deemed to be harmless' and was 'immediately' apprehended.<n>Latest in a string of embarrassing security breaches to hit the US capital.<n>Last week an illicit gyrocopter was able to land on the US Capitol lawn.

FDA investigators found that a number of KIND flavors were labeled 'healthy' - brimming with fiber, protein and antioxidants, while being low in fat and sodium.<n>However, upon closer inspection, it was found that 'none of the products met the requirements to make such content claims' and were in fact'misbranded'

Doug Hughes, a Florida postal worker, landed a gyro-copter on the US Capitol lawn on Wednesday.<n>He flew from Gettysburg, Pennsylvania to Washington D.C. without permission.<n>Homeland Security Secretary Jeh Johnson has admitted that the pilot was interviewed by the Secret Service almost two years ago.<n>Johnson said he wants to know all the facts before making any changes.

Labour has previously predicted that Coalition's austerity programme would see unemployment and crime soar.<n>But in each case, the opposite has happened.<n>In an interview, Miliband refused to admit he had got it wrong.<n>He also refused to say how much Labour would be borrowing by the end of next Parliament.

Patrick and Valerie Jubbs are attempting to sell the estate in Jimena de la Frontera.<n>The town hall ruled alterations made by a previous owner were illegal.<n>The Jubbs said they obtained a certificate stating there were no infractions.<n>They are planning to move back to the UK, but said their money is tied up.

Chris Ryves set up subreddit, Find Boston Bombers, after April 2013 bombings.<n>Millions took to thread to pinpoint suspects, based on photos and videos.<n>But in days after attack, users hurled false accusations at spectators.<n>Claims even led to 22-year-old Sunil Tripathi being wrongly identified as bomber.<n>Now, Ryves has told of his regrets about thread in new documentary.

Man makes his own version of the shepherds pie-trifle combination.<n>Neil Killham, 32, from Manchester, made it 16 years ago in Friends.<n>He posted a picture of his finished creation on Twitter.<n>But it doesn't look very good when sliced - and tastes 'horrible'

BMW Group has designed smart specs to give drivers super-human powers.<n>The Augmented Vision goggles will go on show at the Auto Shanghai show.<n>They generate ‘screens’ showing information that only the wearer can see.<n>For example, the goggles can project navigation information with arrows onto the roads, as well as showing speed limits and even point out local landmarks.<n>Elvis-style glasses can also be worn out of the car and show X-ray views.

Robert F Kennedy Jr is the son of the late Attorney General Robert Kennedy.<n>He spoke at a screening of Trace Amounts, a documentary that purports to show a link between vaccines and autism.<n>Kennedy is fighting a bill in California that would make childhood immunizations mandatory.

Asif Malik, 31, and his partner Sara Kiran, 29, fled UK with four children.<n>They were caught on CCTV boarding a ferry from Dover to France.<n>Thames Valley Police believe they travelled south through Europe to Syria.<n>Turkish official today claimed couple had been arrested in Ankara.<n>Family of six have been missing from Slough, Berkshire, since April 7.

Kym Ackerman, 32, saw the image of Jesus in an x-ray of one her molars when she went for a dental check-up in Flagstaff, Arizona.<n>She pointed it out to both the dentist and hygienist.<n>The dentist didn't find any cavities during the check-up and Ackerman has vowed to keep her mouth, and especially that holy molar, healthy.

Clarkson has agreed to keep quiet about his sacking so Top Gear Live shows can go ahead 'in good spirit'<n>BBC feared he would vent his anger at his sacking during the live shows.<n>But he has agreed to keep quiet so the shows can go ahead.<n>The shows have been rebranded from Top Gear Live to Clarkson, Hammond and May Live.

The Anthem of the Seas will be named on April 20.<n>The world's third-largest cruise ship has 16 decks and a capacity for 5,000 passengers at a time.<n>On board, guests will experience robotic bartenders, be able to take part in circus skills training activities and even go on a virtual sky dive.

US ambassador Mark Lippert was attacked by a knife-wielding activist in March.<n>He suffered a deep facial gash and stab wound to his wrist after being attacked.<n>The North said Lippert's remarks were proof that Washington was intent on hostility.

Spain's Queen Letizia attended a conference for rare childhood diseases.<n>The 42-year-old wore a striking white tailored suit with nude accessories.<n>She also took selfies with schoolchildren outside the museum.

Half of those with severe allergies live in daily fear of a potentially fatal reaction.<n>Yet many Britons are unaware of the seriousness of the condition.<n>Two-thirds don't know how to use an adrenaline pen which can save lives.<n>Around 21million Britons have some kind of allergy.

Tom Moffatt, 27, from Tameside, inked son Riley's name into his arm.<n>But instead of 'L', he started needling 'P' and had to'scribble' over it.<n>He also attempted to mark himself with Riley's nickname 'Sonny Boy'<n>But he ended up scratching 'Sony Boy' across his knuckles instead.<n>NHS worker was drunk at the time and now considers inkwork a 'nightmare'

A kidnapping in South Carolina was thwarted because the would-be abductor couldn't operate a manual stick shift in the victim's car, police said.<n>27-year-old Demetri Nelson still had his victim's keys in his pocket when he was arrested Tuesday, several hours after the kidnapping attempt.<n>Deputies said Nelson broke into a 53-year-old woman's home and demanded money.<n>Nelson couldn't drive the car because of the manual transmission, however, and the woman used the emergency trunk latch to escape.

Sally Jones, 45, fled Kent home with her son, 10, to join ISIS militants in Syria.<n>Mother-of-two seen leading an all-women brigade of terrorists in chant session.<n>Footage also shows fighters practising their shooting techniques on road.<n>Experts say video is first'real evidence' showing Jones involved with brigade.

Ellie Marshall, 10, and Taylor Biggin, five, lost their eight-year-old brother Harvey.<n>He died of a mystery illness last year and they decided to donate eggs to hospital.<n>Strangers have now sent more than 1,000 eggs to Sheffield Children's Hospital.

Alaa Abdullah Esayed posted 45,000 tweets supporting ISIS in a year.<n>The 22-year-old encouraged children to fight and take up weapons.<n>She also posted pictures of dead fighters and a poem on how to raise a child to be violent and learn jihad.<n>Esayed pleaded guilty to encouraging terrorism at the Old Bailey.<n>She could face 14 years in prison for the offences.

Mitzi Neyens, 77, was the last link in a chain of 34 kidney transplants when she received a kidney from a Philadelphia man March 26.<n>Neyens has battled kidney disease for most of her 53-year marriage to Bill, who donated his kidney to a patient in need.<n>On the day of Neyen's transplant, eight surgeons in four states linked five hospitals through transplants.

A 'blob' of warm water 2,000 miles across is sitting in the Pacific Ocean.<n>Since last June it has extended from Alaska to Mexico.<n>It has been present since 2013 and causing fish to seek shelter elsewhere.<n>And a new University of Washington study says it could be responsible for droughts.<n>Droughts lasting more than 100 years are far from unheard of in California.

Robert Kushner lost his varsity coaching job at a private academy after testifying this week about his years selling marijuana.<n>Kushner, 32, is one of more than a dozen former drug dealers testifying for the federal government about allegations of police wrongdoing.<n>Kushner told jurors Tuesday that some of the undercover officers on trial had stolen $81,000 in cash and 7 pounds of marijuana from him during a 2007 arrest.

Andre Cole, 52, became the third convicted killer put to death this year in Missouri.<n>His fate was sealed after the U.S. Supreme Court turned down several appeals, including one claiming Cole was mentally ill and unfit for execution.<n>Cole was executed by lethal injection at 10.15pm on Tuesday at the Eastern Reception, Diagnostic and Correctional Center in Bonne Terre, Missouri.<n>He was pronounced dead at 10.24pm, a spokesman for the Missouri Department of Corrections wrote in a statement to Daily Mail Online.

Al Qaida fighters clashed with members of one of Yemen's largest brigades.<n>They then seized control of the Riyan airport and moved to secure the city's main sea port.<n>It comes amid wider chaos pitting Shiite rebels against forces loyal to the exiled president and a Saudi-led air campaign.

Hamdi Ulukaya settled a lawsuit filed by his ex-wife, who laid claim to half the $2 billion Greek yogurt empire.<n>On April 10, after years of wrangling, Ulukaya settled for an unknown sum.<n>Ex-wife Dr. Ayse Giray first sued Ulukaya in 2012 for a 53 percent stake in the company.<n>The two were married just two years in the 1990s and Ulukaya's company was not an issue in their divorce.

Chinese hospitals are harvesting up to 11,000 organs from political prisoners.<n>Some patients were still alive as they were secretly placed in incinerators.<n>The organs are being harvested without anaesthetic, it is claimed.<n>Members of the banned religious group, the Falun Gong, are a key target.<n>Human Harvest: China's Organ Trafficking charted eight year investigation.

David King, 70, was originally from east London.<n>He had not been seen for six months in picturesque hamlet of Pierres.<n>On October 27, he went to tea with friends living close to his home.<n>He is thought to have got into an argument with one, aged 28.

Photographer Amos Chapple travelled the world using a quadcopter drone between 2012 and 2014.<n>He captured stunning aerial pictures of cities and landmarks around the world using the camera attached to the quadcopter.<n>But a clampdown on the use of drones for photographic purposes has made it harder to recreate these amazing images.

Manuel Delisle, the man accused of the road rage incident involving a chainsaw, has pleaded not guilty to armed assault on Tuesday.<n> Karine Cyr recorded the confrontation on Sunday as she was vacationing with her husband Alexandre Hermenier and their two children.<n>After the video was posted on Sunday night to Facebook it has been shared over 30,000 times and has over 1 million views.<n>Children can be heard screaming and crying in the background of the chilling footage.

Winnie, 19, suffers from the same rare skin condition as Michael Jackson was diagnosed with.<n>The Diesel model was joined by albino model Shaun, 23, at a launch event for Popular magazine in Hollywood on Tuesday.

Roger Byng, 67, captured the action-packed photographs on the Wetlands in Slimbridge, Gloucester.<n>The retired security installer was in a hide as he took photographs of small British birds.<n>However he noticed a charging fox out of the corner of his eye and moved his camera to focus on the fox.<n>The fox came away with a single feather, whilst the goose escaped with a squawk!

Stewart said he was looking forward to not having to watch the'relentless' 24-hour news networks anymore.<n>He said he was becoming more depressed by American politics and cable news.<n>He also confessed that his'moments of dissatisfaction' with the show had started to become more frequent.

Doctor John Parker was taken to Westmead Hospital in Sydney's west.<n>The humanitarian doctor had been working in Sierra Leone since November.<n>NSW Health has confirmed Dr Parker does not have Ebola.<n>The World Health Organisation estimated more than 10,000 people have died from the deadly virus in Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone.

Riley Hughes died at just 32 days old after contracting whooping cough.<n>His parents Catherine and Greg are now leading a campaign, urging adults to vaccinate themselves and their children.<n>The adult whooping cough vaccine will not be available in Australia until July.<n>It comes less than a month after the death of 32-day-old Riley.

Ukip leader calls on Conservatives to vote tactically for him in seats where they cannot win in order to help keep the Tory leader as Prime Minister.<n>Mr Farage said he believed many were in 'their hearts' closer to his position of wanting an EU referendum as soon as possible.<n>Reveals he has already held informal discussions with Tories about potential post-election arrangements.

Rihanna was out for dinner in Santa Monica on Tuesday night.<n>The singer ditched her bra at the restaurant and went unbuttoned.<n>She is one of a number of celebrities who are ditching their bras in 2015.

Becky Handley, 20, learned of her father's crimes after reading about them online.<n>Raymond Handley, 62, was jailed for 13 and a half years for sex assaults.<n>Miss Handley said her father deserves the death penalty rather than jail.<n>She said: 'I want the death penalty brought back for people like my father'<n>Miss Handley did not see her father as a child and was discouraged from contacting him by her mother as an adult.<n>She now wants to change her name via deed poll.

Nathan Priestley, 21, from Norwich, Norfolk, was dubbed 'Jabba the Hutt'<n>He was so depressed over his size that he refused to leave his house for a year.<n>He was just 18 when he took an overdose of 30 pills, but survived.<n>Within two years, he had shrunk to 14 stone.<n>He now works as a personal trainer and is a trim 13 stone.

Judge Olu Stevens was sentencing Gregory Wallace to five years' probation after he and accomplice Marquis McAfee robbed Tommy and Jordan Gray's Louisville home.<n>In victim impact statement's prepared for sentencing, couple called for Wallace to be sent to prison and Jordan wrote that her daughter was still 'in constant fear of black men'<n>Stevens said he was 'offended' by the couple's racist comments and granted Wallace probation because he had no prior convictions for violent crimes.

Clinton said the GOP is 'talking only about me'<n>She's in New Hampshire, a state that traditionally backs Democrats.<n>She's making her first campaign visit this year to the state.<n>She's taking issue with economic views expressed by members of her own party.

Llallawavis scagliai was a flightless prehistoric meat-eating bird.<n>It lived 3.5 million years ago in South America and would have been four feet tall.<n>Scientists say its hearing was below average compared to birds today.<n>It may have even used low frequency sounds to help detect its prey.

Researchers found heart patients who expressed gratitude for the positive things in their life had improved mental, and ultimately physical, health.<n>The study involved men and women who had been diagnosed with Stage B heart failure.<n>It found that more gratitude in these patients was associated with better mood, better sleep, less fatigue and lower levels of inflammatory markers.

I'm UP Alarm can be set to go off the night before and will then only turn off by scanning a QR code on a mug or magnet that can be kept in another room.<n>App uses a Quick Response code, or QR code, which is a form of barcode that the cameras of mobile phones are able to detect.<n>App is due to be released in June and will come as a free download for smartphone users.

The pilot scheme will recruit 10 people with autism or Asperger syndrome to be based in Microsoft's Redmond offices in Washington.<n>Microsoft is running the scheme with support from specialist Specialisterne.<n>If successful, the scheme could extend to more vacancies worldwide.

Harold Henthorn was charged with the murder of his second wife, Toni Bertolet, 51, last November.<n>Police have reopened their investigation into the suspicious death of his first wife, Lynn Rishell, some 20 years earlier.<n>Both women died in 'freak accidents' to which Henthorn, 59, was the sole witness.<n>Henthorn is now fighting for a $1.5million pay out from the policy taken out on his second wife to pay for his attorney in his murder trial.

Actress Patsy Kensit, 47, made the comments in Stylist magazine.<n>Said the Duchess is 'our generation's suffragette'<n>This is the first time the Duchess has been lauded as a feminist icon.<n>Critics have previously described her as a'machine made princess'

Louie, a full-grown Dalmatian, and three-week-old kitten Uno were together.<n>The two animals were recently adopted by the Pogue family in Spokane, Washington.<n>In the video, Louie and Uno snuggle up together and playdate.

Mario Valencia took a rifle from a Walmart in Tuscon, Arizona on February 19 and was able to start firing it as soon as he left.<n>Walmart claims the rifle was properly locked, and that it may have been affected by the hard blow caused by the police car.<n>Police were even told the gun was locked by employees at the store as they pursued Valencia, but just seconds later he began firing into the air.<n>Valencia was later taken down by an officer who hit him with his car.

Wicked Pickets protest group has started painting over offensive slogans on Wicked Campers vans.<n>The van hire company came under fire last year after over 120,000 Australians petitioned to have slogans eliminated.<n>The slogans include, 'A wife: An attachment you screw on the bed to get the housework done' and 'Your thighs won't touch if my head's between them'<n>The women have started arming themselves with spray paint and removing the slogans.

William Smith, 14, died in August last year, four months after mother's death.<n>Teenager wore her favourite bandana and sprayed her perfume around house.<n>His grandmother found him hanged while looking after his younger brothers.<n>Coroner said he likely did not intend to take his life and was 'playing a prank'

Heavyweights Balla Gaye 2 and Eumeu Sene competed in crunch match dubbed 'Le Choc' in Dakar, Senegal.<n>The two grappled with powerful blows on the sand at Demba Diop Stadium in the capital of Dakar.<n>Wrestling with strikes is only practised in Senegal and has boomed in popularity as their football team has struggled.

1.02million men in the UK have opted to work reduced hours.<n>This compares to 4.58million women who have chosen to work part-time.<n>It follows a rise in the number of stay-at-home fathers.<n>Men now make up one in 10 parents who care for their children.

John Potter, from Savannah, forged the picture with his brother in the 1980s.<n>He then passed on the image to the Georgia Historical Society.<n>The photo became an unofficial part of the ship's history.

Three more parties have vowed to teach lifesaving skills in schools.<n>Previously only the Liberal Democrats had promised to add lessons.<n>Labour, Ukip and the Green Party added their support as they unveiled manifestos.<n>It means the Conservatives are the only major party not to make pledge.

94,872 residents and 42,424 employees live in the tsunami hazard zones.<n>Also in danger are 486 public venues, 440 dependent care facilities and 2,314 businesses with a'significant customer presence'<n>Some communities can increase their chance of survival simply by walking faster.

Qantas have been warned they could lose their landing strips at Heathrow.<n>The Australian airline has slipped to an on time ranking of 75 out of 80 airlines that use the busy English airport.<n>Qantas could also be facing a fine of more than AU$38,000 for every time their A380 flights set down more than fifteen late on the tarmac.

The Queen and Prince Philip attended a traditional Easter Sunday service at St George's Chapel at Windsor Castle.<n>Other royals to attend included Autumn Phillips, wife of the Queen’s grandson Peter Phillips, and Sophie, Countess of Wessex.<n>The Queen was greeted by other members of the royal family including Prince Andrew, Prince Edward, Princess Anne, her husband Timothy Laurence.

Former Prime Minister Tony Blair has denied he is super-rich.<n>He said he is 'absolutely not' in the league of the super-rich.<n>He also suggested he has left British politics behind in favour of work.<n>Blair earns millions from consultancy roles and £250,000 for public speaking.

Bryan Morseman, 29, from Bath, New York, ran three marathons in eight days in March.<n>He said the money will go toward the medical bills of his nine-month-old son Leeim, who has spina bifida.<n>Leeim was born with spina bifida, a developmental congenital disorder that starts in the womb when a baby's spine doesn't form properly.<n>Morseman has won 23 of the 42 26.2-mile races he has participated in.

Police have identified 25 people who claim the Labour peer attacked them.<n>Each could claim for up to £100,000 after fourth refusal to prosecute him.<n>One man allegedly attacked by Janner when he was living in children's homes.<n>Several of those who claim to have been sexually abused say Janner got to them through paedophile Frank Beck.

The 32-year-old father was arrested for using medical cannabis on his daughter.<n>The toddler is battling a rare form of cancer called neuroblastoma.<n>He claims the drug has improved her condition but was charged.<n>The father has now spoken out in the hope that he can persuade the government to rethink their cannabis laws and drop the charges against him.

The Obamas paid more than $93,000 in federal taxes last year on an adjusted gross income of more than $477,000.<n>Their effective tax rate was 19.6 percent, the returns show.<n>The Obamas lowered their 2014 tax bill by claiming nearly $160,000 in itemized deductions, including $70,712 in charitable donations to 33 different charities.<n>The White House released the Obamas' tax returns ahead of the filing deadline Wednesday.

Shae-Lee Shackleford, 28, Lana Kington, 25, Madison Lloyd, 27 are a trio of Australian models who filmed themselves miming to Queen's Bohemian Rhapsody.<n>Their first video, Bohemian Carsody, went viral in March.<n>The girls have since earned 260 million views on YouTube and Facebook.<n>They have been booked on The Ellen show and Good Morning America.<n>Shackleford revealed that 'Be on Ellen' was on her list of '100 things to do before I die'

Alexandra Harra, 28, has been dubbed 'The Romanian Kim Kardashian'<n>The life coach turned model has dyed her hair black to look more like the reality star.<n>Harra has appeared on the cover of the Romanian Playboy.

Researchers at John Hopkins Medical School in Baltimore found damage to the right sagittal stratum in the right hemisphere of the brain makes people unable to detect sarcasm.<n>Stroke patients with damage to this area of the brain were far poorer at detecting sarcasm when listening to sentences, according to the new research.<n>The study found that the level of damage to this area directly affects a persons ability to detect sarcasm.

Melissa Borg left her Baulkham Hills home at 7:30am on Thursday.<n>The 13-year-old made her way to The Hills Sports High School in Seven Hills.<n>However she never made it to class and her father reported her missing.<n>Police have questioned her school friends about her disappearance.<n>They have so far been unable to find the teenager.

Marine Le Pen accuses her father of trying to sabotage her party's efforts.<n>Tensions had escalated last week after he defended previous comments.<n>He described Nazi gas chambers as a 'detail of history'<n>Le Pen has tried to rid the anti-immigrant party of its anti-Semitic image.

Latest generation of beauty products will be personalised.<n>Make-up brands offering more than 100 different combinations of brush shapes.<n>Eyeko London's new Bespoke Mascara (£28) comes in dozens of shapes.<n>Cover FX Custom Cover Drops (£36) can be mixed with any of your favourite moisturisers, oils, serums or other foundations.

Three BA flights were diverted over the weekend.<n>One was from Baku, Azerbaijan to London, returning after 11 minutes.<n>Another was from Mumbai, India to London, and landed at Istanbul.<n>A third was from Luanda, Angola to London, and landed in Paris.<n>BA denied two of the diversions, saying the pilots were forced to return.

Jane Laut, 57, was arrested and charged in 2009 for the murder of her husband Dave Laut.<n>The charges were dropped and then refiled immediately on Friday in a Ventura County courtroom.<n>Her attorney called the prosecution's move 'unprofessional' and 'pretty much unprecedented' in a murder case.<n>Laut claims she wrestled a gun from her abusive husband after he became intoxicated and said he was going to kill her after he killed their 10-year-old son and their dogs.

Ted Loveday powered Gonville and Caius College, Cambridge to victory.<n>He answered 10 starter questions in final of BBC quiz show hosted by Jeremy Paxman.<n>The law student has now revealed that he had help from YouTube and Wikipedia.

Eason Chow, 25, from Singapore, came up with the idea for his new product.<n>He says the capsules will cost around £4 for a pack of 20 and the machine will cost around £80.<n>Mr Chow says he came up with the idea after realising how much waste packaging is generated from coffee capsules each year.

Claire Nugent, 43, and Nigel Morter, 47, have been married for 14 years.<n>They restored a 1940s airfield control tower in Norfolk.<n>It now runs as a B&B.<n>They scour local North London markets for 1940s pieces.<n>It took four months to find a 1940s loo on reclamation yards.

Senators voted 19-0 to give the White House some of, but not all of its asks, and left in a signature feature of the bill giving Congress the authority to approve a final deal with Iran.<n>It now goes to the full Senate, where it is could pass with a veto-proof majority of more than 66 lawmakers.<n>The White House had said as recently as yesterday that the president would 'absolutely' veto as written.

Candice-Marie Fox claims to have cured her cancer with a fruit-only diet.<n>She says she was diagnosed with thyroid cancer in 2011.<n>She underwent surgery and radiation treatment.<n>Ms Fox says she has now 'got rid of it all'

Barcelona is a city on a beach. Not a city on a river, but on a proper sandy holiday beach.<n>The city has jaw dropping architecture, a fantastic nightlife and lots of art.<n>Andrea Catherwood stayed at the iconic Hotel Arts, a modern masterpiece of the city.

The tree was planted in January-Wabash Park in Ferguson, Missouri on Saturday as a dedication to the teenager, who was shot dead by a police officer last August.<n>But by Sunday, the branches had been stripped and the plaque at the base had been stolen.<n>The Ferguson Police Department is investigating but they do not have any suspects.<n>It is the third time a Brown memorial has been destroyed.

Millie-Belle Diamond has 115,000 Instagram followers.<n>She is the youngest baby in the world to have a large following on the social media site.<n>Her mum Schye Fox started posting photos of her daughter online when she was two months old.<n>She now makes $250 per post from fashion brands and children's brands.
Cressida, 26, models Mulberry's SS15 dresses and handbags.<n>Was formerly Prince Harry's girlfriend.<n>Shows off brand's iconic handbags and dresses.

Little Catalina from America was filmed emptying out the contents of the kitchen cupboards at home.<n>But when her father tells her to clean up her mess, she vehemently refuses with a heated - and rather cute - argument ensuing.

Comedian tweeted picture of Rebecca Francis lying next to dead giraffe.<n>Francis won Extreme Huntress reality TV show in 2010.<n>She regularly posts pictures of her kills on social media.<n>But Gervais was outraged by the image - which was retweeted thousands of times.

Mary Ann Diano was left homeless when the storms hit Staten Island, New York, in October 2012.<n>But she says it also brought her the love of her life and she and her partner Dennis Krauss plan to spend their winning on a new house.<n>The 62-year-old's home has lived in a trailer park in Connecticut every since the disaster.

The cocaine was seized by U.S. and Canadian forces in 19 separate incidents in the eastern Pacific Ocean near Central and South America.<n>It included a 1012-ton bust from a coastal freighter, the largest maritime drug interdiction in that area since 2009.<n>U.S. authorities have called it the most successful run for drug seizures in the area since 2009.

Gemma the pit bull was filmed at home in California enthusiastically greeting a baby boy named Elliot with kisses.<n>Despite Elliot's best efforts, Gemma keeps licking away.<n>After more than ten seconds, Gemma shows no signs of moving on.

Nikki Kelly, 24, thought she was suffering from cramps after long journey.<n>She kept her size 8 figure throughout her pregnancy and had no cravings.<n>She took the contraceptive pill and had periods for the whole nine months.<n>Gave birth to son James on the bathroom floor in 'three pushes'<n>Baby James is now three months old and healthy, weighing a healthy 6lbs.

David Zaslav was compensated $156.1million for his role as CEO of Discovery Communications in 2014.<n>This thanks to the success of shows like the once popular Here Comes Honey Boo Boo and his running of networks like OWN.<n>The amount is a huge boost from the $33million he received in 2013, with $22.5million of that also coming from stock awards.<n>This is far, far greater than the two television executives who made the most last year, Sumer Redstone and Les Moonves.

Adriana Giogiosa, 55, was reported missing by her brother in Madrid last week.<n>He could not contact her at house in Majadahonda, where she had been staying.<n>Police have arrested the landlord, a 32-year-old man with psychological problems.<n>They have found blood and a meat grinder at the property in quiet street.<n>Officers are also searching nearby rubbish dumps for four other people.

Two teenagers who masterminded Anzac Day terror plot had scouted police stations ahead of a possible attack.<n>A friend of the teenagers who are believed to be behind the plot said the death of Numan Haider was the moment 'we all became more radical'<n>Haider was killed by police last year after he attacked officers with a knife, and is believed to have planned an ISIS-like attack.<n>The two alleged ringleaders of the Anzac Day plot reportedly attended Haider's funeral.

Man, 29, from California, tore tendon in his thumb playing Candy Crush.<n>He had been playing the game for up to eight weeks and felt nothing at all.<n>Doctors said case shows video games can numb people's pain.

Marie D'Argent claims she suffered vertebral disc trauma, whiplash and nightmares when the elevator at The Princeton complex in Melbourne dropped suddenly on October 9.<n>The 55-year-old publicist says the fall also left her with a 'loss of libido','sexual discomfort and impairment' and 'curtailment of ­sexual adventurism'<n>She is suing the building owners' corporation and elevator service, Thyssenkrupp Elevator Australia.

The hole appeared a few weeks ago on the outskirts of Urumqi, in Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region in north-western China.<n>Experts can't get close enough to determine how deep the hole is.<n>The heat blasting from the 'ring of fire' has been measured at 792C from two metres away.<n>Locals told Chinese media that they had noticed the ground nearby had been warm underfoot for some time.

New Scottish drink-drive law was enacted on December 5.<n>The limit was cut from 80mg per 100ml of blood to 50mg per 100ml.<n>Bar sales have plummeted by 60 per cent since the new law was introduced.<n>The drop in sales is being blamed for stalling the country's financial growth.

Jordan Spieth, 21, won The Masters on Sunday and has been hailed as a new sporting hero.<n>A letter of thanks penned six years ago when he was a junior at Jesuit High School in Dallas has surfaced.<n>The grateful golfer wrote the letter to the Murphy family who had funded the scholarship that helped pay for his tuition.

Spain has eight in the list while Italy has seven and Australia had five.

Paul Bramley, 28, died when Andreas Lubitz locked captain out of cockpit.<n>But girlfriend Anneli Tiirik, 23, said she did not blame co-pilot.<n>She said: 'I cannot hate or blame someone for being sick'<n>Lubitz, 27, had hidden sick note and researched suicide methods.

Average woman will spend £18,000 on products for her face in her lifetime.<n>Many women make common mistakes that could lead to skin ageing faster.<n>FEMAIL asked the best dermatologists in the business for their top tips.

'Kick and kill' strategy aims to eradicate the virus by stimulating the immune system.<n>Researchers believe the injection could flush out dormant HIV hiding in white blood cells with a chemical 'kick'<n>It would then allow a boosted immune system to identify and kill the cells.<n>Based on a single patient case study by University College London.

The Black Book of Carmarthen is the earliest surviving medieval manuscript written solely in Welsh.<n>Contains some of the earliest references to Arthur and Merlin.<n>Researchers have found a series of hidden faces and message in it.

Family of Martina Riccioni are pleading with the Australian public to help them bring her body home to Italy.<n>Ms Riccioni and her friend Antoinettia Caffero, 21, were involved in a head-on collision on Easter Monday.<n>Ms Riccioni was thrown from the passenger seat of the car and was killed at the scene after suffering catastrophic injuries.<n>Her friend Ms Caffero remains in hospital in a critical condition.<n>The family cannot afford to bring her body home so have turned to crowdfunding.<n>The transportation of her body could cost as much as $20,000.

A violent brawl involving more than 70 teenagers was caught on camera by Queensland Police helicopter.<n>The brawl took place at a party at the Serbian Community Centre in Willawong on Tuesday night.<n>Police were called to disperse over 200 teenagers just before 10pm.<n>Four people have been arrested over the incident, including a 20-year-old man, an 18-year-old woman and two teenager girls aged 15.

Bentleys and Porsches more likely to break down than cheaper cars.<n>The two marques finished bottom of a 38-strong table of vehicle manufacturers judged on reliability.<n>Honda was the most reliable with Suzuki second and Toyota third.

Raghunandan Yandamuri, 29, of King of Prussia, Pennsylvania, was convicted in the 2012 murder of 10-month-old Saanvi Venna and her grandmother Satayrathi Venna.<n>He was sentenced to death for the grisly stabbing death of the baby and the suffocation death of her grandmother.<n>Yandamuri, who acted as his own lawyer during his trial, is appealing his sentence.<n>He says he would rather be executed than continue with his lawyers.

Estimates suggest around 1,000 iOS apps are vulnerable to the flaw.<n>This includes Uber, Microsoft's OneDrive and Movies by Flixster.<n>The flaw was reported at the end of last month and applies to AFNetworking.<n>It was active between 24 January and 25 March, and was patched on 25 March.<n>The day the flaw was announced, and subsequently patched, there were said to be 20,000 iOS apps using the AFNetworking library.<n>Some 40 per cent were not using the section of the library that applied to secure connections, leaving 5 per cent, or around 1,000 apps, at risk.

Dave Roberts bungee jumped off the Transporter Bridge over the River Tees.<n>He followed in the footsteps of his great-great-uncle Daniel McAllister.<n>Mr McAllister jumped off the bridge in 1913 for a bet worth just a sixpence.<n>Mr Roberts, who is running for mayor of Middlesbrough, survived the jump.<n>He said: 'I screamed like a child as I was going down, but thoroughly enjoyed it'

Hundreds of mourners gathered to farewell three children who died in a car crash.<n>One-year-old Bol Manyang, four-year-old Hanger and their twin brother Madit were laid to rest on Saturday.<n>Their mother Akon Guode and father Joseph Tito Manyang sat in the church's front row, alongside older sister Awel, 5.<n>Police are still investigating how the car ran off the road and ended up in a lake at Wyndham Vale in Melbourne's west on April 8.

Wat Pa Luangta Bua Yanasampanno has been told to hand over all 147 tigers.<n>The temple, just outside of Bangkok, has been open since 1994.<n>The department chief says the temple did not have permits for the cats.<n>The tigers will be moved to a wildlife centre in Chom Bung and Ratchaburi.

Ted Koran, 59, called the VA Suicide Hotline on Saturday night.<n>He was put on hold three times for 10 minutes at a time and never got through.<n>The veteran was struggling with the loss of his wife Karen who passed away six months ago.<n>The VA has a helpline which has 60 calls a day but is at breaking point.

Caitlin Kellie-Jones was diagnosed with Hypoxic Ischemic Encephalopathy.<n>The condition occurs when the brain does not receive enough oxygen.<n>Caitlin was given hypothermia to prevent any brain damage.<n>She is now ten months old and is recovering well from the condition.<n>Her parents are now raising money to help other babies with HIE.

Aerial photographs taken above Whitefish Bay on eastern Lake Superior, Ontario, show some of the freighters lined up across a frozen expanse.<n>They are carrying a variety of goods from Canadian grain to US iron and steel but are being hampered by slabs of ice the size of pick-up trucks.<n>The ships desperately need a path cut through the lake by Canadian and US ice breakers, which have been hampered by the extreme conditions.

Joshua Finbow, 23, Craig Stoner, 24, Simon Radford, 31, and Darren Smalley, 35, are being held by military police in Canada.<n>The four were arrested six days after the alleged attack at a barracks.<n>The sailors are charged with sexual assault causing bodily harm and group sexual assault.

The 18-carat gold rectangular piece was a gift to Lord Uxbridge.<n>He was given it by Trinity College Dublin when he served as Lord Lieutenant of Ireland.<n>The top has a finely embossed coat of arms with a frame of rocaille shells.<n>It was sold by Bonhams to a private collector for £100,900.
