Harvey Weinstein was spotted looking chipper and pleasant outside his New York City townhouse on Thursday.<n>Wife Georgina Chapman has been busy working on her upcoming bridal fashion show for her brand Marchesa.<n>The couple along with their two children all spent Easter together at their Connecticut home.

Mario Balotelli received 8,000 discriminatory messages online.<n>Chelsea received 20,000, Liverpool 19,000, Arsenal 12,000 and Manchester United and City both getting 11,000.<n>Kick It Out teamed up with Tempero and Brandwatch to produce the report.

Crystal O'Connor, owner of Memories Pizza in Walkerton, Indiana, says she stands by her decision not to cater a gay wedding.<n>She has closed her store, but said she will reopen again and $850,000 has been raised for the business by supporters in just two days.<n>O'Connor said she is'still shaken over this' and is not sure when she will open.

David Rylance, 47, stole more than £50,000 from his mother Margaret.<n>She was suffering from Alzheimer's and feared her money was going missing.<n>But in reality her son had been slowly siphoning the money away.<n>He spent it on gambling, a holiday and cinema tickets as well as living costs.<n>Rylance admitted theft and fraud and was jailed for two years and three months.

Sprawling house in Chelsea, west London, has been sold for £51million.<n>Built on site of old telephone exchange, it has nine bedrooms and a cinema.<n>Spread across four floors, it is 18 times the size of average new home.<n>Stamp duty alone, paid on top of price, is enough to pay 330 nurses a year.

Body of Barway Edwin Collins, 10, was pulled from the Mississippi River on Saturday.<n>Crystal Police Chief Stephanie Revering said authorities have electronic evidence that shows the boy's father, Pierre Collins, was in that area at the time the boy disappeared.<n>Revering said Collins, 33, is a primary suspect in the homicide investigation.<n>The Hennepin County Medical Examiner said the cause and manner of Barway's death are still being investigated.

Inside Abbey Road is a new web app that takes users on an interactive tour of the studios.<n>The interactive app shows sound engineers and producers working as they look into Studio 1.<n>More than 150 360-degree images make up the experience, which includes a range of information points.<n>The studios hosted the world's first live global broadcast - from none other than The Beatles - in 1967.

Lib Dem leader's wife hit the campaign trail on her own today.<n>She joined Home Office minister Lynne Featherstone in north London.<n>Pair met cast and crew of a short film examining the girls and gangs.<n>Miriam said the party's MPs 'deserve' to be re-elected in May.

Jourdan Dunn, 24, was severely bullied at school for her striking looks.<n>She was forced to be home-schooled as the situation was so bad.<n>The London-born beauty was scouted at Primark at just 15.<n>She has since become a household name and a celebrated regular on the runway.

Faiz Ikramulla, 35, was arrested and charged on Thursday with aggravated kidnapping.<n>His daughter, Aliya, was found Tuesday evening along a roadside near the forest preserve in Prospect Heights, Illinois.<n>She was crying and waving her hands.<n>Ikramulla will be extradited to Illinois to face charges.

Judy Eddingfield, 65, celebrated her 50th anniversary working at Winstead's restaurant in Kansas City last week.<n>'It's like my home away from home and I just love it here,' Eddingfield said.<n>Eddingfield says she remembers when French fries and a classic Coca-Cola cost just 65 cents at the same restaurant she's worked at for half-a-century.

The 13-year-old boy allegedly killed a teacher and injured three others.<n>He told classmates he was planning to 'kill all the teachers'<n>The boy is undergoing a psychiatric examination.<n>He is not facing criminal charges because he is under 14.

The White House is getting a new fence, but the Secret Service won't build a moat.<n>Instead they're recommending the addition of half-inch-thick steel spikes angled away from the fence.<n>A congressman suggested in November that the White House should build a moat to make it harder for would-be intruders to get in.<n>A Washington, DC television station mocked up what 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue might look like surrounded by a ditch filled with water.

Greenpeace activists boarded the Polar Pioneer drill rig 750 miles northwest of Hawaii on Monday.<n>The group said the activists would not interfere with the vessel's navigation.<n>The rig is under contract to Shell, which is planning to drill in the Arctic.<n>Shell has condemned the boarding and said it jeopardizes the safety of the crew and the protesters.

Alison Saunders' legal adviser was a barrister in same chambers as Lord Janner.<n>CPS confirmed it consulted Neil Moore over whether to prosecute Lord Janner.<n>Mr Moore was a barrister at 23 Essex Street where Daniel Janner worked.<n>Police officers probing allegations of child abuse offences against peer.<n>Mr Moore told Mrs Saunders he had been in chambers with Lord Janner's son.<n>CPS spokesman said Mr Moore had acted properly at all times.

Monitoring by Hebridean Whale and Dolphin Trust teams has seen the number of encounters increase by 68 per cent over the past 12 years.<n>Experts believe that global warming has led to pods moving north.<n>While they were once drawn to warmer waters above 10C south of the area, climate change is causing sea surface temperatures in the Hebrides to rise by around 0.5C a decade.<n>And warmer water species appear to be colonising new areas further north or closer to shore, the trust said.

Note left by chip shop owner when he went on holiday with his wife.<n>He laments the fact that he has to go youth hosteling with his family.<n>Note was posted around a month ago but has gone viral this week.

Researchers at the Technical University of Braunschweig, Germany, found that passive smoking affects plants too.<n>They showed for the first time that peppermint plants can take up high concentrations of nicotine from contaminated soils.<n>The finding may explain why some spices, herbal teas and medicinal plants have high concentrations of nicotine in them.

Argentina has branded British attempts to explore seas around Falklands 'illegitimate'<n>Claimed decision to increase military spending in South Atlantic was 'gunboat diplomacy'<n>Daniel Filmus, Argentina's secretary of state for the islands, said Argentina will mount a legal challenge but ruled out another conflict.

Andreas Lubitz may have used a chemical to force Captain Patrick Sodenheimer into the toilet.<n>Prosecutors believe Lubitz may have added a chemical to his Captain's coffee.<n>The 27-year-old may have also used his computer to research methods of killing himself.<n>Investigators are examining Lubitz's computer to determine his state of mind.

The former Baywatch star joined Maricopa County Sheriff Joe Arpaio on Wednesday to promote the benefits of an all-vegetarian diet to inmates.<n>Arpaio says cutting meat from the meals served to the more than 8,000 inmates has saved an estimated $200,000 per year.<n>Anderson and PETA have come under fire for their association with the polarizing Arpaio.<n>He has long faced criticism that he unfairly targets minorities for law enforcement.

The rare mammal has been making waves at the Taiji Whale Museum.<n>While bottlenose dolphins are typically grey, the mammal is completely white.<n>It is a result of the animals thin skin, which means its blood vessels can cause a change in skin tone depending on its emotional state.<n>The pink tone is a result of the animals thin skin, which means its blood vessels can cause a change in skin tone depending on their emotional state.

Charli, an eight-year-old girl from Australia, makes an estimated $127,000 (AUD $163,893) per month from the ad revenue generated from her popular YouTube channel.<n>Her channel CharlisCraftyKitchen is YouTube's largest food channel in less than three years.<n>The channel features child friendly tutorials for making everything from Minnie Mouse pops out of Oreos to princess teacup cookies.

Sophie Falkiner says she has been using girdles since she had her first child.<n>The Australian TV presenter says she discovered the benefits while interviewing Hollywood plastic surgeons for a work assignment years ago.<n>She says it's important for women to wear protective gear after surgery.<n>Jessica Alba also swears by girdles for getting her pre-baby bod back.

At least 30 people were injured last year in 32 butane explosions involving hash oil.<n>Washington's legal marijuana law in 2012 did not permit the production of hash or even edibles at home.<n>People make hash oil at home for the same reasons they make beer, wine or booze — to save money, make it to personal taste, or as a hobby.

Xie Hong Feng, 45, fell down elevator shaft and died in Ningbo City.<n>Property manager Yang Shao said Ms Xie's son pushed her down shaft.<n>Yang said she used triangular lock to open lift doors and help Ms Xie.<n>But there is no CCTV outside the elevator and police say Yang's statement is the only evidence.

Lucy is the oldest and most complete fossil of an early human ever found.<n>She was discovered in 1974 in Ethiopia and is around 40 per cent complete.<n>A new look at the skeleton suggests one of the vertebrae bones may belong to a baboon.
Vehicle can spin on the spot and park sideways.<n>Controlled by electrical signals sent from the car's rear.<n>Can be driven remotely at up to 70mph.

Hattie Gladwell, 19, from West Sussex has an ostomy bag.<n>Had emergency surgery for ulcerative colitis.<n>Condition caused her colon to become inflamed.<n>Had to have her colon removed and an ileostomy bag fitted.<n>Learned to live with the bag and her stoma.<n>Now shares her story on her blog morethanyourbag.com.

Thousands of purple-blue creatures known as velella velella are washing up on Oregon beaches thanks to strong winds.<n>They have a small blue sail on their bodies which means they are easily blown onto the shore.<n>They are not harmful to humans but will smell like fish as they decompose.

Cadbury is cutting the size of its beloved Freddo Frogs by 20 per cent.<n>The miniature chocolate amphibians, which weighed a plump 20g two years ago, will now weigh just 12g.<n>The downsizing of one of Australia’s most popular children’s chocolates was not widely announced but was in fact spotted by a shop owner who stocks the treats.<n>Cadbury still recommends the blocks are sold for $4.99 - but the retail price will remain the same.

Ground-Based Air Defense Directed Energy On-the-Move program.<n>Can be fitted to Humvee and Joint Light Tactical Vehicle.<n>System will be able to spot and track drones, then shoot them out of the sky.

Matthew Weathers is a maths teacher at Biola University in California.<n>Often posts videos of himself tricking his class on his YouTube channel.<n>This amusing clip would have engaged even the sleepiest student.<n>The pair then begin arguing and the pupil appears on the screen.

Janet Brown was found battered to death at her home in Radnage, Buckinghamshire.<n>Builders found her naked body at the bottom of the stairs of her home.<n>Mrs Brown's two daughters described their mother as a 'kind and loving nurse'<n>Police said they now have the suspect's DNA after 20 years of investigation.

Miley, 22, attended Rock And Roll Hall Of Fame Induction Ceremony on Saturday.<n>Social media users noticed she had bushy underarm region.<n>One said she should shave it and another said it was 'disgusting'

Relationship counsellor Susan Pease Gadoua says we should marry for life.<n>She says that traditional weddings set people up for failure.<n>Instead, she suggests signing a Starter Marriage contract.<n>This is a fixed-term contract, meaning that it can last for life.<n>She says this would work better for many modern day couples.

A Colorado wastewater facility went up in flames on Friday after a fracking tanker was hit by lightning.<n>The fire began when lightning struck a water storage tank, launching it into the air.<n>The water contained traces of hydrocarbons and petroleum as a result of hydraulic fracturing, which ignited.<n>The tanker was near an injection well where fracking wastewater is pumped into the ground.<n>Nearby homes were evacuated, however no injuries were reported.<n>The site is located near the intersection of Weld County Road 47 and Weld County Road 64, just northeast of the Greeley Airport.

The Obamas ditched the White House and the press pool for an impromptu hike at Great Falls Park in Virginia on Sunday.<n>Despite the earbuds, Sasha, 14, and Malia, 17, seemed to enjoy their time outdoors.<n>The president took a selfie with an onlooker before starting along the woody trail.

New exhibition shows the buildings that were destroyed before Landmark Law was established.<n>The law was signed by Mayor Robert Wagner on April 19, 1965, and upheld by the Supreme Court in 1978.<n>St John's Chapel, which was built in Soho in 1807, was demolished in 1918 as the city moved to widen the street next to it.<n>The Randall Memorial Church in Snug Harbor, Staten Island, fell into disrepair and was demolished by 1952.

Tweet published ahead of Liverpool's clash against Newcastle tonight.<n>It read: 'Newcastle have suffered more Kop beatings over the last 20 years'<n>It was accompanied by a smirking picture of Liverpool boss Brendan Rodgers.<n>Twitter users have condemned the bookmakers for the 'disgusting' tweet.

Singer argued with security after being stopped at the artists' entrance where Drake was performing at the event in Indio, California.<n>A video appears to shows Bieber being put in a chokehold and escorted from the area.<n>Sources close to Bieber said he voluntarily left and was considering taking legal action against the security guards.

Staff attorneys at the U.S. Justice Department's antitrust division are nearing a recommendation to block Comcast Corps. $45.2 billion proposal to merge with Time Warner Cable Inc.<n>The merger has been under extreme scrutiny since it was announced last February.<n>If the deal is successful, Comcast would become the nation's leading cable and internet provider.<n> competitors fear that the deal would allow the company to unilaterally set programming prices for the entire industry.

Jamie Silvonek, 14, is accused of conspiring with her soldier boyfriend by text message to have her mother killed.<n>Cheryl Silvonek's body was found stabbed in a shallow grave about 50 miles northwest of Philadelphia.<n>Jamie Silvonek was sent to the county jail this month after she was charged as an adult and is in the women's housing unit, away from older inmates.<n>Her boyfriend, 20-year-old Caleb Barnes, who is from El Paso, Texas, but was stationed at Fort Meade, Maryland, is charged with homicide.

Medical incident officer sent to Worcestershire Royal Hospital last Friday.<n>Came as West Midlands Ambulance Service demanded action over delays.<n>Hospital trust admitted circumstances were 'less than ideal'<n>Comes as figures show it has missed four-hour waiting time target for 28th week.
Damian Lewis says redheads everywhere are doing well.<n>He says it's a 'unique moment in recent history'<n>Famous redheads include Prince Harry, Ed Sheeran and Julianne Moore.

Zane Gbangbola died at home – in the middle of the night – after being poisoned.<n>For months authorities ruled out fears that gas had come from landfill.<n>Instead, they insisted carbon monoxide from a faulty pump had caused death.<n>But damning new evidence proves authorities knew for 14 months.<n> Zane's parents have faced a 'wall of silence' over their son's death.<n>No traces of carbon monoxide had been detected at the home;.<n>No gas was found in the house by firefighters;.<n>No traces of cyanide were found by experts;.<n>No

Swedish scientists analysed more than 10,000 families with children aged two to 14 who did not have the condition.<n>They looked at whether there was any family conflict, a change of family structure, interventions from social services or unemployment.<n>Subsequent to this, 58 children were diagnosed with type 1 diabetes.<n>Many were among those badly affected by events in their formative years.

Nasa's Landsat 7 satellite captured the image in the Erg Chech, a desolate sand sea in southwestern Algeria.<n>It shows 'ribbons' of sand and patterned stripes known as linear dunes.<n>But the exact cause of these longitudinal structures is not known.

Tunnel was uncovered by Mexican soldiers in the border town of Tijuana.<n>They had to descend a 10ft ladder to enter the tunnel wired with lights.<n>Officials believe it would have surfaced a short distance from the border.

NRA CEO Wayne LaPierre told the group's annual meeting people must stand up against gun-control efforts.<n>He said nobody'should be forced to face evil with bare hands'<n>LaPierre celebrated the Republican majority in the U.S. Senate as evidence of the group's political clout.

Ann Malsbury, 22, of Coventry, battered ex-boyfriend Lee Judson, 21, with a saucepan.<n>She also tried to throttle him with iPod lead and stabbed him with knife.<n>But she was cleared of intent to cause serious injury after affray plea.

Daniel Pena had spent hours planning the perfect way to pop the question to his girlfriend Alex.<n>The pair had been driving along a route together when Daniel erected a series of signs along the road.<n>Alex missed the crucial first sign with her name on but caught the second which read: Will... you... Marry.<n>She gasped when the next sign revealed the marriage proposal as a joke when she read LOL JK, meaning 'just kidding'

Liu Siying was pictured grimacing as Hamilton sprayed champagne at her.<n>The 23-year-old said she was just doing her job and wasn't annoyed.<n>Shanghai Institute of Visual Art graduate said she was told to stand.<n>Campaigners have called Hamilton's behaviour'selfish and inconsiderate'

Luiz Antonio from Brazil was presented with a fanciful dish of octopus gnocchi at the dinner table.<n>But instead of digging into the seafood feast he starts asking about where the tentacled creature set before him came from.<n>His mother reassures him that she only cooked using the octopuses 'little legs chopped'

Five sailors committed suicide on HMAS Stirling in Western Australia.<n>Families were not told of previous attempts to take their own lives.<n>The sailors were stationed or had been stationed on the base over two years.<n>They took their own lives after using ice, binge drinking and bullying.

Duncan Burton, 57, was arrested last week and charged with sexual assault.<n>He was released in November 2012 after 14-years behind bars.<n>Burton was convicted of trying to distribute five kilos of cocaine.<n>He was not eligible for a city permit to drive a cab in Houston.<n>Burton did not have a firm background check and had never applied for an exemption.

Tony Abbott was asked to have a drink by Sydney Bats coach Simon Carradous.<n>He appeared happy to oblige and skolled a schooner of beer in six seconds.<n>Anti-drinking campaigners said he was glorifying binge drinking.<n>Julie Robert, a cultural studies professor at the University of Technology Sydney, said it was 'problematic'<n>She said it set up a culture that drinking isn't about socialising with friends, it's about how quickly and how much you can drink.

Libby Jane Wilson was playing in a tunnel when the dog attacked her.<n>Her father kicked the pet away before the owner fled the scene.<n>The two-year-old was left with two puncture marks on her face.<n>Her mother Christie Wilson, 21, says the dog was not on a lead.

Evelin Mezei, 12, was last seen by her mother in Stratford, London, last night.<n>She was seen on CCTV with an unknown man on a city street at 10.30pm.<n>Police traced her this morning and said she is safe and well.

Kenneth Morgan Stancil III, 20, allegedly shot dead Ron Lane at Wayne County Community College in North Carolina on Monday morning.<n>Lane had supervised Stancil under a work-study program but is believed to have recently fired him.<n>Stancil's mother has claimed that Lane had made 'inappropriate sexual advances toward' her son.<n>Police are investigating the shooting as a possible hate crime.

Sarah Brady, 73, died from pneumonia on Friday.<n>She and her husband James crusaded against gun violence after he was shot during an assassination attempt on former US president Ronald Reagan in 1981.<n>The Brady Campaign and Center to Prevent Gun Violence, named in their honor, said they were 'heartbroken' at the news of her death.<n>The group said the Brady Handgun Violence Prevention Act, passed in 1993, has blocked an estimated two million prohibited gun purchases.

Labour leader Ed Miliband was criticised for robotic performance in debate.<n>But he was also reading from motivational notes during leaders' clash.<n>One note reminded him to be a 'happy warrior' and another said 'negative'<n>He also planned put-downs on David Cameron, such as on deficit.

The four Vinceni sisters have come through the ordeal as happy and well-adjusted children.<n>They are 'elegant, gracious, reserved and studious', 60 Minutes reporter Tara Brown told Daily Mail Australia.<n>The girls have established healthy and happy lives in Italy and speak to their mum every night.<n>They are aware of the hysteria the distressing scenes of their exit caused and 'have a bit of regret about how they handled it'

15 men arrested on suspicion of'multiple aggravated murder motivated by religious hate' after 12 Christians were allegedly thrown overboard.<n>Survivor claims men tried to throw other Christians off the side of the vessel.<n>But they huddled together to form a 'human chain' to stop them.

Tulsa County Sheriff's Office 'pushed records through'<n>Three supervisors removed for refusing to sign off on forged hours.<n>Robert Bates, 73, is charged with second-degree manslaughter.<n>He shot dead Eric Harris, 44, on April 2, by mistake.

Abdirahman Sheik Mohamud, 23, pleaded not guilty to charges of attempting to provide and providing material support to terrorists.<n>Mohamud's older brother, Abdifatah Aden, was killed fighting with the Nusra Front,.<n>according to the indictment.<n>Mohamud's high school friend Mohamed Elrayah, who had gotten the 'I'm' from Mohamud, said he was 'chilling in Istanbul'

Shane Dunn, 25, met Ian Garrod, 55, on gay dating app Grindr.<n>He then went back to his home in Medway, Kent, for sex with the man.<n>But when Mr Garrod sat on the bed, Dunn stabbed him in the throat.<n>He then fled, leaving the victim for dead with a 6cm-deep wound.<n>Dunn was caught after police examined two cigarette butts found in Mr Garrod's garden.<n>Both had DNA linking to Dunn and he was found guilty of wounding with intent.<n>He has now been jailed for 12 years after being cleared

Jade Ruthven, 33, of Perth, Western Australia, was shocked when she found the scathing note in her mailbox.<n>The letter claimed to be from ‘a few of the girls’ and cruelly criticised her for posting photos of her six-month-old daughter Addison on Facebook.<n>The author claims the rant was written on behalf of everyone who views Jade’s Facebook posts.

More than one million albums sold on vinyl for first time in two decades.<n>UK’s first official weekly vinyl chart has been established.<n>Inaugural top spots in album rankings and two top places in singles list have been claimed by Noel Gallagher.

Jondrew Lachaux, 39, is married to the teenager's mother, 38-year-old Kellie Phillips.<n>They have six children together while the teen is from another relationship.<n>In August, Lachaux and Phillips decided to go on a road trip in California.<n>While they were away, the teen gave birth in her mom's bed - she did not have any medical help and did not take the newborn to the hospital.<n>During this time, her sister died - the cause of the death is under investigation.

The first print ad, which shows images of various female American Apparel employees, has the words 'Hello Ladies' emblazoned across the page.<n>The images featured in the ad were also posted on the company's Instagram account last month in celebration of International Women's Day.

Kamron Taylor, 23, was awaiting sentencing for murder when he escaped.<n>He 'beat a guard unconscious, took his uniform, keys and SUV and sped off'<n>Police received a tip off about a man with a tattooed name on his neck.<n>Officers chased him three blocks before he was captured.<n>Taylor is being held on weapons charges until he can be returned to police.

Robert Clark, 96, spent his life savings on his care and now needs it.<n>Brent Council said it was no longer able to pay for a live-in carer for him.<n>Mr Clark is blind, deaf in one ear and dependent on a wheelchair.<n>The council said it was cheaper to move him into a residential care home.<n>But Help for Heroes has launched a fundraising drive to help Mr Clark.<n>The charity has so far raised £2,736.22 of the £5,000 needed.

Max Verschuuren, 21, was shot in the back on Saturday night.<n>His friend mistook him for a deer and fired a.270 rifle.<n>He was on his way to hunt a felled deer in the Te Urewera forest, North Island.<n>Mr Verschuuren tumbled down a hill in a desperate attempt to escape.<n>He was taken to hospital and was expected to be discharged on Monday.

Major General James Post III made the comment to 300 airmen at Nellis Air Force Base on Jan. 10.<n>He was fielding questions about the status of the A-10 Warthog.<n>Congress has so far successfully blocked efforts to retire the plane.<n>The incident added fuel to a controversy over efforts to retire the low-flying, tank-killer aircraft.

Bonnie Doll is Australia's answer to Lara Croft in the gaming world.<n>The 28-year-old gamer lives in Brisbane and streams Call Of Duty live.<n>She has given up her job in hospitality to focus on her gaming career.<n>Bonnie has more than 45,000 global followers on streaming platform Twitch.

Sylvia Freedman was on holiday at Avoca Beach in the Central Coast, about 95kms north of Sydney, when she filmed the scene.<n>The foam was swept off the top of the waves because the water was so churned up and its mixed with sand.<n>Ms Freedman and her family were forced to leave the holiday house after their power went out on Tuesday.

Cameron Hooker, 61, was handed a 104-year sentence in 1985 for kidnap, torture and rape of Colleen Stan.<n>Stan was known as 'the Girl in the Box' after it was revealed she was forced into a coffin-like structure for 23 hours a day during for much of her captivity.<n>Despite Hooker's century-long jail term, he was allowed to request parole seven years earlier than under the normal rules.<n>But the parole board at Corcoran State Prison, where Hooker is incarcerated, denied the request and have stated the inmate won't get another hearing for 15 years

Veteran host was warming up audience ahead of his show on Monday.<n>Told college employee: 'Treat a lady like a wh–e, and a wh–e like a lady'<n>But joke received a frosty reception from the shocked crowd.<n>Several audience members at the Ed Sullivan Theater were furious over the joke.

The average listener spent just ten hours a week tuning in to BBC radio.<n>This was 14 per cent down on a decade earlier, when listeners clocked up an average of 11.6 hours a week.<n>Sources blamed the downward trend on people leading faster-paced lives.

Minute-long clip shows the S300 rocket barely taking off before plummeting.<n>A small thud can be heard and debris can be heard flying off the launchpad.<n>Seconds later, the rocket goes out of view and a huge explosion can be heard.

Alan Barnes was left too scared to return to his home after the attack.<n>The 67-year-old was knocked to the ground by drug addict Richard Gatiss.<n>A fund was set up by beautician Katie Cutler which raised £330,000.<n>Mr Barnes was today handed the keys to his new two-bedroom terrace house.<n>He said it was 'lovely' to have his independence back after the attack.

120 dairy workers can tuck into a fine-dining meal for as little as £2 at Yeo Valley's staff canteen.<n>All the food is made from organic and locally sourced produce, which is served to staff in the Blagdon countryside.<n>The eaterie, which has been hailed as the world's best staff canteen, has now opened its doors to the public.

Roman Ehrhardt, a senior communications major at Mississippi State, was secretly completing a project, in which he had to violate a societal norm.<n>One of his classmates shared a photo of him grilling bacon on a George Foreman grill in class on Monday.<n>The photo has been retweeted nearly 1,000 times since it was posted.

Chase Culpepper, 17, was told by DMV officials that she had to remove make-up for her license photo last year.<n>The South Carolina teen, who was born male but identifies as female, sued the agency.<n>The settlement includes a requirement that the DMV officially apologize to her and allow her to take a license photo with her everyday makeup.

General Martin Dempsey, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, apologized to Debbie Lee, whose son Marc was killed in Ramadi in 2006.<n>Dempsey had said the city was 'not symbolic in any way' while discussing operations against ISIS.<n>Lee, from Surprise, Arizona, was shaking and reduced to tears at the remark.<n>Her son was the first Navy SEAL to die in Iraq.

David Cameron and Boris Johnson slam SNP plans to prop up Labour.<n>London Mayor says it would mean 'truckfuls of taxpayers' dosh growling'<n>Salmond caught boasting he would write Labour's budget if SNP wins.

Duchess of Cambridge has the power to send sales of high-street designs sky-rocketing.<n>Anything Prince George has been seen wearing has gone on to sell out.<n>A little girl could bring in £150m for the British economy, expert says.

Mikki Nicholson, 36, stepped in front of a train after suffering verbal abuse.<n>She had planned to move to Newcastle, but changed her mind months before.<n>Inquest heard she was taunted in Carlisle for being different and'stigmatised'<n>She was once ranked as fourth-best Scrabble player in the world.<n>Coroner said she had been well supported and recorded a verdict of suicide.

Wannabe singer Kristina Karo claims Kunis stole her pet hen as a child.<n>Karo, now living in Los Angeles, is suing Kunis for $5,000.<n>Claims moving to LA has brought back bad memories of 'Doggie' theft.

Jaclyn Methuen and Ryan Ranellone shared a bedroom on their first night together.<n>The newlyweds were brought closer together by the process of finding their new homes.<n>The 30-year-old previously admitted that she hadn't had sex in two years and hoped it was like 'riding a bike'

Doctors are concerned with the increasing trend that's seeing people cut whole food groups out of their diets.<n>Experts warn that shunning an entire food group is unsustainable.<n>They say this could damage one's relationship with food and could be doing more harm than good.

Couple complained about loud sex six times in one Brooklyn apartment block.<n>The maintenance worker, 25, pops round for sex with his girlfriend, 30, who is now four months pregnant.<n>She invites him round for romps around her entire apartment.<n>The couple said they didn't see why they were being so noisy.

Madison Avery Crotty, from San Diego, is seen crying until her doting dad starts his deep breathing technique.<n> crackling, deep-sea type sound is reminiscent of what Madison might have heard in the womb just a month earlier.<n>The Dark Lords of the Sith's heavy-breathing sound was devised by American sound engineer Ben Burtt in the Seventies.

Patrick Jones of Buzz60 interviewed a man in New York City who showed his own catcalling techniques.<n>The interview was meant to highlight the problem of catcalling, which women have called 'horrible' and 'uncomfortable'

English manifesto will be launched by David Cameron and William Hague.<n>Will pledge to introduce 'English votes for English laws' to stop SNP.<n>Hague expected to warn England risks being 'held to ransom' by SNP.<n>Will also commit Tories to dozens of new road schemes and Cancer Drugs Fund.

Sacha Whitehead, 26, received donations after posting a call to action on Facebook.<n>The financial adviser spent the night with her sister Lexi handing the generous contributions out to the homeless.<n>She was spurred into action after reading a friend's Facebook status.<n>Whitehead admits she questioned her decision to leave the safety of her home at the peak of the storm.

Mered Medhanie heard laughing on wiretap about overloading migrant ships.<n>Second trafficker Ermias Ghermay declared last summer that 'they probably died'<n>Italian police have released a photofit of Ghermay as they seek to track him down.

Belle Gibson said she had terminal cancer.<n>She said she was inspired by the power of healthy eating.<n>She has now admitted she made up the story.<n>Wendy L. Patrick PhD says we fell for her because 'we love heartwarming stories'

Patrick James Fredricksen, 30, has previous convictions for unlawful sexual activity with a minor and impersonating a firefighter.<n>He is said to have stolen a car and driven it to an empty school bus.<n>He then allegedly tried to pick up a child and had a list of their names and addresses in the bus.<n>He was stopped on his way to pick up another child in eastern Utah.

Institute for Fiscal Studies said Labour would borrow £90bn more than Tories.<n>This would rise to £280bn in extra debt by the end of the next decade.<n>Labour said the think-tank had made 'wrong assumptions' about its plans.

Michael David Ikeler, 36, of Torrance, has been charged with three felony counts of sexual assault in relation to the abduction of a two-year-old girl.<n>The little was found naked and with obvious injuries in a restaurant parking lot two hours after she was abducted from a car wash.<n>A neighbor saw CCTV footage of the car and noticed Ikeler changing the number plates and tinting his car.<n>DNA evidence linked Ikeler to the crime.

Bhadreshkumar Chetanbhai Patel, 24, faces a federal charge of fleeing to avoid prosecution.<n>Patel is believed to have beat his 21-year-old wife, Palak Bhadreskumar Patel, to death with a knife inside a Dunkin' Donuts in Maryland on April 12.<n>The FBI announced on Wednesday that a $20,000 reward is being offered for information that leads to his arrest.<n>Patel was last seen at a hotel near Newark International Airport shortly after his wife was killed.

The Portland, Oregon-based band, which plays a kind of.<n>grunge music it calls Chinatown Dance Rock, applied fortrademarks in 2010 and 2011.<n>Was rejected both times on the grounds the name disparaged Asians.<n>The band argued that in acting as a'referee of political.<n> correctness,' the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office violated the.<n>First Amendment.

Benidorm is bidding for Unesco World Heritage status.<n>The resort is famous for British sitcom and adult entertainer Sticky Vicky.<n> Sociology professor Mario Gaviria is behind the application.<n>He says Benidorm should be praised for being accessible to all.

Tom Sturridge is best known as the fiance of Sienna Miller.<n>But he is set to take his fame to another level this year.<n>He is starring in the West End play American Buffalo.<n>And he is set to star with Ryan Gosling in a new film Weightless.

Robert Downey Jr walked out of interview after being asked about his personal life.<n>Presenter Krishnan Guru-Murthy looked bemused as he left the room.<n>The actor was in London to promote his new film Avengers: Age of Ultron.

Dusty the kangaroo was found on the side of the road in Western Australia in 2013.<n>He now spends his days with Ashley and Felicity Stewart's dogs Lilly and Rosie on their farm near Esperance.<n>The couple believe Dusty thinks he is a dog, and rides around in the back of their truck.<n>He sleeps with the dogs on a dog bed, eats with them, and often tries to sneak dog treats when he can.

A woman found a mildly venomous snake in her shopping trolley.<n>She was doing her grocery alone at Coles in Caboolture, north of Brisbane.<n>She pushed the trolley up an escalator before realising the snake.<n>Sunshine Coast Snake Catchers 24/7 Richie Gilbert removed the snake.<n>He released it back into the bushland just kilometres away.

Kimberley Donoghue, 28, from South Wales broke her leg and a bone in her foot.<n>She was carrying a box of wedding decorations down stairs when she fell.<n>The 28-year-old was wheeled into church by her dad and had to sit to take her vows.<n>The family are planning another party in the summer to celebrate without her cast.

Ashton Taylor, 21, from Perth, has slammed Whole Pantry founder Belle Gibson.<n>She has undergone 15 separate brain operations and hundreds of tests.<n>Miss Taylor said an apology from Gibson won't cut it for her.<n>Gibson admitted in an interview that her cancer story was a lie.

Deborah Roberts, 53, forced wet wipe into Phyllis Hadlow's mouth to stop screaming.<n>She also poured water over dementia patient at Kent and Canterbury Hospital.<n>Roberts found guilty of ill-treatment but avoided prison sentence.

Rupa Huq is standing for Ed Miliband's party in Ealing Central and Acton.<n>She actively campaigned against the Iraq War, boasting about the fact on her website.<n>But she has not returned the money to Mr Blair after he made donations to 106 local campaigns in target seats.<n>She said fellow candidates who had turned down the cash were ‘sticking their noses up’ at Mr Blair.

The blaze took place at a building located on a Flint intersection, and started at about 1pm on Wednesday.<n>A strip club used to be housed at the site, fire officials told local media.<n>The building was destroyed and an investigation into what was behind the blaze continues.

Alice Smellie asked industry experts to find out if it’s vital to buy new supplies.<n>Almost three-quarters of UK holidaymakers are at risk of UV exposure because they use out-of-date sun cream.<n>Out-of-date lotions may separate and not spread evenly, meaning you may not be completely covered with vital UV filters.

Crooks convinced victim his debit cards needed to be recalled.<n>Pair posed as bank staff and persuaded victim to hand over his PIN.<n>They left cards on his doorstep for 'couriers' to collect.<n>But less than two hours later they were filmed stealing £150 from cash machine.<n>Police have released footage in a bid to identify the pair and bring them to justice.

Militants fighting for Boko Haram in Nigeria release first images since ISIS allegiance.<n>Images show jihadis casually posing in front of sinister black and white flag.<n>They carry all the logos and artwork typically seen in official ISIS releases.<n>This suggests Middle East-based militants have taken full control of propaganda.<n>Comes as Nigerian soldiers have invaded the Islamist's last known stronghold.

AJ Francis, 24, is a regular user of the taxi app and sent an application.<n>The defensive tackle plans to work for Uber during the off-season.<n>He said: 'You know what's better than NFL money? More money'

Penny Davison, 59, is the ex-wife of gambler and racehorse trainer Albert Davison.<n>He made a fortune by landing a series of six-figure bets on his own horses.<n>When he died, aged 73, he owned a seven-bedroom country estate in Surrey.<n>But before he died, in 2011, he and his second wife fought a bitter battle over his fortune, before she was awarded just £750,000.<n>Now his ex-wife has appeared back in court, seeking to boost her slice to more than £1million by claiming his death has freed up more of his cash.

Officer Michael Rapiejko slammed into armed robbery suspect Mario Valencia.<n>Video showed him mounting the curb and running him over last week.<n>Inquiry recording reveals he told investigators it was 'lethal force'<n>Valencia had allegedly fired a shot from a rifle into the air and was walking towards other officers in Marana, northwest of Tucson, Arizona.
The three cubs were born on Tuesday at the Columbus Zoo in Ohio.<n>Their mother, Irisa, had mated before but never conceived.<n>This is the third litter sired by 11-year-old, Foli, since 2012.

Clinton Foundation received millions from company tied to Russian atomic agency.<n>Bill Clinton received $500,000 for a Moscow speaking engagement.<n>He earned more than $100 million for his speeches from 2001 to 2013.<n>New poll shows only 38 per cent of Americans believe she is honest and trustworthy.
Evnika Saadvakass became a YouTube sensation when she was five.<n>The video was viewed around three million times.<n>Two years on the youngster has returned to update the world on her progress.

Brendan Cordina found his grandfather's World War II medals in the Northern Territory after two years of searching.<n>He drove 3500 kilometres in four days to be reunited with the family treasures.<n>But on his arrival at the Darwin Military Museum, Mr Cordina was refused the medals and told that they 'were more important to the museum'<n>Mr Cordina started a petition on change.org to have the museum send replicas of the medals to him.<n>He has received 15,000 signatures in under 24 hours.

Victim, 18, was hit over the head 20 times with a rock and dragged into garden.<n>She was then raped and left for dead in Beeston, Leeds, last month.<n>West Yorkshire police have released a new e-fit of the attacker.<n>She will speak out in tonight's episode of Crimewatch in which she tells reporters she is too scared to sleep for fear of reliving the ordeal in her dreams.

Bonds was convicted of obstruction of justice in 2011 for his testimony before a grand jury in 2003.<n>He was convicted of the obstruction charge in 2011, and a three-judge panel of the 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals unanimously upheld the conviction in 2013.<n>But the larger group, which listened to arguments from prosecutors and Bonds' lawyers last September, concluded there was insufficient evidence his initial evasive answer was material to the grand jury's probe.<n>'I am humbled and truly thankful for the outcome as well as the opportunity our judicial system affords to all individuals to seek justice,' Bonds said in a

Alex Vella, 61, the president of the Rebels outlaw motorcycle gang, has failed in a bid to re-enter Australia.<n>The Federal Court ruled unanimously against him this week.<n>Vella is stranded in Malta after the government cancelled his visa while he was overseas.<n>Police say he led a violent gang involved in kidnapping, extortion and drug dealing.<n>Vella has 24 family members in Australia, including a wife, sons and an elderly mother.

Yamini Karanam, 26, struggled to understand things she had read.<n>She also felt lost in conversations and felt unable to speak.<n>She sought medical help and was diagnosed with a pineal tumour.<n>Surgeons feared it was a cancerous growth, but discovered it was a teratoma - a growth containing bone, hair and teeth.<n>Teratomas are very rare and have only been seen two times before.

Google's Project Fi switches between Wi-Fi and cellular networks.<n>Company is selling the basic phone service for $20 a month.<n>Each gigabyte of data will cost $10 a month.<n>Google promises Nexus 6 will automatically connect with the fastest network available.

The alarm at the Houston home failed in September 2013 and the Secret Service took until December to replace it.<n>It came despite a recommendation in 2010 that the alarm be replaced because it 'had exceeded its life cycle'<n>The agency assigned an employee to watch the home throughout the time it was without an alarm.<n>The alarm is the latest in a string of blunders by the agency.

Study compared its results to the most severe emissions scenarios.<n>It says 'climate wiggles' could cause our planet to warm up much faster.<n>These so-called 'climate wiggles' could skew the reliability of climate models.<n>The research, uses observed data, rather than the more commonly used climate models, to estimate decade-to-decade variability.

The three men, who are in their 50s, were questioned over night by police.<n>They were arrested on suspicion of the murder of the chef in 2009.<n>North Yorkshire Police said the trio have been released on bail.<n>Detectives are still looking for evidence which could lead to her body.<n>A man was arrested in March in connection with the case.<n>He remains on police bail and is being questioned over the murder.

The unidentified pilot was flying a six-seat Cessna 310 aircraft on December 12, 2014 at Jabiru Airport, southeast of Darwin.<n>He was carrying two adults and three children on board when he became distracted by one of the passengers.<n>The Australian Air Transport Safety Bureau (ATSB) released its report on Wednesday into the 'wheels up landing'<n>The pilot was'relatively new to the C-310' and unfamiliar with the plane equipment.

3.8million crimes were recorded by police in England and Wales last year.<n>A record number of rapes and other sex crimes were logged, up 32%.<n>Experts say rise is partly because victims are'more willing' to report.<n>Comes after high-profile convictions of Rolf Harris and Stuart Hall.

Marissa Holcomb was held at gunpoint by an armed robber on March 31.<n>He made off with $400 from the Popeyes in Channelview, Texas.<n>She refused to pay it back, and was fired less than two days later.<n>Popskies have now offered to take her back and give her $2,000 backpay.<n>But she is unsure whether she wants to go back to work.<n>'I don't want to go back to a business where I'm treated the same,' she said.

Auschwitz-Birkenau State Museum has had 250,000 visitors already this year.<n>Site in Owicim, Poland, has urged potential visitors to book ahead.<n>It has seen a rise of more than 40 per cent compared with last year.
Kate, 33, is due to give birth to her second child in the coming days.<n>Having two children is significantly harder than having one.<n>Expert Emily-Jane Clark has compiled a list of ways to cope.

Ben Thurlow had been drinking in pubs in Driffield when he was attacked.<n>The 23-year-old shoved a paramedic as she tended to his head injury.<n>He then attacked Rebecca Hudson again as she tried to treat the wound.<n>Paramedics called Thurlow's friends and family in an attempt to calm him down.<n>Police were then called and he was taken to Hull Royal Infirmary.<n>Thurlow was given a four month sentence, suspended for 12 months.

Carrie Reichert, 43, claims she kissed Prince Harry on infamous party night.<n>She says she felt 'overdressed' when she saw him playing strip billiards.<n>In new book, she recounts events of night in Las Vegas three years ago.<n>In January, she said she planned to use a pair of the Prince's underpants.

Gareth Blanks was attacked by a gang because he looks vulnerable.<n>The 31-year-old was kicked and punched more than 20 times in the attack.<n>He is recovering at home but it will take him a long time to recover.<n>More than 1,500 people have joined a Facebook group to support him.

Cities around the world have earned their nicknames from the past.<n>Some refer to the industry found in the city, others refer to the environment.<n>Las Vegas is known as Sin City because of a street that was a brothel.<n>Singapore is referred to as 'Lion City' because of a mix of a mermaid and a lion.

Barclays faced barrage of criticism from long-suffering investors.<n>Shareholders are reeling from big losses in their investments and pension funds.<n>Chairman Sir David Walker defended the bank’s decision to pay out £1.86billion in bonuses.

Jamie Jewitt, 24, and Henry Rogers, 22, both weighed over 18st.<n>Henry went on a strict diet and dropped to 12st.<n>After two years of solid training, he landed a job at Abercrombie & Fitch.<n>Jamie moved to New York alone to pursue his career in modelling.<n>He weighed 15st and was so self-conscious he barely posed for photos.<n>The pair have since fronted campaigns for Tom Ford, Armani, Prada and Dolce & Gabbana.

Tesco announced a record annual loss of £6.38billion yesterday.<n>Loss is largest ever declared by a British retailer and reflects shift in shopping habits away from big supermarkets towards smaller budget stores.<n>Firm is also cutting back on future expansion, with the cancellation of more than 50 ‘big box’ stores.

Wesley Burton, a father-of-three and popular radio host at KPFA in Berkeley, California, was killed in a hit-and-run in the early hours of Saturday morning.<n>The crash occurred near the Berkeley-Oakland city line and police say the hit-and-run driver fled the on foot.<n>Emergency personnel attempted life-saving measures, but Burton was pronounced dead at the scene - just blocks from his home.<n>His wife Lucrecia has made a tearful plea for anyone with information to come forward and speak to the police.

Nike features prominently on leaflet distributed in ISIS' de facto capital Raqqa.<n>Wars jihadis about items of clothing they are no longer allowed to wear.<n>Comes after one militant compared brand's name to a Christian cross.<n>Another argued it was perfectly acceptable to wear Nike products because they are 'comfy and good quality, unlike crosses'

Romanian company MB Telecom has revealed the Roboscan 2M Aeria.<n>It uses a cone of radiation to sweep across planes and look inside.<n>The device is accurate enough to find a filament in a light bulb.<n>But the radiation it emits is not safe for passengers yet.<n>It can be used to detect weapons and other contraband in small or medium-sized jets that land at low-security airports.

The four Nordic tourists were on their way to see Les Misérables on Broadway when they saw a brutal assault on a crowded subway train.<n>The friends subdued an enraged homeless man who was viciously beating another rider on the train.<n>The cops held the attacker until NYPD officers arrived.

Spanish lawyer Miriam Gonzalez Durantez has been in UK for 10 years.<n>She is allowed to vote in local and European elections but not in Commons.<n>But she said she would like to be able to vote in the General Election.<n>Comes after Nick Clegg warned of 'bandwagons of the far right' encircling Tories.

Bulgaria has gained the most from the strong pound, which has cut the cost of visiting the continent.<n>Black Sea resorts offer the best value in terms of a meal out, buying a cup of coffee and essentials such as sun cream and a cold drink.<n>Research into an imaginary shopping basket of ten typical holiday purchases showed a total price of £37.39 for Bulgaria.<n>Algarve in Portugal beat Spain's Costa del Sol to become the second cheapest destination.
James Rebanks has been farming in the Lake District for six centuries.<n>He was born into a job that he takes infinite pride in.<n>The book is an account of a year in his life.

Bodycam footage shows Donald Allen, 66, pointing a loaded pistol at officer Brian Barnett, 25.<n>Barnett shoots Allen dead after he comes at him with the gun.<n>The camera was malfunctioning and it was initially thought the video was lost.<n>It was forensically recovered, but the audio from the bodycam was not.<n>Sand Springs Deputy Chief of Police Mike Carter said he believes the shooting was justified.

Janice Baker Kinney, Marcella Tate, and Autumn Burns appeared with attorney Gloria Allred in Los Angeles on Thursday.<n>They claim they were drugged and sexually assaulted by Bill Cosby.<n>Their claims are the latest to come out against the comedian, who has been accused of sexual assault by 38 people.<n>All three women say they met Cosby at the age of 24 or 20.<n>They say they were invited to his apartment and given alcohol.<n>Their claims were timed to damage sales for Cosby's upcoming tour.

Missoula: Rape and The Justice System in a College Town, a Doubleday publication, was released Tuesday.<n>Author Jon Krakauer interviewed five women who claimed they were raped at the University of Montana in Missoula.<n>One of the women, Kelsey Belnap, said she was gang-raped by four football players, but they were never charged.

Chelsea Clinton spoke at an event on women and girls at the Council on Foreign Relations in New York City.<n>She called the foundation 'among the most transparent of foundations'<n>The foundation recently committed to stop taking donations from foreign governments but insisted it wouldn't return money it has already collected.<n>That hasn't sat well with Republicans vying for their party's presidential nomination: Hillary Clinton is Public Enemy Number One on the campaign trail.<n>'Having raised tens of millions of dollars from foreign nations presents a clear conflict of interest for anyone running for President,' Texas Sen. Ted Cruz wrote Wednesday.

Chinese designers have developed a washing machine for cyclists.<n>By changing the front wheel of the exercise bike into a washing machine drum it will spin as the user pedals.<n>A generator attached to the pedals also produces electricity.<n>The invention could find use in remote areas where people do not have access to reliable supplies of electricity.

Eloise Parry, known as Ella, died this week after taking a lethal overdose.<n>The 21-year-old student 'burned up from the inside' after swallowing DNP.<n>The highly-toxic chemical is used as a pesticide or herbicide.<n>It was also used to fill armour-piercing shells during World War I.<n>Many people died simply by absorbing it through their skin.

Kate Brower became intrigued by the workings of the mansion after watching Downton Abbey.<n>She set about interviewing the staff, who number at least 100.<n>The staff all live out in Washington and commute in.<n>The Residence is really on the second floor and is kept hidden.

Thenga Adams, flying from Guyana in South America was arrested after customs at JFK in New York searched the sneakers in his luggage.<n>When customs opened the soles of the athletic shoes they found $30,000 worth of cocaine.<n>Adams now faces federal narcotics smuggling charges.

Crowds turned out in their finest red and white to celebrate St George's Day in the sunshine today.<n>Veteran parades and Morris men were seen across the country, with spectators draped in flags cheering them on.<n>Temperatures were slightly warmer across England today than on St George's Day last year, with parts of north Yorkshire the warmest.

Aimee Craven, 32, claimed horse for £20 and took it home from train.<n>But British Transport Police officers tracked her down on CCTV.<n>Mother-of-one from Hull is facing a caution for theft, police say.
The calf, called Nandi, is attracting a stream of visitors to his home.<n>He can only take in milk through two of his mouths.<n>Cows are revered in India's Hindu culture.

Outbreak of honesty among politicians came on BBC's Daily Politics show.<n>Tristram Hunt, Labour’s shadow education secretary answered first and said: ‘Yes. In certain circumstances’<n>Just seven per cent of children in the UK are privately educated.

Brett Robinson, 33, is accused of having sex with a male inmate six times over four months while working as a services technician at Washington County Jail.<n>She is on trial for 12 charges related to sexual misconduct and official misconduct.<n>On Wednesday a judge ruled that she would have to stand trial next week without a psychologist's report saying she was mentally ill at the time of the encounters.<n>The report said she was suffering from mental illness at the time of the alleged encounters and that it made her 'vulnerable, passive and gullible'<n>Her colleague Lisa Curry, 39, was sentenced to over four years prison last

Florida mom Kristina Bewley started taking her daughter Giselle to Disney World in September 2014 and they've been visiting the park monthly ever since.<n>Each time the family visits, Giselle puts on a new princess bought by her mother Kristina.<n>Kristina, who works with special needs kids, takes glamorous photos of her daughter playing in the park and wearing her colorful new outfits.

Ukip spokesman Patrick O'Flynn faced questions on the historic link.<n>He said: 'I completely disagree. I'm not particularly hung up on where St George came from'<n>The party announced it would make St George's Day a Bank Holiday.
Body of 50-foot whale washed up on Pacifica State Beach in California last week.<n>The East Bay Rats Motorcycle Club was tagged on the whale.<n>The club did not respond to a request for comment.

People lay candles by sea in Malta and in front of cemetery in Rome.<n>Both remember 900 migrants who died when boat capsized off Libya.<n>Death toll this year on Mediterranean has now reached 1,800.<n>EU leaders to announce only 5,000 refugees will be granted safe haven.

Power tool was used to cut through concrete wall of vault in Hatton Garden.<n>Gang raided 72 security boxes before escaping with wheelie bins full of gems.<n>Scotland Yard has released photograph of Hilti DD350 drill used in heist.<n>Officers in charge of investigation say crime was carried out by 'Ocean's 11' team.<n>Police are offering £20,000 reward for information leading to arrests.

Investigators have released images of fans who tended to the wounded.<n>Pictures show men and women rushing towards those crushed on pitch.<n>Police say 'unusual' appeal is necessary as they may be able to answer questions of victims' families.<n>Footage was taken at the 1989 disaster which claimed the lives of 96 fans.
Lizzi Crawford, 32, from Stoke-on-Trent tipped the scales at 20st.<n>Began eating takeaways, pizzas and kebabs after a boozy lifestyle.<n>Lost over 7st after joining fitness and self-defense classes.

Six city officials in Parma, Missouri, quit their jobs shortly after Tyus Byrd was elected mayor.<n>Trish Cohen, Parma's former police chief, and Rich Medley, the town's former assistant police chief, have revealed what they say are the real reasons they quit.<n>Cohen has said she and Medley feared for their safety, and their home addresses had been shared online by Byrd's family members.<n>Byrd has said she doesn't know what the'safety issues' were and that she 'never said anything about cleaning house'
Gates says the world's demand for meat can be met with'moderation and innovation'<n>He says some of the impacts of meat farming have been overstated.
The rare pink croc Hermes Birkin bag is being sold by Vestiaire Collective.<n>The handbag is so rare that it can't even be brought in store.<n>Victoria Beckham's collection is worth a reported £1.5m.

Mary Doyle Keefe, the telephone operator who inspired millions, passed away on Tuesday after a brief illness.<n>Mary became the poster girl for American women when she shot to fame by posing for Norman Rockwell's iconic painting.<n>Rosie the Riveter was on the cover of the Saturday Evening Post on May 29, 1943.

Current EU regulations do not require alcoholic drinks to reveal calories.<n>European winemakers say introducing the rule would lead to a rise in production costs.<n>They say annual tests would be needed to ensure nutritional value.<n>The European Parliament is set to vote on the issue next week.

Paul Armstrong, 26, flew to Cyprus with four friends to celebrate new job.<n>But he was stopped at airport with stun gun, baton and knuckle duster in luggage.<n>Stun gun was capable of administering an electrical discharge, court heard.<n>Judge said public should be 'warned about gravity' of bringing weapons into UK.<n>Armstrong sentenced to eight months imprisonment, suspended for two years.

David Cameron repeatedly interrupted while being interviewed on Radio 1.<n>At one point host Chris Smith offered to bet him £1,000 he wouldn't win majority.<n>Listeners on Twitter accused the programme of 'leftist hostility'<n>Others turned their ire on host Smith, branding him 'arrogant'

Adam Gadahn, a former Little Leaguer who grew up to become a spokesman for Osama bin Laden, was born in 1978 in Oregon as Adam Pearlman.<n>He converted to Islam at the age of 17 and joined al-Qaida as a propagandist.<n>U.S. authorities filed treason charges against him in 2006 and had offered a $1 million reward for information leading to his arrest or conviction.<n>He was killed during a drone strikes by US forces in January.

Indonesian authorities have sent letters to prosecutors ordering preparations be made for the executions of Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran.<n>The Australian Embassy has been summoned to Nusakambangan Island - where the executions will be carried out - on Saturday.<n>Authorities in Indonesia give death row prisoners and their families 72 hours notice before they are executed.<n>The lawyer for Raheem Salami, who is also on death row, says the embassy has been summoned to Central Java on Saturday.

Chancellor warns of a 'dangerous cocktail' if Labour fails to win majority.<n>He claims it would spark a 'constitutional crisis' if SNP hold balance of power.<n>Chancellor seized on demand for more spending and borrowing.

William Hilton Paul, 22, was cited for a DUI on Sunday in Lexington, Kentucky.<n>He crashed into the back of an unoccupied parked car.<n>Witnesses said he was'revving his engine' while sitting alone in the truck.<n>Paul failed a field sobriety test and was treated at the hospital.<n>He was not arrested.<n>Paul has two previous alcohol-related run-ins with the law.

Study by Lancashire's Edge Hill University found link between anxiety and performance.<n>Students who worry about performance are more likely to do badly.<n>Principal at Burlington Danes Academy in West London offers advice.

Channel 4 will shut down for 12 hours on 7 May to encourage youngsters to vote.<n>Cult US sitcoms like The Big Bang Theory will be taken off air.<n>Viewers will instead be shown an advert telling them to go to the polls.<n>E4 is the most popular channel for younger viewers, reaching 8.7 million.

Two men were arrested trying to sneak into Syria to join the Islamic State.<n>It's claimed they were on their way to join the terror group.<n>Turkey and Australia have agreed to a new extradition treaty.<n>The treaty will cover the detention and extradition of Australian foreign fighters.<n>It will also cover criminal activity such as drug trafficking.<n>There are now an estimated 100 Australians fighting for the Islamic State.

Fire Brigades Union say practice is irresponsible and dangerous.<n>Senior union officials say fire engines routinely turned into makeshift ambulances to ferry patients to A&E.<n>In one case an elderly lady is feared to have died because she was left in the hands of fire crews for nearly 40 minutes while paramedics were delayed.

Dr Arfon Williams is the only GP available across two rural practices.<n>His partner and colleague of 20 years retired at the end of March.<n>Surgery is currently functioning with a skeleton service, he said.<n>He fears areas such as the Lln Peninsula in north Wales will become 'no-go' areas for young, aspiring GPs.

Second eruption from Calbuco volcano in southern Chile has covered nearby towns and villages in a thick layer of ash.<n>The ash covered cars and houses in cities as far as 18 miles away from the source of the eruption.<n>The volcano is one of the most dangerous in Chile and has previously erupted for up to a week.

The Aerostar plane was captured on camera at the Aero Acres airpark.<n>It touches down without deploying its landing gear and skids along the runway.<n>The video maker describes the sound of the propellers hitting the ground as 'one you will not forget'<n>The plane's pilot, Chris Georgaklis, 85, managed to fly 100 miles to Fort Lauderdale.

Chinese traffic police release CCTV footage of motorist's incredible road stunt.<n>The man is seen driving his tiny three-wheel scooter alongside a van.<n>The van is estimated to weigh around one ton.<n>The driver has not been tracked down as the police cannot see his plate.

Michael Hanline, 69, was convicted of murder for the fatal shooting of J.T. McGarr.<n>But new evidence proved he was innocent and he was finally released last year.<n>He has said he wants to go fishing and spend time with his wife Sandy.<n>'Hopefully everything is going to be like it used to be,' he said outside court.

Justine Jones was left covered in sores after opening bottle of Tesco wine.<n>She had bought it for granddaughter's 18th birthday and poured a glass.<n>But when they inspected it further they found clear liquid smelt of bleach.<n>Accountant suffers from rare condition pemphigus and is sensitive to chemicals.<n>Tesco sent her a report and a £15 moneycard but she said response was not good enough.

Navinder Singh Sarao, 36, is accused of making £26million from illegal trades.<n>He is accused of causing the 2010 'flash crash' on Wall Street.<n>US authorities suspected he was making illicit trades back in 2009.<n>But they took six years to bring charges against him.

EU regulations require fish to be treated with homeopathy.<n>First line of treatment should bestances from plants or minerals.<n>Vets have called the directive'scientifically illiterate' and 'unacceptable'<n>Fish farmers can only use mainstream treatments twice per year.<n>They must also have their organic certification revoked if they use homeopathy.

Crawley-based Acro Aircraft Seating has unveiled its new premium economy seat.<n>The 'Series 7' seat has hand-stitched leather armrests and aluminium chassis.<n>Managing director Chris Brady said seats are designed to eliminate the sources of discomfort and provide more space for occupants.

Kate's inner circle is a mix of school friends, society types and family.<n>The Duchess of Cambridge is extremely close to her younger sister Pippa.<n>31-year-old Pippa recently returned to London after spending days with boyfriend.<n>She will be close at hand when the new baby arrives.

Robert Durst, 72, was arrested in New Orleans hotel on March 15.<n>He was charged with possessing a gun with drugs and illegal possession of a handgun by a felon.<n>But a judge ruled that the charges can be dismissed, clearing the way for federal proceedings.<n>He will now face federal charges, which lawyers believe he can win.<n>Durst is accused of murdering Susan Berman in California in 2000.<n>The millionaire's wife went missing in 1982 and he was never found.

The image shows a giant distant cluster of about 3,000 stars called Westerlund 2 inside a stellar 'breeding ground' called Gum 29, 20,000 light-years from Earth.<n>In the image massive young stars can be seen feeding a nearby region with the fuel it needs to form new stars.<n>Hubble was launched on 24 April 1990 aboard Space Shuttle Discovery.

Bikram yoga involves performing 26 poses in a room heated to 40C.<n>Scientists at University of Wisconsin-La Crosse monitored volunteers.<n>Found heart rate and core temperature fluctuated throughout the 90-minute class.<n>Participants' temperatures reached dangerous levels, scientists said.<n>Advised that the standard 90-minute class is reduced to just an hour.

Amelia Morton, 23, from Birmingham, weighed 12 and a half stone.<n>She spent £5,000 a year on pizza and was left feeling bloated and unwell.<n>After being told by her father 'Boys don't fancy fat girls' she started diet.<n>Amelia has now lost four dress sizes and is a consultant herself.

Graeme Whipps captured this image of the Lyrid meteor shower in the skies above Pitcaple in Aberdeenshire yesterday.<n>The annual celestial event has been observed for the last 2,700 years across the globe, but is most visible in the northern hemisphere.<n>The peak of the shower, which occurs tonight, is expected to produce between 10 and 20 meteors an hour.

Figures from Catholic Church show number has trebled from 15 in 2009 to 45 last year.<n>From a low of seven in 2004, the figure has been rising for the past decade.<n>Theodora Hawksley, 29, decided to become a nun at the beginning of the year.<n>She joined Congregation of Jesus in January and is now living in their house in Willesden, North London.

45% of Britons have lied about their earnings, spending and credit cards.<n>11% understated their salary, 4% overestimated it and 4% lied in both ways.<n>41% of people surveyed said they were in the dark about their partner's finances.

Picture obtained by Daily Mail Online shows the 23-year-old on a sofa.<n>He appears to be sitting next to a plastic tub containing a dry, green weed-like substance and rolling paper.<n>The image was taken on Wednesday amid 48 hours during which Tomlinson has been seen partying hard.<n>That same day Tomlinson, 23, was photographed returning to his London hotel in a disheveled state clutching a glass of water.

The teacher, who had not been named, was teaching the fifth grade at Hawthorne Elementary in Albuquerque, New Mexico.<n>Some students were so distressed by what they heard, that they immediately went to the school office to report the teacher.<n>Mother Margie Brooks, whose son was in the class, said she was horrified by what the teacher told the students and felt the school waited too long to deal with the problem.

Candlestick Park, the home of the San Francisco Giants and San Francisco 49ers, has been torn down.<n>The iconic sports field, completed in 1960, is now set to become houses, a hotel and a shopping center.<n>Candlestick was also the home of two World Series, with the Giants losing in 1962 and 1989.<n>The 1989 World Series was the first time a game was played in San Francisco since the earthquake of 1989.

Staff say they are increasingly being asked to perform tasks previously only carried out by nurses.<n>These include changing catheter and colostomy bags and feeding through tube.<n>Concerns come in survey of 1,000 workers employed by councils and private firms.

Researchers have discovered a way to intercept a person's fingerprints.<n>Flaw lies in older versions of the Android operating system, including Android 4.4.<n>It means a hacker can access the kernel, or core, of the system.<n>Once inside they can monitor all data sent to and from the phone.<n>This includes data recorded by the fingerprint scanner.<n>The flaw is more widespread than the one found on the Galaxy S5.<n>Experts are advising people to update their Android devices.

American photographer John Moore's poignant images show the devastation caused by the deadly disease in Liberia.<n>They were praised by the judges for compassionately illustrating how people's daily lives were destroyed.<n>The Sony World Photography Award winners were announced at a gala in London last night.

James Creag, 11, has the condition Erythropoietic Protoporphyria.<n>It means he cannot be exposed to sunlight and suffers from terrible sunburn.<n>He was given a special brown paste which blocks out the sun's light.<n>But he was racially abused when he was given the cream in the street.<n>His mother Claire, 34, said: 'It was either ignorance or evilness'
