David Petraeus, 60, was sentenced to two years probation and fined $100,000 for leaking classified information to his mistress Paula Broadwell.<n>His career was destroyed in 2012 when the affair emerged and he was accused of sharing classified information with Broadwell while she was writing a book.<n>He said he wanted to apologize to those closest to him 'for the pain my actions caused'

Clarence David Moore, 66, escaped from police custody three times during the 1970s.<n>He eventually settled into a quiet life, living in Kentucky since at least 2009.<n>His health is poor from a stroke late last year and he has difficulty speaking.<n>When Franklin County Sheriff Pat Melton showed up at Moore's house to make the 'arrest,' Moore was in a hospital bed. He broke down in tears.<n>'He looks like he's almost 90,' the sheriff said. 'He is very frail. He has a little limp. He has a little trouble speaking'

WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT.<n>Shocking images show two blindfolded men being brutally executed.<n>Group of executioners photographed hugging the men and apparently 'forgiving' them.<n>Up to four jihadis then pummeled the men to death with hundreds of rocks.<n>Images shared online by ISIS sympathisers who claim photographs reveal terrorists' compassionate side.

Chris Christie appeared on The Tonight Show Wednesday, and called out Jimmy Fallon for his weight jokes about him.<n>Fallon however pulled out two spoons thinking the men could share the ice cream, at which point Christie took the treat for himself.<n>Later in the program he hoarded a pint of ice cream, and later said he would not be changing himself just to win office.

The safari can be taken separately, but also as an epic world tour over 203 days, taking in 21 destinations.<n>Guests will be guided across the globe on a carefully planned itinerary.<n>Can spend nights in eco lodges like the domes at Patagonia Eco Camp in Chile.

Bright yellow camera had previously enforced a 30mph speed limit.<n>But it has not been working for two years after being switched off.<n>Council says it will be removed and plans for a pilot have been put in place.

Teenager from Blackburn remanded in custody after appearing in court.<n>He is accused of inciting an Australian teenager to carry out a terror attack.<n>Sevdet Besim, 18, allegedly planned to carry out a Lee Rigby-style massacre.<n>The 14-year-old is thought to be the youngest person charged with Islamist-related terror offences in the UK.

Bettie Jo, 24, from Houston, Texas, weighed 47st (660lb) before surgery.<n>She was housebound and unable to care for herself.<n>Husband Josh was her 'caretaker' and helped her go to the toilet.<n>Josh didn't support her weight loss bid because he feared she'd need him again.<n>Bettie Jo now weighs 35st 8lbs (500lbs) and can stand up on her own.

Documented and undocumented immigrants in the United States could reach a record high of 51million in just eight years.<n>By 2060, immigrants could account for 82 per cent of all population growth in the country.<n>Without change in current immigration policy, by 2023 immigrants will account for 14.8 per cent of the U.S. population.

Curtis Stone is back in Australia to promote his new cookbook.<n>The celebrity chef is back with photos of him cooking and gardening with wife Lindsay and their two sons.<n>Stone is adamant that his children should eat healthily.<n>The 39-year-old says his biggest priority is to feed his children healthy food.

Scientists in The Netherlands were using the Lofar radio telescope.<n>They found it could measure changes in lightning caused by cosmic rays.<n>A storm can have hundreds of millions of volts over multiple kilometres.<n>The method could provide a novel way to understand thunderclouds.<n>It was almost by accident, that cosmic rays were a suitable probe to measure electric fields within thunderclouds.

Andrew Steele, 40, had pleaded not guilty by reason of mental disease to two counts of first-degree intentional homicide.<n>The former Wisconsin sheriff's deputy had shot and killed his wife, Ashlee Steele, 39, and her sister, Kacee Tollefsbol, 38, at their home in August.<n>Defense attorneys argued that the disease damaged Steele's brain, making him not criminally responsible for the deaths.<n>A jury deliberated for about 10 hours until all but two of the 12 agreed the verdict early on Thursday.

Prosecco has long been seen as the second choice to champagne in Britain.<n>But sales of the Italian sparkling wine have overtaken champagne for the first time.<n>Last year UK sales overtook those of champagne for the first time.

Andrew Hutchinson was convicted of 23 offences against patients.<n>The 29-year-old worked at John Radcliffe Hospital Oxford.<n>A student nurse reported Hutchinson for taking inappropriate photos in 2009.<n>Hospital bosses chose not to investigate as there was not enough evidence.<n>Hutchinson was later caught filming women as they changed at a leisure centre.<n>Police found photos and video of him abusing women in the hospital.<n>He was convicted of making indecent images of children and outraging public decency.<n>Hutchinson is due to be sentenced at Oxford Crown Court next week.

Identical twins share 100 per cent of their genes, meaning that until now it has been impossible to tell which sibling a sample comes from.<n>But researchers at the University of Huddersfield have created a technique which they claim can distinguish between the genetic fingerprints of identical twins.<n>The breakthrough may eradicate a stumbling block which has often meant it was impossible to tell which of the pair was guilty of a crime.

Prime Minister Manuel Valls said five terrorist attacks have been foiled.<n>Comments follow arrest of Sid Ahmed Ghlam, 24, on Sunday.<n>He was allegedly planning to storm Catholic churches with weapons.<n>Ghlam was caught after accidentally shooting himself in the leg.<n>He is believed to have been on his way to a number of churches in Paris.<n>Comes just hours after murder of Aurelie Chatelain, 33, in Paris suburb.

Volcano Calbuco erupted suddenly at 6pm local time, sending a plume of ash 100 miles into the sky.<n>The volcano, in southern Chile, has not erupted since 1972, and was not under special observation.<n>1,500 people were forced to flee their homes after the eruption, while several townships were also cleared.

Jamelia said obese women'should feel uncomfortable' about their size.<n>Now plus-size industry has spoken out about her comments.<n>Alice Dogruyol, founder of Beauty in Curves, said it's 'disturbing'<n>Twitter users have also taken to #wearethethey to show off their curves.

Carl Bradey lost everything he owned in the blaze in March.<n>The 25-year-old smashed through a window to rescue the child of a family friend.<n>He has undergone four major operations since the fire.<n>Bradey said the burns were the worst pain he has ever felt.

The Clinton Foundation and the Clinton Health Access Initiative said they will be refiling multiple annual tax returns.<n>Errors generally took the form of under-reporting or over-reporting donations from foreign governments.<n>The charities confirmed to Reuters, which uncovered the mistakes.<n>Republican presidential candidate Ted Cruz called on the non-profit to return all of the money it received from foreign governments.

Henry Rayhons, 78, was accused of having sex with his wife in her nursing home.<n>Donna Lou Rayhons had dementia and Alzheimers and was told she could not consent.<n>Mr Rayhons insisted they had kissed on the night in question but had not had sexual contact.<n>Jurors acquitted the politician after hearing tests could not prove the pair had sex.

DJ Pete Tong will pay tribute to Ibiza and its 'invincible, energetic brand of club music'<n>The Proms will also play host to a live orchestra playing Ibiza-style music.<n>The event will take place on July 29, coinciding with Radio 1's 20th anniversary.

The study identified 17 areas in the central and eastern US with increased rates of induced seismicity.<n>The spike in seismic activity was largely down to the oil and gas industry injecting wastewater deep underground, which can activate dormant faults.<n>Oklahoma lately has been rocked by more magnitude-3 quakes than California, the most seismically active of the Lower 48 states.

Alison Saunders said she was 'not afraid' of legal challenge over her decision.<n>Director of Public Prosecutions said she would not quit her job.<n>She said Lord Janner would not be fit to plead because of his dementia.<n>Victims and politicians have accused her of damaging public confidence.

Deputy finance minister Dimitras Mardas set alarm bells ringing.<n>He said the country had been 'running on empty' since February.<n>Greece faces 200m payment to the International Monetary Fund on May 1.<n>PM Alexis Tsipras expected to appeal to German Chancellor Angela Merkel.
Jake Malone, 60, met woman online 11 months ago and fell in love.<n>He flew to China to track her down but was unable to contact her.<n>He has now turned himself into a walking billboard in the city.

Anika Stanford arrived at Leeton Police Station on Thursday morning.<n>She was taken back to the home she shares with her son Vincent and another son, Luke.<n>Ms Stanford is believed to have given police information which led them to a road in the Cocoparra National Park.<n>Her visit comes after Stephanie Scott was buried in an emotional funeral service on Wednesday.<n>Vincent Stanford, 24, has been charged with the murder of Ms Scott.
Oregon alcohol regulators have approved plans for the beer.<n>It will be made from waste gathered by sewage treatment firm.<n>Ten barrels of beer will be made but it won't be available in shops.

Fiona 'Kitty' Carroll was at Kemah Boardwalk Marina as her father worked on his boat on Wednesday but she was gone 'after a brief moment'<n>Her bucket was found in the water but there was no sign of the girl.<n>Her father called police at 6pm to report that she had disappeared.<n>Dive teams searched the water for more than seven hours but found nothing.<n>Her body was found in the water near the pier on Thursday morning.<n>She had celebrated her fifth birthday that day.

Virtual studio DesignCrowd asked people to submit before and after images of famous landmarks.<n>Paris, London, New York and Milan all feature in the collection of images that look very different without their famous attractions.

Darren Jones was seen stepping away from podium seconds before show.<n>28-year-old Labour candidate complained of pins and needles in his legs.<n>Audience members rushed to help Labour candidate after he fell at their feet.<n>An ambulance was called and programme was delayed for nine minutes.<n>Mr Jones later blamed his collapse on a cold brought on by his campaign.

Ivan Balashov was browsing through smartphones in a shop in Novokuznetsk.<n>The 22-year-old took a picture of himself wearing a bobble hat.<n>He then grabbed another handset and headed for the exit.<n>Security stopped him and he was let go by the shop assistant.<n>But police quickly recognised him from the selfie and went to his house.<n>He was found guilty and given a three month suspended sentence.

Kevin Rebbie, 56, of Limerick Township, Pennsylvania, faces several charges.<n>Girl, 15, found hidden camera in her bathroom and told police.<n>Rebbie allegedly watched her for years while she was undressing.<n>Police found 41 videos from hidden camera that included footage of the girl.<n>Rebbie admitted to filming several victims, including other juveniles.

Deborah Kane, from Manchester, had her right eye removed three years ago.<n>The 46-year-old believes her skin cancer developed from getting badly burned on holiday in Lanzarote when she was 15.<n>She also bought cheap sunglasses without proper UV protection.

Clarkson, May and Hammond pictured together for first time since Top Gear sacking.<n>They were seen outside Clarkson's west London flat with Wilman.<n>Comes hours after it was sensationally announced he had quit BBC.<n>Mr Wilman is now free to reunite with team on rival channel.<n>May earlier said BBC would be'stupid' to try show with'surrogate Jeremy'<n>He said idea was a 'non-starter' and would be 'lame' with new presenter.

Christie's Magnificent Jewels auction will take place in Geneva on May 13.<n>Auction will showcase 351 historically significant and antique jewels.<n>Included in the sale is a pink diamond worth £8million.<n>Also on sale is a sapphire worth £2.7million and diamond earrings with £670,000.

Koby Hodder suffered a cardiac arrest while playing British Bulldog with friends.<n>His heart stopped beating and he collapsed and lost consciousness.<n>He was diagnosed with the same heart condition as footballer Fabrice Muamba.<n>His father, Mark, 45, said he was 'grey and lifeless' when he saw him.<n>Luckily he was brought back to life when paramedics arrived.

East of England ambulance service revealed 1,248 'inappropriate' calls.<n>Ambulances sent to Epping Forest after caller said'someone' had been run down.<n>Another said he had dropped his burger and it was 'bleeding'<n>Woman said she was locked out of house and man hurt his feet in Peterborough.

Lyvette Crespo, 43, was indicted on charges of voluntary manslaughter in the September shooting death of her husband, Bell Gardens, California Mayor Daniel Crespo.<n>She claims the killing was in self-defense after her husband punched their 19-year-old son in the face.<n>Daniel Crespo's brother, William, says Lyvette's claims are all lies and that she killed her husband in cold blood.

Alejandro Bouvier of Uruguay filmed the moment another rider got scarily close to his watercraft one sunny day.<n>Footage shows him zipping towards the driver before he swings around and drives directly in his path.<n>Luckily the two jet skiers avoid a dangerous collision thanks to some swift steering skills.

Dr Mohammad Ali Jawad allegedly molested another patient after getting drunk.<n>He allegedly dimmed the lights, shut the blinds and asked her to dance.<n>She claims he then asked her to dance to the music of Julio Iglesias.<n>He is also alleged to have massaged her neck and touched her breasts.<n>Tribunal is considering whether he is fit to practise as a surgeon.

A week after 10 doctors urged Columbia University to sever all ties with him, Dr. Oz has used his syndicated TV show to hit back.<n>'The 10 doctors who attacked me got what they wanted – sensational headlines and sound bites,' said Oz.<n>'It's ironic that I am being accused of a conflict of interest by these doctors,' he said.

All the land in the lower 48 states is worth a combined $23trillion.<n>Land in the country reached its peak value of $26.2 trillion in 2006.<n>But prices have since fallen three trillion dollars in three years.<n>Washington DC had the greatest land value, with more than $1million per acre.<n>California was the most valuable state overall at $3.9trillion.

Antoni van Leeuwenhoek used his body as a guinea pig in an experiment.<n>Dutch scientist estimated two pairs of lice could generate 10,000 young.<n>Dutch artist Johannes Vermeer also experimented in his home.<n>Could Vermeer and Leeuwenhoek have exchanged ideas and inspired each other’s work?

Lynch, 55, was approved by a 56-43 vote, with 10 Republicans joining with Senate Democrats to approve her.<n>Texas Senator Ted Cruz, a key opponent of Lynch's nomination, was absent from the vote.<n>Lynch is expected to take over as head of the U.S. Justice Department on Monday, replacing Eric Holder.

Cardinal Francis George was remembered Thursday as a man of deep faith, intellect and compassion.<n>He led the nation's third-largest archdiocese and was known as a vigorous defender of Roman Catholic orthodoxy.<n>George died Friday, April 17 at age 78 after a long battle with cancer.
Hand-written apology signs have appeared in Milford, Surrey.<n>Messages read 'please forgive me' and 'we need to talk'<n>Have sparked speculation as to the identity of author.

FEMAIL asked food authors to contribute their spin on the classic Anzac biscuit recipe.<n>The recipe features rolled oats, desiccated coconut, and golden syrup.<n>But how do they stack up against the original?

Andrea Yates drowned her five children in the bathtub of their home in 2001.<n>She was said to be suffering from postpartum psychosis at the time.<n>She was convicted of capital murder in 2002 and sentenced to life in prison.<n>But an appeals court granted her a retrial and in 2006 she was found not guilty by reason of insanity and moved to a mental health facility.<n>Her ex-husband Rusty Yates, who has since remarried and has a five-year-old son, slammed her murder trial as the 'cruelest thing I have ever witnessed'

English MPs will be given veto on legislation which no longer applies in Scotland.<n>Plan will mean English, Welsh and Northern Irish MPs have no say.<n>Reforms will be introduced within 100 days of a Tory election victory.

A dozen Native American extras and the cultural adviser for Adam Sandler's new movie The Ridiculous 6 walked off the set on Wednesday.<n>The Navajo Nation tribal member Loren Anthony said the film was offensive to Native American women.<n>One of the problems he cited was the costumes that were being used, the way the hair was being styled, and the film's treatment of women.<n>The Ridiculous 6 is a spoof of The Magnificent Seven that stars Sandler and Taylor Lautner.

Brock Guzman of Fairfield, California was briefly kidnapped as he slept in his family car while it was stolen from their driveway Monday morning.<n>His parents, Paul and Suzanne, reported the incident, and when police arrived at their home they say Suzanne refused to let them in.<n>Paul claims he took video of the incident, and it shows Suzanne being handcuffed and thrown to the ground.<n>The couple are now filing a formal complaint against police, and say they were treated 'like criminals'

John Hinckley Jr. has been dating a woman he met at a National Association for the Mentally Ill meeting.<n>This was revealed by his brother Scott during a hearing to determine if Hinckley should be released from the institution he has been at since shooting President Reagan.<n>Hinckley currently splits his time between St. Elizabeth's Hospital in Washington and his mother's home in Williamsburg, Virginia.<n>His mother Joan has been introduced to her son's girlfriend.

Juan Carlos was having an affair with a German aristocrat for a decade.<n>The aristocrat is 27 years younger than the former Spanish king.<n>Juan Carlos considered divorcing his wife, Sofia, according to the book.<n>Final De Partida – or End Game – by Ana Romero sold out within 24 hours.

Social media users left scratching their heads over some of the manipulated snaps being shared during New South Wales’ worst storm in a decade.<n>Not all of them were quite what they seemed, with some Photoshop photos including a trampoline caught on power lines and a crocodile stalking flood water at a train station.<n>The more unbelievable Photoshop jobs included a photo of Noah’s Ark majestically cruising into Sydney Harbour.

Officer Daniel Jamieson has been charged with leaking confidential information about Ben Cousins' arrest to his girlfriend.<n>Channel 7 Perth news reporter Monique Dirksz got the scoop on Cousins' arrest when she was the only journalist outside Freemantle Police station at 2am on March 12.<n>Mr Jamieson is accused of divulging information that gave her a particular advantage.<n>The 29-year-old was stood down immediately and has been charged with four counts of disclosing official secrets.

Ahmed Gaddaf al-Dam said the 'overwhelming chaos' in Libya 'has become a shame'<n>He said western countries have shed 'the tears of crocodiles over democracy'<n>William Hague defended the government's role in helping overthrow Gaddafi.

NBC journalist Jeff Rossen filmed an airport worker at LaGuardia Airport in New York doing push-ups on the runway after loading a plane.<n>Footage shows the employee wearing his high-visibility jacket and gloves while performing the aerobic stunt.<n>Rossen later uploaded the 12-second clip of the pro-active employee to social media along with the caption: 'Hardest working man at LaGuardia...from my window'

The £80,000 sports car was crushed by a builder's lorry in Nottingham.<n>Both vehicles were in traffic after a cyclist was injured on a nearby road.<n>Onlooker who witnessed the crash said the owner was 'distraught'

David Billing, 48, was diagnosed with mouth cancer after he couldn't swallow.<n>He had to undergo 14 hours of surgery to remove part of his tongue.<n>Doctors then replaced the lost tissue with muscle from his arm.<n>But the skin still has hairs and he has to return to hospital to have it shaved.

Rupert Brooke died 100 years ago today at the age of just 27.<n>He became a symbol of innocent youth during the senseless slaughter of WWI.<n>But new letters show he was a womaniser who had affairs without settling down.

Mark West, 32, pleaded guilty to having sex with a student in his office.<n>He was sentenced to four months prison and eight years probation.<n>The judge was scathing in handing down the sentence, saying that just three weeks after the incident the girl graduated, which would have made their encounter legal.<n>West is married with a child.

Oskar Groening, 93, is being tried on 300,000 counts of accessory to murder.<n>He told the Lueneburg state court on Thursday that he did not expect Jews at Auschwitz to make it out alive.<n>The former SS sergeant has testified as a witness in other Nazi trials.

'E-waste' worth £34billion discarded globally in 2014 but only 6m tonnes recycled.<n>West-Africa dumping ground for'millions of tonnes' of broken appliances.<n>It costs less to send them to west Africa than to recycle them in Europe.<n>Some appliances leak toxic chemicals and pollute local water.<n>UK contributed 1.5m tonnes of 'e-waste' to 11.6m tonnes generated in Europe.

Bruce Davis, 72, was convicted in the 1969 slayings of musician Gary Hinman and stuntman Donald 'Shorty' Shea.<n>Davis held Hinman at gunpoint while Manson sliced his face open with a sword.<n>He also stabbed Shea, who worked at Spahn Ranch where the family lived, about a month later.<n>Davis claimed he has turned his life around in prison, earning a doctoral degree in philosophy, becoming religious and ministering to other inmates.<n>He also married a woman he met through the prison ministry, and has a grown daughter.

Chris Early, who owns a production company in Knoxville, Tennessee, bought a quadcopter to make commercials.<n>He decided he could use it for personal surveillance purposes too.<n>He used it to follow his daughter, Katie, as she walked to school.

German banking giant Deutsche Bank will pay $2.5 billion in fines for its role in a vast conspiracy to rig LIBOR interest rates.<n>The case centers on charges that Deutsche Bank derivatives traders manipulated the London InterBank Offered Rate from 2003-2011.<n>The $2.5 billion fine is a record for interest-rate manipulation.<n>The bank said it would book an additional charge of $1.6 billion in the first quarter for LIBOR and 'other matters'
Lindsay Lohan, Kate Moss and Johnny Depp are just some of the stars that have aged terribly.<n>The stars have all experienced rapid signs of ageing in their teens and twenties.

Disgraced DJ Dave Lee Travis has claimed his indecent assault trials 'financially ruined' him.<n>But he will still receive £4,000 from the taxpayer to pay for his taxis to court.<n>Travis was convicted of indecently assaulting a woman behind the scenes.<n>The 69-year-old was cleared of 12 counts of indecent assault at previous trial.<n>He was retried and convicted of one count of indecent assault in September.<n>Travis was told he will be awarded travel and hotel fees for his time on trial.

Gang of eight dug a 50m tunnel to breach Hua Pagoda in Guanghui Temple.<n>Used shovels, ladders, and power drills to dig their way to the ancient site.<n>Police found seven-metre-deep tunnel after raiding gang's property.<n>Five gang members were arrested and three are still on the run.

Ruben Blundell, 6, helped deliver his little brother Theo at home.<n>The baby was four days overdue when his mother went into labour.<n>Ruben helped with the birth by fetching towels and telling his mother to breathe.

The 24-year-olds were both arrested on suspicion of assault and disorderly conduct on Wednesday afternoon.<n>Several people at the couple's home tried to stop Griner, who is 6'8", and Johnson, who is 6'3", from fighting after an argument turned physical.<n>Griner told police that she threw a dog bowl at the wall and the fight turned physical, with the couple arguing'mouthing back and forth'<n>She had what appeared to be a tooth mark on her hand, as well as other injuries to her wrist and fingers, police noted.<n>They were taken into custody around 5

On April 7, San Antonio police officers issued a citation and $2,000 fine to Joan Cheever for failing to serve food out of a licensed food truck.<n>Cheever founded The Chow Train non-profit in 2005 and has been feeding the homeless from the back of her pickup truck.<n>The truck is more maneuverable than her mobile kitchen, which is commercially licensed.

Schoolgirl needed medical treatment after drinking corrosive liquid in lesson.<n>She was left needing immediate medical treatment at Hounsdown School.<n>Staff immediately launched an investigation into the incident.<n>Two pupils have been suspended following the incident.<n>Headteacher Julie Turvey said the school was taking the matter'very seriously'

Michelle Carter, 18, is accused of encouraging the death of Conrad Roy III, who gassed himself in his truck in Fairhaven, Massachusetts, last July.<n>Her lawyers say it's 'impossible' for her to receive a fair trial in Bristol County because the District Attorney is the victim's third cousin.<n>However the DA's office filed a response arguing that the DA, Thomas Quinn, has excused himself from any involvement in the case.

Aldi gave away golden tickets to the first 100 people through the doors.<n>More than 200 people were found queuing outside the store this morning.<n>The store in Avlaston, Derbyshire, was officially opened at 8am this morning.<n>Ivy Bacon, 20, won a 21.5inch TV after queuing for 10 hours overnight.

House Benghazi Committee Chairman Trey Gowdy wants Hillary Clinton to testify before his panel twice.<n>The first hearing would focus on Clinton's use of private emails while she was secretary of state.<n>The second would focus on the September 2012 attacks that killed four Americans, including the U.S. ambassador to Libya.<n>The September 2012 attacks occurred during a demonstration against an anti-Islam video in Benghazi, Libya.<n>Clinton refused to answer questions about the attacks on Tuesday after landing in Washington, D.C. following a two-day campaign swing in New Hampshire.

Doug Hughes, 61, is 'lucky to be alive' and'should have been blown out of the air,' Rep. Jason Chaffetz said.<n>Chaffetz said security tracked Hughes as he approached the Capitol last week after taking off from Gettysburg, Pennsylvania.<n>A 'judgment call' was made not to shoot down Hughes, Chaffetz said.<n>Chaffetz said a combination of 'lack of communication and some human error' by Capitol Police and other officials allowed Hughes to steer his tiny aircraft within a few hundred feet of the Capitol before landing on the West Lawn.

Jules Bianchi crashed into a recovery vehicle at the Japanese Grand Prix.<n>The 25-year-old Marussia driver remains in a coma after the accident.<n>His father Philippe has spoken of the pain his family have felt since.<n>He said that Bianchi is 'fighting fiercely' and his condition is stable.

Kate Temple was called a 'homewrecker' by victim Shelley Williams.<n>The 33-year-old attacked Miss Williams after she accused her of affair.<n> Temple left the victim covered in blood after biting a chunk out of her ear.<n>She was jailed for 20 months after admitting inflicting grievous bodily harm.

Juventus defeated Monaco 1-0 in the Champions League quarter-final first leg on Tuesday night.<n>Artio Vidal scored the winner from the spot after Ricardo Carvalho gave away a penalty.<n>The incident occurred on 57 minutes after Alvaro Morata was brought down in the area.<n>Andrea Pirlo's long-range pass sailed over the heads of both teams before falling to Morata who slotted home.

Bristol City are on the brink of promotion to the Championship.<n>The Robins are currently second in the table, just four points off the top.<n>Owner Steve Lansdown has helped turn around the club's fortunes.

Emily Clark, Morgan Bass, Abbie Deloach, Catherine Pittman, Caitlyn Baggett and Brittney McDaniel perished on their way to school Wednesday.<n>The tractor-trailer plowed into traffic on Interstate 16 in Georgia, setting off a deadly chain reaction.<n>Two other students were hospitalized with injuries.<n>The driver of the tractor-trailer reportedly said he wished he was also killed in the fiery wreck.

Chelsea took three brothers from Luton in 2012 to boost their prospects.<n>Jay Dasilva is now earmarked for a first-team future at Stamford Bridge.<n>Dominic Solanke and Ruben Loftus-Cheek are among the club's promising young players.<n>John Terry is the last player to come through Chelsea's youth ranks and become a first-team regular.

Emmanuel Adebayor has scored 41 goals in 106 appearances for Tottenham.<n>The 31-year-old has pocketed £3.4million in wages since his last start.<n>Adebayor has been linked with a move to Real Madrid or Chelsea.

Aaron Hernandez, 25, was moved Wednesday to the maximum-security Souza-Baranowski Correctional Center in Shirley, Massachusetts.<n>He had been at Cedar Junction prison in Walpole since he was convicted April 15 of killing 27-year-old Odin Lloyd in 2013.<n>Hernandez will be Souza's most famous inmate.

Actor was promoting Avengers: Age of Ultron when he got angry.<n>Asked about his history of drug abuse and time in prison.<n>Downey Jnr said: 'I'm sorry, I really don't... what are we doing?'<n>Then walked out of interview with Channel 4 news presenter Krishnan Guru-Murthy.<n>He later said: 'It's all getting a bit Diane Sawyer in here'

Attorneys for Brown's parents, Lesley McSpadden and Michael Brown Sr., filed the complaint at the St. Louis County Courthouse on Thursday.<n>The lawsuit is seeking $75,000 in compensation, as well as unspecified punitive damages.<n>It alleges that Officer Darren Wilson destroyed evidence after he shot Brown on the street of the St. Louis suburb last August.<n>The civil suit claims Brown had his hands up in surrender when he was killed, a claim strongly disputed during the previous investigation.
Lee Tomlin opened the scoring for Middlesbrough in the second half.<n>Patrick Bamford also missed a late penalty for the hosts.<n>The win keeps Middlesbrough fourth in the Championship table.

Nigerian Muslims on dinghy ordered Christian to stop praying.<n>When he refused, they attacked other migrants who tried to defend him.<n>12 African Christians drowned when they were thrown overboard.<n>Italian police arrested 15 people suspected of killing the refugees.<n>UN said 23,500 migrants had sailed to Italy this year in addition to 12,000 who had sailed to Greece.

Scott Turner Schofield will become the first transgender man to have a recurring role on a daytime soap opera when he appears on The Bold and the Beautiful.<n>Schofield will play Nick, a mentor of sorts to the character of Maya Avant, played by Karla Mosley.<n>Schofield is a performer, speaker and author known for his one-person shows that address transgender issues.

Roberto Carlos won the Champions League three times with Real Madrid.<n>The Brazilian defender has picked his dream team from the greats he played with.<n>Carlos picks Iker Casillas, Cafu, Paolo Maldini, Fabio Cannavaro and Clarence Seedorf.

Fulham are deliberating over the future of Kit Symons.<n>The Championship strugglers are looking at Brentford manager Mark Warburton.<n>Khan is planning to release a budget of £20million to spend on new players.

Referee Anthony Taylor sprinted past Sunderland midfielder Lee Cattermole during Yannick Bolasie's hat-trick for Crystal Palace.<n>Gary Cahill has responded well to challenge of Kurt Zouma for Chelsea's defence.<n>Arsenal have kept six clean sheets since replacing Wojciech Szczesny.<n>Vincent Kompany has been named Premier League Player of the Month for December.

Andy Awford has been sacked as Portsmouth manager.<n>The League Two club parted company with Awford at a meeting this morning.<n>The 42-year-old was in charge for just over a year.<n>He won 20 of the 55 matches that he was in charge of the club.

Eden Hazard has been named PFA Player of the Year for the fourth year running.<n>The Belgian has scored 18 goals for Chelsea this season.<n>Hazard: 'I don't know if I deserve to win but it is good for me'<n>Chelsea are two points clear at the top of the Premier League with a game in hand.

Lionel Messi scored his 400th goal for Barcelona in the 2-0 win over Valencia.<n>Luis Suarez opened the scoring after just 56 seconds at the Nou Camp.<n>Messi then doubled the lead in stoppage time to seal the win.<n>Messi has scored 309 league goals, 75 in the Champions League and 32 in the Copa del Rey in just 471 games.<n>CLICK HERE for all the latest Barcelona news.

Douglas Bader was shot down over France in 1941 and ended up in German camp.<n>Officer was involved in mass break-out that pre-dated the break in 1944.<n>Film to be made about his exploits based on book Zero Night by Mark Felton.
Radamel Falcao was denied a chance to score against Chelsea.<n>The Colombian forward was denied space and room to breathe by John Terry.<n>Falcao was also caught out by Gary Cahill and Eden Hazard.

Chelsea are nine points clear at the top of the Premier League table.<n>The Blues are planning a victory parade through the streets of Fulham.<n>The parade is planned to take place on Monday, May 25.<n>A letter from Hammersmith and Fulham council outlines the route.<n>Click here for Chelsea transfer news.

We want to touch him. We want to know him a lot more'<n>Robert Harding, 89, served as an aircraft handler on the warship many decades before his young friends were born.

Images show runway on Fiery Cross Reef in the Spratly Islands.<n>Philippines, Vietnam, Malaysia, Brunei and Taiwan all claim the region.<n>China began building artificial islands on the reef in March 2014.<n>Images show reef virtually untouched by man-made structures.<n>But by March this year it had been transformed into an artificial island.<n>Follows flotilla of Chinese vessels dredging sand onto another island.<n>China's ambassador to the United States has said it was 'natural'

Linda Thompson, 64, tweeted her support for her former husband ahead of his ABC prime time special with Diane Sawyer set to air on Friday night.<n>She has said her former husband's anticipated confirmation that he's transgender and plans to live as a woman is as monumental as his Olympic success.<n>The couple married in 1981 and had two sons together.

The town of Zermatt has banned selfies with St Bernards in its territory.<n>The giant rescue dogs are being kept as tourist props in the town.<n>Animal welfare charity said the dogs are kept in'miserable conditions'<n>The dogs are often locked in a condemned building and left in the cold.

Researchers examined the brains of more than 900 people aged over 60.<n>US researchers found evidence that living near congested roads can lead to ‘silent strokes’ which in turn cause shrinkage of the brain.<n>Silent strokes do not have any outward symptoms and the victim is usually unaware of them.

Switzerland tops list thanks to healthy GDP figures, life expectancy.<n>Britain is ranked 21st, while the United States is 10th and Australia is 10th.<n>Bottom of the list is Syria, Burundi and Togo, ravaged by war and poverty.

Jordan Brennan, 17, was attacked in September last year, as he left his local shop.<n>His killer, now 17, was jailed for eight months for manslaughter.<n>Jordan's mother Kim, 43, has slammed the sentence, saying 'there is no justice'<n>Reveals how her son was a 'cheeky chappy' and 'lots of fun'<n>Says he longed to go on Britain's Got Talent and had made an Ed Sheeran song.

Around 15 animals ran away from a farm in Schodack, upstate New York, on Thursday and then swam across the Hudson River.<n>They then started running down the Thruway, a series of toll roads which link up the major cities in the state.<n>Three men hired by the farm were cleared to open fire Friday afternoon in a stream in woods in the town of Coeymans.<n>Police say the decision was made after experts agreed tranquilizers would not be effective and no portable corrals could hold the animals.

Contract sent out to parents of children at Turnham Primary School, London.<n>It says they must be tolerant of different sexual orientations and lifestyles.<n>But one mother said it would mean explaining something many three-year-olds are not even aware exists.

The vaccine, known as RTS,S, took 30 years to develop and cost £330m.<n>It is now hoped it can be used to save millions of lives around the world.<n>The European Medicines Agency will review the application in October.<n>If approved, it could be used by children in Africa by October this year.

Anthony Trollope, a famous novelist, introduced post boxes to the UK in 1852 after seeing them in France.<n>The first boxes were erected in Jersey in 1852 as a trial before appearing across mainland Britain.<n>Red was introduced as the colour of post boxes in 1874 and it took 10 years to repaint all post boxes.

Punters will be lining up to bet on Two Up on ANZAC Day this Saturday.<n>The game of Two Up involves the toss of two coins.<n>It is one of Australia's longest-standing traditions.<n>The Martingale Betting Strategy is used by many punters on ANZAC Day.<n>It involves doubling up if you lose, but only if you win.<n>The strategy originated in France and is used by many punters across Australia.

Molly Parks was found dead in the bathroom of the pizza restaurant where she worked in Manchester, New Hampshire on April 16.<n>Her father, Tom Parks, knew police were there and wrote an obituary asking for families to be supportive of loved ones with addictions.<n>He said Molly had battled with heroin for at least five years and had experienced a near fatal overdose before.
