Landmark Developments Ltd tore down derelict property in Bath city centre and replaced it with a modern block of 14 flats.<n>Residents complained that the development was three feet higher and four feet wider than the plans approved by the council.<n>Bath and North East Somerset Council says the developer has committed a 'breach of planning control' and ordered the building to be bulldozed.

A supervolcano in Yellowstone National Park releases 45,000 tonnes of CO2 each day.<n>Mammoth chamber beneath the surface is not large enough to produce this.<n>Now, researchers have found a secondary magma chamber deeper underground that's so large its partly-molten rock could fill the Grand Canyon 11 times over.<n>The reservoir contains around 98 per cent hot rock and is too deep to directly cause an eruption.

Cigar consumption more than doubled from 6.2billion in 2000 to more than 13.7billion in 2011 – in contrast with a 33 per cent fall for cigarettes.<n>Researchers analysed 22 studies, including five from Britain.<n>Found risks for cigar smokers of dying from oral, oesophageal or lung cancer was at least as bad as for cigarettes.
The Maybe Tonight singer said she was 'out of control' after Young Divas.<n>She said she would take anything to mask her depression.<n>The 29-year-old underwent gastric sleeve surgery in May 2012.

Dr Warren Weinstein was killed during a US drone strike in January.<n>His family have slammed the government's response to his abduction.<n>It has now been claimed they gave his captors money to guarantee his release.<n>It has also been claimed he was used as a shield to protect a senior Al Qaeda operative while in captivity.
Alessandra, 34, models for Dafiti.<n> Latin American online fashion retailer has launched its own fashion collection.<n>Mother-of-two also stars in campaign with Marlon Teixeira.

Carpenter Kyle Toth built the seesaw from trees behind his workshop.<n>It measures 45ft in length and sends its occupiers into the air at a height of 25ft.<n>Kyle said the tree was about 65ft long so he cut it to make it even on both sides.
Kim has long had her pick of holiday destinations.<n>But how has her travel tastes changed over the years?<n>Recently, she has been to Paris and Florence, Italy.

Neuroscientists at University College London carried out the study.<n>They found that'super speakers' had less activity in a region of the brain.<n>This may be because they found speech less effortful, they say.<n>Findings may also help explain why some people dry up when asked to speak.

David Marshall befriended Eni Mevish while out jogging six months ago.<n>The 68-year-old was on licence for sexually assaulting a 14-year-old girl.<n>He then stabbed her in the heart, lungs and liver at her home in Stoke.<n>Marshall was jailed for 20 years and six months at Stafford Crown Court.

Bill Parker, 34, of Gulfport was mowing his lawn on April 19 when the rusty metal wire entered his left nostril.<n>He thought a rock had struck him in the face but a CT scan revealed it was a three-and-a-half-inch metal fence wire.<n>Dr Timothy Haffey removed the wire with a simple sinus surgery which took 20 minutes and entailed making an incision on Parker's upper lip.

Guests can sleep in one of two underwater suites at Atlantis, The Palm.<n>Suites boast floor-to-ceiling views into Ambassador Lagoon aquarium.<n>Each suite has elegant perks, including soap with 24-carat gold flakes.

Navinder Sarao lived in parents' semi in Hounslow, west London, for four years.<n>It is closer to internet server used by one of major financial exchanges.<n>His trades could be processed faster than those from dealers in Central London.<n>He allegedly made £26.7million in just four years of dealing from home.<n>He was arrested at request of US authorities who accuse him of'spoofing' market.<n>He is accused of making £26million by'spoofing' the stock market.

Richard Hammond has ruled out returning to hit BBC motoring show Top Gear.<n>Tweeted: 'There's nothing for me to 'quit'. Not about to quit my mates anyway'<n>Comes as former producer Andy Wilman launched scathing attack on BBC.<n>He quit the show yesterday, fuelling speculation the team will launch new show.<n>Jeremy Clarkson was seen out last night drinking with friends in London.

The Apple Watch is officially going on sale today - but none of its stores will have them in stock.<n>Instead, consumers have to pre-order the watches online and wait for their arrival until June.<n>Analysts believe Apple is sitting on some two million pre-orders and that sales could top 20 million this year.

Fight broke out in the seventh inning of Thursday's game at Chicago's U.S. Cellular Field, Illinois.<n>Players from both dugouts and bullpens flooded the field.<n>A heated exchange between Royals starter Yordano Ventura and White Sox outfielder Adam Eaton sparked the brawl.<n> Ventura, Lorenzo Cain and Edinson Volquez were sent off along with Chicago's Chris Sale and Jeff Samardzija.

Study by Consumer Reports found 60 per cent of prawns tested contained traces of harmful bacteria.<n>Experts found E.coli, MRSA, salmonella and vibrio - a major cause of food poisoning.<n>Many prawns sold in the UK also come from places such as Thailand and Indonesia.

Samantha Crossland, 30, stole £22,000 from the Child's Play nursery.<n>She was promoted to manager at the nursery by its owner Lynda Quigley.<n>Crossland's parents Michael and Susan won more than £1.2 million on the lottery.<n>She admitted stealing from the nursery and was told to pay the money back.<n>But she escaped jail after the cash was paid back and she was spared jail.

Highlights is limited to English-language readers with the Twitter app installed on an Android device.<n>Users can browse popular tweets from people they know, as well as trending stories.<n>Highlights is being rolled out first in English for people using Android-powered devices, which can be activated in user settings.

Reality show would have seen celebrities pitted against each other.<n>It would have seen them outrun fighting bulls in Pamplona, Spain.<n>But state broadcaster RTVE has axed plans for the show.<n>Town's mayor said he feared it would turn bull running into Big Brother.

SkyWest Airlines flight 5622 was flying from Chicago to Connecticut.<n>Pilot was alerted to potential loss of cabin pressure over New York.<n>Three passengers lost consciousness and others began to feel dizzy.<n>Aircraft made emergency landing at Buffalo, New York, at 11.40am.<n>No mechanical faults have been found on the plane, says FAA.

Conrad Clitheroe, Gary Cooper and Neil Munro were arrested in February.<n>The three men were stopped by police for writing down numbers.<n>They were told they would not be detained but were taken to a police station.<n>Clitheroe's wife Valerie had written to David Cameron to ask for his help.<n>She had raised concerns about her husband's health due to his health.<n>The three men were released earlier this week and can now return home.

Imran Uddin, 25, bought keyboard spying equipment on the internet.<n>He connected to a number of university computers using the software.<n>He was able to find out the passwords that staff were typing in.<n>He then used those passwords to log on to their accounts himself.<n>On one paper, he upped his mark from 57 per cent to 73 per cent.<n>He was jailed for four months at Birmingham Crown Court.

Brian Bayers was preparing to take his son Jackson back to day-care on February 13 when he went outside to warm up his truck and drive it closer to the house.<n>He thought his son was playing inside but when he got out of his truck he noticed that the back door of his house was wide open.<n>Jackson was hit by the front wheels of the vehicle backing up and when the front wheels back around, he essentially walked right into the side of the vehicle.<n>Brian Bayers called 911 and his wife Amanda who was at work at the time.

Australian researchers have tested their drone running companion.<n>Called Joggobot it is designed to float in front of jogger when they run.<n>The technology could allow it to track the speed and direction of the runner.<n>And it could be used for other sports like cycling and rowing.<n>The researchers said theirs was ‘the first system that has been successfully deployed in an outdoor setting’

Aussie the dog saved his owners Kai, seven, and Sophie, 10, from being electrocuted in a puddle.<n>The family were walking near their home at Caves Beach, near Lake Macquarie, when he was killed suddenly in a puddle connected to a fallen live electrical wire.<n>The children were traumatised by the sight of their dog die.<n>The family waited for emergency services to come and cut the wire.

Morgan Geyser, 12, is charged with attempted murder for stabbing a classmate 19 times to please the horror character Slender Man.<n>Her lawyer applied to have her $500,000 bail reduced so that she could get out of jail and seek treatment for schizophrenia.<n>However a judge denied the motion, saying Geyser was a flight risk and capable of plotting a sophisticated plan to murder someone.<n>Geyser's lawyer says his client is schizophrenic.<n>She and a friend, Anissa Weier, 13, are being tried as adults for the attack on Payton Leutner.

rump, fillet and T-Bone are the most popular cuts of meat when eating out.<n>When we cook at home the majority of us rely on burgers or mince.<n>One in four youngsters think pocket and Y-bone are cuts of beef.

The N-222 road from Peso de Regua to Pinhao in Portugal has been awarded Best Road in the World.<n>The 27-mile stretch of tarmac cuts through the heart of the stunning Douro Valley and the picturesque wine towns of the UNESCO World Heritage Site.<n>Britain's best road is the A591 from Kendal to Keswick in the Lake District.

Revellers in remote village in Jharkhand state tie themselves upside down.<n>They hang over a wooden pole that hangs just feet above a raging fire.<n>Seconds later they throw themselves into the flames in the hope it will bring good luck.<n>Locals believe the unusual practice helps protect the village from drought.<n>They add that criticism over the safety of the ritual is misguided.

Veronica Bolina was left with horrific injuries to her face after arrest.<n>The 25-year-old had been arrested over an alleged attack on her neighbour.<n>Images have emerged of her lying partially naked on the floor in Sao Paulo.<n>Police claim she was attacked after she was seen performing a sex act in cell.<n>But reports she was set upon by officers on three different occasions.<n>Outraged supporters have set up campaign groups demanding justice for her.

Freddie Gray, 25, died a week after he was arrested and transported in a police van without a seat belt.<n>The van's compartment was so small that it was impossible to squeeze him into.<n>' Nickel rides' have caused spinal injuries in the past and Baltimore police epartment rules were updated nine days before Gray's arrest.<n>Rules say all detainees shall be strapped in by seat belts or other device.<n>Gray's family lawyer said 'his spine was 80 per cent severed' while in custody.

Thomas Hoey Jr., 43, was sentenced to 12.5 years prison Wednesday for the January 2009 death of Kimberly Calo, 41.<n>The mother of two died from a lethal mix of cocaine and alcohol at Midtown hotel The Kitano.<n>U.S. District Judge Kevin Castel said Hoey showed 'callousness and indifference' during the party.<n>He said Hoey's cocaine-based lifestyle was 'integral to the lifestyle of cocaine, sex and parties' of Hoey.

Robert Bates, 73, charged with second-degree manslaughter in Eric Harris' death.<n>Tulsa County volunteer shot and killed Harris during botched sting on April 2.<n> memo from police inquiry revealed Bates received special treatment.<n>Tulsa County District Attorney has begun contacting outside agencies.<n>He said: 'I am highly concerned about recent allegations that have surfaced'

Tom George had to leave his dog Shelby stuck by the Great Salt Lake's Spiral Jetty and drive an hour out to the nearest town.<n>But a family was willing to stay with Shelby and 20 strangers followed as they heard his story.<n>They brought in items to try and help get Shelby out, using grocery bags, car floor mats, tarp, garbage bags, a straw hat and even bare hands.

Gary Goldsmith posted picture of cyclist who hit his chihuahua on Twitter.<n>He said the man was'speeding' and 'left Cheech for dead' in Regents Park.<n>Mr Goldsmith was with his wife Julie-Ann and two dogs at the time.

Aaron Bee was wanted by police over an alleged domestic violence and assault.<n>The 22-year-old fled his home in Lincoln and went on the run for two weeks.<n>He shared selfies of himself outside police stations while on the run.<n>He was arrested in a cafe and jailed for eight months this week.<n>But he has already been released after spending less than five months behind bars.

War widows are visiting Gallipoli for the first time.<n>Ten of them have travelled to Turkey for Anzac Day on the Gallipoli Peninsula.<n>Widows of soldiers who fought on the Western Front will be guests of honour at the dawn service on Saturday.<n>Widows of soldiers who died on the battlefields will also be in attendance.

Nicholas Salvador, 25, is accused of killing Palmira Silva, 82, with a machete.<n>She was found dead in a garden in Nightingale Road, Edmonton, London.<n>Sal Salvador, nicknamed 'Fat Nick', appeared at London's Old Bailey today.<n>He also pleaded not guilty to a separate assault charge, giving same reason.

Mohamad Saeed Kodaimati, 24, a Syrian national and naturalized US citizen, is accused of making false statements to the FBI about his involvement with Syrian militants.<n>He allegedly falsely claimed he had not been involved in any fighting, had never fired his weapon at anyone and did not know any Islamic State members.<n>Federal agents investigating Saeed have uncovered Facebook photos and posts indicating his alleged involvement with Syrian militants.<n>In online chats and posts, Saeed allegedly bragged about working for a sharia court, openly expressed his support for ISIS and claimed he had fought in a gun battle that lasted four months.

The Turkish peninsula was the scene of one of the Allied's most disastrous campaigns.<n>Thousands of visitors have gathered to mark the centenary of the attack.<n>The isthmus is a patchwork of monuments and memorial stones linked by country lanes, mountain tracks and greenery.

2,700 tourists evacuated from Liberty Island after 911 caller said he was 'going to blow up' the landmark.<n>NYPD sniffer dogs seized a locker on the island, which they thought contained something suspicious.<n>Bomb squad was scrambled, but a full search of the island failed to find anything explosive.<n>All-clear given around 4:30pm, but visitors were not allowed back.

Sprinkles the 33-pound cat is so fat she can't even roll over and she's comparatively as obese as a 700-pound human, say rescue workers.<n>The neglected cat from Sea Isle City in New Jersey was handed over to the rescue agency S.O.S Sea Isle Cats by a family facing a foreclosure on their home.<n>'Whatever position she’s in, she’s stuck. She can barely move,' said S.O.S. Sea Isle City Cats volunteer Stacy Jones Olandt.<n> Sprinkles is a four-year-old spotted black and white cat who

Exeter has outdone all previous cities to get its own version of Monopoly.<n>But game makers have been told there is nowhere low-rent enough to fill Old Kent Road.<n>Thousands of voters have suggested landmarks across the city to fill the brown sections of the board, which cost $60 in Monopoly money.<n>Council leader says whoever gets the spot will be 'castigated' for it.

Mary Todd Lowrance, 49, a teacher at Moises E Molina High School, turned herself into Dallas Independent School District police on Thursday.<n>Police said Lowrance had been in a relationship with the student for a couple of months.<n>Lowrance has been on leave for several weeks while investigators worked on the case.

Joel Edgerton's great grand-uncles Simon Phillip Comerford and Laurence William Comerford served in Gallipoli in 1915.<n>According to their service records, Simon fought in Gallipoli in August 1915.<n>Nicole Kidman's great-grandfather Edward Glenny worked as a private in the military running the wireless communications during WWI.<n>The records belong to relatives of the Great Gatsby star.

Barry Lyttle, 33, has been given a 13-month suspended jail sentence.<n>He pleaded guilty to recklessly causing grievous bodily harm to his younger brother Patrick.<n>Patrick, 31, spent six days in a coma after he was allegedly struck by his brother in Kings Cross in Sydney's inner-city on January 3.<n>Magistrate Graeme Curran found Barry was of good character, remorseful and unlikely to re-offend.

Mary Cartwright was 20 when she was sent to work at Drakelow Underground Factory in Kidderminster, Worcestershire.<n>She spent two years testing metal for Bristol aircraft engines in the site's underground laboratory.<n>Now 91, the great grandmother has revisited the now defunct factory 70 years after leaving her position.

Abu Hafs al-Badri is claimed to be cousin of Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.<n>The teenager blew himself up at a checkpoint in Iraq last month.<n>Al-Badri is one of three teenage suicide bombers to blow himself up in recent weeks.

Surveillance video shows a Sound Transit Link light rail carriage going along a straight trackway in South Seattle.<n>All of a sudden a white sedan veers left into its path.<n>The car gets rapidly rammed back until the train eventually reaches a standstill as a street light gets sent flying.<n>Despite the crunch, the driver of the car miraculously escapes uninjured.

Ariana Mason, 21, claims she was also choked by the man.<n>She was being arrested at The Mirage hotel on Las Vegas's strip.<n>Ariana is suing Officer Shawn Izzo and the Metropolitan Police Department.

Khalid Rashad, 61, remanded in custody by police investigating murder.<n>Charges are for possession of explosive substance and ammunition.<n>Body of Abdul Hadi Arwani, 48, was found in his parked Volkswagen Passat.<n>He was an outspoken critic of the Assad regime in Syria.<n>Rashad was born Burnell 'Bernie' Mitchell but changed his name.

Efan James was found 'face down and unresponsive' in his mother's bed.<n>Hannah James, 26, had taken her son to bed with her at home in West Wales.<n>But the next morning he was 'lying face down and unresponsive', inquest told.<n>Coroner said new parents were given 'confusing' advice over 'co-sleeping'<n>Said parents should not share bed with baby if they 'feel very tired' or have taken drugs.

These tiny settlements are hidden away from the rest of the world.<n>Some are located in volcanic islands, or hidden behind boulders.<n>Others are hidden on cliff face villages, or hidden behind mountains.

Mysterious white lights spotted hovering perilously close to volcano eruption.<n>Footage shows lights floating close to ash cloud and smoke rising from volcano.<n>Thousands of people forced to flee 'apocalypse-like' event on Wednesday.<n>Internet user suggests lights were police helicopters, an optical illusion or alien craft.

Kevin Bowes, 53, had been a patient of Dr Nicholas Crees for 10 years.<n>But in 2013 his wife went to a different dentist after finding out extent of decay.<n>Mr Bowes was diagnosed with extensive decay and told to seek new dentist.<n>He instructed specialist dental negligence solicitors to secure £30,000 payout.<n>Mr Bowes said: 'I feel completely let down by Dr Crees. How wrong I was'

More than a dozen people were injured during a performance of American Pie at Westfield High School in Indiana on Thursday.<n>The stage collapsed as the performers walked on for the finale.<n>One student said they had previously practiced the song with the same number of people with no issue.

Sharista Giles of Sweetwater, Tennessee, went into a coma in December after a car accident.<n>She was five months pregnant at the time and doctors were forced to deliver the baby early.<n>Giles was given a two-per cent chance of recovery.<n>But she opened her eyes earlier this month and now her mom, Anna Moser, says she speaks to her daughter every day.

Trussell Trust asks for 'donation' from churches and community groups.<n>Money needed to pay for staff, branding materials and PR advice.<n>Critics accuse charity of taking money which could be spent on food.

Charlie Stayt was broadcasting from a primary school in Southampton.<n>He missed out the letter 'c' when he wrote the word for the third time.<n>Viewers took to Twitter to complain about the spelling error.<n>Stayt later described it as 'one of those things' and apologised.

Nasa scientists in California have revealed a distant image of Curiosity.<n>The rover is parked over dark sand in a valley with light-toned outcrops of rock.<n>It is seen here in the full image, circled. It is seen here in the resolution of 10 inches (25cm) per pixel.<n>The image was taken using the High-Resolution Imaging Science Experiment (HiRise) camera on the Martian satellite.<n>It is the first time it has spotted Curiosity on the surface of Mars in 2015.

Bobby Burnett forced Samantha Chudley to stop wearing make-up.<n>He wanted to make her less attractive to other men, Exeter Crown Court heard.<n>The 30-year-old installed a tracker app on her smartphone and attacked her.<n>His violence and the stress of his controlling behaviour led her to have two miscarriages.<n>Burnett was a Marine with an exemplary service record who has been thrown out of the Corps.<n>He admitted aggravated harassment and making threats to kill.<n>He was jailed for two years and two months by Judge Phillip Wassall.

Wat Pha Luang Ta Bua in Thailand's western Kanchanaburi province is home to 147 tigers in the care of monks.<n>The temple has long proved a hit among tourists who flock there to visit the monks and be photographed next to their huge feline pets.<n>But Thai wildlife officials began a headcount on Friday after allegations three tigers had recently disappeared from the sanctuary.

Kay Bennett, 33, from Swindon, says tattoos have made her jobless recluse.<n>She says she has applied for 40 jobs but has had no success.<n>She wants well-wisher to pay for laser removal so she can get rid of them.

Dr Giorgi-Guarnieri testified on Friday during court hearings in Washington, D.C.<n>That will ultimately determine whether and under which conditions John Hinckley Jr. will be allowed to live full time outside a mental hospital.<n>Hinckley's lawyer and treatment team say he's ready to live full time at his 89-year-old mother's home in Virginia under certain conditions.<n>He spends 17 days a month at his mother's Williamsburg home.

Washington couple's three-year-old had complained of someone talking to him.<n>But they put it down to their toddler's over-active imagination.<n>One night they heard a strange man's voice come over the monitor.<n>He said: 'Wake up little boy, daddy's looking for you'<n>The family believe the stranger also got into the camera on the device.

Hermann Goering cheated the hangman at Nuremberg by committing suicide.<n>He was deputy to Hitler and the regime's greatest art thief.<n>His daughter Edda, 76, has always refused to criticise him.<n>She petitioned the Bavarian parliament's Legal Affairs Committee.<n>But the petition was refused by lawmakers.

German teacher suspended from Auguste Remoir college in Limoges, France.<n>She is alleged to have said: 'German tanks come to Renoir to subdue unruly pupils'<n>17 of 20 pupils in her class signed a petition against her, which was passed on to the authorities.<n>She has denied any wrong doing, saying she was'very shocked'

Michael Gridley, 26, masterminded scam to steal £15,000 of goods from Asda.<n>Stock including alcohol, cigarettes and DVDs were taken from store in Basildon.<n>But after being sacked from Asda, Gridley landed managerial role at Lidl.

Linda and George Hunter raised their four children in their home in Wavertree.<n>They became mortgage free around 15 years ago and moved out of the street.<n>But eight years ago, the council bought properties and boarded them up.<n>Houses in the street are now being sold for just £1 by the council.<n>The Hunters feel trapped as property prices in the area have fallen.

Liu Guijuan posted pictures of her headdress on Weibo, China's equivalent of Twitter.<n>She said it was made from feathers of 80 kingfishers.<n>Singer was criticised for 'indifference' to animal welfare.<n>But she said she bought it for 120,000 yuan more than a decade ago.

A 17-year-old driver lost control of her vehicle on Thursday night.<n>The teenager crashed into a wheelie bin and collided head-on into a wall.<n>The group of five were travelling in a white Mitsubishi Lancer on Anderson Road, Glenning Valley on the Central Coast of NSW.<n>The driver sustained serious injuries to her limbs, forehead and abdomen.<n>A 17-year-old passenger suffered multiple fractures to her limbs, ribs and serious injuries to her abdomen.<n>Three other passengers were taken to Gosford District Hospital in a stable condition.

Kristy Peckham has spoken out about the years of abuse she suffered.<n>The mother of Cook MP Billy Gordon has been in hiding.<n>She has finally spoken out in an interview with A Current Affair.<n>She has detailed the years of domestic violence she suffered.<n>The violence began when she fell pregnant with their daughter and only escalated after their second child, a boy, was born.

Creflo Dollar, 53, launched appeal for donations to buy a $65million Gulfstream G650 last month.<n>He asked for 200,000 people to each donate '$300 or more'<n>Megachurch pastor says his current plane, bought in 1999, is broken.<n>He has defended the appeal saying 'the devil is trying to discredit' him.

Trio appeared on This Morning to explain their open relationship.<n>Brooke and Jane say they do not'share' Adam but are in love with each other.<n>They all live together and share a super king-sized bed.

Owners of Oregon's Sugar Pine Mine have called in armed Oath Keepers.<n>The militiamen are part of the conservative Oath Keepers activist network.<n>The owners served the facility with a stop-work order last month.<n>The miners have appealed the order and are trying to resolve the dispute peacefully.

The large Android shape covers a mountainous region near Shahpur.<n>It is not an official Google feature and the image is believed to have been added using Google's Map Maker.<n>Google has said it will be removed from Google Maps soon.
Kate, 33, snapped up a basket full of nick-nacks during her visit.<n>She bought some salad servers, a plain door mat and nautical blue bath towels.

Daniel Morcombe's killer could get out of prison early due to judge's bias.<n>Brett Peter Cowan's lawyers will file an application to have Chief Justice Tim Carmody disqualified from hearing his appeal.<n>Mr Carmody met with Bravehearts founder Hetty Johnson and shared an email, in which she referred to him as 'Tim' and included a smiley face.<n>Daniel Morcombe was abducted and murdered in December 2003.<n>Cowan was convicted of murder in 2014 and sentenced to life in prison.

Cobain lived in the apartment in L.A.'s Fairfax district during the height of Nirvana-mania.<n>The singer and his wife rented the two bedroom unit for $1,100 (£727) a month.<n>Current owner Brandon Kleinman, 31, has listed it on Airbnb.<n>He says it is 'the perfect combination of comfort, style, location and...rock n' roll history'

Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao will fight on May 2 in Las Vegas.<n>The fight is being streamed live via apps like Periscope or Meerkat.<n>Broadcasters Showtime and HBO could miss out on millions of viewers if viewers illegally stream the content between their devices.<n>Official outlets sold out within minutes of Thursday night's launch.

Zoo Weekly released a 'Special Anzac Centenary Issue' on Anzac Day.<n>The magazine used images of a bikini clad woman holding a red poppy.<n>The Department of Veteran Affairs said the word 'Anzac' is protected by federal legislation since 1920.<n>The DVA asked Zoo Weekly to remove all offending images from Facebook.<n>Social media users were quick to condemn the controversial issue.

Ibrahim Ahmad, 18, was suspended for five days for the stunt.<n>Ahmad says he was trying to go all out with his prom proposal and questions whether the decision to suspend him was based on his ethnicity.<n>The teen says the prank was all in good fun and simply part of a trend in flashy prom proposals.

Jolie briefed the council as special envoy for the U.N. on refugee issues.<n>When asked about Jolie's briefing, Syria's U.N. Ambassador Bashar Ja'afari responded: 'She is beautiful'<n>Nearly four million Syrians have fled the conflict into neighboring countries, which warn they are dangerously overstretched.

Andre Gignac says he made the'stunning discovery' in Nasa image.<n>Claims he became suspicious about a 'dark spot' on the rim of Endeavour crater.<n>So took a closer look and found 'a massive panoramic window'<n>Says it is also home to missiles, rockets and structures deployed in a circle.

Holder addressed hundreds of lawyers and staff members one day after his successor, Loretta Lynch, was confirmed by the Senate following a months-long delay.<n>'I am proud of you. I'm going to miss you. I am going to miss this building. I am going to miss this institution. More than anything, I am going to miss you all,' he said.<n>Holder, a former judge and U.S. attorney who took the job in 2009, will exit the department as the third-longest serving attorney general in U.S. history.

Remmie, 18, from London, had a thick bar put through her ear as a rebellion.<n>But the piercing became inflamed and she had to remove the bar.<n>The resulting wound healed into a hazelnut-sized keloid scar.<n>The unsightly lump has left the teenager with a bad case of confidence.<n>She has now had surgery to remove the scar but it could return.

Shabana Bibi, 25, died in hospital on Saturday after suffering burns to 80 per cent of her body.<n>Police have arrested her husband Muhammad Siddique and father-in-law Pir Bakhsh.<n>Bibi's brother, Muhammad Azam said Siddique became enraged on learning his wife had visited her sister without first asking him if she could go out.<n>He said Siddique then beat Bibi before dousing her with petrol.<n>Bibi had been married to Siddique for three years, during which time she had suffered repeated domestic abuse because the couple couldn't have children, Azam claimed.

Carol Cole, 17, disappeared in October 1980 after escaping from a Texas juvenile detention center.<n>In January 1981, police in Bossier Parish, Louisiana, found a teenage girl stabbed nine times in the back and chest stashed under a pile of leaves in the woods.<n>Carol's family posted a picture of the teen on Craigslist hoping someone would recognize her.<n>Cops used Facebook to connect the family and the victim after DNA confirmed the body was Carol's.

Toddler was playing in the garden when her family heard screams.<n>They ran to find their eight-year-old dog 'gripping' the three-year-old by her head.<n>They wrestled the animal free but the toddler suffered puncture wounds.<n>She was airlifted to Morriston Hospital in Swansea and is in a stable condition.<n>The family gave permission for their pet to be destroyed.

Alyssa Marie Chang, 56, allegedly kidnapped her lover's other girlfriend and her two-year-old son last week.<n>She was furious with the mother because she thought that the woman had been circulating doctored photos of their mutual lover in 'compromising sexual positions'<n>An Amber Alert was issued for Ronnie Tran on Tuesday, after the mother managed to escape and find help.<n>Chang's brother John Truong agreed to babysit the boy on Tuesday, and she told him they wanted to go on a date night.<n>He never met Ronnie, but he told him about the kidnapping the next day when he

EU leaders agree to send in warships and triple funding for rescue patrols.<n>Britain's HMS Bulwark and German supply ship Berlin expected to arrive.<n>Italian Prime Minister Matteo Renzi calls EU measures 'a giant step forward'<n>But Malta's prime minister Joseph Muscat says assets will 'never be enough'

Ciudad Real airport was built in 2009 at a cost of more 1billion.<n>It was closed three years later when its parent company fell into financial difficulties.<n>Judge in charge of its administration ruled that it should be sold.<n>But there have been no takers and there is now no minimum asking price.

Julieane Jablonski, 38, was arrested on Wednesday for allegedly giving her son Austin Essig, 19, a marijuana-laced brownie that caused him to jump out of a third-story window.<n>Essig commented on a police report about his own injury, saying: 'It was quite the trip for a brownie, I can tell you that much'<n>Jablonski allegedly told Essig he needed to recant his statement and lie about where the marijuana came from to get his freedom.<n>Jablonski was booked on suspicion of providing marijuana to a minor and tampering with a witness.

Connor Sullivan, 17, of Cupertino, California, went missing on Monday.<n>Teenager said he ran off spontaneously and spent most of his time at school.<n>He was using water fountains and Porta Potty on campus, police said.<n>Track athlete said he slept every night under the bleachers at Monta Vista High School.

Tipper Lewis, 43, from London, has been taking superfoods for 20 years.<n>Credits the likes of chia seeds, bee pollen and matcha green tea with her good health.<n>She studied herbs and plants in her teens and now works as a Herbalist.

Genetic analysis of two woolly mammoth remains show their population became chronically inbred.<n>They were isolated on an Arctic island for around 5,000 years, forcing them to inbreed as their population dwindled.<n>Study has raised the prospect of bringing the giant mammal back to life using cloning techniques with modern elephants.

Vivienne Garton, 65, was devastated when 10-year-old dog Ben was stolen.<n>She put up posters and appealed for him to return to her home in Bristol.<n>But she received two phone calls from man threatening to cut up pet.<n>He said he would cut him up unless she paid £500 and gave address.<n>Mrs Garton said she was'sick and scared' and had posters torn down.

Most of the compensation consisted of stock valued at $100 million.<n>Schmidt also pocketed a $1.25 million salary, a $6 million bonus and perks valued at nearly $1 million.<n>His total pay last year soared by more than five-fold from 2013 when his Google compensation was valued at $19.3 million.

Pregnant Canadian weather presenter Kristi Gordon received hate mail from viewers.<n>She read excerpts from the letters on TV.<n>Australian TV presenter Nicky Buckley has written about her own pregnancy.<n>She was slammed for showing bump on The Sale of the Century.<n>She refused to bend to critics and continued to work.

Sanjay Chaddah, 43, was embroiled in an ongoing spat with neighbours.<n>He dug up part of the block paving on their drive to make way for ornate wall.<n>Despite their objections, he carried on transforming his home.<n>He carried on transforming his modest £300,000 four-bedroom home.<n>Neighbours had objected to the wall and railings around his home.<n>But he carried on and was so incensed he charged at Mr Paton, 31.<n>He knocked him over and falsely accused him of racially aggravated assault.<n>But the move backfired when police discovered that the altercation had been

After one of the warmest Aprils on record, temperatures are set to fall.<n>Britain will go from being hotter than Turkey and Ibiza to colder than Moscow, Stockholm and Finland in a matter of days.<n>It also threatens to cause a wet and miserable time for the thousands of runners taking part in Sunday's London Marathon.

Cadbury's set to release a super bar containing seven different fillings.<n>The Dairy Milk Spectacular will contain one row each of: Dairy Milk Caramel, Dairy Milk Fruit & Nut, Dairy Milk Whole Nut, Dairy Milk Oreo, Dairy Milk Daim, and Dairy Milk Turkish.<n>Only 50 of the bars will be available to buy.

LaNia Roberts, 18, is a painting student at Syracuse University.<n>She recently gave a motivational speech titled 'Love Yourself Unconditionally'<n>LaNia began painting self-portraits in high school and recently moved to a more relaxed style at Syracuse.

Comcast CEO Brian Roberts announced the company was abandoning its bid to buy Time Warner Cable for $45.2billion.<n>'Today, we move on,' Roberts said in a statement.<n>On Wednesday night, it emerged that Federal Communications regulators decided that merger wasn't in the public interest.<n>This followed fierce opposition from net neutrality activists and content providers like Disney and 21st Century Fox.

Vonda Thedford, 55, spotted the carcass lying on a rural road in Pittsburg County, Oklahoma.<n>She was disturbed to see it had 'a little truck' in place of a nose, 'little toes' and 'hair on its tail'<n>In a bid to document the unusual-looking beast, she whipped out her camera phone.<n>Wildlife experts who studied the skeleton told Fox News the bones appear to be from a young dog.<n>The legend of the chupacabra dates back to 1995 in Puerto Rico, where many local farmers claimed to have seen the animal after finding their livestock had

Graeme Finlay, 53, went on trial after Ron Phillips, 70, and his wife June, 69, were knocked unconscious in the incident.<n>The frail couple accused Finlay of an unprovoked attack.<n>But the gas worker insisted he only acted in self-defence.

Bradley Parkes, 16, is fighting for his life in a coma after a suicide attempt.<n>He was discovered hanging in the woods with a suicide note.<n>His mother Tiffany, 35, said he had been tormented for months by a gang.<n>She said he had been robbed at knifepoint and even slashed in the face.<n>Ms Parkes, a mother-of-five, said she wanted to do everything in her power to help her son pull through.

Beach hut on Mudeford Spit in Christchurch, Dorset, has gone on the market for £230,000 - the same price as a family home in many parts of Britain.<n>The hut has no mains water or electricity and can only be reached by boat or a novelty 'Noddy' train.<n>Owners will also have to shell out between £2,500 and £4,000 a year in ground rent to Christchurch Borough Council.<n>Hut 39 commands spectacular views across the Solent, although the vista is blighted by a rubbish skip dumped on the beach.

Pret chief executive revealed staff can hand out coffee to people they like.<n>Clive Schlee said staff have to give away a 'certain number' of drinks a week.<n>FEMAIL writer Deni Kirkova visited six Prets across London to find out.<n>She tried nonchalant, sad and friendly approaches to getting a free drink.

Tibetan Mastiffs once commanded prices of up to £1.2million each.<n>But their fortunes are now in decline due to China's corruption crackdown.<n>Owners are no longer allowed to own dogs over 50kg - a huge drop.<n>Dogs' meat is now being put into cheap hotpots and used for leather belts.

Scientists at the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration in Newport, Oregon, recorded an underwater volcano erupting.<n>They found the volcano gave off a muted thrum rather than a loud roar.<n>The research could allow scientists to monitor undersea volcanoes far more effectively than they have before.

Sawyer Sweeten, 19, shot himself in the head while visiting family in Texas.<n>His manager said there were no signs of trouble prior to the suicide.<n>Ray Romano, who worked with Sawyer for nine years, said he was 'terribly saddened'

DeShawn Isabelle, 15, has been arrested for allegedly robbing, beating and sexually assaulting a woman on a Chicago train.<n>The middle school student was sitting in the otherwise empty carriage when the woman boarded the CTA train in Oak Park on Monday at 3pm.<n>During the brutal beating, Isabelle put his hands inside the woman's pants and sexually assaulted her, according to prosecutors.<n>The teen also allegedly groped the woman over her clothes and slapped her buttocks and then sat on her head as he continued to beat her.<n>Isabelle's mother turned her son in to the police after she recognized his face

Brianne Altice, 35, pleaded guilty to three counts of forcible sexual abuse in exchange for prosecutors dropping 11 other counts.<n>One of the boys was 16 and two were 17 when they were having sex with Altice, and one testified that he considered her to be his girlfriend during their yearlong tryst.<n>The boys were all minors, and Utah law also says a person cannot consent to sex if the other person is in a position of special trust.<n>Altice could face up to 45 years in prison when she is sentenced next month.

The Human Powered Vehicle (HPV) was developed by engineers at Plymouth University.<n>It will be piloted by paracyclist Liz McTernan and travel over 656ft (200-metres)<n>The bike will need to travel in excess of 21.39 miles per hour (34.42 km/h) over a 656ft (200-metres) stretch of tarmac in Nevada.<n>The current benchmark is held by Tracy Miller who broke the record on 13 May 1995 on a bike called Chairiot.

Charles Severance, 54, is accused of killing three people in Alexandria, Virginia.<n>His rambling writings, which included a biblical passage, were revealed during a court hearing on Thursday.<n>Severance's trial will be moved to Fairfax County over fears for an impartial jury due to the hysteria surrounding the murders.

Sgt Louise Lucas, 41, was hit by a bus while trying to save her daughter.<n>The mother-of-three was rushed to hospital but later died from her injuries.<n>Hundreds of police officers lined the roads for her funeral in Cardiff today.<n>Her husband Gavin Lucas paid tribute to his wife saying she was his hero.

Kim Pappas, 25, gave birth in the toilet at work in Wyandotte, Michigan.<n>She returned to her desk two hours later with the baby in a plastic bag.<n>She cut the umbilical cord with cuticle scissors and hid it in her drawer.<n>But workers at Ceva Logistics saw blood in the cubicle and alerted police.<n>P Pappas has been charged with premeditated murder and denied bail.

Brian Cassidy was picking up trash outside the store in Bangor, Maine on Thursday when he found the wet stack of money.<n>He immediately contacted security and they contacted the police department, who then returned the money to its owner.<n>Last winter, Ou Chen lost the cash when he cleared snow off his car after leaving his job at a nearby restaurant.<n>He had intended to send the money home to his family but realized that his pocket was empty after he left the car.

Eve Stratford, 22, was a Playboy bunny who worked in London.<n>She was stabbed between eight and 12 times in March 1975.<n>Six months later Lynne Weedon, 16, was raped and murdered.<n>Both murders were linked in 2006 after matching DNA was found.<n>Scotland Yard has now offered a £40,000 reward in a bid to find the killer.

The tiny nipper - measuring just 5.5 inches long - was caught during a 2010 government research trip and its body remained frozen while biologists went about identifying it.<n>This week scientists revealed the dinky creature is a pocket shark - a miniature variation of the more popular kinds.<n>The young male is the second of its species ever seen.<n>The first pocket shark was found 36 years ago in the Pacific Ocean off the coast of Peru and it's been sitting in a Russian museum since.

Taliban militants launched 108 attacks in the first five hours of the offensive.<n>US air base near Kabul and military outposts in Nuristan were targeted.<n>Taliban spokesman claims 80 per cent of Afghanistan is 'controlled' by Taliban.<n>Operation Azm, meaning 'determination', is expected to be bloodiest fighting season in a decade.

Little Jiaojiao only survived because rain canopies, laundry racks and wet grass broke her fall in Zheng Du City, Central China.<n>Her mother, Zheng Jiayu, 31, who left Jiaojiao at home on her own, now cannot afford the huge £100,000 medical bill.

The One Direction star was pictured at London's Soho Hotel on Wednesday night, rolling a'suspicious cigarette' while sat on a sofa.<n>A series of newly-released Snapchat shots have now emerged, showing Louis partying with five female friends in his hotel room.<n>One of the girls jokes that they don't know which member of One Direction he is, hinting that they aren't sure which one he is.

Samsung's next-generation wearable will have a circular face.<n>The Korean giant announced its developer scheme for the device.<n>It will be the 7th generation of the Gear smartwatch.<n>Samsung's previous watches have all had rectangular faces.<n>The Pebble Steel and Apple Watch are square.

Andrew Hichens, 28, is the first person to be trained as a so-called first responder to all types of 999 call.<n>He will be working with one PC and two Police Community Service Officers in Hayle, Cornwall.<n>Father-of-two will mostly be patrolling his beat and spreading safety messages.

Kim Woodward, 34, is the first woman to be appointed head chef at the Savoy Grill.<n>Follows in the footsteps of matre chefs who have headed the kitchen since its opening in the Strand, London in 1889.<n>Auguste Escoffier — dubbed ‘chef of kings’ — was installed by hotel manager César Ritz when the Savoy first opened.<n>Woodward will head a team of about 35 chefs, of whom some 40 per cent are women.

Zeta Beta Tau at the University of Florida and Emory University in Atlanta, Georgia, are under investigation for the deplorable behavior.<n>Students allegedly spat on the ex-servicemen and threw beer off a balcony.<n>The students were attending a formal at the Lakedown Wharf Resort in Panama City on April 17.<n>The Warrior Beach Retreat is a weekend for veterans and their families.<n>Around 60 veterans attended with their families.

Midlands city had 15,000 rat-related calls between 2013 and 2014.<n>Newcastle is most pest-infested place in UK with 5% of residents calling in.<n>Southend is most pest-free place with just 0.03 per cent of people having a problem.<n>Figures released by British Pest Control Association to warn of rise in pests.

Christien Sechrist, 20, from Houston, Texas, had a black and white image of his young son Perseus etched onto the left side of his head in July.<n>The trainee electrician claims that his young son Perseus 'loves it'
Lucy, 23, and Lydia, 19, star in new campaign for Sunkissed.<n>Say it was fun because they don't get to see each other often.<n>Lucy admits she used to overindulge on her fake tan.

Hormone replacement therapy (HRT) is used to ease the effects of menopause.<n>Women's Health Initiative in the US and Million Women Study in the UK both found it increases a woman's risk of breast cancer.<n>Those who take combined oestrogen and progesterone HRT have an increased risk up to eight years after stopping treatment.

Towie, population 300, has a single road, a few houses, primary school, church, graveyard and a community hall.<n>Turkish mining giant Koza Altin Isletmeleri and a Highland firm GreenOre are now seeking planning permission for further investigation.

The news comes after a tornado touched down in Florida on Thursday afternoon.<n>The tornado took place at about 2:45pm near Belle Glade in Palm Beach County, but did not cause any damage.<n>Thunderstorms were predicted to take place in a number of states, including in parts of South Dakota, Nebraska, Kansas, and Texas.<n>Severe thunderstorms may take place in several states Friday and affect metropolitan areas, namely Wichita, Kansas City, Missouri, Oklahoma City, along with Dallas, Houston, and San Antonio.<n>For Saturday, thunderstorms may occur in Nashville, Memphis, Atlanta, Tallahassee, Jacksonville, New Orleans,

Labour leader used a keynote campaign speech to blame the PM.<n>He suggested the deaths of refugees could have been avoided.<n>Mr Cameron has been accused of neglecting Libya after the uprising.<n>Up to 1,750 refugees have lost their lives trying to reach Europe this year.

The 1954 Bentley R-Type Continental Fastback sold for £739,212 at auction.<n>It was estimated to sell for around £200,000 but was bought for four times that.<n>The car was originally commissioned by Welsh racing driver R D Weatherall.<n>It was painted in his racing colour of purple and still bears his initials.<n>The Bentley now needs a full restoration but could be worth more than £1million.

Robert O'Neill will host shooting retreat in Jackson Hole, Wyoming.<n>Potential attendees were contacted by a conservative nonprofit for change.<n>Asked to write back by May 10 for chance to open fire alongside O'Neill.<n>Will be held at luxury Amangani Resort Hotel on edge of Grand Teton National Park.<n>O'Neill claims to have killed Al Qaeda leader Osama bin Laden in 2011.

Elizabeth 'Elle' Edmunds established an online fundraising page in August 2014 claiming she had ovarian cancer and seeking money for medical treatment.<n>Police alleged the 31-year-old mother used a falsified doctor's certificate stating she had terminal cancer to raise about $2500 from her page.<n>In February, Ms Edmunds told a Belmont Local Court she was put up to the act by her violent partner John Heagney.<n>She was issued a court notice this week for the offence of two counts of obtaining benefits by deception.

George Kirby and Doreen Luckie will marry after first getting together 27 years ago.<n>Between them they have had seven children, 15 grandchildren and seven great-grandchildren.<n>On their wedding day, the pair will have a combined age of 194 years and 281 days.

Barbara Anne Beam died in her Greenville, South Carolina home on January 2 after her sister and nephew found her slumped in her chair.<n>The coroner's office ruled her death was homicide by neglect.<n>Prosecutors are now deciding whether to charge the family.

Troublesome the elephant has become a regular visitor to Etali Safari Lodge.<n>He has been filmed wandering around the pool area and deck area.<n>Staff have tried to deter him from emptying the pools with their efforts.<n>But the cheeky elephant has defied their efforts and kept out-witting them.

Christopher Whitmore, 36, killed his son Grayden, 8, and wife Melissa Ball, 27.<n>He then turned the gun on himself at a gas station in Varnell, Georgia.<n>Ball was seen pulling into the station with their son when she was shot.<n>Police said Ball and Whitmore had a history of domestic issues.<n>It is unclear what motivated the horrific shooting in Varnell.

Chipotle will work with the Postmates app to begin offering delivery.<n>The service will be available in 67 cities - with delivery fees starting at $5.<n>The fast-casual chain has gone from strength to strength in recent years.<n>Two presidential candidates have been spotted in Chipotle recently.

Eva Kor, 81, embraced Oskar Groening, 93, in court today.<n>Groening is accused of being complicit in the murder of 300,000 people.<n>He was the Bookkeeper of Auschwitz and worked for an insurance company.<n>Mrs Kor was injected with 'deadly germ' by infamous Nazi Josef Mengele.<n>She was one of the victims of Mengele's 'death camp experiments'

Navinder Singh Sarao, 37, is facing extradition to the U.S. on charges of manipulating the share market and helping trigger a trillion dollar Wall Street crash in 2010.<n>He was bailed with a £5million surety but has not been able to pay it.<n>He will remain in custody at Westminster Magistrates' Court until Monday.<n>Under bail conditions he must live at parents' home in Hounslow, west London.<n>He must be tagged and his passport must be surrendered as part of bail conditions.

Liam Byrne left note after Labour's election defeat in 2010.<n>Note said: 'I'm afraid that there is no money'<n>Mr Alexander today sent a letter to Mr Byrne apologising for the late reply.<n>It said: 'The deficit halved. Jobs up. Growth up. That's the Lib Dem record'

Xie Shisheng was just 16 years old when was imprisoned by the mill owner.<n>Now 34, a very gaunt Xie said he was hit with a hammer and beaten daily.<n>When police arrived at the mill the owners fled the scene.

Bahar Mustafa, 27, student union welfare officer, pictured in front of sign.<n>She is pictured pretending to cry while holding a cup of tea with tears running down.<n>Sign also refers to a ban on 'cis' or cisgender men, a term for transgenders.<n>She had told white people and men 'not to come' to a meeting last week.<n> Goldsmiths' union eventually backed down after a backlash from students.

Concept artist Alex Brady from Cambridge has created beautiful pictures of what space travel might look like.<n>He imagines a space station of tomorrow similar to Las Vegas.<n>It has neon lights, a Ferris wheel and a lit-up cowboy.<n>'I liked the kind of trashy, flashy future in movies like The Fifth Element,' he told MailOnline.

Benjamin Mellor ripped open one of the 41 bales of cocaine after food ran out.<n>The 35-year-old window cleaner broke his wrist in the drug haul.<n>He was one of three Brits arrested after Naval officers stormed the yacht.<n>The scheme began in 2013 when John Powell took charge of the boat.<n>He sailed it for a year as a charter boat to provide a cover story.<n>But the plot started to unravel when another vessel had to be rescued.

The Marry British Royalty Spinner Charm comes in 14K gold vermeil or sterling silver for $198 and $148.<n>The jewelry brand's founder Nicole Parker King launched the collection in 2014 after traveling on six different continents and nearly 50 countries.

Kerrie Armitage suffers from the ultra-rare condition aquagenic urticaria.<n>She was diagnosed after her skin erupted in agonising blisters in a rain storm.<n>Now she has to stop kissing her husband Peter because of his saliva.<n>She claims a kiss from him can trigger a painful flare-up.<n>The 28-year-old has also been forced to give up her job as a cleaner.

Skyscanner CEO Gareth Williams believes travel will become more personalised.<n>By 2030, we may have an 'e-agent' in our jewellery that can show us 3D holograms.<n>Airport check-in will be automated and passport holders will be scanned.

Lincolnshire resort is one of the most popular places in Britain to own a holiday home.<n>Skegness joins picturesque places such as St Ives and Windermere in top ten.<n>It is number five among the UK's holiday home hotspots behind Windermere.

Dan Churchill, 25, is a sexy, single surfer from Sydney.<n>He toured the US to promote his cook book 'Dude Food'<n>He met Gossip Girl star Blake Lively on Good Morning America.<n>Churchill admitted to the Hollywood starlet that he crushes on husband Ryan Reynolds.

Australians have taken to social media to remember the sacrifice of the Anzacs.<n>Record numbers gathered at dawn services across the country to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the Gallipoli landing.<n>Proud Aussies came together in huge numbers in Sydney, while more paid their respects in Queensland's regional towns.

Lisa Heath, 45, was an assistant at Willowtown Community Primary School.<n>A colleague found white powder in her bag and reported it to police.<n>She initially denied the drugs were hers, saying they had been planted on her.<n>But she later changed her story, accepting a caution for possession.<n>She has now been suspended from the school in Ebbw Vale, Gwent.

Ed Miliband has been touring the country with the prop during election campaign.<n>He has delivered key speeches in the campaign stood behind the lectern.<n>But it has also been deployed when he is just making brief remarks.<n>He spoke in Loughborough car park and in front of an aeroplane in Bristol.

App dubbed 'Project Elysium' claims to create a 'personalised afterlife experience'<n>It could be a step towards uploading memories and personalities into computers.<n>The technology is still under development and developers have not revealed how it will work.

John Elder and Armin T. Wegner both documented the unimaginable suffering they witnessed.<n>Wegner, a German nurse, risked imprisonment to smuggle out images of the Armenian massacre.<n>Today marks 100th anniversary of the Armenian genocide.

Paul Nungesser, a German citizen, was accused of raping Emma Sulkowicz.<n>She paraded her mattress around campus in protest, calling him a rapist.<n>Nungesser claims Columbia presented the allegations as fact on a university-owned website.<n>Lawsuit seeks unspecified damages.

Islamic State Health Service (ISHS) is said to be a copy of the NHS.<n>Video features an Australian pediatrician and an Indian physiologist.<n>Doctor is shown monitoring and handling babies in a maternity unit.<n>He also urges foreign doctors to travel to Syria and help ISIS with health care.

Pepsi will no longer contain the sweetener aspartame in its diet drinks.<n>The decision comes after a decade of plummeting sales for the drink.<n>Consumers have shifted away from diet drinks because of perceived health concerns about artificial sweeteners, specifically aspartame.<n>The sweetener has been linked to a range of health problems, including cancer.<n>PepsiCo and Coca-Cola blame the decline on perceptions aspartame is not safe.

A new species of frog has been found in Brazil.<n>Called Hylodes japi, it was found to mate underground in secret chambers.<n>Males and females typically find a spot to mate in about five minutes.<n>And the male will cover up the eggs to protect them from predators.<n>It was found in the Atlantic forest of Serra do Japi in the State of So Paulo, Brazil.

Former state District Judge G. Todd Baugh of Billings has been chosen for a lifetime achievement award by his local bar association.<n>Baugh, 73, sparked widespread outrage in 2013 over comments suggesting that 14-year-old Cherice Moralez shared some responsibility for her rape by a teacher.<n>Baugh sentenced former teacher Stacey Rambold to just one month in prison in the case.<n>Moralez killed herself before the case went to trial.

Jenrry Mejia has been suspended for 80 games after testing positive for a banned substance stanozolol.<n>The 25-year-old right hander will not be able to play again until at least July.<n>Mejia is on the disabled list with an inflamed elbow.

Pasco County Sheriff's office reported it has received death threats.<n>Footage showed Deputy Kerry Kempink killing the dog while responding to call.<n>The video, shot on Kempink's body camera, showed the deputy jumping a fence into the property where he as then confronted by two dogs.<n>Owner Carla Gloger begged the officer to put her pet out of its misery.

Jenna Marotta, 27, of New York, developed dermatillomania, a compulsive skin-picking disorder that left her face bleeding.<n>She would squeeze her pores for hours on end and then go ten days without touching her face.

Anthony Martinez, an openly-gay high school junior, was touched when his straight guy pal Jacob Lescenski, stepped in to fill the spot.<n>Lescenski greeted Martinez in the locker room at Desert Oasis High School on Tuesday morning with a huge pink banner reading: 'You're hella gay, I'm hella str8 but you're like my brother, so be my d8?'<n>Martinez immediately responded to the question with a big 'yes' and excited hug.<n>The pair will be attending the prom on May 2 in Nevada.

Surveillance cameras caught the thief taking $9,000 out of the account of Kate Sullivan at Chase branches in Commack and Freeport on September 23, 2014.<n>State police say the female suspect then racked up $4,000 in bills after opening four store credit cards in Sullivan's name in New Haven, Connecticut.<n>Sullivan, who had lung cancer, was informed of the fraud while fighting for her life at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in New York.<n>The 50-year-old had worked as a marketing executive for fashion designers Kimora Lee Simmons and Diane von Furstenberg.

Daniela D'Addario, 35, was found dead in the boot of her car on Wednesday.<n>Her boyfriend, Josaia 'Joey' Vosikata, 27, has been charged with her murder.<n>The pair were reported missing by Ms D'Addario's family in the ACT.<n>She found out a month ago that he had a secret wife and children back in Fiji after he moved into her apartment in Canberra.<n>Mr Vosikata was arrested in Bermagui, NSW, on Thursday and has since been extradited to the ACT.

1986 file is mentioned in an investigation into an alleged government cover up.<n>Home Office has refused to comment on the dossier, which could conceal name.<n>News comes as 30 more alleged victims come forward since Lord Janner decision.

Lewis Hamilton sprayed champagne straight into the face of a hostess.<n>He celebrated his win at the Chinese Grand Prix by doing it.<n>But leading group which campaigns against sexism has condemned him.<n>They say he should be forced to apologise for'specially directing' bubbly into her face.

Driver caught on camera driving his Honda sports car at 67mph in Essex.<n>He initially ignored police attempts to confirm who was driving the car.<n>The 35-year-old tried to convince authorities that his cousin was driving.<n>He challenged the verdict in six courts before finally admitting perjury.<n>The driver, who changed his surname by deed poll, has been jailed for nine months.

Randy and Jodi Speidel, from Bellefontaine, Ohio, created online fundraisers in late February begging for financial help.<n>Couple's landlord found a note warning passersby of carbon monoxide poisoning in their bedroom on Tuesday.<n>The Speidles had been living without gas all winter, had no running water and cut down their food intake to one meal a day.

Transport for London has launched a campaign to tackle sexual abuse.<n>Footage shows a woman being groped on the Tube by a persistent male.<n>Every time he steps up his creepy efforts, the narrator asks: 'Would you report it?'

Bianca Gascoigne was talking on her phone in Marylebone when she was mugged.<n>The gang of eight on bikes grabbed her phone and tried to snatch her bag.<n>They then ran off when she fought them off and left her with her phone.<n>The 28-year-old is said to have been left devastated by the theft.<n>She has branded the muggers 'lowlifes on bikes' on her Twitter page.

Scottish First Minister says she understands concerns of English voters.<n>Suggests David Cameron has been 'not unhelpful' to SNP by publicity.<n>Polls suggest SNP is on brink of landslide on a scale unprecedented in British politics.

UKIP leader says he is suffering from terrible back and shoulder pain.<n>Reveals he has been prescribed sleeping pill and muscle relaxant.<n>Says he is now feeling 'pretty bouncy' and may give up smoking.

Karen Buckley's death certificate was signed by her parents Marion, 62, and John, 61.<n>The nursing student vanished after a night out in Glasgow's west end.<n>Her remains were uncovered at High Craigton Farm, near Milngavie, East Dunbartonshire.<n>Alexander Pacteau, 21, appeared at Glasgow Sheriff Court today.<n>He made no plea and was remanded in custody.

Ariana Miyamoto, 20, was born and raised in Japan and was crowned Miss Japan last month.<n>She is the first ever mixed race beauty queen and says she has faced racial abuse.<n>Some critics of her win have complained she is a mixed race 'hafu' and not Japanese enough.

James Webster, 35, filmed up women's skirts as they bent over freezers.<n>He was caught after attracting attention of a fellow shopper at the store.<n>Webster admitted outraging public decency and was warned he could face jail.<n>But he was spared jail and ordered to complete a sexual offences treatment programme.

Cops began following the wild animal after it was spotted scurrying through Battery Park City at 6am on Saturday.<n>For two hours it evaded capture, with one witness describing hows cops were chasing it 'like a suspect'<n>It was shot with a tranquilizer dart and put in a cage and taken away into the care of the ASPCA.<n>At least four coyotes have been spotted around Manhattan so far this year.

Lord Fellowes, 65, plans new TV show based on Anthony Trollope's Doctor Thorne.<n>TV insiders say Lily James, who stars in Disney's Cinderella, would be ideal as Mary in the new ITV drama.<n>Trollope's tale is considered one of his best works.

Peter Gale, 47, was dismissed by Nonsuch High School For Girls two weeks ago.<n>He was dismissed for 'unprofessional and inappropriate conduct', school said.<n>Mail on Sunday investigation has revealed he sent 'informal' emails to pupil.<n>Mr Gale became the academy's first male head when he was appointed 18 months ago.<n>School rules forbid teachers sending messages to pupils from private email accounts.

The haunted mirror in a Philadelphia home is said to contain the souls of the wife and children of a Louisiana slave master.<n>The Indiana 'ghost cane' is said to have caused the death of 17 people close to a slave master who murdered a slave.<n>The case of the haunted bunk beds of Wisconsin became infamous in 1987 when a couple bought them from a junk shop.

Shoccara Marcus returned to her childhood home after her father was diagnosed with cancer in 2011.<n>A dancer since she was four years old, her way of coping with the transition was through dance.<n>Marcus said she has been working on the project for more than a year and said in the end, she found love and acceptance in the home.

Gran Canaria is just four hours from the UK, making it one of the most easily reached locations for guaranteed winter sun.<n>The Alfredo Kraus Auditorium is one of the most impressive locations for any performance centre.<n>Gran Canaria is home to the Canarian Philharmonic Orchestra, and world stars at the Canaries Jazz Festival.

Alison Saunders, 54, sparked outrage last week by letting off Lord Janner.<n>She decided 86-year-old should not face a string of charges of paedophilia.<n>It has emerged she trained at same firm as disgraced Labour peer.<n>CPS spokesperson insists pair have never met despite three-year overlap.
