The Anthem Of The Seas is Royal Caribbean's second Quantum-class liner.<n>The 4,180-passenger vessel set sail on its maiden voyage last week.<n>Amenities on board include a vertical wind tunnel for skydiving at sea.

Architect Yener Torun sought to challenge the one dimensional view of his changing city.<n>He captures the new, minimalistic buildings that add a splash of colour to Istanbul.<n>The photographer, who has lived in Istanbul for 14 years, aims to show a clean minimalistic view of the city.

Los Angeles Angels of Anaheim are willing to pay almost $70million for Josh Hamilton to play in Texas.<n>Hamilton, who has a history of substance abuse, is on the disabled list with a shoulder injury.<n>He filed for divorce from his wife, Katie, in February after they celebrated ten years together.<n>Hamilton still has about $83million left on the five-year $125million deal he signed with the Angels in 2012.

The man has been identified as 26-year-old Chris Blowes.<n>He was surfing about 350 metres offshore at Fishery Bay, South Australia, when he was attacked.<n>Shocked witnesses said the shark was seen swimming away with the surfer's leg in its mouth.<n>The man was airlifted to Adelaide for further treatment.
Ron Ingraham, 67, went missing in November after a huge storm hit his boat.<n>He survived for 12 days on raw fish before he was rescued.<n>On Friday his boat ran aground and he is still missing.

Melissa Klein and her husband Aaron refused to make Rachel Bowman-Cryer and her wife Laurel a wedding cake in 2013 because of their religious beliefs.<n>They raised more than $100,000 from anonymous donors on a fundraising page before it was shut down for violating GoFundMe's terms of service.<n>The couple filed a civil rights suit and said they had received death threats.<n>Oregon prohibits businesses from discriminating based on sexual orientation and the Kleins were found guilty of discrimination earlier this year.<n>The couple closed their bakery in 2013 amid attention to the discrimination case and now operate it from their home.

18-year-old Xie Xu carries his physically disabled classmate Zhang Chi to school each day.<n>Zhang suffers from muscular dystrophy, a condition that weakens skeletal muscle.<n>Xie decided to carry his friend around the school's campus to make sure he was able to attend all of his classes.

Craig 'Lazie' Lynch shows off toned physique in audacious self-portraits.<n>Lynch is serving nine years for a series of violent gang robberies.<n>He is said to be making huge profits from websites selling legal highs.

Fred Pagan, 49, is the personal assistant to Mississippi Senator Thad Cochran (R-MS)<n>Police seized a package with over a kilo of date rape drug GBL addressed to him.<n>They raided his home on Thursday and found 181.5 grams of meth.<n>Pagan was paid $160,000 in his Senate role last year.

Splendour of the Seas will be transformed by Thomson next summer.<n>Cruise ship will sail away from Royal Caribbean and get a new name.<n>It is one of many small cruise ships that have been reinvented over the years.

Tracey Woodford, 47, believed to have been attacked in woodland on Tuesday.<n>She was taken back to property of man she was thought to have left pub with.<n>Her body was discovered with'massive injuries' at the property yesterday.<n>Man named locally as Christopher May, 50, has been arrested over murder.

Zachary Cope Ward closed on April 15 after eight patients were found to be carrying carbapenemase-producing enterobacteriaceae.<n>The antibiotic-resistant bacteria can cause potentially fatal infections in the bloodstream and urine.<n>Three patients developed localised infections that required treatment, but all have since recovered.<n>The 20-bed unit, which specialises in vascular surgery, is now undergoing a deep cleaning and patients continued to be screened.<n>If all goes to plan, the Duchess of Cambridge hopes to have her baby at the private Lindo Wing of the hospital, where her first child, Prince George, was born.
Scottish DJ Calvin Harris is rumored to be dating American singer Taylor Swift.<n>The pair were spotted together at a party in West Hollywood.
Coca-Cola has switched all lids on its 500ml bottles to red.<n>Fans of diet Coke have been left confused by the change.<n>The company says it is to'make consumers aware of the full choice'

Ed Miliband accused of trying to make political capital from Mediterranean tragedy.<n>Labour leader claimed PM's Libya policy was 'in part a direct result'<n>Tories said Miliband was 'accusing the Prime Minister of murder'

Prime Minister was outlining his vision for black and ethnic minority communities.<n>He said: 'Of course, I'd rather you supported West Ham'<n>Cameron blamed his gaffe on a 'brain fade' like that suffered by Green leader Natalie Bennett earlier in the campaign.

The Kansas City Royals and Chicago White Sox were both forced to play a series-opening game Saturday after a brawl.<n>Four Royals and three White Sox were suspended for their roles in the brawl.<n>White Sox pitchers Chris Sale and Jeff Samardzija were suspended five games each.<n>White Sox catcher Tyler Flowers escaped suspension but was fined.

Sebastiano Quagliata and his wife, Valbona Lucaj, pleaded no contest to owning a dangerous dog causing death in the fatal mauling last summer of Craig Sytsma.<n>Sytsma, 46, was attacked by two cane corsos last July in Metamora Township, 45 miles northwest of Detroit.<n>The father-of-three was bitten some eight times by two hundred-pound cane corsos while jogging in Metamora Township in July.<n>The two have been in custody for months and were facing a second-degree murder charge before making the plea deal.

Cosmo editor Bronwyn McCahon says she regrets magazine didn't investigate Belle Gibson before presenting her with Fun Fearless Female Award.<n>But she says Gibson won the award, which is given to inspiring women in times of 'triumph and adversity'<n>Gibson, 23, created a social media empire and The Whole Pantry movement on the story of her remarkable cancer survival.<n>But it has emerged she had failed to hand over money raised through social media to five charities as promised.<n>She admitted her cancers may have been'misdiagnosed' in an interview with Australian Women's Weekly.

Grace Rebecca Mann, 20, was found dead in her home last week.<n>Her roommate, Steven Vander Briel, 30, has been charged with her murder.<n>Mann's parents, a local judge and his wife, paid tribute to their daughter.<n>Described her as compassionate and principled young woman.

Leslie Roy, 52, and Lee Marie Wright, 56, got stuck April 11 in Luce County, Michigan, while visiting relatives.<n>They were found Friday near Lake Superior after a pilot noticed a reflection off their SUV and landed the police helicopter on shore.<n>Roy, of Valley, Nebraska, and Wright of Depew, Oklahoma, got stuck about three miles from Crisp Point Lighthouse in Luce County in the Upper Peninsula.<n>They had eight boxes of Girl Scout cookies and a bag of cheese puffs as well as layers of clothes to stay warm.

The girl's parents are divorced and she was taken to the concert in December 2013 as part of Pink's Truth About Love tour.<n>The father said he disagreed with the'sexually suggestive' nature of some of the singer's performances and did not want his daughter seeing it.<n>A judge ruled that while the singer's works can be suggestive, they are preteen-appropriate.

The avalanche buried part of base camp, raising fears for the safety of climbers.<n>A number of Britons are among those who have not been heard from.<n>The identities of those who died in the avalanche have not yet been released.

Jenner said he is a Republican and 'always been on the conservative side'<n>Also said he is a Christian and wondered if transitioning to a woman was his cause.<n>Interviewer Diane Sawyer looked shocked when he made the revelation.<n>Jenner said he would lobby the GOP over LGBT rights.

Deputy of disgraced former mayor appeared to blame vote-rigging scandal on 'institutional racism'<n>Oliur Rahman insisted there was deep-rooted racism within East London borough of Tower Hamlets.<n>His comment was at odds with a devastating legal ruling that condemned his predecessor for bribery and ballot fraud.

Tourist police officers Samuel Kvarzell, Markus Asberg, Eric Jansberger and Erik Naslund halted a fight between two homeless men on the Uptown 6 train this Wednesday.<n>A video of the selfless act then surfaced and has spread on social media, gaining them attention from hoards of fans, both male and female.<n>New York Police Commissioner Bill Bratton thanked them on Friday and said their restraint tactics were in line with what NYPD teaches their officers.<n>'We're no heroes, just tourists,' he said. 'We're no heroes, just tourists'

Steelcase's the Brody WorkLounge is an effort to preserve the privacy and less distractions given in a cubicle.<n>The seating will be available for purchase in late August starting at $2,700.<n>The design for Brody is based on The Cognitive Neuroscience Karolinska Institute in Sweden's work on flow.

Steven Davis, 57, of Milton, believes Bulger killed his sister, Debra Davis, in 1981.<n>The jury returned a 'no finding' verdict, but the film Black Mass claims to be the true story of Bulger's reign of terror in South Boston.<n>Mr Davis said his family are upset the film will profit from their tragedy.<n>He also said the film glamorizes Bulger, who was an FBI informant from 1975 to 1990.

Crowds left fuming after the Ivy nightclub played music during the minute's silence.<n>A contractor is believed to have been responsible for turning the music on.<n>Many took to Twitter to express their anger at the club interrupting the silence on at least five occasions.<n>A spokesperson for Merivale, which runs the Ivy, said the company was'mortified and deeply upset' by the incident.

German Chancellor Angela Merkel has demanded a new European Union system that distributes asylum-seekers based on their population and economic strength.<n>She said the EU's own rules on asylum-seekers are not working.<n>She called for the current rules, known as the Dublin regulations, to be scrapped.

Bus ploughed into the engine of a Boeing 777 jet at Tashkent airport.<n>Tashkent is the largest international airport in Uzbekistan.<n>Plane believed to be Uzbekistan Airways service, national airline.

Children more likely to engage in risky behaviour when supervised by parents.<n>Study found texting and talking on phone a common cause of distractions.<n>Researchers observed randomly selected parents with children at playgrounds.<n>Children whose carers were distracted ‘significantly’ more likely to behave in this way, New York study found.

Teenager gives monkey the middle finger, but it responds by throwing itself.<n>Footage was captured on a CCTV camera near an office in Shimla, India.<n>Monkeys of the area have a reputation for aggression and are common.

Samantha Wills from South Australia adopted her kangaroo Crash.<n>The joey was thrown from his mother’s pouch when she was hit by a car.<n>Ms Wills said Crash is a 'plus-one' who goes on regular trips with her family.

Peter Moore, 47, received letter from HM Revenue and Customs last week.<n>It apologised for family's'recent bereavement' and said he had died.<n>Officials needed to sort out whether he had paid enough tax, it added.
Bulgaria is famous for its folk music and festivals.<n>The Rodopi mountains are a great place to explore the local culture.<n>The village of Yagodina is a haven for walkers and dancers.

Rand Paul, 52, shared a Snapchat video of himself playing poker with professional player Dan Blizerian.<n>Blizerian, 34, is the 'King of Instagram' and a self-described international playboy.<n>The former Navy SEAL trainee was arrested in December for allegedly trying to manufacture a bomb.

Felix David, 24, was shot in the chest by officers during the 1.45pm incident and later died at a local hospital.<n>David had been wanted on a robbery charge and was being arrested at a facility for mentally ill people transitioning into society.<n>Sources said that David, who was wanted for a robbery committed last Thursday, grabbed an officer's radio and hit him over the head with it.

One SEAL died and another was critically injured on Friday.<n>The two were training at Joint Expeditionary Base Little Creek-Fort Story.<n>The SEALS were swimming in lap lanes and were not wearing gear.<n>The sailors were taken to a civilian hospital, where one was pronounced dead.<n>The second service member is listed in critical condition.

Paul Shorter was a teacher at Max Clifford's old school in Hersham, Surrey.<n>Married Shorter, 31, kissed and groped the 15-year-old pupil in his car.<n>Guildford Crown Court heard girl stormed out of tuition when he tried to grope her.<n>Shorter admitted two counts of sexual activity with a child and one count of sexual activity with a child by a person in a position of trust.<n>Judge banned Shorter from working with children or having unsupervised contact with anybody under the age of 18.

Linda Thompson, now 64, met Bruce at the Playboy mansion when he was separated from his first wife, Chrystie Crownover.<n>They fell in love and got married in Hawaii when she was already pregnant with their first son, Brandon.<n>A few years later they welcomed a second son together, Brody.<n>Bruce revealed to Linda the secret that he finally told the world Friday night.

Football League celebrate 10th birthday of the Football League Awards.<n>Gareth Bale is joined by seven current Premier League players.<n>Three outfielders and a manager are also included in the team.

Luke Shaw has struggled to adapt to life at Manchester United.<n>The left back joined the club for £28million from Southampton in the summer.<n>Shaw has started seeing a psychologist in recent weeks.<n>The 19-year-old has played 19 times for United this season.

1st Lt Michael Alonso and 1st Lt Lantz Balthazar have been charged.<n>They are both members of the 12th Missile Squadron at Malmstrom Air Force Base.<n>Alonso charged with illegal possession, use and distribution of ecstasy and cocaine.<n>Balthazar was charged with illegal use of Pentedrone, which is commonly called bath salts.<n>Alonso and Balthazar were among three Minuteman 3 launch officers at Malmstrom who were under investigation for illegal drug use.<n>The other, 2nd Lt Nicole Dalmazzi, was charged in December and court-martial

Colin Shearing, 70, convicted of indecent assault and sentenced to three years.<n>He failed to turn up to court to be sentenced and fled across Channel to Paris.<n>European arrest warrant issued for Shearing, who faces additional sentence.

John Caudwell bought Audley Street garage in Mayfair, central London, for £155million.<n>He is now set to knock it down and build a new luxury apartment block worth up to £2billion.<n>The block will contain five townhouses, three penthouses, a mews home and 21 more luxury flats.<n>Each townhouse and penthouse will have its own gym and swimming pool, while the penthouses will have dedicated lifts.

Royal Family led tributes to those who fought and fell in ill-fated offensive.<n>Queen joined by Duke of Edinburgh, Prince William and political leaders.<n>Prince Charles was in Turkey with Prince Harry to honour the bravery of the Allied troops who stormed the peninsula's beaches in 1915.

John Doyle, 79, was left with a punctured lung and broken rib after attack.<n>He was ushering two 12-year-old girls across the road when Genti Rustemi drove over crossing point without slowing.<n>Mr Doyle tapped his lollipop stick on roof of BMW as it hurtled past.<n>But after Rustemi had dropped off his daughter at a different school, he returned to the crossing minutes later in a fit of temper and attacked Mr Doyle.<n>He threw a punch towards Mr Doyle’s face and then punched him in the chest.<n>Former pub landlord was taken to hospital where he was found

Rebecca Rice, 16, struggled with nerves before her GCSE oral exam.<n>She told her French teacher Lorette Esteve she couldn't cope with the exam.<n>Ms Esteve advised her to bring her pet dog Holly to school to calm her.<n>The pair spent five minutes together to help keep her calm and relaxed.

Craig Bryson opened the scoring for Derby after just three minutes.<n>Tom Ince scored against his former club to make it 2-0.<n>Danny Bent scored from the penalty spot to make it 3-0.<n>Ince scored his second to make it 4-0 before half-time.

Sian Harkin, 54, signed cheques totalling £30,000 to her builder Lee Slocombe.<n>She claimed the work was to be carried out at Llwyncelyn Primary School.<n>But the work was actually carried out at her home in Pontypridd, Wales.<n>She was jailed for two years and nine months at Merthyr Tydfil Crown Court.

Cole Skuse scored his first Ipswich goal in the 29th minute to put the hosts 2-1 up.<n>Freddie Sears doubled the lead for Mick McCarthy's side in the 8th minute.<n>Cardiff equalised five minutes later through Jim Doyle.<n>Daryl Murphy scored a third goal in the 90th minute to secure the win.

Tony Pulis insists he has been told by West Brom chairman Jeremy Peace that any takeover will not drag on.<n>Peace is open to offers for the Midlands club, and is understood to want between £150million and £200million.<n>Groups from America, Australia and China are interested in the club.<n>Pulis praised Saido Berahino, who has been in the news for all the wrong reasons.

West Brom chairman Jeremy Peace is hoping to sell the club for between £150million and £200million.<n>The Baggies announced pre-tax profits of £14.7million up to end of June 2014 in February.<n>Tony Pulis has been assured that the deal will be done by July.

Liverpool lost 1-0 to Aston Villa in the FA Cup semi-final on Sunday.<n>Brendan Rodgers has won just one trophy in three seasons in charge.<n>Sportsmail analysis shows that only seven of 22 signings have been successful.

Capital One yesterday became first provider to scrap its cashback offer.<n>Company has warned existing customers loyalty points will be much lower.<n>Comes after announcement of EU cap limiting fees retailers can be charged.<n>Several credit card companies have millions of customers who earn hundreds of pounds or free flights if they clear their debts every month.

North Sentinel Island is an uncontacted tribe that has refused contact with the outside world.<n>Members of the Sentinelese tribe have been known to fire arrows at helicopters and low-flying planes.<n>The Indian government has established a three-mile exclusion zone around the island to protect the people.

Adriana Alvarez, 22, says she is barely getting by, despite having worked for McDonald's for five years.<n>She is a leader with Fight For $15, an international movement to raise minimum wage laws and acquire the right to unionize.<n>Alvarez said the first thing she would do with an increased wage would be to find a 'decent place to live' with good schools for her three-year-old son Manny.

Edward Moore was assistant director of music at King Edward's School.<n>He had consensual sex with 16-year-old student in his office in Witley, Surrey.<n>Moore, 24, said to her: 'Oh my God, you have to forgive me, you will hate me one day'<n>He admitted two counts of abusing position of trust and sexual activity with girl.<n>Jailed for nine months after admitting the offences at Guildford Crown Court.

Bristol City defeated Bradford 6-0 to secure promotion to the Championship.<n>James Tavernier scored a brace and Joe Bryan, Luke Ayling, Aden Flint and Aaron Wilbraham also netted.<n>The Robins reached 92 points with their 27th league victory of the season.

Scientists in Colorado have found evidence for a new solar season cycle.<n>Every two years it appears 'bands' of magnetic field move to the surface.<n>This combines with the existing 11-year solar cycle, causing even more powerful coronal mass ejections (CMEs) and solar flares.<n>These can endanger satellites and threaten airlines by disturbing the Earth's magnetic field.

Women with advanced cervical cancer to get first officially approved new treatment.<n>Avastin gives women around four months' extra life, trials show.<n>Drug is used in several other cancers and has now been licensed.<n>Patients will have access via the Cancer Drugs Fund until it is considered for routine NHS use.

Thor Dalhaug died an hour after birth following a difficult delivery.<n>Coroner ruled that he suffered fatal brain damage due to a doctor's errors.<n>Senior managers at Lincoln County Hospital tried to remove fact forceps had been used from an account of the birth, he said.<n>Report will come as a blow to the hospital, which has just been taken out of ‘special measures’

Dina Amos-Larkin, 21, was in Salou, Spain for four-day sports festival.<n>She fell while talking to her mother on phone on April 3 and was in coma for two weeks.<n>She was told of her injuries when she was brought round a week ago.<n>GoFundMe page has been set up to raise £20,000 to get her back to UK.

Philip Gigante, 41, has been elected to the positions in Airmont, New York.<n>His grandfather Vincent 'The Chin' Gigante was the head of the Genovese crime family.<n>The Republican real-estate lawyer hopes his 'achievements and accomplishments' are what constituents notice, and not his heritage.<n>But people living in the area who know his background disagree.

The package was picked up from a parcel locker in Nathan, Queensland.<n>It was then sent 934kms to a facility in Chullora, NSW.<n>The next day it was sent back to Queensland.<n>The package finally made it to Sunnybank on Thursday, April 23.<n>Chris, 20, said Australia Post had not been in touch to apologise.

Campaigners launched a scathing attack on the protein supplement company.<n>The advert began appearing on the London Underground three weeks ago.<n>The ‘body shaming’ campaign has seen many of its posters defaced with feminist slogans.<n>More than 50,000 people sign a petition to have them removed.<n>A protest rally is planned for this weekend in protest.<n>But the company’s marketing boss claimed the firm is ‘just trying to make the nation healthier’

Tony Hunt's daughter's cat Harry was hit by a police car near his home.<n>Officers knocked on neighbour's door and asked for a black bin bag.<n>Witness then described seeing them'scooping Harry up and placing him in the bag in the boot of the car'<n>Mr Hunt is demanding an apology from police for their 'disgraceful' actions.

More than 100 sailboats and as many as 200 people were participating in the Dauphin Island regatta in Mobile Bay.<n>The storm rolled through the area about 4 p.m. and a man was plucked from the waters by the Coast Guard around 9 p.m.<n>Crews searched late on Saturday for at least four people missing in the waters.

SNP want to eject Trident from Scotland but Tories and Labour have committed to retaining base on Clyde.<n>Gib Gibraltar could be new home of nuclear submarines if SNP wins election.<n>MoD officials have'sounded out Gibraltar as alternative' to base on Clyde.

Duchess of Cambridge's baby is expected before the end of April.<n>But she is now up to four days overdue and may be induced this week.<n>She plans to give birth at St Mary's Hospital in Paddington, central London.<n>Prince George was reportedly born three days late at the hospital in 2013.

Costa will open on site of former HSBC branch in Windsor, Berkshire.<n>Less than 500 yards away is a Costa which replaced a cycle shop.<n>It means there will be two Costas just a brisk five-minute walk apart.<n>Costa say new shop would be a'significant driver to local trade'

Ian Brady, 77, wrote letters from his bed at Ashworth psychiatric hospital.<n>He was jailed for life in 1966 after torturing and killing five children.<n>In a series of rambling letters, he wrote:.<n>'I hope that UKIP not only wipes out the Lib-Dems and also decimates the Tory and Labour vote, and that the SNP achieves the same in Scotland'<n>'I think David Dimbleby is an establishment dumpling'<n>'I hope that this is the beginning of the end for the Tories and the Labour Party'<n>'I hope that the people of the UK will have

Video shows convoy of Islamist fighters celebrating capture of Jisr al-Shughour.<n>It is believed to be filmed by a British man who has joined the fight in Syria.<n>The man speaks with a British accent as he narrates the video.<n>He claims the al-Qaeda linked group have 'liberated' the city.<n>But the video shows the inhabitants fleeing on foot and in cars.<n>Hours after the video was released, Syrian government warplanes carried out more than a dozen air strikes on the city.

Max Azria's home is spread across three acres in Holmby Hills, one of the three affluent neighborhoods in Los Angeles.<n>Home features 17 bedrooms, 60 rooms, a 6,000 sq ft movie theater, a guesthouse and five French, Japanese, English, Moroccan and herb gardens.<n>Mansion was built in 1939 by architect Paul Williams, who built homes for Old Hollywood stars such as Frank Sinatra and Lucille Ball.

Zeta Beta Tau frat members accused of 'p***** off' wounded veterans.<n>Rehabilitation retreat was held at University of Florida in honor of soldiers.<n>One wounded veteran said frat spat on him and his service dog.<n>Another said frat members urinated on the U.S. flag at retreat.<n>Perry Clawson, a retired Army colonel, set up camp outside frat house.<n>He waved a Stars and Stripes flag and said he would not be moved.

Freeh was involved in a car crash on August 25, 2014 in Barnard, Vermont.<n>It's believed that the 64-year-old fell asleep behind the wheel while driving at 60 to 65 mph.<n>He nearly ran into three other drivers on the road, who were able to swerve out of the way before crashing head-on with Freeh.<n>Eight months later, Freeh is still recovering from the crash and walking with the aid of a cane.
Simon Wood, 38, from Oldham won Masterchef last Friday.<n>He learned everything he knows from reading recipe books and TV shows.<n>He practices his skills with his four children.

NHS guidelines urge GPs to draw up end-of-life plans for over-75s.<n>They are also being told to ask whether patient wants doctors to try to resuscitate them if their health suddenly deteriorates.<n>Medical professionals say it is 'blatantly wrong' and will frighten elderly.<n>NHS says guidance will improve patients' end-of-life care.

London Mayor launched personal assault on his rival on BBC's Andrew Marr Show.<n>Pair clashed over Labour's plans to cut a deal with the SNP to win power.<n>Miliband beat his brother David to the Labour leadership in 2010.<n>But Johnson said Miliband would 'do more damage to the country' than his brother.<n>Miliband laughed off attack, saying: 'Come on Boris, you're better than that'

Tayler Chaice Buzbee made emergency appointment at dentist's office.<n>Had to come because her nine-month-old son, Attley, was hungry.<n>Was assured by employees that she could bring her baby to the facility.<n>But midway through the appointment, Attley started to create a fuss.<n>Dentist then removed Attley from her arms without permission.<n>Then placed him in a stroller - leaving Tayler shocked and upset.

272 children hospitalised in England over past 12 months, figures show.<n>But experts warn actual number could be far greater because of mother's drinking.<n>World Health Organisation says one in 100 babies could suffer problems.

A new video created by Oprah Winfrey's OWN TV, reveals just what's happening in a child's mind when they become angry.<n>Children describe their feelings in the midst of a passionate outburst.<n>Using mindfulness techniques, they explain how they can help ease their anger.

Six women filmed twerking in front of WWII monument in southern Russia.<n>Prosecutors said the 'erotic and sexual' dance was disrespectful to soldiers.<n>Two were jailed for ten days, while a third was sentenced to 15 days.<n>Two others were fined, while the sixth dancer escaped punishment as she was under 16 and was handed a reprimand by her mother.<n>The women posted the video to attract new recruits to their dance school.

Wealthy buyers demanding lower 'Ed Miliband' price for expensive homes.<n>Estate agents offering higher 'Cameron price' and lower 'Miliband price'<n>Labour leader has pledged to introduce annual mansion tax on £2m homes.<n>Annual levy will hit Miliband's own north London home if he wins election.

BBC has admitted it 'occasionally' runs out of meeting rooms in headquarters.<n>It has spent £47,198 on booking external spaces nearby during last year.<n>Meetings have included 'leadership breakfasts', according to corporation insiders.<n>New Broadcasting House in Central London covers half a million square feet.<n>It took a decade to build and was opened by the Queen in 2013.

Dr Alex Zhavoronkov is following strict regime of exercise and drugs.<n>He is also carrying out regular health checks and monitoring his blood biochemistry and cell counts.<n>He is director of the Biogerontology Research Foundation think tank.

Adele McKenzie was set to marry the love of her life, David Elliot, in November.<n>The 31-year-old had dreamed of wearing a dress she had bought in February.<n>She organised a payment plan with 'The Bridal Centre' to pay off her dress.<n>In April, she received an email saying the company was going bankrupt.<n>Ms McKenzie was one of around 140 brides who received the same email.<n>The brides-to-be banded together to create a Facebook page to help each other.

Study at University of Bristol quizzed 40 heterosexual male and female students.<n>Found drinking a large glass of wine makes drinker more attractive.<n>But too much booze leads to 'excessive and unattractive' changes in facial expressions.

Eligah Christian, 49, was being sought on a $100,000 warrant on charges of scheming to defraud, 15 counts of theft and 21 counts of issuing bad checks.<n>He was spotted driving a 2014 motorhome near Wasilla.<n>The officer turned on the patrol car lights and siren, but Christian failed to stop and started driving recklessly.<n>Troopers deployed spike strips to stop the motorhome, but the vehicle struck patrol cars as the suspect tried turning around.

David Cameron will put small business at heart of election campaign today.<n>Prime Minister will say Conservatives are 'party of the grafters'<n>He has faced criticism over a campaign lacking in passion.<n>Mr Cameron said he made 'no apology' for focusing on economy.

Three quarters of us eat cheddar, mozzarella and red Leicester for lunch.<n>A third of us admit to eating melted cheese with everything.<n>A fifth admit to eating whole blocks of cheese in one sitting.

ESPN's First Take host Stephen A. Smith is under fire for his latest controversial stance.<n>Smith claimed Floyd Mayweather Jr's boxing career should be looked at independently from his domestic violence history.<n>The boxer has been convicted twice for domestic violence.<n>Smith was suspended for one week in May for claiming women can play a role in provoking men into violence.

Sharon and Mike Tierney set aside an evening once a month for mutual grooming.<n>Sharon trims her husband's eyebrows, waxes his nostrils and trims his pubic hair.<n>Mike returns the favours with waxing, spray tans and eyelash tints.<n>One incident involved Sharon attempting to give her husband a 'number one', and ended up cutting his scrotum.

A poll has revealed that 12 per cent of Brits would like a girl to be called Diana.<n>Alice and Charlotte were next in terms of preference, getting nine per cent each.<n>A quarter of people polled wanted the Duke and Duchess to have a female baby.

Prime Minister says SNP will prop up Labour government to be 'disaster'<n>Claims SNP 'want to achieve the break-up of our country'<n>But Lib Dem Danny Alexander accuses PM of 'playing with fire'<n>Polls indicate that the General Election race is still neck and neck.

Broccoli chemical sulforaphane known to block inflammation and damage.<n>But patients would have to eat several pounds of vegetable every day.<n>UK drug company Evgen Pharma has developed stable synthetic version.<n>Sulforadex or SFX-01 offers potential of a pill treatment for arthritis.

Madison Hurd, 16, was hospitalized with a stomach bug that turned into sepsis, a life-threatening complication of an infection.<n>Nurses and Hurd's friends spent their day off doing her nails, makeup and hair, getting music and a cake, and decorating her room with streamers and balloons.<n>Her boyfriend flew in from Alabama with a tux and a corsage, and the turquoise gown the teen had gotten an after-school job to afford was laid over her hospital gown.

Holden have recalled more than 26,000 of its vehicles.<n>The models affected are the Holden Colorado- SUV or ute.<n>Five customers reported having 'thermal incidents'<n>Holden said the issue is caused by an alternator cable making unnecessary contact with a steel bracket on the battery tray.<n>If the short circuit creates sufficient heat, there is a risk that the cable insulation may melt or potentially catch fire.

Zoe O'Connell lives in a three-way lesbian relationship with two canvassers.<n>The 37-year-old is standing for the Lib Dems in Maldon, Essex.<n>Her lovers were once a straight married couple – when Ms Brown was a man.<n>The two are now in a civil partnership.

Paula Radcliffe will run the London Marathon on Sunday.<n>The 41-year-old says it will be her last race after a professional career.<n>She has won the race three times but says she's 'unfit' for the 26.2 mile event.<n>She will be presented with the John Disley Lifetime Achievement award.

Tiny oil painting of Catholic saint was kept in attic for years.<n>It was believed to be the work of a follower of 16th century master El Greco.<n>But the selling price suggests the unsigned painting may have been done by the artist himself.<n>Painting was acquired by the owner's late father in the 1970s for very little.<n>He bought it because he believed it was a depiction of Saint Peter.<n>After eight years in the loft, the owner decided to sell it at auction.<n>But after advertising the sale, interest in the work took off.<n>It sold for £9

The Australian Model, 24, stars in a new Protein World advert.<n>The ad has caused a backlash among feminists and body image campaigners.<n>The vegan fitness fanatic says 'two wrongs don't make a right'

Shops are full of red dresses this year, so should you be tempted to trade in your LBD for an LRD?<n>It’s a colour that radiates energy and sexiness, but that can all be wrecked if the style doesn’t suit you.<n>We asked Kate Battersby to try six looks to see which work — and which absolutely don’t.

Professor Stephen Hawking was speaking at the Sydney Opera House on Saturday night.<n>A questioner asked him about the cosmological effect of Zayn Malik leaving One Direction.<n>The physicist happily tackled the question and came up with his own theory.<n>'My advice to any heartbroken young girl is to pay close attention to the study of theoretical physics,' he said.<n>The legendary physicist also spoke about the mysteries of the universe, being diagnosed with ALS, and the future of our planet.

Intrepid Travel have cancelled all trips to Nepal until May 11.<n>Around 200 of their clients are currently in the country.<n>Company say they may have to recommend other destinations.<n>British Foreign Office have advised tourists to stay away from the country.

The Strongsville, Ohio woman was shopping at Walmart when she was cited for leaving her dog in the car.<n>The cop forced her to sit inside the hot car with the windows up and ignition off.<n>Last year, a New Mexico woman was told to sit in her hot car after her dog was found locked inside with no ventilation.

David Duane Watson, 46, was arrested Saturday and charged with the 2000 murder of his ex-wife Linda Watson.<n>Police say Watson killed Linda during a custody dispute over their daughter Jordynn.<n>Three years later, Linda's mother Marilyn Cox and her neighbor Renee Farnsworth were shot dead in the driveway of Linda Watson's home.<n>Police say David Watson had been the prime suspect since 2000, but have only now tied him to the crime with what a Sheriff's Department official said Saturday was 'DNA evidence'

The illegal animal traders had kept the terrified three-year-old for two weeks.<n>They were trying to find a buyer on the lucrative black market in Guinea.<n>The traffickers were caught during a joint operation by authorities.

Venice is a stunning city of marble palaces, ancient churches, canals and waterways.<n>George Clooney married Amal Alamuddin in the Italian capital in 2014.<n>The couple celebrated their wedding in Venice, with their friends and family staying at their favourite hotels.<n>In May, the Biennale Art Festival will take place in the city, showcasing the best of art from 88 nations.

A man driving to work in Alabama noticed his stolen pickup truck following him last week.<n>That set off a chain of events that included a deputy's pursuit, a crash, and an arrest.<n>The truck was stolen from the victim on his birthday.<n>Suspect Terry Proctor, 29, of Piedmont, was captured after a foot chase.

Prime Minister was giving a campaign speech in south London.<n>He joked that everyone should back his team – but then named West Ham.<n>Mr Cameron said he had been 'overcome by something' and 'it was just one of those things'<n>He admitted he could not say what year the match took place or who scored the winner.

Labour leader said he would not do a deal with the SNP to become PM.<n>He said he would only back a Labour Queen's Speech if he won a majority.<n>But Ms Sturgeon said Mr Miliband 'won't have the votes' after the election.<n>She said he will 'change his tune' once the votes are cast on May 8.

Karla Hornby gave birth to Freddie by emergency caesarean section.<n>The 29-year-old and partner Jordan Jackson were on holiday in Benidorm.<n>Couple told they will have to stay in Spain for at least three months.<n>Freddie weighed just 2lbs after being born 12 weeks prematurely.

A film crew were filming the Lair of the Megashark off New Zealand's Stewart Island.<n>They attempted to put a camera on the dorsal fin of the massive ocean predator.<n>The great white then nudges the boat and bites at the thin rope that tethered the dinghy to the main boat.<n>The crew are stunned when the shark resurfaces dangerously close.<n>The footage has been posted online by groups who want to ban shark diving.

James Holmes, 27, killed 12 people and injured 70 more in 2012 shooting.<n>Prosecutors say he was a sought-after neuroscientist-in-training.<n>But evidence shows he was preparing for violence months before shooting.<n>If 12 jurors decide he was not mentally ill, he will be committed indefinitely.

Suzanne Evans said she would 'carry on the mantle' if he quit.<n>Farage is on medication and making twice weekly hospital visits.<n>Ukip leader has also pledged to be 'gone within 10 minutes' if he fails to win Thanet South seat.
Mark-Francis Vandelli, 26, is a keen collector of expensive watches.<n>He has opened up about his collection to the Evening Standard.<n>His most expensive item is a Cartier Moonphase worth £32,000.

Chris Blowes, 26, was attacked by a Great White shark in South Australia.<n>The surfer lost a leg and is in a critical condition in the Royal Adelaide hospital.<n>Onlookers witnessed the attack and carried Mr Blowes to safety.<n>Friends have begun to send their love and support to Chris and his family.

Prime Minister this morning faced first serious criticism of campaign.<n>Tory donors have rounded on the party's lacklustre message.<n>But defiant Cameron this afternoon pledged to continue focusing.<n>He told supporters in Somerset: 'If you want political excitement. Go to Greece'

Paul Gambaccini blamed presenters' obsession with discussing sex appeal.<n>Veteran presenter said it was a 'banal failure' for a slump in ratings.<n>He was annoyed at host Clara Amfo appearing to dismiss Paul Simon.

Security increased at other airports in Southern California.<n>FBI investigating and security increase started at LAX on Saturday.<n>Officials found out ISIS called for attacks on uniformed personnel.<n>Officials said the threat was not necessarily related to aviation.

Sydney was hit by a massive hail storm on Saturday, with marble-sized hailstones up to 2cm in diameter pounding the city.<n>The hailstones were caused by an East Coast Low, which is also known as an extratropical cyclone.<n>The storm caused flash flooding and collapsed buildings in western Sydney.<n>Many took to social media to post images of snow-like hail on the streets of Sydney.

Chuka Umunna said Ukip 'hates modern Britain' and has 'virus of racism'<n>Shadow business secretary said Nigel Farage had 'a problem with race'<n>Mr Farage dragged into fresh racism storm after National Front members turned up to campaign for him in his South Thanet constituency.

Your hands give clues to what is sometimes called ‘brain sex’<n>The way your brain reflects your gender, according to experts.<n>Professor Alice Roberts and Dr Michael Mosley investigate.<n>In the SBS One series Horizon they carry out fascinating tests.

More than a thousand bird watchers descended on Somerset this weekend.<n>They were there to see a rare bird - the Hudsonian Godwit.<n>The shorebird was last seen in the UK in 1988.<n>It is believed the bird was making a 4,000 mile detour from South America.

Massimo Vian, CEO of Luxottica, said his team was working on two new versions of Google Glass, one of which was 'in preparation'<n>He did not give any details about a proposed launch date for the second version.<n>Vian has recently been to California to meet with Google's team.

More than 1,000 passengers crowded outside Tribhuwan International Airport.<n>Passengers had already booked flights but were desperate to leave country.<n>Security guards were unable to control chaos as passengers clamor for information.

Danny Nickerson, 6, of Massachusetts was diagnosed with Diffuse Intrinsic Pontine Glimoma in October 2013 and fought through 33 radiation treatments.<n>Last July, his birthday request for a 'box of cards' for his sixth birthday went viral and he received more than 150,000 cards from around the world.<n>On Friday night, his mother Carley Nickerson wrote that her 'precious sweet boy earned his angel wings' after a 'courageous 18 month battle'

Kathmandu's monuments are recognised as UNESCO World Heritage sites because of their unique architecture.<n>But several of the most recognisable buildings in the city, including towers and temples, now lie in rubble.<n>The Dharahara Tower, built in 1832, has almost totally collapsed after more than 180 years of standing.

Abby Lubiewski was born with Hallerman-Streiff, a rare genetic syndrome that resulted in congenital cataracts.<n>She can only perceive light and dark when she's not wearing her specs and 'has no vision at all without her glasses'<n>Her mother Amanda Lubiewski said when she saw her daughter's school portrait she immediately saw that her child's smile was strained.<n>She was even more concerned knowing that police release official school portraits to the public if a child goes missing.

Lesbos was a notorious sexual playground for straight men, BBC show will reveal.<n>Island was the Magaluf of its day, and a capital for sex tourism.<n>Sapphic poet Sappho lived on the island around 600BC.

Chelsea Bruck, 22, went missing on October 26 in Frenchtown Township.<n>Her body was found on a 13-acre private property near train tracks on Friday.<n>Police say evidence indicates it was a homicide and the property owner is not a suspect.<n>Her costume was found at an industrial site ten miles away earlier this month.

50 earthquake scientists from around the world met in Kathmandu last week.<n>They discussed how to cope with such a disaster in the Himalayan country.<n>But one expert said the devastation was 'an accident waiting to happen'<n>Death toll has now crept up to 2,500 with hundreds still missing.

Tommy Cox, from Colchester, Essex, has fair hair and same cheeky smile.<n>His mother Kate and father Paul are regularly stopped by people.<n>They want their photograph taken with Prince George's lookalike.<n>Tommy is slightly older than Prince George, who will be two on July 22.

Grimes Cottage is a heritage-listed 1830s Colonial Georgian residence with three storeys and six bedrooms.<n>The 416sqm inner city block property boasts stunning views of the Sydney Harbour bridge from the front lacework terrace.<n> Whaling captain George Grimes built the home along with a row of early 1840s terraces depicted in artist Conrad Marten’s work in 1843.<n>The protected property has strict guidelines including not permitting parking in the cobblestone side driveway.
Sarah and Mark Brennan, from south Wales, have endured 10 miscarriages.<n>Couple were told they'd never conceive naturally.<n>But Sarah gave birth to baby Eryn Elisabeth last September.

Yazidi girls as young as eight kidnapped by ISIS last year and held as sex slaves.<n>Hundreds have escaped, but many are traumatised and face ostracism.<n>Some are returning after falling pregnant by their captors.<n>Doctors are performing illegal abortions and hymen surgeries.<n>They are trying to'reverse loss of virginity' by performing abortions.

A second person was found dead in Alabama waters on Sunday after a powerful storm capsized several sailboats in a regatta on Saturday.<n>Crews are still searching for five people missing in the water following the Dauphin Island regatta.<n>The regatta included more than 100 sailboats and as many as 200 people.

Mara Jose Carrascosa, 49, was released from a New Jersey jail on Friday after spending nearly 9 years behind bars.<n>Carrascosa was jailed for contempt of court for refusing to return her daughter to the United States.<n>The girl's father, Peter Innes, had been granted custody of the child and Carrascosa had moved her to Spain.<n>Carrascosa was paroled last year after a judge ruled that she had not violated the custody order.<n>The judge released Carrascosa after her daughter and estranged husband wrote letters to the court urging her to be freed.

Invitations to service at St Paul's Cathedral advise it will avoid glorifying victory.<n>Instead, it will focus on 'pan-European' implications of the battle.<n>Politicians have criticised the move, saying it 'took political correctness to an absurd new degree'

Anais Zanotti, 30, from St Tropez, has modelled for Playboy, GQ and Esquire.<n>She also has 35 cover shoots under her belt and has skydived more than 1,350 times.<n>Now she is a pro skydiving instructor teaching other adrenaline junkies.

The works were stolen in 2010 from Peter O'Mara's Darling Point home.<n>Police executed a search warrant on a Wiley Park property.<n>They found all of the paintings along with three stolen luxury cars.<n>The works have been delivered to the Art Gallery of New South Wales.

Boris Milat has confessed to knowing of his brother's first violent crime.<n>Ivan Milat shot and paralysed a taxi driver in 1962, more then 25 years before he went on a backpacker killing spree.<n>The man convicted for the crime spent five years in jail.<n>He confessed to protect his brother, Boris Milat, from prosecution.<n>Ivan Milat was later sentenced to life in prison.

Joshua Burns was sentenced to three years' probation with the first served in Livingston County Jail for second-degree child abuse.<n>He grabbed his daughter Naomi's face when she slipped from his lap as he was ending a phone call with his wife in March 2014.<n>Naomi suffered several injuries, including seizures, hypothermia, hypotension, bradycardia, apnea and retinal hemorrhages.<n>Brenda Burns has refused to allow social workers and Michigan's Department of Human Services to see Naomi.<n>A civil jury found Brenda Burns not accountable for Naomi's injuries.<n>Joshua Burns maintains his innocence throughout an episode

SBS football reporter Scott McIntyre has been sacked over his Anzac day tweets.<n>The broadcaster said his comments have 'caused his on-air position at SBS to become untenable'<n>McIntyr condemned the commemoration of ANZAC Day calling it 'the cultification of an imperialist invasion'<n>He accused Diggers of committing war crimes including 'widespread rape and theft'<n>Twitter users took to Twitter to spread the #sackScottMcIntre hashtag.

Megan Sheehan, of San Francisco, was knocked unconscious at Santa Rita Jail.<n>She suffered broken facial bones and cracked teeth after police took her to ground.<n>She was booked into the jail after a night of heavy drinking on St. Patrick's Day.<n>She claims that footage of officers and Oakland Police conflict with what police say happened - that she was guided to the ground after 'violently punching'

Marsha Yumi Perry, 36, was arrested on Friday on accusations of felony hit-and-run, driving with a suspended license and on a misdemeanor warrant.<n>On Friday, authorities were called after the boy rode a tricycle out of a driveway when he was hit by a car.<n>Witnesses said Perry tried to drive off but when she was unable to she got out of her Ford pickup truck and walked toward Washougal River Road.<n>Police dog, Ranger, was able to track her scent through a shallow hole she was hiding in before she gave herself up after warnings to reveal herself.

Bill Spedding was charged with five counts of child sexual assault on Wednesday.<n>The 63-year-old was a person of interest in the case of missing William Tyrrell.<n>He was arrested over the alleged sexual assault of two girls in 1987.<n>The Ombudsman is investigating how Spedding was able to live with children.<n>The boys' mother said: 'Someone needs to be held accountable'

James Hayward had his toy gun confiscated by airport security.<n>The six-year-old was forced to hand over the toy after it was picked up.<n>Security officers performed a thorough patting down and inspection.<n>The boy's father, Phil, has labelled the security checks 'ludicrous'<n>The family were forced to return to their home in Doncaster, South Yorkshire.<n>East Midlands Airport apologised for the inconvenience but said they had offered to post the toy back.

Phone records from early 2000s show contact between separatists and US.<n>Putin said he raised issue with then-US President George W. Bush.<n>He said he warned the West about the possible dangers of supporting terrorists.

Robin Barton was just four hours old when he was found by Michael Buelna.<n>Buelna was a Santa Ana police officer at the time and thought it was a cat.<n>He moved some trash and discovered the body of Barton behind a dumpster.<n>Buelna and Barton met for the first time last week and embraced.<n>Barton was adopted by Elizabeth Barton and Daniel Fernandez of Orange County.

Katia Apalategui, 52, was inspired after seeing her mother cope with loss.<n>She was inspired after clinging to her husband's pillow to keep his smell.<n>French insurance saleswoman came up with more permanent way to capture a person's scent.<n>She teamed up with a French university to develop a technique to reproduce smell.

Cecily Strong hosted the White House Correspondents' Dinner on Saturday.<n>She poked fun at Barack Obama and Hillary Clinton during her 20-minute speech.<n>She wore a purple floral halter neck gown by J.Mendel.

The Wave in Arizona is a sandstone rock formation formed by the erosion of Navajo Sandstone during Jurassic age.<n>Svinafellsjokull glacier, part of the great Vatnajkull Glacier in Skaftafell National Park, may look totally inhospitable but with the right gear and guide it's a popular hiking destination.

LeBron James was at practice with his Cleveland Cavalier teammates on Saturday at the TD Garden in Boston.<n>During a break in the action, James decided to practice his long-range shooting.<n>The one-handed shot, which traveled almost the entire length of the 94-foot court, dropped through the basket with an audible swish.<n>James could be heard saying: 'Give me my money' before the shot.<n>Dwight Howard of the Houston Rockets issued a response, using a motion that was one part underhand and one part sidearm.

David Cameron has surged ahead of Ed Miliband in the polls ahead of the election.<n>A Survation poll for the Mail on Sunday has shown a swing towards the Tories.<n>The poll also showed a concern over the influence of Nicola Sturgeon.<n>English voters are worried about Sturgeon's influence on Scottish politics.

Hippopotamus pictured standing its ground against hungry three-year-old lions.<n>The lions were attempting to hunt the large mammal in Zimbabwe's Hwange National Park.<n> Hippo tried to scare them off before charging towards the lions and sending them on their way.

Courtney Terry, 27, was diagnosed with kidney cancer when she was 19.<n>She had chemotherapy and a kidney removal but the cancer returned.<n>She had planned to marry childhood sweetheart Billy Webb in seven months.<n>But doctors have advised her to bring the event forward because her condition has worsened.<n>Courtney's cancer is so rare doctors do not have a name for it.

Police were called to a home in Bear, Delaware, early on Thursday and found Adeyinka Adebamiro stabbed.<n>He was pronounced dead an hour later and his death was ruled a homicide.<n>Temitope Adebamiro, 35, was charged with first-degree murder on Friday.<n>She told police she and her husband had an argument after he sent her pictures of his sister and the nanny's daughter.<n>She said he had sent her to Nigeria on multiple occasions and abused her.

Jeremy Clarkson was spotted in London today after being sacked from Top Gear.<n>He was seen laughing with a traffic warden who tried to put a ticket on his car.<n>The warden then appeared to walk away without leaving a ticket on the Lamborghini.<n>Clarkson was also spotted at Stamford Bridge, cheering on Chelsea.

Christian Trousedale, 18, walked the elderly man to his front door.<n>His act of kindness was seen by a passing woman who took a picture.<n>The picture of the pair has been 'liked' a quarter of a million times.<n>It's attracted attention from all over the world, with more than 50,000 shares in Dubai, Australia, the United States and elsewhere.

Protesters gathered outside Camden Yards before the Orioles-Boston Red Sox game.<n>Some threw bottles and cans at police, others climbed on cars and smashed windows.<n>Police Commissioner Anthony Batts issued order for protesters to disperse.<n>Witnesses inside baseball stadium were told to leave until police cleared them.<n>12 people were arrested, two injured and looted, according to police.

The man, believed to be in his 20s, was trapped under the weight of the car.<n>Firefighters spent 25 minutes trying to free the man from the car in Warwickshire.<n>He suffered head and chest injuries, as well as suspected leg fractures.<n>Medics say he is lucky to still be alive given the severity of the crash.

Sandie Konopelski of Shiloh, Illinois, was struck by westbound train on Friday.<n>She died of blunt-force trauma and was pronounced dead at scene.<n>58-year-old was licensed by Illinois Department of Natural Resources as wildlife rehabilitator.<n>Bi-State Wildlife Hotline of Missouri and Illinois posted tribute.

Alastair Clarkson was filmed lashing out at an aggressive AFL fan.<n>The man was thought to be an Adelaide Power supporter.<n>The Hawks coach was 'pushed and shoved all the way to the door'<n>Hawthorn CEO Stuart Fox described it as'very unfortunate'

Jamie Robbins stole £1,600 from a convenience store in Birmingham.<n>Robbins, 35, stole the money with an accomplice in January 2014.<n>He handed himself into police a year later and said: 'Please arrest me'<n>Robb was jailed for four-and-a-half years after pleading guilty to robbery.

Amira Abase, 15, left London with two other schoolgirls to join ISIS in Syria.<n>She has now tweeted from inside Islamic State about a takeaway dinner.<n>Photo shows a huge Western-style takeaway, including fried chicken.<n>Amira's dinner companion is believed to be a 16-year-old 'jihadi bride'<n>Earlier this year she tweeted: 'uh wanna behead some kafirs [non-Muslims] now'

Andy Erlam led four voters to unseat crooked Lutfur Rahman as Mayor.<n>Mr Erlam said he will stand as an independent candidate in June's election.<n>He said: 'For many years, the people living here have suffered under a corrupt leadership'<n>Rahman was banned from office for five years after being found guilty of rigging his election.

Christopher May, 50, will appear at Pontypridd Magistrates' Court tomorrow.<n>He is charged in connection with the murder of Tracey Woodford, 47.<n>Ms Woodford's family have described her as'very kind-hearted' and'selfless'<n>She is believed to have been attacked in woodland on Tuesday.<n>Police say she was taken back to property of man she was with on Wednesday.<n>Her body was discovered with'massive injuries' at the flat on Friday.

First-time buyers will pay no stamp duty on properties worth up to £300,000.<n>Ed Miliband will say Labour's reduction in the rate of stamp duty to zero would benefit nine in ten first-time buyers.<n>Labour claims its tax break would be funded by a further squeeze on tax avoidance.

Billionaire John Caudwell, 62, says his Staffordshire mansion is haunted.<n>Visitors have felt a bed vibrate and a ghost brushing past them.<n>Mr Caudwell believes it is the spirit of a boy shot by Cromwellian soldier.

Maura Pally said the foundation would'remedy' any errors but stressed the total revenue was reported accurately and that grants were properly broken out on its website.<n>She said the foundation expected to refile some of its tax forms, following a voluntary external review, because it had'mistakenly combined' government grants and donations.<n>Pally said the foundation would'remedy' any errors but stressed the total revenue was reported accurately and that grants were properly broken out on its website.

Lord Janner could be tested by experts to prove he has dementia.<n>Lawyers are considering whether to use the medical evidence in civil claims.<n>The 86-year-old politician has been accused of molesting young boys.<n>He will not face child abuse charges because of his memory problems.<n>But he could still face civil action from his alleged victims.

Two-hour documentary follows canalboat as it travels at 4mph.<n>All viewers will hear are the sounds of the boat's engine and birdsong.<n>Film was shot on a sunny day last month and will air on May 5.

Ashley, 26, is the face of PETA's new campaign against fur.<n>The campaign is aimed at Harvey Nichols, which recently re-introduced fur.<n>The department store previously had a ten-year anti-fur policy.<n>Miss James, who is a vegan, says she 'loves' animals.

Luke Stanwick, 30, was on holiday with his wife and son when he broke his neck.<n>He was put into a medically-induced coma and is fighting for his life.<n>The police officer has been left paralysed from the waist down.<n>His mother has flown from the UK to be by his side in Lisbon.<n>It is not known whether his injuries will leave him permanently disabled.

Labour's plans to impose rent controls are 'economically illiterate', experts warn.<n>They will slash investment in new housing, leading to more tenants being evicted by their landlords, they say.<n>Ed Miliband yesterday confirmed he would press on with controversial plans.<n>He said rent controls would give 'forgotten' renters a fairer deal.<n>But Generation Rent campaign group said plans were 'literated with loopholes'

Ceremony held at Bergen-Belsen concentration camp in Germany.<n>More than 72,000 camp inmates and prisoners of war died there.<n>British soldiers liberated the camp on April 15, 1945.<n>Today, 70 years on, hundreds of people sobbed as they laid flowers.

Heckler & Koch G36 is used by police forces across the UK.<n>Weapon also unreliable when left in sunlight or repeatedly fired.<n>Leaked report commissioned by Berlin's defence ministry.<n>It said precision and accuracy of the G36 deteriorated when it overheated.

Scott Holder, Jon Reiter and Ashleigh Stumler were caught up in avalanche.<n>Three Americans died and many others are missing after earthquake hit.<n> Reiter, from California, was told by doctors that most of the injured will not survive.<n>He and partner Moises are helping to act as medics on the mountain.

Aaron Lennon, 28, was part of Everton side that beat Southampton 1-0 on April 4.<n>He is said to have been partied at Manchester nightclub Suede that night.<n>A teenage waitress claims he grabbed her, slapped her and ripped her top.<n>She fled to toilet in tears and told police he had left her with bruise below eye.<n>The Tottenham winger was reportedly interviewed under caution by police.

Disneyland opened in California on July 17, 1955, under the supervision of Walt Disney.<n>The first attraction was a Peter Pan Crocodile Attraction with live fish.<n>The ladies' heels got stuck in melting pavement on the opening day.

Study of 18,500 patients found that people with bowel cancer who saw their normal GP were diagnosed, on average, a week later than others.<n>Britain has one of the lowest cancer survival rates in Europe.<n>This has partly been blamed on family doctors missing symptoms.

Maren Sanchez was stabbed to death in a hallway at Jonathan Law High School in Milford, Connecticut on April 25, 2014.<n>A classmate, Christopher Plaskon, has been charged with murder.<n>Sanchez was due to attend the prom with her new boyfriend.<n>On Saturday, friends and family held a memorial event to remember her.<n>The event included a kickball tournament, bounce houses and a dunk tank.

Birth will be announced on Twitter and on the traditional easel.<n>Prince George's birth was announced in an emailed press release.<n>Prince William's was announced on the easel outside Buckingham Palace.

Police ignored sexual abuse of hundreds of young girls because they were too busy chasing Labour crime targets that would earn bonuses for senior staff.<n>Money was diverted away from protecting children from rape, trafficking and beatings in order to pursue 'priority crimes'<n>Offences were considered crucial for satisfying target culture introduced by last Labour government.<n>Targets have been scrapped by Tories amid concern they were harming policing.

Chris Lewis, 68, has brought the unusual court case against ex-wife Nicola.<n>He claims she had sex with another man before they married but did not tell him.<n>She had a child - Charlie, now 19 - as a result but led him to believe it was his.<n>DNA tests now prove that Charlie is not his biological son, he says.<n>Mr Lewis wants compensation totalling £322,400 for the deception.

Christopher Marinello, 53, tracked down nine paintings stolen from LA mansion.<n>Works were recovered after he set up a sting operation with the LAPD.<n>He is currently representing the heirs of art dealer Paul Rosenberg.<n>They are trying to recover Henri Matisse's 1921 Femme Assise.<n>It was found in a squalid Munich flat and has been valued at £60million.

Mourners filed into a Baltimore funeral home on Sunday for a wake for Freddie Gray.<n>The 25-year-old black man died a week after he was injured in police custody.<n>He was arrested on April 12 after he ran away from police and asked for an inhaler as he screamed in pain.<n>He was denied medical attention and died a week later from a severed spine.

New generation of smartwatches are designed to do more than tell the time.<n>They can track sleep and calorie intake and even check emails on the wrist.<n>Life & Style investigates which is best for you.

Prime Minister has written to First Great Western to ask it to review decision.<n>Company is planning to almost double some fares on route through his constituency.<n>Mr Cameron has promised to freeze fares in real terms for the whole of parliament.<n>Labour has also pledged to bring in a 'cap' on price hikes.

Mother-of-four, 57, suffered from depression throughout her adult life.<n>She came off anti-depressants last year but expects to go back on when she has another episode.<n>She and husband Phil will celebrate 15th wedding anniversary next month.

Juanette Cullum, 48, was arrested after a witness saw her stealing.<n>Police then searched her Brooklyn home and found more items.<n>They included 19 Kindle tablets, seven iPads, two laptops and toiletries.<n>Cullium admitted stealing from American Airline planes for the last three years.

National Counterterrorism Center advisory group is expected to recommend radical shift in US hostage policy.<n>The group interviewed families of hostages, including the parents of James Foley, who was killed by Islamic State fighters.<n>Foley's mother Diane said officials from President Barack Obama's administration repeatedly told her family it was illegal to try to raise a ransom to free her son.<n>The Obama administration has denied making any such threats.

Investigation has reportedly found Williams embellished at least 11 reports.<n>Latest specific tall tale dates back to 2011 in Egypt's Tahrir Square.<n>NBC executives were briefed on the investigation on Thursday.

Dr Jim Penman has drawn parallels between modern-day Britain and Rome.<n>He claims we have lost the drive for innovation that epitomised Victorian era.<n>Claims we are living in a 'golden age' where there have been no major wars.<n>But economy is stagnating and we're having fewer children, he says.

Band were told to pay back cash after Icebreaker scheme was ruled invalid.<n>But they have yet to stump up the cash, one year after they were ordered to.<n>Spokesperson says they are dealing directly with HMRC but have not appealed.<n>Taxpayers' Alliance says band should be 'addressing the symptom rather than the cause'

Seven women believed they were in a relationship with a Mormon man.<n>They were all contacted by a woman named Kayla who claimed to be a man.<n>The women all attended Brigham Young University in Utah.<n>Kayla apologized to the women on an episode of Dr Phil that aired on Friday.

One of the stunning watercolours, showing the moment Dorothy, Toto, the Tinman, the Lion and the Scarecrow meet the Wizard of Oz, went for £25,000.<n>The other, imagining the Emerald City, capital of the Land of Oz and home to the Wizard, sold for £10,000.<n>Both paintings, from the brush of famed art director Jack Martin Smith, were used to work out how the scenes might look once filming began.

Pippa Middleton is said to have bought eco-friendly nappies for the new royal baby.<n>Self-warming bottles and'shushers' are among the latest gadgets for mums.<n>Headlights for pushchair and mittens for hands are also popular products.

Lung Wong skull is being sold by Hong Kong-based experts Evolve.<n>It is more than 95 per cent complete bone, is 9.2ft (2.8 metres) long, 5.2ft (1.6 metres) high and 4.6ft (1.4 metres) wide.<n>The last time something of this size and quality came to market was when a Tyrannosaurus Rex fossil named 'Sue' was sold for £5.6 million ($8.5 million) in 1997.<n>However, the experts have not revealed when the auction closes.

Japanese photographer Uruma Takezawa spent 1,000 days travelling to 103 countries on four continents.<n>His images capture the faces and dramatic landscapes of those who live off the land in harmony with the natural world.<n>The Japanese artist has made a living documenting remote communities.

Corinthian Colleges ran brands such as Everest and Heald.<n>It was one of the country's largest for-profit educational institutions.<n>It collapsed last summer amid a cash shortage and fraud allegations.<n>The Education Department fined the company earlier this month for falsifying job placement data.<n>It agreed to sell or close its campuses under pressure from the department.

Geoff Haigh, 61, wanted to marry partner Heather, 54, after being diagnosed.<n>Pair settled on venue close to their home in Oldham, Greater Manchester.<n>But wedding descended into farce after a series of blunders were made.<n>Guests were forced to listen to wedding song 10 times in a row due to blunder.<n>Couple were left with three marriage certificates after officials got crucial details wrong on the first two.<n>Mr Haigh, who died weeks after the ceremony, was left devastated by day.

Asda has unveiled 'luxury christening range' in time for royal birth.<n>Clothes inspired by Prince George start at just £4.<n>Average price of a christening has hit £300.<n>63 per cent of families concerned about spiraling costs.

The horseshoe-shaped glass walkway in Chongqing extends 87.5ft from the edge of a cliff, allowing visitors to feel as though they are walking on air.<n>It is the longest cantilever bridge in the world, beating Arizona’s Grand Canyon Skywalk by 16.4ft.<n>Bridge can accommodate up to 200 visitors at once, who each pay an admission fee of 60 yuan (approximately £6.30 or $9.60)

Scientists took CT scans of teeth found at Riparo Bombrini in Ligurian Alps and in the Grotta di Fumane in western Lessini Mountains, both in Italy.<n>They found they belonged to ancestors of modern humans who were part of a group known as the Protoaurignacian culture.<n>Neanderthals were the dominant human species in Europe and much of Asia for around 250,000 years before vanishing entirely 41,000 years ago.

Michelle Obama's office says the first lady chose what's being called 'Kailua Blue' to distinguish her family's china from the red, green, blue and yellow used on more recent state services.<n>The china, which has settings for 320 people, cost approximately $367,000.

RJ Jackson suffers from Netherton's syndrome, a rare congenital skin disease.<n>His skin appears red and inflamed, and is often covered in dry skin.<n>A member of the public called police fearing Mrs Jackson had abused RJ.<n>Armed police were called to the family home in Las Vegas to investigate.<n>Mrs Jackson said RJ is targeted by bullies and regularly covered in creams.

Dr Gupta was asked to perform a craniotomy on 15-year-old Sandhya Chalise, who had been hit by a wall as she collected water outside her home.<n>She was one of many children who had been injured in the earthquake, which killed more than 4,300 people.<n>The hospital, which is struggling to keep up with the demand, had no equipment and Gupta had to use a saw and sterile water from a bottle.

The unidentified woman's conversation with a dispatcher was revealed by ABC News.<n>The woman was allegedly kidnapped Thursday in a parking lot in Loveland, Colorado, police there said.<n>She told the dispatcher 'I went to get some dinner...and someone came up to me and he had a gun'<n>She was later rescued after police found her car keys.

Sophie Wilson, 17, performed CPR on Bradley Parkes after she found him.<n>The 16-year-old was taken to Birmingham Children's Hospital in a coma.<n>His mother Tiffany, 35, revealed he had made a'miracle' recovery.

General Keith Alexander, the retired four-star general and former chief of the National Security Agency, has warned of a growing risk of a systemic cyber-assault.<n>He envisions a worst case-scenario where hackers targeted oil refineries, power stations, and the electric grid.<n>Alexander also voice his concern about the hacking threat from a terrorist organization such as ISIS.

Pakistani children living in the slums often have little entertainment offered, and often have to flee their homes.<n>But there are some facilities popping up in poor areas on the outskirts of major cities, with swing rides and trampolines on offer.<n>Many of those enjoying the rides have fled their villages due to fighting between security forces and militants in the tribal areas.

Michael O'Leary made the vow in an interview with a French newspaper.<n>He said Ryanair expects to grow its passenger numbers and cut costs.<n>The airline boss ridiculed Air France for last year's pilots' strike.

Jackson, 34, was arrested for assault with a deadly weapon on Saturday.<n>He played Hobie Buchannon, son of David Hasselhoff's character Mitch.<n>The victim told police the man was Hobie - Jackson was released on $30,000 bail.

Lisa McElroy, 50, sent the explicit link to her Drexel University students under the subject line 'Great article on writing briefs' on March 31.<n>She said she was'mortified' and 'in terrible shape' when she found out what she had done.<n>McElroy said she would not divulge in her column how the mistake happened.<n>Drexel conducted an internal investigation and found that McElroy had not violated the the university's sexual harassment and misconduct policy.

John Sims, who had Burkitt's Lymphoma, died on Saturday.<n>Married Lindsey Sims on March 21 at the University of Texas.<n>John was told his cancer was terminal and he was given just weeks to live.<n>The pair set off on a a cross-country road trip last week.<n>But their journey came to an end when John's condition worsened.

Myuran Sukumaran has requested to spend his final days painting.<n>His brother Chinthu Sukumaran has pleaded with the Indonesian president to call off the firing squad.<n>Andrew Chan has requested to spend his last hours in church with his family.<n>The Bali Nine pair will be executed on Wednesday 3am AEST.<n>Sukumaran's lawyer Julian McMahon removed four paintings from his cell.<n>The paintings show a bullet hole through Sukumaran's heart.

Nicholas Pence, 25, and father David, 56, shot dead in their garage.<n>They had been celebrating football victory in New Orleans, Louisiana.<n>Couple found lifeless by Nicholas's mother, who heard gun shots.<n>Police believe it was a botched armed burglary, not a random attack.<n>Dexter Allen, 18, and Haraqyon Degruy, 18, charged with double killing.

Vladimir Bukovsky fled the Soviet Union in the 1970s after being accused of spreading anti-Soviet propaganda.<n>He was arrested and spent 12 years in prison and forced labour camps.<n>He smuggled documents detailing the abuse of psychiatric institutions to the West for political reasons in the Communist state.<n>The dissident, 72, has been summonsed to appear in court next month.<n>He will be charged with making and possessing indecent images of children.

1.2 million Australians either have a secret credit card or hide purchases.<n>An estimated 800,000 also admit their spending has led to an argument.<n>17 per cent will hide their credit card spending, versus 14 per cent of men.<n>Generation Y (aged 18-34) were found to be the least trustworthy of the age categories.<n>Victorians had the most cunning credit card behaviour.

The rapper and businessman unleashed a string of tweets on Sunday defending his premium music streaming service Tidal.<n>Tidal, which he bought for $56 million in January, has been described as a flop since its launch last month.<n>Jay Z claimed that there is a'smear campaign' against Tidal from big companies.<n>He did not post any details about the alleged campaign.<n>Tidal has potential rivals including popular streaming service Spotify and tech giant Apple.

Kristopher Hicks, now 27, was on his way home from a night out in Bath.<n>Was in a taxi driven by Michael Young, 56, when he became suspicious.<n>Mr Young decided to take Mr Hicks back to the rank to teach him a lesson.<n>But when Mr Hicks objected, the driver continued on for almost a mile.<n>Mr Hicks jumped from the vehicle while it was travelling at more than 20mph.<n>He suffered devastating brain injuries, developed epilepsy and now requires round-the-clock care from his mother.<n>Mr Justice Edis ruled driver had unlawfully imprisoned Mr Hicks

Presence of Blue Origin, LLC, the brainchild of Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, barely registers in nearby Van Horn, Texas.<n>The company has been buying land in one of Texas' largest and most remote counties.<n>Few visitors are allowed beyond the 'No Trespassing' sign and a remote-controlled gate.<n>At the opposite end — of Texas and the competition — is the highly visible SpaceX venture, led by PayPal co-founder Elon Musk.<n>His company contracts with NASA to resupply the International Space Station and is building a launch site about 600 miles from Van Horn.

Mary Cowan taught at George Watson's College in Edinburgh for 30 years.<n>She passed away in November last year and left £700,000 of her fortune.<n>She asked for a bursary scheme to be set up in her name at the school.<n>Ms Cowan never married and lived in Edinburgh her whole adult life.<n>She left instructions for the remainder to be handed over to good causes.

A cornet player treated stranded residents of Gillieston Heights to a rendition of the Last Post.<n>Karen Newton had just finished playing at the Kurri Kurri dawn service.<n>She was on her way to deliver food to the victims of the floods.<n>The residents were separated from the town by massive flood water.<n>The video has over 5,000 views on Facebook.

If successful, Clinton will be the second oldest president in US history.<n>She is currently 65, but will be 69 when she takes office in 2017.<n>Clinton posted a photograph of herself as a toddler on Twitter.

A baby girl was found buried on Maroubra Beach on November 30, 2014.<n>Two boys discovered the infant's body under 30 centimetres of sand.<n>Filomena D'Alessandro and Bill Green have claimed the infant's body.<n>They have raised enough money to provide the baby with a funeral.<n>A service will be held for the baby girl, who they have named Lily Grace, on Wednesday.

Miranda Ashley Calvin, 19, was arrested by Gresham police on Sunday.<n>She allegedly hit a woman with her car and fled the scene on Saturday.<n>Police found the woman, 49-year-old Jerrie Ann Hornig, dead at the scene.<n>A person who was listening to a police scanner saw the car fleeing the scene.<n>Calvin was arrested and booked into jail on manslaughter and other charges.

Vincent Lamouroux publicly unveiled the project, named 'Projections' in LA's trendy Silver Lake neighborhood.<n>He used an environmentally friendly limewash to coat the so-called Bates Motel, including several towering palm trees.<n>The seedy motel, which has been closed for years, was actually named the Sunset Pacific Motel.<n>It got its nickname from its proximity to nearby Bates Avenue and its passing resemblance to the motel in the Alfred Hitchcock masterpiece 'Psycho'

Jonathan Keats, an experimental philosopher, hopes to capture 1,000 years of changes at a mountain range in Massachusetts.<n>The camera, which is made of cooper and allows light to enter through a tiny hole and change paint inside, will create one image that Keats says will display centuries of changes to the environment.<n>The camera will be placed on the Stearns Steeple, and the Mead Art Museum at Amherst plans on holding an exhibition to show the resulting photo in the 3015.

The couple tied the knot in a romantic ceremony in the Santa Monica mountains on Sunday.<n>Nikki, 26, wore a white lace custom gown by Claire Pettibone.<n>Ian, 36, carried his bride down a muddy slope to ensure her dress didn't get dirty.

Vanessa Kennard was suspended in her absence by the Nursing and Midwifery Council.<n>She was one of three nurses charged with mistreating Grant Clarke, 45.<n>The father-of-three suffered a brain haemorrhage in May 2012.<n>Left him paralysed on his left side, incontinent and unable to swallow.<n>His family became concerned when they visited him at the rehabilitation unit.<n>They planted a camera which captured shocking footage of neglect.<n>Ms Kennard removed the alarm buzzer from Mr Clarke and told his partner she 'wasn't interested' in the case.
