Protein World advert features model Renee Somerfield in a bikini.<n>The billboard has attracted the ire of many body image campaigners.<n>Petition calling for the advert to be pulled has 45,000 signatures.<n>Katie Hopkins has now called those who complain about posters 'chubsters'

Tents flattened by snow, ice and rock as avalanche hit base camp on Saturday.<n>American Dan Fredinburg, 33, was the first confirmed fatality on the mountain.<n>Two other Americans, Dr Marisa Eve Girawong, 29, and Tom Taplin, 61, were also killed.<n>More than 60 people were injured and are still being treated on mountain.

Russian trawler caught fire in Las Palmas port and was towed out to sea.<n>The 1,400 tonnes of fuel oil is now washing up on beaches in Gran Canaria.<n>Spanish government has activated an environmental emergency alert.<n>Greenpeace has criticised the decision to tow the vessel out to sea.

Pritesh, 36 and Mansi Gandhi, 35, started trying for a baby ten years ago.<n>Mansi eventually became pregnant but her baby was so premature he died.<n>Pritesh's sister Hiral Shah, 32, stepped in and offered to carry the couple's baby.<n>After IVF treatment, gave birth to Krish three weeks ago after a 20-minute labour.

Dharahara Tower in Kathmandu was built by Nepal's royal rulers in the 1800s.<n>It has been reduced to an enormous pile of red brick dust following quake.<n>Rescuer says people taking selfies are not 'understanding the tragedy'<n>He says: 'This is earthquake tourism. This is not right'

Chancellor admitted he is secretly addicted to hit BBC series Poldark.<n>He said he allowed himself one hour off a week to watch the programme.<n>Mr Osborne said he was a fan of the lead character Demelza.<n>He vowed to maintain tax relief on big TV productions.

Hannah Wilson was found dead in rural Brown County, Indiana on Friday morning after she was last seen leaving a bar in Bloomington.<n>Friends said she was too drunk to join them at the bar and they put her in a taxi to go home.<n>Police said circumstances of her disappearance are 'eerily similar' to the case of Lauren Spierer, who vanished after a night out in 2011.<n>She was last seen at Kilroy's Sports Bar and her body has never been found.<n>Daniel Messel, 49, was arrested and charged with her murder.

Mark Hawkins, 49, was wanted in Lane County for failing to appear on a charge of delivery of a controlled substance on Friday.<n>He reportedly barricaded himself inside a Greyhound-style bus in a Walmart parking lot in Salem, Oregon.<n>Seconds later, Hawkins allegedly fired his weapon from the front of the vehicle.<n>Bullet struck a police dog in the head, prompting a seven-hour standoff.<n>Officers fired more than a dozen rounds of tear gas, rammed bus with armored car and used tear gas on Hawkins.<n>At around 6.30pm, Hawkins was shot nine times and later died in hospital

Researchers say 75% of extreme hot weather and 18% of heavy precipitation is being driven by global warming.<n>They warn that as climate change pushes global temperatures higher, humans will be responsible for 40% of extreme rainfall events.<n>The scientists claim it is the rarest and most destructive events that seem to be the most responsive to human influence.

Five tornadoes were spotted across north and central Texas Sunday evening as part of a severe storm system.<n>One of the tornadoes was a mile-wide and was described as 'extremely dangerous' by the National Weather Service.<n>Another tornado was also spotted in Stephenville - about 70 miles southeast of Fort Worth.<n>High winds, hail and dangerous conditions were expected to continue through the night.

Dr Warren Weinstein, an American, and Italian aid worker Giovanni Lo Porto were killed in a botched drone strike in Pakistan in January.<n>The CIA was not required to provide proof that intended targets of drone strikes posed an imminent threat to the US before planned strikes.<n>President Obama reportedly gave the spy agency a waiver exempting it from the new rules.

Ed Miliband will claim Labour's attitude to immigration has 'changed'<n>He will insist he offers 'clear, credible and concrete plan on immigration'<n>But only hours before key election speech, his own shadow home secretary refused at least four times to say Labour would put a target on net immigration.

Euan Ritchie and Jen Martin launched a crowdfunding page to track kangaroo numbers.<n>Within two days they received a pledge from someone called Jeffrey Green.<n>The couple have been unable to track down the would-be benefactor.<n>The couple still hope to reach their goal of $15,000.

Paul and Laura Elliott married at St Katharine Docks in London.<n>The couple ran the first half of the marathon separately.<n>They then completed the run together.<n>The couple have raised £7,000 for Cancer Research UK.

Wood Green animal charity has teamed up with cleaning and DIY app Handy.<n>The service is being provided through the Handy smartphone app.<n>The app allows users to book cleaners and handymen for home repairs.

Researchers photographed faces and recorded voices of 42 women.<n>Group of men rated women's voices on attractiveness and attractiveness.<n>Those rated highly for looks often scored well for sound too, study found.<n>Women deemed most attractive tended to have 'lifted jawbones'

Tyrone Sevilla has delivered a poster to Peter Dutton's office begging to stay in Australia.<n>The 10-year-old autistic boy has lived with his mother in Australia for eight years.<n>Maria Sevilla and her son face being deported back to the Philippines.<n>Their visa expires today and Immigration department rejected Ms Sevilla's visa application 28 days ago.<n>She said her son has improved immeasurably since starting school four years ago.

Photos of John Key pulling young girls' ponytails are being posted on social media.<n>This comes after he was forced to apologise to an Auckland waitress.<n>Amanda Bailey, 26, wrote a blog post shaming him for his behaviour.<n>She said she felt 'uncomfortable' and wanted the public to be aware.

Lucy, 24, models Ibiza-inspired summer brights and tropical print sun dresses.<n>Fitness fanatic recently starred in Made In Chelsea work-out DVD.<n>Will be returning to Made In Chelsea in coming weeks.

Several premature babies - some of whom were born prematurely - were ferried to an Israeli military base on Monday.<n>Five more infants landed safely in Tel Aviv with their Israeli families later in the day.<n>Many Israeli male couples have traveled to Kathmandu to father children with the help of surrogate mothers.<n>In Israel, the procedure is limited to only heterosexual partners.<n>However, in the wake of Saturday's 7.8-magnitude earthquake, many gay Israeli couples are eager to get their babies out of Nepal.

TV presenter said her sister, Debbie, had managed to contact family to say she was safe after a 7.9-magnitude quake struck Nepal on Saturday.<n>She said Debbie had not yet reached Everest Base Camp, where a deadly avalanche hit.<n>But Holden said her life may have been saved because she had altitude sickness.

Cassandra Fortin was discharged from Connecticut Children's Medical Center on Monday after she was made to undergo chemotherapy.<n>The 17-year-old and her mother initially refused the recommended treatment for Hodgkin's lymphoma, saying they wanted to explore natural alternatives.<n>But a court ruled in January that she was not legally mature enough to make the decision and the state gained temporary custody of her.<n>Cassandra said she was 'happy' to be heading home after spending five months undergoing chemotherapy to save her life.

The momager looked downcast as she went to the gym in Beverly Hills on Monday.<n>She has been seen in public just once since Bruce's tell-all on Friday.<n>Close friend Kathie Lee Gifford said on Today that Kris is 'trying to get her act together' and is trying to be a good friend to her ex-husband.

Isobel Attwood left her home in Winchester, Hampshire, on Saturday.<n>The 16-year-old has not made contact with her family since.<n>Friends say she is in Southampton with a man in his 20s.<n>Police are becoming concerned for the teenager's welfare.

Dawn, who has had seven miscarriages, was going to spend money on gravestone.<n>She accused her friend, Jamie, of taking the cash but he denied it.<n>She asked Jeremy Kyle to conduct a lie detector test and it revealed it.<n>Dawn, who lives with Jamie and his girlfriend, stormed off the show.

Dr Xiao-Ping Zhai has helped a thousand women conceive using Chinese medicine.<n>Acupuncture and herbal supplements are used to help conceive.<n>Clients are given a bespoke vitamin course containing Chinese herbs.<n>One woman had her son Rupert when she was 40.

Keshwa Chaca is the last Inca rope bridge still standing in the Andes.<n>It is rebuilt every June by local villagers using the same techniques as Incas.<n>The rope bridges were part of an incredible Inca road system.

Chrystie Crownover, 63, said she watched Bruce's Diane Sawyer interview on Friday and was'so relieved' the world knows his 'big, big, big dark secret'<n>The Olympic champion first told her he wanted to be a woman in 1972.<n>The couple, who had a son Burt and a daughter Cassandra, separated when she was pregnant with their second child and later divorced.

John Goodwin, 75, shot himself outside of Rockingham County Superior Courthouse on Friday morning.<n>Jury was deliberating claims that Goodwin had sexually assaulted an underage student.<n>They declared a mistrial when they were not aware of what had happened.<n>Prosecutors said Goodwin repeatedly sexually assaulted the 11-year-old from 2002 to 2005.

73-year-old woman suffered bruising to legs and ribs in crash in Hulme, Manchester.<n>She was waiting for ambulance with her husband, who has dementia.<n>Thief sneaked into car and stole sat nav from underneath passenger seat.<n>Member of public photographed suspect as he left scene with his dog.<n>Police have issued photograph of suspect and are appealing for information.

Platelet-rich plasma is a concentrated mix of substances in the blood.<n>It contains growth factors that help heal burns and prevent infection.<n>The gel is being tested by U.S. researchers as a dressing for burns.
Ian Pettigrew, 46, from Ontario, Canada, is releasing a book of portraits, Salty Girls, starring women with the disorder.

Craig Lister, 54, from Hertfordshire was diagnosed with prostate cancer in 2012.<n>He is now well and his tumours have shrunk.<n>But he is still taking hormone therapy.<n>This starves cancer cells by reducing testosterone in the body.<n>This has the side-effect of hot flushes.

Tens of thousands of selfies have emerged on social media to mark the centenary ANZAC Day.<n>Some misspelt hashtags such as #leastweforget while others uploaded meaningful captions for the fallen soldiers.<n>Others pouted or posed with their tongues sticking out at the cameras while people posted inappropriate or disrespectful captions.

Beatrice, 26, was at the Maple Hayes School of Dyslexia in Litchfield.<n>She was greeted by a flag-waving crowd and opened a classroom.<n>The Princess has been criticised for her penchant for international travel.<n>She has been to Bahrain and Florence in the last week alone.

Extra stretch of coastline on Shiretoko Peninsula near Rausu, Hokkaido.<n>The 1,000ft-long mass of land has risen 50ft from the sea surface.<n>Geologists believe it is a result of a landslide caused by melting ice.

Loretta Lynch replaces Eric Holder, who left the job Friday after six years as attorney general.<n>'We can restore trust and faith both in our laws and those who enforce them,' Lynch said, apparently referring to ongoing efforts to repair relations between police and minority communities.<n>'It seems like such an understatement to say my heart is full, but it is,' Lynch said.
Friends of the Deputy Prime Minister have indicated he will quit if the Lib Dems are reduced to fewer than 30 MPs.<n>But he insisted he would fight for his job 'in all circumstances'

Personal trainer James Staring reveals four simple ways to banish belly fat.<n>Avoid refined carbohydrates like white bread and pasta.<n>Write a food diary to help keep track of what you're eating.<n>Do full body exercises to burn more calories.

Meteorologists say an east coast low – the same weather system that lashed the state's east coast for three days last week – could hit again.<n>Heavy rain could hit the region from Thursday through to Saturday.<n>The State Emergency Service was deluged with calls for assistance last week and has more than 4,000 jobs still to be completed.<n> SES spokeswoman Stephanie Wills said the organisation is concerned that more storms would hamper clean-up efforts.

Viewers took to Twitter to complain of 'withdrawal symptoms' after finale.<n>One said they were already experiencing 'life-changing' withdrawal symptoms.<n>Another urged the BBC to hurry up with a second series of the hit drama.<n>The show has pulled in an average of 5.9 million viewers per episode.

Nissan Note Mk1 came out on top with just 80 per cent of the vote.<n>The Hyundai i20 Mk1 was second with 81.01 per cent of the vote.<n>The Fiat Panda Mk2 came in third with 81.49 per cent.<n>Of the 200 car models covered by the survey, five by Lexus were in top ten.

Rose McGrath was dismissed from St Joseph Middle School in Battle Creek, Michigan, for not meeting academic and attendance standards.<n>She is in remission but still recovering from acute lymphoblastic leukemia treatments, which started in 2012.<n>The school wrote in a letter to Rose's father that officials worked with her but absences 'hampered her academic performance'<n>It added that it has taken'significant adjustments to our standards' to help Rose, including reducing her workload and paring down assignments and tests.<n>Rose's mother Barbara McGrath said her daughter is attending Lakeview Middle School and that she can't say whether

Christopher Nathan May, 50, is accused of killing Tracey Woodford, 47.<n>Her body was discovered at a flat in Pontypridd, south Wales on Friday.<n>May was remanded in custody at Merthyr Tydfil magistrates court.<n>He will appear at Cardiff Crown Court tomorrow for a plea hearing.

The ruins of the St Ivan Rilski Church are visible at the Zhrebchevo reservoir, near the town of Tvardica, Bulgaria.<n>The church is the only remaining evidence of the community of Zapalnya, where residents were forced to leave in the 1960s.<n>Named after the patron saint of Bulgaria, the crumbling stone structure now cuts a ghostly figure in a few feet of water.
Audrey Hepburn voted most stylish Brit of all time.<n>David Beckham came third in the poll.<n>Victoria Beckham came ninth.

Tim Ward and his wife Brandy were at home in Oso, Washington, on March 22, 2014, when mudslide came crashing down.<n>Brandy was one of the 43 people killed in the disaster.<n>Tim was buried under 25 feet of mud but managed to call for help.<n>He has spent the past year trying to pay his mortgage - but was told he did not have 'landslide insurance' so could not receive payment.<n>Last week, Chase Bank told him an anonymous donor had paid the lot.

Many smartphones on sale today come with built-in FM chips.<n>However, nearly two thirds of these devices don't have the feature activated.<n> Broadcasters, including the BBC, are pushing for the mobile industry to activate the FM chips within smartphones to allow users to access their free radio feature.<n>It is thought many mobile phone network providers are reluctant to allow this because it would reduce demand for data used by streaming internet broadcasts.

Lydia Bright interviewed Labour leader as part of 'useyourvoice' campaign.<n>She said Miliband 'definitely' topped her list of political leaders in a game of'snog, marry or avoid'<n>The reality TV star said she would'snog or marry Ed because he's the best-looking one out of them all'

Engineers at the DFKI Robotics Centre in Bremen, Germany, describe the EOssc2 as an 'ultra flexible micro-car for mega cities'<n>It can turn on the spot, shrink in size and move sideways, like a crab.<n>The car's computer and its auto-navigation system enables it to park itself, 'even within narrow and congested roads'

Chilesaurus diegosuarezi is a new lineage of dinosaur that grazed on plants.<n>Palaologists are referring to it as a 'platypus' dinosaur because of its bizarre combination of characteristics, including its small skull and feet.<n>These features are more like those seen on long-neck dinosaurs.<n>The animal is proving to be an evolutionary jigsaw puzzle because it belongs to the theropod group of dinosaurs - which includes the famous meat eaters Velociraptor and Tyrannosaurus rex.

Gary Lowndes purchased the property in 2013 for $2 million.<n>He had planned to film a reality show about strippers on the property.<n>But he has been repeatedly complained about by neighbors.<n>The code enforcement board found he had violated their rules.<n>He has put the property back on the market for $2.3 million.

Andrew Chan has married his girlfriend of three years, Febyanti Herewila.<n>The pair wed at Besi Prison on Nusakambangan Island on Monday.<n>Chan is set to face death by firing squad on Tuesday.<n>The pair met in Kerobokan prison in 2012 and have been together for three years.<n>Chan's last wish was to spend his last days with his family.

Kim Richards was arrested at the Beverly Hills Hotel on April 16 after a heated exchange with her daughter Brooke.<n>The Real Housewives of LA star has now entered rehab.<n>In an emotional interview with Dr Phil, she admits to being drunk on the night of her arrest.<n>She tells all in a show that will air tomorrow.

An American sailor has suffered serious injuries after plunging into a swimming pool from a hotel's balcony.<n>Emergency services were called to the Parmelia Hotel in Perth at about 1am.<n>The 22-year-old man landed in the shallow end of the pool on the second level.<n>He was taken to Royal Perth Hospital with non-life threatening injuries.<n>Police say the man and a woman were heavily intoxicated when an argument escalated.

Rhiannon Wilkinson is head of Wycombe Abbey in Buckinghamshire.<n>She said single sex schools give girls relief from'sexualised world'<n>Added that they allow them to'remain girls for longer'<n>Scientists have found that girls mature faster than boys.

Dan Fredinburg, 33, was one of four Americans confirmed to have died.<n>The Google engineer was at the base camp when an earthquake hit Nepal.<n>An avalanche of snow and ice engulfed the base camp on Saturday.<n>His girlfriend Ashley Arenson said he had a way of making people feel special.<n>She said: 'He would constantly make you want to be the best person you can'

Special Warfare Operator 1st Class Brett Allen Marihugh of Livonia, Michigan, died Sunday.<n>Marihugh and 32-year-old Special Warfare Operator 1st Class Seth Cody Lewis were found unresponsive on Friday at the bottom of the Combat Swimming Training Facility.<n>Officials are calling the incident a 'training accident'

George W Bush, 68, spoke at closed-door meeting with Jewish donors.<n>He suggested that Obama's plan to lift sanctions on Iran was not plausible.<n>Also implied that America could lose leverage if it relaxes sanctions.<n>Said comprehensive nuclear deal would have negative impact on US security.<n>In contrast, Obama believes that deal is America's 'best bet' in the region.

Isa Richardson, 46, was confronted by schoolgirl who handed over last 15p.<n>Richardson claimed she needed money because her car had broken down.<n>The schoolgirl said she felt intimidated and had no choice but to give it to her.<n>Richardson admitted begging and was ordered to pay £20 to the young victim.<n>She told the court she was in such a desperate financial situation she believed her only options were to beg or shoplift.

Ukip leader says his party is now the'serious challenger' to Labour.<n>Accuses Labour of making claims Ukip is racist because it is 'running scared'<n>Calls on Conservative supporters to vote tactically to help Ukip beat Labour.
Singer/actress has completed triathlons.<n>She avoids sugar and salt and tries to get eight hours' sleep a night.<n>We reveal how to get the enviable physiques of the stars.

Karen Bell, 42, met man on dating website Plenty of Fish and met up.<n>Pair exchanged flirty texts before meeting up to act out sexual fantasy.<n>Bell then contacted him and threatened to post footage online unless he paid her £25.<n>She claimed her son had secretly filmed their tryst and footage was ready to publish, until she received £55.<n>Bell has now been jailed for 12 months after pleading guilty to blackmail.

John Lord, 86, went missing from his home on April 6.<n>Less than a week earlier his wife June, 81, died from a 'catastrophic bleed'<n>Family feared the worst after discovering a note describing how much he missed his wife of 63 years and how he could not live without her.<n>Body pulled from River Trent on April 15 by specialist underwater search unit.<n>His family believe he may have killed himself at the picturesque beauty spot where the devoted couple enjoyed going for a walk.

Sky launched its Buy and Keep scheme for customers last year.<n>It is now available to everyone in the UK and Ireland.<n>Films can be watched on TV, mobile and sent in the post.<n>They can also be bought through the Sky Store app on Android and iOS.<n>New releases cost £13.99 and classics are £7.99, but this includes the price of a physical DVD and postage.

Pat Senior, 66, has welcomed strays or abandoned dogs into her home.<n>She spends £240 a week on food and treats for the animals.<n>Grandmother-of-four also pays £17,000 in veterinary bills each year.<n>She has made makeshift beds for the animals in the garage.<n>Mrs Senior, who is also a painter, describes meal times as 'chaotic'

Kieran Murray, from Brisbane in Queensland, recently spent months travelling across the US.<n>He wanted to document his interactions with locals all around the country.<n>One man in Austin insisted Murray was saying 'Get out of my nightgown'<n>Another in Manhattan said 'Sounds Chinese to me man' when asked to repeat the phrase.

Ice, rain and snow arrive with -5C (23F) temperatures, Met Office says.<n>It comes less than a fortnight after mercury breached 25C (77F) mark.<n>Conditions this week are set to be average for April, Met Office says.<n>Sleet and snow forecast for today and tomorrow from Pennines.<n>Met Office has severe yellow ‘be aware’ ice warning for north-east Scotland.

Polish authorities said last week they would ban entry to the Night Wolves.<n>The group vowed to enter anyway and 15 were seen Monday morning.<n>They were allowed to go on by Belarusian guards but held in a hangar.<n>Many Poles view the Night Wolves with suspicion because they have rallied against the Ukrainian government and celebrated Russia's annexation of Crimea.

SBS journalist Scott McIntyre was fired on Sunday over his Anzac day tweets.<n>The senior writer for the Australian Financial Review labelled Anzacs 'racist yobs'<n>He also said he hoped 'in 50 years no soldiers around to honour'<n>Mr Winestock said Anzac day is a 'death cult'

The 41-year-old model and television personality also premiered a new short hairdo at the awards ceremony.<n>Matt Lauer received plenty of thanks during the two-hour broadcast on the Pop basic cable network after a comedy bit featuring pasties and black stockings.

Betheny Coyne, 24, was diagnosed with a rare heart defect before she was born.<n>She was never expected to reach her fourth birthday and needed surgery.<n>Now, she is a mother to three healthy children and is set to marry.<n>She said: 'I can't have any more surgery on my heart so it's a case of living with my heart defect and ensuring I do everything I want to in life while I can'

Tests show Linden, New Jersey police officer Pedro Abad had three times the legal limit of alcohol in his system when he crashed his car last month.<n>Two of his fellow officers were also critically injured in the crash.<n>Victims were Linden Officer Frank Viggiano and friend Joe Rodriguez.

Nasa scientists in California have revealed an interactive 3D map for Vesta using images from the Dawn spacecraft.<n>The map lets you see features on the surface including craters, hills, mountains and even 'canyons'<n>It also lets you switch between three main views - over the North Pole, a Global view or looking down onto the South Pole.<n>A 'gaming mode' lets you fly around the largest asteroid in the solar system using your keyboard's arrow keys.

Colin Pitchfork was jailed for life in 1988 for raping and killing two schoolgirls.<n>He strangled 15-year-old Lynda Mann to death after raping her in 1983.<n>Three years later he raped and killed Dawn Ashworth, also 15, less than a mile from where he murdered Lynda.<n>He received a 30-year minimum sentence which was then cut to 28 years in 2009.<n>P Pitchfork could be out this year if Parole Board does not issue decision.

Mitchell Keenan, 32, was forced to live in a tent during winter after being evicted.<n>He caught frostbite after his sister discovered his blackened toes.<n>They were so badly diseased they could not be saved and had to be amputated.<n>His father Keith, 62, also had health problems including scabies and dementia.<n>Mr Keenan's aunt says they fell behind with their repayments and were evicted.<n>She says she tried to get them accommodation but nowhere would take them.<n>She has now been given temporary accommodation by West Lancashire Borough Council.

Prince Harry will tonight fly out of the UK to Australia without seeing new niece or nephew.<n>With Duchess now overdue for birth of her second child, prince will not be able to meet new royal baby until he returns to UK in mid May.<n>Harry had returned briefly at the weekend to hand out prizes at London Marathon after undertaking several engagements in Turkey.<n>He was dragging out his return until tonight in hope of getting to meet new little prince or princess.

3AW host John Burns has been named as the man alleged to have called Bachar Houli a 'terrorist' on Friday night.<n>The incident occurred during Richmond's match against Melbourne.<n>Mr Burns said he doesn't recall making the comment, and is'mortified' by the allegation.<n>Mr Houli was the first Muslim to play AFL at the top level in 2006.

Media executives who spoke to POLITICO said that the leaked information was designed to make the disgraced anchor resign.<n>NBC journalists have been poring over his past reports and statements after he was booted from the top job in TV news.<n>The anchor has up to a $50million contract and POLITICO claims that he is being pressured to resign.

Tamale Rocks found the mirror when she was performing at Chicago bar.<n>She filmed a video showing the view from a closet of the toilet through it.<n>The mirror was set up as part of a Halloween prank in 2001, bar owner said.<n>He said the mirror has been there since and has brought staff 'joy'

Eben Kaneshiro, 35, was arrested last week and charged with three counts of first-degree sodomy and three counts of first-degree sexual abuse involving a boy.<n>Paramedics were unable to revive him after he was found unconscious around 3am on Sunday.<n>Authorities believe Kaneshiro hanged himself in his cell at Deschutes County Adult Jail.<n>He had a record of 19-12 in 31 MMA fights since 2002 and last fought in Boise, Idaho, in 2014.

Tactics used to bend the rules revealed by more than 500 teachers.<n>One in five reported colleagues had written coursework or dictated essays.<n>Details of unethical techniques emerged at Teacher Ethics In Assessment symposium.

Inspectors in Welshpool and Llandrindod Wells accused of being too lax.<n>Powys County Council inspectors found many people were going unticketed.<n>Authority needs to issue 40 per cent more tickets to break even.

Man in his 50s was travelling on his motorbike in Dezhou City in east China.<n>Was hit by a car and thrown off his bike at a busy junction.<n>His brother died at the same spot eight months earlier after colliding with a lorry.

Samantha Armytage made the comment during a broadcast last month.<n>She was interviewing non-identical twins from the UK, Lucy and Maria Aylmer.<n>The pair have become a sensation due to their opposite skin tones.<n>A petition was launched on Change.com on Monday, signed by 186 people.<n>It demands that Armytage, producer Michael Pell or a representative from Sunrise apologise for the comment.

Spitfire P9374 was among the first Mark 1 planes built in March 1940.<n>But it never made it to Battle of Britain as it crash-landed in May 1940.<n>Pilot Peter Cazenove brought it down on the wet sands at Calais.<n>He was captured by the Nazis and taken to Stalag Luft III.<n>Plane remained there for 40 years before it was discovered poking out of sand.

Naunihal Singh, 54, woke up great-grandfather Ujjal Singh, 63, and slashed him.<n>Had been drinking vodka at son's house in Crumpsall, Manchester.<n>Ujjal had become angry at Naunihal's son for couple's lack of children.<n>He accused Naunihal's son Monty of 'firing blanks', court told.<n>Naunihal jailed for at least 17 years and 39 days after admitting murder.

Designer tote bag was a 50th birthday gift for Hampstead woman, Sabine Smouha.<n>It was a £2,000 gift from her husband, Jeremy, the director of an investments company.<n>But when it arrived in Britain in 2013, customs officers confiscated it.<n>They said it didn't have the right documentation and didn't have endangered species permit.<n>Mrs Smouha has now won a test case bid to get it back after two years.

Cleveland Cavaliers forward Kevin Love dislocated his left shoulder during game four of the first round of the NBA playoffs against the Boston Celtics on Sunday.<n>Love was injured during a chase down a loose ball with Boston Celtics center Kelly Olynyk.<n>Love said he believes Olynyk did it on purpose.<n>The NBA will review the play, Love said.

Archaeologists have found seven human skulls at Crossrail site in London.<n>The remains were packed neatly into a cooking pot and set off at River Walbrook.<n>It has led to the theory they could be the remains of Boudicca's rebels.<n>The Boudiccan Revolt raged from 60-61AD and saw British tribes unsuccessfully try to defeat the Roman army.

Border collies Ace and Holly were caught on camera performing a balancing act.<n>The pooches stood up on their hind legs, with their front paws up.<n>The brief clip was set to 'Les Toreadors' from 'Carmen'<n>The dogs' owner and trainer, Dai Aoki, runs Positive Dog Care in Australia.

Furniture dating back to 1820 was moved from Ickworth House, Suffolk.<n>The move was designed to encourage visitors to 'dwell and take in the atmosphere'<n>Heritage experts branded the move'misguided' and 'pallising nonsense'<n>Trust said experiment was'short-term' and that each house is treated differently.

There are thought to be less than 1 million hedgehogs living in this country.<n>Experts say the number has dropped by 30 per cent since 2013.<n>Part of the reason is the loss of the traditional hedgerows.<n>The popularity of hard wooden or metal fences has made it hard for hedgehogs to move from place to place.

Leah O'Brien, 33, was killed when a car carrying two students on their way to the prom hit her car.<n>Her 8-year-old daughter Kori was in the vehicle at the time and suffered serious injuries.<n>Her fiancé, Alton Hines, was waiting for his bride-to-be at her home on the night of the crash.<n>Hines was going to escort O'Brien to the prom.<n>Ramiro Pedemonte, 19, was driving the car that killed O'Brien and is now facing multiple charges.

Cody Knecht, of St. Tammany Fire District in Louisiana, was sent out to rescue the baby mallards.<n>In the minute-long video the firefighter is seen holding a pole with his phone attached to it into the waterway.<n>During the video, the noise made by the phone is responded to with chirps from the ducklings.<n>All six ducklings were reunited with their mother on Saturday at their home on a nearby canal.

3D master map of the universe spans nearly two billion light years.<n>Spherical map of galaxy superclusters is most complete picture of our cosmic neighbourhood to date.<n>Will help astrophysicists understand how matter is distributed in the universe.

Physicists at the University of Oregon believe the hats, or 'pukao', were rolled up ramps to reach the top of the figures which measure up to 40ft (12 metres) tall.<n>Despite the size of the statues, Sean Hixon believes the rolling of the bulky stones would have been relatively easy.<n>The Moai are monolithic human figures carved by the Rapa Nui people on Easter Island, between 1,250 and 1,500 AD.

Brenda Finn, 30, was left depressed and anxious after losing her hair.<n>She was also bullied after leaving school because of her lack of hair.<n>She says medical tattooing could have saved her years of anguish.<n>She is now calling for the treatment to be made available on the NHS.<n>Says it would save money and help other alopecia sufferers.

Fast food giant Chipotle is making a fresh start and stepping away from using GMOs (genetically modified organisms) as ingredients.<n>Steve Ells, the company's co-CEO and founder, discussed the new development with CNN Money.<n>Ells said in the interview that the company has 68 total ingredients and another company's burrito features upwards of 80.<n>Rice, meat marinades, chips, salsa, and tortillas will not be made with GMOs.<n>Non-GMO corn, sunflower oil and rice bran oil now featuring as ingredients.

Selina Dicker, 38, from London, was at the same camp as avalanche killed 16.<n>She described how she ran for her life as a wall of snow and ice tore through.<n>The tragedy forced Miss Dicker, head of lending for finance company Europa Capital Mezzanine, to abandon her first attempt on the summit.

Stephen Gilbert bitten by dog while campaigning for re-election in Cornwall.<n>Lib Dem joked that dog had 'unresolved anger issues' after posting photo.<n>Party insiders today admitted the party is on course to lose 20 MPs.

Madelyn Yensen, 94, died just after 4pm on April 7 before her husband Marcus Yensen, 95, passed away at 9.30pm.<n>The couple met in 1940 and had three children before they married.<n>The couple lived in the same brick home in Salt Lake City for 65 years.

Elle, 51, carries around a urine tester to check her alkaline state.<n>Says she believes most ailments come from an acidic body.<n>Has been labeled 'The Body' since the 1980s.<n>Has released her own superfood product.

Jemma Gawned appeared on the first Australian Big Brother in 2001.<n>She now runs a wildly successful raw food empire called Naked Treaties.<n>The 40-year-old says'spreading the vibration of love through food' is the key to her success.

Myuran Sukumaran and Andrew Chan will be executed by firing squad.<n>The pair have chosen spiritual advisers who will accompany them to their execution.<n>Sukumaran has nominated his friend Christie Buckingham, a senior pastor at Melbourne's Bayside Church.<n>Chan has asked Salvation Army minister David Soper - a family friend - to accompany him to the clearing known as Death Valley.

Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, 82, has spoken out on the issue.<n>She has said that the public is becoming more accepting of gay rights.<n>She has also officiated at same-sex ceremonies, report claims.<n>She will be part of decision on whether states can ban gay marriage.<n>Arguments will be heard in Obergefell v. Hodges on Tuesday.<n>Decision could legalize practice nationwide, and is expected this summer.

David Curry was asked to leave Wetherspoon pub because of his tracksuit bottoms.<n>He had travelled ten miles with his wife and stepdaughter for breakfast.<n>But when they arrived he was told he could not stay in the pub because of attire.<n>Wetherspoon has apologised but said no-tracksuit policy has been in place since 2013.

Sierra Pippen, 20, was arrested on Sunday after she walked into a Sheraton hotel and urinated on the lobby floor.<n>Pippen was arrested at the same place on April 10 for public intoxication after getting into a fight with the hotel's security.<n>She was 'wearing two bar wristbands' even though she is underage, according to a criminal complaint.<n>Pippen is one of her father's six children.

Greystone Park Psychiatric Center, in New Jersey, was once the largest building in the US, but was surpassed by the Pentagon.<n>The asylum became known for its high number of rapes and suicides, including that of folk singer Woody Guthrie.<n>It has been left to fall into disarray with crumbling walls, flaking plaster and holes in ceilings and staircases.<n>But preservationists are fighting to save it and claim it should be converted into a museum and housing.

Waze is a free traffic app that was acquired by Google in 2013.<n>It allows users to tag the locations of parked police vehicles.<n>Police officers say the app is being used to stalk and plan attacks.<n>Ismaaiyl Brinsley, 28, killed police officer Wenjian Liu and his partner Rafael Ramos in December while they sat in their squad car.<n>Before the killing he was known to have used the app to monitor the movements of police officers.

Ancient civilisations such as the Romans, Greeks and Egyptians have had to deal with rowdy, drunken behaviour in public for thousands of years.<n>Now one academic suggests that modern authorities should take a lead from their forebears as they attempt to mitigate the impact of our boozy culture.

Sharon Smith, 43, from Halesowen, West Midlands, weighed almost 20st.<n>She was a size 26 and had never been happy being overweight.<n>She shed 4st through slimming club but then another 4st after taking up running.<n>She is now a size 10 and is due to run a 10k race on Sunday.

Sir Frank Kitson accused in case of Patrick Eugene Heenan in 1973.<n>Mr Heenan, 47, killed when paramilitaries threw grenade at minibus.<n>Sir Frank said he was confused as to why he was being named.<n>Claimed he was not serving in Northern Ireland at time of murder.

J.M. Giordano, 41, works as a photographer for the Baltimore City Paper.<n>He says he was standing in front of a police line Saturday night when they suddenly started marching and he couldn't get out of the way fast enough.<n>He and a protester were knocked to the ground and about five or six police officers hit him with their shields.<n>The photographer says he was kicked and hit repeatedly by police.<n>He believes police let him go because they knew he was a journalist.

Orchids have evolved a so-called lip - a large and irregular modified petal.<n>This is used to attract insects and serve as a landing platform for them.<n>Researchers from National Chung Hsing University in Taiwan found the shape is determined by two competing groups of proteins.<n>They were able to convert lips into petals in two orchid species by reducing the activity of the L complex using gene silencing.

WWF research identified 11 'deforestation fronts' where 80 per cent of projected global forest losses by 2030 could occur.<n>Areas include the Amazon, Atlantic Forest and Gran Chaco, and the Cerrado in South America.<n>They are home to indigenous communities that depend on their livelihoods and endangered species such as orangutans and tigers.<n>But they are being lost to expanding agriculture, including livestock farming, palm oil plantations and soy production.<n>Unsustainable logging and wood fuel collection is also causing forest degradation.

Poppy Smart, 23, was repeatedly whistled at by men on building site.<n>She recorded the whistles on her mobile phone and complained to police.<n>She also contacted a construction company to complain of sexual harassment.<n>Builders concerned were not involved in the alleged wolf-whistling.
Nicola Bonn, 34, from London started a blog called Upfront Mama.<n>Discuss's the trials and tribulations of raising her 14-month-old daughter.<n>Many of her posts have gone viral.

Undersheriff Tim Albin, of Tulsa County Sheriff's Office, Oklahoma, quit his job Monday.<n>Resignation comes after new revelations about how the department treated reserve deputy Robert Bates, 73.<n>Bates accidentally shot dead Eric Harris, 44, after he was tackled to the ground.<n>Other deputies in the department had expressed concern about his fitness to serve.<n>Albino was named in a 2009 internal investigation that showed deputies had expressed concerns about Bates' performance.

The 511 elephant tusks, worth $6million (£4m), were bound for Laos.<n>They were seized upon arrival Saturday at a major port in Chonburi province.<n>The bust came after customs officials received a tip-off in Laos and Thailand.<n>They tracked the containers from Kenya and found them hidden in tea leaves.

Jeremy Clarkson and Top Gear colleagues were on brink of lucrative new contract.<n>But offer was taken away after Clarkson punched producer Oisin Tymon.<n>Presenter James May revealed he had ordered a rare £200,000 Ferrari 458 Speciale.<n>He said he had celebrated by ordering car while 'draft version' was being finalised on his desk.
The couple wed in a 'private family monastery on the Dalmatian coast'<n>The actress, 37, grew up in Canada.

Rifaat al-Assad, 77, went into exile in 1984 after staging failed coup.<n>He is the uncle of current Syrian President Bashar and a former vice president.<n>He has lived in Paris, London and southern Spanish city of Marbella.<n>He is now facing a year-long investigation into his finances in France.<n>Activists claim he stole money from Syria while in power at heart of regime.<n>But Mr al-Assad denies any wrongdoing and says he gave money to poor.

Yves Van De Ven, 37, wanted to make fun of tourist clichés.<n>He took pictures deliberately missing the top of the Eiffel Tower.<n>His photo was uploaded to photosharing site 4chan.<n>Over 100 users have since submitted their own improved pictures.
Victoria, 41, wore trainers to watch son Romeo run in London marathon.<n>Accessorised with 'Team Romeo' T-shirt and R13 distressed jeans.<n>Star has admitted she is now a convert to flat shoes.

Ellen Gallant was on Everest when the earthquake struck on Saturday.<n>The tremors sparked an avalanche that killed 18 people including four Americans.<n>Ms Gallant and another doctor rushed to help those injured and trapped.<n>She said there was nothing they could do to save a 25-year-old Sherpa.<n>Up to 100 US citizens are still missing following the disaster.

MP passed dossier of information to Home Office in hope it would kick-start investigation.<n> paperwork was shelved by officials until it was discovered in 2013.<n>Revelation will heighten fears that peer was beneficiary of Establishment cover-up.<n>Labour MP Simon Danczuk is calling on Home Office to 'come clean'

A Harvard-led study has mapped taste buds on a tongue for the first time.<n>Scientists examined the different cells used to identify taste.<n>They watched these cells capture and process molecules live.<n>The study reveals how taste buds have different cells that are used to differentiate between between the five basic groups of flavours.

The countdown is on for Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran's execution.<n>Over 300 people gathered at Sydney Harbour for a candlelight vigil on Monday night.<n>Brisbane, Melbourne and Perth also saw hoards of people congregate to show solidarity for the condemned duo.

Two-year-old Landen Martin was struck and killed by his uncle's car on Sunday.<n>Joshua Saunders, 19, was attempting to back out of driveway of home in Georgia.<n>Martin ran behind the vehicle and was pronounced dead at hospital.<n>Saunders was arrested on charges including DUI, reckless driving, leaving the scene of an accident and vehicular homicide.

Christi Shepherd, seven, and brother Bobby, six, died in Corfu in 2006.<n>They were overcome by carbon monoxide that leaked from a faulty boiler.<n>Their father Neil Shepherd and his girlfriend were also almost killed.<n>Their mother Sharon Wood, 44, sat in silence as details were outlined.<n>The inquest into their deaths is expected to last up to three weeks.

The message was splashed across the sky above Brisbane on Monday.<n>It was followed by a love heart and two crosses for kisses.<n>The apology hovered above the CBD at about 1pm.<n>People have jumped to conclusion, believing the man must have done something terribly bad.<n>Rob Vance, of Skywriting Services Australia, created the message.

Professor Irwin Horwitz emailed his strategic management class of about 30 students telling them he was going to fail all of them.<n>He claimed students cheated in class and participated in 'inappropriate conduct'<n>The university has said that the failing grades Horwitz's wishes to give out will not hold.

Australian modelling agencies are catering to a growing demand for 'influencers' and 'bloggers'<n>The average client expectation is between 10,000 - 300,000 followers.<n>'That line of just being a model is being blurred,' says Chic Management's Paul Thomas.

Derek Murray, a University of Alberta law student, found the letter when he returned to his car after accidentally leaving his headlights on all day.<n>The stranger left an extension cord and battery charger to bring his dead Acura back to life.<n>The note has since gone viral.

Virginia Trimble Ritter's daughter, Marcia, was raped and choked to death by Jerome Sydney Barrett in 1975.<n>Her body was found 33 days after she disappeared and Ritter's then-husband advised her against seeing the body and the crime scene photos.<n>Charlie, who died in 1989, wanted their last memory to be of her running in and out of the house, 'the real Marcia'<n> Ritter said she shouted, 'If I had a gun I'd kill him!'

Lu Xincai takes his mother to work every day because there was no one else to look after her.<n>He says that he is scared that she will get lost if he leaves her at home.<n>He rides the four kilometres to work slowly to make sure she feels safe.

Marie Teresa Ratcliffe refused to defend herself at hearing in London.<n>She accepted 77 allegations relating to her care of 14 patients at Furness General Hospital between 2004 and 2013.<n>In a letter read to the Nursing and Midwifery Council she said she will'regret what happened for the rest of my life'<n>Ms Ratcliffe is the first of eight midwives accused of misconduct.<n>Independent inquiry into failings at Morecambe Bay found failures led to 11 avoidable deaths of babies and one mother.

Leo Greene, 39, of Salt Lake City was arrested after eight-minute chase.<n>Was stopped by police after they tried to stop car with bumper dragging.<n>He drove off when asked to hand over keys and crashed through two fences.<n>Crashed onto tarmac area and onto runway at Salt Lake City International Airport.<n>Was arrested and now faces multiple charges including driving under the influence, fleeing and resisting arrest.

Jef Rouner said his daughter was forced to cover up with jeans and a t-shirt when teachers said her spaghetti straps were 'against the rules'<n>The dress was bought from a store in a mall and had previously been worn to church.

SNP leader insists she would call the shots in the event of a hung parliament.<n>She vowed to use influence of dozens of MPs to get her way for five years.<n>New opinion poll puts the SNP on 54 per cent, up two points on two weeks ago.

Michael Churton was with four colleagues at the base camp when avalanche hit.<n>The 38-year-old believes the earthquake shook loose a big ice shelf.<n>The ice shelf careered down the mountainside towards him and his group.<n>He was knocked back and suffered facial injuries but dug himself out.<n>He eventually made his way down and was greeted by fellow survivors.

Keri Davies said having a divan to hand is vital to make sex scenes sound convincing.<n>Added that parties in the fictional Ambridge are limited to nine attendees.<n>Mr Davies was speaking at an Afternoon Tea With The Archers event.

Taya Kyle has given an interview to ABC's Robin Roberts.<n>She revealed she broke the news to her children when she was in tears.<n>It will be the first time she has spoken out since Eddie Ray Routh was convicted of killing her husband, US Navy SEAL Chris Kyle.<n>Kyle, 40, has written a new book about her life since Chris's death.

Ronald Jebson, who killed three children in 1970, died of kidney failure.<n>His final wish was for his death to be secret and victims' families found out 11 days after he died.<n>Mother of one of his victims said: 'I just don't want him to be able to hurt anyone else's children'

Tony Toutouni, 42, has 750,000 followers thanks to his outrageous posts.<n>He is threatening to take the crown from his friend Dan Bilzerian.<n>The billionaire businessman says 'it's not that hard to get any girl you want'

Andrew Silicani, 23, of Cheyenne pleaded guilty on Monday in federal court to four counts of using the mail in his unsuccessful plan to hire someone to carry out the murders.<n>He faces up to 40 years at sentencing this summer.<n>Silicani was serving a five- to seven-year sentence at the state prison in Rawlins for conspiracy to commit robbery and robbery resulting in bodily injury.

Kerry and Zarif reconvened at the Upper East Side home of Iran's ambassador to the United Nations today after their marathon negotiations in Switzerland.<n>They now have little more than two months to meet their own deadline of June 30 to sign a comprehensive accord.<n>All the activity was taking place as the Senate begins debate over empowering Congress to review and possibly reject any nuclear pact.

The town of Santa Barbara d'Oeste is home to many Confederate descendants who came to Brazil during Reconstruction.<n>The annual 'Festa dos Confederados,' or 'Confederates Party' is held in Portuguese every year.<n>The party takes place up a dusty dirt road flanked on both sides by sugarcane plantations.

Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency is scrapping paper counterpart.<n>Information about penalty points for traffic violations will be held online.<n>Motoring groups fear switch to fully online system will make it harder for car hire firms to check details.

Chandni Nigam, 19, spent six years battling demons which spawned from obsession to do well at school, an inquest into her death was told.<n>She would stay up late studying, resulting in sleep deprivation and a negative impact on her performance at school, the inquest heard.<n>Tragically, she had first told her parents she was feeling suicidal in 2013 and had even said she would stand in front of a fast train to take her life.<n>On February last year, the teenager was struck by a train at Twyford railway station in Berkshire.<n>Coroner Peter Bedford said she died from multiple injuries

Guo Kai and girlfriend Dong Hui, who turned 22 on Monday, had been planning to get married this month in Sichuan, China.<n>But Dong was suddenly diagnosed with bone cancer and admitted to hospital.<n>Instead, family and friends helped Dong put on a beautiful wedding dress.<n>Professional photographers came to the hospital to take wedding photos.

Miriam Gonzlez Durntez wore bright pink dress to fashion show in London.<n>Was at LDNY fashion show and WIE (Women: Inspiration and Enterprise) gala.<n>Was accompanied by £560 pair of Gianvito Rossi Perspex-panelled pumps.<n>Also wore matching belt and yellow and pink corsage on shoulder.

Mark Lowe, 32, from Skelmersdale, Lancashire, is currently serving a five-year sentence for beating and kicking his brother Wayne to death.<n>Mark's wife Sarah is now looking after three young children alone.<n>She said: 'Mark will regret what he did for the rest of his life, because he loved his brother'

Spotify analysed data and found users aged around 42 drop their usual playlists.<n>Staff found users are more likely to favour chart toppers today.<n>'Around age 42, music taste briefly curves back to the popular charts,' said Spotify.

Kim Davies bought Llanwenarth House in the Brecon Beacons in 2006.<n>But he then made dozens of illegal alterations to the Grade II-listed property.<n>He installed shiny mosaic baths and chandeliers and replaced timber windows.<n>The Elizabethan manor was where Cecil Frances Alexander wrote All Things Bright and Beautiful.

The 17 mile (27km) iceberg was born in the West Antarctica's Getz Ice Shelf.<n>Nasa captured the calving event from space in March.<n>The Amundsen Sea of west Antarctica is the largest contributors to sea levels.

Sean Jefferson, 45, and Elizabeth Jowitt, 37, covered their home in York with wreaths, lanterns, memorial slates and homemade gifts.<n>Some of the items were from graves of babies, while others were from gravestones of grandmothers who died in recent years.<n>Couple admitted handling stolen goods at York Magistrates' Court this week.<n>They were given a 47-week curfew and a restraining order banning them from cemeteries in the York area indefinitely.

Tareq Kamleh appeared in the latest ISIS propaganda video at the weekend.<n>He urged foreign medics to join the terrorist cult in Raqqa, Syria.<n>The Medical Board of Australia has refused to deregister him.<n>He is still registered to practice medicine in Australia until September 30.

Lynn suffers from hip displasia which causes pain when she moves.<n>She also has scoliosis which means she has to walk with a crutch.<n>After three years of trying to conceive, she fell pregnant.<n>She didn't want to take any risks so stopped taking pain relief.<n>Baby Libby was delivered via caesarean section.

Royal Baby Gaga ice cream is the brainchild of breastfeeding campaigner Victoria Hiley.<n>The 30-year-old from Leeds has collaborated with London-based ice-creamery The Licktators.<n>The product will be available at selected stores in London this summer.

Queen Letizia comforted the families of some of the Spaniards who died.<n>She was joined by her husband King Felipe at a memorial service in Barcelona.<n>The Spanish royals also met with students who had hosted victims.<n>150 people were killed when the Germanwings plane crashed last month.

Joshua Sweet, 20, admitted burglary and sexual assault at Birmingham Crown Court.<n>He broke into the victim's home and took items including car keys and mobile phone.<n>As she lay in bed, he sexually assaulted her and said 'you're not going to make any noise are you?'<n>Judge Mary Stacey admitted victim had been'scarred psychologically'<n>But Sweet was freed and given a three-year community order on account of early plea and having spent just two months in jail awaiting his court appearance.<n>Victim Support said that 'victims deserve justice' and slammed the sentence.

Ian Rogers, 36, became hooked on all things paranormal as a child.<n>Has spent hundreds of pounds on his collection of nine dolls.<n>Says each doll has their own personality and has their own story.<n>Has a favourite doll called Annabel who he thinks is haunted by a seven-year-old girl who drowned.

German cables warned of heightened risk of flying over Ukraine.<n>But Germany failed to pass on the warning, local media reported.<n>Malaysia Airlines Flight MH17 was shot down over rebel-held territory.<n>All 298 aboard were killed, with efforts to find those responsible shifting to prosecution.

Dan Fredinburg was one of three Americans killed when earthquake struck Nepal.<n>The 33-year-old was with three colleagues navigating the area for Google.<n>Was given letters by friends and family before he left on Saturday.<n>It is not known whether he got a chance to read them before he left.

Belichick was caught on camera ogling Teigen's bottom at the White House Correspondents' Dinner on Saturday.<n>His girlfriend Linda Holliday tweeted a photo of the incident, asking, 'who didn't check her out in this photo?'<n>Teigen's husband John Legend was quick to label the incident 'Spy gate'

The single mother of four is facing four counts of endangering the welfare of a child.<n>Firefighters rescued her three daughters and a son, ages 9 to 13, from the basement of a two-story home in Kensington.<n>The woman works at the Philadelphia International Airport and is described as a hard-working student and employee.

Miliband sets out plans to scrap stamp duty for most first-time buyers.<n>He also wants to curb rent rises and give local people priority for homes.<n>But Labour leader also wants to ban developers hoarding land.<n>This has triggered a drop in the value of shares of construction firms.

Aiken lost a November bid to represent the Second District of North Carolina in the House of Representatives.<n>He's already launching a new reality show that chronicles his failed bid.<n>'The Runner-Up' is a reference to his second-place finish in the second season of American Idol.<n>Aiken's opponent, Rep. Renee Ellmers, is an intensive-care nurse who married a surgeon.<n>'She’s an idiot,' said Aiken, 'and I think her self-esteem is just in the floor. Under the floor'

The Nanoheat Wireless Heated Mug is designed to keep tea and coffee hot.<n>It can maintain the temperature at between 68C and 71C for up to 45 minutes.<n>This means you can drink your beverage from the first sip to the last drop.<n>The mug weighs a little over one pound (g454) and can be charged wirelessly.<n>It is currently raising funds on Kickstarter to fund production of the mug.<n>Backers can pre-order the mug for $30 (£20) before it goes on sale in August.

Royal couple will use St Mary's Hospital in Paddington, central London.<n>Prime Minister said he supports peoples' right to choose treatment options.<n>But also ensured he praised the NHS, saying it was'superb' and'superb'

USC senior and Gamma Phi Beta president Alicia Jewell enlisted her sorority sisters to raise money for housekeeper Fannie Randle.<n>Ms Randle had been saving for a new car because hers was old and held together with duct tape.<n>The sorority girls surprised her with a $21,000 check last Monday.

South West Trains cancelled all its trains following the incident this afternoon.<n>Passengers were left stranded at Waterloo station as services were delayed.<n>A person was struck by a train between Wimbledon and Surbiton.<n>Network Rail said staff were working 'flat out' to recover the service this evening.

Dana Vulin was set alight at her Perth home in February 2012.<n>She suffered third degree burns to more than 60 per cent of her body.<n>Natalie Dimitrovska was jailed for 17 years for the attack.<n>She will appeal the sentence on Tuesday, claiming she was not as badly injured as she stated in court.<n>Footage of her recovery for Channel 7's Sunday Night program will be shown.

The Crown Princess, 43, attended an Anzac Day ceremony in Copenhagen.<n>She placed a wreath at a memorial and stood with dignitaries.<n>Her attendance came days after she spoke of feeling alone after losing her mother, Henrietta Donaldson, at 25.

Official data expected to show economy grew by 0.5% in first three months.<n>Down from 0.9% in the same period in 2014, according to the ONS.<n>Manufacturing and construction have shown dismal start to the year.<n>Tories step up warnings about risk of higher taxes and regulations.

Two cheetahs approached the tortoise in the Kalahari desert in South Africa.<n>The big cats tried to scare it out of its shell but the reptile kept its hidden.<n>The cheetahs eventually left after the tortoise cut it a short time later.

An estimated 26,000 people in the UK have HIV but are unaware of it.<n>The BioSure HIV Self Test is 99.7 per cent accurate.<n>It uses a small amount of blood from a finger-prick sample to detect antibodies.

Mobile phone companies charge customers up to 20p a minute to dial 0800.<n>The net result is that millions of people are charged for what should be free services run by the NHS, the government and call centres.<n>The charges will end from July 1 under proposals published by the telecoms watchdog, Ofcom, today.

Andrew Chan and Myruan Sukumaran will face 12 marksmen at 3am on Tuesday.<n>They will be led from their cells in Batu prison on Nusakambangan Island.<n>They will be given white clothing to wear and a choice whether to be blindfolded.<n>The pair will then face the firing squad in a remote location in the jungle.<n>The chilling reenactment was broadcast to millions of viewers on Indonesian TV.

Greg Hardy's Bentley got stuck in flash floods in Dallas this week.<n>The 25-year-old was forced to abandon the car and wait for help.<n>Hardy was signed by the Dallas Cowboys last month after being suspended by the NFL for 10 games for domestic abuse.<n>Last year Hardy was convicted by a judge of beating, strangling and threatening to kill his ex-girlfriend, Nicki Holder.

More than 61 million iPhones sold in first quarter - up 40% from a year ago.<n>iPhone sales grew 72 percent in China, where company has big hopes for expansion.<n>iPad sales fell 29 percent to $5.4 billion - continuing a steady decline.<n>Mac computers rose 2% from a year earlier, to $5.6 billion.

Angus Hawley, 46, died of a suspected heart attack in New York on Saturday.<n>His brother David told Daily Mail Australia he doesn't 'understand' the death of his 'fit and healthy' brother.<n>Mr Hawley was the ex-husband of Antonia Kidman, who he shared with four children.
